description:
Job Description

We're looking for an experienced Data Analyst to spearhead advanced analytics and reporting for TrialPay. Given a set of project requirements, you should be able to implement data mining and visualization techniques, as well as provide statistical analysis and post-campaign analysis for targeted marketing campaigns. You'll also be responsible for data integration among diverse data resources. In general, you are able to provide sound methods and identify key results to support strategic decisions. Ideally, you have fantastic communication and presentation skills, and you can work effectively and efficiently with everyone from fellow data scientists to business partners.

Responsibilities
Develop and implement business-application-based datamarts, data collection systems, data analytics, data sanitizing and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality for business processes
Implement marketing campaign analysis including pre-campaign audience targeting, in-campaign performance monitoring, and post-campaign analysis
Acquire and integrate data from multiple data sources
Identify, analyze and interpret trends and patterns for large complex datasets using statistical techniques
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Explore and define new process improvement opportunities
Present ongoing reports and findings to management and business partners
Job Perks
Competitive salary, comprehensive medical benefits, and 401(k) matching
Free meals, snacks, beverages, and on-site fitness classes
Friendly and collaborative open office environment
Visa stock purchasing plan
Ping-pong, hackathons, rooftop happy hours, and team-building offsites
Offices in downtown San Francisco (close to BART) and Palo Alto (close to Caltrain)
To learn more about us, visit us at: http://www.trialpay.com/about/company/ Qualifications

BS or MS in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, or other related field
3+ years of working experience as a data analyst (marketing analytics preferred)
Strong analytical skills with ability to collect, organize, analyze significant amounts of information and massive datasets (expertise in SQL, Hive)
Experienced in data visualization using Tableau and Excel
Familiar with scripting languages such as R, Python and/or PHP
Technical expertise in data mining: statistical distribution, missing/outliers data statistics, segmentation, regression, A/B testing, hypothesis testing, etc.
Excellent communication and presentation skills: adept at queries and comfortable creating reports and presenting findings to management and business partners using Excel and Powerpoint

Additional Information

Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of Article 49 of the San Francisco Police Code.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
title: Data Analyst

description:
Are you passionate about working with Big Data to solve business problems that directly impact our customers? Are you excited about gaining new insights & intelligence, and answering critical questions based on data?
Hundreds of millions use Outlook daily - we are on a mission to make it a billion. This mission takes us to meet our customers where they are: on all platforms (Windows, Mac, iOS, Android, Web) and through all service providers (Gmail, Yahoo, Outlook.com, Office365, etc.). We are currently working with big data and building tools and models to extract relevant business information to help us reach our organizational goals like grow usage (MAU), grow cross client usage (i.e. mobile + desktop), and monetization (i.e. sell and retain Office 365 subscriptions). We are looking for a talented and experienced data analyst who can mine data and provide key insights to optimize growth and usage while we experiment with new ways to upsell or renew users to the various subscription offerings.

Key tasks and responsibilities:

• Work with the product team to define, track and report key product metrics.
• Provide quick turnaround data analysis to generate insights to help guide decision-makers and executives.
• Manipulate and analyze complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources using a variety of tools and data analysis techniques.
• Build a “data analysis practice” with both full- and self-service models for investigations, and a regular engagement rhythm to empower the entire organization with data-driven decisions.
• Present and communicate broadly across the product groups to drive the future strategy for Outlook - grounded in analytics.
• Work side-by-side with other feature PMs to empower their own data explorations and growth experiments.
• Help develop the skills of the entire team as data-savvy leaders who ask great questions and make informed decisions.

Basic Qualifications:

• 3-5 years of experience in data science or business analytics.
• 3+ years’ experience in Excel and writing SQL queries for data manipulation.
• Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (Sciences, Engineering, Economics, etc.)
• 3+ years’ experience in languages such as Python and/or R.

Preferred Qualifications:

• Master’s degree in a quantitative field preferred but not required.
• Self-starter with a strong passion for using data to influence business decisions and strategy investments.
• Experience in C#/C++ or similar languages is a strong plus.
• Ability to intelligently integrate a wide range of data sources and analysis to answer core business questions and discover growth opportunities.
• Excellent oral and written communication skills and ability to present and discuss data models and analysis to a range of audiences across development, operations and business teams in Microsoft
• Exceptional ability to effectively negotiate and collaborate across teams and organizations

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, marital status, pregnancy, protected veteran status, protected genetic information, political affiliation, or any other characteristics protected by local laws, regulations, or ordinances.

title: Full Time - Entry Level SQL/BI Position

description:
At Blend, we’re dedicated to improving lending. We’re an enterprise technology company, but our product affects the most important purchase most people will make in their lifetime—their home. For homebuyers, our product means a clear, guided path to a new home. For lenders, it means modern, easy-to-use tools that let employees spend their time helping customers, rather than on repetitive, manual tasks. By aligning and modernizing this archaic industry, we believe everybody wins.

We need someone who’s driven to solve hard problems—the harder the better. We’re motivated by the fact that our product won’t just affect the lives of a few people in the Bay Area—it affects people all over America, not to mention a foundational part of the U.S. economy. Founded in 2012 by former Palantir leaders, we’re currently backed by Founders Fund, Andreessen Horowitz and other prominent investors.

The Data Analyst will support data needs across our growing company. As an early member of our analytics team, you will help to define how we work with data and influence decision making throughout Blend with your insightful analysis and reporting. You will work closely with our Data Science and Data Engineering teams, gaining expertise in data analysis, visualization, and infrastructure.

Our ideal Data Analyst has experience working in SQL, is familiar with Python or R, and understands statistics. You may be a great fit if you work well both independently and collaboratively, take ownership of your work, and can explain complicated ideas to just about anyone.

Responsibilties
    • Prepare data for exploratory analysis, intelligent data products, and dashboards.
    • Collaborate with Data Engineers to develop and implement an ETL system for Blend’s rapidly growing data store.
    • Conduct exploratory analysis on our extensive datasets to discover valuable insights for our organization.
    • Maintain and improve our internal dashboard product.
Requirements
    • Experience working in SQL, including joins, windowing functions and time series processing.
    • Familiarity with a scientific computing language, such as Python or R.
    • Understanding of fundamental probability and statistical concepts, such as hypothesis testing, maximum likelihood, and basic regression.
    • Interest or experience in machine learning techniques (such as regression, decision tree, and segmentation) is helpful.
    • Demonstrated ability to structure complex problems, derive insights from data, and communicate with diverse teams.
    • BS in a quantitative discipline.
    • Advanced degree is a plus.
Benefits
    • Meaningful equity at an early stage company
    • Daily catered lunch and dinner, and an endless snack supply
    • Conveniently located in San Francisco's Financial District
    • Top-tier medical, dental, and vision insurance
    • Gym membership
    • Public transportation pass
    • Flexible work hours and vacation time

description:
Development of prototype solutions, mathematical models, algorithms, machine learning techniques, and robust analytics to support analytic insights and visualization of complex data sets

DisneyData
The Walt Disney Studios – Studio Technology: Sr. Data Analyst

Are you curious, creative, and love data? Do you love to learn new things and collaborate to solve hard and interesting problems? Do you want to be on the cutting edge of breakthroughs in data and analytics, encouraged to discover, challenged to think bigger, and supported to learn new things personally and professionally? Do you love the challenge and excitement that comes with not knowing today, what problem you might be working on tomorrow? Do you thrive in a high paced environment? Do you want to “make a difference” with the work you do?

The Walt Disney Studios (TWDS) is seeking a Sr. Data Analyst to oversee the design, build, and testing of formulas for complex metrics/KPIs, (Lifetime Value, Cost Per Registered User, Retention Curves), machine learning methods, and analytics models to support the Disney Movies Anywhere team within the TWDS. This position will report to the Director of Analytics for TWDS. The goal of this team is to create a competitive advantage for TWDS using data.
As a trusted creator of premium entertainment experiences for the whole family, The Walt Disney Studios is committed to making it easier than ever for consumers to grow their digital movie libraries in a seamless and family-friendly experience. Disney Movies Anywhere (DMA) is The Walt Disney Studios’ exclusive cloud-based digital movie service. This app for iOS, Android and Web experiences enables consumers to discover, purchase, manage, and watch movies from Disney, Pixar, Marvel, and Star Wars at home and on the go.

Position Summary:
The Sr. Data Analysts will research, design, implement and validate algorithms to analyze diverse sources of data to achieve targeted outcomes. The role will provide expertise on mathematical concepts and machine learning for the broader analytics team and inspire the adoption of advanced analytics and data science.
This position is with company code 1990, an equal opportunity employer

title: Sr Data Analyst

description:
Blizzard Entertainment has been rated by Fortune as one of the "Best Places to Work" for several years running. We are a community of 4,000 global employees who are passionate about not only gaming, but entertainment and the technology that drives our users experience.

Blizzard marketing is looking for an associate data analyst to join the team! As our franchises continue to grow, and audiences and media platforms expand, this individual and the need for expert data analysis is critical to the success of our campaigns.

This role measures and reports on key insights for our digital marketing campaigns. The position will work with website, social media, television, search, mobile, display and organic datasets to identify underlying trends and optimize marketing ROI across channels and divisions. The role will also help to create reports and visualizations for various operational levels, participate in weekly reporting meetings with agencies and franchise leads to ensure timely delivery of reports, and help complete ad hoc projects as needed.

The ideal candidate is passionate and knowledgeable about digital marketing, is a team player, a critical thinker, and must possess strong interpersonal skills to interface effectively with both the marketing and technical teams.

Responsibilities

Data Preparation and Analysis

  • Align disparate marketing performance datasets; merge internal site-level data with external vendor-side data.
  • Assist analytics manager with regular analysis of campaign performance and best practices.
  • Work closely with teams to coordinate campaign tagging.
  • Work closely with analytics manager, Business Intelligence (BI) and game teams to coordinate tagging implementation for website and new media.
  • Coordinate data transfers from vendors and communicate analyses and recommendations.
  • Work closely with ad teams to A / B test creatives.
Reporting
  • Maintain reporting visualizations and dashboards using Powerpoint and Tableau.
  • Generate reports on digital marketing efforts for Blizzard corporate and Regional Divisions as needed.
  • Provide insights for divisions and internal teams as needed.
  • Assist with individual campaign reporting requests for divisions on an ad-hoc basis.
  • Manage external agencies to produce regular and ad hoc campaign reports, drawing out insights and optimizations related to media objectives, and clearly communicating results to internal and external stakeholders.
  • Data Processing and Verification
  • Maintain and troubleshoot data collection process with media vendors to ensure accuracy.
  • Work with analytics manager to maintain data ecosystem and assist in onboarding new technology or processes.
  • Work closely with vendors to validate data generated by Google Analytics and site-based tags.
  • Maintain campaign and creative level taxonomies.
  • Oversee data quality and hygiene (including extraction, transformation and loading) and identifying inconsistencies and gaps in data to ensure consistency and accuracy.
  • Oversee streamlining data and analytics processes, automating tasks, and identifying opportunities to improve workflow.
Platform Tools
  • Manage global conversion tag requests for all media campaigns.
  • Be an expert in Sizmek AdServer, Tune, Google Tag Manager, and Google Analytics.
Requirements
  • Bachelor’s degree in a related field
  • A minimum of 3 years’ experience in an analytics role in marketing / advertising preferred
  • Extensive experience with Microsoft Excel or equivalent spreadsheet software
  • Results-driven professional with exceptional detail and knowledge around metrics, specifically A / B, multi-variant testing, and ROI analysis
  • Experience analyzing digital media campaign performance
  • Strong knowledge of digital media and analytics / measurement tools including: digital ad servers (e.g. DCM, Atlas, Sizmek), website analytics (e.g. Google Analytics, Omniture, Web Trends),
  • Experience with data visualization (e.g. Tableau)
  • Able to multitask, prioritize projects, and meet deadlines and execute high-quality work under tight deadlines with strong attention to detail
  • Able to work successfully in a team environment, as well as independently, and exercise sound professional judgment
  • Proficient knowledge of SQL (T-SQL, MySQL, HiveQL, etc.) and experience working with complex data sets
  • Experience designing, deploying, maintaining, and enhancing analytical dashboards and reports across a variety of platforms
  • Experience working in a multi-terabyte data volume environment
Pluses
  • Experience with Sizmek, Tune, Google Tag Manager, and Google Analytics
  • Deep understanding of the digital advertising ecosystem; a strong familiarity with online media buying and selling processes and a base knowledge of DSPs, SSPs, and Ad Exchanges
  • Required Application Materials
Resume
  • Cover Letter which should include:
    • Why you are interested in working at Blizzard
    • What games you are currently playing
**Only submittals with Cover Letters will be considered

Blizzard Entertainment is a global company committed to growing our employees along with the business. We offer generous benefits and perks with an eye on providing true work / life balance. We’ve worked hard to foster an intensely collaborative and creative environment, a diverse and inclusive employee culture, and training and opportunity for professional growth. Our people are everything. Our core values are real, and our mission has never changed. We are dedicated to creating the most epic entertainment experiences…ever. Join us!
title: Associate Data Analyst

description:
Base is looking for a Data Analyst to join our Business Analytics team. This is a high visibility position that will work across the company as well as senior leadership.

Your responsibilities as a Data Analyst will include:
  • Provide reporting and insights to help Marketing, Sales and Customer Success Teams make informed business decisions.
  • Compile relevant data from a variety of sources including SQL database.
  • Ensure data integrity by understanding business processes and back-end data structure.
  • Develop and maintain Tableau dashboards for each team.
  • Conduct ad-hoc analysis to answer business questions.
  • Provide specifications and guidance to the data engineering team to ensure data is structured in a way that facilitates business analysis.
Job Requirements

  • 2+ years of experience working with relational databases (MySQL or similar) for business analysis.
  • 2+ years of experience with a data visualization tool (E.g. Tableau).
  • Ability to communicate with business stakeholders as well as data engineers and developers.
  • Ability and desire to learn new tools and technologies quickly and independently.
What we offer

description:
At Globant (www.globant.com) we strive daily to deliver powerful innovative software solutions for our clients through our unique Digital Journey approach. Our passion for technology reverberates in every area of our organization and drives our creativity. Working for us means being at the convergence of engineering, design, innovation and scale. It means being part of a tightly knit and driven team whose work directly affects the products and bottom line of our clients.

Our bar is high, but so are the results we achieve. As a Data Analyst, you will need ETL and SQL skills. So strong experience and competencies with these technologies are required.

All of our engineers are backed up by our Technical Directors and Studios (centers of excellence), and our project team(s) of amazing “Globers”. Each team, while having their own personality, are part of the global tapestry that makes up our powerful culture of collaboration, agility and impact.

We look at the software development process from the three different but complementary perspectives of engineering, design, and innovation...in a constant quest for new insights. We also believe in showing our people how much we value them, which is why one of the many benefits we offer is a fully paid by company PPO health plan.

Relevant skills

  • Data analysis
  • SQL
  • ETL
  • MDM tools or similar a bonus
  • Content people, not coding people
  • Handling and analyzing data quality
  • Checking for anomalies in the data
Role description

  • The data team are looking for several candidates with ETL skills
  • The team is cross-functional - managing services from data of multiple teams.
  • Core responsibilities:
  • Data mapping, data profiling, data modelling
  • Analyze where there are any problems, identifying data problems, anomalies
  • Understand business processes & analyze where the gaps are across departments (HR data, finance date, compensation, REWS data etc)
  • ETL, XML, Json, API related
  • API related dev (building it out, then take over support, as own the data)
  • Managing some projects for various teams such as:
  • Data validation (after testing)
  • Building data
  • Handling and analyzing data quality
Globant is an EOE M/F/D/V. For many positions, relocation is available if needed. Globant does not accept unsolicited third party resumes.
title: Data Analyst

description:
SUMMARY:

Under the direction of the Program Director the Data Analyst is responsible to develop analysis and reporting capabilities, and to continuously monitor program outcomes.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
  • Collaborate with Health Care Agency’s (HCA) Adult/Older Adult Performance Outcomes Department to develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality.
  • Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.
  • Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets, make recommendations for programming based on that analysis, and present findings for review by the Program Director and presentation to HCA. The results of this analysis may be used to make programming modifications.
  • Filter and “clean” data and review computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
  • Work cooperatively with Wellness Center staff as well as HCA staff to manage program. documentation, making timely changes or updates as needed or requested
  • Review compiled data and request changes, clarification or updates from staff as needed to develop the monthly outcomes report for presentation to the Program Director and HCA.
  • Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
  • Attend required trainings and meetings, and participate actively in the community life of the worksite.
  • Must adhere to agreed upon schedule coordinated with Program Director.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • High School Diploma with 1 year of hands-on experience working in a financial, accounting, or record-keeping environment. College or university level classes related to electronic data collection systems is highly desirable.
  • Thorough working knowledge of the latest versions of MS Excel and MS Access required.
  • Experience in auditing spreadsheet and database data highly desirable. Must understand mental health systems.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate information with attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Lived mental health experience preferred.

Job Type: Full-time

Job Location:

  • Orange, CA

Required education:

  • High school or equivalent

Required license or certification:

  • Class C driver's license
title: Data Analyst - Entry Level

description:
Product Data Management (PDM) Analyst

Summary:
  • As a Product Data Management (PDM) Analyst, you will be responsible for inputting technical master data for one (or more) company's division into the SAP Recipe Management system.
  • You will work closely with our business users in packaging development to learn how they do their work and provide help and support in inputting their data into SAP.
  • You will work closely with the other PDM Analysts to learn about the systems and processes used every day to support the data needs.
Key Responsibilities:
  • Independently manages product data setup for new items in SAP Recipe Management (PDM), from project scoping through tech transfer
  • Ensures data is entered accurately, according to Gold Standard and in a timely manner
  • Anticipates and communicates potential timing issues and creates a solution with project team
  • Participates in PDM scoping discussions enabling R&D; to plan projects accordingly
  • Ensures adequate scopings have occurred prior to executing work
  • Understands the basic connections between Recipe Management (PDM) and the Production environment (SAP R3) and its impact on new projects
  • Utilize this knowledge to assist in scoping sessions, manage expectations with R&D; partners and otherwise drive to correct Recipe management set-ups
  • Participates on PDM Steering Team and ensures R&D; community is adhering to latest business processes during PDM project work, including Gold Standards and routings
  • Identify data accuracy issues and work with other members to determine best solution to ensure consistency
Requirements:
Education:
  • Associate Degree or higher
Computer Skills:
  • SAP or similar ERP experience, Microsoft Office suite of products (Outlook, Excel, etc.)
  • Experience with SAP Recipe Management system, including authoring knowledge and in-depth searching
  • Minimum of 1 year of experience developing and implementing manufacturing standards in SAP-PDM (or similar system) with a thorough understanding of product data management in alignment with ERP systems and compliance
  • Completes work accurately and completely with high attention to detail
  • Tracks project requirements (data and timing) and communicates potential issues (missing data, slipping timelines) to team when appropriate.
  • Ability to analyze data from multiple sources (SAP, recipe management, etc.) and drive to accurate data to be communicated to outside sources.
  • Readily responds to shifting project priorities and manages fluctuating project load
  • Acts as “first line of defense” with respect to product data
  • Follows current business processes and best practices, communicates requirements to scientists – to ensure accuracy and compliance.

title: Data Analyst 487411

description:
Health Integrity, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Quality Health Strategies, Inc., is dedicated to protecting the fiscal and clinical integrity of healthcare systems in Medicare, Medicaid, and the private sector. The company operates nationally as a federally-designated program integrity contractor for the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS). Health Integrity’s expert clinical and technical staff identify and investigate potential fraud, waste and abuse in healthcare – assisting law enforcement agencies and protecting public resources.

We have multiple opportunities for entry level and experienced Healthcare Data Analysts to join our Orange, CA based United Program Integrity Contractors (UPIC) team. Home-based positions for well-qualified candidates are available in Northern California. Our UPIC team identifies and investigates fraud, waste and abuse in the Medicare and Medicaid programs covering 16 Western states and territories. In addition to our need for experienced analysts, we also have entry level positions that are perfect for candidates with strong analytical ability and experience working with large data sets using SAS, R, and/or SQL. It's also a great opportunity if you want to make a positive difference in our nation's healthcare programs

Interviews are scheduled for Tuesday, February 28 in Cerritos and Thursday, March 2 in Chico.

Our data analysts perform study design, data analysis, and report preparation. Studies originate from preliminary data analysis (trends), literature review, experience and expertise of the team, and mandated projects. Data analysis, including data preparation and presentation of findings is performed in conjunction with other analysts. Reports are drafted by teams with leadership of Data Scientists.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
  • Trend data to identify potential opportunities (e.g., variances, significant outliers, percentile ranked groups) for quality improvement or focused investigations.
  • Aid in design data analysis strategies to identify potential areas for quality improvement or focused investigation.
  • Analyze data, draw conclusions, and summarize into quality indicator values
  • Develop tabular and graphical presentations of data, which clearly and concisely illustrate current levels of care.
  • Populate tabular and graphical presentation of data.
  • Contribute to the development of interventions (i.e., develop educational materials for doctors and nurses) which will improve healthcare processes and outcomes.
  • Facilitate design re-measurement strategies (after intervention) of healthcare processes and outcomes to effectively quantify impact of interventions for improvement.
  • Analyze re-measurement data and summarize into quality indicator values.
  • Support development of reports concerning all of the above.
  • May mentor junior Data Analysts in technical aspects of their work.
  • Assist in preparing findings for publishing in peer reviewed journals.
  • Familiar with commonly used concepts, practices and procedures, relying on instructions and pre-established guidelines to perform the functions of the job.

Supervisory Responsibilities
  • This job has no supervisory responsibilities.

Required Skills Competencies

To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:
  • Analytical - Synthesizes complex or diverse information; Collects and researches data; Uses intuition and experience to complement data.
  • Problem Solving - Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; Gathers and analyzes information skillfully; Develops alternative solutions.
  • Judgment - Exhibits sound and accurate judgment; Supports and explains reasoning for decisions.

Language Skills
  • Ability to read, analyze, and interpret common scientific and technical and professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations.
  • Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals.
  • Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.

Mathematical Skills
  • Ability to apply advanced mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference.
  • Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations.
  • Ability to apply mathematical operations to such tasks as frequency distribution, determination of test reliability and validity, analysis of variance, correlation techniques, sampling theory, and factor analysis.

Reasoning Ability
  • Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
  • Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.

Other Skills and Abilities
  • To perform this job successfully, an individual should have fluency in SAS or other statistical programming software and MS Office.
  • Ability to work independently and in teams.
  • Must possess familiarity with statistical and epidemiological methodologies, and automation techniques for analytic tasks.
  • Ability to work with highly sensitive information while preserving the confidentiality of the information.
  • Working knowledge of healthcare systems, Medicare/Medicaid preferred, healthcare databases and coding systems.
Required Experience Data Analyst II: Bachelor's degree (BA or BS) in Statistics, Biostatistics, Epidemiology, Public Health or related discipline (e.g., Economics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science) required. 6 months experience with health related analytic research preferred.

Data Analyst III: Bachelor's degree (BA or BS.) in Statistics, Biostatistics, Epidemiology, Public Health or related discipline (e.g., Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science) required. Minimum of 2 years of hands-on SAS or other statistical programming work experience or demonstrated combination of education and experience. A Master's degree will be accepted in lieu of the 2 years of experience. Six months experience with health related analytic research preferred.

Data Analyst IV: Bachelor's degree (BA or BS) required, preferably in Statistics, Biostatistics, Epidemiology, Public Health or related discipline (e.g., Economics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science). Minimum of 4 years of hands-on SAS or other statistical programming work experience, or demonstrated equivalent combination of education and experience. A Master's degree will be accepted in lieu of the 2 years of experience. One year experience with health related analytic research preferred.

Health Integrity is an Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans, and Individuals with Disabilities.
title: Data Analysts- Healthcare Fraud

description:
Quality Data Analyst:

The Quality Data Analyst would be responsible for developing, enhancing and maintaining reporting dashboards and metrics for the purposes of Quality reporting and analysis on several cross functional data sets. The role is a combination of technical and analytical. Candidates should be self-driven, can work independently with fantastic multi-tasking and organizational skills.

Primary Responsibilities:
  • Compiles and validates data for monthly TL9000 data submission
  • Work cross functionally with SME’s to validate data trends and/or anomalies
  • Develop new views and/or enhancements to the TL9000 Dashboard via Tableau; MUST HAVE TABLEAU EXPERIENCE
  • Prepare summary views and analysis for quarterly ‘packages’ as well as periodic executive summaries and/or customer scorecards.
  • Assist with facilitating quarterly review meetings and follow up actions.
  • Maintain the TL9000 Customer Specific SAP BW reports
  • Assist with data analysis fir special projects or ad-hoc support/escalations as needed
Qualifications:
  • Moderate to Advanced Tableau skills: Ability to create, modify and maintain dashboards
  • 5+ years of experience using data quality and/or visualization tools (Tableau, Business Objects)
  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, statistics or related field.
  • Passionate about data quality.
  • Strong analytical and data manipulation skills.
  • Ability to independently identify, research and resolve issues.
  • Quality background and/or Customer excellence/ knowledge preferred
  • Experience in summarizing data trends– what is the data telling us?
  • Excellent Attention to Detail
  • Strong MS Office: Excel / PowerPoint
  • Basic SAP BW skills
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to work with all levels of management and individual contributors
  • Strong facilitation, negotiation skills
  • Strong cross functional team building skills – “Must be team player”
  • TL9000 knowledge is a plus

description:
Job Summary

The Internet Media Data Analyst can predict internet user behavior, studies internet marketing trends, enjoys behavioral statistics and seeks to profit on tenacity.

With access to the best performing marketing platforms and a digital design team, the Internet Media Data Analyst is responsible for recognizing resources, acquiring knowledge, learning platform interfaces, creating data target inputs and evaluating results of digital media campaigns. The goal of the Internet Media Data Analyst is to find the best combination of variables.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Reporting to the Creative Director, the Internet Media Data Analyst is responsible for utilizing innovative data analysis and collaborate goals with a design team to set up a profitable marketing campaign.

Duties include product placement and design research analytics, acting as a liaison with various media advertising platform managers to achieve marketing goals, working within media advertising platforms to set up campaigns, strategizing internet user behavior against marketing resources and goals, managing campaign spend and evaluating results. Finally, reporting and communication of analytic results must be translated into strategy adjustments.

Minimum Requirements (Education, Experience, Special Skills, Licenses and/or Certificates)

  • Must possess a solid understanding of the social media universe and leading properties that include: YouTube, Facebook, Facebook Live, Twitter, Instagram, and Snapchat
  • Must have demonstrated experience in executing various social media campaigns
  • Experience sourcing and managing content development
  • Must possess excellent oral and written communication skills and presentation skills and be able to work individually or in a team or project environment
  • Computer proficiency with Microsoft Office, Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint a MUST
  • Must be able to work in a multi-tasking deadline driven and fast-paced environment
  • Must be able to quickly analyze situations and develop clear and logical solutions
  • Must possess excellent communications, organizational, goal setting, analytical, planning and problem-solving skills
  • Must be in the office in Newport Beach during business hours.

Essential Physical Demands

Must have the ability to work extended hours at a computer workstation, laptop and/or via mobile smart phone.

Essential Mental Functions

The ability to coordinate and reprioritize multiple projects and tasks, think logically and make quick, sound decisions.

Equipment Used

Computer workstation, laptop, mobile smart phone and other typical office equipment

Job Type: Full-time

Job Location:

  • Newport Beach, CA

social networking: 2 years

Salary: $3,000.00 /month

description:
Job Title :Lead Data Scientist FLSA:Exempt /Non-Exempt Department:Commercial Insights Band:Management/ Individual Contributor Location :Los Angeles Job Level:Reports To:Director, Commercial Insights Position Type :Full Time /Part Time/On-Call Travel Required :No JD Creation Date:Job Summary:
As part of the Commercial & Analytics Team, the Lead Data Scientist will be responsible for providing actionable insights, analysis, and strategy to better understand the business and the marketing investments.
This candidate has a technical/analytical skill set, a strong business acumen and a curious mind-set capable of thinking outside the box and questioning the status quo. As the senior member of the team, the Lead Data Scientist will coordinate other data scientists and will be accountable for a good portion of the delivery of the entire team. The role will work with stakeholders (commercial and marketing) and support them to answer questions such as: How efficient are we spending the retention budget? Which is the Return of Investment of the acquisition and media spend? Which levers can we pull to grow a given segment of customers?

The position is uniquely positioned within Betfair US business to gain a detailed understanding of all aspects of the Business: Commercial, Marketing, Business Development. As such, the role requires a high degree of flexibility and the ability to proactively provide insight and recommendations throughout the organization.

Essential Functions: Business cases: Work on new investment ideas, building a business case to support the decision. Assess costs and forecast the revenue streams Marketing spend analysis: Understand the impact of retention and acquisition marketing on the business. Calculate the Return of Investment, provide actionable insights and work with the commercial and marketing team to set the right strategy In depth analysis: Work closely with the commercial team, understanding the business drivers. Spot new growth opportunities and make recommendations to drive the business to a higher level of profitability Modelling and segmentation: Build in-house models that will support the marketing execution. Segment the customer based on value and behavioral clusters. Build predictive models to forecast the value of the customer or the next best action Risk Analytics: Understand how to identify and measure risks that a business is exposed to, and know how to communicate those risks effectively to senior management so they can make decisions

Required Qualification: Business Insights: has a nose for business, uses insights to impact commercial drivers Drives Results: gets stuck in and achieves results that impact the bottom line with high levels of energy and enthusiasm Innovative: Provide innovative and out of the box solutions to complex issue Experience in coordinating/managing a team Investigate : Trying to understand the source of the data and communicate with various stakeholders get a better view where the data resides Intuitive : Have a strong understanding of how the business works and try to find the red flags or areas of improvement Collaborates: is a team player - works with the team and stakeholders across the organization to get things done Communicates effectively, develops, and delivers multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences Nimble Learning-is agile and flexible. Learns quickly when faced with new situations Comfortable using graphs and other illustrative tools to present large volumes of data (i.e. Tableau, Qlik ) Understanding of the online business, ecommerce Pro-active problem solver attitude with flexibility to work across different units Strong work ethic complemented by a positive, can-do attitude Experience working with large complex datasets to derive insight and analysis Work closely with the BA and Business teams to gather requirements and deliver project successfully Experience in a data driven environment delivering insight and reporting Expert knowledge of MS Excel (Macros, Pivots, lookups etc ). Expert knowledge of Power Point E xperience with advanced data analysis application packages (i.e. R, Python, SPSS, SAS, KNIME, Altyrex etc.) with at least 3 years’ experience Proficient knowledge of SQL Server, Redshift, Google Big Query, and excellent data warehousing concepts to extract, manipulate, and model data from various data sources E xperience with Google Analytics/Omniture, GTM and online advertising E xperience with A/B testing tools ( Mixpanel , Optimizely etc ). Experience with predictive modelling, LTV Modelling (decision trees, regressions, text mining etc.) Experience with ticketing tools to track projects (JIRA) Experience with large amounts of customer data E xperience in building creative and interactive dashboards using Tableau, Microstrategy , D3, Looker or Qlikview Experience of ecommerce business Commercial/marketing experience, working in an analytically focused role (i.e. Data Analyst, Financial Analyst, etc.) Project Management – Experience prioritizing and managing multiple projects at one time Experience overseeing the entire process of extracting data, turning it into useful information, converting that to a presentable format and then delivering the message to senior stakeholders in an effective way University degree in an analytical discipline (i.e. Engineering, Statistical Science, Mathematics, Actuarial Studies, Economics, Computer Science, Management Information Systems etc.) Passion for online gaming preferably gambling. Leading independently a project from end to end showing autonomy in a proactive approach

Physical demands (ADA):
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to walk and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to use hands to finger, handle, or use calculator or numerical keys on computer keyboard. The employee is frequently required to sit for long periods of time as well as bend, reach, and stoop, or kneel. Moderate physical activity is required, including the ability to lift 15 pounds.

Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.

Work Environment:
Work is normally performed in a typical interior/office work environment. Must be able to multi-task in a constantly changing environment. Requires the ability to meet pressure deadlines and time constraints.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

title: Junior Data Analyst

description:
What do we do and why should you join us?:
  • We help people change their lives. BetterHelp is a platform for online counseling. We let anyone facing life's challenges have easy, affordable, and private access to a licensed and certified therapist. Our users get professional counseling using their laptop, tablet or mobile phone, anytime they need, anywhere they are.
  • We're small and big at the same time. We have hundreds of licensed counselors, thousands of paying members, hundreds of thousands of online sessions, and millions of dollars in revenues. Yet, our team is still small and nimble, letting you have a huge impact from the early start and make your mark.
  • We're growing super-fast. Doubling our size every two months - no better time to join!
What are we looking for?:
BetterHelp is looking for a smart, ambitious and analytical Data Analyst to be responsible for anything data related. The goal of this position is to use data to drive insight into the business with a focus on growth. The ideal candidate would have a good understanding of business metrics and what numbers actually matter. You'll be doing plenty of post-hoc analysis, many analysis driven by your own curiosity and desire to grow the business (help as many people as possible) as well as setting up frameworks for more regular analysis. You should have some professional experience in this type of setting.

What will you do?:
  • Slice and dice an enormous amount of data to gain insight on how to grow the business
  • Look at complex problems and come up with testable algorithms to optimze the platform
  • Develop theories that can be explored with analysis to help us grow
  • Plan, monitor and analyze split tests in the platform with statistical rigor
  • Set up BI tools and regular reporting services and interfaces
  • Deliver charts and graphs with actionable decisions
  • Live and breath SQL
  • Enjoy great teamwork, have lots of fun, and take pride in building a world-class product that makes a difference on people's lives
What will you NOT do?:
  • You will NOT worry about "runway", "cash left", or "how much time we have until the next round". We have the startup DNA but we're fully backed and funded, all the way to success.
  • You will NOT be confined to your "job". You will get involved in product, marketing, business strategy, and almost everything we do.
  • You will NOT be bogged down by office politics, ego, or bad attitude. Only positive, pleasure-to-work-with people allowed here!
  • You will NOT get yourself burned out. We work hard but we believe in maintaining sustainable work/life balance. Really.
Requirements:
  • BSc/MA in a quantitative discipline such as Statistics, Math, Economics, or Engineering
  • Experience in quantitative data analysis
  • Ability to analyze an enormous amount of complex data, and deliver meaningful conclusions that can be turned into actionable decisions
  • Knowledge of statistics
  • SQL experience
  • Great grasp of numbers with love for data and analytics
  • Tech savvy
  • Excellent communication (oral and written), attention to detail, time management and organizational skills
Bonus (great to have but not required)::
  • Coding experience
  • R or other statistical language
  • Start Up experience (Ideally B2C)
Benefits:
  • Very competitive salary & equity compensation
  • Excellent health, dental, vision coverage
  • 401k benefits with employer matching contribution
  • Catered lunch every day
  • Door-to-door shuttle from San Francisco
  • Building something that matters - loved by the people and admired by the press
  • Any piece of hardware or software that will make you happy and productive
  • Awesome people to work with
title: Data Analyst

description:
We are looking for a talented data analyst to join our exciting, fast-paced and growing team! The Healthcare Data Analyst contributes to the overall success of our organization by reviewing, trending, reporting and interpreting population health data to better understand total cost, utilization and quality of care for a defined patient population typically part of an Accountable Care Organization (ACO) or simiar environment. Through analyzing patient claims and organizational data, the Healthcare Data Analyst will contribute to identifying progress, performance and opportunities for improvement on program, financial, quality, patient experience and other metrics. Reports will help rural healthcare facilities in various value-based and pay-for-performance programs understand and identify methods to maximize reimbursement and improve population heath. This work contributes to the development of new strategies and tactics to improve overall health care delivery and transform rural health systems across the country as they adapt from volume-based to value-based models of care.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
Prepare a variety of reports including statistical analyses for stakeholders to assist with decision-making and tracking accountability. Develop new reports, dashboards and other means to enable transparency and to monitor system-wide performance of program progress, total cost of care and clinical quality. Support acquisition and implementation of new information sources, data collection strategies, data governance, and analytics.
Monitor and interpret the performance of a participant "scorecard" report to track accountability on a monthly basis; review and analyze performance data, and summarize it to present the the participant
Become an expert "superuser" of Lightbeam Heath Solutions, a data warehouse and analytics system, and support internal and external stakeholders in optimizing their use of the Lightbeam Data Warehouse
Collect, trend and compare CMS claims data on cost and utilization, as well as quality scores.
Mine and aggregate dataset to identify trends/opportunities at regional- and national-level
Respond to Ad hoc reporting requests by creating reports as needed for specific situations
Supply data from Lightbeam to internal staff for grant reporting requirements
Discuss scorecard performance with internal stakeholders, identifying areas for improvement and strategies to achieve improvements
Create and upload relevant education videos in the learning management system; develop associated written education documents to accompany videos
Perform quality assurance analysis and functions on multiple data sets
Interpret data and support meaningful data reporting (trending, dash boarding, and graphical reporting for presentation)
Help staff with data manipulation and other methods to improve data quality when required
Develop and implement policies, procedures, and guidelines to support the Performance Improvement team

JOB REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor degree with concentration in health informatics, health administration, computing, epidemiology, statistics or related field
2-3 years of previous data analysis and/or applied research experience. Previous HMO/Managed Care or Healthcare industry experience strongly preferred; experience or interest in understanding patient care delivery in rural health care setting a plus
Preferred understanding of health data formats including: Medicare claims, EMR, lab and pharmacy
Excellent knowledge of data collection, analysis, statistics and data presentation with experience in data mining techniques and procedures
Prefer Industry knowledge including Accountable Care Organizations, health care reform, population health management models
Experience using statistical packages for analyzing large data sets, advanced MS Excel and Access skills and experience, SQL report writing skills and experience a plus
Excellent oral and written communication skills; ability to present complex information in an understandable and compelling manner
Excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Strong interpersonal, communication and collaboration skills
Demonstrated ability to complete projects in an environment with diverse, competing and sometimes conflicting priorities
Ability to plan, develop, implement, and evaluate participant performance against risk-based population health programs and develop tactics to improve performance and minimize total cost of care
Ability to present concepts and analysis in front of diverse audiences
Experience with quality reporting such as HEDIS, PQRS or CMS STAR ratings, highly preferred.
Interest in contributing to a fast paced and growing company!

Keywords: healthcare, health care, data analyst, SQL, informatics, statistics, epidemiology, health administration, EMR, electronic medical records,
title: Healthcare Data Analyst

description:
Data Analyst

The internet is experiencing a transformation – ad blindness and blocking are forcing media companies and advertisers to rethink the way they connect with consumers. This evolution is changing the way we consume content and how we interact with brands. Nativo is enabling this shift to advertising that is mindful of the user experience, and is focusing on user attention and engagement - not just clicks and traffic. Our technology is digital advertising 2.0, and we pride ourselves on being thought leaders in the space as well as technology leaders utilizing ad technology that is not available anywhere else.

The Nativo platform is used everyday by thousands of publications across billions of page views, by some of the largest and most important media companies in the world, who power their native programs and engage consumers with content rather than interruptive ads. Our main focus is to make elegant software that is both powerful and enjoyable to use.

The Data Analyst will assist the Campaign Operations team by providing analytic support through measuring the effectiveness of active and completed native advertising campaigns. This position will also collaborate with other internal departments to advance the capabilities provided by the Analytics team

What You'll Do:
  • Craft easy-to-understand narratives and actionable insights from complex concepts using advanced data visualization and presentation skills; includes but not limited to deriving insights from multi-faceted campaigns to inform advertiser clients of successful executions and prove out their return on investment
  • Provide analytics support to internal team members allowing them to make informed decisions backed by quantitative and qualitative metrics
  • Lead A/B testing initiatives to further enhance headline, preview image, and other content best practices
  • Manage brand lift studies and other attitudinal-based measurement projects used to prove the efficacy of campaigns
  • Develop best practices to improve process/workflow for completing campaign wrap decks
  • Use Excel and SQL (and in some cases other programming languages) to tease out patterns in the data and articulate findings to internal teams
  • Develop content optimization strategies and distribute to Campaign Operations team resulting in increased campaign performance
  • Maintain network, category, device and product level benchmark data and corresponding one-sheeters
  • Document processes to help create training materials and drive efficiencies throughout the company
  • Provide assistance in other areas of the department/company as needed

What You'll Need:
  • 2 years minimum work experience in digital analytics, preferably at an agency, publisher, or ad tech company
  • Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint), web analytics (Omniture, Google Analytics), ad servers (DoubleClick, Sizmek, Atlas), brand lift measurement platforms (Nielsen, Millward Brown, comScore), and working knowledge of database languages such as SQL (hands-on experience with data analysis tools like R and Python and considered a plus).
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills and the ability to present analysis to various levels of management and staff.
  • Intellectual curiosity to enjoy problem solving and ask the right questions to arrive at an insight
  • Capable of working with large amounts of data to support or refute a hypothesis
  • Experience with online brand survey techniques including setup and measurement
  • Basic understanding of concepts related to statistics, machine learning, and probability models
  • Excellent teamwork skills
  • Ability to work well without constant direction
  • Strong organizational skills and keen attention to detail; experience in innovating and optimizing tasks and workflows a strong plus
  • Must enjoy working in a fast-paced entrepreneurial startup environment
  • BA/BS degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Marketing, or related field
  • Experience or knowledge of A/B testing would be a plus.
  • A strong plus: Innovation and optimization to the workflow, direction, day-to-day task etc.

What We Offer:
At Nativo, you make an immediate impact. Nativo is made up of smart, talented and driven people looking for other potential team members with the same attitude of innovation and excellence. We offer incredible opportunities to learn and work on projects that transform digital advertising. We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package that includes stock options, health coverage, employer-matched 401k, cutting edge work, and the opportunity to join a rapidly growing startup with a proven product.
title: Data Analyst

description:
Arthur J. Gallagher & Co., one of the world's largest insurance brokers, provides a full range of retail and wholesale property/casualty (P/C) brokerage and alternative risk transfer services globally, as well as employee benefit brokerage, consulting, and actuarial services in the United States. We also offer claims and information management, risk control consulting, and appraisal services to clients around the world.

Arthur J. Gallagher Risk Management Services, Inc. is the U.S. retail property/casualty brokerage division of Arthur J. Gallagher & Co. Our advisors specialize by industry and coverage types—developing solutions uniquely tailored to individual client requirements. We deliver a full range of insurance and risk management products and services, including traditional and loss-sensitive coverages, captives, alternative risk solutions, and financial products to clients around the world. For additional information, please refer to Career Opportunities with Arthur J. Gallagher & Co.

Position Summary:
Works primarily with large market accounts, serves as liaison for all service, maintenance and set-up issues related to assigned accounts.

Essential Duties:
  • Works with Underwriting and Risk Control staffs on account issues.
  • Conducts New Business orientations, including Claims Reporting, coding, and any special service issues.
  • Single point of contact for any service concerns or general questions, both account and broker.
  • Negotiates and communicates special handling instructions, assuring compliance.
  • Facilitates interdepartmental communications to address questions client may have concerning billing, legal questions, financial impact, etc.
Additional Considerations:

The primary function of the Healthcare Data Analyst is to provide an analytical role for the managed care reinsurance team. The ideal candidate will highly organized, detail oriented, have a strong understanding of data analytics, and enjoy working with numbers. The Healthcare Data Analyst directly contributes to key business outcomes such as client retention, client satisfaction while enhancing AJG's value to our clients and prospects.
  • 1 – 3 years medical claims experience (professional and facility preferred)
  • Customer service oriented
  • Proficient with numbers
  • Proficient with analyzing and understanding report discrepancies
  • Proficient in using Microsoft Excel to manipulate data for correcting discrepancies
  • Identify pricing parameters for comparison purposes
  • Microsoft Access knowledge preferred
  • Preferred knowledge of CPT codes and revenue codes
  • ICD 10 knowledge a plus

Required:
  • Associate's degree and 5 years related experience in insurance, and multi-line claims adjusting.
  • Licensed or certified in all states in which claim oversight and direction is being provided.
Desired:
  • Bachelor's degree preferred.
U.S. Eligibility Requirements:
  • Interested candidates must submit an application and resume/CV online to be considered
  • Must be 18 years of age or older
  • Must be willing to submit to a background investigation; any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background investigation
  • Must have unrestricted work authorization to work in the United States. For U.S. employment opportunities, Gallagher hires U.S. citizens, permanent residents, asylees, refugees, and temporary residents. Temporary residence does not include those with non-immigrant work authorization (F, J, H or L visas), such as students in practical training status. Exceptions to these requirements will be determined based on shortage of qualified candidates with a particular skill. Gallagher will require proof of work authorization
  • Must be willing to execute Gallagher's Employee Agreement or Confidentiality and Non-Disclosure Agreement, which require, among other things, post-employment obligations relating to non-solicitation, confidentiality and non-disclosure
Gallagher offers competitive salaries and benefits, including: medical/dental/vision plans, life and accident insurance, 401(K), employee stock purchase plan, educational expense reimbursement, employee assistance program, flexible work hours (availability varies by office and job function) training programs, matching gift program, and more.

Gallagher believes that all persons are entitled to equal employment opportunity and does not discriminate against nor favor any applicant because of race, color, religion, sex, age, veteran status, disability, national origin, or any other legally protected status. Equal employment opportunity will be extended in all aspects of the employer-employee relationship, including, but not limited to, recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, transfer, demotion, compensation, benefits, layoff, and termination. In addition, Gallagher will make reasonable accommodations to known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified applicant with a disability, unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business.
title: Healthcare Data Analyst

description:
Description

Come join Intuit as a Staff Analyst in the Data Analytics & Science team. We are looking for creative problem solvers with a passion to deliver advanced data-driven solutions. This position works alongside marketers and agency partners to drive business results using data for optimization and insights.

The Team

The Small Business Data Analytics & Science team drives user growth and retention using product insights and marketing channel optimization for the Small Business Group (i.e. Intuit QuickBooks). We are an exciting, growing and fun team that works with industry-leading analytics tools, techniques and best practices.

The Role

We are seeking a Staff Analyst who will partner with our Online Advertising team and drive the profitable growth of our advertising channels using data-driven tactics. As a senior member of the analytics team, the successful candidate will have a strong track record of combining advanced analytics skills and knowledge of marketing channels to optimize our acquisition campaigns.

Primary Responsibilities
  • Provide thought leadership as the subject matter expert on online advertising analytics; work directly with Paid Search, Display, Paid Social and Affiliate marketing teams, and technical/data specialists to create and execute marketing strategies
  • Conceptualize and lead sophisticated attribution and incrementality studies leveraging large scale (granular) advertising data
  • Provide the leadership team with insights regarding marketing campaign effectiveness by measuring return on ad spend (and other success metrics); lead discussions of metrics derived from statistical analyses
Qualifications
  • 7+ years of experience in generating and presenting insights from marketing data; experience in advanced online advertising analytics and optimization a plus
  • Experience with multi-channel analytics and multi-touch attribution a plus
  • Advanced SQL skills to perform data segmentation and aggregation from scratch; experience working with granular web clickstream data a plus
  • Knowledge of programming languages and stats packages (e.g. python, R); comfortable running multiple regression analyses
  • Knowledge of online advertising platforms (e.g. Google AdWords, DoubleClick) and processes
  • Outstanding communication skills with the ability to influence decision makers and build consensus with teams
  • Masters degree in a quantitative field
title: Staff Business Data Analyst - U.S Channel Analytics

description:
We are a chiropractic software company looking for Operations/Data Analyst for reports development and to perform data conversions.

The Operations/Data Analyst operates in a rapidly evolving technical environment and must maintain a current working knowledge of assigned application systems and Chirotouch development standards. This position requires a proven ability to solve complex data problems and improve business processes.

The BI department influences business decision making by providing quantitative and qualitative data analysis of patterns, insights, and trends from multiple internal and external sources. Findings and insights are communicated to stakeholders via operational dashboards and ad hoc reporting and provide recommendations to the business for optimizing performance.

Job Duties that will deliver success include:
  • Design and develop ETL processes using T-SQL and occasionally SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
  • Assist with complex system integrations as necessary
  • Assist with BI Solution architecture and performance tuning
  • Develop, test and deliver error free data
  • Produce new and creative analytic reports using Tableau or other data visualization tools
  • Collaborate with the Salesforce development team, business analysts and users to understand business problems and develop new analytics solutions that add business value.
  • Assist the BI Manager by reviewing the work of Data Conversion Specialists and Data Analysts to further their skills and knowledge.
  • Perform requirements gathering and analysis
  • Perform other related duties as assigned or required.
  • Efficiently conduct Data Conversions from legacy software to Chirotouch or SmartCloud software using Excel, Microsoft Access, SQL Server and SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services).
Qualifications:
  • Strong knowledge of SSIS and TSQL (3+ years)
  • Solid understanding of the Kimball Method and advanced Data Warehousing methods
  • Advanced understanding of data visualization practices and methods
  • Expert documentation and communication skills
  • 2+ years developing Operations solutions
  • Experience with Tableau
The Company

Integrated Practice Solutions is doing business as ChiroTouch. Founded in 1999, ChiroTouch is the leading provider of Practice Management Software to the Chiropractic profession. This San Diego based company has experienced rapid and sustained growth through recent years and is looking for positive team members to join an exciting and encouraging culture. ChiroTouch has a strong entrepreneurial feel and seems to best support individuals that are resilient, solution oriented, very comfortable being a positive influence, and working well under some level of stress. The pace is brisk, the rewards uplifting, the successes are recognizably shared.

IPS is an equal opportunity employer in a right to work state, providing employee with personal Medical / Dental / Vision coverage, 401K 4% company match, FSA 125, Vacation and other paid time off, and in most cases a five day work week. The only requirement is to be your best and bring out the best in others, while keeping focused attention on making the best environment possible for our clients.

No Agency Calls Please
title: Operations/Data Analyst

description:
Mortgage Operations Data Analyst

In-House position - No relocation assistance

American Advisors Group (AAG) is the nation’s leader in reverse mortgage lending, licensed to operate in 48 states. The company, founded in 2004 by CEO Reza Jahangiri, is headquartered in Orange, CA. We are dedicated to helping American seniors leverage their home equity as an asset to help fund retirement. AAG holds an A+ rating with the Better Business Bureau, has a 96% customer satisfaction rating and is a member of the National Reverse Mortgage Lenders Association (NRMLA).

We are looking for an ambitious and driven individual to grow with us. We operate in a fast-paced, dynamic environment where everyone on the team "comes to win"-- our work atmosphere is high- entrepreneurial. AAG’s success stems from our unique core values that are inherent in every employee:

  • Caring for our customers and treating them with the dignity and respect in which they deserve.
  • Driven to provide superior customer service.
  • Ethical in how we conduct our work, every day.

AAG rewards hard work, promotes from within, supports career development and fosters a fun and friendly work environment. If this sounds like a company you are interested in joining, please review the job description below.

Position Overview

AAG is looking for a motivated Operations Data Analyst to provide support to the Operations Departments by mining, analyzing and reporting department level performance, gathering and compiling reporting information relevant to division and managing a number of different objectives, projects, and activities at one time. Significant multi-tasking abilities are required. Regular involvement with high-level leadership and exposure to sensitive information. Requires the use of considerable tact, diplomacy, and judgment.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Analyze data specific to Operations and loan fulfillment and provide intelligent synthesis, interpretation and appropriate action plans based on conclusions
  • Develop regular reporting on metrics and provide ongoing presentation recommendations based on data
  • Design, prepare and distribute reporting to Senior and Executive Management
  • Write standard operating procedures (queries, views, stored procedures, functions)
  • Test and validate reports to insure accuracy and quality
  • Maintain, automate and increase efficiency of existing reports
  • Create scripts for importing, exporting, analyzing, mapping and converting data
  • Develop and maintain a variety of report types, including but not limited to pivot, tabular, drill down, matrix, charts
  • Additional tasks may be assigned, as needed

Position Requirements

  • Data mining
  • Proficient in MS Office Suite (specifically exceptional Excel skills)
  • Strong research, financial modeling, analytical and quantitative skills.
  • Strong attention to detail, Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions in one-on-one interaction, meeting/group
  • Knowledgeable of SQL objects and query development
  • 1-2 years’ experience in a fast paced and entrepreneurial environment
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills, business judgment, and work ethic
  • Excited to work on a small team part of a large and well-known organization
  • Strong collaboration and personal leadership skills with the ability to influence others
  • Mortgage Experience a plus
  • BA/BS Degree with a finance focus or technical background preferred

Job Type: Full-time

Required experience:

  • Data Analyst: 1 year
  • Data Mining: 1 year
title: Data Analyst

description:
LifeMoves seeks a dependable, people-oriented, hard-working Program Data Analyst to join our committed team. Reporting to the Associate Director of Data, Reporting & Compliance, the Program Data Analyst is responsible for program performance reporting, including but not limited to data mining and analysis, explaining variances to Plan, and providing ongoing data and reporting support to program staff and data system users. LifeMoves is in a period of exciting, positive transition, resulting in fluid roles for many employees. Therefore, customer focus, flexibility and a “can-do”, roll-up-your-sleeves attitude are required.

PRIMARY DUTIES

Reporting & Statistics: Create reports on client demographics and program performance for LifeMoves programs. Collaborate with program staff and government contracts staff to ensure up-to-date and accurate system data. Submit statistics to Finance, Development, and others as requested. Work with Program Directors to ensure all programmatic components of reports (client statistics and narratives) are submitted in a timely manner.

Evaluation & Analysis: Prepare monthly, quarterly and annual statistical reports for all programs . Work with the VP of Programs and Services and Program Directors to improve data collection and evaluate program efficacy. Develop tracking systems for data collection.

Database Training: Assist in training staff on Salesforce.com database changes and other data collection requirements. Understand underlying program processes and tailor training accordingly.

Process Documentation: Create and maintain documentation for key business processes

Compliance: Keep track of changes to reporting and data collection requirements

General Duties: Perform other related duties and departmental coverage as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS

Strong analytical and critical thinking skills

Strong organization and prioritization skills

Attention to details

Proficient in Microsoft Access, Excel and Word

Experience using Salesforce.com a plus

Ability to work independently, meeting deadlines and customer expectations

Strong written and verbal communication skills

Exceptional interpersonal skills and ability to interact effectively internally and with partner organizations

Ability to patiently and effectively support non-technical employees with technical tasks and problems

Presentation and training skills

Bachelor’s degree preferred

HOW TO APPLY

Please e-mail a resume and brief cover letter to adminjobs@lifemoves.org . Include the job title in the subject line and send resume and cover letter as attachments. We do not accept phone calls.

LifeMoves is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE).
title: Program Data Analyst

description:
Looking for an innovative, creative, passionate, and fun company in OC. Then let us introduce ourselves. We are MobilityWare and we make fun for a living and do it better than most! Our mobile games have been rocking the app store since its inception and we regularly show up in those top two, top five, and top ten lists for most popular games. We're reaching 300 million downloads...which is like 3/4's of the US populate!

We were voted 2015 & 2016 Best Places to Work in Orange County by the Orange County Business Journal and OC Register!

What's the Gig

Do oceans of data get you giddy to grab your suit and jump in? Do you have a special connection with the 18th letter of our alphabet? Have you ever longed for a day when you could write SQL query that would help you understand the eternal question, "What were you thinking?" Let's join forces and make a data symphony.

We're looking for a big time data geek who can provide some serious Swami insight into our business from feature optimization to user behavior and acquisition/retention campaigns. If you aren't rocking some serious game experience, we definitely want to hear from you, but you'll need to demo your gamer instincts and love for the game.

What's Your Day Look Like

  • Bringing the goods, the excellent data that is, to marketing and our user acquisition plans.
  • Make some action happen; your KPIs and analysis will shine a light on what we have to do and what to do next.
  • You'll be delivering analyses on customer segmentation, retention analysis, loyalty, ROI, and Lifetime Value.
  • Using your analysis to craft our marketing communications.
  • Collaborating and working across all functions and boundaries of the organization.
  • Creating A/B testing programs that achieve major insights and help drive ongoing performance improvements through multivariate optimization.
  • Give your data a visual touch by creating dashboards and presentations that aren't just lovely, but provide key findings.
  • Giving presentations to key stakeholders.
If You're Coming to The Table, Be Sure to Bring With You

  • Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative field (Business, Economics, etc.)
  • Advanced business degree (MGA, MS Analytics, etc.) a plus.
  • Minimum 4 - 7 years hands-on experience with data analysis in business.
  • Previous experience with one of the following data solutions: Treasure Data, SnowFlake
  • Good understanding of the Mobile Game market (Platforms & Trends).
  • Ability to manage people and foster relationships across business units.
  • Experience with one or more programming or scripting languages a plus.
  • Experience in SQL queries.
  • Analytical mind with the ability to spot patterns and trends others miss.
You've Got to Bring the Love for Games

  • Previous experience as a marketing and/or retention analysis in the games industry.
  • Good understanding of the Mobile Game market (Platforms & Trends) and Live Support for games (Online or Mobile).
  • And of course, you absolutely must have experience playing Mobile games (I mean really, why do I need to say such things).
Why you should work for us:
  • Freaking amazing culture - we do what we say we are going to do, we're honest, we're nice, we're crazy smart, and we love to have a good time and all of this is true at every level of the organization.
  • Awesome Perks: free lunch, free snacks, free soda, free coffee, free dental, free vision, and even a free medical option
  • Casually awesome workplace - yes, flip flops and shorts are pretty much an everyday thing
  • Growth, growth, growth - we are growing and we would love for you to join us on the ride
  • We also want to take care of our team so we've got medical (100% paid option), dental (100% paid), vision (100% paid), OPEN PTO, life insurance (100% paid), and 401K

description:
