About ZapLabs LLC
ZapLabs ( www.zaplabs.com ) is the innovation and technology hub for global real estate leader Realogy Holdings Corp. (NYSE: RLGY), and the driving force behind inventive technology for brokers and agents affiliated with Realogy’s world renowned real estate brands. ZapLabs delivers its highly effective consumer, sales associate and broker solutions in support of Realogy’s leading franchise brands and is positioned to expand the scope of its technology development efforts to encompass Realogy’s other business segments, including residential brokerage, relocation and settlement services. ZapLabs is headquartered in Emeryville, California.

Junior Data Analyst

ZapLabs’ Data team is looking for data geeks. The Junior Data Analyst will work closely with ZapLabs’ data scientists, product managers, engineers and senior leadership to provide insights and analyses that drive product strategy, innovation, and adoption of ZapLabs’ consumer and business products.

Acquire, clean, and structure data from multiple sources, including Google Analytics, AdWords, and internal databases

N ice to Have
Experience with Google Analytics and SQL required

title: Sr. Data Analyst

description:
Experience start-up momentum!

tispr is the mobile services marketplace to discover, connect and collaborate with talented, independent, and skilled persons locally.

We are dedicated to building the new home for work; a reliable, safe, and self-sustaining community that empowers people to instantly connect and collaborate on any project. We’re looking for great people who are passionate about helping to rapidly grow the independent workforce and change the lives of millions of American freelancers. It’s a mission that takes some serious smarts, intense curiosity, and dedication to be the best. Come explore endless talents with us.

Summary

tispr is seeking a Marketing Data Analyst who is self-motivated, passionate, and motivated by a strong data culture. This role is highly cross-functional, which means you will get to work with product, engineering, business development, and marketing teams. Become part of our ambitious and colorful startup team and work hands-on with a fast-growing tech company!

What you’ll do

We are looking for an analytics-driven Digital Marketing Analyst to help plan, analyze, and monitor digital marketing campaigns. You will manage all testing, analysis, and improvement of our various conversion points in the marketing funnel. This role will also be responsible for oversight and performance of SEM, SEO, ASO, Paid Display, Mobile and Social campaigns and website performance reporting. You will work closely with the Analytics and Marketing team to identify and explore opportunities for new data sources and reporting functionality.

Responsibilities Include:

  • Reporting on high-quality, targeted media buys for Digital (including Search, Display, Email and Social Media) advertising campaigns

  • Support the Product Team in ad-hoc analytics

  • Work with a variety of software platforms, including Google AdWords, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, GDN, Doubleclick, retargeting, DSPs, PPC and social media platforms

  • Partner with the Analytics Team and digital agencies to track and analyze performance by channel, conduct A/B and multivariate tests, establish reporting infrastructure, and communicate out results, strategic insights and action plans on a weekly, monthly and quarterly basis

  • Analyze website traffic and behavior to provide feedback and strategies to improve user experience and conversion rates

  • Partner with Marketing to increase retention and leverage CRM data in Acquisition Marketing channels, including display retargeting, lookalike targeting, dynamic ads, remarketing lists for search ads, etc.

  • Reporting on keyword, seasonality and freelancer trends, impact of changes and latest results

  • Utilize additional research tools to improve site rankings and make digital media campaigns more effective and efficient

  • Develop insights, Key Performance Indicators and visual dashboards; reporting to management and project teams

  • Work internally with Branding & Communications to plan campaigns, collaborative development of ad content, and provide ongoing campaign reporting and recommendations

  • Work closely with cross-functional teams (engineering, product, creative, marketing, operations) to align marketing strategies with the goals and objectives of the overall business designed to increase engagement, retention and loyalty

  • Stay apprised of data and analytics technologies within the digital marketing industry

  • Identify new opportunities to acquire new users in a scalable manner, such as growth hacking
Requirements
  • : What to bring
    • Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business, Data Analytics or related fields
    • At least 2-3 years in online marketing, online advertising, traffic acquisition, and marketing analytics
    • Self-directed - Strategic, Independent thinking, motivation and creativity
    • Paid Search and Display experience (including social, mobile and video) is required, but ideally you’ll have additional experience with some of the following: SEO, Affiliates, Influencers, Referral, Digital Radio, etc.





  • Experience with multi-channel, cross-platform marketing campaigns with proven track record of meeting and exceeding ROI objectives

  • Experience with 1st and 3rd party data, specific targeted audience segments and customer segmentation

  • Precise and polished communicator / presenter, expertly organized with a strong ability to translate data into actionable insights

  • Experience with reporting platforms including Google AdWords, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Bing Ads, DSPs, PPC and social media platforms

  • Flexible and positive personality. For example, if you haven’t done something before, you immediately move into ‘how do I accomplish this’ mindset.

Bonus points, if you have

  • Knowledge of JIRA and Confluence, as well as, experience working in Scrums

  • Technical experience or acumen to manage database integration for accurate reporting and experience with Mailchimp, Mandrill, Appboy & Appsflyer

  • Ability to set up and manage CRM systems

  • Expert level proficiency in excel and an advocate of using data to make business decisions, build business cases and support campaign optimizations

  • Highly motivated with an entrepreneurial spirit and ability to work independently, while also able to build strong internal relationships and build consensus on critical initiatives

  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills; comfortable leveraging large amounts of data to drive decisions and a passion for continuous testing and optimization

  • Strong business acumen. Ability to operate in a fast-paced environment, managing multiple projects simultaneously and prioritizing time and resources based on business impact
title: Marketing Data Analyst

description:
To Apply - all candidates must express interest at: https://apply.coolworks.com/sacfoodcoop/job-details.asp?JobID=50615

Reports to: Finance Manager

Classification: Full-time

FLSA Status: Non-Exempt

POSITION SUMMARY:

Under the direction and guidance of the Finance Manager, the Data Analyst is responsible for ensuring effective and consistent decisions are made regarding purchasing, product mix and resource management. The Data Analyst provides reporting and research for ordering, cost-of-goods and inventory practices. This position will turn various degrees of data into information, information into insight and insight into sound business decisions and recommendations for change in product management. This position supports and provides effective analyst through a commitment to uphold Sacramento Natural Foods Co-op’s purposes and mission and in a manner that strengthens the cooperative identity.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Design, develop and distribute key indicator reports on inventory, sales and operational activity to appropriate personnel.
  • Proactively interpret data, analyze results and provide timely reporting to all stakeholders and management.
  • Assist in the development and implementation of databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies and tactics that optimize operational efficiency and performance.
  • Acquire data from internal and external data sources and maintain databases and data systems.
  • Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
  • Filter and organize data by reviewing system reports and performance indicators to identify and correct systems and process problems.
  • Work with management to prioritize business and information needs.
  • Locate and define new process improvements opportunities and communicate them to appropriate individuals.
  • Engage and support all business operations as well as vendor activities.
  • Maintain knowledge of trends and systems for maintaining and reporting on inventory and cost-of-goods.
  • Conducts physical and electronic inventory counts as needed.

Other Duties

  • Abide by all co-op policies and procedures.
  • Supports the values of the cooperative principles in their daily work.
  • Performs other duties and works in other department and events as assigned.
  • Upholds General Responsibilities daily.

ESSENTIAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

To perform the job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, ability and/or experience required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Working knowledge of Point of Sales Systems and other pricing software.
  • High School Diploma, GED or equivalent certificate.
  • Language Ability
  • Comprehend complex instructions, correspondence, memos and administrative reporting.
  • Communicate effectively in oral or written form.
  • Effectively present information to people of diverse backgrounds in both one-on-one and group environments.
  • Reasoning Ability
  • Apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed written and oral feedback and explanation.
  • Deal with problems involving a few concrete variables in standardized situations.
  • Prioritize multiple tasks, objectives and manage their own work. * Computer Skills
  • Use of word processing, spreadsheet (MS Office), email and internet software.
  • Proficiency in typing skills * Problem Solving
  • Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner.
  • Reports problems to appropriate individuals.
  • Gathers and analyzes information skillfully.
  • Improves processes and services. * Adaptability
  • Consistently modifies and adapts to meet management’s expectations.
  • Manages competing demands.
  • Able to deal with frequent change, delays or unexpected events. * Attendance and Punctuality
  • Ensures compliance with attendance standards.
  • Provides adequate notification and coverage when absent.
  • Arrives to meetings, appointments and other commitments on time.
  • Available to work evenings and weekends. * Dependability
  • Responds to management’s direction.
  • Commits to long hours of work when necessary to reach goals and work assignments.
  • Completes tasks on time or notifies appropriate persons with status updates and alternate plans. * Quality
  • Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness.
  • Looks for ways to improve and promote quality.
  • Applies feedback to improve performance
  • Monitors own work to ensure quality and improves work performance as needed. * Project Management
  • Develops project plans and coordinates projects as needed.
  • Completes projects on time. * Knowledge and ability to accurately record essential elements of meeting proceedings. Ability to record a brief, clear and accurate summary of meeting discussions
  • Ability to work with people of diverse backgrounds.
  • General clerical and archival skills.
  • Excellent attention to detail.

DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

  • Working knowledge of point-of-sale systems: Catapult, CostGuard, Cheftec and/or Sage.
  • Interest and/or experience in natural foods, cooperatives and/or value based organizations.
  • Associates of Arts or Bachelors of Arts degree.

ESSENTIAL PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Required Daily
  • Sitting and reviewing information on a computer screen or on paper for extended period of time.
  • Use of hands, arms and wrists to type and other task; which includes: reaching, grasping, handling, feeling, touching.
  • Walking
  • Lifting and moving up to 25 pounds
  • Talking and hearing
  • Climbing, stooping and balancing

WORK ENVIRONMENT

The work environment described her are representative of those and employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • The duties of this position are performed in a well-lighted, temperature-controlled office environment.
  • The noise level may range from quiet to relatively noisy.
  • Occasionally may be exposed to smells and odors that may range from natural to chemical.

IMPORTANT DISCLAIMER NOTICE:

This is an FLSA Non-Exempt position. The job duties, elements, responsibilities, skills, functions, experience, educational factors and the requirements and conditions listed in this job description are representative only and not exhaustive of the tasks that an employee may be required to perform. The employer reserves the right to revise this job description and general responsibilities at any time and require employees to perform other tasks as circumstances or conditions of its business, competitive considerations or the work environment change.

title: Data Analyst

description:
Academic Affairs is the largest of the vice chancellor areas at UC San Diego. Led by the Executive Vice Chancellor-Academic Affairs (EVCAA), it is comprised of seven academic divisions and schools, six undergraduate colleges, the University Libraries and University Extension. The vice chancellor area also includes academic support units, as well as the units under the purview of the Vice Chancellors-Research, Student Affairs and Equity, Diversity & Inclusion. Academic Affairs annually manages expenditures in excess of $700M, 2.7M ASF of space and employs over 13,500 academic, staff and research employees. The Office of the EVC provides leadership and support to the units in Academic Affairs and is responsible for policy and procedure communication and implementation, resource administration, training and guidance, and program development for administrators, faculty, and staff.

Under the direction of Director Financial and Budget Management the Decision Support and Data Analyst provides reliable and comprehensive high-level qualitative and quantitative data and trend analyses supporting the various operations and projects within the office of the Associate VC-Resource Administration (AVC-RA). Serves as the primary data analyst for the AVC-RA and is responsible for short- and long-term analyses of available and projected resources in the areas of faculty recruitments and compensation, temporary faculty and teaching assistant funding, graduate student financial support, and department support. Analyze implications of allocation formulas, keeping in mind the best interests of the academic enterprise. Collaborates and partners with the AVC-RA, and other senior colleagues in the development, collection and analysis of project data. The incumbents will serve as an expert resource and partner to Academic Affairs management and departmental staff regarding the collection, use and analysis of data, including sources of data, how to extract relevant data, and methodologies to utilize and analyze data to solve management issues.

Overtime and weekends may be required.
  • Please submit a cover letter for a complete application.
QUALIFICATIONS
  • Expert skill in collecting, analyzing and interpreting large quantities of financial, budget, employee, student, enrollment and related data gathered from large central data depositories. Demonstrated experience with campus principles and procedures involved in handling sensitive data.



  • Demonstrated experience to research complex organizational and financial issues through the review of organizational documentation, financial information, interviews with individuals, and review of other material to develop and prepare financial and budgetary reports.



  • Excellent analytical and quantitative skills including statistical analysis, modeling and forecasting.



  • Demonstrated expertise in applying advanced computer technology as a problem-solving tool in financial modeling, analysis, budgetary management, and other administrative functions and solutions. Advanced knowledge of computer systems and applications, including expert skills in the use of databases, spreadsheets, word processing, presentation and statistical software.



  • Ability to think strategically, engage in proactive problem solving both individually and in a group, and take ownership of technical issues until problems are successfully and completely resolved. Strong analytic, inductive, and deductive reasoning skills. Evidence of strong time management and organizational skills; ability to multi-task and maintain accuracy in the face of significant time constraints, high workloads, and possibly rapidly shifting, contradictory demands and priorities.



  • Excellent interpersonal skills with strong, demonstrated ability to communicate orally and in writing. Possess skills of tact, poise, diplomacy, confidentiality and hospitality with a diverse population of staff, faculty, industry, and the community in a high pressure and demanding environment. Ability to maintain confidentiality.



  • Strong ability to communicate effectively one-on-one and before large and small audiences.



SPECIAL CONDITIONS
  • Background check required.
Duties may require direct contact with children (defined as individuals under the age of 18); completion of the Child Abuse and Neglect Reporting Act (CANRA) form will be required.

This position is designated "Confidential" within the meaning of the Higher Education Employer-Employee Relations Act.

description:
Arch Telecom is one of the nation’s largest Sprint Authorized retailer with stores in 13 states. The Data Analyst position is an essential part of Revenue Assurance. This position will be responsible for extracting and analyzing data to generate useful conclusions and actionable recommendations for various business needs.

Essential Functions

  • Perform quantitative and qualitative analysis of data in order to produce analytical solutions
Required Experience
  • Experience with data analysis and interpretation required; experience with Access, Excel, or other statistical packages preferred.
  • High degree of computer literacy required, including ability to learn new software and systems.
  • Examine the unique needs and concerns of the business to develop relevant practices and procedures.

title: Data Analyst

description:
The Data Analyst will work in a fast-paced environment within our Data Science team, using diverse data sets and technologies to produce solutions to a diverse set of challenging data problems. This individual will have the freedom to utilize the latest technologies to solve challenging problems, improving processes and tools used by the team. This role will collaborate closely with others within the Data Science team to provide profound insights from your analysis with the ultimate goal of helping TrueCar redefine the car buying experience for millions of people worldwide.

ABOUT THE JOB:
Produce complex data sets by combining various data sources in order to support company analytics efforts
Track, analyze and interpret trends in data in order to provide relevant conclusions and recommendations to management
Update and run statistical data models and other algorithms, tracking results against forecasts and fine-tuning when required
Improve existing methodologies through automation and quality enhancements
Collaborate with other team members to support efforts to improve the quality of our outputs and deliverables

WHAT YOU NEED:
At least one year of experience working with large data sets
Strong background in analytics with a desire to constantly improve processes
Must be a proactive problem solver and able to handle complex projects and tasks
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail a must
Prioritization and time management skills essential
Expert proficiency in Microsoft Excel
BS/BA degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Math, Statistics, Economics, Business Administration)

NICE TO HAVE:
Experience with SQL, Tableau, Python and any other analytical software a huge plus
Auto industry experience a plus

ABOUT TRUECAR:
At TrueCar we pride ourselves on being a bold, innovative brand, one that’s committed to creating a better car-buying experience. We bring game changing technology to the automotive marketplace because we believe there’s a better way to do things. We’re not simply another website or app. Our pricing information and Certified Dealer network are helping people save thousands, while they enjoy a buying experience that’s truly exceptional. Bringing this vision to life is our amazing team of people, the very heart of our company.

We care deeply about our culture and creating a casual, fun workplace. We work collaboratively, across departments, fostering an environment where there’s open communication and recognition of hard work. TrueCar isn’t simply a place to have a job. It’s a company where you can be a part of something that lasts. We value the entrepreneurial spirit and encourage employees to take ownership of both their projects and their careers.

Recognizing the effort and passion of our employees is a top priority at TrueCar. So we’ve created a benefits package that is more than competitive. We pay 100% of your health benefits for you, not a dime taken from your paycheck. We also offer 401K matching, a generous equity package, monthly fitness reimbursements, and, because everyone needs an occasional re-charge, an excellent PTO policy and 10 paid holidays. All of this set in outstanding office locations in Santa Monica, Austin and San Francisco.

title: Data Analyst

description:
Recognized as a global leader in interactive and digital entertainment, Sony Interactive Entertainment (SIE) is responsible for the PlayStation® brand and family of products and services. PlayStation has delivered innovation to the market since the launch of the original PlayStation in Japan in 1994. The PlayStation family of products and services include PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Vita, PlayStation®3, PlayStation®Store, PlayStation®Plus, PlayStation™Video, PlayStation™Music, PlayStation™Now, PlayStation™Vue, PlayStation®Original and acclaimed PlayStation software titles from SIE Worldwide Studios. Headquartered in San Mateo, California, SIE is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation and has global functions and regional headquarters in California, London and Tokyo.

San Diego Studio is looking for a Data Analyst who will be responsible for providing our Development and Production teams with insights and analysis of gameplay and user spend data. This position will primarily focus on working with internal teams to gather initial questions and requirements, ensure necessary data is being recorded, mining large quantities of data and providing insights based upon the results.

If you are an analyst who is in tune with video game market advancements, read gamer reports and are interested in utilizing game telemetry to help drive the creation of video games, then video game business analytics is the career for you. If you understand the details, techniques, principles of gaming and are keen on studying online game data to uncover patterns, this is the right job for you.

Responsibilities:
  • Define and iterate on development of analytics infrastructure for pre-production and post-production titles.
  • Document and record data definitions and structure as well as specifications for business intelligence reports and dashboards.
  • QA telemetry implementation to ensure data from gameplay is posting correctly along with reporting and fixing bugs.
  • Analyze and interpret the benefits of introducing new features and game content.
  • Determine monetization strategies and develop mechanisms to objectively measure the effectiveness of existing or new content.
  • Work with technical experts to guide the creation of reporting dashboards.
  • Develop and deploy reporting and visualization for cross title performance analysis.
  • Assess and cultivate long-term strategic goals for gaming BI (Business Intelligence) development in conjunction with studio developers, designers, producers, end users and other stakeholders.
  • Conduct internet based market research and make recommendations on game features, trends; keep abreast on the gaming industry trends, title launches, community enablement features, etc.
  • Perform player profiling to determine user segmentation and make recommendations relating to marketing strategies (target selection, timing, offer, regional offerings etc.).
Qualifications:
  • A Bachelor's degree (i.e. in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics) or equivalent experience.
  • A minimum of 3 years demonstrated experience in Business Intelligence and Data Analytics role working with databases such as Postgres, MySQL , Oracle, MS SQL Server.
  • At least 2 years of advanced reporting and analytical experience utilizing Tableau (or similar BI Tools).
  • Deep experience in developing queries and reporting based upon user requirements.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced game development environment.
  • Thorough understanding of data modeling and relational databases.
  • Strong ability to derive insights from data.
  • Experience with database tools and direct SQL access.
  • Experience with off the shelf data solutions such as Tableau, Spotfire or other similar platforms.
  • Experience and enthusiasm to work with large, raw data sets.
  • High degree of initiative and ability to learn.
  • Have exposure to working with statistics packages such as SPSS, Minitab, SAS, or Stata.
  • Professional and interpersonal communication skills (email, phone, face to face) to interface with other work groups and stakeholders.
  • Directing and maintaining project priorities; identify reports to create, trends to study and prepare reports to determine what would bring the greatest business benefit.
  • A strong understanding of BI systems and online gaming features; practical experience as a gamer, developer in the gaming industry is a strong plus.
  • Manage priorities; work with the business to help prepare reports in a timely manner to align with a title's various development milestones.
  • A passion for online gaming, video gaming and desire to shape game design through data.
Desired qualifications:
  • Master’s degree or an advanced degree or professional certification requiring formal training (i.e., MBA, MA, MS, Ph.D., CPA) or equivalent
  • Have gaming industry work experience
  • Finance or an MBA with exposure to analytics in a prior job
  • Agile software development experience
  • At least 5 years’ demonstrated experience in Business Intelligence and Data Analystics role
  • Technical Skill: R, Matlab, C++, C#, Python
Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, legally protected physical or mental disability, covered veteran status, status in the U.S. uniformed services, sexual orientation, marital status, genetic information or membership in any other legally protected category.

We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond.

We sincerely appreciate the time and effort you spent in contacting us and we thank you for your interest in PlayStation.

Having a good eye for layouts, and formatting of text, photos, and videos is an ABSOLUTE MUST, you will be involved in this aspect of the ad-campaigns from a creative standpoint. Understanding culture and trends are a bonus.

Must be superb at recognizing trends across projects, and over extended periods of time. Previous experience in advertising or media company is mandatory. And the MOST important thing: NICE, FRIENDLY people only! If you have a negative attitude, don't love the hustle, and aren't interested in putting in the blood, sweat, and tears, then don't apply for this position.

description:
Data Analyst- ITOM Product Line
Santa Clara, CA
This position reports to: Sr Director of Customer Success
ServiceNow is changing the way people work. With a service-orientation toward the activities, tasks and processes that make up day-to-day work life, we help the modern enterprise operate faster and be more scalable than ever before.
ServiceNow’s IT Operations Management (ITOM) offering streamlines the interaction between the worlds of Service Management and Operations Management and drives ITOM Service Delivery transformation by
Enabling easy access to information and engaging content for a modern employee experience
Providing effective and efficient means of managing and fulfilling employee requests, thus boosting productivity and
Helping ITOM teams leverage insights to continually optimize and improve operations and service levels
At ServiceNow, we’re disruptive. We work hard but try not to take ourselves too seriously. We are highly adaptable and constantly evolving. We are passionate about our product, and we live for our customers. We have high expectations and a career at ServiceNow means challenging yourself to always be better.
Our Data Analyst is responsible for customer data analysis in a reliable, repeatable and scalable manner to deliver fast time-to-value. The successful candidate will be very analytical and understand how to pull data, analyze it, make it consumable for stake holders, identify trends and make suggestions based off this data to leadership.

What you get to do in this role:
Supporting ITOM customer success by providing real time data analysis as well as ad-hoc, on-demand and scheduled reports
Concurrent management of 6 - 8 new and existing customers
Collaborate with other lines of business to determine reporting requirements, delivery methods, and priorities
Work with our business intelligence developers to provide self-service reporting options
Develop graphs, verbal descriptions, and slide presentations of data and analysis for both routine and ad hoc reports.
In order to be successful in this role, we need someone who has:
Proven experience working with large data sets and deriving insights from data using various business intelligence and data analytics tools
Execution focused – knows how to get things done
Possesses a keen analytical mind with attention to detail and accuracy
Agile thinker, quick learner
Outstanding organizational and time management skills
Solid analytical and problem-solving skills
Must be self-motivated
Strong presentation and communication skills (verbal, written, and listening)
Quickly acquires new skills and knowledge
We provide competitive compensation, generous benefits and a professional atmosphere. This is a very collaborative and inclusive work environment where individuals strong on aptitude and attitude will have an opportunity to grow their professional careers through working with some of the most advanced technology and talented developers in the business.

description:
Freedom Financial Network (FFN) has seen tremendous growth in the past few years, appearing multiple times on the Inc. 500 Fastest Growing Companies list and has been recognized as one of the Best Places to Work, many years running, in both the San Francisco Business Times and the Phoenix Business Journal. We have over 1,000 employees based in our San Mateo, CA and Phoenix, AZ offices and expect to grow to over 1,800 team members within the next 24 months.

With growth comes new opportunity!

The Optimization Analyst will be responsible for continuously improving the customer experience and improving conversion at every step of the funnel. This person is going to use site analytics to identify opportunities; develop, prioritize and schedule testing hypotheses and optimization efforts; ensure all tests/optimizations are executed accurately and according to plan, and own the reporting and communication of results of these efforts across our businesses. The person in this role should have experience managing A/B testing tools, technical expertise in test execution, knowledge of proper testing setup and hygiene, and a strong understanding of best practices in the web flow design.

Position Responsibilities:
  • Drive the execution of A/B tests for web form flows and landing pages for all businesses.
  • Quantify value estimates for all tests; prioritize these tests to optimize for strategic initiatives as well as incremental leads and revenue.
  • Collaborate with the creative team to create designs, partner with the technical lead to set up, QA, and launch all A/B tests.
  • Use technical knowledge and testing best practices to ensure optimal test setup and performance.
  • Regularly monitor testing dashboard for unusual results and work with teams to resolve in a timely manner.
  • Understand test variables and what drives short and long term fluctuations in results. Proactively cut off or extend tests based on consistent monitoring of results
  • Ensure all test results and recaps are completed and shared in a timely manner, and communicate strategic ideas effectively by telling the story behind data.
  • Work with Product Management and/or Engineering teams to implement test winners on site.
Qualifications and education Requirements:
  • Bachelor’s degree in marketing or related degree, and at least 2 years prior experience in managing site optimization.
  • At least 2 years of experience using web analytics platforms and optimization tools like Optimizely, Adobe Target, Site Catalyst, Google Analytics etc. to perform analyses, develop hypotheses, and measure results.
  • At least 2 years of experience testing high volume entry pages and/or lead generation form flows, with focus on improving conversion at each step to maximize revenue.
  • Advanced Excel skills and ability to direct work of front-end web developers.
  • Deep understanding of website funnel pages and metrics; knowledge of industry best practices related to user experience, and site performance.
  • Well-developed project management skills, including managing multiple projects simultaneously; able to shift quickly with changes in business priorities; appropriate sense of urgency.
Why work with us at Freedom Financial Network?

If you like working in a fast paced, dynamic start-up environment, then the Freedom Financial Network is the right place for you. Although we have been in business for more than a decade, we consciously cultivate a strong entrepreneurial culture that values individuals who take ownership, provide transparency and have integrity. We believe that great companies are built on great teams (made up of great people!).

FFN values the impact that team members make on our business and the Company provides growth opportunities for those who make a big impact.

description:

TinyCo, a Jam City-owned company, is a San Francisco studio at the forefront of bringing the world’s most popular entertainment franchises to mobile games. Our titles, including Family Guy: The Quest for Stuff and Marvel Avengers Academy, have been downloaded more than 115 million times and in the process, have won several “Best Game” awards. And with huge Hollywood properties on the horizon, we’re just getting started!

As gamers ourselves, we attribute our success to our passionate team. Our mission is to make millions of people happy five minutes at a time. We believe when you staff a team with creative people, cut away bureaucracy, and add in heavy doses of fun & challenge, you get award-winning results!

ABOUT THE ROLE
Currently looking for a Data Analyst with an interest in freemium games who is capable of using analytics to drive business decisions regarding the game economy and user experience of our mobile games.

Understand and effectively communicate trends and analysis on user behavior, player segmentation, virality, and marketing campaigns
Continuously develop thorough analysis and conclusive insights that drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization
Assists in design and implementation of advanced statistical testing for custom problem-solving, like A/B testing.
Assists in the coordination of various research initiatives
Help to create regular presentations for CEO and other team leads to discuss game performance and suggest improvements WHAT WE EXPECT FROM YOU

Ability to communicate effectively and combine both technical and business perspectives
Demonstrated ability to use data to influence decision making and reach out to a broader audience
Ability to execute research projects, and generate practical results and recommendations NICE TO HAVE
Experience in top-tier consulting, venture capital, investment bank or social gaming

Data Analyst, web analyst. SQL, statistics, economics, mathematics

WE ARE AWESOME. YOU WANT TO WORK HERE.

A problem solver with a keen understanding of how to select and use appropriate statistical methods to analyze and interpret complex, disparate, large-scale data sets and visualize the findings. Someone who is passionate about analyzing trends and can help improve business performance.

description:
NexGen Pharma, Inc., a leader in quality pharmaceutical manufacturing and nutritional products for over 80 years, seeks to grow the talent of its Private Label team with a Market Data Analyst in Irvine, CA.

We provide a work environment that is fast-paced and entrepreneurial where our human capital is valued as the number one asset. We create success through a goal-oriented and goal-achievement atmosphere, surrounded by a committed staff and management team.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Produces regularly scheduled reports from marketing databases. Compiles statistical data and provide written analysis in the form of charts, graphs, presentations, and executive summaries.
  • Updates spreadsheets, databases and files with statistical, financial and non-financial information.
  • Replies to data requests from sales, marketing, and product development teams.
  • Collects data on consumers, competitors and market place and consolidates information into actionable items, reports and presentations.
  • Tracks general market conditions, trends, and competitor pricing.
  • Conducts secondary research, including finding information from industry associations, statisticians and marketing experts.
  • Researches market conditions and conducts feasibility studies to determine market demand for existing or new products.
  • Catalogues findings to databases.
  • Analyzes marketing metrics to identify cause and effect relationships.
  • Analyzes new business and product opportunities.
  • Evaluates market penetration of existing and new products.
  • Monitors profitability and performance of existing products and services.
  • Provides competitive analysis on various companies’ market offerings, identify market trends, pricing/business models, sales and methods of operation.
  • Analyzes marketing data to help shape future marketing strategies.
  • Assesses effectiveness of current promotional activities, including ROI.
  • Assists in forecasting sales volumes and profits by product line based on lead tracking, growth or decline of products and report on findings.
  • Interprets information to assist in marketing, pricing and promotional strategy.
  • Analyzes proposed promotions and forecast impacts in order to assist in the approval or rejection of new promotional activities.
  • Identifies positive financial outcomes to increase profitability.
  • Reviews and updates current marketing materials.
  • Partners with print media department to compose and post online content on the company’s websites.
  • Assists in developing of marketing literature and promotional materials to augment the company’s presence in the market.
  • Remains fully informed on market trends, research, and implement best practices.
  • Communicates directly with customers and sales representatives, and encourage trusting relationships.
  • Supports multiple cross functional teams in organizing various projects.
  • Performs daily administrative tasks to ensure the functionality and coordination of the department’s activities.
  • Other related duties as required.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Bachelor’s degree (BS/BA) in business, marketing, statistics, or related field.
  • 3+ years of related experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Experience in dietary supplement or natural products industry preferred.
  • Knowledge of standard research methodologies, data analysis techniques and marketing procedures. Experience with online survey tools and syndicated data sources.
  • Excellent analytical and critical thinking skills. Ability to interpret large amounts of data.
  • Advanced skills in MS suite of tools (Powerpoint, Access, Word, Excel).
  • Able to multi-task, manage time, solve problems, and articulate findings. Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Able to build rapport and interact at every level of the organization and with external contacts.
  • Able to grasp consumer behavior, market and financial trends, and generate creative ideas.
  • Good understanding of office management and marketing principles.
  • Well-organized with a customer-oriented approach.

description:
The Data Analyst role demands an analytical, detail-oriented self-starter who possesses strong project management skills and the ability to handle multiple tasks with confidence and maturity. You must possess an understanding of the mobile gaming industry and recurring subscription billing models to develop analytics processes and reports that will drive key product decisions.

We’re looking for someone who has experience working with world-class analytics platforms and reporting systems to demonstrably improve product quality and revenues. You will work with large volumes of data, running your own analyses, and make recommendations to all areas of the business to drive revenue and growth.

The role is broad in scope and offers the potential candidate the opportunity to touch all areas of our organization and grow within PlayPhone. This position is based in downtown San Francisco and reports directly to the Chief Product Officer.

Day to Day
    WHAT YOU'LL DO: · Develop and maintain company-wide data analytics systems and processes that allow product owners to optimize revenue and retention
    · Conduct campaign analyses of ongoing marketing promotions to optimize for cost of user acquisition
    · Solely own and manage the forecasting, modeling, retention, and LTV analysis for recurring subscription billing business
    · Monitor and optimize our product performance on key dimensions for revenue, retention and engagement
    · Meet regularly with product teams, executive management and key stakeholders to present analysis and actionable recommendations for product optimization and/or innovation
    · Provide regular, timely reporting and performance monitoring to Executive Team, Finance, and other key business stakeholders






Qualifications
    WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR: · 3+ years experience in mobile, social gaming, or related quantitative fields or consulting firms/financial institutions
    · Thorough understanding of mobile game analytics and recurring subscription billing models
    · Hands on experience with data warehouse and track record of analyzing large amounts of raw data, defining problems and then recommending actions; not just “reporting”
    · Strong expertise in Microsoft Excel (Pivot Tables, Stats functions, What Ifs, Custom Functions), VBA, MySQL, and other statistical or BI tools. Proficiency in PHP a plus.
    · Proven ability to conceive and test hypotheses based on inconclusive or incomplete data from unstructured data and creating structures that lend themselves to analysis
    · Background in statistical analysis and familiarity with core statistical functions, including multivariate regression, correlation models, and analysis of variance
    · Experience working cross-functionally across all areas in a company
    · Excellent communication skills including solid verbal, written and listening skills








Education
    Bachelor’s Degree required (Math/Stats, Economics, Computer Science), MBA preferred
title: Data Analyst

description:
The Data Analyst is part of GumGum’s Business Intelligence (BI) team, whose primary responsibilities include BI system development, campaign optimization and analysis of data generated from GumGum platform as well as third party system. The Data Analyst will focus their attention in many critical areas requiring complex analysis and reporting. The ideal candidate should be an enthusiastic and flexible team player, with a strong analytical and creative mind that thrives in a fast paced startup environment.

Responsibilities:
  • Build, develop and maintain tools within the organization to analyze publisher yield, network growth, ad/platform performance in aggregate
  • Provide regular updates to management, making suggestions on ways to improve the current framework in place
  • Lead optimization initiatives with other teams including Publisher Development, Engineering, and Sales
Minimum Requirements:
  • Proficiency in SQL (Redshift & MySQL)
  • Advanced Excel Skills
  • R proficiency desired
  • BA/BS required, preferably in an analytical field (e.g. Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, or Finance)
  • Excellent Communication Skills
  • 1+ years experience with digital display advertising preferred
  • Familiarity with SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS), Looker, Tableau, Salesforce, etc preferred
  • Ability to think strategically and creatively. Thinking outside of the box and making logical assumptions and connections is incredibly important
Perks
  • Stock options, 401k, great medical/dental plans
  • Unlimited vacation policy
  • Great co-workers, monthly happy-hours

description:
Job Title : IT R&D; Data Warehouse - Data Analyst

Location : Sunnyvale, CA

Duration : 6+ Months

Interview : Phone & Skype

Experience : 8+ years

Excellent communication required. Visa copy and I94 copy required at the time of rate confirmation.

Client is seeking an IT R&D; Data Warehouse - Data Analyst who will be accountable for supporting all activities related to the R&D; Data Warehouse.

Responsibilities

  • Responsible for analytic data needs of the R&D; business unit. Handle complex data projects and acts as a lead for R&D; Data Analysis Requirements.
  • Extract, load, model, and reconcile large amounts of data across multiple R&D; system platforms and sources
  • Model data using MS Excel, SQL, Oracle and/or other data warehouse analytical tools
  • Partner with R&D; management team to maximize data use in program management including adherence to applicable standards.
  • Develop knowledge of multiple R&D; business functions to support these areas through reporting

TECHNICAL SKILLS

  • 7+ years of working in Bio-Tech/Bio-Pharmaceutical Industry supporting R&D; as a Data Analyst.
  • Familiar with various industry standard data formats including SAS, SDTM & ADaM datasets.
  • Familiar with Clinical concepts including the ability to interpret clinical study protocols.
  • Familiar with EDC structure, CTMS concepts.
  • Familiar with Oracle Argus
  • Familiar / active with Pistoia Alliance or similar / Must know the mindset of the groups that you will be working with
  • Strong Taxonomy and information Architecture logic.
  • Excellent analytical abilities and good problem solving skills.
  • Background in Data Structure, Algorithms
  • Modeling skills including Data Modeling experience
  • Experience extracting, manipulating, and analyzing data and then using it to draw relevant conclusions.
  • Prior experience working in a system analytics and/or data warehousing environment is strongly desired.
  • Experience with large data sets and/or analysis of health care data in R&D; is desired.
  • High level proficiency with statistical platforms and reporting tools desired.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Bachelor's degree in business, computer science or related discipline.

title: R&D Data Warehouse Data Analyst

description:
At Rocket Lawyer, we want to change things by making legal services affordable, simple and available to more people than ever before. We are proud to say that we’ve been able to build a service that millions of people rely upon.
Every day we spend our time and resources making it easier for people to get the legal help they need. If you’d like to spend your time with us, then join our team. You will work in a growing company, surrounded by the best talent. If you can contribute to an already strong environment, we want you and will compete for your skills
This individual contributor Data Analyst position will assist business stakeholders with insights based on finding patterns and relationships in data. As our Analytics team is highly cross-functional, you will need to able to tackle a diverse range of projects spanning various predictive modeling techniques. However, for this position, we’re looking for someone who can bring advanced data science experience and skills into the team such as data mining unstructured data, applying machine learning methods and simulations, text analytics, natural language processing, etc. to name a few.
Also required will be the ability to work in teams to drive the analytics process from acquisition, extraction and manipulation of data as driven by the business need for knowledge and decision-making. You will need to be knowledgeable about the vast range of third party data sources for marketing and advertising, various data mining tools, and be able to show resourcefulness in acquiring and utilizing this data to solve business problems. When analysis is complete, you will need to pull together the results in a digestible manner (e.g. not massive amounts of data but a narrative) that outlines key takeaways and recommendations.

Primary Responsibilities:
Perform big data user research projects leveraging advanced machine learning and statistical techniques.
Identify key measures, approach and methodologies measuring traditional and digital (online, interactive) marketing campaign success against business objectives.
Perform data analysis research to identify the key touch points/factors that drive predictive consumer behavior and make personalized recommendations that will drive strategy
Working with the acquisition team to formulate channel specific strategy and execution plans to meet business objectives
Use knowledge of advertising and marketing to deliver critical analyses including: campaign effectiveness analysis, customer segmentation and profiling, retention analysis, churn prediction, lifetime value analysis, and competitive market research
Work with development teams throughout their product lifecycle.
Setup A/B testing framework, analyze the results, and provide recommendations

Qualifications:
PhD or MS in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, or Econometrics and 3 years of experience.
Ideal candidate would have solid background in a quantitative field, with demonstrated experience constructing and evaluating large data sets for analysis.
Experience with statistics and machine learning is essential.
Knowledge of modeling software (MATLAB, R, SAS, SPSS) database tools (SQL, Excel Pivot Tables, HBase) and enterprise business intelligence tools such as Cognos or Business Objects or Tableau
Advanced-level query-building experience (e.g. SQL, T-SQL, HiveQL, etc.).
Advanced-level experience with programming languages (e.g. Python, Java, etc.)
In-depth understanding of machine learning and modeling algorithms such as decision trees, random forest, neural networks, etc.
Serve as the subject-matter expert on data sources, data definitions, and processes for capturing, accessing and extracting data
Providing recommendations for continuous improvement in data accessibility and reporting as driven by the business need for knowledge and decision-making
Collaborative, team player who drives to resolving stakeholder needs. Ability to participate in discussions with stakeholders and articulately boil down complex analyses into digestible insights addressing business issues.
title: Data Analyst

description: The Department of Neurology and Neurological Sciences at Stanford University is seeking a Research Data Analyst 1 at 50% FTE (20 hours per week) to work in a large interdisciplinary research team. The desired candidate is self-motivated, detail-oriented, independent, patient, punctual, and conscientious, with excellent written/oral communication and interpersonal skills. Under the supervision of the principal investigator, the s/he will be developing and managing databases linked to multiple projects in the lab and help implement searchable, web-based interfaces for proteomic and other types of data. Duties include participation in research projects, data collection, development, implementation, and maintenance of a research databases, assistance with data analysis, and general support of the laboratory.

title: Data Analyst

description:
Job Summary:

The Universal Reporting Data Analyst will be responsible to ensure that Daily, Weekly, Monthly and Quarterly Universal Reports to the Health Plans are submitted accurately and timely. The Claims Analyst Universal Reporting Data Analyst will also be responsible for analyzing reports and identifying process improvements for holding Medical Management staff accountable for completing their portion of the reports. Universal Reporting Data Analyst will be responsible for creating DBMS and Access queries and working with IT to find ways to refine reporting to ensure accurate data is being sent to Health Plans.

Essential Duties:

  • The timely creation and submission of the Universal Reports. Analyze reports to help identify deficiencies. Ensure daily, weekly, and monthly reports are generated timely and distributed to Health Plans. Additionally, must ensure database is refreshed daily to ensure accuracy of reports being distributed. Work with IT to resolve system issues and find work arounds if system problems.
  • Provide analytical support to the Medical Management and the Claims Department by creating, updating DBMS queries and analyzing ad hoc reports as needed. Work closely with Medical Management Staff to hold them accountable for completing review timely and inform them of any discrepancies in the data that is being generated. Works closely with IT to communicate any system issues that might occur.
  • Provide Training to Medical Management and Claim staff on how to pull specific reports for back-up

Qualification Requirements:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. This job description reflects management's assignment of essential functions; it does not prescribe or restrict the tasks that may be assigned. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Education/Experience:

  • A High School Diploma required BS/BA or equivalent education and experience preferred.
  • At least three years relevant experience within the healthcare industry in an IPA/MSO.
  • Minimum of three years experience working with Excel in creating and generating reports.

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

  • Ability to multi-task, prioritize and work in a fast pace environment under minimal supervision.
  • Knowledge of CMS and DMHC Regulations.
  • Maintains member confidence and protects company by keeping claim (or any other type of PHI) information confidential in compliance with HIPAA requirements.
  • Thorough knowledge of PC usage is required. Proficient in Excel and Access to include the ability to create queries to generate ad hoc reports as well as create and update Excel spreadsheets for purposes of tracking and reporting providing accurate and clear reports.
  • Exceptional understanding of Access from creation to updating.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to write business correspondence effectively.
  • Must possess advanced reasoning and problem solving abilities and planning skills.
  • Must possess the ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, and schedule form.

Job Type: Full-time

Required education:

  • High school or equivalent

Required experience:

  • Excel: 3 years
  • Knowledge of CMS and DMHC Regulations: 3 years
  • IPA/MSO Healthcare: 3 years
title: Universal Reporting Data Analyst

description: The Data Analytic Consultant provides support in making strategic data-related decisions by analyzing data, finding actionable insights, and working with leaders and stakeholders to drive change to optimize organizational cost and member satisfaction. The Data Analytic Consultant will build reports and interactive dashboards that uncover these actionable insights. These positions function both as a consultant and as a high-level data analyst. The position works with clients to develop the right set of questions/hypotheses, using the appropriate tools/skills to derive the most actionable data to address stakeholder and customer needs.
title: Data Analyst, Member Services Analytics

description:
Under supervision, the Data Analyst acts as a liaison with the State of California Genetic Disease Screening Program responsible for collecting, analyzing and reporting data, maintaining quality assurance. Performs data reporting to includes; abnormal patient results, tracking physician competency byway of volume standards for tests ordered and performed, all practitioner adverse outcome studies, and quarterly Prenatal Diagnosis Center reports. Applies and adheres to all state rules and regulations and completing the annual application.

Ensures communication to physicians and staff necessary to maintain compliance with the State. Maintains and monitors quality assurance for meeting imaging standards, reporting guidelines, and supported documentation for medical and billing compliance consistent with the California Prenatal Screening Program Guidelines. Organizes and directs a quarterly interdisciplinary quality assurance meeting with Comprehensive Prenatal Diagnosis staff.

Organizes, plans, and directs a bi-monthly Medical Management Conference including location reservations, presentations, speaking engagements, and CME information for all practice participants and attendees. Maintaining CME accreditation, participant disclosures, tracking attendance, and speaker surveys, reported annually. Responsible for planning, organizing, directing, coordinating, administering resources, for other programs, and special projects for the Maternal-Fetal Care and Genetics program. Analyzes, develops, and manages new and existing processes to improve service standards and maximizes use of available resources for the practice.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
  • Graduation from College with a major in a related field and two (2) years of analysis or operations experience; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.



  • Minimum two (2) years work experience in Healthcare, including planning, organizing, coordinating, and managing administrative and/or program operations.



  • Advanced computer skills are necessary utilizing Word, PowerPoint and Excel.



  • Demonstrates analytical and problem resolution techniques to ensure problems are addressed and resolved in a timely manner.



  • Experience with California AFP Program and Prenatal Genetics preferred.



  • Follows strict HIPAA regulations.



PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • Previous perinatal/OB experience.



  • Medical terminology.



  • Bilingual: English/Spanish.



SPECIAL CONDITIONS Must be able to work various hours & locations based on business needs.
title: Data Analyst

description:
Position

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Scientist to lead and support implementing data assessment and decision systems for biological assays: High-throughput Screening (HTS), in vitro and cellular, in vitro and in vivo ADME and toxicology. This person will establish and support the models and processes used to assess the quality of data, the statistical methods to apply, the criteria for selection of hits, and the capture of decisions why particular methods were selected. This individual will work closely with a team of interdisciplinary scientist and would be providing insights to other scientist to leverage scientific and information systems to record and drive the decisions of the teams. The ideal candidate will be self-driven, resourceful, very organized and focused, and enjoy working in a dynamic team environment.

Primary Functions

Understand raw data from low-throughput in vitro and high-throughput screening (HTS) assays
Create automated scripts to process assay data into analysis-ready results including consideration to outliers, edge effects, controls, and methods to calculate IC50 and EC50
Assist scientists with statistical analysis and interpretation of results into decisions, including pass/fail of target hit, compound confirmation, and activities in counter screens
Develop, refine, and deploy models to visualize single and multiple data sets in order to streamline the decision-making process with scientists and leaders
Present meaningful, easy-to-understand, consistent visualizations incorporating statistical assessment of data quality with comparisons among methods, data sets, and assay conditions
Analyze historical trends across targets and share insight into classes of action and promiscuity
Discuss/Document workflow and requirements of scientists into action items
Assist in the proper storage and retrieval of information to/from databases
Qualifications

Ph.D. in Computational Biology, Computer Science, Bioinformatics, Statistics, or related field with 3+ year’s post-degree experience. Master’s degree candidate with 8+ years’ experience would also be considered.
Experience with multivariate statistical techniques, algorithms, and packages to handle systematic and random error in multiple types of biological experiments and implement them in data analysis workflow
Knowledge of appropriate models to filter and fit multi-dimensional, chemical and assay data as well as assess the quality of the data being reviewed
Expertise in comprehensive data analysis with commercial scripting tools such as Pipeline Pilot and decision tools such as Dotmatics’ Vortex and TIBCO Spotfire
Ability to use statistical packages such as R, JMP, Minitab, and ProMV
Ability to code algorithms using formal (e.g., Java) or scripting (e.g., Python) languages
The successful candidate will be aligned to Nurix’ culture and values; he/she will be team oriented and highly collaborative with a hands-on approach
The candidate should be enthusiastic, driven, have the ability to work independently and thrive in a dynamic start-up environment
title: SCIENTIFIC DATA ANALYST, INFORMATICS

description:
Are you interested in being part of a highly dynamic and successful team, supporting one of the fastest growing organizations within Google? We are looking for motivated and talented individuals to join our Google for Work Data Analysis Team.

Job Responsibilities:

  • make weekly forecasts and generate quarter performance metrics for business reviews
  • maintain a strong focus on managing projects and programs on both an on-going and an ad-hoc basis, while working collaboratively across the global organization
  • execute data and root cause analyses to identify opportunities for improvement of our workflow processes and data infrastructure
  • create documentation as necessary and work with engineering to design and implement new processes

Requirements:

  • a BA/BS Degree in Business, Finance, Engineering or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience
  • strong SQL skills : use strong analytical and modeling skills, including some experience with project management and analysis of large data sets using SQL and modeling in Excel. Resumes without professional SQL experience will not be considered .
  • fluent English – additional languages are a plus
  • a minimum 3 years experience , post-college, as an analyst, in management consulting, or in business operations
  • problem-solving and analytical skills combined with strong business acumen
  • excellent communication skills : versatile oral and written skills are required for contact with both engineers and business leaders, as well as external partners
  • software familiarity : Excel, SQL, database and CRM systems (e.g. Salesforce)
  • are familiar with quota planning support and will collaborate with sales operations and finance to develop the annual plan
  • Sales operations experience is a strong plus
  • Availability to work days in Mountain View (this is not a telecommute role)
  • Ability to work for any US employer ( we do not provide visa sponsorship )

We could be a team if you

  • are looking for an international and dynamic working environment
  • wish to take the chance to develop yourself individually
  • are a team player with analytical and communication skills

About the Company

The SELLBYTEL Group is a global outsourcing company specializing in Sales, Service, Support, Human Resources, Training and Back Office. We are a trusted partner of Google in the promotion of Google Maps for Work and related products.

We are looking for motivated and talented Data Analysis professionals to join us and work with the Google for Work team. This is not a contract role, but a full-time placement on a vendor team at Google.

Job Type: Full-time

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • Data Analyst: 3 years

Required license or certification:

  • Authorized to work in US without visa sponsorsip
title: Data Analyst - Sales Operations

description:
ShareThis is looking for a data analyst to come in and help us monetize our global, online behavioral data asset. We gather around 3-4 TB of social sharing events per day made up of page views, click backs, searches, and social sharing. We are looking to add to the team of people who know how to gleam further value from a data source like this. Your work will directly contribute to the quality of products we're building which have a direct impact on the timeliness and relevance of marketing messages that go to people in the global, omni-channel marketing eco-system. Trust us, that's big and heady stuff.

Responsibilities:
  • Improve the value of our data by mining and finding the relevant signals across all internal data sources that when connected together, provide the ingredients for a high performing targeted audience in Omni-Channel Marketing.
  • Ongoing improvement of the quality of our Data asset
  • Analyze the data gathered from all completed Product Experiments that then help us drive the 'next' business decision for the business or for the product roadmap
  • Develop new and/or more efficient data research and data analysis techniques.
  • Writes/executes code to understand and derive value from large data sets
  • Processes both structured and unstructured data
  • Explains to stakeholders and clients the intricacies of ShareThis data
  • Works seamlessly across various processing environments based on analysis needs
Qualifications:
  • 2-3 years of proven experience in a similar role in a MarTech and/or AdTech Company with similar datasets
  • Experience with VBA/Excel Macros, SQL, SAS or other data manipulation tools.
  • Extensive experience with excel and pivot tables
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with emphasis on determining the geographic nature of the Internet
  • Ability to manipulate, interpret, and convey big data sets
  • Knowledge of programming or scripting language
  • Strong research skills and ability to document research findings
  • Result oriented and have the mindset to improve data, processes, and procedures
  • Self-starting with ability to work independently as well as work effectively in a team environment
  • Team player with excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to drive to the core of problems, solve them, then successfully explain your solution
  • Have experience with large distributed processing environments such as BigQuery, Hive, etc.
  • Experienced with scripting languages such as Python or Perl and database experience (SQL)

He/she is responsible for using their in depth knowledge of Epsilon’s Automotive marketing product(s) to research and trouble shoot issues that are reported to be "problematic" by clients or internal business users.

  • Troubleshoot, test and maintain the delivery of marketing software solutions

description:
*Position Summary & Key AccountabilitiesTailored Brands provides a personal, convenient, one-of-a-kind shopping experience with compelling products and world-class service. Tailored Brands features leading menswear Men’s Wearhouse, Jos. A. Bank and Moores Clothing for Men; designer brand Joseph Abboud; family retailer K&G; Fashion Superstore; and corporate apparel leaders TwinHill, Alexandra, Dimensions and Yaffy. We are building a world-class analytics function at Tailored Brands and recruiting for a Data Analyst, CRM & Analytics to join our Marketing department in Fremont, CA. In this position, you will play a critical role in supporting the development of analytics and reporting capabilities foundational to the success of the marketing organization.

*Skills, Abilities, Experience & Qualifications Primary Responsibilities

Qualifications

  • 1-2 years SQL experience * Ability to query complex data warehouses and aggregate data for strategic reporting * Strong project management skills and ability to quickly react to changing priorities and deadlines * Strong team player with high aptitude, problem solving skills * Excellent written and verbal communication skills * Experience using business intelligence tools such Tableau, Business Objects, or Microstrategy, a plus*Work Environment, Physical & Mental Demands * Ability to maintain a sustained posture in a seated position for prolonged periods of time and operate computer equipment * Ability to work at least 40 hours per week from the Company’s Fremont, California corporate office with flexibility based on project needs * Exerts up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount frequently to move objects.

  • SQL: 1 year
  • Data Analyst: 1 year
title: Data Analyst – CRM & Analytics

description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst who likes to play and have fun with data. In this role, you are hands-on mining mobile behavioral and transactional data to provide key metrics, analyses, and insights for internal clients and external stories. You will report to the Analytics Director and expect to collaborate extensively with the Portfolio and Growth teams among others.

Responsibilities

  • Be constantly curious and continue to pursue in-depth explorations of our data sets
  • Support the internal Business Intelligence product with regards to new data and new reporting
  • Leverage new techniques to investigate our data and incorporate external information to boost our knowledge of this market
  • Communicate complicated data findings in a clear and concise manner to our multi-country teams
  • Collaborate with other teams on initiatives that improve our company-level KPIs and match our corporate priorities.
Requirements

  • 2+ years of relevant experience
  • Exposure and basic understanding of credit
  • Proficient in SQL and/or other data-mining languages
  • Bachelor's degree in any field which requires logically creative thinking
  • Proven strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Some experience working with technology or software
  • Strong technical communications skills
Preferred Requirements

  • Experience in coding (Python, MATLAB)
  • Interest in payments, fintech and technology
  • Ability to absorb vast quantities of information in short periods of time
  • Proven ability to make logical and commercial decisions based on partial data and under time pressure
  • Knowledge of financial inclusion or leveraging mobile technology for social impact
  • Experience or familiarity with emerging markets such as Eastern Africa and Southeast Asia
  • Previous development on the back-end management of a Business Intelligence tool (i.e. Tableau, Looker)
  • Familiarity with alternative financial products, such as prize-linked savings or microinsurance
  • Previous work on evaluating product iterations or experiments
  • Live an active life with multiple activities, because you can always rest later
We strongly believe that inclusion fosters innovation and we’re proud to have a diverse team with a wide variety of backgrounds and experiences. We focus on hiring talented people regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

About Tala:
Tala ( http://www.tala.co/ ) (formerly InVenture) builds mobile products that help creditworthy individuals in emerging markets validate their financial identities and get access to fair credit to advance their businesses and families. Tala is providing choice and control to individuals around the world when it comes to their financial identity.

Tala is backed by Data Collective (DCVC), Lowercase Capital (Chris Sacca), Google Ventures, Collaborative Fund and other leading venture & impact investors. Fast Company ranked InVenture as the World’s Most Innovative Money Company ( http://www.fastcompany.com/3041657/most-innovative-companies-2015/the-worlds-top-10-most-innovative-companies-of-2015-in-money ) in 2015 and our work has been highlighted by Wired UK, Forbes, the Economist, Vodafone, TED ( https://www.ted.com/talks/shivani_siroya_a_smart_loan_for_people_with_no_credit_history_yet?language=en ) and many others.

description:
Looking for a chance to do meaningful work that touches millions? Come join the hardest working, nonprofit health plan in California and help us shape the future of health care. Blue Shield of California is focused on transforming health care by making it more accessible, affordable and customer-centric. Being a mission-driven organization means we do much more than serve our 3.5 million members: we were the first health plan in the nation to limit our annual net income to 2 percent of revenue and return the difference to our customers and the community, and since 2005 we have contributed more than $325 million to the Blue Shield of California Foundation to improve community health and end domestic violence. We also believe that a healthier California begins with our employees, so we provide them with resources to develop and maintain a healthy lifestyle through our award-winning wellness program, Wellvolution.

We're hiring smart thinkers and doers who want to work for a leader and innovator in the challenging, ever-changing healthcare space. Come and help us make health care better for everyone.

Collects, analyzes and synthesizes data; develops information to guide business decision making for BSC populations' health management, cost of health care management, quality of care, and network design and strategies. Responsibilities Low Complexity: one or two sources of data, descriptive statistical methods, one or two clinical areas. No coordination with analysts in other Departments is required Moderate Complexity: three or four sources of data, univariate statistical methods, statistical graphics, three or four clinical areas. Requires consultation and coordination with analysts in other Departments but not reconciliation of analytical approaches High Complexity: more than four sources of data, multivariate statistical methods, statistical graphics more than four clinical areas. Requires consultation and coordination with analysts in other Departments and reconciliation of analytical approaches Mastery of Medical Informaticist I & II responsibilities. Conducts independent analysis of high complexity under moderate supervision and guidance, develops novel analyses and reports. Communicates analytical results in abstracts, graphs or summaries with minor editing and input from supervisor or manager. Develops documentation and creates and executes workplans for analyses of high complexity Produces analysis of high complexity under the guidance and direction of Medical Informaticist IV, supervisor or manager. Prepares presentation materials that clearly and succinctly convey information to appropriate internal and external Blue Shield audiences. Makes oral presentations to internal customers. Participates on internal workgroups and committees to provide analytical insight and support for the implementation and enhancement of new programs, products, and services. Designs, builds, and enhances data systems and applications so that they better serve specific reporting requirements. Critically reviews and revises existing analytical processes for currency, efficiency, and sufficiency. Identifies existing inefficiencies and problems and takes action to implement solutions. Anticipates unrealized problems and recommends solutions. Facilitates data reporting and analysis projects involving team members from multiple departments. Interacts with internal and external customers to define analytical needs and specifications. Assists junior team members through informal training and mentoring. Seeks and provides advice to analysts in other departments and business units regarding standardization of business rules and methods for analysis and reporting. Identifies business risks relating to report design and production. Provides training to designated team members to mitigate risk and provide back up for report production. Uses appropriate technical, clinical, and financial knowledge to assess the completeness and reliability of data and the validity and accuracy of analytical results. Produces accurate work under tight deadlines Communicates analytical results so that they are easily understood by non-technical persons. Continuously refines and expands the technical, clinical, and financial content knowledge required to successfully complete these duties. Other duties as assigned
