description:
We're looking for someone who loves digging into data, building models, testing those models, and driving recommendations to internal and external audiences.

You must have the ability to balance multiple priorities, deep analytical rigor, and excellent communication skills that can be tailored to cross-functional audiences at every level. You will deliver results and showcase attention to detail. As a Sr. Data Analyst you will be on our Professional Services Team. You’ll work closely with the Technical Account Managers, Customer Support, and Technical Project Managers to transform insights from large data sets into actionable policy recommendations that guard billions of dollars.

About ThreatMetrix:
We are a pre-IPO security company with thousands of customers contributing over a billion high-risk transaction details to our real time network each month. As a leader in our industry, ThreatMetrix’s customers include global banks, household name retailers, and the most popular on-demand services such as ride-sharing and subscription TV and movie streaming. Using a broad array of technologies, we help our customers recognize their trusted users and flag individuals, devices, and networks committing crime on the Internet.

Responsibilities:
  • Synthesize business problems, define hypothesis and test model changes to confirm positive/negative impact
  • Develop and present data and insightful analytics to business leaders
  • Proactively identify opportunities for improvements based on data
  • Prepare documents and materials for leadership/customer meetings, reviewing results and modeling different options
Requirements:
  • 5+ years experience using data analysis and modeling in the technology industry, especially with large consumer-generated data sets
  • PostgreSQL experience required. Python & R experience preferred
  • Advanced skills with manipulating large data sets for feature discovery and predictive modeling exercises
  • Experience in creating presentations to communicate strategy to non-technical persons, as well as building curated datasets to be shared with customer policy managers and decision science teams
  • Certification on any reporting/data visualization is a plus (e.g., Tableau)
  • Knowledgeable of the fraud or security industry
  • Bachelor degree with strong academic performance; preferably data, computer science or engineering
  • Capable of providing a support role in design sessions with a client
title: Sr. Data Analyst

description:
Hulu is a premium streaming TV destination that seeks to captivate and connect viewers with the stories they love. We create amazing experiences that celebrate the best of entertainment and technology. We’re looking for great people who are passionate about redefining TV through innovation, unconventional thinking and embracing fun. It’s a mission that takes some serious smart, intense curiosity and determination to be the best. Come be part of the team that’s powering play. SUMMARY
Hulu’s Product Management team is seeking a Product Data Analyst who will be an exceptional addition to our team. Our ideal team member is someone who loves the hard problem of turning mounds of data into data stories, reports, and dashboards that business people and technical people can easily understand and can use to answer critical business questions. Using your own knowledge of industry best practices, you will identify the key metrics that drive decisions and measure performance at Hulu to influence overall business strategy and product management efforts. You should love business analysis, analytics, data modeling, query writing, and report development. This isn’t a job to own some boring tools or to create charts that nobody uses. This is an opportunity to help revolutionize how Hulu leverages its data to make decisions and to play a key role in the evolution of Hulu’s internal reporting and reporting tools towards a relevant, dynamic and insightful standard. If you are someone who loves empowering others with data and thrives on helping people find and understand the information they need at the moment they need it, then this is a great role for you. WHAT YOU’LL DO
Gather, manipulate, analyze and document raw, complex data and share data stories that make sense to business and technical audiences
Serve as tactical liaison for product management teams to provide the most accurate and relevant information to help drive meaningful business decisions
Continually design, test, and deploy new reports - all with the goal of providing a state-of-the-art reporting environment
Respond to ad-hoc reporting needs while ensuring data accuracy and integrity WHAT TO BRING
BS or MS in a Technical Degree or awesome experience in showing you can geek out on reporting and analytics
3-5+ years of experience as a Business Systems Analyst, Reporting Analysts, Business Intelligence Analyst, or similar field
Experience with standard report development methodologies, both front-end and back-end processes
Experience building reports and dashboards that are meaningful to drive business decisions
Sample Portfolio of reports, dashboards, and data visualizations that you have created
Passion for turning data into insights and helping others unlock the power of their data
Good influencing skills with a positive attitude and a proactive / self-starter mindset SKILLS
Proven ability to clearly articulate data stories to business and technical audiences
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Proficiency and solid foundation in statistics
Advanced level of proficiency in Microsoft Excel (including Pivot Tables and VLookup) and Microsoft Powerpoint
Proficiency at SQL Query development (MySQL, MSSQL)
Proficiency with business intelligence dashboarding tools like Tableau, Looker, Jaspersoft, Cognos, Business Objects, Crystal Reports or similar
Experience working with data in formats like CSV, JSON, and XML
Experience with scripting languages: BASH, Python, Perl or programming languages Java
NICE-TO-HAVES
Experience with streaming media metrics and KPIs
Experience with newer technologies such as Hadoop, MapReduce, HIVE, Kafka, and Cassandra.
Experience with data visualization libraries such as D3.js and NVD3.js
Experience with near-time data collection and dashboard libraries such as Graphite and Grafana

title: Data Analyst

description:
About you

You have a strong will to constantly learn new things and always improve. You are really good at spotting fraud trends and love working on puzzles, investigating suspicious behavior, and digging through large data. All these while using your keen eyes for details to connect the dots. You are well-versed with the payments world (especially CNP environment) and have some background with chargebacks. If this is you, then Signifyd is the place for you.

About Us

At Signifyd, we’re very good at proving that people are who they say they are. We build software systems that catch bad guys. Using all available payment, user, and machine data, we separate legitimate credit card transactions from fraudulent ones in under 400ms. That means building large-scale systems which reduce the complexity of human purchasing behaviors into simple and quick decisions.

You’ll join a new team working towards minimizing losses, maximizing revenue and mitigating fraud for our customers. You will be working with various cross-functional teams and will be analyzing and interpreting suspicious trends, fraud and chargeback data to draw actionable intelligence to feed into our models. This is a high-impact role that offers tremendous opportunities for growth, learning and leadership.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Identify meaningful insights from chargeback data. Interpret and communicate findings from analysis to engineers, product and stakeholders.
  • Analyze high-volume data to investigate, identify and report trends linked to fraudulent transactions.
  • Review suspicious activity and complex fraud cases to help identify and resolve fraud risk trends and issues.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional groups such as Customer Support, Product Management, and Engineering to enhance tools, data sources, system functionalities, and fraud detection methods
  • Monitor fraud alerts and configure risk rules accordingly to flag potential fraudulent orders
  • Apply risk management policies and procedures to help manage and minimize losses.
Qualifications

  • Minimum 3 years experience in fraud investigation in e-commerce or payments industry
  • Analytical, quantitative mindset with a keen attention to detail
  • High level of computer skills to effectively use multiple systems
  • Willingness to adapt to a constantly changing, customer-driven work environment
  • Ability to work on routine tasks both independently and with the team
  • Self-starter and comfortable taking initiative while quickly grasping concepts, processes and ideas
  • Excellent SQL skills
  • Fluency with data analysis and visualization tools (Tableau is extra credit)
  • (highly desired) Familiarity with scripting
  • (highly desired) Experience working with Rules Engine
  • Local candidates only

description:
Healthcare Data Analyst

CareOnSite is a stable and fast-growing 24-hour occupational medical facility located in Long Beach, California area. We are seeking an individual with a strong work ethic that has an eagerness to show initiative.

The Data Analyst’s position requires leadership skills to manage numerous critical priorities in a continuously changing, fast-paced environment. The successful candidate must possess both the mind set and the willingness to adapt as the position evolves to meet the changing needs of our industry.

MAJOR DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Analyzes and interprets data; ensures data validity; performs calculations, prepares and updates tables, charts, graphs and technical summaries in an accurate and professional format for presentation according to, management and client requirements.
  • Analyzes large amounts of complex data to develop innovative solutions and methods to ensure the best possible outcomes.
  • Review forms/reports and confer with management/users about format, distribution and purpose in order to continually identify problems and identify process improvements.
  • Functions as in-house expert on EMR system, including knowledge of mapping from electronic health record and practice management systems to understanding the measuring and reporting logic and algorithms.
  • Utilizes other data sources and products to generate information and reports to support management staff and clients.
  • Designs, develops, and documents basic data entry and tracking tools in support of client’s needs.
  • Participates in evaluating and selecting new data-related products and systems and enhancements.
  • Participates with Management meetings and staff members to assist them and clients with data-related workflow to assure data validity and integrity.
  • Works closely with the Management team on successful delivery of timely deliverables to teams, projects or themes assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Bachelor’s degree in business administration, information science or healthcare management.
  • 4+ years of experience working as an analyst in the healthcare industry
  • Extensive experience with Excel.
  • Excellent organizational and project management skills
  • Strong collaboration and communication skills
  • Good at logical and analytical thinking with strong problem solving skills
  • Ability to analyze complex problems and make recommendations based on research interests of clinical staff, availability of data, and research methodology considerations.
  • Ability to engage with business end users and IT personnel to elicit and clarify detailed data requirements to support analysis use cases
  • Experience with electronic health records (EHR)
  • Experience and/or exposure to population health and healthcare business intelligence
  • Experience and/or exposure to a robust healthcare data environment

title: Data Analyst

description:
San Diego based Myers Media Group offers enterprise SEO products and services that help large web presences reach their broadest market share in highly competitive spaces. We develop the core components of a sustainable organic search marketing infrastructure, including the abilities to catalog and prioritize all SEO assets, control and direct a large internal link hierarchy, and generate and manage large quantities of SEO optimized content.

JOB OVERVIEW

Myers Media Group is seeking a Project Data Analyst for the Sorrento Valley office to help improve macro SEO results for major clients ranked in the Top 500 Sites by Alexa. You will extract, import, transform and load large data sets used as information sources for customer projects involving millions of webpages. You will work with project teams to review, analyze, and manage this data. You will also work with the data management team to version control, store and backup these datasets. You should be familiar with database and data management best practices, concepts, and procedures. You should also be an experienced data munger/wrangler.

JOB DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Extract, transform and load customer data using code you develop. (SQL and Python)
  • Help identify and repair datasets that are incomplete, inconsistent, or require cleaning before use
  • Handle internal customer data inquiries, data investigations, or other information requests from the project teams
  • Help develop, test, debug, and document RDBMS/NoSQL queries, etc
  • Help Investigate and understand available data sources on the market to solve customer site content challenges
  • Debug and optimize existing queries, views and tables to improve performance
  • Construct SQL queries quickly for ad-hoc reporting
  • Automating the procedures you develop to resolve tasks, whenever possible

REQUIRED SKILLS

  • 5+ years experience performing technical analysis (including data wrangling/munging) on large business intelligence, and/or similar datasets
  • 5+ years experience performing RDBMS-related work using PostgreSQL, MySQL or MSSQL Server, including SQL Programming experience
  • Programming experience in Python or similar scripting language
  • Experience importing, cleaning, transforming and managing large data sets
  • Familiar with version control systems (Git or svn)
  • Ability to gather and communicate technical requirements and issues to business teams, and interpret business requirements to clearly convert into technical requirements
  • Ability to review and QA your own work
  • Precise and concise oral and written communication skills

ADDITIONAL USEFUL TECHNICAL SKILLS (A PLUS)

  • Experience using Amazon Web Services, including RDS.
  • Amazon Redshift
  • SEO knowledge

REQUIRED JOB EXPERIENCE

Requires 5+ of related professional experience and the required soft and technical skills listed above.

EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCE

Bachelor’s Degree (or equivalent experience), Computer Science majors preferred.

BENEFITS

Medical, dental, vision, 401(k), 10 paid holidays, unlimited PTO and catered lunches.

WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

It is the policy of Myers Media Group (MMG) that no employee or applicant will be discriminated against because of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, disability, or veteran status. MMG will consider all individuals for any position for which they are qualified and able to perform.

title: Data Analyst II

description:
PicsArt is looking for a Data Analyst in San Francisco, CA to join our Growth Data team.

The PicsArt data analyst is a key contributor on a diverse team of PicsArt product managers, marketing experts, engineers and senior management in the US and Europe. You will define goals, conduct analysis and present recommendations to improve PicsArt for over 60,000,000 monthly users. You will identify and recommend improvements that impact user retention, engagement and acquisition.

This role requires a flexible, can-do attitude and self-motivation to “own” your results. It is intended for someone willing to take meaningful responsibility for our business metrics and grow with the company.

PicsArt builds the #1 mobile application for creative photo expression, distributed in app stores in over 120 countries around the world, with over 300,000,000 downloads to date. Our inv estors include Sequoia Capital, Doll Capital Management and Insight Venture Partners.

The Data Analyst role is fulltime and located in San Francisco, CA.

Desired Skills and Experience

Communicator : Strong communication skills resulting in teams requesting to work with you repeatedly

Flexibility : Ability to quickly assess problems, suggest solutions and deliver results in a startup environment across multiple projects at once. Startups move quickly!

Self-Motivated : Strong internal motivation to do quality work and constantly improve

Ideator : Ability to suggest & present innovative product and marketing strategies using data-informed reasoning

2+ years experience in a complex data analysis role

2-5 years experience in mobile or web digital consumer products

Experience with large-scale visually-driven digital communities strongly preferred

Experience with statistical analysis tools, e.g.: Spark, Scala, SQL, PostgreSQL, Hadoop

Highly proficient in business analysis tools, e.g.: Tableau, Google Spreadsheets, Google Analytics, Cohort Analysis, Mobile Analytics, etc.

Experience with machine-learning solutions strongly preferred

Exceptional problem solver who can transition between detail and high-level insights

Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a diverse, international team environment

Responsibilities:
Perform modeling/analytics to discover & suggest acquisition, retention and engagement metrics

Define and own metrics to improve PicsArt growth and engagement

Think creatively about how data can drive consumer stories for PicsArt’s community

Develop Executive Level presentations and deliver to leadership
title: Data Analyst

description:
You’re a data enthusiast backed by serious technical chops, the idea of developing predictive analytics excites you. Well, TextNow is searching for an ambitious Data Analysts to join the San Francisco Data Science team. This team implements data-driven strategy and influences decision making across the company through predictive analytics, testing and optimization.

The Data Science Analyst contributes to the team’s quarterly objectives by defining and building the best product for our users. At TextNow, we are highly data driven in how we establish the product direction and in optimizing core features. Data science at TextNow utilizes quantitative metrics to accurately predict how users interact with our features like determining who is more likely to send more texts or which users are likely to conduct long calls. You will use data to determine which features are likely to move the needle forward and drive growth, not to mention we defined the needle. We’re looking for a Data Analyst to contribute to these Data Science efforts at TextNow.

This is an excellent opportunity for a proactive, highly motivated, and skilled individual to contribute to a cutting-edge technology stack in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.

Join us to make a BIG impact as part of the disrupting force that's changing telecommunications forever.

What you'll do:
  • Analyze user behavior and generate product insights
  • Locate and develop new data sources and/or basic analytical models and projects
  • Develop reports and dashboard using SQL and data visualization tools
  • Analyze A/B tests
  • Develop data models and predictive analysis
  • Identify new questions that need answers, and provide those answers using tools and frameworks that you and your teammates have created
Requirements

Who you are:
  • 3+ years of quantitative experience
  • Degree in a quantitative field (statistics, operations research, math, etc.) with strong experience in data & business analysis
  • Expert level usage of SQL & Excel
  • Experience with data visualization in either academic or professional capacity
  • Thorough knowledge of statistics and demonstrated experience with applied business analytics
  • Strong presentation skills. You are able to confidently author and present insights to senior management
  • Bonuses:
    • Experience with Python / R
    • Machine Learning, Multivariate Calculus, Data Munging, Data Visualization
    • Technologies - NoSQL, Redshift, MySQL, S3, Tableau, HighCharts/PHP, AWS
Benefits
  • Impactful work
  • TextNow-powered smartphone
  • Competitive total compensation package
  • Catered lunch
  • Professional development
  • Paid fitness membership

TextNow embraces and promotes diversity, inclusion and acceptance in our workplace. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we select applicants on the basis of their qualifications. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals and will reasonably accommodate individuals with accessibility needs. Candidates requiring accommodation during the recruitment process are asked to contact the Human Resources team at Recruitment@textnow.com .
title: Data Science Analyst

description:
The Data Analyst supports the data reporting requirements of the Quality Analytics Department by performing analysis and reporting data to support the business requirements of the team. The incumbent is responsible for assisting with the development of internal systems and reporting to ensure timely and accurate data reporting and analysis; communicating updates and analysis results to stakeholders for Medical Affairs projects and activities, which may include QI initiatives, HEDIS ® , QIPs and P4V, and performing analysis of business needs and data integration.

Position Responsibilities:
  • Analyze and document requirements and specifications in collaboration with business departments to accomplish their desired results.
  • Prepare reports and findings in a clear and concise manner, both written and verbal.
  • Evaluate reports for accuracy of data, including the application of standardized analysis, and assist in the timely production of reports.
  • Participate in progressively more complex projects, and perform progressively more complex analyses as s/he advances through Data Analyst levels.
  • Refer complex data integrity issues to the Senior Data Analyst and/or Quality Analytics Supervisor for further evaluation and action as needed.
  • Ad-hoc analyses, special projects, and other duties as assigned by management.
  • Other duties and projects assigned by management.
Required Skills
  • Plan, organize, and implement data collection activities.
  • Initiate and follow-through on projects with little supervision or guidance.
  • Communicate effectively in writing and orally, including public presentations.
  • Collect data, identify pertinent information and prepare and present clear and concise reports, which reflect understandable data, analysis and appropriate findings.
  • Effectively utilize computer and appropriate software and interact as needed with CalOptima Information Systems.
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office products including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook. Intermediate-level knowledge of Access and SQL is preferred.
Required Experience

Experience & Education:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Health Care Administration, Business Administration, Mathematics, statistics or a related field; or equivalent work experience is required.
  • 2+ years of health care administration experience or experience that would have developed the knowledge and abilities listed required.
  • 2+ years of professional experience in a managed health care organization performing data analysis type work required.
  • Prior experience with Business Intelligence data integration preferred.
  • Project Management experience preferred

Knowledge of:
  • MS Access to create ad-hoc reports and design databases; competence with Mathematical, statistical and operational research tools in order to produce valid reports.
  • Techniques in data design and data management, utilizing PC and Mainframe systems.
  • Principles of effective analysis and report writing.
  • Principles and practices of health care systems, and medical administration.

description:
Position Summary:

The Data Analyst conducts studies, gathers and analyzes data from various databases and sources, develops reports, summaries, recommendations, and visual representations, performs statistical programming, develops and/or maintains databases and provides consultation and technical assistance to a wide variety of internal clients; advises and assists internal clients in determining the appropriate analytical methodology to meet their needs and objectives, uses various statistical packages, summarizes and interprets statistical results and designs and implements process improvements.

The Data Analyst will lead and perform complex analysis in an evolving data environment. In addition to very strong technical skills, this position will have superb business process analysis and interpersonal skills. The ability to extract and analyze data, patterns, and related trends is needed, with the subsequent ability to synthesize the data into information consumable by senior business decision makers.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
  • Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality.
  • Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.
  • Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
  • Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
  • Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.
  • Perform complex data analysis in support of ad-hoc and standing management requests.
  • Develop programs, methodologies, and files for analyzing and presenting data.
  • Use and support database applications and analytical tools: evaluate data quality, applications, and functions, produce output, and maintain operation.
  • Research new data sources and analytical tools; contribute to new product development and improvement in product delivery and presentation.
  • Respects and adheres to HIPAA confidentiality guidelines.
  • Maintains the highest level of confidentiality and integrity.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Education, Experience & Licensure:

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in relevant field, or equivalent
  • Training from a recognized vocational school, or an associate's degree preferred
  • 2-5 years’ experience in data analysis, decision support, including demonstrated proficiency with analytical software

Skills & Requirements:

Required

  • Strong knowledge of building queries with Microsoft TRANSACT-SQL, including working with compound JOIN and SELECT statements.
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server tools, including SSMS and SSRS.
  • Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
  • Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
  • Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical software for analyzing large datasets
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
  • Advanced knowledge of MS Office suite
  • Knowledge of assessing client needs and evaluating client satisfaction, analyzing information and evaluating results to choose the best solution to solve problems
  • Requires strong ability to be thorough, reliable, responsible, and dependable
  • Ability to fulfill obligations while paying full attention to detail when completing work tasks
  • Requires analyzing information and using logic to address work-related issues
  • Can rapidly adapt to change

Preferred

  • Knowledge of Microsoft SSIS
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Sharepoint
  • Knowledge of implementing and troubleshooting issues related to electronic transmissions
  • knowledge of X12 4010 and 5010 design and implementation.
  • Digital Rx and other Pharmacy software experience

Other key features of job:

  • Work in a professional office environment
  • Work with professional staff and management
  • Part of a growing healthcare company
  • Assist to develop a unique clinical pharmacy residency program

Company Statement:

NS & Associates and its Companies provide the highest quality of health care and management, by placing the needs of our patients first. Our Companies have multi-location pharmacies throughout Los Angeles County and Orange County area with ample opportunities for growth and expansion. We practice a culture of C.A.R.E where we place value on Collaboration, Accountability, Respect and Efficiency. We invite you to join our diverse team as we strive to deliver excellent customer service and health care to our patients.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this position. They are not intended to be construed, as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified.

  • Microsoft SQL Server tools, including SSMS and SSRS.: 2 years

description:
Data Entry/Analyst

Inc. Magazine rated BuyAutoParts.com as one of the fastest growing companies for 2011, 2012, 2013, 2014, and 2015 in the United States. www.inc.com/inc5000/profile/buyautopartscom

BuyAutoParts.com has been in business for over 25 years. We started out as a wholesale distributor of automotive products in 1988 and grew as an online retailer of auto parts. Today we have 120 employees in our San Diego, CA headquarters. Our traditional WD group continues to serve wholesale accounts, while our internet site is a popular destination for retail customers, car enthusiasts and mechanics.

We are currently seeking a Data Entry/Analyst to join our Products Team. This position will provide analytical and tactical support to the company’s Products team, performing a variety of purchasing, product management and supply chain duties. Advanced excel skills and outstanding attention to detail are a must, as the position requires a considerable amount of Excel work and data management. The position also requires excellent written and verbal communication skills, as the Data Entry/Analyst will communicate frequently with international and domestic vendors. Additionally, the Data Entry/Analyst will work with both the Accounting and Purchasing departments to reconcile vendor issues and to help facilitate inbound and outbound shipments. The ideal candidate will be a self-starting individual with excellent communication skills, who is able to multi-task in a fast pace environment.

Qualifications:
  • Minimum of 1-3 years professional experience (Data Entry or supply chain experience a plus, but not necessary)
  • Excellent communication(written & verbal), customer service, and analytical capabilities
  • Excellent Organization skills and the ability to manage multiple projects at various stages of completion
  • Ability to understand, analyze and verify large volumes of data
  • Ability to type no less than 65 Words per minute
  • Microsoft Excel skills a must(VLOOKUPS, subtotals, filtering, and other basic routines within Excel)
  • A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree
Responsibilities
  • Review and approve domestic and international purchase orders
  • Coordinate with domestic and international vendors daily to ensure records are accurately maintained and updated
  • Organize vendor pricing by conducting cost updates, maintaining discounts and resolving invoice discrepancies
  • Organize and maintain up to date product information via excel sheet-based review
  • Perform ad hoc projects as needed for Products Team
Salary and Benefits

We offer a competitive salary depending on experience, ranging from $30K-$40K. We also have a generous benefits program including 3 weeks paid time off, paid holidays, full healthcare, flexible schedules, on site yoga, free drinks and snacks, and a great company culture.

Application

Please include your cover letter telling us why you are the best fit for this position. We only seek the best and the brightest. Strong work ethic, a great attitude, self- motivation, and the ability to thrive in a team-player environment are always expected
title: Data Analyst

description:
Research Data Analyst (RDA) will work under the supervision of the Director of the Biostatistics Division, and will play a critical role in managing all aspects of a brain tumor imaging patient study. The RDA will support brain tumor imaging studies with regard to project management, maintaining specific imaging and analysis protocols, data post-processing, data entry, compliance with the regulatory and UCSF policies, and collecting data to meet the reporting requirements of industry and other granting agencies. The latter of which can include data acquisition on the scanners, data post-processing, and entry.

NEUROLOGICAL SURGERY
The Department of Neurosurgery at UCSF is one of the most pre-emanate neurosurgical departments in the country for clinical care, training and research. The Department is one the largest recipients of Federal grant funds in the School of Medicine at UCSF and has been number one in NIH funding for the past 13 years. The Department is ranked highly for academic research publication productivity and recently named as one of the top Neurosurgery Training Programs in the country. The Department also ranks 5th in the nation for Neurosurgery & Neurology and is the number one Neurosurgery Department on the west coast (US News & World Report).

ABOUT UCSF
The University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences and health professions, and excellence in patient care. It is the only campus in the 10-campus UC system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences.

Required Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree in related area and / or equivalent experience / training
• Experience working with disparate data, including abstraction, compilation, entry and descriptive statistical analysis
• Acquiring knowledge of research function. Acquiring ability to perform research analysis duties
• Acquiring statistical analysis, system programming, and database design skills to perform research analysis duties
• Ability to effectively manage time and see assigned parts of projects through to completion on deadline
• Basic consultation and communication skills
• Excellent ability for initiative and teamwork in contributing to study objectives that often involve many moving parts and cross-functional flexibility
• Ability to work well independently, complete projects in a timely manner, and prioritize multiple projects to ensure the completion of essential tasks by deadlines

Note: Fingerprinting and background check required.
All jobs will require fingerprinting and background check as of Mid-March. 2017.

description:
The Data Analyst will be responsible for translating client needs into engaging reports and visualizations to support in-depth analysis. This position will also collaborate with key stakeholders to develop reports, dashboards, and other visualizations for analysis into possible trends or correlations to other data sets from competing clients. The successful candidate will be highly analytical with the ability to collect, organize, and disseminate significant amounts of information.

The position is located in Irvine, CA.

Essential Functions:

  • Analyze large sets of raw data using various analytical tools (MSSQL Server, Teradata, R, Python,Tableau, or Domo) to create reports and charts that could lead to insights on ecommerce consumer buying behavior for our brand manufacturer clients.
  • Collaborate with the Client Management team to thoroughly understand business objectives and determine types of data required to create informative and actionable reports to our clients.
  • Analyze competitive information to inform leadership and make recommendations in support of strategic decisions to increase our software service offerings.
  • Prepare and effectively present your findings to the Client Management team, including executive management in a concise fashion.
  • Generate ad hoc analysis and reports as requested.

Required Education and Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or Physics.
  • 5 plus years’ experience in business intelligence, data analysis, and trend analysis with various forms of data, especially web analytics or e-commerce data.
  • 3 plus years’ proven track record of building innovative and interactive web-based data visualization reports and dashboards in a BI platform such as Tableau, Domo, JReport, QlikView, or Crognos.
  • 3 plus years of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, R, SAS, SPSS, etc.).
  • Ability to work independently as well as partner with cross functional teams.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to deliver clear, concise information to leadership and partners.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience running A/B or and multi-variate tests
  • Big data analytics experience (Hadoop, Mongo, SQL)

description:
The Doctor’s research focuses on improving the health of Veterans with posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD). The Data Analyst will be responsible for planning and implementing a study comparing mental health and cardiovascular outcomes of medication regimens for PTSD. The prospect will develop statistical analysis plans; clean study data; preform and interpret statistical analyses; and assist with the presentation of findings. The Data Analyst may also assist with other VA research projects.

The Data Analyst uses skills as a seasoned, experienced research professional with a full understanding of in-depth statistical analyses and research software programming techniques. Demonstrates good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions. Works with the research team to achieve analysis goals and tackle complex coding and analysis questions.

THE DIVISION OF GENERAL INTERNAL MEDICINE
The Department of Medicine at the University of California, San Francisco works in conjunction with the San Francisco VA Medical Center to tackle leading questions in Veteran health and treatment. The Study team members work in a vibrant and collaborative environment, and are dedicated to improving the lives of the Veterans we serve.

ABOUT UCSF
The University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences and health professions, and excellence in patient care. It is the only campus in the 10-campus UC system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences.

Required Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Epidemiology or a related field and 5 years of professional statistical experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
• Experience with data cleaning and data quality control
• Strong interpersonal and organizational skills
• Proficiency in SAS or equivalent program
• Training in a variety of statistical modeling techniques, including linear, logistic and Poisson regression models, mixed effect modeling, and Cox proportional hazards models, with factor analysis, mediation, and SEM a plus
• Ability to provide custom-designed reports and graphical presentation of data using STATA, SAS, Excel, Power point, and/or Photoshop
• Ability to work both independently and as part of a team
• Ability to set priorities, meet deadlines, and manage multiple tasks simultaneously

Preferred Qualifications
• Masters or Doctoral degree in Statistics, Epidemiology or a related field
• Experience with grant writing and manuscript preparation
• Proficiency in SQL

description:
NCSOFT is seeking a talented Data Analyst to work across multiple released and unreleased titles. The Data Analyst is responsible for collecting data, generating reports, and analyzing player behavior.

NCSOFT is focused on making high-quality, cutting-edge, and conceptually innovative Massively Multiplayer Games. NCSOFT is a great place to work, fostering creativity and collaboration. Because of this it has attracted top talent from the best of the best in the MMO industry. A casual, friendly work environment, comprehensive benefits package, a competitive salary, and more are all part of what makes NCSOFT a great place to work. If you love making great games and have the skills to make it happen, then NCSOFT is the place for you.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Analyze game systems, economies, and player behavior to drive game development and business practices that maximize player enjoyment and profitability
  • Understand, analyze, and predict trends in player data.
  • Collect and help to elaborate on data reporting requirements, primarily from game design, customer service, and business departments.
  • Generate reports from accumulated data using SQL, Excel, HTML, Google Analytics, Tableau, and Qlikview, as well as defining automated procedures related to data collection.
  • Communicate findings, actionable recommendations, and data limitations to stakeholders to facilitate data-driven decisions.
  • Formulate process improvement suggestions through ad hoc analyses and data mining.
  • Take ownership of data integrity to ensure that the data are correctly supporting the analyses and recommendations being proposed.
REQUIREMENTS:
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or related field, or equivalent experience with data analytics
  • Experience using SQL to query for and to aggregate data
  • Quantitative skills including statistical analysis and hypothesis testing
  • Understanding of game design and in-game economies
  • Strong communications skills and ability to work on a team
PLUSES:
  • Previous MMO development experience or avid gaming experience
  • Experience with big data software like Hadoop
  • Other programming or scripting skills
title: Data Analyst

description:
About Classy:
-------------

Classy is an online fundraising platform built for the most innovative and groundbreaking nonprofits in the world. Our goal is to not only help organizations raise more money online, but also help them interact and engage with supporters in creative ways they never deemed possible.

Classy is a VC-backed San Diego startup with triple-digit revenue growth and customer retention that beats the world’s top SaaS companies. We’re the market leader in peer-to- peer fundraising, and our products are used by thousands of social impact organizations, including Oxfam America, Leukemia & Lymphoma Society, and Heifer International.

Our team is growing, and we are hungry and hiring to meet the incredible demand of our clients.

Our culture is and will always be fun, exciting, and results-driven. Our nonprofit clients deserve a technology solution—and a team— that can help them transform the online fundraising experience and change the world, and we’d love for you to be a part of it.

Position description:
---------------------

We want you to help us establish Classy as THE thought leader in social impact and fundraising. Help us build our dataset, and create automated reports that support our internal teams as well as awesome organizations, to achieve their goals to do good.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We’re looking for a data analyst who understands that the key to great analytics and modeling is a clean, diverse dataset, and has experience creating reports from challenging and varied sources:

  • Writing scripted analytic reports on top of table-based data (relational databases, CSV files, spreadsheets)
  • Debugging and cleaning data, to ensure that reports are correct.
  • Writing automation to extract data into appropriate formats, for other teams to leverage.
  • Researching, identifying, and accessing third-party data sources to augment analytics.
  • Publishing internal reports / visualizations and/or blog posts on data results.
You will work on a small, talented team of web developers, data engineers, and data scientists to help build the best dataset possible to guide our business and help guide our customers in online fundraising. With this dataset, we’ll aim to answer questions such as:

  • What charities are most likely to succeed on our platform?
  • What factors predict whether a fundraising campaign is successful?
  • How do we identify top fundraising users as early as possible?
  • Can we automatically score how good a user’s text and images are for fundraising?
  • Much, much more!
You will have chances to leverage your existing skills while learning new ones, in a fast-paced startup environment. You will be among the first to work with our unique in-house dataset, to help discover new insights in how Classy can best support organizations and their supporters to do good in the world.

Requirements
------------

  • 2+ work years of experience in data analytics, preferably with experience in data engineering.
  • Prefer individuals who have completed one or more self-led data analytics / data science projects, from data aggregation to publishing text and visualizations (the more diverse the data sources, the better!).
  • Great attitude
  • Eagerness to learn
  • Motivated self-starter
  • Excellent communicator
Desirable traits also include:
  • Strong programming skills
  • Experience with feature engineering
  • Statistical modeling / machine-learning methods
------------------
Our awesome perks!
------------------

  • Half-Day Fridays the first Friday of each month
  • Monthly parking pass, public transit pass, or Uber Allowance
  • Pet friendly office
  • Monthly happy hours at the local watering hole
  • Love the active life? We have company and team outings and participate in team sports.
title: Data Analyst

description:
Radiology Partners is the largest and fastest growing on-site radiology practice in the US. We are an innovative practice focused on ensuring radiologists provide consistently exceptional services to hospitals, imaging centers, referring physicians and patients. With our state-of-the art clinical technology, specialized expertise, access to capital, and retention of top physician talent, Radiology Partners reliably exceeds the expectations of our clients, patients, and partners. We serve our clients with an operational focus, and, above all, a commitment to quality patient care. Our mission is To Transform Radiology.

POSITION SUMMARY

The management team at Radiology Partners requires a versatile and high-performing individual to help drive and support key initiatives related to clinical value, quality and operations. This position provides a unique opportunity for an analytically-inclined individual to apply and build their skills in a dynamic and entrepreneurial operating environment. The individual will have the opportunity to work across multiple functional areas in the practice and interact closely with senior management. The role provides a solid foundation for future potential management opportunities within Radiology Partners.

POSITION DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Obtain, verify and analyze data to determine clinical performance (data mining and analytics)
  • Work as part of a team to develop, plan and implement multiple initiatives simultaneously
  • Plan and participate in strategic brainstorming sessions
  • Create executive and board-level presentations
  • Interact with multiple groups within Radiology Partners including the clinical team, IT, analytics team and radiologists

DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
  • Detail-oriented, highly motivated, able to manage multiple projects simultaneously often with tight deadlines
  • Quick learner who is not in need of step-by-step instructions
  • Outstanding written and verbal communications skills
  • Strong organizational and analytical skills
  • Creative problem solving skills with an ability to overcome obstacles
  • Strategic and logical thinker adept in using metrics to drive performance
  • Team player
  • Ability to communicate with, work effectively with and present to key constituents including senior management
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite including Excel, PowerPoint and Access
  • Experience with Tableau or SQL is a plus
  • 2-4 years of work experience, ideally in a hospital or physician setting, management consulting firm or corporate finance/development/strategy division of a well-regarded large operating company
  • Experience interacting and communicating with physicians is a plus but not required
  • Undergraduate degree from top-tier institution
  • Pre-MBA

title: Healthcare Data Analyst

description:
Data Analyst – HEDIS & Medicare Star

Long Beach, CA
Full-time

About SCAN

Our mission is simple: Keeping Seniors Healthy and Independent–that’s been our mission for almost 40 years. Rated as one of the top Medicare Advantage plans in California, SCAN Health Plan employees are passionate about what they do. Understanding that
success is based on achieving the mission, SCAN employees are afforded with the training and tools necessary to do their jobs and they are rewarded for their efforts and recognized as experts in their fields. Ask anyone who works here and we’ll proudly tell
you that SCAN’s commitment has never wavered. We are as steadfast in our pledge to help our members live healthy and independent lives.

The job

Develops, documents, and programs in support of 5-Star projects and in-house initiatives. In pursuit of high 5-Star ratings, conducts in-depth data analysis and interpretation, HEDIS reporting, and other related tasks.

You will

Designs and produces timely and meaningful analysis and data interpretation regarding large health care related datasets, related to 5-Star ratings, HEDIS,
, state specific programs (such as QIP/PIP), programs issued by state agencies (such as DHCS or HSAG) and other associated company initiatives.

Utilizes software programs such as SAS, SQL, Excel and/or other business intelligence tools to extract needed data. Writes original code and modifies existing code, as needed, to execute projects to specifications, and assists in the development of these
specifications.
Interprets data accurately and produces clear and comprehensive written analyses, graphics, tables, etc. for diverse internal and external audiences.

Plans, organizes, and prioritizes assigned projects, creating and managing work plans that reflect the tasks, timeframes, and processes required to successfully complete each.

Assists with development, implementation, and documentation of quality assurance (QA)

processes to ensure that reported data is accurate and reliable.
Documents data collection processes with other teams in Healthcare Informatics to transition data collection from one team to another.

Contributes to and advances group knowledge about the Medicare population.
Demonstrates a commitment to customer service through timely, accurate, and supportable deliverables.

Ensures understanding of customer needs by proactively clarifying scope and requirements and keeping customers apprised of project status through effective communication.

Supports customer understanding of analytical findings through effective presentation of results to individuals and groups.

Achieves high-quality deliverables by assuring accuracy and thoroughness in executing projects.

Manages multiple projects by effectively prioritizing work and communicating workload issues to management.

Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
Your qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree required.
2+ years of related analytical experience required.
Strong analytical skills required.
Ability to effectively interact with, and present findings to customers at various levels of the organization.

Advanced SAS data step, SAS macro language, and other SAS procedures required.

Ability to document processes and analyses for reference/re-use required.
Excellent technical, interpersonal, written and oral communication skills required.

Proficient in MS Office.

Your preferred qualifications

Proficiency with MS SQL (queries) preferred.
Clinical code knowledge related to claims/utilization preferred.
Experience with managed care contract terms/analysis preferred.
Experience in a Medicare Advantage environment preferred.

What's in it for you? Qualified employees will receive

A competitive compensation and benefits program
An annual employee bonus program
Generous paid-time-off (PTO)
Ten paid holidays per year
Excellent 403(b) Saving Plan, providing up to 4% match and vesting after three years

Casual attire
A work-life balance and much more!

Conditions of Work

Office Hours: Monday – Friday, 8:00am to 5:00pm. Extended work hours, as needed.

We're always looking for talented people to join our team! Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply now!
title: Data Analyst-HEDIS & Star

description:
Looking for a chance to do meaningful work that touches millions? Come join the hardest working, nonprofit health plan in California and help us shape the future of health care. Blue Shield of California’s Mission is to ensure all Californians have access to high-quality care at an affordable price. Blue Shield is focused on improving health care delivery by working closely with providers and making it more accessible, affordable and customer-centric. Being a mission-driven organization means we do much more than serve our 4 million members: we were the first health plan in the nation to limit our annual net income to 2 percent of revenue and return the difference to our customers and the community, and since 2005 we have contributed more than $325 million to the Blue Shield of California Foundation to improve community health and end domestic violence. We also believe that a healthier California begins with our employees, so we provide them with resources to develop and maintain a healthy lifestyle through our award-winning wellness program, Wellvolution.

We're hiring smart thinkers and doers who want to work for a leader and innovator in the challenging, ever-changing healthcare space. Come and help us make health care better for everyone.

The Accountable Care Organization (ACO) financial team is a fast paced department within Blue Shield of California. ACOs are everywhere in today's healthcare marketplace and Blue Shield orchestrated the first collaborative ACO within California with resounding financial success. Our ACO presence has grown all over the state of California with significant expansion projected over the next several years. We are looking for a candidate to join the dynamic ACO team with the following responsibilities:

Supports the technical development and enhancement of provider ACO cost targets and reporting tools, including attribution model support. Performs technical analysis to determine present and future cost of health care performance. Analyzes, prepares and summarizes recommendations for ACO cost targets, experience dashboards, healthcare cost trend, and annual ACO financial reconciliation. May perform healthcare research and application to include healthcare revenue/expense, hospital reimbursement, physician reimbursement, population attribution, and health risk adjustments. Applies, interprets, and implements health insurance concepts for ACO financial modeling and provider presentations.

Other Responsibilities:
  • Manipulate and develop SQL and SAS programs in support of ACO collaborations and periodic reporting.
  • Running, updating, and evaluating member level attribution model and review for reasonability.
  • Summarize detailed revenue/expense data and compare summarized claim data against other sources for benchmarking
  • Summarize analytic results and develop presentations for both external provider audiences and internal customers.
  • Utilized in-house data query tools for provider specific and adhoc cost analyses.

Qualifications
title: ACO Financial Data Analyst

description:
Looking for a chance to do meaningful work that touches millions? Come join the hardest working, nonprofit health plan in California and help us shape the future of health care. Blue Shield of California is focused on transforming health care by making it more accessible, affordable and customer-centric. Being a mission-driven organization means we do much more than serve our 3.5 million members: we were the first health plan in the nation to limit our annual net income to 2 percent of revenue and return the difference to our customers and the community, and since 2005 we have contributed more than $325 million to the Blue Shield of California Foundation to improve community health and end domestic violence. We also believe that a healthier California begins with our employees, so we provide them with resources to develop and maintain a healthy lifestyle through our award-winning wellness program, Wellvolution.

We're hiring smart thinkers and doers who want to work for a leader and innovator in the challenging, ever-changing healthcare space. Come and help us make health care better for everyone.

Collects, analyzes and synthesizes data; develops information to guide business decision making for BSC populations' health management, cost of health care management, quality of care, and network design and strategies. Responsibilities: Mastery of Associate level responsibilities. Under general supervision, writes reports and presents data in formats such as abstracts, graphs or summaries. Develops technical specs and develops and executes a work plan for uncomplicated analyses. Prepares documents, correspondence and other communication materials to convey information to appropriate audiences within Blue Shield. Assists in the design of reports that integrate data from multiple sources, including design of reporting systems and standardization of metrics and formats across departments and functional areas. Enhances database systems and applications for specific reporting requirements. Critically reviews and revises existing applications for update and enhancement. Identifies systems and operational problems and recommends solutions and changes to streamline procedures for more effective reporting. Participates on report development teams. Interacts with internal customers to define reporting needs and report specifications Assesses the validity, accuracy, completeness and reliability of data collected and reported. title: Intermediate Health Data Analyst

description:
Morgan, Lewis & Bockius LLP, an international law firm with almost 4000 lawyers and staff in 29 offices is seeking a Data Analyst who will be resident in our San Francisco, Santa Monica, Los Angeles, Irvine or Philadelphia/Princeton office. The Data Analyst will report to the Manager of Data Analytics and provide analytical and statistical support to the Labor and Employment Practice Group.
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: working with large scale disparate data sets; mining and investigation of data; serving as the liaison with the client’s HR and Payroll Departments to collect the necessary raw data for purpose of analysis; preparing compensation analyses from electronic payroll records; preparing analyses of demographics for client audit and affirmative action plans; preparing detailed summaries of statistical results from Reduction in Force (RIF) analysis.

The candidate must be a self-starter, team player, manage projects to completion, and be able to work with minimal supervision.

A bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in computer science, engineering, mathematics or technology related curriculum along with one year of relevant experience is preferred.

Candidates must have the ability to: monitor, track and document processes; follow and prepare SOPs and protocols; assess and meet the needs of attorneys.

A high degree of customer/client service and exceptional organizational skills are necessary as well as a willingness to work in a team environment and adhere to firm standards. Candidates much also have excellent problem solving ability and verbal/written communication skills; the ability to exercise good judgment in advising firm clients and attorneys; the ability to work under strict deadlines; the ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw conclusions; and the ability to interact with all levels of staff and attorneys are also necessary. The ability to work independently in a production environment, flexibility for overtime and availability for occasional travel are essential.

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be proficient in the following: Microsoft SQL, MS-Excel, MS-Access, and Citrix. Experience with Oracle, PeopleSoft or SAP databases is preferred, and familiarity with KNIME analytics platform is a plus.

Morgan Lewis is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Spacecraft Data Analyst

description:
Riot Games was established in 2006 by entrepreneurial gamers who believe that player-focused game development can result in great games. In 2009, Riot released its debut title League of Legends to critical and player acclaim. As the most played PC game in the world, over 67 million play every month. Players form the foundation of our community and it’s for them that we continue to evolve and improve the League of Legends experience.

We’re looking for humble but ambitious, razor-sharp professionals who can teach us a thing or two. We promise to return the favor. Like us, you take play seriously; you’re passionate about games. We embrace those who see things differently, aren’t afraid to experiment, and who have a healthy disregard for constraints.

That's where you come in.

As a Risk Analyst, You’ll help lead the team's efforts to protect players and Riot’s payment systems from threats and fraudulent activity. You will be master of Riot's Payments ecosystem, become intimately familiar with payment systems and data infrastructure.

You’ll rule over analysis and insights and help turn data into meaningful and actionable information for the team and stakeholders. Your natural curiosity will also make you a determined investigator, sifting through Riot's payment data looking for threats. Your natural passion for games will drive your cultural alignment and help complement excellent communications skills required to make convincing, data supported arguments necessary to drive team projects towards successful conclusions.

You are:
  • Experienced: you have a Bachelor’s degree in a related field (or 3+ years of related experience); XP in CNP fraud, payments, and digital goods will earn you bonus points
  • Player-focused: you understand your impact on the player experience because you're a player, too; you listen closely to the community to better understand their needs before they do and improve the overall League of Legends experience
  • Technically astute: you rapidly learn new skills, grasping complicated technical information that often leaves others lost, scared, and generally rocking in fetal position; you have an understanding of the fundamentals of object-oriented programming, proficiency in SQL in various implementations (MySQL, Vertica, and HiveQL specifically)
  • Results-driven: never satisfied, you consider anything less than surpassing your goals a total wash; you push the pace, motivating yourself and others to deliver results while consistently performing at the top of your game
  • A problem solver: when problems appear, you're the on-call fixer, cleaning up even the stickiest of situations; you look past the obvious solution, checking all sources to uncover any hidden issues lying dormant
  • A priority-focused organizer for results: you quickly identify critical projects, separating essential tasks from dreaded time-sucks; you can spot and avoid roadblocks miles ahead, which keeps you on track and focused like a laser beam; you efficiently and effectively keep projects on track by managing the right people, materials, and support needed to get the job done
  • Action oriented: you take the bull by the horns and ride the damn thing through the heart of a dragon; you turn challenges into opportunities, even without extensive planning; "too hard" means nothing to a dragon slayer like you
  • Player focused: you're a lifelong gamer who's passion for games (especially League of Legends) helps you stay focused on initiatives that make the difference to the players in and out of the game (and you get the memes)
You will:
  • Dive deep into our payments data to identify opportunities for improved risk rules and to ID emerging fraud threats
  • Have a strong aptitude for developing KPI dashboards and other reporting tools
  • Investigate fraud issues with a high degree of autonomy and integrity
  • Set ambitious goals to drive personal growth and team improvements in workflow and performance
  • Communicate seamlessly with other Riot teams to promote account and payments security and raise awareness of emerging threats using diplomacy and data supported arguments
  • Be a fearless advocate for players in the realm of payments and account security
title: Risk Data Analyst

description:
﻿ ﻿

There has never been a better time to work at Marin General Hospital! We have made great strides since returning to our roots as a community-owned hospital. As Marin County’s ONLY resource for a wide range of essential services, it is our mission—and our passion—to excel in every medical specialty. We attract the finest physicians and employees who appreciate having the best of both worlds: the resources and medical sophistication of an academic medical center combined with the personalized, caring touch of a stand-alone community hospital.

We have an exceptionally collaborative team that adheres to the highest service excellence standards to ensure that we all do our best for the good of our patients, and it shows through the numerous awards and certifications we've earned.

Reporting to the Chief Medical Information Officer, The Clinical Informaticist Data Analyst is responsible for the direction and oversight of analytics, reporting, and research to support clinical, financial, and client reporting, in support of Marin General Hospital’s business strategy. The Clinical Informatics Data Analyst assures that existing and future systems facilitate and enhance clinical practice and delivery of patient care and meet quality and regulatory requirements. The analyst also coordinates and facilitates on-going clinical information system evaluation including: user accuracy, data integrity, and system reliability. Ongoing system activity responsibilities include report writing, auditing, system and workflow improvements, change communication, end user education, and competency validation, coaching and re-training. Responsible for the development, delivery, and evaluation of clinical analytical systems educational programs and services, and acts as resource to Quality and Regulatory staff regarding data acquisition and reporting processes and compliance.

EXPERIENCE

  • Minimum of eight (8) years in healthcare analytics/informatics, managed care enrollment and claims data, and report development experience required, in a customer service oriented environment.
  • Core knowledge of managed care data reporting and analysis such as HEDIS, quality of care studies, benchmarking, predictive modeling and risk stratification.
  • Experience with advanced data visualization tools preferred.
  • Experience in a lead or supervisory capacity is preferred.
  • Experience with analytics systems required, multiple vendor experience preferred.
  • Experience with project management and process improvement processes required.

PREREQUISITE SKILLS

  • Demonstrated leadership skills such as coaching, facilitating and developing staff, and ensuring positive group relations.
  • Demonstrated leadership effectiveness in change management projects.
  • Fundamental understanding of patient work and workflow of care providers.
  • Demonstrated ability to analyze workflows, identify problems and prescribe ideas for improvements.
  • Strong verbal and written communication, presentation/facilitation, and teaching skills.

EDUCATION

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Nursing or Healthcare Analytics preferred.
  • Master degree or graduate certificate in Healthcare Analytics or Data Science preferred.

LICENSE/REGISTRATION/CERTIFICATION:

  • Healthcare Analytics

PATIENT PRIVACY (HIPAA Compliance):

Employees in this position have access to protected health information. The protected health information a person in this position can access includes demographics, date of service, insurance/billing, medical record summary information, and all other information that may be contained in patient records. This position requires patient health information to perform the functions outlined as part of this position description.

We invite you to apply! Marin General Hospital offers full-time and part-time employees a generous benefits package that includes no-cost premiums for health, dental & vision. In addition to the 403(b) plan, we offer a company-funded retirement plan. We pride ourselves in a safe, healing and caring work environment.

Job Type: Full-time

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • Hospital or clinical systems: 3 years
  • Data Analyst: 3 years

description:
We are a well-established health and wellness company looking for a seasoned Product Data Analyst. The selected candidate will contribute an informationally motivated viewpoint and deliver significant insights to influence essential company decisions.

Responsibilities:
Comb through product data and interpret analytics in an effort to understand user behaviors and product usage.
Perform exploratory analyses to identify opportunities to improve our product and make it more engaging for our users.
Sustain large-scale A/B testing and multivariate testing to provide in-depth insights on how we can improve user experience
Collaborate directly with the Product Team to build data-driven solutions and KPIs
Design dashboards, visualizations and granular datasets that provide actionable insights on product interactions and user engagement.
Find and implement efficiencies through the automation of repetitive tasks

BA or BS degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or Engineering.
3-6 years of professional experience in a Consumer Product company.
Ability to excel in a startup environment; the capability of working independently when necessary.
Strong SQL, Excel and quantitative skills.

Experience with Redshift/PostgreSQL and Looker (or applicable) skills required.
Experience using tools such as Optimizely, Google Analytics, Omniture, and/or Localytics
Skill and some development experience in at least one scripting language; Python is ideal.
Analytically minded: a resourceful and structured problem solver with the ability to thoughtfully evaluate data with a critical eye.
Excellent communication skills; able to easily communicate the results of analyses in a clear and effective manner.
Analytics experience across mobile and web platforms.
Experience performing analysis within a subscription business model.
Passion for meditation or digital health and wellness.

title: Product Data Analyst

description:
Under general supervision, this position is responsible for designing, developing and maintaining databases to support business requirements. This includes periodically reviewing the databases to enhance the process and functionalities. Responsible for assisting with the development of internal systems and exception reports to ensure timely and accurate claims adjudication. Exercises discretion and judgment.

Position Responsibilities:
  • Works in conjunction with Coding Initiatives and/or Information Services to implement benefit or financial changes that impact system configuration due to federal and state notices.
  • Develops, modifies and maintains reports/databases using SQL, Excel and MS Access.
  • Works with Management to provide accurate, informative reports for decision making.
  • Maintains claims and PDR databases.
  • Develops and generates reports from Facets to support daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly report processes. Responsible for the assurance of data integrity.
  • Maintains and generates quarterly reinsurance edit and report files.
  • Prepares CMS/DHCS audit universe datasets.
  • Prepares daily and weekly audit oversight claim pulls for review.
  • Provides analytical support and technical expertise on requests for information from Executives, Directors and other staff regarding claims.
  • Creates business user test scenarios for Business and Project Analyst.
  • Keeps current on State and Federal Health Care Environment, identify impacts to CalOptima programs and claims processes (utilizing DHCS OILS, Med Learns, CMS Updates, Medi-Cal Provider Bulletins, Medi-Cal manuals, ICE).
  • Develops various ad-hoc reports and perform other duties as assigned.

Required Skills
  • Meet and maintain established quality standards.
  • Work independently and as part of a team.
  • Develop and maintain effective working relationships with all levels of management and staff.
  • Present information in a useable format and be able to clearly explain content.
  • Work with complex databases and projects build queries and reports, format reports, export reports, etc.
Required Experience

Experience & Education:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Health Care Administration, Business Administration, Mathematics or a related field is preferred.
  • Must be able to work with claims data, manipulate spreadsheets and perform quantitative analysis.
  • 3-5 years as a Data Analyst/Reporting Specialist in a Managed Care environment or that would provide the knowledge and abilities listed.

Knowledge of:
  • Data analysis and good organizational skills.
  • Quality assessment, report queries, and data evaluation.
  • System testing, reporting requirements and documentation skills.
  • Creating ad-hoc reports, database and design development.
  • Medical coding, including ICD10, CPT, and HCPCS codes.
  • Medicare/ Medi-Cal guidelines, regulations and data reporting requirements.
  • Personal Computers - Advanced skills.
  • Microsoft Access, Excel to produce charts, spreadsheets, and/or other information applicable to position assignment. Knowledge of SQL and/or VBA would be helpful.
