title: Campaign Data Analyst

description:
Leaf Group is looking for a Data Analyst to join our Business Intelligence (BI) department and help provide data-driven insights that enable better decision-making at our Santa Monica, CA office.

A big vision calls for a big job. As we grow, our need for a Data Analyst grows with us.

Leaf Group is a diversified Internet company that builds platforms to enable communities of creators to reach passionate audiences in large and growing lifestyle categories. We create amazing experiences that celebrate the best of art, design and technology. We want people with an intense curiosity, a commitment to high quality service, who embrace the fun of the journey. Come help us disrupt and transform the digital media and art world!

We work in a fun, collaborative environment that is diverse, adventurous, and open-minded. We encourage all of our employees to learn and grow personally and professionally so they can assume greater responsibilities and advance their careers within the department or within one of our operating businesses. Check us out here: https://www.leafgroup.com/brands/ ( https://www.leafgroup.com/brands/ )

You’ll Report To: Director, Business Intelligence

A typical day as a Data Analyst might include:
  • Create complex SQL queries and perform ad-hoc and exploratory data analysis.
  • Provide data-driven insights to enable decision-making.
  • Create data visualizations using various BI tools and Excel.
  • Work with the business units to establish KPIs and methodology, and then create the appropriate reports and analysis.
  • Develop, own, and present dashboards to Senior Management that provide actionable insights.
  • Investigate data anomalies and perform Root Cause Analysis (RCA).
  • Audit peer reports and provide constructive feedback.
You’ll be successful if you are a motivated Data Analyst with strong SQL skills and looking to join an energetic, fast-paced, project-driven BI team.

What You Have:
  • BA in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics or Mathematics.
  • 3+ years’ practical experience in SQL query scripting, debugging, and execution.
  • Ability to audit and optimize existing SQL queries.
  • 1+ years of experience working in a data-intensive organization with large-scale datasets.
  • Excel proficiency is required.
  • Previous internet industry experience is highly desirable.
  • Redshift or other Postgres database experience is a plus.
  • Proficiency in Tableau or other data visualization tools is a plus.
  • Proficiency in Python or other scripting language is a plus.
  • Highly detail-oriented, self-motivated and takes initiative.
  • Strong communication and data presentation skills.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication.
  • Not afraid to wear multiple hats - no job being too small or too large.
  • We're casual and informal but we work hard and work responsibly. A pleasant and supportive demeanor goes a long way.
What We Have:
  • Cool office environment and culture (if we do say so ourselves at our ice cream socials, Thirsty Thursdays, Free Lunch Fridays, and all of the other fun activities we gather for)
  • Discounted gym memberships
  • Paid-to-play vacation rewards
  • Discretionary unlimited vacation time
  • Employee discounts for Saatchi Art and Society6
  • 401K
  • Medical, Dental, Vision
  • Flexible Spending Accounts
Agency Disclosure:
If the Leaf Group Talent Acquisition department, or any current company employee, receives an unsolicited resume from a third party recruiting agency and Leaf Group does not have a signed Agency Agreement active, Leaf Group will not be deemed liable to pay a placement fee. The unsolicited resume will be considered a gift and can be considered for our recruitment efforts.
title: Data Analyst - BI

description:
10x Genomics is looking for an outstanding scientist to join its Applications Development group. The scientist must have a passion for innovating new applications that use Next Generation Sequencing technologies to drive discovery and improve human health. The scientist must be able to learn quickly, creatively solve problems, and have a deep understand of NGS technologies. You should have experience with performing and analyzing sequence alignments, for both genomic and RNA based analyses. Additionally, the candidate must have strong data analysis skills. The ideal candidate will have a PhD in either population genomics, cancer genomics or clinical genomics.

Individuals applying for this position must be self-starters, strategic thinkers, action driven, flexible in changing direction and methods, thrive in a fast paced environment, excel at managing multiple priorities, succeed in communicating with all levels within the organization and provide immediate contribution.

Key Responsibilities

  • Work with key scientists to develop new applications that take advantage of 10x technology.
  • Analyze data for a variety of applications, including variant identification, assembly assessment and metagenomics applications.
  • Develop scientific materials to be used in webinars or other platforms to highlight the advantages of the 10x genomic platform.
  • Work with core product development teams to improve products and enable novel applications as driven by the scientific community.
Required Skills and Background

  • PhD or equivalent in genomics, cancer genomics or clinical genomics.
  • Extensive experience analyzing large sequencing data sets using Python or R
  • Solid knowledge of commonly used tools (BWA, GATK, FreeBayes, etc)
  • Solid knowledge of commonly used formats such as BAM, VCF and GFF3.
  • Proficiency with the command line and source control.
  • Experience with existing NGS platforms (e.g., Illumina, Ion Torrent, PacBio, etc.)
  • Demonstrated ability to trouble-shoot complex problems and to work effectively in a multi-disciplinary team
  • An eagerness to dramatically improve NGS tools
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Strong written and oral communication skills demonstrated with peer-reviewed publications and conference presentations
  • Demonstrated ability to maintain relationships with customers or external collaborators
Desired Skills and Background

  • Experience with NGS-related products such as Agilent SureSelect target capture, Ion AmpliSeq, Fluidigm single cell sequencing, etc.
  • Experience with DNA and/or RNA extraction methods
  • Knowledge of RNA or cellular biology in cancer or immunology contexts
  • Experience with other laboratory assays including real-time PCR, droplet digital PCR
  • Understanding of gene editing methods including CRISPR
title: Applications Data Analyst

description:
We are Farmers!

Join a team of diverse professionals at Farmers to acquire skills on the job and apply your learned knowledge to future roles at Farmers. Farmers Insurance also offers extensive training opportunities through the award winning University of Farmers named by Training magazine amongst top 10 corporate training units in the world. Start your career at Farmers today!

Job Summary

Provide data in response to one-time or recurring requests for reports or analysis. Understand customer objectives and processes; effectively communicate system capabilities and limitations; and deliver available data. Analyze data quality and take corrective action. Analyze impact of system changes to data/reporting infrastructure (support testing and implementation activities). Contribute data and expertise to the success of complex analysis projects.

Essential Job Functions

Extract and manipulate data to solve business problems: • Respond to new requests for reports/data: understand customer objectives and processes; review and refine requirements; and commun icate estimated hours and timeline to complete; • Extract data using Cognos ReportNet, OBIEE Answers, or similar business query interfaces; • Extract data directly from relational databases (e.g. Oracle, SQL Server), data warehouses, or other data stores using SQL; • Format data for business use in Excel, Access, or similar format; • Produce reports manually and through automated scripting; create and maintain scripts and macros used to automate reports; • Support application testing for enhancements or system upgrades; identify and communicate data quality issues or data differences; • Scope and deliver data for analytic purposes (data designed for the construction of advanced mathematical models); measure, document, and address data quality issues; maintain datasets and dataset documentation; and contribute knowledge and expertise to the success of the project; and • Act as liaison between business and IT; collaborate on technical issues that require IT involvement and business priority to fix.
Communicate effectively: • Be concise and precise in written communication; • Incorporate best practices in developing intuitive reports to share with a broad audience; and • Describe and document unique aspects or limitations of data to aid understanding.
Demonstrate business understanding: • Develop in-depth knowledge of data associated with multiple lines of business (LOBs), and effectively support the data needs of those LOBs; and • Demonstrate commitment to lifelong learning.
Exemplify good teamwork: • Proactively communicate with customers and team members; • Provide excellent customer service by making realistic commitments and keeping them; • Work productively on assigned tasks; • Collaborate effectively with other team members; • Demonstrate accountability to management and customers for hours spent on assigned tasks; • Diligently strive to deliver value in the fewest possible hours; and • Share effective SQL or other data extraction/manipulation techniques with team members; debug problems with report automation or queries; propose and implement remedies

Physical Actions

  • Essentially sedentary work consisting of occasional walking, standing, and lifting/carrying 10 lbs. maximum • Functional ability of seeing, hearing and speaking • Ability to type proficiently
Physical Environment

  • Work in a climate-controlled office, with occasional travel by car or airplane
Education Requirements

  • Bachelors degree (preferably in Information Systems or related field) • (Preferred) Masters degree (preferably in Information Systems or related field)
Experience Requirements

  • Internal candidates: (Preferred) 2+ years of Farmers or other insurance claims experience plus 2+ years experience as a Data Analyst I • External candidates: 4+ years’ experience with data extraction, manipulation, and presentation in usable format
Special Skill Requirement

  • MS Excel: advanced proficiency (Pivot Tables, Pivot Charts, AutoFilter, and formulas) • MS Access: proficient with loading data, writing queries, and manipulating data • BI query tools: advanced proficiency in Cognos ReportNet, OBIEE Answers, BusinessObjects, STATISTICA (preferred), or similar systems • SQL: proficient with complicated queries (many tables, many joins, complex data relationships, large databases) • Report automation: proficient with scripting tools and languages (batch files and VBA for Excel) • Communication: professional, concise, and precise in verbal and written communication

description:
Data Analyst Responsibilities

Include:

  • Interpreting data, analyzing results using statistical techniques and providing ongoing reports
  • Developing and implementing databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
  • Acquiring data from primary or secondary data sources and maintaining databases/data systems

Job brief

We are looking for a passionate certified Data Analyst. The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions.

Data Analyst Job Duties

Data analyst responsibilities include conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design. Data analysts will develop analysis and reporting capabilities. They will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.

Responsibilities

  • Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
  • Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
  • Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
  • Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
  • Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
  • Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
  • Locate and define new process improvement opportunities

Requirements

  • Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
  • Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
  • Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
  • Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
  • Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings

Job Type: Full-time

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • Data Analyst: 1 year
title: Data Analyst

description:
IT Security is a big deal . It’s in the news, growing rapidly, a critical tool for every company , and our specialty . Now is the time to be part of an organizat ion that is changing the game. We are the ONLY company in the Leader’s Quadrant of the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Web Application Firewall s . And for 2 straight years ! We’re also a leader in the Forrester Wave for DDoS S ervices Providers with the highest score in the “current offering” category.

If a growing public company is of interest to you, then you should know we are hiring! Hiring to handle our growth! Thousands of the world’s leading businesses, government organizations, and service providers rely on Imperva solutions to discover assets and risks, protect information wherever it lives – in the cloud and on-premises – and comply with regulations.

The Opportunity
This is a great opportunity, where you will work with Sales Operations and IT teams, acting as liaison in managing Xactly Incent and its integration with our SQL database and Salesforce.com. You will gain invaluable experience in a position which offers daily cross-departmental interaction, as well as communication with senior management in a quickly growing and dynamic sales organization. Our ideal candidate is diligent and proactive in analyzing system setups to create and improve upon commission processes and integration with Salesforce.com.

Responsibilities Standardize processes, controls, and documentation to promote accuracy and integrity of sales data and commissions payout Partner with departments to perform weekly/monthly/quarterly data audits and systems maintenance of Xactly Incent and Salesforce.com Review and recommend commission plan design components such as quotas, hierarchy assignments and rate calculations Lead the design/implementation process for plan updates, system enhancements and testing for calculation logic, data tables and reporting in Xactly Incent and Salesforce.com. Interact with the sales teams and sales leadership to address inquiries regarding sales and resulting commissions Manage requests from auditors Provide support for ad-hoc sales commissions analytics

Qualifications Bachelor’s degree: Business, Economics, Finance, or a related field preferred 2+ years in a Finance or Sales Operations Analyst role Hands on experience with Salseforce.com required Xactly and/or SQL experience a plus Ability to organize and summarize large volumes of data in Excel Analytical, detail oriented and self-motivated Results-driven and comfortable handling multiple deadlines

Our Company
Imperva® (NYSE: IMPV), is a leading provider of cyber security solutions that protect business-critical data and application s. The company’s SecureSphere™ and Incapsula™ product lines enable organizations to discover assets and vulnerabilities, protect information wherever it lives – on-premises and in the cloud – and comply with regulations. The Imperva Application Defense Center, a research team comprised of some of the world’s leading experts in data and application security, continually enhance Imperva products with up-to-the minute threat intelligence, and publish reports that provide insight and guidance on the latest threats and how to mitigate them.

Rewards
Imperva offers a competitive compensation package that includes base salary, medical, employee stock purchase (ESP) programs, flexible time off and more. It’s an exciting time to work in the security space. Check out our products and services at www.imperva.com and career opportunities at www.imperva.com/careers

Imperva is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, protected veteran status, medical condition or disability, or any other c haracteristic protected by law.

title: Performance & Data analyst - Digital Solution

description:
Google operates on a global scale, but each office seeks to emulate the same Googley feel of our Mountain View, California home base. As a Business Intelligence and Data Analyst, you build consistent, outstanding workplace experiences around the world. You design, implement and manage Google's service offerings. You're a great communicator who is comfortable taking on complex projects with a diverse set of stakeholders. You believe that great isn't good enough. You bring an analytical mind to constantly improve the efficiency and efficacy of your projects, from building new workplace tools and applications to mergers and acquisitions. You get satisfaction from knowing your clients are happy, healthy and productive, and are excited about joining a fast-paced, collaborative team that is reinventing what a workplace can be.

You will use data to inform real estate and workplace service business decisions across the globe. You will take a leadership role in providing visibility on key metrics, performance, and opportunities for scale and growth. You will also work closely with Corporate Engineering teams to shape and develop REWS’ (Real Estate and Workplace Services) data architecture, determining how to best structure and visualize key data. You will craft scalable solutions to automate reports and dashboards. You will ensure reports and dashboards that you build deliver high-quality and relevant data to manage our real estate portfolio. You will work with business owners to understand their evolving requirements and with Corporate Engineering to deliver practical but innovative solutions. You will also have the creativity and drive to build your own prototype solutions and to provide training and guidance to team members and partners.

You are naturally curious and you enjoy diving into data to both ask and answer big questions about service performance, real estate utilization and overall planning (e.g. - predicting impact on team commute times based on office relocations and employee addresses, etc). You are a well-rounded top performer who can be a key contributor in a high-growth environment. You should be a self-starter with good knowledge of Business Intelligence (BI) tools and approaches. You can "crunch the numbers" one minute, and critically think through business problems and communicate to stakeholders the next.

Just as Google products always focus on the user, Google offices focus on the Googler. From state-of-the-art green construction projects to maintaining our resident T. Rex skeleton (named Stan), the Real Estate and Workplace Services team builds environments that keep Googlers feeling inspired and energized. We're a team of inquisitive and energetic real estate, construction and facilities operations professionals that are constantly searching for new ways to improve workplace efficiency and make Google a great place to come to work everyday.

Responsibilities
  • Work closely with REWS management and their teams to understand their information needs, developing a BI strategy that both fulfills current needs and can evolve to anticipate future ones.
  • Work with REWS and Corporate Engineering partners to help shape and drive the development of BI infrastructure, tools, and processes.
  • Manage and deliver multiple BI work streams for diverse internal clients, both on an ongoing and ad-hoc basis. Provide interpretation, analysis, or insight along with clearly-stated information, representing interests of both team and leadership.
  • Customize communication and output to a wide variety of audiences; determine best audience for data-driven insights, both inside and outside immediate team.
  • Create dashboards, visualizations, and analyses that surface insights and drive key business decisions.

Qualifications Minimum qualifications:
  • BA/BS degree with a quantitative focus or equivalent practical experience
  • 4 years of relevant work experience including database experience with SQL, query optimization and operating with data schemas.
  • Programming experience (i.e. Python, R, JavaScript, etc).

Preferred qualifications:
  • Experience with data warehousing (e.g. storage methods/formats, database design) and Google BigQuery.
  • Experience in Web-scale databases, Hadoop, NoSQL technologies and related underlying technologies (i.e. App Engine or other cloud platforms).
  • Experience with Extraction Transformation Load (ETL) optimization and strong competency working in web-based tools including spreadsheet programs and Apps Script; Tableau and/or GIS.
  • In-depth experience analyzing data and creating reports with demonstrated spreadsheet, database query experience (namely SQL), statistical (e.g. R, SAS), quantitative modeling and forecasting skills.
  • Working knowledge of command line/console interface and version control (git, svn, etc).
  • Distinctive problem-solving and analytical skills combined with effective communication skills; demonstrated ability to convey complex concepts and solutions to all levels of an organization.
title: Business Intelligence and Data Analyst, REWS

description:
Legal Data Analyst, Bankruptcy

Team works remotely in USA

6 month contract

Lex Machina provides Legal Analytics to companies and law firms, enabling them to craft successful strategies, win cases, and close business. We are a cutting edge company based in Menlo Park, CA. Following our mission to be the most trusted source of litigation data, Lex Machina provides corporate leaders, attorneys, and policy makers with valuable empirical data and analytics that promote informed decision making and bring transparency to litigation. We launched Lex Machina for patent litigators and are now expanding Legal Analytics to all areas of the law including employment, commercial, bankruptcy and product liability litigation.

Role and Responsibilities

Lex Machina is hiring full-time, short-term legal data analysts for four new legal data projects running March through to September 2017. The projects involve annotating bankruptcy practice area.

You may work remotely and hours are flexible, 30-40 hours a week. Legal Data Analysts are expected to commit to the project for its full duration.

Qualifications


Qualifications

A law degree (JD) is required. 2+ years litigation experience, a passion for law and enthusiasm for building new datasets are preferred. The job requires familiarity with civil procedure and a capacity to confidently analyze litigation data especially case resolutions, dispositive rulings, damages and remedies. Practice area knowledge is important.

The North American Research Solutions business of LexisNexis serves the information and workflow needs in the U.S. and Canada for professionals in the legal, government, corporate and academic markets using cutting-edge search technology. Legal and Business professionals rely on expansive LexisNexis® content and tools to make better informed decisions and achieve better outcomes in the practice of law and in managing their businesses.

description:
We are searching for a Data Analyst to join our Data Center Global team in Sunnyvale, CA. This is a full-time Mon-Fri, long-term need for our team. You would be working closely with Technical Program Managers and other Data Analysts to build on business reporting needs. This is a great fit for someone who has the ability and passion to lead data reporting projects utilizing project management and business operations skills. We need sound data analysis skills and someone who is passionate about data in an engineering space.

Your main responsibilities:
Extracting, organizing, and analyzing data center capacity delivery performance data using tools and functions such as SQL, excel, and Google spreadsheets.

Auditing and maintaining data center physical layouts and capacity delivery performance reports

Resolving issues involving capacity delivery metrics derived for data center project data

Follow-up with internal teams to get data corrected

Resolving minor issues regarding risk identification and management in relation to delivery of data center capacity with guidance from other team members

Manage multiple projects and effectively communicate status updates with Project Managers

Detail and explain methodology used in analyses as requested by Project Managers

Generate various visual charts and reports pertaining to data center capacity

Deliverables:
Daily, weekly, and quarterly reports to support the data center operations needs

Creation and maintenance of proprietary dashboards reports, utilizing tools such as Actionable Business Intelligence (“ABI”) reports, SQL Scripting, and Google spreadsheets related to data center projects

Communication of inefficiencies and/or recommendations for existing processes

Qualifications:
B.A./B.S. or Masters degree with emphasis on coursework of a quantitative nature (e.g., Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Data Sciences).

5+ years of experience in an operational role performing data analytics

5+ years of experience with articulating operations questions, pulling data from datasets (SQL) and using statistics to arrive at an answer

Deep interest and aptitude in data, metrics, analysis and trends and applied knowledge of measurement, statistics and program evaluation

Experience in scripting with SQL, extracting large sets of data, and design of ETL (Extract, Transform, and Load) flows.

Nice to Haves

Passion for the engineering space from a business perspective

Distinctive problem solving skills

Capable of translating analysis results into Operations’ recommendations

Strong written and verbal communication skills

Ability to work in team-setting and give/receive guidance with other group members

Required Skills

Required Experience

title: Project/Data Analyst Internship

description:
You will be responsible for extracting signal out of the noise, to help us understand purchase and travel behavior among people in the United States and around the world. You will be responsible for anticipating questions that could be answered with our dataset and helping build tools to answer those questions. You will be in touch with our data savvy customers to guide their analysis and advocate for their needs internally. As an early member of the data team, you will play a crucial role in the company and will have a voice in guiding our data strategy and technologies.

You are skilled at working through problems with statistically sound thinking. You are familiar with sampling statistics and understand the decomposition of errors and biases. You are a skilled project leader with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple overlapping projects. You are an excellent communicator and effectively guide our customers to make sense of data that might be outside their domain.

As part of the data science team, this role reports to the Vice President, Data Science.

What we want from you:

  • Excellent written and oral communicator
  • Ability to write quality code for data management and analysis (r, python, ..)
  • Proficient in extracting data from varied data stores (t-sql, spark, ..)
  • 1+ years of data analysis experience
  • Excited by a high learning curve

What you get from us:

  • Be at the frontier of uncovering answers that have never been unearthed
  • Highly competitive salary and benefits
  • Stock option grants pre-IPO at a company backed by top investors
  • Take unlimited, responsible vacation
  • Great office location in San Jose, CA
  • Opportunity for professional development (conferences, peer reviewed papers)

About Us:

EasilyDo provides intelligent email solutions for users and email intelligence for businesses. The largest most valuable and most untapped data on earth is in mail; 3x larger than the worldwide web. Through our user base of over 1.5 million users, we empower investors, brands, and technology companies to understand trends in the marketplace and gain deep insights into consumer behavior patterns.

As a team, we’re collaborative, engaged, and committed to continually improving as we serve our mission. None of us are on an island-- we trust our teammates to lend a hand when we’re stuck and our egos take a backseat to figuring out the best approach to tackling problems. We’re energized by tough problems and are excited to know that a challenge ahead of us does not have a textbook solution. Finally, we’re always in a posture of learning-- there is a lot we do not know but that does not hold us back from making an attempt at solutions. We lead thorough blameless postmortems to become better analysts, scientists, and managers.

title: Data Analyst

description:
Position: Data Analyst I
Experience level desired: junior / mid-level

I. Position Summary
The Data analyst will support the Wholesale Sales and Marketing team by providing data, analysis, and consultative assistance. The work will include building reports, analyzing trends and variances, managing data sources and data flow, and collaborating directly with a team of sales and marketing professionals. The right candidate will have strong skills in the areas of analytical and data management, as well as exceptional customer service and communication.

II. Essential Functions
1. Reporting and data analysis: assist with daily, weekly, and monthly report preparation. Able to
analyze variances and ‘build a story’ from the data, then communicate that story to senior management
2. Data validation and tracking: monitor incoming data, systems and processes to validate data streams and sources. Test for accuracy and find solutions to correct data issues
3. Customer Service: support the sales and marketing team to help explain and understand their operational and financial results. Help dig into and explain potential questions they have on what is driving trends.
4. Assist controller and team with forecast and annual plan inputs, ensure data consistency
between data sources, and preparing reports for teams and distribution.
5. Provide ad-hoc analysis: support the team with various ad-hoc analytical projects to help
support strong business decision making
6. Expand the data and analytic toolset: assist the controller in developing tools, reports, and
systems to provide better information in support of the sales and marketing objectives

III. Approximate breakdown of time spent (subject to change)
40% Sales and Marketing analytical support, training, planning and forecasting
30% Data validation, data management
20% Report building and analysis
10% Ad-hoc analysis

IV. Physical Demands/Qualifications
Able to lift the equivalent of one case of wine/promotional materials.

V. Non-Physical Demands/ Qualifications
1. Technical proficiency: technical background or degree in Finance, Math or IT
3. Loves working with data & problem solving, comfortable with large datasets and data systems
4. Has a service heart and is customer service oriented: looking to help the Sales and Marketing team ‘win’ through better data and decision making
5. Analytics and report building: advanced Excel analytics and report building, presentations with
PowerPoint/Word. Able to use a wide range of analytical and BI tools such as SQL databases, Qlikview, Hyperion, JDE-Insight to gather data and build analysis and reports
6. Data management: comfortable working with query tools, data structures
7. Able to catch mistakes and self-audit, work independently and accurately
8. Strong communication skills
10. Basic understanding of finance and accounting

V. Additional Skills preferred:
1. Experience in the CPG or Wine industry
2. Data Visualization through BI tools (Qlikview, Excel)
3. Form and report building in Qlikview, Hyperion, JDE/Insight
4. Basic programming: SQL data extraction, Qlikview programming, Hyperion report and Essbase programming, Excel macros

VI. Environmental Conditions
Working conditions are normal for an office environment.

VII. Sustainability Values Statement
Supports economic sustainability thru key decisions that promote the long term health of the organization. Supports environmental sustainability thru long term production planning that takes care of the land and water resources. Supports social responsibility thru ongoing commitments to the community and employee population.

This position description does not promise or imply that the functions listed are the only duties to be performed or that the position may not change, or be eliminated. Employees are always expected to follow their supervisors’ instructions and to perform the tasks requested by their supervisors.

title: Data Analyst

description:
This position will be responsible for the analysis, development, modification, general maintenance and validation of Hospital reports. The IT Data Analyst works directly with functional clients, physicians and managers to collect report and information requirements to include: develop specifications for requested reports, gap analysis, changes to existing reports, identify delivered reports already available, and develops and maintains a self-service searchable index of existing reports. The IT Data Analyst provides business application support; training to help interpret data in Epic EMR, advanced structured query language (SQL) techniques, and other common reporting tools; collaborates with functional and technical staff on data architecture issues and changes to Clarity data fields and business processes related to reporting requirements. This position collaborates closely with Information System Programmer Analysts, Managers, Technical Specialists in functional departments and the Data Governance Committee on proposed changes to data fields and tables required to meet reporting requirements. The IT Data Analyst develops reports using tools that include: BOE Crystal, Reporting Workbench and Excel. The Data Analyst/Report Writer serves as liaison to Database Administrators and Information Systems staff for large data uploads from internal and external sources. This position is also responsible for overall data quality and develops and executes unit test and validation procedures to ensure delivered information is reliable and accurate.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS :

Bachelor's Degree

3 years of experience

title: Data Analyst

description:
At Yelp Data Science, we see our 100M+ reviews not only as a great source of information about the best salted caramel ice cream in SF, but also as a vast storehouse of data. We leverage that data to connect our users with great local businesses. We work tightly with the product and engineering teams to find the opportunities hidden in usage data and the features hidden in our user generated content. Data science at Yelp answers questions ranging from who is likely to love a certain flavor of ice cream to which features are likely to move the needle...and we define the needle.
We’re looking for a Data Analyst to contribute to these Data Science efforts at Yelp. In this role you’ll be tackling a variety of projects ranging from analysis of A/B tests and user behavior, to data-driven blog posts and product insights. As your role grows you’ll identify new questions that need answers, and provide those answers using tools and frameworks that you and your teammates have created.

Requirements
  • Minimum BA/BS degree in Statistics, Math, Physics, Economics, Computer Science or related analytical discipline Endless ideas about how to leverage Yelp's unique data set
  • Experience with data analysis and data visualization in either academic or professional capacity
  • Experience with analytical and quantitative problem solving
  • Familiarity with relational databases and SQL
  • Excellent typing ability in the presence of flying nerf darts
Pluses
  • Experience with Python
  • Experience with analysis tool(s) such as Pandas or R
  • Experience building visualizations in one or more toolsets (d3, tableau, matplotlib, ggplot, etc)
title: Data Science Analyst

description:
RichRelevance is the global leader in omnichannel personalization. Ranked #1 for personalization in both the US and EMEA, RichRelevance is used by more than 200 multinational companies to create a data-centric, single view of the shopper, delivering the most relevant experiences across web, mobile and in store. RichRelevance drives more than one billion decisions every day, and has generated over $10 billion in sales for its clients, which include Target, Costco, Marks & Spencer and Priceminister. Recently, the company opened its cloud-based platform through its service-oriented architecture (SOA) to accelerate “Relevance in Store”—a strategic omnichannel initiative that enables clients to seamlessly merge disparate data sources and build applications that adapt to where, when and how consumers shop today. Headquartered in San Francisco, RichRelevance has been recognized as a “Best Place to Work” and a “Most Engaged Workplace” in the Bay Area for numerous years, and serves clients in 40 countries from 8 offices around the globe.

Primary Responsibilities:
Distill our technology¹s performance down to consumable and familiar key performance indicators and visualizations
Build/utilize tools and processes that will scale the reporting function
Perform diagnostic and forensic analysis of product performance
Develop new ways to view and describe our business and product lines
Collaborate with the Engineering and Product Management groups to translate analyses into dashboard product requirements
Collaborate with the Relationship Management and Ad Operations teams to develop and present KPIs to top-tier ecommerce clients and brand advertisers
Some infrequent travel may be required (< 5%)
Mentor Junior Analysts
Provide technical training to client services and other internal organizations

Technical Skills

SQL: expansive breadth of knowledge of query operators as well as performance considerations
You are proficient in basic statistical topics (conditional probability, sample sizing, Bayesian vs frequentist, ANOVA, DOE)
You have had exposure to web analytics tools (e.g., Omniture SiteCatalyst, WebTrends, CoreMetrics, Google Analytics) and/or business intelligence tools (e.g., JasperSoft, Crystal Reports, Pentaho)
You are familiar with consumer analytics and the associated metrics (e.g., analysis of online transactions, ave. order value, conversion rates)
Exposure to a statistical package (preferably R, but including SAS, SPSS, Matlab) is a plus
Experience with Hadoop (Hive/Pig/Hbase) is a plus
Scrappiness with UNIX is a plus

Experience and Education

Minimum 5+ years of professional experience
4-year Bachelor¹s degree required, technical/business-oriented degree preferred
title: Senior Data Analyst

description:
The role of FIU data analyst is to research and document full list of SVB’s products and services, transactions used for each product, and any data transformation logic from source systems into various downstream systems and databases in standard templates and/or tools, and identify any product and data gaps as it relates to transaction monitoring compliance. This position would require knowledge of banking products and services, and in-depth data analysis and reconciliation process. Position will require coordination with Data Warehouse team (IT), IT client services vertical, accounting/finance management, business intelligence/reporting, and various line of business. It will also play a key part in inbound monitoring control build out for transaction monitoring, as well as actively supporting various solutions and changes affecting BSA/AML.

Primary Responsibilities:
  • Perform complex business and data analysis of banking processes, products, customer statements, databases etc.
  • Document inventory of products and services, end to end flows of products and transactions from source systems or desktop procedures.
  • Develop gap analysis of products and transactions identified versus what exists in the current documentation and systems and databases.
  • Document data gaps from source systems or desktop procedures to data warehouse and other downstream systems.
  • Conduct data lineage and mapping from source systems or desktop procedures to data warehouse and transaction monitoring systems.
  • Consolidate all existing technical and process documentation.
  • Updates data dictionary, system context diagrams and other documentation for relevant SVB systems.
  • Analyze data in test environments/data warehouse to support gap analysis
  • Partner with IT and business system analysts in performing product inventory and gap analysis.
  • Notifies and keeps business unit and management abreast of findings affecting transaction monitoring compliance.
  • Escalate issues and roadblocks in a timely manner to the management.
  • Facilitate audit and exam related data requests.
  • Participate in the ETL code reviews for upcoming changes to solutions.
  • Strong knowledge on testing methodology and able to work with project team, business users to ensure the right testing strategy is defined and executed, and may perform User Acceptance Testing representing the business unit.
  • Project manage various remediation work efforts that including all aspects of controls (people, process, technology) to finish line.
  • Strong hands-on database skills (Oracle, SQL) and hands-on SQL knowledge and experience with connecting to data sources, perform analysis and creating dashboard for reporting.
  • Act as Subject Matter Expert for the application when needed.
  • Perform duties & responsibilities specific to department functions & activities.
  • Performs other duties & responsibilities as required or assigned by supervisor.
  • Responsibilities include the following: 1) adhering to and complying with all applicable, federal and state laws, regulations and guidance, including those related to Anti-Money Laundering (i.e. Bank Secrecy Act, USA PATRIOT Act, etc.), 2) adhering to Bank policies and procedures, 3) completing required training, 4) identifying and reporting potential suspicious activity to the BSA/AML Officer, and 5) knowing and verifying the identity of any customer(s) that enters into a relationship with the Bank.
  • Critical features of this job are described under the items above. They may be subject to change at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons. This job description reflects management’s assignment of essential functions; it does not prescribe or restrict the tasks that may be assigned. Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.
Skills and Requirements:
  • Must have a bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science.
  • Experience with Financial Services, Banking systems, and products, securities, foreign exchange, and lending and deposit business.
  • 6+ years’ experience with SQL
  • 2 years hands-on experience in Tableau
  • At least 5+ years of Application Testing experience in Cross Browser/Platform testing
  • 6+ years’ experience in functional and System Integration testing.
  • 5+ years’ experience working with Users and supporting UAT testing.
  • 6+ years’ experience in translating requirements into detailed test plans and test cases.
  • 3+ years of Banking Application experience BSA/AML/Sanctions/Fraud etc.
  • Ability to utilize standardized testing methods, tools and procedures are used to ensure testing is efficient, effective and comprehensive.
  • Ability to work on multiple projects with aggressive deadlines.
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, and outstanding attention to detail.
  • Working knowledge on Microsoft Excel, MS SharePoint, MS Visio, MS PowerPoint.
  • Certification(s) in testing is a PLUS
  • Must possess the ability to work effectively with business personnel at all levels as well as with outside vendors and contractors.
  • Requires strong interpersonal and organizational skills, including the ability to meet deadlines, follow written policies and procedures, and maintain superior customer service at all times with all users.
  • Ability to establish and maintain good working relationships with a variety of persons and groups both inside and outside the bank.
  • Team player
  • Provides extraordinary service
  • Furthers the Silicon Valley Bank culture and values
For
more than 30 years, SVB Financial Group (NASDAQ: SIVB) and its subsidiaries
have helped innovative companies and their investors move bold ideas forward,
fast. SVB Financial Group’s businesses, including Silicon Valley Bank, offer
commercial and private banking, asset management, private wealth management,
brokerage and investment services, funds management and business valuation
services to companies in the technology, life science and healthcare, private
equity and venture capital, and premium wine industries. Headquartered in Santa
Clara, California, SVB Financial Group operates in centers of innovation around
the world. Learn more at www.svb.com .

Developing new queries to track programs over time Assessing performance of vendors (DM, CM, etc.) within the application Ability to create cohorts, show impact, and identify cost savings based upon both the individual and population level Create various benchmarks by industry and market using data provided in Verisk tool Create baseline reporting to first guide clients in correct direction Slice and compare subsets of data within clients BOB to demonstrate innovation and ‘think outside the standard healthcare box’ in order to target short term changes, to go along with the long-standing programs already in place Cross reference various other systems used in nurses workflow to demonstrate true clinical value and savings, quickly pin pointing key areas Create standard report package templates according to clients’ needs and clients’ industry Incorporate predictive risk modeling to help drive client wellness program initiatives Work towards an average pricing resource tool in order to show more accurate soft savings Identify clinical trends and tracking intervention / activity results Summarizing clinical findings, options, and recommendations Skills Proven experience working with multiple projects and collaborating with diverse resources to meet tight delivery timeframes. title: Healthcare Data Analyst

description:
Linkage Biosciences, Inc. is a privately held, emerging molecular diagnostics company developing and marketing products that dramatically improve and expedite complex genetic testing. LinkSēq™, the company’s Human Leukocyte Antigen (HLA) testing product line, is a PCR based product used in organ and stem cell transplantation and other areas of immunogenetics research.

Linkage Biosciences is currently seeking a QC Data Analyst to work with the manufacturing team to analyze and summarize in-process and final QC data for our proprietary and leading edge molecular diagnostic products. The successful candidate will have a strong technical background in end point and real-time PCR data, strong attention to detail, and a desire to be part of an exciting, growing company.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Conduct quality control analysis for in-process, finished good product, and stability of samples according to SOP (Standard Operation Procedures) and/or guidelines.
  • Compile analyzed data, interpret data and submit data summaries for review
  • Maintain detailed records and documentation
  • Identify problems that may affect test performance or results and conduct corrective action per protocols. Document corrective actions taken when test deviate from established performance specifications.
  • Work with R&D; to transfer new products into Manufacturing
  • Assist in the development of QC Procedures, create and maintain QC documentation for new and existing products, processes, and equipment.
  • Ensure compliance with SOPs and ISO 13485 regulation
  • Assist manufacturing with production process
  • May perform other duties as assigned
  • Help identify and implement new process improvements. Assist in existing process improvements.
  • Adhere to all processes and procedures
  • Conduct training for new QA team members
QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Molecular Biology, Biochemistry or related Science Filed
  • Minimum of 2 years Biotech industry work experience
  • Previous experience in QC role with significant experience in PCR
  • Proficient with Excel and other data analysis tools
  • Detail oriented, quality focused and self-motivated
  • Ability to organize and prioritize work load to meet deadlines
This is a full time position located at our offices in South San Francisco.

Please visit our website for additional information on the company: www.linkagebio.com

We apologize in advance for not responding directly to each applicant; only applicants selected for interview will be contacted.

Applicants should send their CV summarizing qualifications and experience, including references, to: careers@linkagebio.com

Applications from principals only please.

Linkage Biosciences, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer

description:
The Analyst will be responsible for developing the reporting and executing queries to support data requirements across the entire program. The analyst will be working with multiple business organizations at Humana, as well as external partners, so they need to have good oral and written communication skills. This role requires intimate knowledge of both Medicare and Clinical systems and data tables. It’s a requirement that the associate knows how to create queries using data tables from multiple business areas. Additionally, the individual will need to rely on other business areas for data requirements.

You will run reports/extracts, creating queries from a variety of data sources and databases to pull specific information and collect multi-faceted data, analyze the information, validate report outputs and make recommendations which drive decision making.

Complete routine dashboard and reporting reviews to identify potential process gaps and performance trends.

You will also provide a level of business acumen to ensure that the results are correct based on various data validation tests and approaches.

Ensure that alignment of data definitions and consistency of data sources for teams reports are aligned with operational and compliance metrics, as well as executive dashboards.

Continuously improve and implement enhancements to all processes.

Work closely with IT teams to plan and provide oversight to the report configuration and workflow management of each report with the market and functional business teams.

Work with Business Areas and Markets to continually improve reporting and enhance capabilities needed to perform the required analysis.

Perform specific analyses to support business decisions.

Provide routine and ad hoc analyses of forecasted versus actual and year over year results.

Qualifications

Role Essentials

Bachelor’s Degree required; preferably in Mathematics, Economics, Finance, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, Data Mining, or any discipline involving analysis and programming.

Experience analyzing and presenting complex data and proven problem solving abilities.

Data analysis experience.

Detail oriented and process and systems thinker.

Excellent organizational skills required.

Excellent written and oral communication skills required.

Complete proficiency in Advanced Microsoft – Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint.

Knowledge of SQL programming.

Role Desirables

Graduate degree in a Healthcare, Health Technology, Informatics discipline, or a related quantitative discipline

Experience with reporting/business intelligence tools against large databases, such as Qlikview, SAS, SSRS and Access

Knowledge of VBA programing

Knowledge of healthcare and/or medical, pharmacy and clinical data a significant plus

Prior experience within the healthcare industry.

Reporting Relationships:
You will report to a Manager.

At Humana, we know your well-being is important to you, and it’s important to us too. That’s why we’re committed to making resources available to you that will enable you to become happier, healthier, and more productive in all areas of your life. If you share our passion for helping people, we likely have the right place for you at Humana.

description:
If you're motivated, energetic, personable, driven to succeed, have marketing experience and like to contribute to the success of a great team, First Financial Credit Union has an exciting career opportunity for you in the financial industry!

Our Marketing Data Analyst position assists in managing the credit union's MCIF (Member Customer Information File) database, calculating projections and results of all marketing campaigns, including response rate and return on investment (ROI) analysis, and working collaboratively with teams to define and collect data to support strategic goals.

Put your analytical skills to work as you work closely with our Vice President of Marketing to develop and execute marketing campaigns, support the Retail sales staff, and respond to database needs, including the MCIF and more.

Marketing Data Analyst responsibilities include:

--Coordinates relationship with Marketing Customer Information File (MCIF) provider and other sources of data. Explores all options for improved data gathering and analysis.

-- Calculates projections and results of all marketing campaigns, including response rate and return on investment (ROI) analysis

--Manages credit union's research and competitive needs and reporting

--Produces reoccurring and ad-hoc reports

--Works collaboratively with teams to define and collect data to support strategic goals

-- Responds to the Marketing Department's MCIF needs including the creation and distribution of targeted lead lists to field representatives with clear instructions regarding content and usage.

--Provides lead lists created from MCIF system for targeted marketing campaigns.

--Coordinates the annual Raddon survey, including gathering final results and providing detailed reporting and recommendations on results.

--Coordinates relationship with market research providers, obtains and reports on market research information.

--Creates reports regarding trends and marketing program results.

--Maintains and updates files and status of competition's marketing, promotions, pricing, product line, and delivery mechanisms.

--Develops awareness of laws and regulations ensuring compliance as related to member information and communication.

--Writes or assists in the writing of letters for the credit union, internal memos and articles for the credit union newsletters.

--Assists in the establishment of marketing strategies, goals and objectives for marketing planning.

-Reviews, revises, or edits copy for collateral materials, forms, promotional letters and member communications.

Why you should work with us...

We are celebrating over 80 years as a leading provider of financial products and personalized service to the California educational community.

First Financial is committed to enriching the lives of its employees and offers a rich array of benefits of employment including:

--Competitive Salary

--On-site Gym and basketball court (at our Corporate Offices)

--Medical, Dental and Vision

-- 401(k) plan (4% Safe Harbor contribution)

If you are looking for a good place to grow and develop your skills, we want to meet you. Apply now to join our winning team!

Successful candidates should meet the position requirements:
  • Must have strong analytical, quantitative, qualitative, organizational, writing and computer skills.
    •

  • Advanced knowledge of spreadsheet, database and word processing applications.
  • Excellent oral and written communication and presentation skills.
  • Ability to work independently and in teams, analyze business information and make sound recommendations.
  • Time management skills and organizational skills to handle multiple projects.
    •
  • Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Business Administration or Marketing.
  • Valid current driver's license and auto insurance coverage

First Financial Credit Union is an equal opportunity employer.

description:
ITIQ is a nationwide provider of Information Technology services for mid to large sized companies. We have an immediate opening for a SQL Report Writer – Data Analyst with at least 2 years of working experience in writing SQL queries against Microsoft SQL Server. The Data Analyst will be responsible for all aspects of company report creation, execution and administration.

The Data Analyst is responsible for interfacing with client to interpret their technical business requirements, assist with data file submissions, enforcing company data standards, and cleansing data files submitted by clients. The Data Analyst must be highly proficient with Excel, writing SQL queries, and report writing.

The Data Analyst will also perform some SQL database management, administration, and maintenance tasks as necessary for the successful operation of company databases. The ideal candidate will have a good overall technical background with the ability to troubleshoot identified technical issues. This is a hands-on technical position that also has heavy interaction with business leaders and end user clients.

MAIN DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Writes, maintains, and supports a variety of reports or queries utilizing Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) and Excel as applicable. Will need to cleanse data routinely submitted by clients using Microsoft Excel. Will need to import data batches into SQL server databases. Will create standard as well as ad-hoc reports as requested.

Acts as main point-of-contact for all ad-hoc and database report requests. Automates and streamlines reports, where possible, for distribution on an ongoing basis. Responsible for basic database technical duties, including general backups, restores, updates, testing, debugging, integration and analysis. Follows processes and standards for database systems recovery and back-up checks as well as user performance and data security. Ensures reports and analysis are validated with the highest level of accuracy. Other duties as assigned by and for the Information Technology Department and the CFO.

REQUIREMENTS High School graduate with a college degree from an accredited institution or equivalent professional experience required; 2 years of experience with SQL Architecture and Development Experience in a production environment required. 2 years Prior experience with Microsoft SQL Architecture and writing queries required. 2 years SSRS Report development preferred. Experience with Crystal Reports will be considered. Ability to resolve and handle difficult challenges and issues. Proven ability to manage confidential information. Ability to deal with periodic levels of highly stressful situations associated with handling difficult issues and challenges. Must have exceptional interpersonal skills. Must be able to understand, speak, read and write in English in order to perform the essential functions of the job as they relate to comprehension of laws, regulations, standards, documents and other internal and external communications.

description:
About the role We’re looking for a Senior Data Analyst to support dotloop, a Zillow Group company. You will work closely with the product team and management to help the us make well informed, decisions based on data that influence the product roadmap and business direction. Some highlights of this role:
Huge impact: dotloop is data-hungry and we rely on analytical insights to support virtually all of our decisions. You’ll have an opportunity to quickly impact several critical aspects of the business and will play an integral role in the decision-making process.
High visibility: We're a flat organization that is growing quickly; because your work will influence important decisions, you'll communicate directly with Directors, VPs and the Founder/GM on a regular basis to present data.
Fun: Join the largest and most exciting tech company in real estate and help us transform the home buying and selling experience. We know you’ll love coming to work in the morning! This position provides you the opportunity to:
Ingest data from a variety of sources including MySQL, S3, and Amazon Redshift using SQL tools and Python.
Build dynamic & scalable production dashboards for the dotloop product offering, providing product, marketing, and strategy partners a window into the day-to-day operation of dotloop.
Partner with dotloop leadership to develop medium and long-term strategies aimed at achieving dotloop’s business objectives.
Respond to the daily needs of the dotloop business by fielding questions from leadership, translating them into an analytics framework, and providing actionable results.
Explore dotloop’s rich set of data, mining it to find insights that you can bring to your business partners.
Collaborate with dotloop’s data warehouse team to streamline inefficiencies in the data preparation process. About the team We are a fun, small team of engineers working in an agile environment. We work hard while keeping a good work-life balance. We believe in building a high-availability, scalable infrastructure.

Who are you?
Undergraduate or Master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g. science, engineering, economics, finance, statistics, or analytics).
Interest in and willingness to wear different hats – data engineering, Tableau reporting, ad hoc analyses, and project-based analytics.
Proficient at writing SQL code against complex databases for the purpose of data extraction.
Experience translating business questions into problems solvable using analytics tools, and a real passion for converting the results of your analyses into visual stories tailored to the needs of your audience.
Extensive Experience with text mining tools (such as SAS, R, Python, Matlab, Stata SPSS or comparable platforms). Familiarity with natural language processing, categorization models and computational linguistics is a plus.
Detail oriented, but able to balance pragmatism over perfection.
Passion for efficiency with a strong desire to automate costly business & analytics processes using Python or another multipurpose language.
Thrive on autonomy and want to take ownership of your interactions with business partners, your projects, your job, and your career.
Strong written and verbal communication skills and have experience working on and communicating with fast-paced, dynamic teams. Get to know us dotloop replaces your form creation, e-sign, and real estate transaction management systems with a single end-to-end solution, while helping you streamline your business with real-time visibility into your transactions. Over 3,500 businesses - including 40 of the top 100 largest brokerages and over 85 state and regional associations - use dotloop.

Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, ethnicity, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law.
title: Senior Data Analyst

description:
We believe that everyone benefits from their biological information. It’s our mission to empower every person to improve their life through DNA. With our high-quality, trusted partners and state-of-the-art lab, we’ve created the first platform of personalized products and services powered by genetics. From advanced cancer screening to custom fitness and nutrition plans, the world of DNA learning is becoming more accessible and more valuable than ever.

Our big vision comes with big responsibility. That’s why we’re building a team of experts in the field of genetics, engineering, design, business development, and beyond to help bring actionable insights to our customers. With the backing of investors like Illumina, KPCB, Warburg Pincus and Sutter Hill, we’re looking for the brightest minds passionate about our mission and excited to work at an early-stage startup on a truly diverse team.

Helix is building a high-throughput genetics laboratory using next generation sequencing to provide genomics scale information to our clients. We're excited to deliver novel genomic insights to our customers and the laboratory is the foundation of our ability to supply high quality, accurate and reproducible genomic data.

We are searching for a highly motivated, independent and team oriented Data Analyst to join our growing team in San Diego. As a Data Analyst in the Helix team you will work in a dynamic, team-oriented environment to provide technical review of customer’s DNA sequencing results that will be used in cutting-edge clinical genetics applications.

As a Data Analyst, you will:
  • Review high volume NGS results, both primary and secondary metrics, as part of the data release process for clinical samples.
  • Track samples from DNA sequencing raw results thru to passing QC thresholds to ensure timely reporting of clinical results.
  • Use systematic problem-solving methods to troubleshoot complex issues related to quality of results.
  • Help to establish best practices for analysis of results in compliance with clinical lab quality regulations. Document plans, processes and results accordingly.
  • Perform analyses of processes, identify gaps and deficiencies in the data analysis workflow. Help design controlled experiments to optimize processes to achieve commercial levels of stability, robustness, and performance.
  • Present clear and concise written and oral communications to colleagues and supervisors, lead and/or participate in technical meetings, and provide recommendations based on technical results.
  • Provide technical leadership in the transfer of new processes to clinical production.
  • All listed tasks and responsibilities are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilities.
Required Background:
  • PhD or equivalent experience in Biology, Genetics, Chemistry, Biochemistry or related field.
  • 3-5 years experience in the analyses of NGS data.
  • Strong data analysis skills, ability to interpret and draw conclusions from large amounts of data.
  • High level of attention to detail.
Ideal candidate will have:
  • Strong understanding of next generation DNA sequencing process from raw data, alignment to analysis of QC metrics.
  • Experience with BaseSpace
  • Ability to read log files.
  • Motivated, enthusiastic, hard-working, positive individual who desires to be part of a fast-paced, dynamic development environment.
  • High level problem solving and reasoning skills.
This is a fantastic opportunity to help Helix build a state of the art, high throughput, NGS-based clinical production laboratory. If you like the idea of contributing to a production scale clinical laboratory, then this is the ideal opportunity for you.

What Helix has to offer you
Aside from working alongside brilliant, dedicated, passionate, down-to-earth, curious, warm, and thoughtful people, we also provide great benefits:

  • Competitive compensation, including meaningful equity
  • Health insurance, including medical, dental, and vision
  • 401(k) with employer matching
  • Catered meals
  • Unlimited vacation
  • Commuter benefits
  • Gym subsidy
