title: Business Analyst

description: Job Description
title: Data Analyst

description:
----------------------
Team Description
----------------------

Our People & Recruiting team is responsible for finding our most valuable asset: our people. We find and hire the people who will shape our product and our company.

----------------
Role Description
----------------

We're looking for someone who loves digging into data, building models, and communicating talent acquisition and process recommendations to various audiences. You must have the ability to balance multiple priorities, deep analytical rigor, and excellent communication skills that can be tailored to cross-functional audiences at every level. You will deliver results and showcase attention to detail. As a People Data Analyst you will sit on our HR Technology & Analytics team and support the Recruiting Process, Innovation and Talent Branding team, working closely with recruiting leads and our business partners to enable recruiting processes through technology, and identify hypothesis to drive recruiting effectiveness.

----------------------
Responsibilities
----------------------

  • Synthesize business problems, define hypothesis and test process changes to confirm causality or impact of those changes
  • Monitor and validate data ensuring high-quality information is collected and accurately stored.
  • Develop and present data and insightful analytics to Recruiting and business leaders.
  • Provide input on our systems to support analytics.
  • Proactively identify opportunities for process improvement based on data.
  • Help to continually improve data management methods and systems. Proactively suggest opportunities to avoid problems and anticipate future data needs.
  • Prepare documents and materials for leadership meetings, reviewing results and modeling different strategic options for future recruiting initiatives.
  • Respond to ad hoc requests from recruiting leadership and teams, internal departments, etc.
------------
Requirements
------------

  • 5+ years of data analysis, analytics in HR, Marketing or Sales in the technology industry
  • SQL or Python (or equivalent) analysis of data sets based upon hypothesis
  • Advanced skills with Microsoft Excel manipulating very large datasets, is required.
  • Comfort with ambiguity, uncertainty, and a rapidly evolving business landscape
  • Humble attitude with a willingness to shift from high-level strategic thinking to stepping in and helping to drive implementation alongside functional teams
  • Basic knowledge in HR or Recruiting processes
  • Master’s degree with strong academic performance; preferably data, computer science or engineering.
title: People Data Analyst

description:
Practice Fusion’s Data Services team is an exceptional group of data architects, data engineers, and business intelligence professionals. The Data Services team builds data intensive applications including our business intelligence platform for turning data into information and knowledge. As a BI practitioner within Practice Fusion's Data Services team you will be tackling tough challenges in user research, analytics and data-driven storytelling. You will be proficient in SQL and data warehouse technologies as well have experience with advanced analytics.

We are looking for a true Data Analyst who loves technology and data analytics. We want someone who will have fun building statistical models for conversion, and churn while working with individuals across the organization to define metrics that better define our users and competitive landscape. You will be expected to produce end-to-end work defining analysis plans, coding, storytelling, and presenting findings directly to stakeholders including the executive team. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter with excellent problem solving skills and attention to detail. If this sounds like you, come join us!

----------------
Responsibilities
----------------

  • Complete data-driven research projects using Tableau, SQL and advanced analytics applications such as SAS, SPSS, R or Python
  • Help put useful data into the hands of our team by automating ad-hoc queries into regular reports and visualizing our data using Tableau
  • Extract key takeaways from analyses and present findings directly to internal stakeholders.
  • Collaborate with team members on ongoing development projects focused on improving data quality
------------
Requirements
------------

  • 3+ years of relevant work experience involving a BI application such as Tableau (preferred), Cognos or similar.
  • Experience with Software as a Service (SaaS) specific metrics such as Churn, Conversion Rate, ARPU, etc.
  • Hands-on experience working with a large relational database such as Netezza, SQL Server or similar
  • Worked with an advanced analytics/statistical application such as SAS, SPSS, R or Python (preferred)
  • Experience in healthcare(preferred), financial services or ecommerce
  • Great attitude, are team-focused and love to get things done
  • Bachelor degree in a technical subject; master’s degree preferred
---------------------
About Practice Fusion
---------------------

Practice Fusion connects doctors, patients and data to drive better health and save lives. With over 80 million patients served by doctors using Practice Fusion’s free cloud-based health records, Practice Fusion is the country’s largest patient-physician community.

Unsolicited Resumes: Practice Fusion will not pay a fee to any employment agency or third party for the referral of candidates unless the agency or third party has signed a formal agreement by an authorized member of our Human Resources Department. Unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or third parties of any kind will become the property of Practice Fusion and will be considered gratuitous, no-fee referrals.
title: BI & Analytics Analyst

description:
Under the direction of the Program Compliance Manager, the HMIS Data Analyst will work to ensure the accuracy and integrity of HMIS data. The HMIS Data Analyst will work with appropriate entities to problem-solve technical issues and assist with both small and large-scale reporting projects and data requests.

Essential Duties:
  • HMIS data entry for all ACOF properties including receiving, recording and updating all tenant entry/exits and data changes
  • Input initial intake information during lease up for LAHSA set up of bed/contract system for new buildings
  • Work alongside Services and Property Management staff to assist with back end maintenance, accuracy and integrity of HMIS data
  • Ensure site-staff sign up for required HMIS training sessions and assist with staff training
  • Conduct periodic site visits to ensure completeness and congruity of records against HMIS
  • Generate and compile database reports as requested by funders and management including HUD and LAHSA
  • Compile annual demographic reports
To perform effectively in this position, the Senior Staff Accountant must have:

Basic Qualifications
  • High School Diploma or GED
  • One-year experience using Excel to compile data analysis
  • Two years’ experience working in an office environment
  • Two years’ experience using Clarity, HMIS–Adsystech, SharePoint or other HMIS software
  • Valid California Driver’s License
  • Access to a personal vehicle to be used to conduct ACOF business.
  • Ability to meet California minimum and ACOF insurance requirements
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Human/Social Services field
  • One-year experience generating reports and troubleshooting data errors in HMIS
  • Two years’ experience working with Adsystech-HMIS
  • A strong desire to work with computers and database systems
  • Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously under strict deadlines
  • Knowledge of public benefit and social service systems
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to interact with a variety of internal and external individuals with poise, tact, and diplomacy
  • Ability to conduct self-directed work and function as part of a team
  • Advanced understanding of Microsoft software programs
  • Regular consistent attendance
  • Sense of humor
title: Homeless Management Information Systems (HMIS) Data Analyst

description:
With light to moderate supervision and guidance from the Manager of Post-Market Product Surveillance and the Sr. Data Analyst, the Data Analyst will assist with creating and communicating Post-Market Product Surveillance data across the organization. This individual will support the Sr. Data Analyst for inter-departmental data requests and work with Business Intelligence to manage data preparedness. The Data Analyst will also process product complaints to maintain familiarity with the complaint handling system.

This position is based in the San Diego office.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Work in various databases and with Business Intelligence to pull information from verified and validated sources to track and trend Post-Market Product Surveillance data.
  • Create charts, graphs, and other visualizations for inter-departmental communication of Post-Market Product Surveillance data.
  • Must be able to present information in a way that is understandable for those not familiar with the data.
  • Work with various departments to provide data relevant to their business processes and data needs.
  • Must be able to converse professionally and effectively and deliver data relevant to customer needs.
  • Monitor Post-Market Product Surveillance data to identify potential product performance issues for elevation to Sr. Data Analyst.
  • Assist in creating recurring metrics for the Post-Market Product Surveillance Management team to monitor product and department performance.
  • Review and evaluate complaints per Standard Operating Procedures.
  • Support internal, external, and third-party audits.
  • This position assumes and performs other duties as assigned.
Required Qualifications:
  • Comprehensive skills in Microsoft Office products, Word, PowerPoint and Excel.
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Two or more years of data analysis or information distribution experience.
  • Knowledge of and experience in field of diabetes and CGM technology is highly desirable.
  • Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
Education Requirements:
  • Bachelor's degree (B. A.) from a four-year college or university; or one to two years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Travel Required:
  • 0 – 24%
Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

description:
Amazing Job Opportunity - Direct Hire

Job Summary

Under general supervision, the Data Analyst (Call Center) provides Customer Service specialized tasks relevant to an assigned program and/or project. This position has analytical responsibilities specific to the functional area. The incumbent is assigned to Medi-Cal Customer Service related programs and projects and involves specialized background or knowledge regarding Customer Service processing rules, business user system testing, and regulatory guidelines relevant to the assignment. The incumbent often works independently, performs analytical duties. Exercises discretion and judgment and may lead a function and the work of others within the program or representing the program/project.

Experience & Education

  • Must be able to work with Customer Service data, manipulate spreadsheets and perform quantitative analysis.
  • At least 2 years of professional experience in a managed health care organization performing data analysis type work.
  • A combination of professional education in the area of Customer Service Administration, such as a relevant Bachelor’s degree, and/or equivalent experience that would provide the knowledge and abilities listed.
  • Software experience in Excel, Word and knowledge of Access and PowerPoint and experience in Customer Service processing systems.

Knowledge of:

  • Benefit knowledge of Medi-Cal .
  • Services, policies, and general responsibilities and requirements/regulations related to the department.
  • General information relevant to professional or administrative responsibilities in the department.

Salary: $60,000.00 /year

description:
Palo Alto Networks is the fastest-growing security company in history and a four-time Gartner Magic Quadrant leader for our innovation and ability to execute. Named best place to work by the Silicon Valley Business Journal, we offer the chance to be part of an important mission: ending breaches and protecting our way of digital life. If you are a motivated, intelligent, creative, and hardworking individual, then this job may be for you!

Do you have proven analytical capabilities, an entrepreneurial spirit and the ability to multi-task and thrive in a fast-paced environment? We are looking for a results-oriented person with proven data analytics or business intelligence experience to help expand our recruiting analytics team. As the Data Analyst, you will have the opportunity to impact a wide range of initiatives across the business, both domestically and internationally. As we continue to grow rapidly, operational best practices, standards, and viability in providing the business analytics for HR are more important than ever to help sustain and maximize that growth in the most efficient way possible. You will act as a team partner to build a meaningful and engaging story that will influence and impact our business decisions.

The Data Analyst will work closely with the Manager of Business Intelligence and Analytics to help build the strategy behind scaling our talent acquisition analytics partnerships globally. Working to analyze and make recommendations to all levels of the business, including leadership, this role requires an individual with a passion for consumer service, excellent analytical abilities, and strong business acumen. This person will need to influence internal and external stakeholders, and use data to autonomously make key strategic business decisions that impact the business. The successful candidate will be comfortable with ambiguity, have strong attention to detail, and be motivated by a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment. Palo Alto Networks moves fast and we put our own spin into every area of the business – we need somebody knowledgeable that will move fast, act with grit, and adapt to take advantage of our internal capabilities while bringing in additional, outside expertise.

A successful candidate will have demonstrated the ability to
manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously with high attention to detail.
use data to analyze assumptions quantitatively and develop business cases.
think strategically, persuade stakeholders effectively, and execute methodically and autonomously.
quickly recommend, develop, and deliver contextual, actionable recommendations based on the synthesis and analyses of findings.
hit the ground running and act with high integrity to drive projects to completion through seen and unforeseen challenges.
communicate and collaborate with skills that enable you to earn trust up, down, and across the company.
identify risks and opportunities, brainstorm innovative solutions, and drive actions to quick resolution.

Responsibilities will include
managing ad hoc projects, as well as defining and delivering ongoing dashboards, reports, and metrics to provide actionable insights and inform talent acquisition strategy.
analyzing and interpreting trends and patterns in complex data sets that may be disparate and/or unstructured.
identifying areas of improvement, performing business analysis, offering potential solutions, such as new business processes, training methods or technology changes, and delivering subsequent results.
cleaning, transforming, validating, and modeling data to understand and drive business/performance results.
designing audience-specific reports and tools with consideration of visualization principles in order to share data in an intuitive manner.
establishing data extraction and usage strategies, along with working collaboratively to drive system readiness for execution.
developing and maintaining reporting standards and criteria, including responsibility for data and reporting integrity out to the business.

Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Business, or a related field is required
3+ years of experience required in related positions requiring strategic analysis
Strong analytical execution with an unprecedented degree of thoroughness, accuracy, and focus on both data cleanliness and integrity
Dedicated consideration to a project’s details, in terms of both numerical data as well as presentation precision and aesthetics
Prior usage of BI and analytics tools required; Tableau, Alteryx, APIs, and SAP Hana are preferred
Technical and business communication (oral and written) skills, particularly in writing well-reasoned and data-driven proposals
Thrives in a fast-paced environment and comfortable working collaboratively
Resourceful and takes initiative; able to solve problems in creative ways and understand which necessary stakeholders to involve

Learn more about Palo Alto Networks here and check out our fast facts
title: Data Analyst, People Analytics

description:
Be a part of the CalAtlantic Group, where building the dream of home from coast to coast is our focus. Our culture is established from strong leadership and dynamic teams across the country driven to become the preferred builder of our customers. As the nation’s fourth largest residential homebuilder, CalAtlantic Homes proudly operates in 17 states serving 41 major markets. As a talented organization with a long proven history of success, CalAtlantic provides you the opportunity to join this outstanding team in the new home industry.

Experienced Data Analyst/SQL Report Writer. The Data Analyst/SQL Report Writer is responsible for projects from design development to implementation with key focuses on SQL based report, dashboard development and supporting documentation. Provide Data Analytics for end to end business needs; Sales, Operations, Product, Marketing, and Finance.

The Data Analyst/SQL Report Writer is responsible for gathering, reviewing, understanding, interpreting the data. In addition, they will be documenting data and reporting requirements, project planning, management, execution, training, and quality assurance. Maintenance and modification of existing reports is also required.

Responsibilities Job Responsibilities:
  • Report Writer / Data Analytics
  • Identify report data requirements and create comprehensive technical design specifications.
  • Gather, inspect, clean, transform, and model data with the goal of discovering useful information, suggesting conclusions, and supporting decision-making
  • Collaborate with key stakeholders to produce and support custom built reports and dashboards using SSRS
  • Design and develop high quality, high performing data SQL queries.
  • Use SQL skills including creation of user defined functions, complex stored procedures, query optimization and SQL scripts
  • Provide accurate estimates for development timelines
  • Identify any shortcomings or system errors and make recommendations for improvement
  • Assist with Test Planning; Coordinate user acceptance testing
  • Develop test scenarios and use cases as required/requested
  • Involved with training as necessary
  • Responsible for getting process owner sign off
  • Report to the Analytics / Business Intelligence Lead

Qualifications Job Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Management Information Systems/Computer Science or equivalent work experience
  • 2+ years of general reporting experience. * Strong knowledge and experience in relational database concepts, design, constraints, stored procedures, functions, and optimization
  • Expertise with SQL Server Databases and SQL Server Reporting Services. * Expertise with Microsoft SSIS (data cleansing) or SSRS (or equivalent)
  • Proficient with Excel and pivot tables, charts, dashboards
  • Expertise in working with data in Microsoft Access, Excel and DB2 iSeries SQL
  • Strong organizational and prioritization skills with exceptional attention to detail
  • Ability to communicate effectively to all levels of management
title: Data Analyst/SQL Report Writer

description:
Legal Data Analyst, Product Liability

Team works remotely in USA

6 month contract

Lex Machina provides Legal Analytics to companies and law firms, enabling them to craft successful strategies, win cases, and close business. We are a cutting edge company based in Menlo Park, CA. Following our mission to be the most trusted source of litigation data, Lex Machina provides corporate leaders, attorneys, and policy makers with valuable empirical data and analytics that promote informed decision making and bring transparency to litigation. We launched Lex Machina for patent litigators and are now expanding Legal Analytics to all areas of the law including employment, commercial, bankruptcy and product liability litigation.

Role and Responsibilities

Lex Machina is hiring full-time, short-term legal data analysts for four new legal data projects running March through to September 2017 . The projects involve annotating product liability, bankruptcy, employment or commercial litigation, and each analyst will focus on one practice area.

You may work remotely and hours are flexible, 30-40 hours a week. Legal Data Analysts are expected to commit to the project for its full duration.

Qualifications


Qualifications

A law degree (JD) is required. 2+ years litigation experience, a passion for law and enthusiasm for building new datasets are preferred. The job requires familiarity with civil procedure and a capacity to confidently analyze litigation data especially case resolutions, dispositive rulings, damages and remedies. Practice area knowledge is important.

The North American Research Solutions business of LexisNexis serves the information and workflow needs in the U.S. and Canada for professionals in the legal, government, corporate and academic markets using cutting-edge search technology. Legal and Business professionals rely on expansive LexisNexis® content and tools to make better informed decisions and achieve better outcomes in the practice of law and in managing their businesses.

description:
Behind every patient success is the dedication of a unique team of skilled and talented individuals who help make the Keck Medical Center of USC one of region’s premier medical facilities.

As a member of the USC health care team, you will help build upon the university’s exceptional expertise in patient care as well taking advantage of our excellent compensation package that could include shift and weekend differentials, online rewards-based scheduling, and generous educational benefits.

Come be a part of a world-class health care facility and an important member of the Trojan family.
The Pharmacy Business Analyst is responsible for pharmacy systems and outcomes in the following areas: 1) supply chain analysis, product procurement & selection, inventory control, reporting, 2) 340B Program analysis, monthly reporting, dispensing patterns, inventory process, contract pharmacy optimization, 3) billing processes, charge master maintenance, 4) information support systems/technology development. As a member of the Pharmacy team, collaborates with the team to plan, organize and operate the department to achieve unit and organizational goals, meet customer needs and assure high quality services and products.

Requirements
Minimum Education:
- College graduate in a health related field required; advanced degree preferred.

Minimum Experience/Knowledge:
- Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology, Finance, Business, or Accounting or four years’ equivalent experience.

- Experience: Financial operations and/or pharmacy operations experience in healthcare environment at a 340B covered entity preferred. Demonstrated expertise in pharmacy informatics and technology development and ability to work with teams to achieve specific results.

- Knowledge: This position requires a high degree of specialized knowledge in informatics and technology with an emphasis on 340B split billing, charge master databases, and information systems. Provides a health system coordination function required to assure security and regulatory compliance across all care sites. Applies a high degree of analytical, interpretive and evaluative skills, frequently dealing with complex concepts and imaginative approaches to problem definition and resolution. Project management expertise and complex system oversight key job accountability.

- Special Skills/Equipment: Demonstrated competencies in the use of information support systems, automated technologies and analytical tools in a health care setting and the ability to synthesize operational flow into a concrete work plan, with implementation oversight a critical component of this role. Proficient in Microsoft Office (namely Excel). Technical expertise regarding data models audit processes and database design development. Experience in data mining techniques and procedures and knowing when to use appropriately.

-
Required License/Certification:
- A Fire and Safety card must be presented upon hire or must be obtained at our facility within the first 30 days of hire and maintained by renewing before expiration date.

The University of Southern California values diversity and is committed to equal opportunity in employment.

description:
First Republic Bank is seeking a Data Analyst to join the Digital Analytics team within the Digital Channels department. Digital Analytics was established to deliver analysis, data interpretation, and reporting to support key initiatives and strategic decision-making in Digital Channels. Digital Analytics is responsible for measuring the success of the bank’s digital offering and responsible for identifying and helping to prioritize enhancements to the website and Mobile Banking App.

Responsibilities:
  • Create and maintain dashboards in Adobe Analytics platform.
  • Perform analysis to measure the success of website enhancements, and present findings to the project team.
  • Produce reports that are accurate, intuitive, actionable, and reports are distributed on a timely basis.
  • Regular communication with product managers, UX designers, Mobile App team, and online marketing team to understand their business questions and key initiatives in order to deliver insightful reports and analysis
  • Perform proactive and reactive analyses to ensure data integrity. Review reports, identify unexpected variances or inconsistencies, and bring them to light. Identify issues and help develop and implement solutions.
  • Serve as a subject matter expert on customer and web analytics; stay abreast of industry best practices, new tools, innovations, and new opportunities. Advocate the importance of analytics and measurement.
  • Assist in making continuous improvements to Adobe Analytics tool implementation (i.e. develop new custom metrics and tagging strategies, etc.)
  • Create and present data and recommendations to key stakeholders

Qualifications:
  • Minimum 5 years of data analysis experience; minimum 2 years within Financial Services industry
  • Past work experience in digital/web analytics is a must
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail/accuracy
  • Recent experience with Adobe Analytics
  • Tag Management and website optimization (A/B testing) experience is a plus
  • Experience with data visualization best practices
  • Experience in developing metrics, conducting analysis, and implementing new measurement solutions.
  • Experience using SQL is a plus
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Strong planning and organizational skills. Able to handle multiple priorities and effectively meet deadlines.
  • Ability to work autonomously
  • Strong team player – Ability to collaborate effectively with team members across the organization.
  • High standard of excellence, results-oriented, and creative thinker
title: Contract Role: Reporting Analyst, Digital Analytics

description:
The Clinical Data Analyst/LVN is responsible for, as a Clinical Data Analyst, accurately analyzing, abstracting and compiling data from patient's medical record and/or audit tool for use by hospital committees. Manage data as it is received into the Quality Management Department and develop reports and analyze data for the department. This individual is also responsible for assisting in the management and maintenance of investigations of events including physician peer review and regulatory compliance in the Quality database. Must work effectively in a collaborative environment throughout the organization. Provides ongoing collaboration of accurate reports for committees and supports. As an LVN, Provides ongoing follow-up assessment and intervention as directed under the supervision of the registered nurse. Fosters a collaborative working relationship within and outside of the department.

Minimum 2 years experience in Quality or Bachelor's degree OR equivalent combination of experience and education. CA LVN LICENSE. Data analysis and data collection experience preferred. Two years acute care nursing experience as an LVN preferred.

Ability to demonstrate respect for people in ethical and courteous behavior, be an active, effective team member and a team leader. Ability to accept supervision and guidance and work cooperatively with others. Ability to follow regulations of the Hospital pertaining to job performance, behavior and patient care. Ability to be flexible in meeting the need of varying situations. Ability to comply with Mercy Hospital's standards of personal hygiene, grooming and uniform dress. Ability to maintain continuing education requirements for licensure. Good organizational, interpersonal, oral and written communication skills required. Demonstrated ability to function independently with a high level of initiative. Demonstrated ability to cope with complex and sensitive situations using excellent judgment and tact. Must have good systems aptitude, analytical and organizational skills, excellent verbal and written communications skills, and demonstrated ability to work as part of a team. Able to demonstrate problem solving by applying common sense understanding. Ability to exemplify good interpersonal and facilitation skills. Must have internet knowledge for research purposes. Computer knowledge, MS word and Excel. Excellent communication skills required to write letter, and / or communicate verbal explanations to managers, and employees. Must be able t read, write and speak English. Computer skills are required.

CA LVN Required

About Us:
Sponsored by the Sisters of Mercy , Mercy Hospitals of Bakersfield is a member of Dignity Health and has served Bakersfield and the surrounding Communities for more than 100 years.

Mercy has two campuses in Bakersfield to meet the needs of the growing community. The Truxtun Campus , located at 2215 Truxtun Avenue, Bakersfield, CA 93301 was founded in 1910 by the Sisters of Mercy. This acute care hospital in the downtown area and is licensed for 194 beds. The Truxtun Campus offers a full range of services including medical/ surgical care, emergency services, intensive care, peri-operative and ambulatory services. This facility employs over 1,000 people.

The Southwest Campus located at 400 Old River Road, Bakersfield, CA 93311 was built in 1992 and is the only acute care hospital in Bakersfield west of the 99 Freeway. This 78-bed hospital also offers a full range of services including emergency services, obstetrics and women's care, medical/surgical care, and orthopedic services. In 2009, the Orthopedic and Hand Center opened offering comprehensive orthopedic services to the community. This facility employs over 400 people.

Area consumers consistently select Mercy Hospitals of Bakersfield as their Hospital of Choice. SOME MAJOR BENEFITS AT MERCY HOSPITALS OF BAKERSFIELD

FREE health insurance premiums for you and your dependents

Paid life insurance

Tuition Reimbursement

Retirement and Pension Plans

Paid time off for vacation and holidays

Mercy Hospital and Mercy Southwest Hospitals are smoke-free facilities.

Incentive Bonus Potential for Management

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status. title: CLINICAL DATA ANALYST / LVN - QUALITY MANAGEMENT - FULL TIME

description:
We are looking for a passionate data analyst to help shape the best consumer virtual reality experience. You will be working closely with designers, marketing, sales, production, engineering, and product management to bring insight into Jaunt’s core consumer offerings.

A strong candidate offers a data driven perspective, analytical skills and enjoys opportunities to provide meaningful insights that can drive product and business decisions. The ideal candidate has outstanding analytical and technical skills, business acumen, time management, and the ability to synthesize and communicate information clearly. Additionally, an ideal candidate can demonstrate a strong ownership mentality, experience and desire to work in a fast-paced environment, and is passionate about VR.

Jaunt is a fully-funded venture-backed tech company based in Palo Alto, CA. We are building an end-to-end solution for creating and distributing cinematic virtual reality experiences. We have developed an integrated suite of hardware and software to produce and deliver the highest-quality immersive content across multiple platforms.

Responsibilities:
  • Proactively analyze consumer usage data to deliver insights required for sound business decision-making
  • Support the development of analytics for first- and third-party content creators and publishing partners
  • Lead multi-variate experimentation
  • Provide reporting and performance monitoring to the apps and business groups
  • Develop dashboards, visualizations and granular datasets
  • Find and implement efficiencies through the automation of repetitive tasks
Basic Qualifications:
  • 3+ years of data analyst experience in consumer mobile and web products
  • Excellent SQL skills, data modeling, and data warehousing experience
  • Good understanding of statistical analysis, and preferred experience with statistical packages such as R, MATLAB, SPSS, SAS, Stata.
  • Comfortable manipulating and analyzing large complex data sets from numerous sources.
  • Strong passion for entertainment and creating fun, compelling user experiences
  • Outstanding written/oral skills to properly communicate and report business insights.
  • Able to work in a fast-paced environment and managed multiple projects.
  • Enjoy working in both individual and team dynamics
  • B.S. or B.A. in Math, Statistics or other technical field required
Preferred Qualifications:
  • CS Background/ Masters Degree a plus.
  • Highly developed skills in data visualization
  • Periscope experience is a plus.
title: Data Analyst - Consumer Apps & Content

description:
Technology company seeks an individual who can think, eat, and breathe data. This person is responsible for understanding, cleansing, interpreting, and analyzing data for internal processing. Reporting to the Manager of Data and Analysis — has exposure throughout the organization. High-energy, spirited, and creative individuals encouraged to apply.

*Job Description and Responsibilities*

Essential duties and responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

  • Support multiple audit projects with including data integrity checking, data classification, compiling “In Take” statistics, and data normalization
  • Demonstrated ability to take unknown data sets and provided context, identify anomalies, and create actionable insights to support the business
  • Work with business to prepare the input data sets for systematic processing and reporting.
  • Work with business and supervisor to design and develop ad - hoc and standard reports to meet audit discovery, decision support, and management reporting needs.
  • Program data import, data analysis, data export, and reporting applications with Microsoft Access Database.
  • Demonstrate skills and knowledge of relational database management system, e.g. Microsoft Access Database, Oracle Database Server, and others.
  • Prepare supporting documentation on data import, data normalization, and data export processes.
  • Prepare and maintain process and procedure documentation.
  • Work continuously to improve efficiency and repeat-ability of processes and procedures.

Other Skills and Abilities :

  • Solid understanding of data analysis best practices
  • Driven to develop analytic and technical capabilities working with large and varied datasets
  • Ability to plan tasks in a logical and achievable manner.
  • Ability to summarize, conclude, and report on analytical results in both tabular and graphical formats.
  • Ability to work under minimal supervision, has initiative, and can manage several simultaneous projects.
  • Ability to work through problems and develop creative solutions
  • Python, VB, or similar helpful
  • Familiarity with IBM Infosphere, Tableau, SharePoint

*Education and Experience*

  • Bachelor’s Degree (BS/BA) in Business Information Systems, Business Administration, Marketing, Statistics, Computer Science, or similar is preferred.
  • At Least three years experiences working with/supporting enterprise data interrogation, analytics, or reporting environments.
  • Insurance/Financial Products industry experiences preferred.
  • Ability to use advanced features throughout the Microsoft Office Suite (i.e. pivot tables, functions, data imports)
  • 4+ years data manipulation with Oracle or other large relational database
  • 4+ years actively using SQL

Job Type: Full-time

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • Data Analyst: 5 years
  • Repoting or Business Analysis: 5 years
  • SQL: 4 years
title: Business Data Analyst

description:
POSITION OBJECTIVE:

The Data Analyst position assists with the management of data with Kedren. The Data Analyst is accountable for aspects of data management, including: documentation and tracking of data, graphical display, reporting and integrity of data reports.

DUTIES INCLUDE BUT NOT LIMITED TO:

  • Perform quantitative and qualitative analysis of data in order to produce business intelligence reports, performance charts, graphs and other reports, and develop and present healthcare data analytical solutions
  • Extract, update, and interpret medical data from a variety of databases/sources and transform it into intelligent, actionable reports
  • Analyzes and reports data related to various operational metrics in order to make recommendations for operational process improvements to senior management

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Knowledge of health care systems and healthcare compliance required; knowledge of community health care, Federally Qualified Health Centers, Medicaid and Medicare, and HRSA strongly preferred
  • Experience with data analysis and interpretation required; experience with Access, Excel, or other statistical packages preferred.
  • Familiarity with principles and practices of quality management strongly preferred.
  • High degree of computer literacy required, including ability to learn new software and systems.

At Kedren we Value Workforce Diversity AND EOE M/F/D/V.

title: Data Analyst

description:
Supports business decisions by providing quantitative and qualitative data analysis and reporting of patterns, insights, and trends to decision-makers. Produces actionable reports that show key performance indicators, identify areas of improvement into current operations, and display root cause analysis of problems. Responsible for performing analysis of various data sources and structures in support of Business and IT teams.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Collects and aggregates data from multiple internal and external sources for the analyses to drive insights into business performance.
• Utilizes strong database skills to work with large, complex data sets
• Transforms unstructured or ambiguous data into usable data sets that can be analyzed to extract insights and improve business processes
• Collaborates with appropriate parties within the organization to integrate new data sources into our existing data infrastructure

Provides quantitative and qualitative data analysis and reporting of patterns, insights, and trends to decision-makers
• Collaborates with team members across the organization to identify and understand business problems and processes
• Develops analytical and reporting solutions to solve business problems and extract insights
• Develops and supports enterprise-wide strategies, processes, and standards for business intelligence and reporting
• Collaborates in cross-functional teams to implement analytical solutions
• Presents analysis effectively to audiences across the organization

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Math, Economics, or Computer Science plus 2 years technical experience in analytics, data science, actuarial or equivalent quantitative field or Master’s degree in similar quantitative field.

Strong analytical and problem solving skills. Ability and willingness to continuously acquire new knowledge (business domain knowledge, expertise with software, etc.). Ability to communicate effectively, especially in a cross-functional team setting. Ability to effectively present analysis to ICW staff and external audiences. Ability to multi-task effectively and work well with others in a team environment.

Proficiency in SQL. Experience with SAP Business Objects BI tools (Webi, Crystal, Explorer, Dashboards, etc.). Knowledge of statistical modeling and machine learning techniques preferred but not required. Experience programming in R and/or Python preferred but not required. Exposure to a data visualization tool such as Tableau is preferred but not required. Familiarity with business operations in the property casualty insurance industry is preferred, but not required.
title: Data Analyst

description:
At HouseCanary, we’re using data and analytics to predict the future of real estate. Our goal is to help people make better real estate decisions by offering an unparalleled level of insight and transparency. HouseCanary platforms forecast property values at a local level, and every month, we forecast 36 months into the future. Across all markets, our models explain more than 95% of the past variability in price.

We're seeking a passionate Data Analyst to help continue building the most powerful dataset in real estate.

What you'll do:
  • Apply expertise in quantitative and business analysis to reach actionable insights and drive decision making
  • Collaborate with engineering, product and data science teams to identify needs and solve problems
  • Ensure the quality of all data flowing into and out of our systems
  • Develop key business reporting and marketing analytics
What you have:
  • 3+ years experience in quantitative analysis
  • Advanced level SQL knowledge
  • Exposure to large datasets
  • Experience with Python
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Collaborative and proactive personality
  • Ability to work through ambiguity and deal with shifting priorities
Bonus points for knowledge of:
  • Real estate markets
  • Predictive modeling
  • Pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn
  • Hadoop
HouseCanary builds products that use data and predictive models to help others make better real estate decisions. There is over $33 trillion in residential real estate in the US, but the data and tools available to builders, investors and appraisers to help them understand the market are lacking when compared to other fields.

HouseCanary empowers clients to make better real estate decisions by providing products that leverage the best real estate forecasts, data and visualization tools around - ours. We track thousands of data elements every month, from national factors down to house-level data to pinpoint the driving factors behind market change. Together, we have built the most exhaustive proprietary dataset going back 40+ years.

description:
Pharmacy Data Analyst – Programs
  • Long Beach, CA
  • Full Time
About SCAN

Our mission is simple: Keeping Seniors Healthy and Independent–that’s been our mission for almost 40 years. Rated as one of the top Medicare Advantage plans in California, SCAN Health Plan employees are passionate about what they do. Understanding that success is based on achieving the mission, SCAN employees are afforded with the training and tools necessary to do their jobs and they are rewarded for their efforts and recognized as experts in their fields. Ask anyone who works here and we’ll proudly tell you that SCAN’s commitment has never wavered. We are as steadfast in our pledge to help our members live healthy and independent lives.

The Job

Supports the Pharmacy Clinical Programs team to investigate business questions and identify improvement opportunities by designing appropriate studies, conducting statistical analysis, and developing reports with healthcare data in areas including utilization and quality. Works with Clinical Programs team to prepare standard and ad hoc pharmacy reports, presentations, dashboards, and etc.to help with decision-making, program development, and program implementation.

You Will
  • Performs data extraction and data management from multiple sources.
  • Develops reports and conduct quantitative analysis to understand trends, issues, and/or to identify opportunities to improve quality of care, manages cost, and/or utilization.
  • Pulls membership data based on targeted criteria provided.
  • Design studies to measure clinical program effectiveness, including estimate of sample size to achieve desired power for studies.
  • Selects and applies appropriate analytical approaches and methodology in analysis, produces tables and graphics, and draws conclusion from the analysis.
  • Makes predictions/projections on utilization, cost, and other measures under reasonable assumptions with appropriate statistical methodology.
  • Verifies and ensures the accuracy of programs developed by others.
  • Meets predetermined timeline for projects.
  • Collaborates with staff and leadership across the organization to define, quantify, and present analyses.
  • Full-life cycle activities for pharmacy and medication-use projects and initiatives including designing the project, monitoring the process, collecting the data, analyzing the outcome, and making conclusions and recommendations.
  • Review literature, performs data quality checks, and other related duties incidental to the work described herein.
  • Maintains professional and technical knowledge by reviewing technical specification, conducting research and by attending educational and technological workshops.
  • Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results, as needed.
  • Actively supports the achievement of SCAN’s Vision and Goals.

Your Qualifications
  • Master’s Degree or PhD in statistics, biostatistics, mathematics, or related field, with emphasis on quantitative analysis.
  • 3+ years of experience integrating clinical and healthcare industry knowledge to design and develop utilization and cost analyses.
  • 3+ years of prior managed care experience with Part D at a pharmacy benefit manager or health plan.
  • Experience mining healthcare data, including but not limited to, eligibility, encounters, pharmacy, provider, and financial data.
  • Experience analyzing pharmacy data including, but not limited to, pharmacy claims, prescription drug events (PDE), industry drug databases, and formulary data.
  • Knowledge of CMS Star Rating methodology, HEDIS, and HCC risk adjustment methodology.
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
  • Strong communication skills.
Your Preferred Qualification
  • Proficient in querying relational databases using SAS, SAS - BASE, STAT, or, SQL. Experience with R, s-plus, and/or other data mining tools.
Conditions of Work
  • Office Hours: Monday – Friday 8am to 5pm. Extended working hours as needed.
What's in it for you?
  • A competitive compensation and benefits program
  • An annual employee bonus program
  • Generous paid-time-off (PTO)
  • Ten paid holidays per year
  • Excellent 403(b) Saving Plan, providing up to 4 % match and vesting after three years
  • Casual attire
  • A Work - life balance and much more!

We're always looking for talented people to join our team! Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply now!

SCAN is an equal opportunity employer and it is our policy to abide by all federal, state and local laws prohibiting employment discrimination. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

description:
VaynerMedia is a digital agency that helps Fortune 500 companies tell their stories. Our expertise in strategy, creative, photo and video production, and ad buying yields work that drives actual business results. We day-trade consumer attention, guiding our diverse clientele to focus on the platforms that command the attention of their specific customers, whom we captivate with the highly targeted videos and content we develop. With offices in New York, London, Los Angeles, San Francisco and Chattanooga, TN, we market for the year we live in, we live and breathe emerging technology and we are always growing.

VaynerMedia is seeking a Senior Data Analyst to lead the West Coast analytics practice. This person will balance the standard experience and skills in digital advertising with a comfort in evangelizing the practice among internal and external stakeholders. They will also collaborate frequently with the NYC-based analytics lead of the agency.

The Senior Data Analyst should have experience with/understanding of measuring:
  • Paid media (including ad servers, viewability, and ad fraud)
  • Social media (including platform analytics, listening)
  • Websites (including Google Analytics, ecommerce conversions analysis, and audience profile building).
  • ROI contribution measured by mix models and multi-touch attribution
  • Brand lift surveys
Beyond these hard skills, the Senior Data Analyst will:
  • Serve as the face of analytics for VM-LA in new business pitches, clients, and internal stakeholders
  • Create educational programs for non-technical stakeholders
  • Partner closely with the office managing director and head of new business in matters of process and product
What you should bring to the table:
  • A bachelor's degree or entrepreneurial street cred
  • 3-4 years of experience working with large data sets, quantitatively and/or qualitatively, from initial research through to insights generation
  • 1+ years experience working directly with and presenting to clients
  • 1+ years of managerial experience
  • Experience with statistical software such as R, SQL, SAS, SPSS
  • Familiarity with monitoring tools like Google Analytics, social listening (Netbase, Crimson Hexagon, Brandwatch, etc.) and Simply Measured
  • Experience working in the agency/start-up/social space, working in statistical and data analysis is a big plus

description:
Founded in 2011, Manage is a performance DSP that helps marketers connect with consumers through in-app mobile advertising. Our clients include leading apps such as Uber and Lyft, brands and agencies, helping them achieve their mobile marketing goals. Core to our company is a mobile marketing platform featuring proprietary algorithms, a machine-learning bidding engine and high performance architecture. We reach billions of consumers worldwide, and access over 40 billion ad impression opportunities daily.

Headquartered in Mountain View, CA, Manage was named one of the Best Places to Work in the Bay Area for 2015 by the San Francisco Business Times and Silicon Valley Business Journal. We are a startup with flat organization structure where team members can have huge areas of ownership and authority. We are looking for smart, driven team players who can help us get things done.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join the team. Candidates should be naturally curious, detailed oriented, have a sharp analytical mind, are good with SQL, can write scripts and have the ability to communicate complex concepts with technical and non-technical people alike.

Responsibilities:
  • Work with various groups within the company to understand business needs, provide relevant data, and in-depth analysis
  • Write complex SQL queries to pull and process data from multiple data sources
  • Create dashboards to help business keep track of important metrics
  • Provide ad hoc and regular reports on key business metrics
  • Write scripts to automate repetitive tasks
Qualifications:
  • BS/MS in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, or other highly quantitative field
  • 1-3 years of practical experience in SQL querying large and complex data sets
  • Experience in Excel including pivot tables and common functions
  • Proficiency in Python, PHP, or other scripting languages as well as proven ability to work with large data sets
  • Strong communication and client-facing data presentation skills
  • Proven ability to learn quickly, work independently, and adapt to change in a fast-paced environment
Bonus:
  • Experience with Hadoop, MapReduce, and other scalable architecture
  • Experience in tools such as Pandas, R, etc.
  • Experience with BI/reporting tools such as Tableau
  • Previous internet/mobile industry experience
title: Data Analyst

description:
Prezi is looking for Senior Data Analyst with a passion for working with web, marketing, sales, product, and user behavioral data to help define strategy, guide operations and KPIs, and impact how we build experiences and products that empower our users to be the best communicators in the world.

Prezi.com is a top global web site (#419 in US per Alexa rank, Oct 2016), with over 75 million registered users, and hundreds of millions of user prezis created. So, we have data and scale where data can really matter in helping us decide on many things. And, we are pretty good at using data, but want to be world class.

Our data engineering team and infrastructure is modern and robust. We use mainstream tools such as hiive, Pig, Python, R, Bash, Git, Hadoop, AWS’s EC2, EMR, and Redshift. Our data engineering team is in Budapest. So, our San Francisco based Analysts need to be very self sufficient. In return, the analysts are deeply engaged in meaningful operations and discussions with product, marketing, and sales/support teams.

We are looking for a special person that can join our team to 1) help our internal clients be world class in using data, and 2) who loves working across the data analytics process of building pipelines, managing data sets, developing impactful analyses and models, and improving business operations and strategy.

Challenges and responsibilities

  • Help key clients of Marketing, Sales, Support with analytical strategies and operations
  • Be self starter on creating with clients the right analytics roadmap
  • Understand our business deeply (customer acquisition, sales, support, user experience)
  • Work with senior managers in critical operations, provide input on key decisions for our business
  • Deploy techniques such as A/B testing, user segmentation, price elasticity testing, and when warranted predictive modeling to solve complex challenges
  • Create the necessary dashboards and reports for your clients, and provide insights into emerging patterns and trends. Work at fast pace with large (10TB++) data sets.
  • Comfortable working in a highly changing web driven technology company.
  • Create and manage your data on top of our data infrastructure. You have to love doing it all.
Requirements

  • 5+ years of experience in data/business analytics with bigger datasets (Internet, banking, telecommunication)
  • Wants to be part of a global team, willing to travel to Budapest on occasion
  • Great with comprehensive statistical analyses:
  • basic statistical methodology: eg. A/B testing, clustering
  • predictive modelling: eg. decision trees, regressions
  • proficient in at least one statistical software: R, Rapidminer, SPSS, SAS, MATLAB or similar
  • Proficiency in data transformation: SQL and Python or any other scripting language is a must
  • Experience working with large data sets 10TB++
  • Experience working with Log files, and WebGL technologies, both structure and un-structured.
  • Knowledge of SDLC / Agile Methodology. Development best practices.
  • Experience creating and maintaining ETL pipelines, job schedulers.
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Math, Physics or related areas
We work with these technologies

  • SQL, Hive, Spark, Pig, Python, R, Chartio, Bash, Git, Kafka
  • Amazon Web Services: EC2, EMR, Redshift

description:
Come Work at HJF!
HJF is seeking a Data Analyst to provide research support for the Recruit Assessment Program, a large epidemiologic research project located at the Naval Health Research Center (NHRC) in San Diego, CA.
Provides routine and non-routine statistical/analytical support for the department/division to enhance operating efficiency; exercises independent judgment in the resolution of analytical problems.

Responsibilities:
  • Designs and manages numerous research projects simultaneously.
  • Designs requirements for research databases as well as conduct analyses.
  • Maintains a data warehouse for the DoD Center.
  • Performs data manipulations and statistical analyses using SAS.
  • Writes reports and scientific manuscripts for peer-reviewed professional journals.
  • Develops budget recommendations for statistical DoD Center support.
  • Reviews and remains current with technical and scientific literature in biostatistics.
  • Performs analytical and statistical work to include multivariable logistic regressions using survey data and Cox proportional hazard modeling.
  • May direct work assignments. Prepares and presents informal and formal briefings at various international, national, and military activities.
  • Reviews and assesses the work of other professionals in own field. Contributes to the team effort by accomplishing related duties as needed
Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
  • Advanced knowledge of epidemiology.
  • Knowledge of basic disease etiologies and preventive strategies.
  • Advanced knowledge of survey methods and statistical methods used to collect and interpret survey data.
  • Skill in use of word processing, spreadsheet, graphic, email, and database software.
  • Skill in writing memorandums, correspondence, abstracts, articles, and proposals.
  • Ability to plan and prioritize work.
  • May require the ability to supervise and direct work assignments.
  • Ability to make presentation to groups.
  • Ability to be a self-starter and work both independently and in teams.
  • Ability to interface with investigators, vendors, research staff, and study participants.
  • Sample survey analysis experience, creating weights, using PROC SURVEYSELECT, PROC SURVEYLOGISTIC
Minimum Education/Training Requirements: This position requires a Master’s degree in Public Health or related field plus 4-6 years related experience.
Physical Capabilities: Walking, standing, must be able to read reports, labels and use computer, must be able to hear well enough to communicate with coworkers, must be able to write, type, and use phone system
Clearance: If a security clearance is not active upon hire, the candidate must be able to obtain a security clearance of secret for this position. Candidates will access DoD databases that have classified information.
Work Environment: Normal office working conditions
Any qualifications to be considered as equivalents, in lieu of stated minimums, require the prior approval of the Director of Human Resources
HJF is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

The ICT Data Analyst is responsible to research, design, support and provide expert consultation for enterprise reporting, BI software and systems including integration with databases and data warehouses. SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITY REQUIREMENTS * Experience with ERP systems and commercial data concepts * Advance SQL skills (complex querying capabilities) * Proficient SQL Reporting Services, ODBC, MS Access, and MS Excel and/or equivalent data capture/reporting tools * Experience performing ETL, Data Validation, Data Mapping, Data Migration * Excellent analytical and problem solving capabilities with special attention to accuracy and detail * Self-starter with a proven ability to take ownership of job responsibilities and ensure successful completion of all projects and requests * Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to interface effectively with all levels of management, including executive and senior management teams * Ability to effectively prioritize and multi-task in high volume workload situations

title: Data Analyst

description:
The Research Data Analyst will work as a member of the Violence Prevention Research Program (VPRP) research team. The collaborative work will be concerned initially with a large cluster-randomized trial of unique law enforcement intervention designed to prevent firearm violence. This position will serve as a coordinator for this study working under the supervision of Dr. Wintemute. Duties will include study and analysis plan design; data acquisition, management, maintenance, and linkage; statistical and epidemiological data analysis; interpretations of results; literature review; manuscript, presentation, report, IRB protocol, and proposal preparation; and liaison with investigators at other institutions and staff at the California Department of Justice and National Institute of Justice. The Analyst will also perform other duties related to project coordination and administration as assigned.--Experience with scientific manuscript writing and data analysis in an academic or research setting.
--Experience programming, managing and analyzing data using statistical software such as SAS, R or Stata.
--Advance understanding of principles of epidemiological study design and execution and of statistical data analysis.
--Master's or doctoral degree in epidemiology, biostatistics, public health or related field.
--Experience with MS Access, Excel, SharePoint, or related database management software.
--Experience obtaining, managing and/or analyzing large datasets for multidisciplinary research projects.
--Ability to work independently and collaboratively, making significant creative contributions, with a multidisciplinary group of researchers and staff.
--Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills appropriate to project coordination responsibilities.
--Experience with GIS methods to examine spatiotemporal patterns of events under study preferred.
--Experience with hypothesis-driven data analysis, including linear and logistic regression and non-parametric regression preferred.

description:
Would you like to join one of the fastest growing startups in the world? Talkdesk - a 2016 Forbes Cloud 100 Company - is the world’s leading cloud-based contact center software provider. We have awesome investors (DFJ, Salesforce Ventures and Storm Ventures), are in a $22B market that is ripe for disruption and boast an impressive roster of customers including Shopify, Box, Anki, DoorDash, Edmunds and Qualys. We’re looking for a world-class data analyst to help us continue on our hyper-growth trajectory and shape the future of Talkdesk.

You believe that any modern company cannot succeed in today’s business environment without properly utilizing data to make decisions and inform strategy. You consider data to be a company’s greatest asset and you are passionate about turning that asset into tangible value. You thrive in a data-driven organization and evangelize the use of data - fully integrating data into how departments and teams operate. You have both the technical skills to partner with our Engineering teams as well as the business acumen to identify and influence the key drivers of company growth and product success.

Talkdesk is looking for whole-brained problem-solvers to join our Analytics team. The right candidate will enjoy the challenge of delivering impactful analyses, streamlining business processes (or creating new ones where needed), and building a data-driven culture at a high-growth startup.

Responsibilities

  • Champion the use and application of data and analytics across the company
  • Partner with different departments (e.g. Sales, Success, Marketing, Business Operations, Product, etc.) to produce insights as an internal data consultant
  • Identify strategic opportunities, areas of improvement, and best practices within the team and across the organization
  • Design clever data models that balance the diverse, specific needs of various business stakeholders with general principles of flexibility and extensibility
  • Collaborate with Engineering to collect and process data, develop business tools, and enable new insights
  • Establish data governance by setting standards for the consistent definition and application of metrics
Requirements
------------

  • 2 or more years of experience in a Data Insights, Data Analytics, Data Science or Business Analytics role
  • Proficiency in SQL (Postgres preferred, but not required)
  • Formidable Excel or R skills
  • Experience with business intelligence tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau)
  • Expertise with statistical analyses and concepts (e.g. regressions, experiment design, etc.)
  • Background in handling very large (1TB+) data sets (optional, but highly preferred)
  • Strategically-minded yet detail-oriented
  • Excellent interpersonal communication and presentation skills
  • BA/BS degree in a related field (Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Engineering)

title: Sr. Data Analyst

description:
– Los Angeles

Data S cience and Analytics team at Tillster is looking for a highly motivated Senior Digital / Optimization Analyst with an emphasis on web site & mobile app optimization. You will be exploring data from multiple tools & sources to find actionable insights and prioritize, recommend & execute strategies working with cross-functional teams & clients to improve and optimize consumer experience and profitability for global restaurant brands in the quick service and casual dining space .

General Profile
You are a rock star digital analyst who is a jack of all trades related to analytics & optimization and a master of a few. You are comfortable with pulling data from multiple data sources, able to analyze data using variety of tools and find interesting actionable insights from the data. You focus on uncovering profitable sources of traffic, increasing conversion rates, improving average order value and finding loyal segments of customers to encourage repeat purchases. You are able to form hypotheses to test based on data and working with cross-functional teams , execute and analyze experiment results . You are able to effectively communicate analyses , visualizations & insights to a broad audience with different levels of data sophistication . You have great presentation skills and have significant client interaction experience. You have a high attention to details and have quick thinking & problem solving skills.

Responsibilities Explore data to find actionable insights through funnel analysis, user segmentation & cohort analysis. Build a backlog of measurable and actionable hypotheses based on customer behavior data and prioritize & execute AB & Multivariate tests for mobile apps and responsive websites. Collaborate with clients, product managers, engineers & UX/UI designers to implement tests & experiments and to present your analyses & recommendations. Develop and present analys e s, actionable insights & recommendations to key stakeholders including senior executives & clients in forums and periodic business review meetings.

Requirements 5 + years of experience in site and app analytics providing customer behavior insights in a data-driven fast growing mobile/web company . Experience in ecommerce analytics is required. 3 + years of managing and executing AB & multivariate tests in optimizing customer experience and behavior using tools such as Maxymiser, Optimizely , Test & Target etc. Expertise in Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager required. Proficiency with at least one visualization tool and/or library e.g. D3, Microsoft Excel, Tableau , R is required. Expertise in writing SQL and understanding of database s & data structures is required. Understanding of digital marketing concepts such as SEO, SEM, social media, email, push notifications strongly preferred. Basic knowledge of s tatistics, probability , controlled experiment & the underlying mathematical concepts strongly preferred . Basic knowledge of JavaScript, CSS & HTML strongly preferred. Experience in p roduct management and/or user experience a big plus. Experience in collecting data from/exposing data to various data sources and services (API, JSON, XML) a big plus . Highly a nalytical and great problem solving skills. Exceptional communication & presentation skills and ability to explain data and analysis to a variety of audience. Self motivation & enjoyment of a fast-paced environment. Bachelor’s degree in quantitative or related field .

About Tillster
Tillster is the global leader in digital ordering and customer engagement solutions. For over a decade we’ve developed revolutionary self-service, ordering and payments solutions – for mobile, tablet, online, kiosk, call center, and more – creating personalized interactions based on consumer preferences, language, and currency. Our platform is compatible with 15+ unique POS systems, representing over 90% coverage in multi-unit restaurants. We offer one platform; one scalable, enterprise class solution – to create world-class digital engagement solutions.

Tillster is proudly an Equal Opportunity Employer
Local Candidates Strongly Preferred
Relocation Assistance Considered
No visa sponsorship
Principals only – no Agencies or calls please

title: Data Analyst

description:
Masimo (NASDAQ: MASI) headquartered in Irvine, California, is a fast-growing and award-winning international medical technology and device company with operations spanning the globe. We develop innovative, noninvasive monitoring technologies that save, extend and improve the lives of people of all ages, in all walks of life. These revolutionary technologies are helping to solve "unsolvable" problems that have plagued the healthcare industry, while taking the pain and discomfort out of blood monitoring. For more than 25 years, innovation has been and will continue to be our passion.

To learn more about us, please visit: www.masimo.com

Job Summary

The Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst, Supply Chain Operations creates and maintains solutions that enable data based decision-making in the organization. The BI Analyst creates recurring and ad hoc reports for the organization’s leadership; develops new BI integrations across business systems; normalizes data between disparate systems; administers the user objects and security permissions within the BI environment; trains users on BI concepts and software; and builds data visualizations that facilitate ease of understanding and distribution of information. Position requires strong initiative to work independently and exercise professionalism, discretion, and independent judgment when acting on behalf of the organization. The incumbent is an expert in system functionality that is required by Supply Chain Operations, and uses this knowledge to define how new system/data/functionality could be incorporated into overall Supply & Operational Planning (S&OP;) processes and new system applications.

Duties & Responsibilities
  • Assists Supply Chain Operations users to analyze and define new/improved processes and resolve issues in accordance with best practices and leveraging appropriate technical tools and applications;
  • System-administers the supply chain operations business intelligence environment. Collaborates, creates and supports company’s Operations Data Warehouse system including:
    • updating and maintaining the integrity of the operational data to enable accurate operational reporting and other management analysis
    • analyzing and implementing new requirements
    • creating, maintaining, generating and/or distributing reports
    • supporting operation users and other internal customers with ad hoc data requests;
    • Establish and maintain BI constants used for data normalization within a single information system and between disparate information systems in the organization.
  • Develops BI integrations between ERP (Expandable), MRP (Rapid Response), Masimo data warehouse and Supply Chain Operations business information systems (ETL: extract, transform, and load) and creates SQL queries and reports for company-wide users from Expandable ERP, Rapid Response MRP and data warehouse;
  • Provides ad hoc reporting requests used in Operational close processes, supply chain management performance reporting and cost reduction activities;
  • Executes test cases to validate expected results;
  • Serves as primary interface between Operations and IS/IT: advocates on behalf of Operations team to obtain support required to implement Supply Chain & Operational Planning systems and tools;
  • Responsible for:
    • Understanding industry standards and best practices and keeping current with industry trends and emerging technologies
    • Understanding and evaluating complex business functions and processes and recommending a comprehensive strategy
    • Overall end-to-end BI system architecture design and planning for supply chain business systems
  • Facilitates meetings, leads discussions and presents to senior management;
  • Develops and provides user training on various key systems and reports;
  • Proactively meets with departments and users to explain BI concepts and reporting solutions and solicits feedback for improvements and new projects.
  • Participates in new IT/IS software selection to assess potential BI integration for Supply Chain Business Systems.
  • Performs other duties or special projects as requested;

Minimum Qualifications:

· Minimum six years’ experience working in Business Intelligence related jobs, such as Business Intelligence System Administer, BI analysist, BI manager, Big Data Analyst, etc..

· Experience with Microsoft Office Excel, Access, Visio, SharePoint and Microsoft Project;

· Expert-level experience in reports development using Microsoft SSAS (Analysis Services), SAP BI or related tool;

· Experience in Business Intelligence, especially in report writing;

· Expert-level experience in relational databases (SQL-Server, etc.) and data warehouse and how they work;

· Strong database query language skills (SQL, T-SQL)

· Experience and knowledge of data architecture design patterns (Star,Vault,Graph,Relational,NoSQL)

· Experience with ETL and data integration using multiple technologies

· Experience architecting, designing and building web-based business intelligence and analytics;

· Strong experience with BI platform administration, including server administration and performance tuning;

· Strong experience with data warehouse, data integration, data virtualization, big data, and ERP/MRP database platforms and systems

· Strong data modeling and analysis for data warehousing, data analytics, and big data

· Expertise in process design and documentation methodologies, and design and production of quality deliverables, process and use case modeling, business case development;

· Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills ( verbal and written);

· Demonstrated ability to manage projects involving a variety of disciplines/business functions;

· Excellent analytical and problem solving skills, critical thinking and attention to detail;

· Excellent organization, communication and project management skills;

· Demonstrated ability to identify opportunities for improvement and drive change throughout the organization;

· Flexibility and adaptability, ability to manage in dynamic business environment with a strong sense of urgency;

· Solid understanding of data flows within business systems;

Preferred Qualifications

· Proficient with systems, database administration, and scripting with software such as Microsoft Access Programming; Microsoft SQL Server; Microsoft Excel; HTML; ASP; Visual Basic 6.0; VBA; SQL; Crystal Reports, a plus;

· Experience having supported Operations team with a strong understanding of Operations data, modeling, and reporting, a plus;

· First hand application & UI (user interface) administration experience working within Kinaxis Rapid Response, a plus;

· Experience in design and developing home growing system before that have been in use for production.

Education
  • ​ Bachelor's or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Information Systems (CIS) or related field preferred

Physical requirements/Work Environment

This position primarily works in an office environment. It requires frequent sitting, standing and walking. Daily use of a computer and other computing and digital devices is required. May stand for extended periods when facilitating meetings or walking in the facilities. Some local travel is necessary, so the ability to operate a motor vehicle and maintain a valid Driver’s license is required.

The physical demands of the position described herein are essential functions of the job and employees must be able to successfully perform these tasks for extended periods. Reasonable accommodations may be made for those individuals with real or perceived disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job described.

We are proud to offer if eligible a highly competitive compensation plan with an excellent benefits package including three weeks vacation, stock options, 401k match, medical, dental, vision plans and much more!

Masimo is an Equal Employment Opportunity Commission / Affirmative Action employer, We encourage Minorities, Females, Disabled and Veterans to apply.

***NO AGENCIES PLEASE*** Thank you!
