title: Data Analyst I

description:
OVERVIEW

tronc (formerly Tribune Publishing) is seeking a Social Media Marketing Data Analyst to join the Digital Audience Development team at our Los Angeles Times location.

In this role, you’ll connect readers with relevant and important content by leveraging robust data and cutting-edge technology. You’ll be the vital bridge between the collection of data and its application, exploring and socializing patterns among our content, audience, and monetization opportunities that maximize the value delivered to readers and to tronc.

The right person for this role is highly analytical, has a track record of translating insights into actions, demonstrates a curious and experimental spirit, and thrives on continual improvement.

Position Highlights:

  • Unique Leader: Well-recognized brand with an innovative, start-up mentality
  • Advancement: Potential to directly impact the success of a growing company (and grow with us, of course!)
  • Drive: In the midst of a revolutionary evolution from national newspaper company to global media organization
  • Growth: Historic portfolio expansion with a core product offering of over 11 award- winning daily titles, 150+ niche publications in 180+ vertical markets, 60+ digital properties, best-in-class digital and marketing services and solutions, etc.

At tronc, we believe in comprehensive rewards packages:

  • Competitive salaries
  • Exciting opportunities with room for growth within the company
  • A competitive insurance package including medical, dental, vision, and life
  • 401(k) with company matching
  • Paid time off
  • Other coordinated discounts/perks

WHAT YOU WILL DO

  • Audience Segmentation : Identify customer cohorts by examining content consumption dashboards and other sources of user data. Describe these cohorts by their content preferences, engagement patterns and monetization opportunities. Recommend valuable cohort discoveries, along with related content and behavioral markers, to colleagues in our Content Optimization and Audience Development groups, so that they may execute organic and paid campaigns to reach these customers in targeted, voluminous and profitable ways.
  • Boosting Content: Identify opportunities to boost valuable and unique pieces of content from our properties. Illustrate the reader segments that would be most likely to benefit from that content, and pair that with other recommendations like ideal channels and times of day to reach those users.
  • Monetization Attainment: Help fulfill monetization opportunities, such as rich advertising campaigns that require specific user targets. Devise content plans that will optimize the ways we reach those users.
  • Experimentation: Coordinate tests that provide even more data about user cohorts’ engagement with our content, expanding our intelligence beyond what usage dashboards report. This work could include understanding how to best write messaging, select accompanying videos and photos, schedule posts, etc. In each case, the Marketing Data Analyst will formulate a hypothesis and test structure, and then collaborate with Content Optimization and Audience Development colleagues on execution.
  • Performance Analysis: For all recommendations above related to customer cohorts, content optimization, monetization opportunities and experimentation, the Marketing Data Analyst will track performance, publish and present detailed results, maintain a library of findings, and answer questions from colleagues.
  • Technology Partnership: Partner with data scientists in the Technology organization on the creation and enhancement of data dashboards. This means the Marketing Data Analyst should seek Technology’s tutelage to fully understand the sources and meanings of data; define requirements to Tech for new data needs; work with Tech on vetting vendors that can provide even more data or easier access; and engage in everyday collaborations to improve our effectiveness.
  • Special Requests: Fulfill ad hoc requests for analyses from tronc colleagues in our Newsrooms, the Content Optimization group and the Audience Development group.

WHAT YOU WILL NEED

  • Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Math, or a Business discipline with a strongly quantitative foundation
  • 2-3 years of experience in an analytical role, with proven ability to translate insights into action
  • Experience with formulating customer cohorts, especially for use by content/social media publishing
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to clearly communicate findings to internal customers
  • Self-starter spirit, comfortable exploring patterns and surfacing meaningful insights from a swell of data without precise direction on what to seek
  • Advanced capabilities in data visualization tools like Tableau and Domo, in Excel, and with statistical methods and software
  • Experience with Adobe SiteCatalyst/Omniture, Google DFP/Analytics/AdWords, or other related traffic/advertising data sources

COMPANY INFORMATION

tronc (formerly Tribune Publishing) is a media company rooted in award-winning journalism, which harnesses proprietary technology to present personalized, premium content to a global audience in real time. tronc draws content from its vast media portfolio, where a commitment to informing and inspiring communities has earned 92 Pulitzer Prizes and a monthly audience of 60 million. From pixels to Pulitzers, tronc brands optimize content and create engaging experiences for audiences across all channels. Learn more at tronc.com/about-us.

At tronc, we believe in fostering growth, learning new skills, and making sure every team member feels valued. If you think you'd be a great fit here, we'd love for you to apply!

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $60,000.00 to $70,000.00 /year

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • Adobe SiteCatalyst/Omniture, Google DFP/Analytics/AdWords: 2 years
  • data visualization tools like Tableau and Domo, Excel, statistical methods and software: 2 years
title: Social Media Marketing Data Analyst

description:
Education Pioneers is currently accepting applications for the EP Fellowship from professionals who want to use their background in data and financial analytics to transform education by helping organizations interpret data and make strategic recommendations.

Education Pioneers is a non-profit that recruits, develops, and connects top professionals to work for K-12 school districts, charter schools, and other education organizations in non-instructional roles. They use their skills to transform education from outside of the classroom to ensure every student has access to opportunities and an excellent education.

The Education Pioneers Fellowship Career Track places talented professions into full-time, permanent roles within the education sector using their existing skills and experiences to make the biggest impact. Fellows participate in leadership development programming alongside a cohort of diverse peers designed to build the mindsets and K-12 knowledge necessary to become a change agent in education.

Position Overview:

Fellows hold various roles depending on their placement. Previous Fellows have:

  • Performed statistical analysis to support leader decision-making
  • Built financial models and developed tools to support data analysis
  • Builtdata visualization tools and dashboards to drive accurate decision making
  • Led financial reporting, budgeting processes, and resource allocation at a school district
  • Promoted data-driven instruction and created sustainable teacher retention strategies

Fellows participate in three months of professional development alongside a cohort of diverse peers, building their K-12 knowledge and mindsets to become a change agent in education. They also receive access to our network of 3,000+ Alumni nationwide. Over 70% of EP Alumni continue to work full-time in education, with 30% serving in senior-level positions

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s Degree required
  • Two years of full time, professional work experience, which excludes undergraduate or graduate internships
  • Authorization to work in the United States on a full-time basis for the entire program (international students eligible only if visa assistance is not required)
  • Commitment to the full program term including the ability to attend workshops and other mandatory aspects of the Fellowship
  • Commitment to Education Pioneers’ mission and values, and a passion for K-12 public education

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience in data analysis, operations, strategy, and project and program management (Professional experience outside of the classroom is strongly preferred)
  • Ability to take initiative and drive results
  • Track record of success in academic and professional settings
  • Strong communication skills to communicate effectively with diverse colleagues and stakeholders
  • Completion of or enrolled in a graduate degree program
  • Knowledge of Tableau, SPSS, STATA, or other data visualization and data management software is a plus
  • Intermediate or advanced knowledge of excel is a plus
  • A willingness and ability to learn new software

Timing & Benefits

Education Pioneers admissions process is highly selective.

The application deadline is May 12th for fall start opportunities (beginning September 2017)

Career Track Fellows salary is commensurate with experience

APPLY today to become a Pioneer and launch your career in education

Placement locations: Chicago, Il | DC Metro Area | Denver, Co | Greater Boston Area | Hartford, CT | Kansas City, MO | Memphis, TN | Nashville, TN | Newark, NJ | New Orleans, LA| New York, NY | San Francisco Bay Area

Education Pioneers believes it is critical for leaders in education to reflect the communities they serve. We actively recruit people of color for our programs. We support equal opportunity for all people and strongly encourage people of color to apply to our Fellowships.

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

title: Data Analyst (Web Analytics)

description:
The Quantitative Sciences Unit (QSU) is an interdisciplinary collaborative statistics unit in the Biomedical Informatics Research Division within the Department of Medicine at Stanford University. The mission of the QSU is to facilitate cutting-edge scientific studies initiated by Stanford investigators by providing expertise in biostatics and informatics, to mentor and educate clinical investigators in research methods and to mentor data scientists. To optimally achieve this mission, the QSU members become fully integrated into individual research teams.

The QSU is seeking a highly motivated, hard-working and professional data scientist to join their team. The successful candidate will join a vibrant team of academic data scientists working on a wide variety of collaborative projects in medicine. Under minimal supervision, the incumbent will perform the most complex technical work associated with a wide variety of analytical data and produce routine, single data sources’ information requests. The incumbent will work closely with senior statisticians to integrate databases for the purpose of creating analytic files, performing quality control and data cleaning, managing data and doing data analysis under supervision of a statistician. This position holds excellent career development opportunities.
title: Data Management Specialist (Data Analyst 2)

description: Recruitment Marketing Manger and Data Analyst
title: Recruitment Marketing Manger and Data Analyst

description:
Summary Statement: Analyzes complex business problems and issues using data from internal and external sources to provide insight to decision-makers. The Analyst will assist in the analysis, planning and execution of key strategic

planning, market management, and sales initiatives including executive reporting and recommendation around new customer acquisition, product bundling, and asset efficiency. This is a great opportunity to flex your analytical horsepower, business acumen, and financial bent to refine and execute a growing medical device company’s international strategic plan.

Keys to Success: Business acumen, international business experience, financial modeling, financial acumen, business forecasting, asset management/efficiency metrics, asset valuation, project management, and effective business plan creation. Medical device experience or MBA a plus. Experience with Tableau and COGNOS a plus.

Key Responsibilities: International Development Decision Support, Planning, & Execution
  • Single point of ownership for international business data collection, analysis, and reporting (excluding standard financial P&L; reporting).
  • Coordinate and manage analytical efforts with Finance, Operations, IT, and Market Managers.
  • Identify and evaluate the key drivers of market success – assess risk, advise go-to-market plan, present alternatives across financial and non-financial parameters
  • Prepare and evaluate written business cases and recommendation/conclusion presentations for new market entry, capital expenditure, annual operating plans, and business development opportunities for review by market management team and NUVA leadership.
  • Provide robust quantitative analysis in support of strategy execution, partnership evaluation, and investment decisioning/prioritization - scenario and sensitivity analysis, discounted cash flow, accretion/dilution analysis, net present value, asset optimization, and asset efficiency metrics.
  • Evaluate, assess and quantify the value of investment and business development opportunities – prepare business cases, build financial models, and highlight financial/operational/strategic/IP risks and opportunities
  • Liaison with NUVA business, product, operational, and market management teams to drive the development of meeting materials and analyses that ensure translation, accountability and alignment across the executive team for prioritization decisions.

Strategy, Market Research & Reporting
  • Develop and own international market intelligence function – external research, reports, data collection and dissemination
  • Perform industry research to highlight opportunities within the company's existing lines of business and identify promising new areas for value creation.
  • Analyze and report out on metrics that guide strategic and operational decisions.
  • Identify key issues and areas of focus to integrate into strategy development.
  • Support annual, quarterly, and monthly compilation of executive reporting for operating mechanisms.

Additional Responsibilities/Requirements: Perform duties in compliance with applicable FDA and state regulations as well as standards including, but not limited to, ISO 13485.

Nature and Scope: Applies in-depth specialty knowledge within subject area to complete assignments of diverse scope; contributes to the development of new plans, models, standards and techniques.

Normally receives little instruction on day-to-day work, general instructions on new assignments.

Leads projects of limited scope; provides training and constructive input to team members.

Solves problems in complicated situations through the application and integration of analytical skills, creativity and judgment.

Adapts communication to accommodate audience diversity and may communicate internally at higher levels.

Impacts business performance and operational efficiency through the delivery of results.

Basic Qualifications
  • Requires a minimum of 5 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 3 years and a Master’s degree; or a PhD without experience; or equivalent work experience.



Preferred Qualifications
  • MBA
  • Strong quantitative skills, financial acumen, financial modeling, and accounting fundamentals
  • Ability to work with and help IT partners refine imperfect data
  • Outstanding professional & personal maturity and strong cultural fit
  • Demonstrated ability to participate in and analyze business development transactions
  • Experience building business cases
  • Proven analytical problem solving skills, with ability to extract “big picture” conclusions & implications from the detail and identify action required.
  • Demonstrated ability to excel in dynamic, demanding and high pressure environment
  • Demonstrated track record of delivering exceptional work product
  • Demonstrated ability to interface with multi-disciplinary teams and senior leadership - this position will have regular interaction with Sr executives, Jr executives and functional leaders from nearly all departments of the company.
  • Outstanding ability to analyze and articulate complex sets of metrics into a clear written analysis.
  • Demonstrated ownership of projects with outstanding action oriented results & outstanding 360 evaluations from team indicating energy, creativity, high customer focus & professionalism.
  • Familiarity with Tableau and Cognos preferred.
  • Experience with Microsoft (Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, Word).
title: Senior International Strategic Data Analyst

description:
U.S. Interactive Media is seeking a Senior Data Analyst for our Los Angeles, CA office.

Position Summary

Act as a primary resource for clients’ media measurement and research needs including: reporting and insights, testing and optimization, attribution modeling, and media research. Someone who is passionate about analyzing trends and can help improve business performance.

Key Areas of Responsibility

  • Collecting and analyzing Media data to perfect media practices
  • In-depth analysis of media performance across all channels from CPI to revenue
  • Design and ownership of best practice media measurement, guidelines, attribution and reporting framework across client and internal teams
  • Work with our sales and client services teams to understand client objectives and develop studies that provide the most accurate and comprehensive picture
  • Develop analytical strategies to solve business problems; this involves understanding the business problem, identifying relevant data, gathering and summarizing data meaningfully and applying appropriate statistical analysis to identify causal relationships and predict future outcomes
  • Assess the methodologies, data quality and synergies across various third-party data sets and develop strategic recommendations on behalf of the research and analytics team
  • Provide thought leadership across the following areas: segmentation, targeting, attribution, marketing mix modeling, decisioning & optimization algorithms and data management platforms
  • Collaborate with consumer & marketing Intelligence Solutions to explain and wrap human insights around analytical output that helps describe the targeting group, consumer, model results, etc.
  • Responsible for the day to day management of assigned projects including: project initiation and planning, directing and managing project execution, monitoring project progress and execution.

Qualifications

  • BA/BS degree (in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Economics, Information Systems preferred)
  • 3+ years experience in media, advertising or digital marketing
  • 4+ years experience collecting and analyzing media data
  • Ability to analyze all points of ad inventory - impressions, revenue, fill rates, as well as eCPMs in Real Time Bidding (RTB) environment
  • Omni channel and attribution metrics experience is a plus
  • Clear understanding of data management platforms and data vendor offerings to power our advanced analytics products (Experian, Neustar, Oracle, etc.)
  • Digital Marketing background with knowledge of Google Analytics
  • Able to work with large amounts of data: facts, figures, and number crunching. You will need to see through the data and analyze it to reach conclusions
  • Experience with Tableau or other BI and data visualization tools, preferred
  • Experience with SQL required, MDX preferred, and VBA or other scripting languages preferred
  • Experience with eMarketer, Spyfu, Quantcast, Simmons, MRI, DemographicsNow, Media Audit, Nielsen, Comscore

If you meet the above requirements, please provide the following to career at usinteractivemedia.com :

  • Cover Letter (within email body ok)
  • Resume
  • Salary History

U.S. Interactive Media offers flexible benefits and compensation packages that allow our employees to make choices that fit their individual lifestyles. Some of our benefits include:

  • Competitive Salary
  • Health, Dental and Vision Insurance
  • Business casual dress code
  • Paid Holidays, Sick and Vacation
  • 401K

U.S. Interactive Media is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

U.S. Interactive Media is part of US International Media (USIM), one of the fastest-growing, full-service media management companies in the United States.

If you meet the above requirements, please provide the following to career at usinteractivemedia.com.

title: Business Analyst 21936

description:
Founded in 2011, Manage is a performance DSP that helps marketers connect with consumers through in-app mobile advertising. Our clients include leading apps such as Uber and Lyft, brands and agencies, helping them achieve their mobile marketing goals. Core to our company is a mobile marketing platform featuring proprietary algorithms, a machine-learning bidding engine and high performance architecture. We reach billions of consumers worldwide, and access over 40 billion ad impression opportunities daily.

Headquartered in Mountain View, CA, Manage was named one of the Best Places to Work in the Bay Area for 2015 by the San Francisco Business Times and Silicon Valley Business Journal. We are a startup with flat organization structure where team member can have huge areas of ownership and authority. We are looking for smart, driven team players who can help us get things done.

We are looking for a Sr. Data Analyst to join the team. Candidates should be naturally curious, detailed oriented, have a sharp analytical mind, are good with SQL, can write scripts and have the ability to communicate complex concepts with technical and non-technical people alike.

Responsibilities:
  • Work with various groups within the company to understand business needs, provide relevant data, and in-depth analysis
  • Write complex SQL queries to pull and process data from multiple data sources
  • Create dashboards to help business keep track of important metrics
  • Provide ad hoc and regular reports on key business metrics
  • Mentor more junior members of the team
  • Write scripts to automate repetitive tasks
Qualifications:
  • BS/MS in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, or other highly quantitative field
  • 3-5 years of practical experience in SQL querying large and complex data sets
  • Experience in Excel including pivot tables and common functions
  • Proficiency in Python, PHP, or other scripting languages as well as proven ability to work with large data sets
  • Strong communication and data presentation skills
  • Proven ability to learn quickly, work independently, and adapt to change in a fast-paced environment
  • Experience with Hadoop, MapReduce, and other scalable architecture
  • Experience in tools such as Pandas, R, etc.
  • Experience with BI/reporting tools such as Tableau
Bonus:
  • Previous internet/mobile industry experience
title: Senior Data Analyst

description:
Responsibilities:

Responsible for employee data reporting within the Human Resources Merger and Acquisition team.

Performs application testing against predefined use cases. Develops strong relationships with the HR M&A; C&B; and PM members to provide critical HR Deal support. Responsible for the development, implementation and maintenance of employee data reporting methods and processes including the collection, retrieval, security, and usage of employee information. Responsibilities include data quality testing and troubleshooting, and issue resolution to ensure business and data quality requirements are met.

Specific role & responsibilities:
1. Quality check of employee data before it goes to the employee data management team and record maintenance office for official record keeping. Provide quality check on final employee data file against deal related documents prior to the closing of a deal. Identify gaps and issues in data and raise issues to data owners for resolution.
2. Develop and manage a version control process of confidential files containing employee information that will ultimately be sent to record maintenance office
3. Conduct analysis of target data and develop preliminary interpretations. Own the creation/maintenance of diligence data requests
4. Upload Bonus documentation in GRIT (Global Retention Incentive Tool) – and partner with key HR contacts for the coordination of Bonus payments
5. Track Offer Acceptance rates for multiple deals
6. Collection and disposition of acceptance documentation. Work with key partners to determine best place for record keeping for this type of information.
7. Diversity tracking tool/process and data collection
8. Provide Welcome Day/Day 1 logistics – manage venue reservations, audio/visual equipment setup/testing, welcome material/goodie bags, etc.
9. Provide Pre-close support – (manage I9 document collection for United State employees)

Critical Skills: Requires flexibility and the ability to multi-task, work proactively in a fast-paced environment with frequent interruptions and exceptional attention-to-detail. Expected to exercise independent judgment and decision making ability is required when troubleshooting issues. Uses appropriate problem-solving techniques to research and develop solutions to moderately complex issues and make decisions efficiently and also knows when to elevate issues or concerns. Excellent organizational and written/verbal communication skills are a must. Demonstrated experience in managing projects with limited supervision. Proficiency in Microsoft Suite and Outlook critical.

Candidates must demonstrate professionalism and possess excellent planning, organization, problem solving, communication and attention to detail skills to achieve results. A high degree of confidentiality, creativity, flexibility and the ability to introduce efficiencies while maintaining accuracy are critical to success. The selected individual must demonstrate strong people skills. Applicants should have a proven ability to take ownership and responsibility for work assignments, work independently and manage multiple priorities while maintaining excellent customer service and composure.

PC/Systems skills needed include exceptional skills in Power Point, Excel, Word, Outlook calendar. Must be familiar with HR systems/tools and reports and be a quick learner. Candidate must be able to turn data into useful information and work effectively with multiple business partners to support this role.

Education & Experience:
College degree and 3-5 years of progressively responsible experience. Prior experience working with sensitive HR data preferred

Qualifications:
• Ability to manipulate large data sets (e.g. target employee census, data conversion file)
• Experience and comfort with using a range of data-related tools, such as MS Excel, MS Access, etc.; a "power user”
• Familiarity with various HRIS technologies and integrations between systems and the implications from a data quality and data accuracy perspective
• Understands the importance of data privacy and security when dealing with PII and/or confidential M&A; related data
• System thinking and process orientation
• Strong financial acumen and analytical thinking
title: Data Analyst - II

description:
The Data Analyst reports to the Vice President of Organizational Performance and supports the team in implementing College Track’s performance management protocols in service to internal constituents, primarily the sites, the program team and the Development team. The Analyst is responsible for supporting the department in identifying and analyzing programmatic trends and outcomes, generating funder reports to articulate and communicate these findings, and responding to requests from the sites about how we can improve outcomes for students. The Data Analyst plays a key role in ensuring data integrity and accuracy across the national network.

Primary Responsibilities include, but are not limited to

Data Collection and Quality Assurance
  • Supports the department to implement and monitor College Track’s data habits and performance management processes across the national network
  • Supports database integrity tasks, auditing and cleaning up duplicate records, transferring over archived data, etc.
  • Supports the department by providing data analysis and raising concerns as they relate to data quality and compliance
  • Manages a subset of processes, by coordinating and importing records, documenting processes, monitoring data entry and trends, and analyzing inefficiencies
  • Supports department in training new and existing staff
  • Provides support and guidance to Data Interns on specified projects

Communicating Impact
  • Responsible for the regular running of funder reports (public and private), data quality reports and internal performance management reports
  • Supports department in addressing ad hoc requests from sites, Development team, and the National Leadership Team for grant reporting, board reporting and
    other external reports
  • Supports department to quantify and communicate College Track’s current and future impact
Skills and Experience Required

First and foremost, the Data Analyst must embrace the College Track vision of transforming low-income communities into places where college readiness and college graduation are the norms. Additionally, candidates should possess the following qualifications:
  • Minimum four-year college degree, preferably with a quantitative focus or component
  • Experience with handling data to facilitate decision making, ensuring accuracy of the data but also presenting the data to highlight findings
  • Experience with Salesforce.com preferred
  • Advanced Excel skills necessary; experience with modeling a plus
  • Proactive, resourceful and persistent; seeks solutions and takes initiative and focuses on delivering outcomes despite obstacles
  • Demonstrated supportive, collaborative and problem-solving attitude, continuously looks for ways to reduce the data entry burden on site staff
  • Excellent time management skills
Compensation and Benefits

College Track offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package.

We will only contact candidates chosen for further consideration. No phone inquiries please.

College Track is an equal opportunity employer fully committed to achieving a diverse workforce. College Track does not discriminate on the basis of race, age, color, religion, national origin or ancestry, sex, gender, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, or gender identity or expression.

title: Financial Data Analyst

description:
We are seeking a Senior Analyst to join the Finance and Accounting group. This role is responsible for defining, developing and managing curated datasets, key business metrics and reporting for the finance and accounting team to ensure the accuracy, efficiency, and scalability of the loan origination and servicing functions

Responsibilities

Builds a deep understanding of the relationship between loan transactions, cash flows, and financial reporting implications throughout the loan lifecycle, from loan origination through payoff or account closure

Monitor the status and health of the borrower and investor funnel calling out any downstream implications to the financials or other operating plans
Manages and implements a framework to ensure daily reconciliation between source system data and cash accounts:
Ensures cash is properly received and deposited into correct bank accounts
Works with business partners (Operations and Product Management) to research and resolve discrepancies identified
Research reconciliation issues to identify root causes and partner with Product Management team to design and build permanent fixes
Support Accounting team in month end close, SEC reporting, and audits:
Provide financial data to Accounting team or auditors either on ad hoc basis or by creating Data Warehouse tables to persist relevant financial reporting information
Actively participate in automation of repetitive tasks within Treasury and Accounting to alleviate month-end workload, improve accuracy of reporting and strengthen internal controls
Work with internal groups (e.g. Business Intelligence, Business Operations, Product Management) throughout the product release cycle to ensure that financial reporting needs are addressed throughout the ideation, business requirements, product requirements, implementation, user testing, release and post production validation phases

Proactively identify operational gaps in processes or controls and design steps to improve or mitigate issue. Where applicable, builds user tools to remediate issues in the short-term and prototypes which can be further developed into production.

Aide in monthly forecasting of Revenue and other variable costs

Support the preparation of internal/external communication (monthly reforecasts, board deck, etc.)

Perform ad hoc analysis, insight requests, and data extractions to resolve business issues

Requirements

Strong academic record required
Technical requirements:
Excellent SQL skills and demonstrated ability to write complex queries for analyzing and translating data
High level of proficiency in Excel, VBA or report automation skills are highly desired
Prior data management, data warehouse / BI experience is strongly preferred
Experience with Tableau a plus
3+ years of experience within a high-growth company with minimal supervision
1+ years working with large data sets in an operationally focused role
Superior intellectual and quantitative analysis capabilities; pays extreme attention to detail.
Passion for problem-solving, flexibility, comfort with ambiguity, and creativity
Preferred experience with consumer lending and/or financial services
Proven track record of working effectively and collaborate well in a cross-functional team environment
Be a true self-starter that can quickly and independently assess business requirements and become a trusted and integral part of the team

Prosper is built on a simple idea: connect people who want to borrow money with those that have money to invest. Prosper is an online marketplace that gives borrowers access to individual and institutional investors. Borrowers get low, fixed rates with no hidden fees or prepayment penalties. Investors can earn great returns through the platform’s data-driven underwriting for personal loans, creating a new and diverse investment opportunity. Through Prosper, more than $6 billion in personal loans have helped borrowers consolidate their credit card debt, pay for large purchases, make home improvements and cover medical expenses. Prosper Marketplace is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices in Phoenix and Tel Aviv.

Prosper offers an excellent compensation package including monthly incentive bonuses, options for company paid health, dental and vision insurance, paid vacation time, 401k with employer match and even a Prosper Fit Reimbursement Plan where we’ll reimburse a portion of your fitness expenses.

title: Administrative Ass. Analyst

description:
Data is integral to all the decisions we make at Twitch - come join our growing team of data analysts and work with our data scientists, product managers and engineers to resolve ambiguity with data, play a crucial role in product iteration and optimization at Twitch, and evangelize data-driven decision-making across the organization.

Responsibilities
    • Influence product decisions from inception to launch to post-launch - educate your stakeholders on how to resolve ambiguity through quantifiable goals at the inception phase, design and help implement data instrumentation and tracking during execution, and come up with accurate KPIs to track performance and make suggestions post-launch for future iterations or deeper data dives.
    • Supplement day-to-day operations with data - provide teams with ad-hoc analysis, automated reports and dashboards, and self-service reporting tools that accurately reflect the health of their business and help them track their progress towards their goals.
    • Identify opportunities for developing new data sources, and provide technical leadership around making those data sources high quality and broadly available.
    • Communicate your results to diverse audiences at all levels from executives to engineers with effective writing, visualizations, and presentations.
    • Be a champion for high quality data-driven decision-making on your team and throughout the company.
Requirements
    • Expert SQL skills. Your ability to tap into our data pipeline will be key to your success.
    • 2+ years of experience in using data to iterate on and improve a product and meaningfully impact product decisions.
    • Fluency in data analysis and communication about data, including time series and event data analysis, data visualization, and defining KPIs.
    • Experience with automated self-service reporting tools.
    • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Bonus Points
    • Technical background with some programming experience.
    • Statistics and AB testing experience or knowledge is always a plus.
    • You know a lot about online communities, games, or Twitch.
Twitch is the world’s leading video platform and community for gamers, with more than 100 million visitors per month. We connect gamers from around the world by allowing them to broadcast, watch, and chat with each other. Twitch’s live and on-demand video platform forms the backbone of a distribution network for video game broadcasters including pro players, tournaments, leagues, developers and gaming media organizations. Twitch is leading a revolution in gaming culture, turning gameplay into an immersive video experience. Learn more at: http://twitch.tv

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Twitch. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records .
title: Data Analyst

description:
Description

We have an exciting opportunity on a team that is defining how we use analytics to transform customer experiences, accelerate business growth and optimize ROI. We are looking for a business focused analyst with excellent quantitative skills and web analytics experience.

Responsibilities:
  • Partner with product managers, marketing, and engineering to enable decision support and key customer insights through web tracking metrics
  • Study website behavior patterns using site metric tools to analyze and optimize business results and user experience
  • Uses quantitative data gathered with software measurement tools, traffic extracts, click streams and drill-downs to develop an understanding of customer behavior, demographics and lifecycle
  • Coordinates report requirements with internal customers to meet business objectives
  • Applies statistics-based market intelligence to business issues and formulates recommendations
  • Typically requires proficiency in web analytics applications, strong database skills and technical understanding of website architecture
  • Create dashboards by pulling data from different sources and present them to management team
  • Collaborate with external partners such as Agencies to assist with data collection and reporting
  • Focus reporting and analysis holistically through end to end funnel metrics for campaign and non-campaign channels: click-stream analysis, outcomes analysis, search analysis, multivariate testing analysis
  • Partner within the team to measure impact of website strategy to campaign channels (search & direct marketing), online demand generation, business unit financial performance, product mix, affiliates etc
  • Answer ad-hoc analytic questions and train users to self-serve standard reports leveraging Tableau
  • Ensure site tagging is optimized to provide crystal-clear visibility into the impact and value of new initiatives and product releases
  • Pursue data quality, troubleshoot data validation, and see issues to resolution

Qualifications
  • 3-5 years of experience in web analytics decision support and website optimization for online/ecommerce businesses
  • Deep subject matter expertise with SQL
  • Tableau experience a PLUS
  • Ability to tell stories with data, educates effectively, and instills confidence in recommendations, motivating others to act on them
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills: able to develop and use structured approaches to identify root causes and recommend resolutions: can present results in meaningful terms
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
title: Senior Business Data Analyst

description:
At Niagara, we’re looking for Team Members who want to be part of achieving our mission to provide our customers the highest quality most affordable bottled water.

Consider applying here, if you want to:
  • Work in an entrepreneurial and dynamic environment with a chance to make an impact.
  • Develop lasting relationships with great people.
  • Have the opportunity to build a satisfying career.

We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages for our Team Members.

Compensation and Data Analyst

The HR Compensation and Data Analyst is a key resource for Niagara’s HR team, supporting compensation benchmarking and analysis for the organization as well as providing data analytics across other areas of HR. This role plays a key part in helping Niagara make decisions on its talent by developing reports and analyzing data for key stakeholders.

Detailed Description
  • Works with the HR team and third parties on a variety of compensation related projects, including program design, analysis, and implementation of new programs.
  • Manages projects such as compensation survey participation and analysis.
  • Develops and documents procedures to streamline processes and ensure compliance.
  • Assists HR partners and organization leaders with analyzing and benchmarking new and existing job descriptions.
  • Generates and delivers various scheduled and ad-hoc reports across all levels of the organization.
  • Develops and analyzes KPI’s across multiple areas of HR including, but not limited to: Turnover, Recruiting, Compensation, Training, Time and Attendance, and other data related to our HR systems.
  • Audits data and reports to ensure completeness and accuracy.
  • Leverages new and existing HR systems to provide better data analysis and self-service functionality to the organization.
  • Please note this job description is not designed to contain a comprehensive list of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without prior notice.

Work Experience/KSA’s
  • Required:
      • 2-4 years – Experience in the analysis and administration of compensation programs
      • 0-2 year(s) – Experience in analyzing and interpreting HR data
      • 0-2 year(s) – Writing and analyzing job descriptions
    *experience may include a combination of work experience and education
    • Preferred:
      • 5-7 years – Experience in the analysis and administration of compensation programs
      • 2-4 years – Experience in analyzing and interpreting HR data
      • 2-4 years – Writing and analyzing job descriptions
    *experience may include a combination of work experience and education

    Competencies

title: Compensation and Data Analyst

description:
We are building the marketplace technology platform to transform the massive $400B+ global beauty and wellness industry. Think Uber for transportation and OpenTable for restaurant reservations, but for haircuts and related services. Consumers love how we help them find the right services, as well as the convenience of booking and paying online. Small businesses love how we deliver them new clients and automate client relationship management to increase their revenue 70+%.

StyleSeat is seeking an exceptional leader in analytics to further our growth efforts, ask the right questions and deliver actionable insights to push the business forward. You will turn our data into recommendations that will improve our growth, engagement and retention across both the supply and demand sides of our business.

Analytics plays a crucial role in our decision making process, acting as a cornerstone of both our day to day operations and our long-term strategy. In this role, you will work with product teams, marketing, corporate strategy and finance, and the executive team to understand and define the big analytics projects to move the needle. This is a hands-on role, working directly with our CTO to complete our data warehouse definition and build out, define and build internal reporting dashboards, and connect with leads across the company to make sure they're asking the right questions and getting them answered.

Responsibilities:
  • Lead KPI development and tracking across all key functions of the business including product, marketing, and finance.
  • Designing both the business logic and the technical specifications to define the data collection and data model infrastructure, and develop the last-mile SQL-based ETL components.
  • Serve as a key thought leader and business insights provider for the senior leadership of the company.
  • Provide insights into performance trends, be able to identify and explain root causes of changing performance.
  • Partner with marketing and product managers to design experiments and distill their results into actionable conclusions to drive test iterations.
  • Raise the bar across the organization in terms of analytical rigor. Advocate for data driven decision making and work to insure that key decision makers are using the right data and approaches when making important decisions.
Ideal candidate will have:
  • Demonstrated achievements in analytics/data science in prior positions; will have produced analysis critical to driving top line growth; startup experience preferred
  • 4+ years of analytics experience
  • A BS/MS degree in quantitative discipline required (economics, statistics, math, physics, engineering etc.)
  • Demonstrated ability to influence outcomes and decisions, even when you don’t have positional authority
  • Excellent communication skills (written and oral)
  • Experience presenting and explaining technical results to a variety of audiences, including senior executives and key stakeholders
  • Experience in performing analytics for user behavior on consumer web and mobile applications.
  • Experience with a mix of Consumer, SaaS, and Marketplace Analytics
  • Experience in A/B and multivariate testing, experiment design and statistical performance reporting
  • Strong ability, willingness and passion to do hands-on work requiring complex SQL queries
  • High-level SQL skills
  • Looker experience a plus
  • Excel, data visualization and BI dashboarding software required
  • Experience with Python, R or other statistical packages preferred
title: Lead Data Analyst

description:
Junior Data Analyst (Modelling, Insights & Data Science) International Solution Sources LLC is market leader in Data Analytics and Insights based solutions to leading consumer based based businesses. They boast the industry's largest and most comprehensive consumer 'Big Data' sets which are leveraged to deliver a range of Customer, Marketing and Credit Risk driven statistical models. Employing the industry's brightest analytical minds they offer a hot bed for innovation and guarantee unparalleled opportunities for career development and growth.Following the internal promotion of a valued team member a brand new position has been created for a Junior Analyst (Data Modelling, Insights & Data Science) to join the Fremont based team. With the key focus on leveraging strong SQL / SAS programming skills to manipulate data, uncover insights, and build statistical models the responsibilities of the role will include but not be limited to:

  • Engaging with internal stakeholders to consult around analytical project requirements, discuss methodologies, and negotiate deliverables.
  • Providing support to variety exciting stakeholder driven projects that could include; marketing campaign execution & optimization, customer insights analysis, statistical modelling, credit analysis, credit risk / scorecard modelling, product & portfolio analysis, digital / web analytics, data visualization / dash boarding, sales reporting & insights.
  • Leveraging your strong SQL, SAS or R data management skills you will extract, manipulate and merge large volumes data from a variety of complex data sources. Delivering against ongoing requests from the business for timely and accurate SQL, SAS or R data sets to support their strategic initiatives.

The successful applicant will come with exposure to working in a data driven analytics environment, where analyzing and delivering insights from large data sets has been the key focus. You will be able to demonstrate:

  • Strong technical skills and experience (1-2yrs) using SQL, SAS or R to extract, manipulate and merge large volumes of customer behavioral or transactional data from a variety of source systems (e.g. SQL Teradata, Oracle SQL, SQL Server, MYSQL, SAS Base or R)
  • At least one year of experience working in a commercial environment with large volumes of data relating to; customer insights, marketing campaigns, customer reporting, risk reporting, risk analysis, statistical modelling, marketing mix modelling, credit analysis etc
  • Strong attention to detail, work prioritization, and process improvement skills.
  • Educated to a minimum of degree level in a highly analytical discipline such as - Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Actuarial Studies, Data Science, Computer Science etc.
  • A genuine interest in pursuing a career in Data Analytics / Data Scientist, implementing analytical techniques and concepts such as; marketing campaign analytics, customer insights analysis, customer propensity modeling (churn / acquisition / cross sell / up sell), segmentation analysis (cluster / basket), credit risk analysis, credit scorecard development, price optimization, customer lifetime value analysis, next best offer analysis, significance testing, decision trees, neural networks etc

To apply for this position please click on the 'Apply' button below .

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $50,000.00 /year

Job Location:

  • San Francisco, CA 94105

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • Teradata: 1 year
title: Teradata Analyst

description:
The Sales, Marketing & Communications Data Analyst will have a dual role as both an analytic and creative resource, reporting directly to Meggitt Control Systems’ (MCS) VP of Strategy, Sales and Marketing. The Sales, Marketing & Communications Data Analyst will execute a variety of complex tasks, through data analysis and reporting, that will ultimately drive action by both the outside sales team as well as MCS’ Senior Leadership Team.

He/she will design market research projects that result in accurate assessment and reporting of current industry trends. Influencing through data will be the primary focus, by collating information from various industry sources, including, but not limited to, customer profiles, competitive intelligence & mapping, macro-economic drivers, and advances in new technology, etc. Data and knowledge generated through this reporting will ultimately drive MCS’ marketing excellence agenda and will have a major impact on the growth of our business. Through his/her exceptional presentation and marketing skills, the Sales, Marketing & Communications Data Analyst will also be called upon to work with Meggitt’s Brand Management team, thereby helping to design marketing collateral that effectively communicate capabilities through digital and printed media.

This role has considerable visibility across the organization and will provide the successful candidate a unique perspective on the business that can be leveraged into future career aspirations

Job Core Responsibilities
  • Deliver concise, yet effective marketing reports based on collation of data from multiple sources – internal and external – that help Meggitt’s senior leadership team take action.
  • Develop and maintain competitive intelligence database on Meggitt Control Systems peer companies that includes financial performance, technical capabilities, customer exposure, etc.
  • Execute Meggitt Control Systems Marketing Excellence agenda through the management and administration of marketing KPI’s and the sales pipeline/dashboard, upated monthly.
  • Support MCS’ growth strategy into new, adjacent markets by creating data driven reports that include key barriers to entry such as competitive forces, technological requirements, investments, etc., as well as revenue projections and ROI.
  • Analyze data to identify specific industry or market trends, perform analysis to justify marketing budgets. Example reports include: market share, product gap analyses, performance to sales budgets (revenue and profit), aftermarket vs. OEM revenue projections, etc.
  • Gathers, analyzes, and compares competitors’ products, performance data, customers and pricing to analyze strengths and opportunities relative to competing organizations.
  • Determines the best methodologies for accurately determining customer purchasing patterns, preferences, the company's image and marketing effectiveness.
  • Attend industry conferences and seminars, as appropriate to obtain further insight into key markets and customers
  • Work with Meggitt’s brand management team, MCS’ leadership team and external design resources as needed to devise effective marketing collateral.
  • Focal for maintaining the intranet website by coordinating content provided by functional leadership teams from across the organization.
  • Strong analytical skills, excellent communication skills, ability to convey thoughts and ideas verbally and in writing, and with a creative mind.
  • Prepares materials, content, and templates as required for internal sales meetings and conferences.
  • Ability to travel when necessary (10-25%).
  • Other responsibilities as assigned.

Job Specifications

Education: Bachelor's Degree in Business (with technical marketing focus), Engineering or other relevant disciplines.

Years Experience: 5-7 years of relevant experience.

Location: Position is located at either the Simi Valley or North Hollywood locations. For an exceptional candidate, position could sit in Irvine and the person would have to be on site at Simi or North Hollywood 1-2 days per week.

Skills:
  • Experience with CRM applications required; Salesforce.com preferred.
  • Ability to provide expertise in analyzing and synthesizing complex and/or diverse information.
  • Skilled at collecting and researching data; Uses intuition and experience to complement data.
  • Demonstrates knowledge of markets and competition.
  • Demonstrated aptitude and appreciation for key aerospace system technologies, products and manufacturing trends.
  • Strong attention to detail, good organizational skills and the ability to prioritize with changing situations.
  • Ability to problem-solve using existing procedures, analysis and standard practices to make judgments.
  • Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills.
  • Advanced proficiency and understanding of Microsoft Office Suite and database management tools (Access, Work, Excel and Powerpoint). Experience with Microsoft Publisher preferred.
  • Exceptionally talented in development of company graphics, presentations, and promotional items



This position requires use of information which is subject to the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). All applicants must be U.S. persons within the meaning of ITAR. ITAR defines a U.S. person as a U.S. Citizen, U.S. Permanent Resident (i.e. 'Green Card Holder'), Political Asylee, or Refugee.

Meggitt is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran Status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request an accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access our career center as a result of your disability. To request an accommodation, contact a Human Resources Representative at 1-855-474-7665 or HRISon@meggitt.com .

description:
As the Data Analyst you will be responsible for supporting the processes that assist leaders in making strategic and operational data-based decisions by delivering timely, accurate and relevant financial and operational information. As the Consultant you will design, develop and analyze data to measure clinical outcomes and network performance as well as interpret and analyze clinical data from various sources and recommend best approaches for its consolidation.

Primary Responsibilities:
  • Analyze various sources of information and large data sets including encounters, referrals, HCC and Quality

  • Develop actionable reports for internal clients using various reporting and query tools, especially MS-SQL and Reporting Services

  • Administer SQL server and data warehouse while identifying critical areas of the data structure and recommend improvements to existing reports and reporting processes.

  • Interpret and analyze clinical data from various sources including Optum One (Clinical Analytics Software)

  • Prepare written analysis and summarize results using graphical representations and professional formatting using Qlikview (Business Intelligence Software)

  • Maintain data integrity and ongoing quality control of delivered reports

  • Work closely with all levels of end users, including executive level staff, to quickly develop reports which will be used to make strategic business decisions and support the overall scope of the company's business strategies

  • Create detailed documentation outlining report criteria and provide recommendations to the requestor based on the results of the report

  • Ownership of a large-scale, ongoing project and/or area that may contain multiple reports, analysis, and representations



















Required Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, IS or related field

  • 2-4 years of experience reporting, analyzing, interpreting, and presenting data to various stakeholders

  • Healthcare Industry experience

  • Knowledge of SQL

  • Ability to interface with multiple users across the organization and effectively project manage reporting











Preferred Qualifications:
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills and abilities

  • Demonstrate strong communication (verbal, written, and interpersonal) and customer service skills, with the ability to exchange information with others clearly and concisely

  • Ability to manage own work flow and meet deadlines while responding to frequent demands of stakeholders

  • Ability to take ownership of each project from start to finish and follow-up with management on project status









Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world’s large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life’s best work.(sm)

Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

description:
MobileIron is on the cutting edge of the mobile revolution. Think about how important your phone is – mobile devices are becoming increasingly critical for employees to be productive at work. This has left companies struggling to keep those devices secure while enabling access to company information and preserving employee privacy and positive user experience. More and more companies are now turning to Enterprise Mobility Management software to assist them with that priority. MobileIron is the leading standalone EMM vendor in the 2016 Gartner Magic Quadrant.

We are looking for people that can help us build the next chapter of MobileIron which means helping us scale to meet the needs of our rapidly growing customer base.

This Analyst is responsible for delivering and supporting the business applications that automate our explosive growth. The main responsibility of this position will be to work with our business users to enhance and update our cloud applications to automate our business. This person will be on the Business Applications team whose goal is to automate our business processes with the best applications available. The primary application is Salesforce.com but other applications this person will get their hands on are Apttus, Boomi, and NetSuite. This team plays a strategic role as we look to scale our company efficiently and rapidly bring on new customers

What you’ll be doing…

  • Work with the team of Senior Business Analysts, Business Process Owners and End Users to define business requirements and systems enhancements
  • Perform data analysis and updates operations to keep a clean customer master and install base
  • Provide 2nd tier support for customer requests/issues and investigate issues related to quote-to-cash business process
  • Document business process flows and requirements
  • Make configuration/development enhancements to the Salesforce application per business requirements
  • Assist in creating reports and dashboard for users
  • Identify test criteria and test new functionality/enhancements
  • Provide training to end users
Who you are…

  • Strong statistical and data analysis skills to help support decision making
  • Excellent data visualization capabilities
  • Ability to conduct research and make recommendations around business process issues or improvements
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Excellent problem-solving, analytical and investigative skills
  • Ability to handle ambiguously-defined problems
  • Highly self-motivated and directed
  • Keen attention to detail
  • Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment
What you have done…

  • Degree in MIS
  • 5 years of relevant business experience
  • Minimum of 2 years of experience as a Salesforce application analyst
  • Minimum of 1 year experience with industry standard Business Intelligence tools like Tableau, Domo or Wave
  • Minimum of 2 years of experience as a systems or data analyst
  • Strong Salesforce Sales/Service Cloud functional and configuration knowledge
  • Apttus CPQ experience is desirable

description:
Looking for a chance to do meaningful work that touches millions? Come join the hardest working, nonprofit health plan in California and help us shape the future of health care. Blue Shield of California’s Mission is to ensure all Californians have access to high-quality care at an affordable price. Blue Shield is focused on improving health care delivery by working closely with providers and making it more accessible, affordable and customer-centric. Being a mission-driven organization means we do much more than serve our 4 million members: we were the first health plan in the nation to limit our annual net income to 2 percent of revenue and return the difference to our customers and the community, and since 2005 we have contributed more than $325 million to the Blue Shield of California Foundation to improve community health and end domestic violence. We also believe that a healthier California begins with our employees, so we provide them with resources to develop and maintain a healthy lifestyle through our award-winning wellness program, Wellvolution.

We're hiring smart thinkers and doers who want to work for a leader and innovator in the challenging, ever-changing healthcare space. Come and help us make health care better for everyone.

Collects, analyzes and synthesizes data; develops information to guide business decision making for BSC populations' health management, cost of health care management, quality of care, and network design and strategies. Responsibilities: Mastery of Associate, Intermediate and Senior level responsibilities. Independently writes reports and presents data in formats such as abstracts, graphs or summaries. Develops technical specs and develops and executes work plans that may involve collaboration with more than one team.

Coordinates the design of reports that integrate data from multiple sources, including design of reporting systems and standardization of metrics and formats across departments and functional areas. Designs, builds and enhances database systems and applications for complex, high level reporting requirements. Critically reviews and revises existing systems and applications for update and enhancement. Identifies systems and operational problems and recommends solutions and changes to streamline procedures for more effective reporting. Manages complex business reporting system design and implementation, including systems for QA and report documentation.

Functions as facilitator and/or mentor for data reporting projects, teams and task forces. Provides training and mentoring for team members on best practices for analysis and reporting; assists in the development of supplemental analytic training tools and materials. Supplies consultative advice to analysts in other departments and business units regarding standard business rules and algorithms.

Provides coordination and oversight of peer review of accuracy, completeness and report/system design and implementation. Assesses business risks relating to back up for reporting design and production and develops and implements plans to mitigate risks. Coordinates interaction between data analysis teams and support functions including information systems, provider relations and medical management. Collaboration/leadership role in the critical review and ongoing development of data management and systems for strategically important enterprise-wide reporting. Ad hoc assignments as requested

Qualifications

Education/Requirements: Requires an MPH, MBA, MS, MA in science, social science, public health, health services research or business, or BA/BS with demonstrated equivalent work experience. PhD preferred.

Position also requires five to 10 years experience in Health Care (managed care, academic, or gov't payer), demonstrated ability to work with all clinical coding systems (e.g., ICD9, CPT, DRG, LOINC, RxHUB). MS Office, esp. Excel and Access, Unix, SQL/PL-SQL,SAS.

Must be able to develop new SAS programs and SQL scripts that improve the efficiency of the work of others. SAS Base and Adv. Certification preferred Minimum Experience Level: Typically has 5 or more years experience as a Health Data Analyst, Medical Economist or related role in a managed care setting.
title: Lead Health Data Analyst, Clinical Program Reporting

description:
Data is integral to all the decisions we make at Twitch - come join our growing team of data analysts and work with our data scientists, product managers and engineers to resolve ambiguity with data, play a crucial role in product iteration and optimization at Twitch, and evangelize data-driven decision-making across the organization.

Responsibilities
    • Influence product decisions from inception to launch to post-launch - educate your stakeholders on how to resolve ambiguity through quantifiable goals at the inception phase, design and help implement data instrumentation and tracking during execution, and come up with accurate KPIs to track performance and make suggestions post-launch for future iterations or deeper data dives.
    • Supplement day-to-day operations with data - provide teams with ad-hoc analysis, automated reports and dashboards, and self-service reporting tools that accurately reflect the health of their business and help them track their progress towards their goals.
    • Identify opportunities for developing new data sources, and provide technical leadership around making those data sources high quality and broadly available.
    • Communicate your results to diverse audiences at all levels from executives to engineers with effective writing, visualizations, and presentations.
    • Be a champion for high quality data-driven decision-making on your team and throughout the company.
Requirements
    • Expert SQL skills. Your ability to tap into our data pipeline will be key to your success.
    • 2+ years of experience in using data to iterate on and improve a product and meaningfully impact product decisions.
    • Fluency in data analysis and communication about data, including time series and event data analysis, data visualization, and defining KPIs.
    • Experience with automated self-service reporting tools.
    • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Bonus Points
    • Technical background with some programming experience.
    • Statistics and AB testing experience or knowledge is always a plus.
    • You know a lot about online communities, games, or Twitch.
Twitch is the world’s leading video platform and community for gamers, with more than 100 million visitors per month. We connect gamers from around the world by allowing them to broadcast, watch, and chat with each other. Twitch’s live and on-demand video platform forms the backbone of a distribution network for video game broadcasters including pro players, tournaments, leagues, developers and gaming media organizations. Twitch is leading a revolution in gaming culture, turning gameplay into an immersive video experience. Learn more at: http://twitch.tv

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Twitch. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records .
title: Data Analyst - Developer Success

description:
As a Business Analyst on the FP&A; team you will play a critical role developing insights into the performance of our games. Your immediate focus will be on helping to build out mid-term and long-term predictive models. You will be a key team member supporting both the revenue and marketing side of the games business diving directly into the data, creating recurring reports and dashboards and supporting ad-hoc analysis and deep dives. You will partner with our Marketing, Game Ops and Live Ops teams to monitor current performance and trends.

We’re looking for an inquisitive, smart and excited individual to help analyze and speak fluently about our top line revenue, gross margin and other critical game KPIs. We are seeking an individual who wants to be part of a fast paced company with tons of opportunity for growth. You should be willing to dive deep and contribute on an individual basis. Qualified candidates will be smart, self-starters, able to multi-task and comfortable in a fast-paced, high growth, dynamic setting. We are looking for candidates who are high energy and excited about building and being a part of a hard working team.

Responsibilities:
    • Design, build and maintain standardized game models for a growing portfolio of games
    • Develop a deep working knowledge of each game’s critical KPIs including each step of the acquisition, conversion, step-up and retention funnels, in-game monetization cycle, eCPI, and LTV
    • Support regular gaming performance reviews (trends, budget and forecast compares)
    • Assist in near and long term planning cycles
    • Assist in internal executive, BOD and investor reporting
Requirements:
    • 2-5 yrs experience as a quant/data analyst in a gaming or SaaS business
    • Proven track record in a fast paced, dynamic and complex professional setting
    • Ability to quickly and accurately discuss business performance and make recommendations or provide input
    • Presentation and communication skills
    • Analysis Techniques: Spreadsheet Modeling, Monte Carlo Simulations, Hardie/Fader Modelling, Optimization Modelling (Standard, Lean and Goal Based)
    • Other skills: Tableau and/or PowerBISQL , Python, JMP, RPrevious exposure to Vertica and/or Hadoop database environments

description:
Become a WorkMonger JobSeeker today and unlock Data Analyst roles around the country (at no cost to you). WorkMonger is a profile based job matching service for non-teaching jobs in the education sector. As a JobSeeker, just complete a free profile to let us know about your experience, geographic preferences, work style, and more, and we'll search for jobs that are uniquely fit for you and the next stage of your career. Our employer partners include education non-profits, charter management organizations, school districts, think tanks, and ed tech companies. Job opportunities span all non-teaching roles, such as program management, operations, finance, curriculum design, teacher coaching, advocacy, policy, communications, and more.

The job description below is reflective of data analyst positions we often receive from our employers nationwide. Please review it for more information and complete this short form in just 30 seconds to express your interest in opportunities like these: http://bit.ly/2jFQoNz

Responsibilities:
Data Management & Reporting:
Collect, interpret, and analyze data using statistical techniques, assessments, surveys, and audits.

Provide reports accurately and on-time.

Design, maintain, and analyze data tools to inform leadership of progress.

Manage sensitive information systems to meet needs of end users and create reports.

Prepare reports analyzing achievement and progress towards the organization's goals, utilizing multiple data sources and measures.

Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies to optimize statistical efficiency and data quality.

Identify trends, patterns, anomalies, and useful information in complex data sets for the organization staff.

Implement and manage project plans to coordinate logistics and communicate roles and responsibilities of IT and other administrators.

Prepare summative reports for organization staff that clearly report progress towards goals, and motivate staff to new targets.

Progress Monitoring and Organizational Effectiveness:
Produce strategic recommendations for organizational goals, priorities and action.

Create tools like rubrics, checklists, and dashboards to measure and report on goal progress.

Lead weekly meetings with organization staff and leaders to motivate and manage towards goals.

Prepare presentations for internal and external staff to motivate stakeholders to take action.

Administrative duties:
Work closely with leadership to prioritize organization needs.

Participate in staff development meetings and make presentations and professional development sessions as requested by leadership.

Stay abreast of developments in the field by attending trainings and workshops, as needed.

Qualifications:
BA/BS required; Masters Degree preferred (Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics preferred).

Experience collecting, analyzing, and reporting data (preferably in a charter school, school district, non-profit, or policy environment).

Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing large datasets (Excel, Stata, Tableau, Power BI, or other data analysis tools).

Knowledge of and experience with reporting packages, databases, and programming.

Expert knowledge of data models and database design development.

Strong analytical skills with ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate complex datasets.

Demonstrated success delivering major projects on time and within constraints of project management tools, logistic plans, and vendor relationships.

Excellent oral and written communication skills.

Demonstrated ability to collaborate with others.
