title: Data Analyst

description:
HPRS is responsible for leading California state regulatory initiatives across all functions statewide, as well as managing relationships and maintaining communications with stakeholders at all levels, both internally and externally. The Data Analytic Consultant provides support in making strategic data-related decisions by analyzing, manipulating, tracking, internally managing and reporting data. These positions function both as a consultant and as a high-level data analyst. The position works with clients to develop the right set of questions/hypotheses, using the appropriate tools/skills to derive the best information to address customer needs. HPRS Data Analytic Consultants are responsible for the following: processing regulatory complaints in a timely manner and trending, reporting, and analyzing data related to these complaints with Health Plan and Medical Group stakeholders, supporting the Complaint Integrated Workflow Reporting System.

Essential Functions:
• Provides consultation to clients, including organizational leadership and guides work towards actionable outcomes.
• Regularly measures the impact of business decisions on clients and customers.
• Evaluates effectiveness of actions/programs implements & makes recommendations.
• Works with clients and staff to identify opportunities and methods to improve efficiencies with analysis.
• Provides support to peers and mentoring to junior staff including: technical & programming assistance, project management and scoping, documentation review and support.
• Directs and executes creative analytic approaches that lead to actionable outcomes which further promote organizational goals.
• Designs and enhances databases. Designs menu systems that are effective and user-friendly. Develops reports with accurate, easy to read, useful information. Designs and generates tracking and monitoring tools.
• Builds and maintains sophisticated statistical data analysis tools to test software written by self and others (using MS Access, Excel, Word, SQL Server, Windows batch, Oracle, Visual Basic, Visual Basic for Applications).
• Translates needs, issues, and ideas into effective strategies and action plans. Develops creative alternative solutions.
• Proactively recognizes potential issues, develops plans to address and understands how to communicate these steps to department leadership and clients.
• Analyzes and develops complex logical db designs, data models, and relational data def in support of corporate and client area info systems requirements.
• Participates in the development of outcomes and process measures, including technical specifications, to enable measurement and evaluation.
• Defines and frames complex multi-dimensional healthcare issues and develops time tables/processes for decision making.

Laurel & Wolf is looking for a leading data and business intelligence analyst. The ideal candidate will have exceptional analytical and technical skills, especially in SQL and Looker (or similar business intelligence tools). This person will work closely with executives, Finance, Marketing, Product and Operations teams to make data-driven decisions. You should be able to work in a fast-paced start-up environment. We're creative, grounded people who recognize and appreciate a beautifully designed space as much as a thoughtfully crafted website. We inspire each other to work better, be better, and do better. We're experts at having fun while doing our jobs really, really well. We believe anytime is a good time for snacks and espresso (but seriously, we do) and love group brainstorming sessions. title: Data and Business Intelligence Analyst

description:
ConsumerTrack is a rapidly growing digital marketing company and content platform with technology innovation at the core of our business model. Our Team has built a profitable company with a reputation as the preferred digital advertiser for Fortune 1000 brands, banks, and financial institutions. We use our proprietary technology platform along with both our owned and operated sites and partner sites to reach hundreds of millions of US consumers every month.
We hire high performance individuals that are highly accountable, able to collaborate and communicate in a Team environment and who want to be the very best that they can be every day. The opportunities are endless at ConsumerTrack and we will continue to promote from within based on great performance and the impact you can make to the Company.
We are a quickly growing marketing measurement and web analytics company and are looking for a talented person to develop into a measurement expert and thought leader as the business grows. This position is responsible for creating, compiling and interpreting web data in order to scale our revenue streams. This individual will assist in the execution of marketing measurement strategies, web analytics implementations and A/B testing initiatives.

What you will be doing:
  • Translate results from data into clear and actionable insights that are relevant to business goals
  • Consolidate & streamline organization analytical functions to instill data, measurement and testing across all departments
  • Develop intelligent analysis backed by quantitative data to influence strategic business decisions
  • Manage the tracking/reporting of data on a daily, weekly, monthly basis to assess campaign performance and recommend related strategies
  • Work with large amounts of data: facts, figures and number crunching
  • Define and develop real-time analytics and reporting flow to maximize optimization efforts
  • Manage the design and own the implementation of reporting dashboards that track key business metrics
  • Maintain positive relationships with clients as well as internal teams, ensuring the information they are receiving is accurate and usable
  • Acquire new knowledge and skills while applying it in a fast paced environment
Requirements:
  • Experience: 4-5 years of relevant work experience
  • Experience with Tableau Desktop & Server
  • Advanced knowledge in Microsoft Excel
  • Ability to analyze large data sets, manipulate data, make data driven recommendations and tell a story with the data
  • Perform well in environment that values leadership, independence, efficiency, dependability, and organization
  • Complex problem solving skills and ability to work with large amounts of data
  • Experience or desire to work in a small, fast paced entrepreneurial environment
  • Must have the ability to handle multiple deadlines and projects
  • Detail Oriented and proactive attitude
  • Ability to understand and decipher data and analysis requests from business users
  • Understanding basic statistics and math principles
Nice to Have:
  • Experience with retrieving data from SQL databases
  • Experience with SCRUM & Agile processes
Benefits:
At ConsumerTrack Inc., we seek out the most talented people in the industry and place a high value of keeping our employees happy and fulfilled by offering the following company-wide benefits:
  • Entrepreneurial culture, which promotes creative thinking and new strategies and ideas
  • Competitive salary with excellent growth opportunity
  • Company funding for outside classes and conferences to help you improve your skills
  • Awesome medical, dental and vision plans with heavy employer contribution
  • Paid vacation, holidays, and sick days (i.e. days off on your birthday, etc.)
  • 401k: We match 3% of employee’s salary after one year of full-time employment
  • Free gym membership for elite Bay Clubs
  • Monthly employee activities
  • Great office location, near the I-405, with an array of fun restaurants and happy hour venues within short walking distance

description:
Company Description:

Primitive Logic, founded in 1984, is the premier business consulting and technology firm developing and implementing solutions that create value for market-leading corporations. With offices in San Francisco, Los Angeles and San Diego, Primitive Logic is proud to be a three time winner of the #1 Best Places to Work in the Bay Area by the San Francisco Business Times and Silicon Valley Business Journal. We value open-communication, respect for ideas, a collaborative work environment, a healthy work-life balance, and we want like-minded individuals to join our team!

At Primitive Logic, we recognize that our success is due to the ingenuity and dedication of our employees, so we offer a competitive compensation and benefits package that includes profit sharing, stock options, commuter benefits, paid time off, health benefits and the flexibility you need to maintain balance in your personal and professional life.

Job Description:
The Data Analyst role is responsible for reporting and analyzing complex data relationships used in consumer online product. As a Data Analyst, you'll be responsible in interpreting data, analyzing results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports. Must be comfortable working with a mixed team of developers and analyst in an agile environment.

Other job responsibilities may include but aren’t limited to:
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing reports, and performance indicators
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities

Qualifications:
Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
Must have 5-6 years of experience with SQL scripts
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent team player with strong communication and desire to learn quickly

While not required, the following qualifications would set you apart from other candidates
Knowledgeable with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc).
Experience with BSA/ AML compliance
Banking/Financial Service experience is a plus

Additional Information

If this sounds like the right job for you, then use the button below to apply via Jobvite. If there is an interest in interviewing you for an available position, a representative from Primitive Logic will contact you in the future. We regret that we are unable to respond to each submission.

All positions with Primitive Logic require a pre-employment background investigation. Primitive Logic is an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse work environment in which all individuals are treated with respect and dignity.

description:
Req ID: 97391
Entity: AMR
JOB TITLE: Data Analyst
REPORTS TO: Operations Manager
LOCATION: Sacramento County
JOB REQ.: 94728

SUMMARY: Under the direction of the Operations Manager, the Performance Analyst will conduct data analysis, oversee reporting, and efficiencies in the field. In addition, the Performance Analyst will assist in processes around billing and clinical care reporting.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Perform data analysis and prepare various periodic reports and documents for review by the operations and clinical teams. These may include response time performance analysis, late call analysis, contract compliance reports, dispatch discrepancies, deployment efficiency, call volume, unit hour utilization and other related reports.
Assists with PCR accounting and paperwork tracking.
Updates and revises company definition of data as defined in State and Federal EMS data dictionaries (information about data, including name, description, source of data item, and key words for categorizing and searching for data item descriptions).
Develop s data models describing data elements and how they are used.
Adheres to all company policies and procedures.
Effective information systems security is a team effort involving the participation and support of every AMR employee who deals with information and/or information systems. It is the responsibility of every computer user to:
Know and follow Information Systems security policies and procedures.
Attend Information Systems security training
o Report information systems security problems
Assist in driving performance management.
Comply with all employment laws and support affirmative action I equal opportunity and diversity goals.

QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE :
Associate's degree or other education and one to two years database experience is preferred. Other healthcare experience, experience with information management systems, and/or knowledge of medical terminology or Emergency Medical Services also preferred.

LANGUAGE SKILLS :
Ability to read, analyze, and interpret professional scientific and technical journals. Ability to respond to common inquiries from customers, regulatory agencies, or members of the health care community. Ability to effectively present information to management, public groups, health care professionals and other allied agencies.

MATHEMATICAL SKILLS:
Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference and advanced algebra. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations.

REASONING ABILITY:
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.

COMPUTER SKILLS:
Extensive familiarity with personal computers and ability to type at a minimum of 40 words per minute. Proficiency with software programs such as Microsoft Word, Excel, Access, is preferred.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls and talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to sit. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk.

title: Senior Business Data Analyst

description:
Data Analyst
The Company
Ten-X (formerly Auction.com ) is the nation’s leading online real estate marketplace, having sold 200,000+ residential and commercial properties worth over $35 billion since 2007. Ten-X is private and growing, and recently announced the Ten-X brand and platform, setting up our next stage of expansion. Ten-X enables consumers, investors and real estate professionals to safely and easily complete real estate transactions entirely online. Ten-X helps customers bring assets to market and attract investors from around the world. By virtue of our best-in-class marketing and scalable platform, buyers and sellers conduct transactions in a transparent, efficient manner.

Ten-X empowers users with unprecedented levels of flexibility, control and simplicity, enabling the convenience of transacting properties whenever and wherever they want. As real estate continues to move online, Ten-X is uniquely positioned to drive this dramatic industry evolution.

Position Summary:
The Data Analyst will contribute to the data-driven decisions that guide the Company’s investments at every step in the customer lifecycle from building world class acquisition marketing capabilities to funnel optimization throughout the site and product flows to maximizing the lifetime value of our existing customer relationships.

Responsibilities/duties:
Use superb data mining, analytics and business judgment to help identify, prioritize, structure and solve complex data problems.
Partner with Product Managers to identify product tracking needs and work closely with the Engineering and QA teams to get Adobe Omniture SiteCatalyst tracking implemented.
Work across Product and Marketing to turn insight into action that lifts business performance and delivers customer experiences that delight buyers, sellers, institutions and agents.
Help drive strategic business decisions around segmentation, performance-based internet, digital and social marketing, targeting, CRM, A/B testing initiatives and product optimization.
Perform ad hoc analyses and data extraction requests; actively build processes, tools and metrics dashboard to make data more accessible; extract insights from data to improve the product experience and operational efficiency.
Manage multiple concurrent projects in a fast-paced, intense, results-oriented environment.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Strong analytics, problem-solving, strategic thinking and data capabilities.
Deep experience with web analytics and statistics (multivariate stats, predictive modeling, controlled test design, machine learning, marketing mix modeling)
Experience analyzing very large, multi-dimensional data sets using at least two of the following tools: SQL, Hadoop, Hive, Tableau, Adobe SiteCatalyst (Omniture), Google Analytics, SAS/R or similar.
Keen business judgment, ability to see the “big picture” and to prioritize for actionable impact. Deep knowledge of best practices in data-driven product and marketing functions.
Great influence, partnering, and collaboration skills.
Excellent communication skills and strong executive presence.
Passion for building world class customer experiences and converting insights into action.
Familiarity with data warehousing concept/tools.
Management experience and well-honed ability to inspire and lead a plus.

Education/Experience:
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative discipline / Computer Science / Information Systems with at least five years of work experience or Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline / Computer Science / Information Systems with at least two years of work experience.
Three years of experience in using at least two of the following analytics tools: SQL, Hadoop, Hive, Tableau, Adobe SiteCatalyst (Omniture), Google Analytics, SAS / R or similar.
Demonstrable experience of at least two years in product or marketing analytics in a top-tier consumer-focused technology company.
title: Data Analyst, Marketing & Product Analytics

description: ironSource is seeking an energetic leader with a can do approach that is passionate about data and the value it can create.
title: Head of Analytics

description:
Riot Games was established in 2006 by entrepreneurial gamers who believe that player-focused game development can result in great games. In 2009, Riot released its debut title League of Legends to critical and player acclaim. As the most played PC game in the world, over 67 million play every month. Players form the foundation of our community and it’s for them that we continue to evolve and improve the League of Legends experience.

We’re looking for humble but ambitious, razor-sharp professionals who can teach us a thing or two. We promise to return the favor. Like us, you take play seriously; you’re passionate about games. We embrace those who see things differently, aren’t afraid to experiment, and who have a healthy disregard for constraints.

That's where you come in.

As Technical Data Analyst, you'll provide expertise into bridging business and product needs with data solutions. As data is an integral part of modern life and work, knowing how to collect and use it is incredibly powerful. As TDA who lives at the intersection of engineering, business, and analytics, you’ll help unlock data's value and manage it effectively, with a focus towards engineering and business. You’ll be both powerful and extremely flexible, helping to achieve Riot’s goals of being data-informed company-wide and lending much needed expertise to a wide variety of areas.

You are:

  • Data-experienced: over the years, you've earned scars and stripes designing, implementing, and managing data systems for mission critical, large-scale applications; you understand data through-and-through; you have recommendations on how to ingest, model, and partition data and how to maintain a meta store that adheres to high data quality standards
  • Analytical: you're able to expediently identify and analyze problems using a variety of intuitive, logical, and creative methods, but you don't spin your wheels too much, instead move quickly to implement solutions that make our data warehouses much better
  • Business savvy: you can think about data as a product; you understand it is a resource that is valuable to a company and therefore managed properly; as a consumer of data you can also view data from a user's point-of-view; you can help establish and measure data quality, data access, data compliance, and you can tell that story to both engineers and stakeholders of data
  • Consultative: you're comfortable working through ambiguity, seeking out value, and working without close supervision; when we parachute you into a problem space, you’ll seek out the best solution and advocate that solution with stakeholders; you're comfortable operating behind enemy lines, clearing the problem's fog of war, and providing relevant intel to aid in decision making
  • Hands-on: you want to work in the kitchen where the data is made; you have no problem working with engineers and talking about data in a way that provides information gain; you are curious about data systems and how data goes from an event to rest and all the transforms in-between while in-flight
  • Player-focused: as a gamer yourself, you know the importance of listening to player needs, especially the implicit needs that can only be uncovered by analyzing and understanding player data
You will:
  • Function as the SME on enterprise data and set the standard on how to troubleshoot data issues, how to profile source data, how to build out scalable data quality checks, and how to best meet business needs with data
  • Work with data in HDFS, Amazon Redshift, and Vertica, and understand data in a distributed system
  • Ensure the integrity, availability, and confidentiality of data, database systems, and supporting services; optimize performance of database and data warehouse infrastructure
  • Work with architects, product managers, and engineers to ensure adherence to best practices and data standards
  • Collaborate with analysts and data scientists as a front line contact for Big Data to help them extract even more value from data, and to help the engineers set data up for maximum value.
  • Act as the technical point of contact for architectural changes and improvements to a world-class data and analytics infrastructure
title: Technical Data Analyst

description:
Are you a financial analyst who wants a hand in business development analysis? If so, then you have to hear about this opportunity. Beacon Resources is working on behalf of their client in the Conejo Valley. We are looking for a Sales and Data Analyst to join our client.

Our client is in the health care industry and is in constant acquisition mode. This Sales and Data Analyst will provide a blend of financial analytical responsibilities with exposure to business development budgeting and strategic analysis. You, as the hired Sales and Data Analyst, will have a key role in driving the growth of the company with well-written reports to management.

SALES AND DATA ANALYST DUTIES

  • Review financial statements of proposed acquisition targets to estimate profitability of target
  • Performing budgeting, forecasting, and variance analysis of projected v. actual revenues and expenses
  • Analyze business trends that will impact on any proposed acquisitions or divestitures
  • Recommend course(s) of action as relating to proposed acquisition or divestiture deal
  • Other ad-hoc financial and analytical duties as needed

SALES AND DATA ANALYST QUALIFICATIONS (REQUIRED)

  • At least two (2) years of analytics experience A Bachelors’ degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business Administration or equivalent work experience

SALES AND DATA ANALYST QUALIFICATIONS (PREFERRED)

  • A Masters of Business Administration (M.B.A.) or a Certificate of Public Accounting (C.P.A.) license
  • Experience with budgeting
  • Experience with valuations

SALES AND DATA ANALYST JOB SKILLS (REQUIRED)

  • Ability to understand and communicate complex financial information data and concepts to other members of the Finance team and C-level executives
  • Ability to read and analyst financial statements
  • Extensive use of Microsoft Excel (VLOOKUP’s, pivot-tables, IF formulas)

SALES AND DATA ANALYST JOB SKILLS (PREFERRED)

  • Experience with a CRM system such as Salesforce or ACT-1

For further information, submit your resume in MS Word format. I will hold all inquiries in the strictest confidence.

description:
POSITION SUMMARY:

The Business Analyst – is responsible for the coordination and tactical management of new projects with little supervision. Support the development and management of the project's business case. Define client requirements and project specifications. Analyze and discuss the potential risks and benefits of technology solutions. Monitor projects on an ongoing basis, evaluating progress and quality, managing issue resolution process and taking corrective action as necessary.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Serve as a Liaison between both business and technical teams driving effective timely solutions to fulfill strategic and operational needs
  • Work with SMEs in all Servicing areas in developing solutions related to data management and reporting
  • Develop data requirements and source-to-target data mappings for a creating a centralized data repository from multiple disparate sources.
  • Ensure proper integration of data solutions into existing reporting environments
  • Ability to understand the underlying data sources and business derivations and documenting
  • Understand logical and physical data models and ensure proper design and flow of information across the applications
  • Apply business validation and analytic skills to ensure high data quality
  • Proactively identify and promote leveraging of successful services and processes from across the firm
  • Perform Data Analysis, deep data investigative (SQL) capabilities - combine that with Business knowledge in Mortgage, Default areas
  • Analyze and develop data requirements and source-to-target (data) mappings for a creating a single-source-of-truth-type data warehouse solution (drawing from multiple desperate sources into one)
  • Ensure proper integration of new (data) solutions into existing (reporting) environments
  • Ability to understand the underlying data sources and business derivations and documenting
  • Interact with Business team, stakeholders and prepare Business Requirements Documents and presentations to IT teams
  • Understand logical and physical data models and ensure proper design and flow of information across the applications
  • Apply business validation and analytic skills to ensure high data quality
  • Proactively identify and promote leveraging of successful services and processes from across the firm
  • Perform all other duties as assigned

ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS

  • Excellent verbal and written skills, including ability to write clearly, concisely, and logically
  • Ability to work well with all levels of management, staff and third party vendors
  • Ability to research, gather background information, and analyze complex data
  • Use of systematic, organized, proactive approach to resolve problems and issues
  • Strong knowledge of Rushmore policies, procedures and processes
  • Strong knowledge of MSP and Navision
  • Ability to handle fast paced, multi task projects

EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent

  • 5+ years of Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Reporting Analyst, Project Management experience

title: Business Analyst

description:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to share, and make the world more open and connected. Through our growing family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that helps billions of people around the world connect and share what matters most to them. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to make the world more open and accessible. Connecting the world takes every one of us—and we're just getting started. Facebook designs, builds and operates one of the largest and fastest growing Content Delivery Networks in the world. The Edge Network team is responsible for egress capacity for all products, including Facebook Newsfeed, Live, Messenger, Instagram, WhatsApp, Oculus, and more. We are looking for the right person to lead a global team of talented network professionals to engage with ISP partners to identify and solve a wide array of challenges in both developed and emerging markets. Our goals of enabling massive scalability, reliable serving, and fantastic performance are critical to put video at the heart of all our apps and services.

Facebook is looking for someone with a strong desire to influence Facebook's network and software build plans by bringing together multiple large datasets around product performance, reliability, network metrics, & location. This is a highly collaborative role that will require working with many teams across network planning & engineering, CDN & product software engineering, technical program management, and more. Any day could include providing engineers with data to understand the impact of their latest software deployments in markets and network conditions across the globe, or working with network planners to visualize performance and reliability data to share with ISPs to help them improve their networks. The responsibilities of the role are diverse and flexible, with opportunity to expand over time. This position is full time and based in our headquarters in Menlo Park and will report directly to the Director of Edge Network and CDN. Work cross functionally with highly technical software and network infrastructure teams, understand their goals, collect data, and produce analyses to inform future direction for individuals and teams.
Communicate final recommendations and drive decision making to key stakeholders.
Leverage data, engineering and business principles to solve large scale web, mobile and data infrastructure challenges.
Leverage tools like PHP, Python, Hadoop & SQL to drive efficient analytics and decision making. As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Facebook is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.

We are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-ext@fb.com or you may call us at 1+650-308-7837.
title: Edge Network Data Analyst

description:
Learner’s Digest International publishes continuing medical education activities for an international audience of physicians, nurses, and other healthcare professionals. Our mission is to help these clinicians take better care of patients. Learner’s Digest International is accredited by several national accrediting bodies, and each year we issue in excess of one million Category 1 credits. Our customers tell us regularly that a lesson learned on one of our programs made a difference in how they treated a patient the very next day. Learner’s Digest International’s headquarters are located in Glendale, California.

The Data Analyst - Marketing position will report to the Senior Manager of Financial Planning & Analysis but their primary customer will be the Marketing department. This role will assist marketing with data and retention analysis, support monthly financial reporting and work on marketing and finance special projects. The Data Analyst will partner closely with marketing and IT to synthesize data from the fulfillment system and provide key recommendations to the business.

The Data Analyst position requires strong systems knowledge and will work closely with the Retention Manager to focus on renewal sales and new customer prospecting. This position will build segmentation and prospecting models designed to elicit the strongest customer responses.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Marketing Database and Reporting:

• Work with marketing department to assess, define, and develop report deliverables to meet their requirements.
• Support the design of appropriate data repository and reporting tools that will be used to organize, analyze, and report data.
• Query data bases to extract information needed to develop reports and support the development of standard reports.

Customer Data Quality:

• Research and integrate data sources for target marketing purposes.
• Interpret, analyze and provide recommendations regarding data accuracy and data collection needs and processes.
• Work with IT to identify opportunities to enhance existing and to develop new data information processes and tools.

Marketing Analytics:

• Transform data into actionable insight through the use of business intelligence and analytics tools.
• Perform hands on analysis of marketing and sales data to develop insights and make recommendations on areas for optimization and strategy.
• Develop predictive models to support effective targeting for customer acquisition and retention.
• Analyze the financial implications of marketing strategies and translate them into reporting requirements and forecasts.
• Participate and support staff training related to data collection and reporting.

Qualifications:
Education: Bachelor's degree in Economics, Finance, Accounting, Mathematics, Marketing, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics preferred, or equivalent experience required.

Required Experience:

3+ years of proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst including:

• Experience in a dynamic corporate analysis environment, preferably with tiered reporting.
• Technical expertise regarding data mining and segmentation techniques.
• Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (such as Tableau, etc.) and databases (such as SQL, etc.).
• Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (such as Excel, SPSS, SAS, R, KNIME, etc.).
• Strong analytical skills and previous experience collecting, organizing, analyzing, and disseminating significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.

Preferred Experience:

• Programming experience with XML, JavaScript, or ETL frameworks a plus.
• Ability to diagnose issues quickly and communicate effectively.

Travel: 5 – 10%, minimal travel required.

About Wolters Kluwer

Wolters Kluwer N.V. (AEX: WKL) is a global leader in information services and solutions for professionals in the health, tax and accounting, risk and compliance, finance and legal sectors. We help our customers make critical decisions every day by providing expert solutions that combine deep domain knowledge with specialized technology and services.

Wolters Kluwer reported 2015 annual revenues of €4.2 billion. The company, headquartered in Alphen aan den Rijn, the Netherlands, serves customers in over 180 countries, maintains operations in over 40 countries and employs 19,000 people worldwide. Wolters Kluwer shares are listed on Euronext Amsterdam (WKL) and are included in the AEX and Euronext 100 indices.

For more information about our solutions and organization, visit www.wolterskluwer.com, follow us on Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, and YouTube.

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY
Wolters Kluwer U. S. Corporation and all of its subsidiaries, divisions and customer/business units is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

INFORMATION
For any assistance with your application for this job opening, please call the HR Source at (888) 495-4772 or email HRSource@WoltersKluwer.com. TTY is also available at (888) 495-4771.

description:
Under general direction, the Sr. Enterprise Systems Data Analyst coordinates, manages and/or participates in activities related to the design, configuration and implementation of ACADIA’s information systems, related integrations, and Data Warehouse initiatives. You will participate and at times lead in the analysis and resolution of issues related to information flow and content with our Business Customers, IT management and staff. title: Data Analyst

description:
Includes design, testing, implementation, control and maintenance of organization's logical and relational databases across platforms and computing environments.

Essential Functions:
• Project Management: Manages small to medium size projects. Develops and executes project plans. Provides project reporting to project sponsor under guidance of higher level resource.
• Meta Data Repository: Develops data definitions consistent with data management standards and conventions. Defines meta data structures for information repository and performs model management.
• Data Design (logical): Analyzes business information requirements and translates these into logical database designs. Collaborates with physical database designers to develop alternative solutions for meeting complex and conflicting requirements. Develops data definitions consistent with data management standards and conventions. Participates in model integration and convergence activities.
• Database Development (physical): Develops, tests and implements the organization's physical databases across multiple platforms, technologies and computing environments.
• Database Performance: Provides support to Lead in capacity planning, forecasting, and tuning. Develops performance/tuning evaluation reports.
• Communications: Communicates business/information models to clients, developers and database designers. Communicates database designs to data analyst and application programming staff.
• Technology Evaluation: Researches and evaluates alternative database solutions and recommends the most efficient and cost-effective solution for the project, ensuring consistency with enterprise direction.
• Methodologies and Standards: Recommends development of or adoption/incorporation of new methodologies and standards for supporting information management.
• Database Management and Support Tools: Implements, configures and customizes database management and support tools.
• Client Consulting: Consults with clients and development areas in the design and implementation of small to medium projects. Consults with clients to determine information management requirements.
• Training/Mentoring: Provides direction, guidance, and technical support to clients, applications, and operations areas. Develops technical and analytical skills of lower level resources.
• Data Transformation: Designs, develops and tests complex transformation extract s and load routines.
• Database Maintenance: Provides second level diagnosis and resolution of database problems. Works with vendor personnel, if necessary, to achieve timely solutions of database problems. Escalates as necessary and provides problem resolutions.

Qualifications
title: Data Management Senior

description:
The Technical Data Analyst role is the backbone of GreatSchools’ data pipeline, executing high volume, complex ETL projects on a wide variety of data inputs such as test scores, school characteristics, directory, course enrollment, college readiness, postsecondary outcomes, and others. This work includes ETL work on heterogeneous inputs, the use of a variety of data processing tools and languages, and will require collaboration with roles spanning the data pipeline, including acquisitions and strategy upstream, and software engineering and data science / analytics downstream. This position reports to the Data Engineer. It is a full-time, exempt position located in Oakland, CA.

Responsibilities
  • Own processing and loading of data files for display on the website and integration into data feeds
  • Own performance of thorough quality assurance analysis before and after loading data
  • Support Data Engineer by identifying process improvement opportunities, and work to implement tool enhancements that support increased automation of data loading
  • Execute data quality control standards according to Data Governance guidelines during loading and load QA
  • Support Data Engineer in solving data structure and architecture problems
  • Aid Data Engineer in support of Engineering
  • Support Data Operations Analysts in data coverage and quality reporting
Qualifications
  • BA plus 1 year of work in a related field.
  • 1+ years of experience with SQL, relational database management, and familiarity with working in a shell interface.
  • Proficiency with Excel, including formulas, filtering and data formatting.
  • Experience with a scripting language such as Ruby, Perl or Python (Ruby preferred).
  • Self-starter; ability to work independently and as a strong contributor to team projects.
  • Extremely detail-oriented and organized.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects, work within tight deadlines, and prioritize work as necessary.
  • Positive work ethic, sense of humor, and contributor to our fun work environment.
  • Experience working with K-12 education data, analytics or data science tools, automated reporting, work in a non-profit, and a passion for the
  • GreatSchools mission, to help parents get a great education for their kids are pluses.
  • Experience working in an Agile software development framework or with a statistical programming language (R) are big pluses.
How to apply

Please submit a cover letter, including salary requirements, along with your résumé. Your cover letter should include reasons why you want to work at GreatSchools. Résumés without cover letters will not be considered. No phone calls please.

description:
Oakland, CA

The Surface Forces Logistics Center (SFLC) is the single logistics center for the Coast Guard (CG) surface fleet, providing engineering, maintenance, supply, and technical information services to 242 cutters and over 1,800 boats stationed throughout the United States. The SFLC core workforce is comprised of approximately 1,800 employees geographically distributed across the U.S. Its mission is to provide the surface fleet and other assigned assets with depot level maintenance, engineering, supply, logistics and information services to support Coast Guard missions.

We are seeking a Maintenance and Logistics Data Analyst in support of the Long Range Enforcer Product Line (LREPL).

Responsibilities:
: Review, analyze, and process configuration data from multiple government maintained data sources provided in various formats for the purpose of maintaining accurate configurations for each of the WHEC/WMEC/WAGB/WMSL hulls in FLS/NESSS

: Complete Reliability-Centered Maintenance (RCM) analysis when required by the Coast Guard. RCM is used to develop maintenance requirements for systems affected by design changes. RCM analysis documentation shall be submitted to the Coast Guard for review and approval

: Provide assistance in conducting formal Mini- Maintenance Effectiveness Review (Mini-MER)'s, using SFLC Engineering Services Division Mini-MER model, each fiscal quarter analyzing systems as directed by the COR. Appropriately plan and execute Mini-MERs, gather relative data, schedule meetings, compile reports, and manage approved recommendation updates

: Conduct evaluations on HM&E; and ELEX maintenance and logistics support for planned and emergency repairs of Coast Guard Cutters as requested by the COR. Analyze cause of casualty, and make recommendations to change maintenance practices to preserve functionality and achieve the highest reliability at the lowest life cycle cost

: Analyze SFLC LREPL business practices to include but not limited to working hours, cutter deployment profile, scheduling, scope of dockside and dry dock repair availabilities, stocking of and pushing parts, and deficiencies in organization/depot level maintenance. Make recommendations to resolve issues

: Provide other sustainment support in the areas of Configuration Management for the WHEC/WMEC/WAGB/WMSL Classes as directed by the COR

Qualifications:
: 4 years' of experience preferred providing USCG entities with HM&E; and Electronics Configuration Data & Maintenance Management for various CG assets, which shall include, but is not limited to, 282' WMEC, 378' WHEC, 399' WAGB, 418' WMSL and 420' WAGB

: RCM certification preferred

: Technical experience in the operation, repair, and support of Hull, Mechanical, and Electrical (HM&E;), and/or Electronics, and/or Ordnance, and/or Navy Type Navy Owned (NTNO) equipment Basic understanding of Preventative and Corrective maintenance principals, MPC development, and corresponding MPC accomplishment

: Knowledge of the Coast Guard Surface Forces Logistics Center (SFLC) supply support procedures

: Have basic understanding of Preventative and Corrective maintenance principals, MPC development, and corresponding MPC accomplishment

: Possess good verbal skills to engage commercial vendors to acquire cost data, availability, and technical documentation

: Proficient in the use of Coast Guard Standard Workstation III

: Experience in Microsoftr Power Pointc, Microsoftr Wordc, Microsoftr Accessc, Microsoft Paintr, Microsoftr Excelc, and Microsoftr Projectc

Applicants selected will be subject to a U.S. Government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

description:
Rockstar Games (developers of Grand Theft Auto, Max Payne, Red Dead Redemption, L.A. Noire, Bully & more) is seeking an experienced data analyst to join our growing Analytics practice and help build Rockstar’s business intelligence capacity. Successful candidates will work with analytics and product leadership to assure that the most relevant possible real-time and historical data is identified, tracked, analyzed, and made actionable across all of our titles.

RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Partner with analysts and live producers to identify strategic business questions, key metrics, and actionable insights.
  • Provide consumer-ready analysis and reporting to Analytics team leadership, live producers, product managers and partner groups.
  • Assure Rockstar’s ongoing competitive advantage through best-in-class business and game data analysis.
  • Initiate and carry out research aligned with long-term, strategic initiatives.
  • Drive needle moving improvements via hands-on exploration of data, dashboards, statistical analysis and predictive modeling.
  • Combine qualitative and quantitative driven insights with game knowledge to recommend potential avenues to the game and business teams.
  • Advise analytics and engineering leadership on the build-out and ongoing development of a unified data platform across all Rockstar studios and products.
  • Work within a team of data analysts and engineers.
QUALIFICATIONS
  • 2+ years in a similar position or an analytics role in the marketing, finance, forensics, or technology fields.
  • Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Operational Research, Business Intelligence or any other relevant field).
  • Graduate degree (MBA, MSc or master’s, PHD), an asset.
  • Extensive knowledge of data analysis techniques, languages, software and systems (SAS, R, Matlab, Python, SPSS, Tableau) required.
  • Fluency in SQL (or a SQL-like language) required, other programming experience highly preferred.
  • Experience with Vertica and Hadoop, an asset.
  • Game industry experience strongly desired.
SKILLS
  • Ability to develop and maintain good relations and communicate with people at all hierarchical levels.
  • Strong problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to reconcile technical and business perspectives.
  • Autonomy and entrepreneurship.
  • Strong team spirit.
  • Passion for Rockstar Games and our titles.
title: Big Data Analyst

description:
St. Jude Medical is now Abbott
We are seeking an experienced, high caliber Data Analyst II Postmarket Surveillance. The individual will be responsible for the data analysis of all facets of customer complaint handling (Postmarket Surveillance) data. The data requested is utilized for many purposes including but not limited to: further analysis of specific issues, regulator and management reporting and trending analysis. The duties for this position require a thorough knowledge of the development and maintenance of: the information systems in use for customer complaints, the data reporting package and data repository in use. This position requires excellent communication skills, initiative, ingenuity, database management skills, data retrieval and statistical analysis. Additionally, this role provides improvement suggestions/ input to Sr. Management in order to ensure effective data reporting and analysis and timely customer communication are continuously maintained and improved.

Each employee can make a difference at St. Jude Medical and has the power, either individually or as a team, to influence the success of the company. We are team-oriented, fast-paced and progressive. We value people with great ideas who partner with others both internally and externally to take action and accomplish goals.

Impact this role will have on St. Jude Medical:
  • Conducts the retrieval of data as requested
    • Actively participates in understanding the intended use/purpose of the data requested

    • Works with Postmarket Surveillance team to ensure the accuracy of the data puled to fulfill the intended use/ purpose


  • Provide various forms of statistical data analysis and presentations for both internal and external customers
    • This may include data for presentations such as management review, operations review and/or quality review

    • This position will require conducting research, verification and validation of data sources


  • Assist Regulatory Affairs with reporting requirement requests from regulatory agencies (FDA, Notified Body, Distributor, etc.) by pulling related data

  • Interface with other departments, such as Sales/Clinical, Clinical Affairs, R&D;, Manufacturing Engineering, Technical Services, Quality Assurance, etc. to obtain additional information to ensure data pulled is accurate
    • Leads and/or participates in cross-functional meetings as necessary to drive actions associated with process improvements


  • Apply innovation skills to improve the input content and the output (queries, reports, etc.) of the complaint database

  • Support all Company initiatives as identified by management and in support of Quality Management Systems (QMS), Environmental Management Systems (EMS), and other regulatory requirements

  • Complies with U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) regulations, other regulatory requirements, Company policies, operating procedures, processes, and task assignments
    • Maintains positive and cooperative communications and collaboration with all levels of employees, customers, contractors, and vendors


  • Performs other related duties and responsibilities, on occasion, as assigned

Your experience(s), education and knowledge will further expand St. Jude Medical’s marketplace success:
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent industry experience required

  • 3+ years’ experience in a manufacturing environment
    • Medical Device experience preferred


  • Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities

  • Strong Microsoft Office capabilities required

  • Experience with automated database systems
    • Knowledge and experience with InfoMed and SAP Enterprise Software highly desirable


  • Ability to query and refine data into summarized results

  • Experience with Microsoft SQL Server, Reporting Services, Analysis Services, a plus

  • Experience working in a broader enterprise/cross-division business unit model preferred

  • Ability to work in a highly matrixed and geographically diverse business environment

  • Ability to work within a team and as an individual contributor in a fast-paced, changing environment

  • Ability to leverage and/or engage others to accomplish projects

  • Strong verbal and written communications with ability to effectively communicate at multiple levels in the organization

  • Multitasks, prioritizes and meets deadlines in timely manner

  • Strong organizational and follow-up skills, as well as attention to detail

  • Ability to maintain regular and predictable attendance

  • Preferred experience in data retrieval and reporting, advanced database skills

  • Knowledge of Quality tools/methodologies

  • Solid communication and interpersonal skills

  • Advanced computer skills, including statistical/data analysis and report writing skills

  • Experience working in a broader enterprise/cross-division business unit model preferred

  • Ability to work in a highly matrixed and geographically diverse business environment

  • Ability to work within a team and as an individual contributor in a fast-paced, changing environment

  • Ability to leverage and/or engage others to accomplish projects

  • Strong verbal and written communications with ability to effectively communicate at multiple levels in the organization

  • Multitasks, prioritizes and meets deadlines in timely manner

  • Strong organizational and follow-up skills, as well as attention to detail

  • Ability to maintain regular and predictable attendance

Your preferred qualifications and education:
  • BS degree in Engineering or Technical Field or equivalent experience;

  • Preferred experience in data retrieval and reporting, advanced database skills

  • Preferred knowledge of SJM complaint handling process and data
title: Data Analyst II, Postmarket Surveillance

description:
Program Data Analyst

Easter Seals Bay Area is in a period of expanded vision and planned growth! This is an exciting time to join our dynamic team of people who are passionate about their work!

At Easter Seals Bay Area, our employees are our greatest asset. By joining Easter Seals Bay Area as an employee, you will have the opportunity to help individuals’ with disabilities and special needs address life’s challenges, achieve personal goals, and gain greater independence for everyday living. The people who make up the Easter Seals Bay Area team are creating solutions and changing lives for individuals with disabilities and special needs, families, and communities throughout all nine Bay Area counties and 15 northern California counties. Join us and let's make a difference together!

Essential Job Functions:
We are looking for a passionate Program Data Analyst to turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. The Program Data Analyst will compile performance metrics, make recommendations based upon the data, and present the information in a clear and detailed manner.

Responsibilities:
Uses a computer with word processing, spreadsheet, database and presentation software to produce and edit letters, memoranda, reports, or other materials from rough drafts or notes

Works to optimize the work environment for employee success as ESBA continues to expand globally. We are doing groundbreaking research in how to drive changes across the business by creating models of employee behavior, team interaction, and organizational engagement

Should have an advanced quantitative background, be comfortable enough with research methodologies to tackle abstract business problems with well-backed solutions, and bring enthusiasm to the challenge of better understanding human behavior

Able to translate business objectives into actionable analyses and communicate findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences

Research mindset – ability to structure a project from idea to experimentation to implementation

Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports

Work with lead program data analyst to implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data integrity

Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets as guided by supervisor

Work closely with supervisor to prioritize business and information needs through the use of Agile methodologie

Participate in special projects, and assist with additional duties or tasks, as assigned Attends staff meetings, in-services, trainings, and other meetings as requested by management

Completes additional job duties as assigned by Supervisor

Data Cleaning

Attaining and achieving position competencies in relation to role responsibilities.

Minimum Education & Minimum Years of Additional Related Experience :

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Quantitative Research or I/O Psychology, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics is highly preferred

Minimum of 3 years of experience in a data analyst capacity is preferred

Technical expertise regarding data models

Knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc.) and databases

Knowledge of statistis and experience using statistical packages for analyzing large datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc.)

Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy

Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings

Human Services or Healthcare industry experience preferred

Qualifications:
Ability to work effectively and efficiently in a team environment and relate well to others

Ability to show initiative and commitment to ESBA’s goals and mission

Ability to readily adapt to changing requirements

Strong commitment to performing and producing at the highest level of quality at all times

Ability to manage individual workflow effectively and improve processes when necessary

Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with coworkers both in written and verbal communications

Sensitivity to working with an ethnically, linguistically, culturally, and economically diverse population

Ability to exercise confidentiality and discretion pertaining to the work environment

Able to consistently demonstrate good judgment and decision-making skills

High level of organizational skills and attention to detail

Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite programs and EMR systems is desirable

Ability to obtain and maintain criminal record clearance through the Department of Justice. The People & Performance department must analyze DOJ/FBI live scan reports in accordance with applicable federal, State and local laws as well as fitness for position.

Work may be demanding and require quick problem analysis and decision-making

Physical Requirements:
Ability to sit for extended periods of time up to and including 6-8 hours a day.

Frequent speaking and listening (25-75%) to clients, staff, and others in the workplace.

Visual and auditory ability to work with staff and others in the workplace continuously.

Ability to utilize computer, cell phone (iphone), fax machine, telephone and copy machine.

Frequent proofreading and checking documents for accuracy.

Must be able to communicate effectively within the workplace, read and write using the primary language within the workplace.

Easter Seals Bay Area is an Equal Opportunity Employer

description:

title: Data Analyst - Sr

description:
Netflix is a company that is transforming the way we watch television. We are leading the SVOD business and as we develop markets globally, we are looking to build teams with very high concentrations of talent. Customer Service is one of the few verticals in which we clearly hear the sentiments of our customers. At Netflix, we take Customer Satisfaction very seriously, continuously driving satisfaction higher, by listening to what our customers tell us.

We are looking for an exceptional, highly driven Data Analyst that will take Customer Service analytics to the next level. A critical thinker who thinks ‘outside the box’ to find creative, elegant ways to use rich data to improve CS KPIs, such as customer satisfaction and agent efficiency. You will be working directly with CS Leadership, Operations, Product Managers and Engineering teams, partnering to drive decisions and to support clearly articulated directional recommendations. You will present your findings and use data to tell compelling stories.

Responsibilities:


  • Provide decision-support to Engineering and Customer Service teams by performing descriptive, statistical analysis and building presentations on a daily basis
  • Mine through CS data to develop deep analysis producing meaningful insights that will lead to improving customer satisfaction, operational efficiency and drive key CS decisions
  • Translate unstructured, complex business problems into a mathematical framework
  • Provide expert advice and education in the area of statistical analysis






Qualifications:


  • Essential:
  • Strong expertise in mining data to pull meaningful, actionable insights and building comprehensive, descriptive analysis to support and present your findings
  • Strong statistical background that will allow you to apply various statistical techniques to support your analysis
  • Extensive experience writing SQL on various RDBMS (Oracle, Teradata, MySQL etc.)
  • Experience working with analytical tools to support data analysis, reporting and visualization (MicroStrategy, Tableau, R, etc.)
  • Enjoyment of creating impressive visualizations that make data insights easily digestible
  • Excellent communication skills: written, verbal and presentation skills is a must
  • Passionate about data and insights, extremely curious, with great attention to detail
  • B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science, MIS, Engineering or related field


  • Desired:
  • Some experience in predictive analytics / statistical modeling / text analytics
  • Experience working with distributed computing tools, such as Spark, MapReduce or other NoSQL or scripting experience
  • Experience programming with languages such as Python, Java
  • Understanding of Data Warehouse concepts
  • Experience in Customer Service analytics








A few more things to know:


  • We expect a lot. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about Netflix at jobs.
title: Senior Data Analyst, Customer Service Analytics

description:
Role: Manager, Quality Data

Duration: Full Time

Location: Los Angeles, CA

Job Summary:

  • The Manager, HOA Quality Data Manager is an important role on a the quality data team.
  • This position who will works closely with technical, clinical, and compliance personnel to assure accurate and timely delivery of HEDIS and Survey data to regulatory entities, partners and other stakeholders.
  • The Manager, HOA Quality Data Manager plays a key role in optimizing data procurement and streamlining operational processes for ETL.
  • This manager position is responsible for the performance of the HEDIS data analysts which includes Lead Analyst, Sr. Data Analyst, other Data Analysts and Survey Analysts.
  • This position is responsible for data process regarding HEDIS and Surveys, including Member and Provider experience, Health Outcomes and others which together are used for NCQA accreditation and provider, group and plan partner performance management.
  • This position will creates and maintains policies and procedures relevant to the HEDIS and Survey data process involving rate calculations and reports and quality assurance checkpoints. This position in this role will also coordinates with vendors, provider groups and plan partners to maximize data completeness, analyzing quality data results to identify improvement opportunities.
  • In addition to these responsibilities, this position works with product evaluation, reviews and manages the budget, accounts for variations, works with the legal advisor on review and vetting of proposals and contracts, participates in compliance audits such as HEDIS, NCQA and others as needed and will contribute to executive summary documentation and presentations on outcomes.
  • The Manager participates in Quality Improvement initiatives and committee meetings.
  • The Manager in this role will have a pivotal role in the success of public reporting and data process efficiency are of utmost importance.

Standard Duties and Responsibilities:

  • "Manages the HEDIS and Survey Projects: Updates internal policies and procedures that pertain to functions related to data process, data collection, and HIPAA compliance. Present to groups as needed." - 20%
  • "Staff support and administration, Works with staff to set up incentive goals, and work metrics, Monitors activity to assure staff are engaged., Works with the technical staff to develop databases for data capture and reporting, Conducts verbal or written counseling, writes performance improvement plans, and resolves issues impacting productivity." - 20%
  • "Works with and presents to Plan Partners and provider groups to optimize data quality and completeness" - 10%
  • Works with the technical staff to produce and assure the delivery of reports for submissions required by NCQA, CMS, MRMIB, and other regulatory or accreditation agencies - 10%
  • Resolves issues impacting delays in timelines, staffing, and/or production - 10%
  • Initiates and participates in performance/quality improvement initiatives and workgroups - 10%
  • Sets work standards and monitors production as indicated by the project plan - 5%
  • Oversight of data vendor services - 5%

Important skills required:

8 years of clinical outcomes review and quality data experience with strong skills in data validation with at least 6 years of progressive management experience with a good skill to communicate with technical staff in a NCQA accredited health plan.

Experience with HEDIS (at least 3 years) and Surveys (for example, CAHPS, CG-CAHPS, CAHPS- MAPD, QHP-EES, HOS, etc.).

Advanced SAS programming skills working with data types such as membership, provider, claims and encounters (5 years preferred). Working knowledge of MS Access, Excel, and Word software. Able to manage project timelines, requested deliverables and developing and maintaining prioritization thereof.

Preferred:

Certified HEDIS auditor, RN, LN, RHIA, RHIT, or certification from a nationally recognized Quality Improvement or Project Management program

Job Type: Full-time

Job Location:

  • Los Angeles, CA

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • HEDIS: 3 years
title: Manager, Quality Data (Healthcare)

title: Data Analyst - 6510645

description:
At Nuna, our mission is to make high-quality healthcare affordable for everyone. We are dedicated to tackling one of our nation’s biggest problems with ingenuity, creativity, and a keen moral compass.

Nuna is committed to simple principles: a rigorous understanding of data, modern technology, and most importantly, compassion and care for our fellow human. We want to know what really works, what doesn't—and why.

Nuna partners with healthcare payers, including self-insured companies and the United States government, to turn data into learnings and information into meaning.

If you share this passion, join us!

--------------------
Nuna Data Operations
--------------------

Data Operations is at the core of Nuna’s promise to deliver exceptional and actionable data insights to our clients. Responsible for the scalable comprehension, ingestion, cleaning, and deploying of client data on schedule, Data Operations act as the heart muscle that pumps data throughout Nuna. Quality and consistency are our hallmarks, so we are more than a little obsessed with detail and process. Nuna is looking for an ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) Data Analyst for the Data Operations team, responsible for performing a range of functions in the areas of problem recording, problem resolution, problem escalation, data mapping, and file tracking.

----------------
Responsibilities
----------------

  • Ingest and track data from various healthcare carriers.
  • Manage monthly cleaning and data quality testing.
  • Deliver monthly database updates on schedule.
  • Translate data into Nuna Standard schema.
  • Use internal SQL-based systems to import, process, and clean client-supplied data files in various formats.
  • Operate closely with cross-functional teams (e.g., client services, data science, engineering, etc.).
  • Closely review pre- and post-processed data to ensure data accuracy and integrity, using excellent QA skills.
  • Work equally well in both technical and non-technical environments and effectively communicate technical information in a common, non-technical manner.
  • Provide data support and serve as a technical resource in resolving client issues related to database or other data issues.
  • Organize and prioritize projects and assignments efficiently to meet deadlines.
------------
Requirements
------------

  • 2+ years experience working with data and databases.
  • Experience with relational database system.
  • Experience using SQL or other query and scripting languages to aggregate, gather, and manipulate data.
  • Experience with data quality processes, data quality checks, validations, data quality metrics definition and measurement.
  • Strong oral and written communication skills.
  • [Bonus] Experience with data warehouse and ETL architectures and concepts.
  • [Bonus] Healthcare experience.
  • [Bonus] Data manipulation skills using text processing utilities, Python, and/or Java.
  • [Bonus] Familiarity with distributed version control systems, such as GIT.
------

------

Nuna is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics and/or veteran status.
title: ETL Data Analyst

description:
The successful candidate with use skills as a seasoned, experienced research professional with a strong understanding of fundamental statistical analyses and / or research software programming techniques. The Data Analyst, Global Brain Health Institute (GBHI,) will have sufficient programming skills to manipulate and merge complex datasets to support all research database querying needs. He/she will demonstrate good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions. He/she will work independently informed by partnerships with faculty and trainees and with oversight by the GBHI Deputy Director.

The individual will work primarily with trainees at UCSF but may work with faculty across sites, including new sites added across the world. Across the UCSF Memory and Aging Center (MAC), there are several additional training programs in neurobehavioral and neuropsychology, among others, each with some trainees who require access to dataset in order to be transformational in their field of work. The individual will work with all trainees and faculty at the MAC, as time allows.

NEUROLOGY
Global Brain Health Institute (GBHI) is housed within the UCSF Memory and Aging Center (MAC) and works to reduce the scale and impact of dementia locally and globally by training and supporting a new generation of leaders to develop and translate research evidence and innovation into more informed and effective policy and practice. Established in 2015, this innovative program supports intensive training of 16 successful applicants annually at UCSF and 16 at Trinity College Dublin.

ABOUT UCSF
The University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences and health professions, and excellence in patient care. It is the only campus in the 10-campus UC system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences.

Required Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree in related area and / or equivalent experience / training
• Thorough skills associated with systems programming. Knowledge and experience programming in SAS and SQL
• Thorough skills in analysis and consultation
• Skills to communicate complex information in a clear and concise manner both verbally and in writing
• Skills in project management
• Database analysis skills at a level to evaluate alternate solutions and develop recommendations
• Strong written and oral communication skills, attention to detail, and excellent interpersonal skills

Note: Fingerprinting and background check required.

Preferred Qualifications
• Interest in topics of neurology and neurodegenerative diseases

License/Certification
n/a

Position Type
Full Time

Percentage
100%
title: Data Analyst, GBHI

description:
CLINICAL PHARMACY
We are an organization of people—clinical pharmacists, researchers, administrators, scholars and staff—all focused always on ensuring patients benefit from the safe and effective use of medicines to treat, prevent, and cure disease. To do this we care for patients, teach tomorrow’s pharmacists, mentor those who have already earned degrees, serve the public, and study questions that involve everything from how to eliminate medication errors in hospitals to the influence of industry on the outcome of research results.

JOB OVERVIEW
Under supervision and with instruction from the PI, the Data analyst will support research to determine the economic impact of the current methods of payment for types of pharmacy goods using a large claims data base. In addition, the data analyst will manage the Medi-Cal and Medicare data bases and conduct statistical analysis for the determination of health care utilization and costs of dementia patients. The data analyst will also conduct statistical analysis using these claims data sets.

Please note: This is a full time contract position that will have an end date attached to it.

ABOUT UCSF
The University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences and health professions, and excellence in patient care. It is the only campus in the 10-campus UC system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences.

Required Qualifications
• Graduation from college with a major in science, math or statistics or a related field, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
• Experience researching literature on-line and summarizing its content
• Experience with using SAS, STATA or other statistical analysis software to analyze data
• Experience analyzing Medi-Cal or Medicare data preferred.
• Ability for critical thinking
• Experience managing study protocols
• Ability to write with cognitive clarity and accuracy
• Demonstrated ability to multitask and quickly prioritize work assignments
• Demonstrate ability to communicate effectively with information sources and colleagues in a professional manner

Preferred Qualifications
• Ability to use SAS STATA or other statistical analysis software to analyze large claims data bases
• Ability to conduct costing using excel spread sheets
• Ability to conduct multivariable statistical analysis
• Experience writing journal articles for submission
• Experience with drug pricing or ability to learn

License/Certification
n/a

Position Type
Full Time

Percentage
100%
