description:
The Data Analytic Consultant provides support in making strategic data-related decisions by analyzing, manipulating, tracking, internally managing and reporting data. These positions function both as a consultant and as a high-level data analyst. The position works with clients to develop the right set of questions/hypotheses, using the appropriate tools/skills to derive the best information to address customer needs.

Essential Functions:
  • Provides consultation to clients, including organizational leadership and guides work towards actionable outcomes.
  • Regularly measures the impact of business decisions on clients and customers.
  • Evaluates effectiveness of actions/programs implemented&makes; recommendations.
  • Works with clients and staff to identify opportunities and methods to improve efficiencies with analysis.
  • Provides support to peers and mentoring to junior staff including: technical&programming; assistance, project management and scoping, documentation review and support.
  • Directs and executes creative analytic approaches that lead to actionable outcomes which further promote organizational goals.
  • Proactively recognizes potential issues, develops plans to address and understands how to communicate these steps to department leadership and clients.
  • Analyzes and develops complex logical db designs, data models, and relational data def in support of corporate and client area info systems requirements.
  • Participates in the development of outcomes and process measures, including technical specifications, to enable measurement and evaluation.
  • Builds sophisticated statistical models and forecasting tools using databases.
  • Defines and frames complex multi-dimensional healthcare issues and develops time tables/processes for decision making.
Daily Responsibilities

:

Run production SQL / SSIS data processes, Excel reports and Tableau dashboards. When issues arise, research and perform data forensics to validate and trouble-shoot business rules and data logic, discuss findings and recommend resolution.

Work with business partners to fully understand business needs for new data/ report requests, design/develop data extracts and/or reports.

As part of the team to adapt and learn the new Hadoop marketing data platform, the candidate will then use the new Hadoop tools to design and develop new reports and data outputs.

Preferred Skills:
A candidate who has advanced skills in writing complex SQL queries and developing data outputs and reports, as well as strong problem-solving skills in trouble-shooting business rules and data logic and coming up with findings.

A candidate who has experience or has the skillsets to learn Hadoop and Tableau to develop datasets and reports.

Advanced skills in data merging, matching, and cleansing data sets from disjoint data sources utilizing advanced programming skills to develop complex T-SQL joins, create stored procedures and SSIS packages in relational databases on SQL server; worked in Oracle database environment as well.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:
Experience

  • Minimum five (5) years of work experience.
Education

  • Bachelor's degree OR four (4) years of experience in a directly related field.
  • High School Diploma or General Education Development (GED) required.
License, Certification, Registration

  • N/A
Additional Requirements:
  • Thorough knowledge of policies, practices and systems.
  • Complete understanding and application of principles, concepts, practices, and standards.
  • Full knowledge of industry practices.
  • Broad application of principles, theories, and concepts in applicable discipline, plus working knowledge of other related fields.
  • Must be able to work in a Labor/Management Partnership environment.
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Bachelor's degree AND five (5) years of work experience OR a master's degree AND three (3) years of work experience preferred.
  • Knowledge of health care industry preferred.
  • Familiarity with Kaiser Permanente health care system preferred.
title: Data Consultant-Marketing

description:
At Glassdoor, our mission is to help people everywhere find a job and company they love. We do that through data science – by matching people with the best jobs for them. This is a hard problem and we are looking for curious and brilliant individuals who are up for revolutionizing the way people find and choose jobs.
Decision Science @ Glassdoor
The Decision Science team drives data-driven strategy and decision making across the company through predictive analytics, testing and optimization. We work on a wide variety of problems. We drive product prioritization and inform business strategy by developing a deep understanding of our users and clients. We work with Product team to build and refine data products, such as personalization to power the site and internal products, such as fraud detection, to improve our business efficiencies. We work with Sales team to score and prioritize leads, with Marketing team to build media models, optimize spend to increase pipeline, with Marketplace to understand elasticity of supply and demand, and work with Finance and Business Operations teams on financial planning and forecasting. If gaining exposure to a wide variety of business functions across a fast-growing company excites you, this is the place to be.
This Role
The Sr. Data Analyst will work within the Decision Science team and focus on helping define and build the best product for our users and customers. We are highly data driven in how we set product direction and optimize product features. In this role, you will be a key collaborator and driver of our product and marketing strategy and optimization.
The ideal candidate will be extremely analytical and demonstrate strong business judgment. You thrive on data, analyses and insights. You ask deep business questions, generate dozens of ideas to solve them, rapidly test them and close your analyses with a solid recommendation. You are extremely results driven.
A sampling of projects –
Construct models and define KPIs that allow us to better understand marketplace dynamics
Conceptualize and build tools and dashboards that empower stakeholders, enabling them to access data and draw insights in a self-serve manner
Leverage data to help us improve jobs performance and translate that into strategic recommendations for our most important accounts

  • Basic computer hardware and software troubleshooting techniques required

  • 5010 transaction standards for healthcare preferred.

description:
Are you the kind of person who believes in changing the world through advanced data analytics and pattern recognition? Do you want to change the way buildings use energy? Do you love a big challenge needing a big solution? If so, this is a great opportunity for you! Controlco is seeking a full-time data analyst to focus on data collected from building systems. This position is located in Pleasant Hill, CA. Controlco is a system integrator and value add automation distributor providing automation products and solutions to process control and energy management industries in North America. Our growth has created several outstanding opportunities. Our success is built on delivering integrated automation solutions to the buildings in the commercial real estate, data center, healthcare, education, and government verticals. Our customers include some of the most prestigious and well known organizations in the world. We help enhance their brand names by providing custom-designed, automated engineering solutions for their facilities. For more information on Controlco, visit our website at http://www.controlco.com

Job Summary: This position is responsible for performing data analysis on millions of data points and billions of rows of time series data collected from applications and solutions in the building automation and controls market. This is commonly referred to as Buildings IoT (Internet of Things). There is an emphasis on identifying patterns in the billions of rows to find waste and inadequate performance of the system(s) operating the building. The goal is to reduce the amount of energy required to operate the building while maintaining ideal comfort, security, and tenant satisfaction. The successful candidates will utilize existing software rules and will develop new rules to further analyze the data once the simple target are identified and solved. Additionally, this role will seek out innovative solutions for key industry segments as by the sales and project teams.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Develop and implement analytics and data strategies.
  • Follow established methods of building data analytics.
  • Demonstrate competency in database and analytics applications.
  • Provide consulting to sales and projects team on results.
  • Work with User Experience team to adequately visualize results for clients.
  • Be responsible for and initiate self-development to elevate job knowledge and self-education.
Education and Experience:
  • Bachelors of Science degree in Operations Research, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or related
  • High levels of logical thinking & problem solving skills
  • Experience in data extraction, data cleansing, data profiling and manipulation for reporting (you can list specific tools if you want, but a tool can be learned)
  • Ability to apply analytical techniques to a wide variety of data
  • Ability to organize material and summarize findings in a clear & concise manner
  • Familiarity with Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel)
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize multiple projects, deadlines and responsibilities
  • Capable of dealing with all levels of management, client executives, and client representatives
  • Prior programming experience a plus
Pay and Benefits: Controlco is an Equal Opportunity Employer. The successful candidate will receive a highly competitive salary depending on qualifications. The overall benefits package includes medical, vision, and dental insurance along with a 401k with company contributions. Paid vacations are offered as well. Email resume to Bridget Davies at bridget@controlco.com for prompt and confidential consideration.

Apply Here

description:
The Data Analyst will support the Director of Data Analytics leading and performing complex data analytics that will drive improved business performance. The Data Quality Analyst must possess and demonstrate acute business acumen. The Data Quality Analyst may work closely with internal stakeholders to secure resources and with the IT department to deliver technology, process, and integration improvements. The Data Quality Analyst must be capable of delivering results despite a shifting environment as well create order from chaos. Maintaining confidentiality and all other aspects of HIPAA compliance are essential in this position.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Performs data analysis including: importing, cleaning, transforming, validating or modeling data with the purpose of understanding or making conclusions from the data.
  • Successfully complete projects that require data mining, analysis and presentations in charts, graphs, and tables.
  • Review and translate high volumes of information; incorporates analysis into project documentation and distributes to involved parties.
  • Report on project activities and provides routine status updates to impacted departments/units.
  • Clearly and accurately defines problem statements to systematically identify data-driven root causes. May provide innovation and effectiveness to solution development, risk mitigation, and execution of risk management plan.
  • Use collaborative skills to influence others, with or without direct authority, to unite groups with diverse perspectives bringing teams to consensus/alignment.
  • Acquire and maintain knowledge of Company products and services, industry challenges, revenue drivers, customer demographics and centralized functions and processes.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.

KNOWLEDGE SKILLS AND ABILITIES :
  • The ability to extract and analyze data, patterns, and related trends in an evolving data environment; the ability to synthesize the data into information consumable by the business.
  • Ability to do detail oriented work.
  • Ability to do root cause analysis of data and reports, trouble shoot, and problem solve.
  • Exceptional problem solving skills and ability to work with diverse client groups.
  • Accepts accountability for actions; drives results and learns from mistakes.
  • Ability to concisely document activities throughout a project and evaluate effectiveness of actions during and after implementation.
  • Ability to promptly identify issues and make quality decisions; resolves problems quickly.
  • Excellent planning and prioritization skills with the ability to multitask.
  • Effective communicator at all levels of an organization; ability to teach and present complex and/or new ideas with clarity and simplicity.
  • Strong customer relationship management.
  • Accepts accountability for actions; drives results and learns from mistakes.
  • Ability to concisely document activities throughout a project and evaluate effectiveness of actions during and after implementation.
  • Ability to build and maintain relationships with stakeholders across the organization.
  • Ability to utilize project-planning tools to organize and manage tasks, and establish and meet deadlines.
  • Demonstrated understanding of business process flows.
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong customer relationship management ability.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
  • Bachelor’s degree in a related field or 4 years of directly related experience substituting for educational requirements. High school diploma or GED required.
  • Requires expertise using Excel 2010 or later for data manipulation and reporting (through pivot tables, lookup tables, and charts), and comfort using VBA in Excel. Also requires experience writing SQL to acquire reporting data. Preference will be given to candidates who have a good understanding of Microsoft SQL Server and SSMS. Familiarity with Windows automation tools like PowerShell and Windows Task Scheduler is a plus.
  • Experience in healthcare a plus.

PHYSICAL EFFORT:

Work time will be spent sitting approximately 90% of the time, standing and walking approximately 10% of work time. PC Keyboarding will constitute approximately 80% of work time. This position may require travel up to 30% of the total time.

description:
Google's brand is only as strong as our users' trust--and their steadfast belief that our guiding principles are what's best for them. Our Trust and Safety team has the critical responsibility of protecting Google's users by ensuring online safety by fighting web abuse and fraud across Google products. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic leader. You understand the user's point of view and are passionate about using your combined technical, sales and customer service acumen to protect our users. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google developers and Product Managers to navigate challenging online safety situations and handle abuse and fraud cases at Google speed (read: fast!). Help us prove that quality on the Internet trumps all.

As a Trust and Safety Data Analyst, you are responsible for protecting the integrity of some of Google's key products, including Google Search, Google Maps, AdWords, Adsense, Google Checkout and Google Product Search. You investigate financial fraud, account-related abuse, questionable business practices, violations of Google's policies, and general misuse of our products. You are introduced to dynamic analytical techniques and you leverage custom-built technology to have a direct impact on improving the experience of millions of Google users. You subscribe to a "user-first" philosophy and are interested in improving Google's user experience and product integrity. You are comfortable navigating ambiguity and thrive in a fast-paced environment. You harness your analytical and technical skills to drive tool development and process improvements. At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Gaining and retaining this trust is critically important to Google’s success. We defend Google's integrity by fighting spam, fraud and abuse, and develop and communicate state-of-the-art product policies. The Trust and Safety team reduces risk and protects the experience of our users and business partners in more than 40 languages and across Google's expanding base of products. We work with a variety of teams from Engineering to Legal, Public Policy and Sales Engineering to set policies and combat fraud and abuse in a scalable way, often with an eye to finding industry-wide solutions. Trust and Safety team members are motivated to find innovative solutions, and use technical know-how, user insights and proactive communication to pursue the highest possible quality and safety standards for users across Google products.

Responsibilities
  • Perform statistical analyses on huge data sets to determine trends and develop business insights in order to protect Google’s users.
  • Utilize machine learning to scale, and optimize and automate our abuse fighting efforts.
  • Assist with designing and building infrastructure to facilitate analysis and experimentation.
  • Develop metrics for measuring and understanding Google’s effectiveness at combating fraud. Conduct investigations into sophisticated forms of abuse, take action on fraudsters and close attack vectors.
  • Translate business needs into data modeling initiatives and work with engineers to put predictive models into production.

Qualifications Minimum qualifications:
  • BS degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Quantitative Social Sciences, related field or equivalent practical experience.
  • 2 years of relevant work experience.
  • Programming experience in one of the following languages: Python, C++ or Java.

Preferred qualifications:
  • MS degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Quantitative Social Sciences or related field.
  • Experience with machine learning, data mining, or building statistical methods.
  • Ability to thrive in a fun, collaborative and fast-paced environment.
title: Data Analyst, Trust and Safety

description:
The primary responsibility of this position is the configuration and day-to-day management of the PeopleSoft Student Records module within the Office of the Graduate and Professional Registrar. This data expert needs to understand the configuration, regular use, and data elements in the PeopleSoft module and translates between business, data, and technical resources. In addition, this position is engaged and focused on initiatives that improve the quality, effectiveness, and services targeted to meet the registration, class scheduling, advising, and graduation requirements for APU graduate students. The Senior Data Analyst writes departmental queries, letters, and reports as appropriate with the escalated assistance of IMT. In addition, this position sets standards for use of software in the unit and serves as the liaison between the department and IMT when technical issues need escalation. This position plays a critical role in training and IT project development.

Required Education

Bachelor’s degree required. Excellent oral and written communication.

Required Experience

Five to Seven years experience configuring and managing higher education student records technology.

Experience in PeopleSoft Campus Solutions required.

Primary Duties/Essential Functions

Responsible for the configuration of the Student Records module in conjunction with other Student Records offices and IMT.

Works in conjunction with the Associate Registrar for Information and Data as a technical liaison and support for the Office of the Graduate and Professional Registrar.

Works with IMT to coordinate all escalated technical issues.

Involvement in training, instruction and being a resource to all new data employees to the Graduate and Professional Registrar team as it relates to the Student Records module.

Collaborates as the primary technical resource with the Data Analyst: Academic Advising to ensure data integrity and functionality.

Coordinates configuration updates and changes each academic year.

Creates and runs queries, verifies and analyzes data, and audits business processes as needed by staff.

Researches and proposes improvements to existing processes.

Ability to learn and use work order and change management software.

Participates in the process to fix a break when it occurs in the module.

Configures and coordinates scheduling of processors pertaining to graduate and professional student records, including but not limited to, term activation, grade processors, and other batch processes.

Works with the Associate Registrar for Information and Data and IMT to coordinate and test periodic bundles/patches to PeopleSoft and other software systems.

Oversees training of Graduate and Professional Registrar staff on all relevant software and documentation of all business processes.

Participates and collaborates on the implementation and testing of software interfaces between PeopleSoft Student Records module and Sakai, Series25, and future software packages.

Collaborates with Associate Registrar for Information and Data to make recommendations for system modifications and additional software needs to IMT.

Determines essential maintenance projects and assembles project teams as needed, under the supervision of the Associate Registrar.

Provides an extra line of support to the Graduate and Professional Registrar data team and other colleagues to meet project deadlines as necessary.

Regular, punctual attendance as required by the supervisor based on department needs.

Performs other duties as required by the supervisor.

Skills

description:
Be. Think. Do. Extraordinary!

With over $50 million of commercial solar assets deployed across California, generating $5 million in electric bill savings for our clients, Vista Solar is making a difference every day. By focusing on commercial solar installations, each project we work on has a measurable positive impact on the lives of our clients, our community and the environment. Our commitment to excellence and portfolio of success has enabled us to offer, as a standard, best-in-class production guarantees, price assurance and peace of mind. If you want to be part of a winning team that’s building a better tomorrow – read on!

Vista Solar is seeking a proactive, results-driven Portfolio Analyst (PA), with a go-getter attitude to join our dynamic team. The successful PA thrives in a data-centric environment. They are passionate about numbers and getting down to the how and why of changing data trends. They live and breathe in a world where they are not only required to see the big picture, but also able to foresee and prevent possible issues before they arise. The ideal PA is determined to do whatever it takes to get the job done, and will utilize their inquisitive mind to solve complex issues. If this is you, apply now!

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Management of online solar monitoring platform
  • Accurate data entry and daily maintenance on monitoring updates
  • Proactively identify ratios/trends of project performance and propose ways of improvement
  • Perform system production reports for clients and internal purposes
  • Create new accounts for new projects including alert settings, generation baselines, and system specific notations
  • Review alerts and proceed to Tier 1 troubleshooting process
  • Present production and usage data to customers on an annual schedule
  • Collaborate with O&M; Technician and Asset Performance Manager to resolve issues
  • Additional duties and special projects required as needed

Qualifications

  • Bachelors in mathematics, engineering (preferred)
  • 1+ years of data analyst experience (preferred)
  • Strong with statistics and numbers
  • Exceptional Microsoft application skills especially Excel (pivot table, statistical formulas, report generation etc.)
  • Ability to quickly learn various software and platforms
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Organized and detail oriented
  • Experience with ALSO Energy platform (preferred)
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • Passion for renewable energy
  • Must have a clean driving record and valid license. (example, no DUI in the last 5 years)
  • Must be able to successfully pass a pre-employment criminal, driving and drug screen

Benefits

  • Engaging and open team that welcomes great people with great ideas

  • Comprehensive benefits, including medical, vision, dental and life insurance (Employee premiums 100% covered)
  • 401(k) savings plan
  • 12 paid holidays and attractive Paid Time Off Program
  • Employee Referral Program
  • Career development opportunities
  • An energetic work atmosphere with an incredible team

description:
East West Bank is one of the largest independent banks headquartered in California serving consumers and businesses throughout the U.S. and Greater China. With over 130 locations worldwide including California, Texas, New York, Georgia, Massachusetts, Nevada, Washington, and Greater China – East West Bank is committed to helping their customers’ enterprises succeed. We are currently seeking a Senior Business Data Analyst.

As an East West Bank employee, you will be part of a growing and stable organization that provides career path development opportunities while serving a growing and profitable market.

Extract and review monthly datasets for accuracy, validity and data integrity. Maintenance of report templates and production of performance reports.
Generate ad-hoc reports and assist in detailed analysis for areas of focus in the performance of business units.
Build and enhance processes to iteratively improve the quality and efficiency of department deliverables

Minimum 2 years of experience in a data management and analytics role. Experience in Finance or Accounting in the banking industry preferred.

description:
If you want to achieve more in your mission of health care, you have to be really smart about the business of health care. Challenge yourself, your peers and our industry by shaping what health care looks like and doing your life's best work.(sm)

The Healthcare Data Scientist is responsible for participating in the full array of analytics, clinical analytic consulting and applied analytic activities at Optum. Conducts quantitative and qualitative analyses on clinical outcomes, authors quality reports and assists in the development of new clinical programs. Serves as a content expert in clinical methodologies and analytic techniques applied to large claims databases. The Healthcare Data Scientist provides clinical support for outcomes studies and projects; and contributes to their conceptualization and design, synthesizing and disseminating results to internal constituents at Optum as well as to Optum’s clients.

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and / or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Primary Responsibilities:
  • Design and develop analytic methodologies for multiple projects on a wide variety of total health care and clinical pharmacy issues
  • Provide consultative support to internal teams and external collaborators, support the development of clinical analytic approaches, draft analytic approaches, evaluate clinical value, and lead the interpretation and positioning of analytic findings and value
  • Responsible for clinical report development and presentation of findings, including identification of actionable insights related to Optum’s value in terms of clinical quality, cost outcomes and patient safety
  • Develop clinical quality assurance and improvement processes and reports
  • Develop the approach for integration of new and existing provider performance data into comprehensive analytic evaluation tools
  • Conduct data analyses for evaluating healthcare cost effectiveness and quality, health systems impact, and other health related outcomes
  • Generate actionable insights and make strategic recommendations that drive decision in quality area
  • Identify best practices and innovations in Optum leveraging data for impact to effect continuous quality improvement (clinical and non - clinical) and recommend performance improvement activities
  • Design predictive modeling and data mining approaches, based on quality, utilization and cost data, to support consistent delivery of cost - effective, high quality care initiatives that can drive value for our clients
  • Propose clinical methodologies and execute a wide variety of data analysis activities
  • Assess and validate use of various externally available datasets to improve the outcomes and design of clinical analytics, such as outcomes, Census data, and Consumer behavior data
  • Build consensus with clients, clinicians, product managers and executives on clinical analytic strategies and priorities
  • Develop ideas for new clinical analytic projects and programs to strengthen partner relationships with Optum’s client base
  • Serve as liaison to vendors to develop and evaluate reports related to clinical decision-making, reliability, validity and productivity
  • Serve as project leader, or clinical research manager
  • Author or co - author clinical analytic reports and peer-reviewed articles
  • Prepare and give presentations at conferences for the field
  • Translate complex clinical analytic concepts for executive or lay audiences
  • Have major responsibility for the management of specific projects or tasks
  • Must have the ability to work on multiple Tasks at once
  • Adapt to change quickly

Required Qualifications:
  • Master’s degree in statistics, mathematics, computing sciences, public health or related discipline with relevant healthcare experience
  • Expert in using analytic software programs, including hands on ability to code in SAS and SQL, and expert in MS Office tools including Excel, Access, Word, Visio and Power Point
  • 5+ years of progressive experience in conducting analytic projects using administrative pharmacy and medical claims, preferably in a Pharmacy benefit manager, health insurance company, or other healthcare setting
  • 3+ years of experience with pharmacy and medical metrics and clinical quality measures, with critical thinking skills to apply variations of methods based on business needs
  • 3+ years of progressive experience and leadership in clinical analytics in a healthcare environment is essential

Preferred Qualifications:
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills are needed, including the ability to “translate” analytic concepts, approaches and results for executive or lay audiences, and analytic interpersonal skills with an ability to communicate to small and / or large audiences (both internal and external to Optum)
  • Experience in communicating to a senior management audience and ability to drive consensus on complex, controversial issues
  • Knowledge of Specialty Pharmacy
  • Demonstrated success in analytic or healthcare related consulting engagements
  • Demonstrated experience in planning and execution of complex analytic projects
  • Knowledge of pharmacy and medical metrics and clinical quality measures, with critical thinking skills to apply variations of methods based on business needs
  • Requires demonstrated analytic skills and creativity to quickly integrate information and develop proposals for new analytic initiatives
  • Demonstrate curiosity and determination in pursuing complex and innovative approaches to data needs
Careers with OptumRx. We’re one of the largest and most innovative pharmacy benefits managers in the US, serving more than 12 million people nationwide. Here you’ll fill far more than prescriptions. As a member of one of our pharmacy teams, you’re empowered to be your best and do whatever it takes to help each customer. You’ll find unrivaled support and training as well as a wealth of growth and development opportunities driven by your performance and limited only by your imagination. Join us. There’s no better place to help people live healthier lives while doing your life’s best work.(sm)

Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

title: Data Analyst

description:
ABOUT US

Inspire is creating the world’s most customer-focused clean power platform. Our inaugural product, a clean energy subscription, connects members to 100% wind power in less than five minutes through frictionless digital enrollment. We guarantee a seamless member experience through concierge-level service and simple, transparent pricing. We make energy personal by providing relevant insights and smart tech recommendations based on your unique energy profile. And above all, we prioritize the long term value of your home. Our proprietary analytics engine powers a unique member profile to help you make better decisions about your home. Inspire is the smartest way to power your life.

THE POSITION

The Data Analyst, position is an opportunity for an inquisitive analyst to join an analytics team whose developed algorithms power both a proprietary recommendation engine and global index. As a data analyst, you will be scouring the earth for data to continue to develop our dataset and pushing the boundaries of your technical knowledge to empower our Technology and Product teams in building a category disrupting consumer technology platform. You will also be the research lead for the team, helping aid in algorithm development and data quality best practices.

RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Identify and Research potential data sources to help improve accuracy / efficiency of recommendation engine
  • Investigate the intricacies of known relationships between data in our business to further our understanding using predictive modeling techniques
  • Develop capability to pull data sets of interest into sandbox environment for Q/A and initial analysis
  • Participate in weekly team meetings to understand coming workflow to prioritize research initiatives
  • Research best methodologies and practices to develop solutions to challenges as they arrive
  • Work very closely with Tech team to ensure developed logic is translated into production applications

QUALIFICATIONS
  • 1-3 years work experience or graduate degree in a field related to data science or quantitative analytics
  • Practice in aggregating quality data sets from disparate sources
  • Extensive knowledge of algorithm development
  • Working knowledge of SQL, R, Python and other tools
  • BA/BS degree required
  • Excellent communication skills

description:
Growing Healthcare company in Irvine is seeking a ITC Data Analyst to join their great team! This is a Direct Hire position. $90-100K DOE

The ICT Data Analyst is responsible to research, design, support and provide expert consultation for enterprise reporting, BI software and systems including integration with databases and data warehouses. Works in conjunction with data governance to ensure consistency and reliability of source data as well as assess the quality of the data across multiple systems. Recommends and implements new or modified reporting methods and procedures to improve report content and completeness of information. Provides subject matter expertise on all data elements and report content related to the data warehouse. Coordinates with end users to ensure total system quality assurance is met at all times

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES :

  • Conducts data profiling, performing analysis, reviewing results, developing data quality rules
  • Identifies data quality metrics, set up capture mechanisms and design data quality scorecards
  • Develops procedures to cleanse data and work with system owners to correct data quality issues at the source
  • Investigate, plan, deliver and operate the data and information systems including the data warehouse, analysis and reporting, master data and integration and interfaces.
  • Facilitate the master data program, data security and confidentiality and data quality requirements.
  • Troubleshoots data integrity issues, analyzes data for completeness to meet business needs, and proposes documented solution recommendations
  • Transfers data into meaningful, professional and easy to understand formats for various audiences
  • Combines various data sources into a comprehensive understanding of customer behaviors
  • Recommends and implements new or modified reporting methods and procedures to improve report content and completeness of information

EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering or management information systems with a minimum of 5-7 years’ of experience as a Data Analyst

SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITY REQUIREMENTS :

  • Experience with ERP systems and commercial data concepts
  • Advance SQL skills (complex querying capabilities) MUST
  • Proficient SQL Reporting Services, ODBC, MS Access, and MS Excel and/or equivalent data capture/reporting tools
  • Experience performing ETL, Data Validation, Data Mapping, Data Migration
  • Excellent analytical and problem solving capabilities with special attention to accuracy and detail
  • Self-starter with a proven ability to take ownership of job responsibilities and ensure successful completion of all projects and requests
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to interface effectively with all levels of management, including executive and senior management teams
  • Ability to effectively prioritize and multi-task in high volume workload situations

Preferred Skills

  • Experience developing and customizing requirements, process, and design documentation
  • Experience performing requirements, design, and testing activities
  • Experience in the Pharmaceutical, Medical Device or Healthcare industry

Salary is $90-100K DOE

Please send your resume if you are interested and available.

Thanks,

Carina Gutierrez

title: Financial Data Analyst

description:
The Clinical Informatics Data Analyst reports to the Regional Director, Clinical Informatics and is responsible for working with clinical and business colleagues to analyze, design, build, test, deliver and maintain reports, dashboards and other data extracts requested. The position requires an understanding of the Cerner Millennium database, the Enterprise Data Warehouse and associated reporting tools: CCL, PowerInsight (Business Objects Webi/Rich Client, SAS). In order to be successful, the ideal candidate will be an expert in developing reports using Business Objects Webi, as well as, constructing complex SQL statements in a healthcare environment.

The analyst will also be responsible for working on reported production issues in addition to contributing reporting expertise while assigned to project teams. The Clinical Informatics Data Analyst will work closely with clinical and revenue cycle informaticists and report consumers across the organization. The Clinical Informatics Data Analyst should thrive in a client-focused environment and demonstrate dedication to implementing `best practices' and systems improvements. Ideal candidate will also demonstrate strong analytical and problem solving skills as well as a willingness to learn new things. Documenting business and system processes and procedures through the use of industry standard process flow and flow charting techniques is also important.

Minimum 5 years experience in the healthcare industry and minimum 2 years data analytics work experience in a healthcare setting required, utilizing Business Objects, SQL, CCL, SAS or related analytics apps language. 5+ Years data analytics experience in a healthcare setting utilizing Cerner products preferred. Experience in constructing complex queries using SQL and strong understanding of database architecture and design (physical and logical) preferred. Knowledge of Cerner's data model and architecture. Bachelors Degree in Healthcare, Healthcare Informatics, or Business Administration or a combination of education and/or additional job related experience required. Must have expertise in hospital clinical computer applications.

Training in E.H.R. system design and or build experience preferred. Knowledge of Cerner application suite. Strong understanding of process redesign including documentation of current and future state workflow processes. Excellent analytical and problem solving skills. Demonstrated ability to be self-directed with excellent organization, analytical and interpersonal skills. Understanding of clinician needs and practice patterns, as well as hospital operations and workflow. Ability to test, analyze, trouble shoot, and isolate complex problems

About Us:

As a leading provider of compassionate, high-quality and affordable patient-centered care, we share a rich legacy with Dignity Health, one of the nation’s five largest health care systems. We are part of a 21-state network of nearly 9,000 physicians, 55,000 employees, and more than 380 care centers

description:
Description

We are seeking a Senior Payroll Risk Data Analyst as part of our growing Risk Analytics and Insight team within Intuit’s Small Business Group (SBG). The Analyst will work across functions (Risk Operations, Decision Science, Marketing, Product, Finance, Corporate Accounting, etc.) to use data to drive insights to help achieve Intuit Small Business Group’s short and long term business outcomes.

Over the past several years, SBG has begun to build strong strategic risk capabilities in testing and analyzing new ways to widen the acquisition funnel while maintaining acceptable risk. We’re looking for a candidate to help continue to build a strong analytics culture as part of the growing team. This role reports to the Manager of SBG Risk Analytics and Insight.

Primary Responsibilities

Coordinate with Payroll Risk and Operations leaders, database engineers and business leaders to accomplish the following:

· Translate business questions into verifiable hypotheses and make decisions through testing.

· Leverage data to understand our Small Business Payroll business and related Fraud, Financial and Compliance Risk in depth and identify trends that indicate elevated risk and inform and influence Risk Policy where applicable.

· Proactively identify areas of opportunity and suggest projects to mitigate risk while providing an awesome and delightful customer experience.

· Work with engineers to develop, test, and maintain accurate tracking, capturing and reporting of key Payroll and Risk metrics via server-side data collection and other database sources.

· Maintain and improve a set of automated reporting to provide the basis for in-depth analysis and business evaluation; in doing so provide the standardized logic for Risk analysts to build upon.

· Use tools and programs such Microsoft SQL Server (SSRS, SSAS), ODBC, Excel, Netezza, R, Quickbase, Tableau, QlikView and many other internal tools to work efficiently at scale.

· Provide analysis and insight that help manage Risk policies such as customer processing limits and approvals/underwriting for all Payroll products

· Partner with Risk Operations to provide analysis and reporting that enables efficient Risk processes and results in improved loss metrics and performance

· Develop forward-looking loss forecasting capability for new and existing products and merchant types, reflecting other macro loss performance trends that affect forecasts

· Deploy advanced analytics using data mining and predictive modeling techniques to drive Payroll business outcomes

Qualifications · Strong business acumen and exceptional analytical ability with 3-5 years of relevant experience. Experience with Small Business Payroll processing and/or merchant acquiring preferred.

· Advanced SQL and coding skills to perform data segmentation and aggregation from scratch. Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio experience highly preferred.

· Good working experience with data analytics and visualization tools (Excel, Power Pivot, Tableau, QlikView, etc.). Experience with statistical analysis preferred.

· Outstanding communication skills with the ability to deftly negotiate, prioritize across teams, influence decision makers and build consensus with teams.

· High degree of accountability, organization and empathy.

· Experience working with Key Performance Indicator metrics such as conversion rates, user acquisition, conversion and retention and/or product usage.

· Bachelor’s Degree in Quantitative Field or commensurate experience. Master’s degree preferred.
title: Senior Payroll Risk Data Analyst

description:
Job Description - Senior Data Analyst - CRM (161815)
Experian is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Senior Data Analyst - CRM - Job Number: 161815

Description
Experian is the power behind the data. As the leading holder of consumer and business credit data, we’re transforming data into solutions that advance industries, move companies forward and improve the lives of millions of consumers around the world. In 2015, we were named by Forbes magazine as one of the “World’s Most Innovative Companies.”

Experian Consumer Services is seeking a Senior Data Analyst, CRM to help deliver insightful reporting, in-depth analyses, and advanced predictive analytics to enable action that increase overall customer life time value (CLV). The successful candidate must have advanced SQL programming skills, strong experience and knowledge with A/B and multivariate testing, excellent quantitative analysis and statistical programming skills. Functional responsibilities include analyzing direct marketing campaigns to identify revenue generating customer segments, developing performance measures, forecasting, and advanced predictive models to drive business decisions and efficiency. This is a hands-on analytical role in a fast-paced environment. This person will report to the Director, Customer Insights & Analytics.

Responsibilities:

• Develop reporting and analysis to measure the effectiveness of direct marketing channels; make data driven recommendations that optimize channel performance.
• Conduct in depth analysis to determine responsive and profitable customer segments.
• Develop and execute experimental designs and optimization schemes for ongoing marketing campaigns to improve marketing effectiveness and ROI.
• Develop and continually improve customer segmentation, targeting propensity models (response, attrition models), and customer lifetime value model using advanced statistical techniques.
• Translate analysis results and modeling outcome into understandable and actionable business knowledge; effectively and clearly presents findings to non-technical audience.
• Must be able to interact productively with key organizational decision makers.
• Collaborate closely with other analytic teams across the organization to share findings and best practices.
• Develop a strong partnership with the BI Team in performing complex data extractions, manipulations and validation to ensure accuracy and appropriateness of analytic model.

Qualifications
Qualifications & Experience:

• Bachelor degree in Statistics, Economics, Operations Research, Applied Math, Computer Science or related quantitative field. Graduate degree preferred.
• 3+ years of experience in the Analytics field.
• Advanced SQL programming skills and experience working with large and complex databases, preferably in a marketing capacity.
• Knowledgeable and experienced with analytic methodology, statistical analysis and test design including experimental design, A/B testing, sample size, and t-tests.
• Predictive modeling skills using statistical programming tools (SAS, R).
• Proficient with Microsoft Office products (Excel, PowerPoint, and Word).
• Experience with Business Intelligence tools (Tableau, Cognos) a plus.
• Excellent oral and written communication skills.
• Analytical thinker and a team player who thrives in a fast paced environment.

description:
THE CURRENT VACANCY IS IN THE HEALTH AND HUMAN
SERVICES AGENCY; OFFICE OF THE DIRECTOR

ORAL EXAM IS TENTATIVELY SCHEDULED FOR MARCH 2017

SEE "SPECIAL REQUIREMENT" SECTION REGARDING
POSSESSION OF A VALID DRIVER'S LICENSE

RESPONSES TO SUPPLEMENTAL QUESTIONS REQUIRED

SKILLS OR EXPERIENCES LISTED UNDER THE IDEAL CANDIDATE
STATEMENT MAY ALSO BE USED TO SCREEN APPLICATIONS

FINAL FILING DATE: MARCH 15, 2017 AT 5:00 PM

ABOUT THE POSITION Under direction, to perform data analysis, develop data collection systems, assess and disseminate information, participate in special studies or projects, and develop policy implications/recommendations of analyzed information; to perform related work as required.
DISTINGUISHING CHARACTERISTICS This data analyst class is responsible to a supervisor or manager for performing various data collection and analysis work. Duties will include importing and managing large data sets collected through birth and death certificates, hospitalization records, and emergency room encounters; developing data collection tools (i.e., surveys, spreadsheets, and databases); analyzing and presenting data in an easy to understand but meaningful way; and supporting the epidemiologists in program evaluation and epidemiologic activities. This position is distinguished from the Agency Staff Services Analyst I by its responsibility for more complex projects, emphasis on outcomes evaluation and policy development in relation to analyzed data, and its enhanced level of computer savvy and data management skills.

EXAMPLES OF ESSENTIAL DUTIES:
Collects, enters, validates, extracts, and analyzes data on current issues of concern; designs data collection methodology; draws logical conclusions from analyzed data and makes recommendations on procedures, policies, and program alternatives; develops "user-friendly" reports or otherwise prepares data for dissemination; conducts reviews of program data to assess outcome impact and cost effectiveness; assists department staff in gathering and entering information into data systems; works with and assists in maintaining the integrity and reliability of existing database or other software programs, to analyze, collect and display information; plans and develops software applications to link programs; may assist in improving the Department's ability to assess outcomes; participates in program evaluation study design and implementation; conducts reviews of existing programs to assess outcome impact, work load distribution, or cost-effectiveness; may make recommendations on financial, personnel, client, program, community or administrative systems, as assigned; prepares correspondence and may assist in the development or preparation of proposals for state, federal or private foundations; and may assist in the supervision of staff.

TYPICAL QUALIFICATIONS:
Any combination of education and experience sufficient to directly demonstrate possession and application of the following:

Knowledge of : General public and business administration practices; governmental functions and organization; principles and practices of the functional areas germane to this specialized position; data collection methodology and statistical analysis; and assessment, policy analysis, and program and outcome evaluations.

Ability to: gather and analyze data; identify problems and central issues; reason logically; perform and document research in dealing with administrative issues; read and interpret legislation, policies, operating procedures, and regulations; recommend and implement changes; speak and write effectively; establish effective working relationships with those contacted during the course of work; operate a personal computer, including word processing, statistical analysis, database, graphics presentation, and electronic file transfer software packages; maintain confidentiality, prioritize work independently, manage personal stress, accept increasing responsibility; and actively promote the mission of the department to which assigned.

These standards are typically attained with a bachelor's degree and one year's experience equivalent to an Agency Staff Services Analyst I with Shasta County. IDEAL CANDIDATE The ideal candidate will have experience with data analysis, statistics, and managing large data sets using Stata, SPSS, Excel, and/or Microsoft Access. Experience with map creation using Geographic Information System (GIS) products is also beneficial but not required. The ideal candidate is organized, self-motivated, has a strong attention to detail, and efficiently and effectively manages his or her time amidst competing priorities and tasks. SUPPLEMENTAL QUESTIONS Responses to the following must be submitted with a completed application. Do you possess a bachelor's degree? ___Yes ____No Have you completed any college level courses in statistics? If yes, please list the name of the course. If no, please put "n/a." Do you have one year of full-time experience equivalent to an Agency Staff Services Analyst I? If yes, please list your job title, duties performed and dates in this classification. In no, please put "n/a." Do you have experience using Stata, SPSS, Excel, Microsoft Access, or another software program to manage and analyze large datasets? If yes, please list your job title, duties performed, and dates in this classification. Please also list the software package used and an example of a project you completed. If no, please put "n/a." I understand that if I answered "yes" to any of the above questions, but did not give the requested additional information, my application may be considered incomplete and may be screened out. ___Yes ___ No SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS

Possession of a valid California driver license. PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; reach with hands and arms; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.

The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and the ability to adjust focus.

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. OTHER CONSIDERATIONS
All new employees are required to have their paycheck directly deposited to a bank account. Some positions may require a valid California driver's license and acceptable driving record according to County policy. Reasonable accommodations may be made for those persons who are disabled under the Americans with Disabilities Act to perform the essential functions of the position. As part of the selection process, all individuals provided with a preliminary offer of employment with Shasta County will be subject to a background investigation, including a criminal history check (primarily completed through the taking of fingerprints). An image of your fingerprints will be captured and sent to the California Department of Justice (DOJ) and the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI). The resulting report of your conviction history , (if any) , will be evaluated along with the other information received in connection with your application . Except as otherwise required by law, a criminal conviction will not necessarily disqualify you from the position. The nature of the offense, the date of the offense, the surrounding circumstances, and the relevance of the offense to the position applied for may, however, be considered. Based on the results of the background investigation and criminal history check, applicants may then be provided with an offer of employment conditioned on the results of a medical examination, which includes drug/alcohol testing. In accordance with Government Code Section 3100, County employees, in the event of a disaster are considered disaster workers and may be asked to respond accordingly. Positions in this classification are covered by a collective bargaining agreement between the County and the United Public Employees of California (UPEC) – General Unit. Employees in this classification are covered under the CalPERS retirement program. Depending on the provisions of the California Public Employees' Pension Reform Act (PEPRA) and other applicable laws, an employee in this classification will be covered under one of the following CalPERS retirement formulas: (1) 2% at 55, (2) 2% at 60, or (3) 2% at 62. An employee in this classification will also contribute 7% of his/her pay to this plan, or will contribute such other amount to the plan as authorized by PEPRA and other applicable laws. Please visit our employees benefit page at Employee Benefits for additional information regarding benefits and CalPERS coverage information. The provisions in this flyer and on the County's website are for information purposes only. To the extent the provisions of the flyer or the County's website are inconsistent with PEPRA and other applicable laws, PEPRA and other applicable laws shall govern.

APPLICATION AND SELECTION PROCEDURES:
Shasta County Personnel will accept applications and responses to the supplemental questions until 5:00 p.m., on March 15. A cover letter and/or resume will be accepted in addition to the application form but will not serve as a substitute for a completed application. Incomplete applications will not be processed. It is not acceptable to complete the application with statements such as, "See/Refer to Resume," or "See Attached." Closing date postmarks or faxes will NOT be accepted. This recruitment will establish a list that may or may not be used by other departments. Prior applicants must reapply to be considered.

Applicants will be screened and those considered best qualified will be invited to appear for an oral and/or written examination. Meeting the announced requirements does not guarantee inclusion into the selection process. Depending upon the number of applications received, the selection process may consist of additional application screening, written and/or practical exam(s), oral interview, or any combination thereof.
Veterans' Credit : Veterans (as defined by California Government Code section 18973) who have been discharged from military service under conditions other than dishonorable and who receive a passing score on all components of the employment examinations (up to and including oral examinations) shall receive credit for an additional five points to be added to their final examination score. To be considered for this credit, a veteran MUST provide a copy of his or her discharge document (DD-214 or equivalent) and information as to the type of discharge (honorable, dishonorable, etc.) WITH THE EMPLOYMENT APPLICATION ON OR BEFORE THE FINAL FILING DATE.
Applicants are encouraged to apply on-line at apply on-line or submit an application to the Shasta County Personnel Office.

Arrangements may be made to accommodate applicants with disabilities. Requests for accommodations may be made to the Shasta County Personnel Office by the filing deadline posted on this bulletin. Shasta County does not discriminate on the basis of disability. If you feel you are being denied service based on a disability, our ADA Coordinator may be reached at (530) 225-5515; relay service (800) 735-2922; fax (530) 225-5345. title: Agency Staff Services Analyst II

description:
The SIOP Data Analyst provides support for developing and maintaining accurate sales plans, forecasts and detail demand plans for end-items on a regular basis, is r esponsible for preparing key analysis with Marketing and Sales information, Customer or A/C forecasts and historical trend data, and other information that builds the case for use of the best sales forecast for driving master planning and developing the best demand plan (least forecast error) to drive master planning. Includes metrics on forecast accuracy with an objective of identifying opportunities to improve the SIOP process.

Job Core Responsibilities
  • Develops and maintaining integration metrics with regular progress reports
  • Develop and improve forecasting/demand management tools and processes
  • Support the development of market outlooks and assumptions, aircraft build rate projections (i.e. rollouts), market analyses, etc.
  • Support the monthly SIOP review and corporate reporting process, to ensure demand drive is linked to customer requirements.
  • Communicate significant forecast changes with buyer/planners to alert to possible procurement actions required (SIOP Alert).
  • Prepare data for monthly SIOP demand review meetings with sales/product management, operations, and engineering for forecast collaboration. This would also include the preparation of SIOP related data to support corporate initiatives.
  • Utilize modeling to develop forecasts that support OEM build schedules and MRO service center material requirements.
  • Supporting role in coordinating and improving the existing SIOP Planning processes
  • Perform work with intermittent direction
  • Support department goals and be a strong team player
  • Any other task assigned by your supervisor or management
INITIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Create and maintain excel based forecasting models for a set of assigned products. The forecast profile reflects the required product / customer, forecasting horizon, frequency of update, and forecasting time buckets—which are specified by the planned SIOP (Sales, Inventory, and Operations Planning) process.
  • Work closely with Contract Administration, Sales & Marketing and Engineering to review/assess the key inputs of their forecasts and customer forecasts (if available).
  • Develop analysis to improve forecasts that include factors outside the Demand Planning application--such as customer forecasts, and production actions.
  • Develop and report key demand planning process metrics including forecast error, trend analysis, and other demand behaviors for the demand forecast.
  • Regular, consistent and punctual attendance is required. May need to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and additional hours as necessary

Job Specifications

Education : Post-secondary degree required
Years Experience : 2-5 years of relevant experience

Skills :
  • General understanding and ability to apply industry principles concepts, practices and standard of the forecasting / demand planning field.
  • Demonstrated experience developing and implementing solutions for a variety of problems of moderate scope and complexity.
  • Experienced in analyzing and synthesizing complex and/or diverse information in demand planning or procurement for aerospace/manufacturing environment.
  • Strong attention to detail, highly organized and the ability to prioritize with changing situations.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills (written and verbal), with ability to drive tasks to completion.
  • Good analytical skills and judgment to proactively identify and solve problems
  • Intermediate to advanced experience using Microsoft Office Suite, in particular Excel.

This position requires use of information which is subject to the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). All applicants must be U.S. persons within the meaning of ITAR. ITAR defines a U.S. person as a U.S. Citizen, U.S. Permanent Resident (i.e. 'Green Card Holder'), Political Asylee, or Refugee.

Meggitt is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran Status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request an accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access our career center as a result of your disability. To request an accommodation, contact a Human Resources Representative at 1-855-474-7665 or HRISon@meggitt.com .

description: As an integral member of the newly created center of marketing research excellence at Sutter Health, serve as the liaison between enterprise data management (EDM) and the Marketing and Marketing Research Organizations, as well as the Strategy team. (EPSi) and others. Proactively identify opportunities to create hybrid analyses and presentations curating both primary and secondary data. title: Senior Analyst, Big Data

description:
Description

Every day, millions of people rely on Mint to stay on top of finances, bills, budgets, credit scores and more. As “Minters,” we’re an entrepreneurial team within Intuit who share a passion for personal finance, building awesome mobile app experiences, and helping customers build their financial futures. Our Mint app, designed for iOS, Android and web, is absolutely free to customers. We monetize our app through highly targeted advertising that leverages the rich user data in Mint to connect users with offers that help them save money and build the financial freedom to live the lives they want.

We’re looking for a Sr. Business Data Analyst to join the Mint team, a creative problem solver with a passion for delivering data-driven insights and prior experience with web and marketing analytics.

Responsibilities:
  • Deliver key metrics, reports, dashboards and ad-hoc analyses with interpretation, contributing to the development of hypotheses and actions
  • Define, implement and standardize metrics, reports and dashboards leveraging Tableau
  • Analyze website and marketing campaign data to optimize business results and user experience
  • Support A/B testing by designing robust experiments, analyzing results, and communicating insights to business stakeholders
  • Work with marketers to develop learning plans with recommendations of analytics approaches to address questions or validate hypotheses
  • Lead the thinking on multi-channel attribution and how to apply data to optimize for ROI
  • Develop targeting and lists for email marketing campaigns, lookalike models and experiments
  • Pursue data quality, troubleshoot data validation, and see issues to resolution
Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree
  • At least 3-4 years experience with web analytics, decision support, and, ideally, marketing optimization for a SaaS product
  • Experience with analysis, testing & reporting tools (e.g. Google Analytics, Optimizely, Tableau, Mixpanel, SiteCatalyst, Searchlight)
  • Familiarity with programming languages and stats packages (e.g. python, R)
  • Subject matter expertise with clickstream data and writing and tuning SQL queries
  • Excellent problem solving skills and end to end quantitative thinking; ability to develop and use structured approaches to identify root causes and recommend resolutions
  • Ability to tell stories with data and instill confidence in recommendations
  • Strong communications skills with both technical and non-technical colleagues
  • Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously to meet objectives and key deadlines

description:
Job in Azusa CA
A reputable non-profit Medical Center that is committed to providing high quality healthcare to the surrounding community of Southern California is now actively searching for a Healthcare Strategic Data Analyst.

The Hospital Business Data Analyst will be part of the Medical Center that looks for exceptional people who share its vision and values. Joining the prestigious team, you know that working in this healthcare organization is more than a job, it is a vocation and commitment to excellence. The healthcare professionals in the hospital have a unique opportunity to affect lives for the better every day.

The Hospital Strategic Data Analyst will provide analytical support to generate business plans through analyses of internal and marketplace data. The Healthcare Strategic Data Analyst will support managed care analyses, service line analyses, and analyses for various projects and work groups.

The Acute Care Strategic Data Analyst will be responsible for the maintenance and production of various metrics and dashboards as well as operational reports, which provide details of the organization’s performance to the Hospital’s Executive Leadership team.

The ideal candidate for Business Data Analyst will have three years minimum experience in health care analytics, business, managed care analysis or related field preferred. Knowledge and understanding of strategic and business planning concepts and practices. Ability to effectively interact with management. Strong analytical, communication and organizational skills. Excellent customer service skills required.

The hospital focuses on clearly defined goals that are developed to bring about exemplary patient care. It provides employees with the structure to achieve these goals by providing advanced technological systems, processes and practice; performance improvement and patient safety standards to foster positive patient outcomes; a collaborative practice model; evidence-based nursing practice; and education and development programs to support recruitment and retention.

The hospital also offers competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package. Join the prestigious team now!

description: The IQS Data Analyst Senior is responsible for providing analytical and reporting expertise for SMF quality programs and initiatives, focusing on performance measurement and quality improvement. This position will work with both internal and external stakeholders to evaluate the needs for data analysis and reporting. The IQS Data Analyst Senior will design, plan, gather, analyze, interpret and report clinical and administrative data to identify opportunities to improve the quality and cost of healthcare services within the organization. The IQS Data Analyst Senior should understand business processes, data entities, data producers, consumers and data dependencies between various departments and foundations. The IQS Data Analyst Senior must be flexible and comfortable dealing with the ambiguity of working in a matrix environment with various work teams, providing support, expertise and guidance to ensure that the strategic initiatives of SMF’s population health and quality initiatives are achieved.

description:
At Electronic Arts we put our players first, and we’re looking for the most talented and creative game developers to help create amazing experiences for our players. At our Maxis studio, we have been creating amazing games for over 25 years, for PC, console and mobile - with franchises like The Sims and SimCity. Come and join an exciting team that is working to bring our current products to new heights, while also preparing to launch redefining mobile experiences for long-running beloved franchises. Collaboration, gameplay and a creative culture are what makes us tick. Our team is excited by the opportunity to deliver awesome player experiences and pushing the envelope of deep engaging games.

We are looking for a passionate Analytics Lead to turn data into insight and insight into business decisions and results. You will lead our team of analysts and help define our strategy for using analytics to improve gameplay and product performance. You will support multiple products, from currently live titles like The Sims 4, to yet unannounced major mobile game launches. You should be a sharp, curious, and an analytic individual who has a passion for games and a strong desire to develop and grow a critical team and function. Your insight and leadership will influence game design to drive improved acquisition, retention, and monetization.

What a Analytics Lead does at EA:
  • Works collaboratively with design, producers, data analysts, and data scientists, to present data that will provide actionable insights into the game to improve the acquisition, engagement and monetization of our audience
  • Manages the daily workload of the analytics and data engineering teams
  • Works to develop and grow the technical and soft skills of their team members
  • Define the framework and approach for regular reporting, tools, dashboards, etc.
  • Ensures high quality production of that reporting
  • Helps script, maintain and create automated processes for pulling and reporting data
  • Drives continuous improvement in our methodologies, systems and processes
  • Prepares and presents ad hoc analyses and decks to senior management
  • Is actively engaged in our game and develop a deep understanding of game mechanics including gameplay and economy
  • Defines and develops metric frameworks for production and design to measure and monitor their success
  • Structures and leads regular conversations with production and design leadership to develop and test hypotheses about player behavior and motivation in pursuit of producing a better player experience
  • Partners closely with other studios and central resources providing services ranging from data science to user research

The next great Analytics Lead needs:
  • BA or BS in statistics, mathematics, computer science or related field
  • 6+ years of relevant hands-on experience in a consumer products-oriented industry; gaming, entertainment, or e-commerce is a plus
  • 5+ years hands-on experience as a data analyst
  • Experience leading teams
  • Experience with data visualization packages like Shiny or Tableau
  • Experience with a statistical software package; R is a plus
  • Exemplary SQL skills, including experience querying large, complex data sets; Hadoop is a plus
  • Ability to effectively communicate with people at various levels of business and technical expertise, including the ability to simplify difficult technical concepts
  • Proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment, and to meet changing deadlines and priorities on multiple simultaneous projects
  • Team player and self-starter with the ability to liaise with multiple teams and stakeholders
  • Passion for gaming is a big plus
