title: Director of Analytics

description:
About KIPP Bay Area Schools

KIPP is a national network of 200 college-preparatory public charter schools with a 20-year track record of preparing students in educationally underserved communities for success in college and in life.

There are currently 11 schools in the Bay Area serving 4,700 students. These innovative, college-prep public schools are located in underserved neighborhoods of Oakland, San Francisco, San Lorenzo, San Jose, and Redwood City. Our newest elementary school will open in East Palo Alto, CA in the Fall of 2017.

Position Overview

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our relentlessly curious, entrepreneurial regional Data and Evaluation team. In this high impact position, the Data Analyst will play an integral role in shaping our regional Data Strategy. We are looking for a data guru, who enjoys diving deep into data sets, uncovering key insights, and championing a data-driven culture. S/he will own our regional reporting platform, and help build out our data infrastructure, ensuring access. The ideal candidate will be an analytical, resourceful problem-solver and a skilled communicator. The Data Manager will work in our Regional Support Office in Oakland, and collaborate closely with our Academics, School Culture, KIPP Through College and Operations teams. S/he will report to our regional Director of Data & Evaluation.

Essential Functions

With support from the Data and Evaluation team, the Data Analyst will be responsible for:

Data Analysis and Visualization:
Analyze school and student data, identifying trends and patterns and determining their implications for our practices in core areas such as teaching and learning, school culture, and talent

Own our data reporting platform, developing deep expertise in designing, building and maintaining our report portfolio using Tableau and custom SQL reporting within our data warehouse

Use Tableau, Google Apps, Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services, MS Excel, Powerpoint, or other tools to customize and create powerful, sustainable and user-friendly dashboards, reports and analyses to drive data-driven decision-making

Develop and maintain clear documentation to ensure consistency of data definitions and procedures around data collection and reporting

Complete ad hoc data analysis requests in a timely and efficient manner

Build Capacity and Drive Data Literacy:
Develop training for teachers, staff and senior leaders on how to effectively use data dashboards

Help schools troubleshoot academic data reporting issues in a way that builds their internal capacity, developing training tools for the most common issues

Partner with regional teams on data-related projects and initiatives

Data Strategy:
Work with schools and regional staff to plan and prioritize short-term and long-term analytics needs

Conduct needs assessment with teachers, staff and senior leaders around topics such as academic achievement (assessments, blended learning program usage, etc.), operational reports (staffing and development), and social and emotional learning (e.g,. school culture)

Assess the quality of user experience for dashboards and tools and refine products as needed

Collaborate with the Data team to develop and maintain a data warehouse that connects key student, academic, and operational data for meaningful analysis

Requirements

Experience & skills:
Extensive experience analyzing large datasets, with high accuracy and attention to detail; experience with educational data a plus

Significant experience in database management and reporting

Highly resourceful, with demonstrated ability to learn new data platforms/systems quickly and independently

Strategic thinker, with ability to think critically about issues and solutions

Goal-oriented, with strong initiative and creative problem-solving skills

Flexible, with strong ability to multi-task and prioritize

Proven track record of teamwork and proactive collaboration with others

Outstanding written and oral communication skills

Bachelor's Degree with minimum three years' work experience

Technical skills:
Demonstrated experience in SQL for database management and reporting

Advanced expertise with Microsoft Excel

Tableau experience preferred

Culture & fit:
Mission-driven, with a strong commitment to KIPP's mission and values

Self-starter, comfortable in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment

Sense of humor

Compensation

We are dedicated to you and your family's well-being! KIPP offers a competitive salary as well as comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, and transportation benefits.

  • You are a stickler for details and always have extreme attention to detail.
  • Microsoft Access or SQL DB knowledge preferred but not required

POSITION DESCRIPTION

An ideal candidate would successfully be able to

description:
RichRelevance is seeking an Analytics Manager to oversee our reporting function, support the data requests of each division within the company, and function as both an internal and external data evangelist and thought leader.
At RichRelevance, data is at the heart of our business. As the industry leader in e-commerce personalization technology, there are many questions that arise regarding the behavior/performance of our solutions, insights to be learned from our droves of customer data, and opportunities to articulate value in innovative ways. We are are looking for an experienced data analyst/manager to oversee these functions. This is a leadership role with direct reports—and the expectation of individual contribution.
Centralized within Product, the Analytics function will require you to leverage clickstream terradata in order to provide reporting, come up with creative solutions to answer business questions, and convey what’s driving the bottom line for retail trends. RichRelevance logs millions of page views of data every day, so the ideal candidate will possess a combination of technical proficiency, quantitative literacy, and the ability to turn big data into actionable insights.
Responsibilities
Manage Analytics function, including global team of two data analysts
Support and help prioritize reporting requests from Product, Client Services, Sales, and Marketing
Regularly meet with clients to understand business/reporting requirements and execute paid statements of work
Own, refine, and document our best practices and methodology around the A/B testing of our various personalization solutions
Define/refine the success metrics for our various personalization solutions and formulate coherent supporting narratives
Partner with Sales to qualify data services opportunities and ensure expectations are appropriately set with clients
Monitor back-end database engineering, including QA’ing daily rollups and sqoop jobs
Qualifications
At least 4 years experience analyzing data in a technology or other big data field
One year A/B testing experience
Proficiency in SQL, R
Strong statistical background (hypothesis testing, statistical significance)
Ability to distill complex mathematical/numerical concepts into coherent narratives
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Client-facing experience preferred
Experience with BI reporting platforms (Pentaho, ThoughtSpot) a plus

description: Role/Responsibilities: The Research Data Analyst will be a part of the group that sources and maintains the credit risk data that are vital to the success of Moody’s Analytics’ (MA) credit risk models and consulting services, creates data analytics, reports and performs model validation. The successful candidate will also participate in state of the art research with our renowned quantitative research team in the area of credit risk. Primary Responsibilities: Analyze and Quality Control company financial statement and loan portfolio information in MA’s global Credit Research Database (CRD) Standardize data formats from multiple data sources into CRD standards Analyze patterns and discrepancies in the credit data provided Produce reports and visual dashboards that describe data characteristics and highlight trends and issues Perform data analyses, and be comfortable with statistics and relational databases Collaborate closely with Product Management and Technical Team Make presentations and communicate regularly with clients and data vendors Qualifications: Requires Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Finance, Accounting or a closely related field. Master degree or 1 - 2 year experience working with an economic or financial data preferred. Excellent organizational and communication skills Attention to detail and the ability to learn quickly Strong analytical skills Ability to read and understand Financial reports such as 10K and 10Q Experience or academic training in: financial data analysis and management, Bloomberg media, MS Access, MS Excel, Structured Query Language (SQL), SAS, R and BI tools such as Qlik or Tableau is a strong plus Familiarity with US GAAP, IFRS, and other regional accounting principles is a plus Knowledge of relational database design strongly preferred Department/Team: The ERS Research team members are tasked with providing quality credit research data. The importance of credit research data is recognized by many of the globe’s most advanced financial institutions and corporations. These organizations contribute their data to our effort because they seek access to more powerful models based on broader credit risk experience, as well as a structured approach to data collection and greater insight into trends in credit markets for private and public firms.

description:
Analytics is a specialized, centralized, and cross functional team that collaborates with product /
engineering, growth, operations, and marketing to drive decision-making at Lyft. The team leads
ambitious projects, interacts regularly with our executive team, and develops key strategic
frameworks for all business areas.

Our team is growing rapidly, and we’re looking for an experienced data analyst to help us grow
faster. You’ll be working closely with our growth, product, and marketing teams to optimize our
overall customer experience. You’ll be responsible for analyzing experiments and informing new
products we build and marketing campaigns we run to grow the business.

The ideal candidate is technically minded, business savvy, and exceptionally driven. If you’re
sharp, highly analytical, resourceful, and can communicate complex ideas with ease, then we’d
like to talk to you.

RESPONSIBILITIES
    • Build and automate actionable models and reporting for key business processes
    • Design and analyze experiments to increase engagement with the Lyft platform
    • Perform deep­ dives into our customer data to understand passenger and driver behavior
    • Partner and develop strong relationships with cross­ functional teams across product, marketing, and engineering

EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS

    • Comfortable working with very large data sets
    • Expert SQL experience; experience with big data frameworks preferred
    • Strong oral and written communication skills; extremely attentive to detail
    • Ability to thrive in a fast­paced startup environment
Lyft is an EEO employer that actively pursues and hires a diverse workforce, and pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

description:
ARYZTA is a global baking company with a Passion for Good Food. We provide our retail and foodservice customers with a portfolio of bakery solutions so they can deliver memorable, delicious food to consumers. With operations in the United States, Canada, South America, Europe, Asia, Australia and New Zealand, ARYZTA has become a global leader in the baked goods industry and one of the largest specialty bakery companies in the world. Our leading bakery brands in North America include La Brea Bakery®, Otis Spunkmeyer®, and Oakrun Farm Bakery®. We have 58 state-of-the-art bakeries and kitchens around the globe, with 26 of those in North America, and are committed to driving innovation, predicting upcoming consumer trends and flavors, and exceeding our customers’ expectations. The Americas team champions the values of Integrity, Ownership, Customer Focus, Creativity and Care to help us deliver on People Safety, Food Safety, Quality and Collaboration.

ARYZTA Americas operates one of the largest specialty bakery businesses servicing all major customers in the retail, foodservice, QSR and convenience store channels.

The Americas Structure includes five operating Business Units: Brazil, Canada, Brand, US Specialty Bakery and US Consumer Foods, which are serviced by five Americas Central Support Functions covering areas such as Food Safety & Quality Assurance, Environmental Health & Safety, Sustainability, HR, Legal, IT, Finance Shared Services, Procurement, Category Management, and Commercialization.

Description of Position

This position functions within the ARYZTA (N. America) Business Services organization (ABS), which provides centralized Financial services including customer collections & credit risk management, vendor payments, payroll, and customer rebate management to the ARYZTA N. America business. The Business Data Analyst must possess the business process knowledge and technical skills necessary to develop, test and implement complex reports and analysis utilizing Advanced Excel, Business Objects, SAP and other tools. Primary responsibility is reporting and analysis of Service Level metrics (SLA’s) and Key Performance Indicators (KPI”s) for Transactional Finance processes (Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable, Payroll, Customer Rebates and others), in order to facilitate marked improvement in process efficiency and effectiveness. Other duties may include managing department Intranet site, cost center budgeting & reporting, documentation of processes, and root cause analysis of process issues.

The ideal candidate will have experience as a Financial Analyst with a focus on process improvement.

Key Responsibilities
    • Become an expert in the various sources of business process information (reports from SAP, Business Intelligence, Salesforce and other systems) and maintain a repository of historical data.
    • Compile a variety of weekly and monthly routine and ad-hoc reports and analysis including SLA‘s, KPI’s, operational statistics and detailed data. Perform metrics calculations and prepare Management reports in a variety of formats: Excel, PowerPoint, etc.
    • Partners with the Business Intelligence Team to develop and test complex reports
    • Serves as department Excel and Business Objects super user resource
    • Assist with initial setup of the ABS intranet site, and own its ongoing maintenance
    • Create and update procedures and documentation including work instructions, quick reference guides, process maps, forms, etc.
    • Ongoing focus on improving processes making recommendations and participating with implementations to improve overall efficiency
    • Assist with evaluating and implementing technology enhancements including business case analysis and Capital Expense Request preparation
    • Assist with preparation & formatting for various presentations such as budgets, project updates, etc.
    • Maintain positive and effective working relationships within and outside of ABS
    • Other tasks as assigned
Required Skills Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or Business Management
  • Minimum 2 years financial analysis experience including organizing and analyzing large amounts of financial and/or operational data
  • Solid understanding of end-to-end business processes (Customer-to-Cash, Procure-to-Pay, Record-to-Report, Hire-to-Retire, etc.) and associated process measurements
  • Ability to “connect the dots” in understanding cause and effect while analyzing business results
  • Strong technical skills with Advanced Microsoft Office (emphasis on Excel; macros, lookups, data manipulation and graphing) skills.
  • Business Objects /Business Intelligence expertise skills report building, data mining
  • Strong initiative and ability to manage multiple tasks
  • Experience working with ERP systems (e.g. SAP) and associated bolt-on tools highly desirable
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently and take all assignments to closure
  • Must be detail oriented with strong organizational, analytical and trouble shooting skills
  • Ability to work well with a wide range of individuals and subject matters in a fast paced, dynamic environment

ARYZTA is proud to be an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer (AA/EOE)

Required Experience Typical Work Schedule: M-F
title: Business Data Analyst

description:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to share, and make the world more open and connected. Through our growing family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that helps billions of people around the world connect and share what matters most to them. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to make the world more open and accessible. Connecting the world takes every one of us—and we're just getting started. The Media Operations team develops solutions for public figures on Facebook and Instagram by creating scaled systems to address the issues impacting their experience with our product and support, analyzing how they interact with products and each other, and packaging these insights for the rest of the company.

We are seeking individuals who are passionate about the news industry and enjoy using data to tell a story. From improving the experience of our partners to increasing the efficiency at which we work, you're making us smarter, better, and faster. In addition to up-leveling our data analysis abilities, this person will be responsible for providing support to our top partners and identifying opportunities for our team. This is a full-time position located in Menlo Park, California. Become an expert in the FB experience for media companies
Develop and share expertise on media/public content products
Drive data discovery and leverage findings to improve our partners' experience and increase our impact
Listen to partners and partner managers with the ability to modify services and support to generate exceptional experiences
Lead a team of analysts to identify trends in the News Feed distribution of our partners' content and leverage those trends to improve the product by working with Product Management, Engineering, Policy, and other partners within the company
Develop strategy for scaling team coverage across our global base of partners BA/BS degree or higher
Desire to help people and provide delightful support experiences
Experience with Hadoop/Hive, SQL, and Excel to analysis and reporting of trends
Understanding of Tableau or similar software and experience with a programming language a plus
Ability and experience working independently and a track record of taking initiative in uncertain, dynamic environments
3+ years of experience in data, reporting, and analytical problem solving
Ability to analyze data to tell a story and make recommendations
Exceptional communication and presentation skills
Demonstrated ability to think strategically about complex issues, leading to thoughtful recommendations and action plans
Ability to work effectively and cross-functionally with all levels of management, both internally and externally
Rapid learner who thrives in a fast-paced environment As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Facebook is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.

We are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-ext@fb.com or you may call us at 1+650-308-7837.
title: Lead Data Analyst, News Feed - Media Operations

description:
Experience level desired: junior / mid-level

I. Position Summary
The Data analyst will support the Wholesale Sales and Marketing team by providing data, analysis, and consultative assistance. The work will include building reports, analyzing trends and variances, managing data sources and data flow, and collaborating directly with a team of sales and marketing professionals. The right candidate will have strong skills in the areas of analytical and data management, as well as exceptional customer service and communication.

II. Essential Functions
1. Reporting and data analysis: assist with daily, weekly, and monthly report preparation. Able to
analyze variances and ‘build a story’ from the data, then communicate that story to senior management
2. Data validation and tracking: monitor incoming data, systems and processes to validate data streams and sources. Test for accuracy and find solutions to correct data issues
3. Customer Service: support the sales and marketing team to help explain and understand their operational and financial results. Help dig into and explain potential questions they have on what is driving trends.
4. Assist controller and team with forecast and annual plan inputs, ensure data consistency
between data sources, and preparing reports for teams and distribution.
5. Provide ad-hoc analysis: support the team with various ad-hoc analytical projects to help
support strong business decision making
6. Expand the data and analytic toolset: assist the controller in developing tools, reports, and
systems to provide better information in support of the sales and marketing objectives

III. Approximate breakdown of time spent (subject to change)
40% Sales and Marketing analytical support, training, planning and forecasting
30% Data validation, data management
20% Report building and analysis
10% Ad-hoc analysis

IV. Physical Demands/Qualifications
Able to lift the equivalent of one case of wine/promotional materials.

V. Non-Physical Demands/ Qualifications
1. Technical proficiency: technical background or degree in Finance, Math or IT
3. Loves working with data & problem solving, comfortable with large datasets and data systems
4. Has a service heart and is customer service oriented: looking to help the Sales and Marketing team ‘win’ through better data and decision making
5. Analytics and report building: advanced Excel analytics and report building, presentations with
PowerPoint/Word. Able to use a wide range of analytical and BI tools such as SQL databases, Qlikview, Hyperion, JDE-Insight to gather data and build analysis and reports
6. Data management: comfortable working with query tools, data structures
7. Able to catch mistakes and self-audit, work independently and accurately
8. Strong communication skills
10. Basic understanding of finance and accounting

V. Additional Skills preferred:
1. Experience in the CPG or Wine industry
2. Data Visualization through BI tools (Qlikview, Excel)
3. Form and report building in Qlikview, Hyperion, JDE/Insight
4. Basic programming: SQL data extraction, Qlikview programming, Hyperion report and Essbase programming, Excel macros

VI. Environmental Conditions
Working conditions are normal for an office environment.

VII. Sustainability Values Statement
Supports economic sustainability thru key decisions that promote the long term health of the organization. Supports environmental sustainability thru long term production planning that takes care of the land and water resources. Supports social responsibility thru ongoing commitments to the community and employee population.

This position description does not promise or imply that the functions listed are the only duties to be performed or that the position may not change, or be eliminated. Employees are always expected to follow their supervisors’ instructions and to perform the tasks requested by their supervisors.
title: Sales Business Analyst

description:
The Loyalty/CRM Analyst will be responsible for performing analyses using consumer loyalty data to extract actionable insights for the purpose of designing new targeted promotional campaigns and consumer outreach strategies.

Main Areas of Responsibilities
  • Manages and analyzes consumer loyalty program data to design and improve targeted consumer marketing; analyses may include:

  • Segment consumers based on factors such as demographics, product usage patterns, and other available data (e.g., online behaviors)

  • Segment physician practices based on factors such as size, growth, consumer base demographics, practice type, and product mix

  • Identify overall sales trends and trends at the product, consumer, and practice levels

  • Design targeted promotional campaigns and consumer outreach strategies to drive incremental sales while optimizing cost to Allergan

  • Work directly with Allergan's customers (physician practices) to support them in development of targeted promotional campaigns, with same objectives

  • Monitors efficacy of promotional campaigns and generate reports on key metrics, such as:

  • Coupon redemption rates

  • Email click-through rates

  • Customer satisfaction survey data

  • Incremental sales driven by promotion

  • Overall consumer engagement with different forms of marketing outreach and media (different content, channel, degree of targeting, and consumer type)

  • Analyzes transactions data to detect abnormal sales patterns that are indicative of potentially fraudulent activity

  • Researches competitors' CRM activities and state of the art CRM activities

Education and Experience
  • Bachelor’s Degree, Master’s Degree preferred in a technical or quantitative discipline

  • Two or more years’ experience in a data analyst or marketing role

  • Previous experience with customer and sales data is preferred

Essential Skills and Abilities
Exhibits:
  • Strong analytical skills and data-driven thinking

  • Strong communication skills, both verbal and written

Ability to:
  • Work within complex multi-faceted organization and a cross-functional environment

  • Manage and prioritize work load, multi-task and manage a diverse mix of issues, responsibilities and challenges

Demonstrates:
  • Analytical expertise while able to articulate concepts and ideas

  • Strong skill in big data analysis and Excel; SQL experience is a plus

description:
At Harbor Freight, we deliver the quality tools and affordable prices that hard-working Americans need to build, fix and create. We all work together to help them get the job done and make ends meet. We're also equally committed to doing the right thing and giving back to the communities that we serve.

Harbor Freight Tools is different, we’re not your typical retailer, we are a large company with a start-up feel that provides a collegial and collaborative environment dedicated to high achievement. We are committed to support and promote people based on their relative contribution, skill set and accomplishments and firmly believe in generous pay for performance compensation and building long-term careers.

We're a 40 year-old, $4 billion company - on pace to $8 billion in the next few years. We have over 750 stores nationwide and are opening a new one every three days. If your ego is in check, you are an open-minded partner, aren't afraid to get into the weeds to learn and understand our culture and have a desire to join our history making enterprise, then we'd love to talk to you.

The ETL Developer will be responsible for the scripts and processes required to extract, transform, clean and move data and metadata so they can be loaded into a data warehouse, data mart or operational data store. Reads, analyzies and digestes what the company wants to accomplish with its data, and designs the best possible ETL process around those goals.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Work with business requirements to identify and understand source data systems; provide resolutions to all data issues and coordinate with data analyst to validate all requirements, perform interviews with all users and developers.
  • Map source system data to data warehouse tables
  • Develop and perform tests and validate all data flows and prepare all ETL processes according to business requirements and incorporate all business requirements into all design specifications.
  • Define and capture metadata and rules associated with ETL processes
  • Adapt ETL processes to accommodate changes in source systems and new business user requirements
  • Collaborate with all developers and business users to gather required data and execute all ETL programs and scripts on systems and implement all data warehouse activities and prepare reports for same.
  • Provide support and maintenance on ETL processes and documentation
  • Build partnerships across the application, business, and infrastructure teams
  • Strive to continuously improve the software delivery processes and practices
  • Champion company standards and best practices
  • Perform other duties or responsibilities as necessary or assigned.

Education and/or Experience:

  • Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or equivalent 2 years of experience working with large enterprise class Data Warehouse projects as an ETL Developer or equivalent combination of education and work experience.
  • Experience working with Informatica PowerCenter 9.x or higher
  • Strong experience and passion for Business Intelligence and Data Warehousing design principles and industry best practices.
  • Experience in requirements gathering and creating architectural, detail design documents and mapping documents.
  • Experience with many of the transformations of Informatica including complex lookups, stored procedures, update strategy, mapplets, etc.
  • Skilled in developing Informatica objects - mappings, sessions, and workflows based on the prepared low level design documents.
  • Experience in debugging mappings and identifying errors and error rows so that they can be corrected and re-loaded into a target system.
  • Performance tuning of Informatica Mappings, processes, and load routines.
  • Experience with Data Integration Web Services, Data Quality, and Data Validation Option.
  • Analyze business requirements holistically and as they relate to the ETL process, research, evaluate and recommend alternative solutions.
  • Experience automating ETL processes with Informatica PowerCenter.
  • Ability to perform relational and multidimensional modeling and schema creation.
  • Development of cube dimensions, measure groups, calculations, and any data management code for the partitioning schemes.
  • Good understanding of XML and corresponding XSD's.
  • Solid experience in database query/performance optimizations.
  • Ability to interact with other departments and business users who are not as technical in nature.
  • Ability to understand system functionality, process, and architecture at a technical and business level.
  • Experience with SQL Server, Oracle or DB2 in the areas of database administration, as well as schema design, database object development, management, optimization, and SQL programming
  • Proven communication and presentation skills to effectively communicate information to all levels within the organization, and to interact well in a team environment
  • Experience working with and planning projects of medium size or complexity

Job Type: Full-time

title: Junior Financial/ Data Analyst

description:
The Manager of Web Analytics is responsible for providing customer insights on Adobe’s Creative Cloud business on Adobe.com. The team is responsible for deeper understanding of Adobe’s ability to deliver an optimal customer experience to attract, convert and retain Creative Cloud customers. The team measures all aspects of the web marketing strategy to ensure high conversion, retention and engagement rates on the site. The Manager will be an excellent Adobe Analytics and big data analyst that excels in data storytelling.

Responsibilities:
  • Analysis
    • Deliver insight and understanding of visitor and customer behavior on Adobe.com.
    • Synthesize Adobe Analytics and Hadoop data to drive deeper understanding of customer journeys – who is coming to the site and what they are doing
    • Understand key business priorities and marketing goals for Adobe.com; deliver insights to support sales and customer retention goals
  • Performance measurement
    • Identify site requirements to ensure proper tracking of new pages and experiences; work closely with the enablement team to ensure requirements are implemented
    • Set and deliver on web goals and targets to drive improvements to web traffic, conversion, engagement, and retention
  • Collaboration
    • Collaborate with other marketing analytics teams and researchers and contribute to holistic funnel measurement
    • Drive next generation of report automation (Analysis Workspace, Tableau, etc)
Strong Analytics Skillset
  • Expert with Adobe Analytics analysis and insight generation. Able to prioritize and establish the analytics strategy for the site to deliver actionable insights.
  • Strong analytical and quantitative orientation with advanced SQL knowledge in large, complex data environments.
  • Experienced with Hadoop/big data environments to synthesize and analyze data. Demonstrated ability to tie web data and offline data together effectively
  • Expert at the creation and use of Excel pivot tables to drive analytics. Tableau skills strongly desired.
  • Strong knowledge of online marketing strategies.
  • Ability to knit together Adobe Analytics and customer attribute data to deliver robust insights into customer behavior on Adobe.com.
  • Experience forecasting website traffic/orders desired but not mandatory.
  • Data management and modeling a plus.

Leadership
  • Proactive driver of initiatives with an excellent ability to multitask
  • Ability to prioritize across diverse stakeholder needs.
  • Partner with eCommerce, marketing, IT and web strategy teams to develop analytics and insights to acquire and retain customers.
  • Collaborate across functional teams to deliver insights and observations on customers and marketing effectiveness. Strong interpersonal skills are a must.
  • Collaborate with IT and analytics enablement teams to ensure timely capture of analytics data and delivery of insights.

Strong communication and presentation skills:
  • Ideal candidate can communicate clearly, concisely, effectively across multiple levels within the organization. They can tell a story from the data including recommendations that impact the business. The ability to transform data into clear PowerPoint based presentations for senior leaders – and explain the story behind the data - is critical for success.
Other:
title: Manager, Web Analytics

description:
MyLife.com is the leading service helping people protect their identity, privacy, and public image online. We help people monitor and control personal information that’s exposed everywhere, with the aim to help them look good to the world, while staying protected, to positively impact their lives. The company was founded in 2002 and is located in Los Angeles and has over 50 million members.

The successful candidate will be a member of Data Development team working closely with the Email Marketing team to create and target market products to our 45 million members. This is an excellent career opportunity for an individual who wants to be a hands-on marketing data analyst and wants to directly contribute to the growth of a unique company with an amazing team of people in Los Angeles.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
  • Explore email marketing data using the following analytical techniques: data analysis and mining, customer profiling, segmentation and analysis
  • Identify new opportunities to better segment target markets, messaging cadence and rules related to optimizing email marketing communications
  • Address a variety of database integration issues including migration between disparate databases, integration, maintenance/conversion, capacity planning issues, and new applications
  • Work with application development teams to ensure that database changes adhere to best practices & are properly prioritized / scheduled
  • Advise on troubleshooting, exception handling, and other data management issues
  • Assist the software development teams in dealing with performance issues in all database custom code released to the production
  • Define monitoring requirements to prepare for deployment of these new database features
  • Provide production and on-call support during office hours & if required during off hours

Qualifications :
  • 4+ years of work experience in database development
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills – the ability to communicate within Development organization to discuss designs and implementation techniques, and with Product Management to understand specifications
  • Knowledge of Oracle internals; partitioning, indexes, star schema optimization, Oracle parallel queries, Oracle BI tools
  • Expert in Oracle SQL tuning optimization skills
  • Database experience in writing Packages, Procedures, Functions, Triggers, Complex SQL
  • Experience in high volume (over 100 million records) data load using External Tables, SQL*Loader, and other utilities intended for high-performance ETL processing
  • Experience in Unix scripting language (Shell, Perl, Python, etc.) and other language (Java, C, etc.) to help maximize ETL performance
  • Experience working to leverage and apply data insights for the purpose of improving customer experiences and marketing through personalized experiences to improve lifetime value
  • Prefer Bachelor’s Degree, though not required

Employment Details:
  • Location: Westwood Village, CA
  • Status: Full time
  • Salary: Competitive, based on experience
  • Benefits include: Medical, dental & vision benefits, life insurance & disability, 401K plan with employer match, AFLAC, vacation

Company Culture & Perks:

As an internet company we provide a Casual work environment with Flexible Start Times as well as free drinks and snacks, Perks include; Breakfast Bagel Mondays, a fully catered Friday lunch, a lounge with a large flat screen TV and plenty of company parties to celebrate our ongoing successes and product releases.

We have a highly open and collaborative team; utilizing the latest technologies to reach a united goal in making sure everyone is successful at what they do. If this sounds like the kind of place where you can build your knowledge and career, we want to hear from you.
title: Database Developer

description:
IDEO U & OpenIDEO - Data Analyst (Contractor)

Join IDEO U and OpenIDEO in IDEO’s San Francisco studio.

IDEO U is building an online learning platform that helps leaders from around the globe learn to unlock their creative potential and build their problem-solving skills. There is no shortage of challenges to tackle in the world, and we believe we need more creative leaders who can deeply understand diverse needs, think of radical solutions, and confidently experiment their way forward.

OpenIDEO is an open innovation arm of IDEO, enabling people everywhere to use design thinking to collaborate in addressing pressing global issues. Over 80,000 people have participated in OpenIDEO challenge on topics ranging from improving maternal health through mobile technology to fighting Ebola. OpenIDEO challenges guide participants through a collaborative process based upon IDEO’s design methodology. Our challenges spark engaged discussion, new collaborations, and innovative ideas and initiatives.

This role is a unique opportunity to join two of IDEO’s forward-thinking platform teams and help shape their use of data to improve their products and strategies.

Role Description:

As part of these teams, you will see the results of your work as you help to evaluate learner behavior and engagement and impact of marketing initiatives. This role is for someone who is able to make the data sing, discover hidden patterns, and communicate the results in a clear and effective way. Often times the data is ambiguous and the problem is not well-defined - but in this role you will clarify both and move forward. You are always careful about validating your approach and delivering results that are both actionable and highly reliable.

You…
  • Have a strong analytical skill set. You are a ninja with some combination or Excel, SPSS, R, Python, Matlab, or other analytical tools, and are comfortable using SQL to pull database reports



  • Enjoy uncovering insights from data, working quantitative methods to answer questions and find opportunities to improve user engagement, optimize marketing activities, and help to grow the business.



  • Ideally, you have experience working with both small- and large-scale data in multi-method studies. However, we hope that you not only help pull together diverse datasets (via APIs), but also help create new data. This means you have some familiarity with experiment design, survey design, and response effects.



Responsibilities:
  • Continuously improve the quality and accessibility of our product engagement and marketing performance data.



  • Assess and measure online learner engagement, completion and usage patterns of the learner experience.



  • Mine and structure data to test hypotheses that will guide product development.



  • Answer product questions by using appropriate statistical techniques on available data.



  • Track and measure our marketing funnel to optimize our efforts



  • Support the team with business analytics and modeling to help grow the business and identify new market opportunities.



  • Building dashboards and visualizations to make the data accessible to the team on an ongoing basis.



  • Generating ideas for data analysis, then shifting quickly to execution.



Qualifications:
  • A bachelor's degree or equivalent in economics, statistics, math, physics, or engineering or possess other relevant training in data analysis.



  • 1-3 years of experience in an analytical role at a fast-paced company, preferably in business insights or business analytics.



  • You have solid statistical and data analysis skills (e.g. significance testing, regression modeling, etc.) and experience working with large-scale data in multi-method studies. You must have one statistical analysis tool you call home (e.g. SPSS, SAS, R, Matlab, and Python).



  • You have the ability to translate complex analysis and results into actionable insights for a non-technical audience.



  • You have a self-starter mentality, a strong sense of ownership, and an insatiable appetite for learning.



  • You have a team-oriented mindset and the ability to work with a wide range of individuals.



  • You have a passion for online education and digital products experiences.



Time Commitment:
  • 30-40 hrs / week for 6 months, with potential for full-time hire.



To Apply:
  • Please submit a cover letter and resume describing your fit for this role.



  • Please share 1 to 3 case studies demonstrating a time that you used quantitative data (with other inputs), to help a team generate a unique perspective that resulted in a positive change.
title: IDEO U and OpenIDEO - Data Analyst (Contract)

description:
Behind every patient success is the dedication of a unique team of skilled and talented individuals who help make the Keck Medical Center of USC one of region’s premier medical facilities.

As a member of the USC health care team, you will help build upon the university’s exceptional expertise in patient care as well taking advantage of our excellent compensation package that could include shift and weekend differentials, online rewards-based scheduling, and generous educational benefits.

Come be a part of a world-class health care facility and an important member of the Trojan family.
The Lead Quality Analyst is responsible for ensuring the accuracy, completeness and timeliness(quality control) of data that is reported internally and to external organizations, regulatory and accrediting bodies, included but not limited to CMS , CDPH , data registries, payor centers of excellence and other publically reporting organizations. The Lead Quality Analyst acts as database administrator and expert user of internal hospital systems related to quality and for disease specific data registries in which the hospital participates. Under the direction of the Clinical Quality Informatics Director, the Lead Quality Analyst trains and oversees the day to day work of department Clinical Quality Abstractors.
Requirements
Minimum Education:
- BA/BS in health related field
- RN experience preferred

Minimum Experience/Knowledge:
- Minimum of two (2) years’ experience in data processing, health information systems, clinical technology in a related field in an acute care facility
- Excellent working knowledge of acute care demographic and clinical data elements, medical terminology and formulae
- Excellent skills in the use of data entry and data base relationships
- Working knowledge of ICD -10CM coding system
- Detail oriented and aware of the importance and impact of data quality data on ability to improve patient outcomes
- Expert user of Microsoft Office applications
- Knowledgeable of accreditation and licensing standards, standards especially those related to quality and performance improvement

Required License/Certification:
- A Fire and Safety card must be presented upon hire or must be obtained at our facility within the first 30 days of hire and maintained by renewing before expiration date.

description:
St. Joseph Heritage Healthcare (SJHH) is one of California's most respected medical groups. With over 2,000 employees and 25 locations throughout California, including, Northern California, Orange County, High Desert and Los Angeles County, SJHH has been continually recognized as a leader in quality, customer service and information technology. This kind of success is the result of team work, a commitment to excellence and a strong adherence to the organization's mission, vision and values. St. Joseph Heritage Healthcare (SJHH) provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, St. Joseph Heritage Healthcare (SJHH) complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
Services as a key resource and support for all mammo reporting applications including MRS, Powerscripbe, Medinformatix, Meditech and Synapse. . The mammo System administrator ensures that system design, related policies, interface functionality, and clinical processes are coordinated and functioning effectively at each Breast Center and at an enterprise level.

Essential Values-Based, Leadership and Management Competencies: Demonstrates values-based competencies in line with the four core values that are the foundation of all activities performed by employees in order to achieve the Mission of the St. Joseph Health System.

Dignity: Demonstrates competence in communication and interpersonal relations.

Excellence: Demonstrates competence in continuous improvement, continuous learning, accountability, and teamwork.

Service: Demonstrates competence in customer/patient focus and adaptability.

Justice: Demonstrates competence in community orientation and stewardship.

Essential Functions:
  • Handles interdepartmental requests and phone calls.
  • Occasionally types or transcribes other work.
  • Works closely with the Radiologist as well and Mammography department staff.
  • The project lead for the planning, testing, installation, maintaining and upgrading of the mammography reporting system in coordination with the electronic medical record, imaging applications, PACS and related technologies
  • responsible for resolving highly complex issues regarding the mammography reporting system, coordinates testing and implementation of software releases, assists in developing strategies for training and champion's standardization, utilization, optimization and use of best practices throughout all facilities
  • In coordination with system and facility medical staff leadership, identifies quality metrics and mines data for credentialing, accreditation, quality reporting and research. This individual works directly with medical staff, mammography technologists and support staff to ensure appropriate and standardized use of the application
  • This position would also be required to cover other duties as needed such as but not limited to scheduling, ordering office supplies and contacting patients to confirm information.

Additional Responsibilities:
  • Uses professionalism and honesty in all business dealings on behalf of SJHH.
  • Adheres to all attendance policies at SJHH.
  • Remains flexible with regards to job assignments that may require the necessity to cover other departments or locations.
  • Demonstrates excellence in customer service when dealing with both external and internal persons while on the job.
  • Adheres to all policies and procedures set forth at SJHH and all applicable laws under which SJHH is obligated to comply.
  • Performs all other duties as assigned.

Age-Related Competencies: Demonstrates age appropriate communication skills for the population served.

Information Management: Treats all information and data within the scope of the position with complete confidentiality and security. Maintains all practices to protect PHI and follow HIPAA guidelines.

Risk Management: Cooperates fully in all risk management activities and investigations .

Safety Requirements: Is knowledgeable of, observes and complies with hospital Codes of Safe Practice, safety policies and emergency procedures.

Minimum Position Qualifications:

Education :
  • High school diploma or equivalent required.
  • Specialized training and/or certification in designated mammography reporting prefered.

Experience : Demonstrated mastery of mammography software system and a strong working knowledge of breast center operations and technologies, breast pathology and breast cancer workflows.

Minimum of five years' experience supporting MHS' designated mammography reporting system.

title: Assoc Clinical Data Analyst

description:
ADP is hiring a Senior Net Promoter Data Analyst . In this position you will be responsible for analysis and reporting of Net Promoter System and other voice of the client data that drives decision making for the Added Value Services division. Leverage a variety of analytical tools to provide information that is flexible, responsive and nimble to changing business needs. The NPS Data Analyst is responsible for Analysis/ Consulting, Configuration/ Integration, Validation/ Support and Project Planning for all aspects of the NPS process with a focus on predictive Analytics, Reporting and Survey Administration.

At ADP we are driven by your success. We engage your unique talents and perspectives. We welcome your ideas on how to do things differently and better. In your efforts to achieve, learn and grow, we support you all the way.

If success motivates you, you belong at ADP. We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values: Insightful Expertise, Integrity is Everything, Service Excellence, Inspiring Innovation, Each Person Counts, Results-Driven, & Social Responsibility. RESPONSIBILITIES: Analytics/ Consulting/Communicating Viewed as a credible, value-added partner across the business providing meaningful analytic conclusions and recommending innovative solutions. Conducts NPS and voice of the client reporting and analysis.

Provides professional consulting in the areas of tool customizations, business processes, analytics, complex custom reports and special projects. Work with Business Unit champions and Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to define requirement related to reporting, analytics, trending and communications. Create business requirements based on detailed analysis of Business Unit needs. Coordinates and consults with Corporate IT for customization work.

Develops ad hoc inquiries to assist in reporting, categorization and analysis. Provides demos and training for champions and SMEs, including documentation as required for reporting, analysis, trending and communication. Configuration/ Integration Works and counsels with business units on system and service configuration tools, tool adaptation and business best practice solutions. Determines best methodology and oversees the accurate and timely conversion of survey data, reporting and analytics.

Consults on interfaces to internal and external systems. Validation/Support Builds survey control information and oversees the pre- and post-implementation testing of tools, processes, reports and alerts. Establish predictive analytics Performs testing and support during UAT, works to resolve defects/ issues Supports the business unit during the production release of new tools, reports, alerts and analytics. Provide Tier I/II support for the tools, reports and system supporting the NPS initiative to the business units.

Project Planning Participates in establishing and monitoring of Business Unit implementation schedule and report status to Project Team Members. Ensures issues and risks are documented and work with team members to resolve. Knowledge Sharing of Best Practices Work collaboratively to standardize all aspects of process, analytics, reporting and survey administration with consideration for the unique needs of the individual businesses. Train appropriate uses on analytical tools to ensure widespread adoption of best practices in collecting and analyzing data for actionable recommendations to leaders.

Performs other related duties as assigned. QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED: 8 to 12 Years of Directly Related Experience Net Promoter Certified Associate or equivalent knowledge of Net Promoter System methodology Bachelor's Degree or its equivalent in education and experience with a Major Area of Concentration in BS in Finance, Accounting, Statistics #LISERVICE Preference will be given to candidates who have the following: Related experience in analytics, market intelligence and analytics, financial modeling or statistical analysis Excellent quantitative and analytical skills, and strong attention to detail Excellent project management skills Strong verbal and interpersonal skills, with demonstrated ability to work with and communicate at all levels of staff and management. Ability to interpret data into actionable recommendations Strong Excel skills required, including data modeling and ad hoc analysis Experience with Medallia and Clarabridge a plus Experience buiilding out predictive NPS model a plus Ideal candidate will be passionate about making a big impact on a small, entrepreneurial team that's housed in a large organization. Software in the Cloud.

Experts on the Ground: ADP powers the working world with comprehensive solutions that drive business success. Consistently named one of the "Most Admired Companies" by FORTUNE® Magazine, and recognized by Forbes® as one of "The World's Most Innovative Companies," ADP has over a half-million clients around the globe and 65 years of experience as one of the largest providers of human capital management solutions world-wide. At ADP, we believe that diversity fuels innovation. ADP is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, genetic information, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, lawful alien status, national origin, age, marital status, non-job related physical or mental disability, or protected veteran status.

We support an inclusive workplace where associates excel based on personal merit, qualifications, experience, ability, and job performance.
title: Senior Net Promoter Data Analyst (Customer Experience Insights)

description:
NerdWallet is looking to hire a Marketing Data Analyst/Senior Analyst to join our rapidly-growing marketing team. The marketing team is responsible for driving growth in our financial business units (e.g. credit cards, mortgages, student loans, insurance) by acquiring users primarily through content marketing. As a Marketing Data Analyst/Senior Analyst, you are responsible for researching and utilizing data to craft a unique, data-driven and compelling story that will engage the media outlets and consumer. You will work collaboratively across multiple teams to launch creative content marketing campaigns. This is a fantastic opportunity to make an immediate impact at a profitable, growing company.

Where you can make an impact:
-----------------------------

  • Conduct competitive analyses to understand SEO and traffic landscape to develop strategic recommendations
  • Brainstorm creative story ideas and content marketing campaigns
  • Develop consumers insights for our financial business units by researching and validating multiple data sources including internal data, government data, survey data, and external experts
  • Develop and track campaign progress to drive towards business goals
  • Contribute to an exciting, creative, rapid test and learn environment
You are:
--------

  • Data & Insights Driven: You demonstrate a passion and relentless drive for finding an answer. You can take seemingly disparate data and combine it to create deep and meaningful insights for your financial business unit.
  • Business Aptitude: You seek to understand how competitors acquire consumer traffic and how NerdWallet can improve by keeping a pulse on search engine results. Ability to think strategically about how to diversify traffic sources.
  • A Strong Researcher: Intellectual curiosity is one of your strong suits. You have the desire and the aptitude to develop a strong understanding of the data and experts within a given industry ecosystem. No data set is too big or too difficult to find and you often find yourself reaching out to others to further your understanding.
  • Creative: Financial topics can sometimes be labeled as dry or boring. You are able to take those topics and your data driven insights and craft a story that is unique in your area of expertise.
  • Customer Driven: You are interested in designing compelling marketing campaigns that will resonate with the consumer, media and industry stakeholders.
  • A Proactive Self Driver: You are skilled at planning, prioritizing and executing on multiple projects while meeting deadlines. You work well under pressure, maintain strong communication with your cross-functional team, and proactively surface roadblocks that could affect the success of the campaign.
Your experience:
----------------

  • 1-3 years work experience, preferably in a market research, data journalism, or data intensive roles
  • Proficiency in Excel or other data tools or software
  • Bachelor’s degree
  • Previous work in marketing, advertising, financial analysis a plus
About NerdWallet:
-----------------

NerdWallet is focused on helping people lead better lives through financial education and empowerment. When it comes to credit cards, insurance, loans or expenses like hospital costs, consumers make almost all their decisions in the dark. NerdWallet is changing that by building accessible online tools and providing research and experts that can’t be found anywhere else, all to balance consumer finance in favor of the consumer. We call it putting knowledge in your wallet.

What we offer:
--------------

  • Competitive compensation package
  • 100% paid premiums for medical, dental and vision for employees and their dependents
  • 401(k) with company match
  • Generous, flexible vacation
  • Catered lunches daily, free dinner, and a kitchen stocked full of snacks
  • In-office fitness classes
  • Paid commuter benefits
  • Friday happy hours
  • Pet-friendly office

description:
The ASPCA Community Medicine Program deploys mobile veterinary clinics. The Operations Team supports these functions from a garage/office space in Los Angeles, CA where fleet vehicles and supplies are based. Reporting to the Director of Operations, the Field Lot Manager will be responsible for the maintenance of the Community Medicine Fleet vehicles and for the cleanliness of the field lot as well as maintaining adequate inventory levels. This person will be responsible for stocking the mobile clinics to ensure there are ready for daily operations. This person will also be required to perform Senior Veterinary Assistant (SVA) duties on a regular basis and when needed.

Responsibilities:

Maintain, Organize the Field Lot Operations (35%)
  • Open or close the field as needed; assist with dispatching mobile clinics to the field
  • Coordinate maintenance and repairs of Community Medicine Fleet and Equipment and communicate with repair vendors to ensure minimal downtime of any fleet vehicle
  • Ensure the cleanliness of all fleet vehicles inside and out
  • Maintain tracking system for scheduled vehicle maintenance
  • Maintain incident tracking database and work with data analyst to summarize information
  • Track appointment compliance and canceled spay/neuter clinics or transport events
  • Respond promptly to maintenance requests from drivers and medical teams to ensure all fleet and equipment are in working order

description:
A video game company located in Santa Monica is looking for a Data Analyst to add to their growing team. They need this data analyst to help optimize their data ecosystem. The Data Analyst will be responsible for ensuring integrity and confidentiality of data as well as ensuring the performance of the data infrastructure.

Required Skills

  • 3+ years of experience in a Data Analyst position
  • Extensive experience with Hadoop, Spark, MapReduce, SQL, and other big data tools
  • Experience implementing ETL
  • Familiar with AWS cloud

Benefits

Benefits include medical, dental, vision, 401K, PTO, flexible hours, catered lunch, and much more.
title: Data Analyst

description:
The Data Analyst II uses their technical skills and training to extract data from core application libraries for the purposes of creating and manipulating complex spreadsheets and formulas, discovery of patterns and relationships, creation of summarized reports for senior management. These reports are used to assess business events and trends, as interpreted from health care clinical data and corporate financial data. Candidates must have a strong mathematical ability and a passion for analytical work. Under the direction of the Chief Financial Officer, the Data Analyst serves as a decision support specialist for projects relating to practice workflow improvement, enhancements to quality outcomes for patient services, and the proper use of professional resources to meet the organizational objectives.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
· Bachelors degree with a major in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Finance or Computer Sciences, and at least 3 years of experience in scientific or enterprise data analytics. Examples are: real estate analysis with an investment group or fund, investment trust asset valuation, banking or insurance risk/actuarial studies, or data analysis for hospital, public health or advocacy institutions.
· Expert or very advanced Excel skills level.
· Expert or very advanced SQL report composition skills
· Expert or very advanced skills with Oracle Discoverer or other ad hoc querying tools
· Advanced data analysis (“mining”), data modeling, and financial modeling skills, using 4 th dimension, interdisciplinary modeling dynamics.
· Excellent professional presentation and written communication skills.
· Experience developing pitch book, business plans, and/or cash flow models is preferred
· Experience with healthcare (medical or surgical) data analysis is preferred
SPECIFIC DUTIES:
· Develop and utilize complex financial models.
· Analyze proposed projects.
· Develop reports, proposals, presentations, forecasts, analyses, dashboards
· Prepare and maintain all documentation needed for due diligence, projects, etc.
· Organize a methodology to auto-generate stating reports and to quickly respond to prioritized information requests.
· Performs other duties as assigned
PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTS

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
  • Knowledge of p rinciples and practices of organization, administration, and personnel management
  • Knowledge of s tatistical methods and methods of graphic presentation
  • Knowledge of modern office procedures, methods and computer equipment
  • Knowledge of p rinciples and procedures of financial record keeping and reporting
  • Knowledge of t echnical report writing procedures
  • Ability to a nalyze facts and make sound recommendations
  • Ability to work with and control sensitive, confidential information
  • Advanced skills in using computer and calculator
  • Skill in identifying problems and recommending solutions
  • Ability to exercise initiative, judgment and decision-making
  • Ability to express oneself clearly and concisely both orally and in writing
  • Ability to prepare comprehensive statistical and narrative reports

TYPICAL PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

Ability to operate a keyboard, sit for long periods of time, bend, squat and reach occasionally. Requires manual and finger dexterity and eye-hand coordination. Occasionally lifts and carries items weighing up to 25 pounds. Vision must be correctable to 20/40 and hearing must be in the normal range for telephone contacts. Frequent public contact; constant decision-making, concentration; ability to work independently.

TYPICAL WORKING CONDITIONS:

Most daily tasks are performed in the corporate headquarters business office. This employee may be required to attend meetings and conferences away from the main office, at other CMC sites and elsewhere.

EOE

description:
Looking for a chance to do meaningful work that touches millions? Come join the hardest working, nonprofit health plan in California and help us shape the future of health care. Blue Shield of California’s Mission is to ensure all Californians have access to high-quality care at an affordable price. Blue Shield is focused on improving health care delivery by working closely with providers and making it more accessible, affordable and customer-centric. Being a mission-driven organization means we do much more than serve our 4 million members: we were the first health plan in the nation to limit our annual net income to 2 percent of revenue and return the difference to our customers and the community, and since 2005 we have contributed more than $325 million to the Blue Shield of California Foundation to improve community health and end domestic violence. We also believe that a healthier California begins with our employees, so we provide them with resources to develop and maintain a healthy lifestyle through our award-winning wellness program, Wellvolution.

We're hiring smart thinkers and doers who want to work for a leader and innovator in the challenging, ever-changing healthcare space. Come and help us make health care better for everyone.

Blue
Shield of California is seeking a Senior Business Analyst in HCQA Division. The
Senior Business Analyst’s primary responsibility is to guide tactical and
strategic actions using the best-in-class analyses and robust analytic tools.

The HCQA Division is responsible for developing, maintaining, and managing the
relationship with Blue Shield's network of physicians, hospitals, ambulatory
surgery centers, HMO IPAs, and medical groups.

Our team (Network Performance Analysis and Contracts) is part of the HCQA Division and focuses on provider network performance
analysis, reporting, and consulting. The
NPAC team is
responsible for developing analytics and supporting materials to assist and
guide strategic development and maintenance of Blue Shield's network of
physicians, hospitals, ambulatory surgery centers, HMO IPA's, and medical
groups.

Our team focuses on network design, maintenance and regulatory support. Some of
our key responsibilities are (1) provide analysis and consultative services on
new network design in support of corporate strategic roadmap; (2) manages and
oversees development and production of regulatory network filing artifacts as
required by regulators for all Blue Shield commercial and Medicare networks; (3)
provides network analytics, reporting and oversight on existing networks to
ensure meeting regulatory access, availability standards as defined by
regulators; and (4) provides consultative and analytical support as needed to
during contract negotiations, pricing activities and product/network strategy
roadmap planning.

This
position can be located in our San Francisco, Rancho Cordova or Woodland Hills
offices.

Responsibilities:
Lead and
facilitate cross-functional process improvement initiatives as it relates
to the network filing end to end process; scope inclusive of business,
infrastructure and operational changes needed to support the effort.

Independently manage
projects that may involve coordinating a team and working with different
stakeholders.

Collects, analyzes
and synthesizes data; develops artifacts and summaries in response to
regulatory filings and comment letters.

Support BSC’s key
network initiatives using robust analytic tools. Translate data analysis
into insightful and actionable items for internal customers.

Produce geo-access
reports and analysis/summaries for regulatory filings.

Collaborate with
internal stakeholders and customers to identify enhancement opportunities
to improve data collection, integrity and efficiencies.

Collaborate with
and support other teams such as network managers and Access & Availability
workgroup in developing strategies in support of data collection,
reporting, network adequacy assessments as it pertains to new and existing
networks.

Independently
summarize findings and presents data in formats such as excel pivots,
power point, reports, grids and tables.

Support
development of presentations/reports for internal and external customers

Ad hoc assignments
as requested.

Qualifications

Requires an MPH, MBA, MS, MA in science, social science, public health,
health services research or business, or BA/BS with demonstrated equivalent
work experience. PhD preferred.

Position also requires five to 10 years' experience in Health Care
(managed care, academic, or gov't payer), demonstrated ability to work with all
clinical coding systems (e.g., ICD9, CPT, DRG, LOINC, RxHUB).

5 or more years' experience as Health
Data Analyst, Medical Economist or related role in a managed care setting.

Excellent interpersonal skills

Excellent communication and presentation
skills, previous experience in presenting to leaders

Good business acumen, ability to work in a
team environment

Good math, analytical and problem-solving
skills

Intermediate to Advanced knowledge of MS Excel
(able to model, use formula) and Access (link tables, run queries)

Unix, SQL/PL-SQL,SAS.Must be able to develop
new SAS programs and SQL scripts that improve the efficiency of the work
of others.

SAS Base and Adv. Certification
preferred

Ability to work in a team environment.

Ability to work independently, proactively and
with little direction.

External hires must pass a background check/drug screen. Qualified applicants with arrest records and/or conviction records will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with Federal, State and local laws, including but not limited to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. description:
Description

Intuit is a leading software provider of business and financial management solutions for small and mid-sized businesses, consumers and accounting professionals. You probably know us by our flagship products, QuickBooks®, TurboTax® and Mint®, but that’s just the start. We are currently going through a fundamental transformation to a global financial solutions and services company. Come join Intuit as part of the Small Business Group Risk Data Analytics Team as a Sr. Data Engineer / SQL Developer. We are looking for creative problem solvers with a passion for innovation to join our team and revolutionize the way the world does business. This is a full time part time position in our Woodland Hills, CA location. This position may also require some occasional travel to our corporate office in Mountain View, CA. The primary role of a Sr. Data Engineer / SQL Developer is to provide timely technical, analytical and data support to the data analyst community to define, test, implement, and maintain strategies and procedures that will assist Intuit in growing revenue and profit by developing and maintaining cutting edge products and techniques in the target markets we serve. This position includes the following major areas of activity:

1. Work with SBG Risk and Compliance teams to enhance and maintain our SBG Risk Data Mart solutions, and provide a high quality and highly interactive experience with the SBG Risk and Compliance product managers and data analysts

2. Relational database design and maintenance using SQL Server 2016

a. Identify data sources needed for robust analysis and decision making

b. Develop and maintain complex ETL processes using SQL Server Integration Services to maintain

current data

c. Automate routine procedures

3. Provide Methodology, Data Mining and Analytical capabilities a. Perform complex data analysis, data modeling and data mining using SQL Server Analysis Services multi-dimensional and tabular Cubes b. Create comprehensive reporting capabilities using SQL Server Reporting Services c. Develop tools that will allow Data Analysts to access data and perform routine analysis Skills:
  • Technical – Can work with Business Intelligence and Reporting applications; automate routine procedures and create tools that increase productivity and efficiency
  • Software Development – Strong knowledge of SQL Server 2016 platform, Excel, Tableau
  • Analytics – Experience in analyzing data, drawing appropriate conclusions, ability to effectively translate statistical findings to business strategies that positively impact the business and the customer
  • Data Mining – Comfortable working with large volumes of data, discovering trends and relationships between different pieces of information and enabling compelling data visualizations
  • Communication – Demonstrated persuasive written and verbal communication skills with ability to establish logical flow and story to present complex information in an easy to understand manner
  • Interpersonal/Team Skills – Ability to work well with others, not just at a social level, but by building bridges and sometimes confronting tough issues that need to be resolved for the good of the business
  • Personal Traits – High degree of Initiative, Integrity, Outspoken, Driven (while being a team player) and Strong Attention to Detail

Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s Degree or better in Computer Science
  • 3+ Years Relevant Work Experience
  • Advanced skills in SQL Server 2014 or higher, and MS Excel
  • Experience with ETL processes using SQL Server Integration Services
  • 4+ Years work experience with SQL Server Analysis Services and Reporting Services
  • Prior Experience with Data Analysis and Data Modeling
  • Must pass background check
Preferred
  • Working knowledge of C#, .Net Framework, Hadoop, Tableau
  • Working knowledge of Windows Server 2012, Windows Failover Cluster Manager, PowerShell
  • Higher education in Computer Science or Mathematics
  • 3+ Years work experience in Financial Services
title: Senior Data Engineer / SQLDeveloper

description:
National Funding is continuing to grow its Analytics Department and has an exciting opportunity as a Senior Business Data Analyst. We are looking for a data-driven individual with excellent analytical skills and experience to work alongside business stakeholders primarily on our Operations team to deliver insights and make recommendations.

Senior Business Data Analyst Major Responsibilities

  • Provides analytic support and strategic thought partnership to Operations team
  • The ideal candidate will have the ability to tell stories with the data, communicate effectively and instill confidence in recommendations to motivate stakeholders to take action
  • Builds recommendations by synthesizing data from multiple sources, developing assumptions where needed, to drive business insights and strategy development
  • Completes analytics projects requiring collaboration with business stakeholders
  • Builds, validates, and publishes analytics reports and dashboards for the business
  • Delivers key insights with interpretation and recommendation, contributes to the development of hypotheses and actions, and presents them to management team
  • Partners with Operations leaders to identify areas of opportunity for efficiencies or risk mitigation and contributes to the implementation of these initiatives
  • Develops new and better analytics approaches to solve questions in a creative way
The Ideal Candidate

  • 3-7 years of experience in data analysis
  • Strong knowledge of SQL and/or SAS
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Experience with Tableau preferred
  • Outstanding communication skills with both technical and non-technical colleagues
  • Prefer candidates with experience in Finance, Mortgage, Banking
Why National Funding?

  • Positive, energetic, passionate, business casual environment with management who commits to your success
  • Fantastic benefits package including a 401(k) match
  • Numerous employee events throughout the year, including our annual traditions such as a Day at the Del Mar Racetrack, Del Mar Mud Run, Bring Your Kid to Work Day, Holiday Party, Employee and Family Picnic, sporting events and more.
National Funding is one of the leading providers of short term loans and equipment leasing for small businesses across the United States. In both 2013 and 2014, we were ranked by the San Diego Business Journal as one of the 100 Fastest Growing Private Companies in San Diego and listed on the Inc. 5000 List of America’s Fastest Growing Private Companies. We serve the small business community nationwide by offering a range of financial services and products. Since 1999, we have been in the forefront of the equipment leasing business, working with businesses in hundreds of communities and industries to expand and upgrade their business equipment. As we have grown, so too has our product line, and now we are one of the country’s largest private lenders of small business loans. Our customers call on us to get working capital, merchant cash advances, credit card processing, and, of course equipment leasing.
