description:
Description: Apria Healthcare is one of nation’s leading providers of home healthcare products and services including respiratory therapy, sleep apnea therapy, non-invasive ventilation therapy, enteral nutrition therapy, negative pressure wound therapy and home medical equipment. Headquartered in Lake Forest, California, Apria owns and operates branch locations across the nation and serves more than 1.8 million patients each year. With over $1 Billion in annual revenues, Apria is one of the largest home healthcare companies in the United States. Apria was the first company of its type to obtain voluntary accreditation from The Joint Commission and has been continuously accredited for more than 25 years. For more information, visit www.apria.com .

description:
We are seeking an experienced, high caliber Analyst I, Product Surveillance. Under the direction of the department manager, the Product Surveillance Analyst will be responsible for complaint investigation management and including all activities pertaining to product complaints for SJM. This includes, but is not limited to: receiving and investigating reports of worldwide complaints/events on a variety of products; entering information into the complaint database; independently determining and filing appropriate medical devices reports with various regulatory agencies; participating on cross-functional teams; and providing information on product complaints, including data extracted from the complaint database to various teams (e.g. Regulatory, Quality Engineering). Another role of the Product Surveillance Analyst is that of evaluations of returned complaint products, coordinating product testing/analysis with other departments and external consultants, preparing technical reports of findings and customer letters, and collecting and evaluating analysis data. The Product Surveillance Analyst will also be able to perform trending of complaint data in either role as requested by management, including preparation of trending charts utilizing the complaint database and other programs, in support of the department Data Analyst.

Each employee can make a difference at St. Jude Medical and has the power, either individually or as a team, to influence the success of the company. We are team-oriented, fast-paced and progressive. We value people with great ideas who partner with others both internally and externally to take action and accomplish goals.

Impact this role will have on St. Jude Medical:
  • Assisting the department manager in ensuring all global medical device reports are filed within regulatory timeframes

  • Represents Product Surveillance at cross-functional meetings as requested or in the absence of the department manager

  • Provides training on complaint reporting to other groups

  • Supports Product Surveillance Data Analyst by performing trending

  • Supports complaint database upgrades, changes, conversions through design input, testing, maintenance functions

  • Ensures complaint information on intranet sites is maintained

  • Orders department supplies in accordance with budget

  • Support inspections by regulatory agencies (e.g. FDA, TUV) as requested

  • Assists in training new employees and maintaining training documents

  • Is vigilant of product complaint trends

  • Ensures department procedures and work instructions are maintained

  • Supporting and instruct other department members as needed on product complaint investigations and devices

  • Collaborate independently with other team members and departments needing product complaint information

  • Act as information resource to other Product Surveillance team members

  • Be able to conduct investigations with customers or field staff with minimal direction, utilizing experience and knowledge of products and various types of product complaints

  • Be able to make sound decisions regarding medical device reporting to various global regulatory agencies, minimizing the need for input from department management

  • Use procedures, judgment and experience to determine appropriate testing of returned products with minimal guidance

  • Be able to ascertain when additional support may be needed from other teams on complaint investigations (e.g. potential manufacturing-related issues)

  • Train others in Product Surveillance product complaint handling

  • Support department manager in their absence

  • Provide support to Legal Dept on product complaints

  • Support all Company initiatives as identified by management and in support of Quality Management Systems (QMS), Environmental Management Systems (EMS), and other regulatory requirements

  • Complies with U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) regulations, other regulatory requirements, Company policies, operating procedures, processes, and task assignments
    • Maintains positive and cooperative communications and collaboration with all levels of employees, customers, contractors, and vendors


  • Performs other related duties and responsibilities, on occasion, as assigned

Your experience(s), education and knowledge will further expand St. Jude Medical’s marketplace success:
  • Four-year degree, preferably in the healthcare or science fields; or 2-year degree and relevant experience supporting complaint handling investigations, medical device reporting, or product analysis
    • Degreed applicants without medical, scientific, or complaint handling experience may be considered if they possess the strengths suitable for this position


  • Knowledge of global regulations for medical device reporting and medical terminology is a plus

  • Strong written and oral communication skills are required

  • Candidate must be able to work well independently and on teams in a busy department while managing multiple ongoing tasks and investigations simultaneously

  • Good problem-solving and proficient computer skills are required

  • Experience working in a broader enterprise/cross-division business unit model preferred

  • Ability to work in a highly matrixed and geographically diverse business environment

  • Ability to work within a team and as an individual contributor in a fast-paced, changing environment

  • Ability to leverage and/or engage others to accomplish projects

  • Strong verbal and written communications with ability to effectively communicate at multiple levels in the organization

  • Multitasks, prioritizes and meets deadlines in timely manner

  • Strong organizational and follow-up skills, as well as attention to detail

  • Ability to travel approximately 10%, including internationally

  • Ability to maintain regular and predictable attendance
title: Product Surveillance Analyst I

description:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.

The Publisher Intelligence team is a business analyst team responsible for delivering data-driven insights to support Online Partnerships Group's (OPG) global sales and support efforts. As an analyst on the Publisher Intelligence team, you will be responsible for scoping, initiating, and delivering on analytical projects, such as modeling publisher behavior, creating complex SQL workflows, and evaluating the impact of projects via A/B testing. This requires not only deep analytical and modeling skills, but also the ability to develop strategic recommendations based on analysis and communicate and operationalize them (often in conjunction with various other cross-functional stakeholders). This role is not about simply grinding out numbers; it is about building new business processes based on data and models to drive business growth, increasing efficiency, and improving customer satisfaction. This is a highly collaborative role in which you will work closely with the various teams within OPG and throughout Google to drive the business decisions that will make our partners more successful.

Google’s Global Partnerships team works with a wide range of partners to bring the best of Google to power their business. The team partners with Publishers and App Developers of all sizes to promote their ad inventory, working with Google's broad range of partner solutions including AdSense, DoubleClick Platform Solutions and the Ad Exchange, across mobile, display, and video formats, helping our partners and their audiences get the most out of the web. In addition, the Partnerships team supports Google’s own product teams with essential partnerships to help power Google’s user experiences in search, maps, travel, shopping, payments and more.

Responsibilities
  • Scope, initiate, manage, and execute data projects in conjunction with various cross-functional stakeholders.
  • Manage and develop the data infrastructure of the Online Partnerships Group
  • Respond to ad hoc data requests from global sales, support teams and broader analyst community.

Qualifications Minimum qualifications:
  • BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Data infrastructure experience (databases and spreadsheets), and experience in database languages and querying (SQL).
  • Project management experience.

Preferred qualifications:
  • BA/BS degree of a quantitative or business nature (Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Finance, Business etc.).
  • 2 years of relevant work experience (data analyst, business analyst, product analyst, consultant).
  • Strong database management skills
  • Passion for organizing and streamlining data for broader use.
  • Excellent verbal/written communication skills including presentations.
title: Publisher Intelligence Analyst, Online Partnerships Group

description: Principal - Data Analyst (Realtime Operation Intelligence)Looking for a self-driven developer/technologist that loves working in a highly collaborative and dynamic environment to engineer, develop and integrate a variety of systems and applications in multiple environments. Candidate should posses skills to define roadmaps, execution plan, and works with Development, Operation, Security, and Business stakeholders to implement group initiatives. Tasks including, but not limited to* Develop ETL scripts/configuration to move data across pipeline* Develop/integration monitoring tools to monitor system health, performance and fault recovery* Lead effort in data management for Real Time Operation Intelligence (RTOI).* Lead effort in incorporation of machine learning capability to the Real Time Operation Intelligence (RTOI) platform* Ensure performance, availability, and scalability of Real Time Operation Intelligence (RTOI) platform* Architecture, design platform for operation data collection, storage, and analytics* Technical evaluation and testing of third party analytics and process solutions* Work with Operations, Development, Security, and Business organization to define and execute business initiatives.* Assist roadmap definition for team to be on the leading edge of technology to enable using of data/analytics for realtime actions.* Define/improve application development process to deliver Real Time Operation Intelligence (RTOI) components.* System, application, and data pipeline design, provisioning, capacity planning and performance testing.* 4+ years of application development and/or engineering experience* 2+ years of experience in OLAP database and analytics application* 4+ years of development experience in Python and/or Ruby using object oriented patterns.* Excellent written and verbal communication skills* Experience in Brokerage and Operations* Experience with Oracle, Sybase, and standard RDBMS database* Experience with ElasticSearch, Kafka, Samza, Spark* Exposure to Hadoop platform and components* Exposure to APM platform and programming (New Relic)* Basic Linux application and system administration* Experience with integration of Software solution from Open Source and vendorsEducationBachelor degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or MathematicsHadoop platform/Elastic search/Etl /RDBMS/Python or ruby

description: We have a 4 month assignment - 3 days per week with our client in the apparel industry. They are looking for a Data Analyst to collect monthly vendor reports from 21 different markets, combine them into one report, then providing monthly and quarterly reporting. We would need someone who is organized, good with excel and access and works with data. The temp is not completely replacing a position but is assisting with this data portion of the role. Therefore I will not need specific work experience related to my team’s job function (Trade Compliance).
title: Data Analyst

description:
Were on a mission to create a world wherepeople love their workand were doing it in jeans.

(Sometimes sweatpants when we work from home!)

Help us make life-changing products and showus up in the office Ping-Pong rankings.

Roadtrip Nation seeks a Sr. Data Analyst to join across-disciplinary team that thrives on impact, collaboration, and drinking ridiculousamounts of fancy coffee.
The Senior Data Analyst will gather, analyze and translate data using bothinternal and external sources to better report on operational and mission basedperformance, including measures related to determining student impact, ofRoadtrip Nation (RTN) products and services. This individual will createprocesses and manage the data reporting requirements for RTN that could also beused across other sister organizations. This role will be reporting directly to theVP for Data Analytics. The incumbent will create dashboards and reports providing insight into businessdata, and help to generate an annual impact report for RTN.
The Sr. Data Analystwill also collaborate with team members to gather requirements for dataanalysis and reporting data to continuously improve the impact of its productsand the organizations operational performance. The incumbent must have good general technical skills to conceptualize,develop and present KPI-related data. Must have a solid understanding of the postsecondary and workforcechallenges RTN is deeply invested in .

Responsibilities
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individualswith disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Develop reporting solutions that will improve operational efficiencies and inform C-suite strategic planning at RTN Design and develop graphics-rich scorecards, dashboards and reports that address both operational and mission-related KPIs Develop and conduct quantitative analyses that integrate operational and extant data sources Develop manual and automated data reporting tools Synthesize results, develop conclusions and recommendations and report those findings to relevant business units and company directors Ability to: Work with minimal supervision Juggle multiple projects simultaneously Work under the occasionally tight timelines

Qualifications A bachelors degree or relevant experience Minimum of 3 years of experience in an analyst/BI reporting capacity, ideally 5+ years. Ability to be based in the RTN offices in Costa Mesa, CA 2 + years experience with Google Analytics Familiarity and first-hand experience working with national and/or state education data sets (e.g. NCES, College Scorecard) as well as facility pulling and manipulating other federal data (e.g. BLS and ACS data) SQL query experience Experience developing and producing dashboards and scorecards Advanced knowledge of MS Office suite, including Access Familiarity with data mining and statistical modeling techniques Excellent verbal and written communication skills Familiarity with education data reporting best practices

Preferred Education/Experience Candidate with a firm understanding of national postsecondary education and workforce development policies is a plus Prefer an advanced degree in business, economics or education Prior experience working with Tableau, Power BI or any other of the big intelligence platforms is a plus Prior experience conducting data analysis in the postsecondary education and/or workforce spaces is helpful

AboutRoadtrip Nation
70% of Americans are unhappy with their work, andRoadtrip Nation has charged itself with finding a solution. You could call us acareer exploration organization, but we do things a little differently. Wedont just tell people what they should do; we help them find what they love todoand we do it through travel and storytelling. ( Hencethose green RVs you see splashed on our website that maaaaybe made you think wesell recreational vehicles.)
From our TV show thatreaches 70 million households annually, to our educationaltools thatve helped 8 million students learn more about themselves and the world,we create products that empower people to get more out of work than just apaycheck. On a typical day, you can findus mid-brainstorm scrawling (sometimes incoherent) ideas on white boards, or huddlingaround a Photoshop file oohing and ahhing. Of course, there's always time forfun. From hitting the beach at lunch to emailing each other important info inthe form of memes, we know play isnt just a distractionits an imperative.
If you think youd fit inwell with us, wed love to meet you!
title: Sr. Data Analyst

description:
Looking for a chance to do meaningful work that touches millions? Come join the hardest working, nonprofit health plan in California and help us shape the future of health care. Blue Shield of California’s Mission is to ensure all Californians have access to high-quality care at an affordable price. Blue Shield is focused on improving health care delivery by working closely with providers and making it more accessible, affordable and customer-centric. Being a mission-driven organization means we do much more than serve our 4 million members: we were the first health plan in the nation to limit our annual net income to 2 percent of revenue and return the difference to our customers and the community, and since 2005 we have contributed more than $325 million to the Blue Shield of California Foundation to improve community health and end domestic violence. We also believe that a healthier California begins with our employees, so we provide them with resources to develop and maintain a healthy lifestyle through our award-winning wellness program, Wellvolution.

We're hiring smart thinkers and doers who want to work for a leader and innovator in the challenging, ever-changing healthcare space. Come and help us make health care better for everyone.

Collects, analyzes and synthesizes data; develops information to guide business decision making for BSC populations' health management, cost of health care management, quality of care, and network design and strategies. Responsibilities Low Complexity: one or two sources of data, descriptive statistical methods, one or two clinical areas. No coordination with analysts in other Departments is required Moderate Complexity: three or four sources of data, univariate statistical methods, statistical graphics, three or four clinical areas. Requires consultation and coordination with analysts in other Departments but not reconciliation of analytical approaches High Complexity: more than four sources of data, multivariate statistical methods, statistical graphics more than four clinical areas. Requires consultation and coordination with analysts in other Departments and reconciliation of analytical approaches Mastery of Medical Informaticist I, II & III responsibilities. Conducts independent analysis of high complexity under minimal supervision and guidance. Develops innovative analyses and reports using understanding of the business need for information. Develops analytical methods so that they may be subsequently delegated for production to Informaticists at lower levels. Produces analysis of high complexity under the guidance and direction of Medical Informaticist IV, supervisor or manager. Communicates analytical results in presentations, abstracts, graphs or summaries with minor editing and input from supervisor or manager. Develops documentation and creates and executes workplans for analyses of high complexity. Workplans may coordinate the activities of Informaticists at lower levels and may involve collaboration with more than one team. Designs, builds, and enhances data systems and analysis methods so that they better serve complex, high level reporting requirements. Critically reviews and revises existing analytical processes for currency, efficiency, and sufficiency. Identifies existing inefficiencies and problems and takes action to implement solutions. Anticipates unrealized problems and and takes action to implement solutions. Designs, implements, and manages complex data structures and analysis systems. Creates system QA processes and documentation. Functions as facilitator and mentor for analysis workgroups. Provides training and mentoring for team members on best practices for analysis and reporting; assists in the development of supplemental analytic training tools and materials; conducts formal training sessions for lower level analysts and analysts in other Departments. Supplies consultative advice to analysts in other departments and business units regarding standard business rules and analytical methods. Provides coordination and oversight of the peer review of analyses for accuracy and completeness. Assesses business risks associated with analytical processes and data systems and develops strategies to mitigate risks. Uses appropriate technical, clinical, and financial knowledge to assess the completeness and reliability of data and the validity and accuracy of analytical results. Produces accurate work under tight deadlines Communicates analytical results so that they are easily understood by non-technical persons. Continuously refines and expands the technical, clinical, and financial content knowledge required to successfully complete these duties. Other duties as assigned

Qualifications
title: Lead Data Analyst, Rx Outcomes / Trends

company: USC Center for Applied Molecular Medicine
description:
The Ellison Institute aims to provide exceptional clinical care and to engender transformative changes in the management of cancer to significantly impact human health and well-being, and quantity and quality of life. The Ellison Institute’s research focuses on the application of proteomics (the study of the body’s proteins) and genomics, mathematical modeling, integrating clinical trials, pre-clinical studies and molecularly targeted therapy, which focuses on molecular and cellular changes specific to cancer. The Ellison Institute uses all of these techniques to determine which cancer therapies are likely to work best for individual patients, allowing physicians to customize treatment for each patient’s cancer. Within the Institute, the Center for Applied Molecular Medicine (CAMM) is improving cancer outcomes by discovering optimal approaches to personalized therapy. Our vision is that a patient’s own metrics will determine their most effective treatment. They might include molecular tumor markers, the dynamics of intracellular processes, or the behavior of cells across diverse microenvironments. We investigate a broad range of biological systems, including cell culture, mouse models, and patient-derived tissues.

The University of Southern California (USC), founded in 1880, is located in the heart of downtown L.A. and is the largest private employer in the City of Los Angeles. As an employee of USC, you will be a part of a world-class research university and a member of the Trojan Family, which is comprised of the faculty, students and staff that make the university what it is.

The Center for Applied Molecular Medicine (CAMM) at the Lawrence J. Ellison Institute for Transformative Medicine of the University of Southern California is looking for a Data Analyst/Database Analyst II and for a Biostatistician/Statistician II to complement its Data Management and Analytics team. At CAMM, you will join an interdisciplinary team dedicated to support the institute’s mission of transforming cancer treatment by providing cutting-edge solutions for the analysis of biomedical data.

You will directly cooperate with the Institute investigators and outside partners on a variety of projects, tackling among the most significant challenges facing human health. Besides building and running a modern computational infrastructure, members of the Data Management and Analytics group collaborate in highly interdisciplinary teams throughout a project’s lifecycle: from the initial design phase to the study publication, data release and subsequent monitoring of the outcomes.

Thanks to a generous gift from Lawrence J. Ellison, we are going to substantially expand both in size and in the scope of our activities in the near future. This makes it a uniquely exciting time to join our team to make a significant impact on the life and well-being of millions of people.

We are seeking a talented statistician with a strong interest cancer biology and expertise in the statistical analysis of biological data. The candidate will interact frequently with biological scientists and clinicians to understand their experiments, data, and project goals. The ability to communicate effectively with biologists and clinicians on their own terms is essential. The successful applicant will be capable of designing experiments, providing compelling data visualizations, and applying appropriate statistical analyses of experimental data. Data sets may include high-dimensional multi-omic data, time series from live cell microscopy, and complex clinical data from electronic medical records. Contributions will also be made to current and future development of grant applications, scientific research and scientific manuscripts for CAMM.
title: Statistician II

description:
Our client, a fast-growing tech company with high profile entertainment clients, has an immediate need for a Jr. Data Scientist / Data Analyst. This is a full time direct hire position with excellent benefits and the opportunity to be part of a cool, dynamic team.

Ideal candidates have a strong understanding of advanced statistical and probabilistic models, which are utilized in digital advertising campaign management. This person will work autonomously in a very collaborative team environment liaising with members of the Data Science, Media, & Engineering teams.

DESIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:

• Experience processing large volumes of data for analysis that is often unstructured and preparing it for further distribution

• Experience preparing understandable reports & presentations and delivering succinct explanations

• Ability to collect, analyze and communicate data

• Experience with Excel and pivot tables

• Proficient in MS Office and Keynote

• Strong attention to detail and a self-starter mentality

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Please submit your resume along with your availability. Our client is ready to interview this week!
title: Jr. Data Scientist / Data Analyst

description:
Operates as the primary business and financial analyst for projects within a program. Participates in the preparation, analysis, reconciliation, and forecasting of project-related business, accounting and financial data.

Operates as the performance data analyst for a program. Participates in the preparation, analysis, reconciliation and forecasting of project related operations data such as compliance, utilization rates, completion rates, response times, milestone completion rates and other performance metrics.

Role Responsibility:
Coordinates preparation and analysis of internal and external reports through gathering, analyzing and summarizing data and information. This includes budget reports, forecasting reports, variance reports and other financial and management reports.

Prepares presentation materials for project and corporate management as required.

Evaluates and monitors the performance and efficiency of the program or project(s).

Monitors project/program revenue and expense transactions and reports, reviews for accuracy and completeness; investigates discrepancies.

Develops and maintains management of critical and key performance reports.

Works on overall project planning, schedules, and deliverables along with project team.

Works with project staff to prepare cost and revenue budgets.

Provides support to the project team by gathering and analyzing data in the establishment and/or maintenance of project business processes, procedures and policies.

Assists in the initiation, conducting, and coordinating of studies and analysis of resource allocation.

Responsible for coordination of transactional accounting activities with corporate office personnel.

Position operates within the project/program structure, and has dotted line reporting responsibility to corporate accounting.

Other duties as assigned by supervisor.

The Ideal Candidate:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE

BS/BA degree in Business Administration, Finance, or Accounting, with a minimum of 1 to 5 years of experience in a business or operations environment. An acceptable equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered. Should be knowledgeable and experienced with software packages such as Microsoft Word and Excel. Experience with Great Plains Accounting, and SAP Ariba systems is a plus. Individual should be a self-starter and used to working in a fast-paced environment.

LANGUAGE SKILLS

Communicates effectively in both oral and written English technical language, both in interpreting requirements and providing reports. Should possess good customer service abilities along with refined grammar skills. The position requires interaction with other departments and field employees and therefore the incumbent should possess excellent interpersonal skills.

REASONING ABILITY

Ability to define problems, collects data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. On occasion the ability to interpret a variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

While performing the duties of this job, the incumbent is regularly required to sit; use hand and fingers, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear. The incumbent is occasionally required to stand for long periods of time. The incumbent may be required to lift and/or move up to 10 lbs. And occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 lbs. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

While performing the duties of this job, the employee regularly works in an office environment. There is low to moderate noise in this work environment.

About the Company:
Why work for G4S Secure Integration?

Global experts in the assessment, design, construction, maintenance and management of communication networks and electronic security systems

Over 20 Years of proven experience as an established large-scale systems integrator providing unified communications and security solutions

Financially Sound Company, Highly Regarded by Customers & Industry Peers

Highly Competitive Compensation Plan & Comprehensive Benefits Package

G4S Secure Integration is a systems integrator that brings innovative, flexible and cost efficient thinking to the design, construction and maintenance of stand-alone or integrated communication networks and electronic security systems. For over two decades, we have offered commercial, industrial and governmental clients an efficient single point of contact for all their project issues. A trusted partner to customers and suppliers around the world, G4S Secure Integration takes great pride in delivering outstanding technology, superior customer service and a great return on investment.

G4S Secure Integration has deployed over 2 million fiber miles in more than 200 metropolitan and rural areas and completed over 1,500 large-scale, electronic security systems projects in the United States, Europe, Asia, Central America, and the Middle East.

Headquartered in Omaha, Nebraska, G4S Secure Integration is managed by executives from the telecommunications, construction and security industries. For more information, visit the company’s website at www.g4s.us or call (866) 221-5641 .

We offer an attractive, competitive compensation plan, an outstanding comprehensive benefits package, and significant opportunity for professional growth and advancement in the rapidly expanding security/telecommunications industry. We strongly encourage inquiries from qualified women and minority candidates. While interest from all applicants for employment with G4S Secure Integration is genuinely appreciated, we can respond only to those candidates with qualifications closest to the job requirements. For confidential consideration, please visit http://technologycareers.g4s.com/ and apply on-line. No phone calls please.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Minorities/Female/Disabled/Veteran

title: Project Analyst

description:
Job Descriptions:
The Application Support Engineer’s role is to provide application support from a technical perspective. This includes supporting data loading and mining operations, responsibility for standard maintenance processes, log verification, error resolution, patch maintenance, supporting the implementation of new applications and building application interfaces. Light database administration is also a requirement.
We are looking for an individual who is passionate about their work, eager to tackle new challenges and learn the skills necessary to find solutions while on the job. We value innovation, intelligence, and ability as well as a demonstrated willingness to take ownership of projects and systems. The IT department is excited about the opportunity to help shape and support our growing company and we hope you are too!

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Builds interfaces / manages interface projects between business applications.
Modifies existing forms and reports; builds new forms and reports as required by users.
Monitors application processes to ensure availability
Work directly with personnel (functional and technical), external consulting partner and/or other outside vendors as required.
Work with different departments to develop a thorough understanding of the business processes and business requirements in order to facilitate the implementation of the ERP system and other related applications.
Perform application configuration and setup across multiple areas of the ERP system and other related applications.
Lead application functionality testing, patch testing, and provide recommendations for functionality enhancement. Work with software vendor to implement enhancements.
Develop and update important documentation including business process flows, requirements documents, functional and technical design documents, test cases, and user training materials.
Execute the activities and tasks identified with little to no supervision.
Communicate and manage relationships with internal and external customers. Must portray excellent facilitation skills.
Research and resolve technical issues (in person, by telephone, or via e-mail); provide prompt assistance with resolutions or a work-around when possible.
Help develop business process modeling.
Communicate progress to management.
Test pilot new applications to validate work instructions and database information.
Utilizes project management skills to successfully manage time to accomplish projects.
Mentors Level I Application Support Engineers.
Translates complex business needs and problems into system configuration, test and setup requirements.
Translate business requirements into working IT documentsincluding functional requirements, functional design, and technicaldesign, as applicable.
Solves complex, highly technical problems effectively while under pressure.

Required Experience:
5+ years related experience in a technical application support function.
Requires BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or MIS.
Must be a self-motivated, dependable team player with the ability to work independently.
Demonstrated passion for customer satisfaction.
Demonstrated strong communication skills. Must be able to multi-task, be proactive and complete tasks in a timely manner.
Proven knowledge includes database and networking administration, and programming experience.
Demonstrated ability to interact successfully with all levels of employees, external resources and customers.
Effective planning and organizational abilities and superior detail-orientation. Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
Proficiency with SQL Server, MS Biztalk, and MS Visual Studio application.
Experience with Microsoft development technologies (VB, VB Script, COM+, etc.)
Working knowledge of MS office suite of products including MS Access and MS Project preferred
Ability to quickly learn new technologies and programming languages with little mentoring and/or training.
MS Access experience is plus. VBA and Application development using MS Access.
SharePoint experience is required. Both 3.0 and MOSS.
Must be a U.S. Citizen

title: Application Support Engineer II - Data Analyst

description:
Bring us your experience, your head for strategy, your strength with relationships and your eye for opportunity. In return we offer an unmatched place to grow and develop your career among a richly diverse group of businesses driven by the power and stability of a leading health care organization. Come help us heal and strengthen the health care system as you do your life's best work.(sm)

The Senior Compliance & Privacy Analyst will perform data extraction and analytics, data reporting and other compliance and privacy related duties to assist the CIA Program Manager (CIAPM), Chief Compliance Officer (CCO), Chief Information Security & Privacy Officer (CISPO), VP of Revenue Cycle Quality and Compliance and others in developing, implementing, coordinating and supporting compliance functions and activities in a client setting.

Primary Responsibilities:
  • Works effectively and collaboratively with colleagues, employees, internal clients, business partners and key customers, vendors, and management within Optum360, responding promptly and efficiently to emails, telephone calls, and complaints that come through the hotline
  • Strong analytical skills with experience in pulling and analyzing data from hospital and physician billing and related information systems
  • Applies comprehensive knowledge and a thorough understanding of legal and compliance concepts, principles, and technical capabilities to perform varied tasks and projects
  • Supports CIAPM in coordinating the implementation of and the ongoing monitoring and maintenance of Optum360’s responsibilities under the client’s Corporate Integrity Agreement (CIA)
  • Ability to develop practical and innovation solutions to a wide range of problems
  • Ability to handle complex projects and understand and prioritize risks
  • Assists in developing, maintaining, and updating compliance and privacy policies and procedures to support Optum360’s Corporate Compliance Program and culture of integrity and ethics
  • Performs internal monitoring and auditing to ensure compliance with laws, rules, and policies governing Optum360’s operations
  • Reviews and analyzes results of internal audits and monitoring activities and prepares reports detailing the findings for discussion with CCO, CISPO and VP of Revenue Cycle and Compliance others
  • Anticipates and identifies areas of improvement for the Compliance Program and participates in developing compliance performance improvement projects and activities
  • Models and supports Optum360’s core values, mission, and vision as well as C - i - Care strategy when interacting with others
  • Supports annual compliance training efforts
  • Performs other duties as assigned

Required Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s Degree and / or experience in a healthcare related field with a combination of professional training and / or work experience
  • 3+ years of experience working in health care environment (hospital revenue cycle preferred)
  • 2+ years’ experience in healthcare data analyst position
  • Experience in training and educating employees
  • Excellent computer skills and demonstrated ability to prepare effective presentations and reports using a variety of software programs (including Microsoft Office Suite).
  • Willingness to obtain HCCA Compliance and / or Privacy certification within twenty - four months
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Experience in clinical operations, accounting, compliance, privacy, internal audit, billing, coding or equivalent related field
  • Knowledge and understanding of healthcare industry regulations and guidelines
  • Professional certification in one or more of the following areas: Healthcare Compliance Professional (HCP), Certified Internal Auditor (CIA), Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) Project Management Professional (PMP), Certified Healthcare Financial Professional (CHFP), or similar
Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)

Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

title: Senior Compliance and Privacy Analyst - Sacramento, CA

description:
Job in Petaluma CA
A fantastic career opportunity for Senior Clinical Informaticist Analyst is now available with a reputable hospital in beautiful and coastal San Francisco Bay Area in California!

The Senior Clinical Systems Analyst will work with a hospital known for its state-of-the-art technology, collaborative culture, and excellent growth opportunities in sought-after specialties. This non-profit Medical Center unites the best elements of private practice and an academic hospital with diverse specialty services and patient base.

The Clinical Informaticist Data Analyst will be responsible for coordinating between Nursing and Information Services all aspects of clinical information systems to assure that existing and future systems facilitate and enhance clinical practice and delivery of patient care and meet quality and regulatory requirements.

The Senior Clinical Informaticist will coordinate and facilitate on-going clinical information system evaluation including: user accuracy, data integrity, and system reliability. The Senior Informaticist Data Analyst will be responsible for ongoing system activities include auditing, system and workflow improvements, change communication, end user education, competency validation, coaching and re-training.

The Clinical Informaticist Data Analyst will be responsible for the development, delivery, and evaluation of clinical systems educational programs and services to nursing and related patient care staff; serve as the chair of the Nursing Informatics Oversight Committee, and act as resource to Quality and Regulatory staff regarding documentation processes and compliance.

The ideal Clinical Informatics Nurse will have BSN and MS in Nursing/Nursing Informatics degree with experience in a lead or supervisory capacity, patient care informatics systems, and multiple vendor experience preferred. Experience with project management and process improvement processes required.

The Senior Clinical Systems Analyst will join a team of professionals with national reputation for excellence based on a hospital-wide commitment to outstanding patient care. The hospital offers prestige, satisfaction, enrichment—and fun. Join now!

description:
We are seeking an experienced, high caliber Senior Data Analyst for Post-market Surveillance. This position is responsible to partner with cross-functional Quality and Business Unit Teams to perform various data analysis activities on Critical Care product lines and reporting the analysis to Management.

This person will teach the organization on the use of various statistical methods that can be applied to complex data sets. Will lead the creation of statistical and trending policies for the organization to utilize around quality, regulatory, manufacturing and new product development processes.

This person must be comfortable in a regulated environment, possess excellent teamwork and communication skills, and be able to apply an analytical mindset that leverages data to better improve the customer experience.
title: Senior Data Analyst, Post Market Surveillance - Critical Care

description:
The Personalization Data Engineering and Analytics team is dedicated to supporting the algorithm research/engineering teams at Netflix. As part of Netflix's greater personalization efforts we partner with leading researchers to determine the best way (through algorithm development and data) to make each user's experience unique and customized. In this role, you will have the opportunity to cover a broad array of disciplines. This can include (and is not limited to) understanding how our customers interact with our ranking algorithms, surfacing critical insights about algorithm performance, and judging the efficacy of many complementary/competing algorithms.

The perfect person will have a background in a quantitative/technical field, and a rich history of answering questions using web-scale datasets.

Responsibilities:


  • Identify failure modes. You will be partnering with algorithm leaders to research opportunities to improve the user experience. It is expected that you’ll become an expert in how ML algorithms are implemented at Netflix and look for weaknesses in the current implementation.
  • Size and Scope. New opportunities for our recommendation algorithms.
  • Measure algorithm performance. You will need to create new methods for describing how ML algorithms are performing, and summarize findings in easily consumable formats.






Skills & Characteristics:


  • You have general knowledge of predictive modeling and algorithms.
  • You have the ability to see both sides of an argument, and successfully argue for either side. You’re comfortable taking a position.
  • You're ambitious and willing to take action, but not stubborn. You recognize when you're wrong and move past your own mistakes.
  • You are a well-rounded, top performer who is able to process data at scale and work strategically with algorithm partners.
  • You leave your desk & collaborate. You recognize the value in face-to-face contact. (Not to be mistaken with extroversion.)
  • You are curious. You learn eagerly about new concepts and tools.
  • You're comfortable working in a variety of tech stacks (e.g. SQL, Scala, Python), and you strive to write beautiful code.
title: Senior Data Analyst, Personalization Algorithms

description:
Netflix embodies the modern entertainment experience where anyone can enjoy shows and movies seamlessly on nearly all modern platforms like smart TVs, computers, and mobile devices. Continuing our aim to innovate we have combined our data and entertainment expertise to craft new shows and movies, the Netflix Originals. Now, in the space of growth and messaging we’re pushing boundaries by using data to innovate and improve the products.

We’re looking for someone with strong analytical skills, resourcefulness, and business insight to partner with the product team. Do you enjoy innovating the next generation of products through the lens of data? Then this role is for you.

What you will do


  • Be fully immersed in the domain of product regarding growth and messaging and own it from end-to-end
  • Drive data analysis and visualizations/dashboards to maximize strategy and decisions
  • Analyse data to support new product ideas
  • Partner and innovate with the product team - you will work with them, be like them, think like them






Who you are


  • You are passionate about the Netflix Product
  • Thrive on autonomy
  • You have a strong understanding of product and can combine with equally capable technical skills
  • You can take the complex, distill it to it’s essence and share with partners in meaningful ways via reports, visualizations, and presentations, and new product ideas
  • You are proficient in at least one programming language like Python, R, or similar
  • You’re fluent in SQL
  • You’re curious yet motivated by business context
  • Appreciate simplicity over complexity - pragmatic
  • Passion to lead, be dedicated, and innovate
title: Senior Data Analyst, Growth & Messaging

description:
At YapStone, we approach payments with the same startup mentality that we had when we launched our first payment solution in 1999. We are now focused on combining our entrepreneurial spirit with our immense payment expertise to take our company and our partners to the forefront of innovation. As one of the leading payment companies, YapStone is continually searching for passionate thinkers to join us in changing how the world pays.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Actively detect, respond to, and remediate security events across our global infrastructure
Perform proactive enterprise-wide operations to hunt for actionable events
Dissect network, host, memory, and other artifacts originating from multiple operating systems and applications
Security automation development (enabling to move faster, more securely) software engineering background a plus
You will help build a future of intrusion detection, depriving strong signals from our data to aid our detection and response efforts
Work closely with product and engineering teams to drive changes in Corporate security posture.
Maintains up to date knowledge on current vulnerabilities, attacks, and countermeasures.

QUALIFICATIONS:
Broad exposure to security disciplines and deep exposure in one or more of the following disciplines: cloud security, IAM, public key infrastructure, web applications; AWS & cloud (SaaS) Security a plus.
Experience in an IT/Operations/Call/Command Center type environment
Host Based Forensics Analysis Experience utilizing tools such as ECAT, encase, Carbon Black or similar
Automation experience using Python or PowerShell, or similar
Network Security Forensics Analysis experience utilizing tools such as Wireshark, encase, FTK or similar
Experience with SIEM products and crafting indicators to alert on malicious activity
Minimum 2 years’ experience preferred in any of the following: SOX, PCI, ISO, general compliance and/or risk-based compliance, yielding a comprehensive understanding of technology and best practices
Analytical / Innovative / Creative thinker
Strong investigative mindset with acute attention to detail
YapStone is a global provider of full-stack payment solutions for global marketplaces and large vertical markets. YapStone powers online and mobile payments for HomeAway ® , VRBO ® , and thousands of apartment and vacation rental companies, Homeowners’ Associations, self-storage companies, hospitality establishments and non-profits. YapStone processes over $14B in payment volume annually and has been recognized for its growth, ranking on the Inc. 5000 list of Fastest-Growing Private Companies for eight consecutive years and named to the Forbes’ List of America’s Most Promising Companies again in 2015. YapStone has raised over $110 million from investors including Accel Partners, Meritech Capital and Bregal Sagemount. YapStone is headquartered in the San Francisco Bay area with additional offices in Santa Monica, California and Ireland. To learn more, visit www.YapStone.com .
title: Senior Security Data Analyst

description:
In partnership with the faculty, the Clinical Education Coordinator will provide curricular support to create, implement and manage these focused education programs and training activities, in close collaboration with SPLICE leadership, applying evidence and clinical expertise to ensure content is accurate and appropriate for the diverse learners.

The Clinical Education Coordinator will work with the SPLICE leadership team in ensuring that all educational activities meet the overall grant objectives and are aligned within the overall timeline. Additionally, the Clinical Education Coordinator will ensure that all educational programs are aligned with the learning objectives for each of the learners. Lastly, the Clinical Education Coordinator will work with the grant leadership team to make sure that grant activities do not disrupt any of the regular program curricular activities.

The Clinical Education Coordinator, in partnership with the faculty, will be responsible for ensuring that pre-and post-tests are developed and employed; test results are captured in and Excel spreadsheet; and that test results are provided to the data analyst on time per the agreed upon due dates.

The Clinical Education Coordinator will be responsible for developing a system to document the progress of all education activities to include the development of the classes, a method to capture all learners, a calendar of when any in-person activities will occur, marketing of events, and evaluation of all course work.REQUIRED
  • Possession of valid California RN license
  • Graduation from an accredited school of nursing
  • Experience in developing clinical education programs and collaborating with faculty to meet the needs of diverse learners
  • Experience with implementing and conducting clinical education for pre-licensure learners, peers, and working professionals
  • Experience in developing objective test questions.
  • Experience with research or clinical projects and knowledge regarding protocols and requirements
  • Mastery of Microsoft Office software applications
  • Experience with Learning Management Systems
PREFERRED
  • Masters degree in nursing strongly preferred
SPECIAL REQUIREMENT
  • Ability to safely lift 25 lbs and to transport learning materials as needed
  • THIS POSITION MAY BE SUBJECT TO A CRIMINAL BACKGROUND INVESTIGATION, DRUG SCREEN, LIVE SCAN FINGERPRINTING, MEDICAL EVALUATION CLEARANCE, AND FUNCTIONAL CAPACITY ASSESSMENT
title: Clinical Education Coordinator

description:
As a Senior Sales Operations BA, you will report to the Director of Sales Operations. You will support the growth of our Women’s Health Sales team, with analytical rigor, process improvement and new tool deployment. You will manage an analyst dedicated to enabling the Women’s Health Sales team alongside you. Your work will be closely tied to data housed in our financial, commission and Salesforce platforms. You will provide data driven insights to our Sales Operations, Field Sales and executive team that help shape our strategic and tactical plans and will be the VP of Women’s Health Sales’ go-to partner. Success in this role requires that you maintain a keen focus on data quality. Your work will also require that you engage effectively across multiple cross-functional teams to create complete solutions with high adoption. This role will include day-to-day tasks, quarterly deliverables as well as high level analytics and projects primarily focused on reporting and analytics, forecasting and data management. It will be critical for this person to prioritize the work done by the analyst on the team as well as themselves to ensure the highest and best use of time.

What you'll do
    • Master Data Management in Salesforce.com: Manage territory alignment and sales team alignments - report out quarterly. Manage data integrity and cleanliness. Coordinate with the field teams to gather market intelligence and drive compliance with sales processes. Produce and publish a calendar of department deliverables - ensure we remain on target to those dates and that we have the required input from key stakeholders to hit these key dates; communicate to Sales Ops leadership if due dates are at risk with a plan of action to get back on track
    • Reporting and Analytics: Run point on presentations for the Sales team, Executive leadership and Board meetings. Make recommendations about new ways to review and utilize our data to inform and enable our Women’s Health Sales team. Maintain/update sales reports/dashboards. Manage ad-hoc reporting requests and provide day to day support to the sales teams. Manage forecasting data inputs, outputs and template with RDs and work closely with Counsyl’s Market Intelligence team, Finance and Procurement to provide accurate monthly forecasting
    • Technical Program Management: Perform sales business process design and optimization to support commercial operations objectives and key results. Support specification development, implementation and roll-out of new system features and new tools in support of the Sales team in conjunction with Data Analyst. Effectively liaise between the Women’s Health Sales team and the team at headquarters to drive results and achieve common goals
    • Sales Tools and Others: Proactively suggest new sales tools in support of increasing the efficacy and efficiency of our Women’s Health Sales team and drive the ROI for these recommendations. Support roll-out of tools and processes as well as driving adoption of those tools and processes (partner with Data Analyst and Commercial Learning & Development to ensure these tools and processes are appropriately scoped and trained). Support other initiatives and programs within the commercial team as needed
About you
    • BA or BS degree
    • 5+ years of experience in sales or business analytics, preferably in healthcare or diagnostic industry
    • Has 2-3 years experience using SQL + BI tool to generate reports
    • Proficient in salesforce.com
    • Advanced in Excel, Powerpoint Experience with Python, R and/or shell scripting a plus
    • Experience using Looker for business analytics
    • Hands-on experience with data management
    • Good analytical skills with attention to detail
    • Strong written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills
    • Proven track record of working collaboratively in a team environment
Counsyl is a health technology company that offers DNA screening for diseases that can impact men, women and their children. The Counsyl philosophy is simple: screen for diseases where advanced knowledge makes a difference in health outcomes, whether it’s changing a behavior, pursuing preventative measures, or simply preparing for what lies ahead.

The Counsyl team includes an accomplished group of problem-solvers — top engineers, scientists, and designers — who are taking the lead on building the modern clinical laboratory. Scientific rigor, custom robotics, and software are at the heart of every Counsyl product, resulting in better, faster and more affordable screens that are broadly accessible. Beyond the laboratory, Counsyl offers doctors and patients a technology platform for results delivery in real time, with on-demand access to board-certified genetic counselors.

Counsyl has screened more than 600,000 patients and served more than 6,000 health care professionals in its CLIA-certified, CAP-accredited and NYS CLEP-permitted clinical laboratory. The company has raised a total of $102 million and is privately backed by Pilot Growth Equity, Goldman Sachs Asset Management, Founders Fund, Felicis Ventures, David Drummond, and other high profile investors.

description:
Credit Sesame is one of the fastest growing startups in Fin-Tech with a user base exceeding 8 million and growing fast. We pride ourselves on being an irreplaceable tool for consumers by delivering a clear picture of one’s debt and liabilities and by offering recommendations based on one’s own financial goals. Bring your individual talents here and discover why a career at Credit Sesame is the opportunity you’ve been looking for.

You’ll team with an enthusiastic group of analysts, engineers, marketers and product managers to help build upon our data driven culture. The product, marketing, and business development teams at Credit Sesame constantly use data to make business decisions. With our large set of consumer data and fast paced culture, we are able translate insights into business decisions and measurable results quickly.

We are looking for an experienced data analyst who can roll up their sleeves and take our data to the next level. The Data Analyst role provides an opportunity to solve the company’s most interesting problems and develop new business strategies.

Responsibilities

  • Support Business Development data projects to drive revenue growth and guide business decisions
  • Interpret partner and user related data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
  • Interpret data trends and provide actionable recommendations
  • Regularly mine data from SQL databases
  • Filter and clean data in order to provide regular reporting
  • Assess current processes and identify ways to expedite and automate them
  • Design and maintain reports and dashboards to track and communicate Credit Sesame’s key performance indicators
  • Interact with data source owners and participate in developing project plans.
Qualifications

  • 2+ years of relevant experience
  • SQL experience
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (Pivot Tables, VLookups)
  • Coding experience preferred
  • Exposure to Statistics, Econometrics, or Data Science and some of the tools associated with them preferred
  • An understanding of the difference between correlation and causation.
  • Adaptable in a startup environment with the ability to move quickly
  • Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively
Perks & Benefits

  • Meaningful equity
  • Catered lunches and Snacks
  • Credit Sesame premium account to help you manage your credit
  • Health Insurance, Dental and Vision
  • Fun and Entertainment to celebrate company successes
title: Data Analyst/Senior Data Analyst

description:
Position Summary:

The Portfolio Management and Research Data Analyst / Senior Analyst reports to the Assistant Portfolio Manager for the American Core Realty Fund and, among other duties, is responsible for gathering, managing and maintaining portfolio data and preparing detailed fund and property level performance reporting and other metrics. The position provides analytical support to the Portfolio Management Group, working in connection with the Research Group, which may include creating, updating and revising Excel models, analysis of data queried from NCREIF, MSCI IPD and accounting and reporting systems, and other ad-hoc analyses. This position contributes to property markets and submarkets, capital markets and macroeconomic data analysis and research and its impact on the American Core Realty Fund.

This position resides in our Glendale, CA office but ARA may be willing to temporarily house the position in our downtown Chicago office for the right candidate. The Glendale, CA office will be relocating to downtown Los Angeles in Summer, 2017.

Essential Functions:

  • Gather data from various sources and prepare detailed analysis of core fund and property level performance.
  • Support the Marketing, Research and Portfolio Management Groups by creating and refining various models, metrics, and reports on a periodic and ad-hoc basis.
  • Prepare performance measurement and analysis including, but not limited to, various historical and projected portfolio diversification, lease roll, occupancy, budget variance, and valuation metrics.
  • Prepare and submit property and fund level data for the MSCI IPD benchmarks.
  • Assist with development and maintenance of proprietary market and industry research, including from third party providers, that supports investment strategies and capital raising activities.
  • Periodic preparation of written reports detailing research and analytical pursuits for internal purposes and presentation to senior management.

Prerequisites:

Education:

  • Bachelor’s degree required.
  • Finance, accounting, economics, real estate, mathematics, statistics, computer science and/or engineering major preferred.

Experience:

  • Minimum of two years of experience within data analytics.
  • Prior real estate portfolio management experience working on a NFI-ODCE core fund preferred.

Job Type: Full-time
title: Portfolio Management and Research Data Analyst / Senior Analyst

description:
Job Summary:

The Geo Data Analyst plays an integral part in the Nextbus team - participating in the analysis, processing, and integration of various transit data into the NextBus data model. The Analyst uses various software tools to verify and visualize transit data, execute configuration workflows, and monitor the performance of NextBus’ real time passenger information systems.

The ideal candidate must be able to work closely with team members to service client accounts by executing a wide range of data processing tasks directly affecting and used in evaluating daily system performance. This position typically works under the general supervision of the Geo Data Configuration Manager, in daily collaboration with both Project Management and Engineering teams to fulfill customer satisfaction needs.

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Evaluates route schedules and associated configuration data from transit agencies to meet quality standards.
  • Analyzes and processes transit configuration data using numerous internal processing tools and scripts.
  • Edits and/or corrects transit configuration data as part of schedule and route updates.
  • Converts transit configuration data to appropriate formats for further automated processing.
  • Uses effective time management practices to ensure deadlines are met consistently.
  • Availability for off-hours, remote support as required.

Desired Skills and Characteristics:
  • Experience with ESRI ArcGIS desktop software.
  • Demonstrated experience in manipulating large data sets with a high level of attention to detail.
  • Ability to create and modify scripts using Python, Bash, etc.
  • Experience with using and/or developing software tools to work with GTFS data feeds, and converting to other data formats for visualization, processing and analysis.
  • Self-motivated team player with a positive attitude of cooperation, and the ability to accept constructive criticism.
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills in interacting with professional technical and non-technical persons.
  • A quick learner who can easily adapt to a fast changing environment. Works in a measured, organized, and logical manner.
  • Experience in using mass transit, with a strong interest in improving public transportation.

Minimum Job Requirements:

Bachelor's Degree in Geography, Math or Computer/Data Science. Minimum of 3 years of directly related professional experience. A working knowledge of both MS Windows and Unix operating systems, as well as SQL syntax. Experience with office software packages (Open Office, Microsoft Office, etc).

Worker Type:

Employee

description:
We are looking for a highly motivated individual to assist with our reporting team in the San Francisco office.

This position is for a Data Analyst with experience in the development of AUM and other Senior Management Finance reports. Strong Excel skills required. The ability to create and maintain SQL based data repositories to support robust reporting capabilities is a plus. This position will also be responsible for helping enhance and streamline existing department reports and processes.

Responsibilities:
  • Extract and analyze data, patterns, and related trends and synthesize the data into information consumable by Senior Management decision-makers.

  • Conduct requirements gathering, design sessions, and technical reviews with end users.

  • Establish and build a metadata repository to define connections between data arrays. Optional but preferred.

  • Develop and administer a SQL based data repository for use in Data Management reporting. Optional but preferred.

  • Recognize and investigate data inconsistencies, providing explanation and potential solutions to maintain data integrity.

  • Provide production support and troubleshooting for departmental reporting in SQL, Excel, or other systems.

  • Create and refine department data flows. Suggest enhancements to procedures to improve workflow.

  • Advanced technical skills including Excel macro design and VBA programming and ability to utilize SQL without relying on IT support. Preferred.

  • Work independently and as part of a group to analyze data from multiple sources to prepare complex management reports on a monthly, quarterly and ad-hoc basis.

  • Performs other duties & responsibilities as required or assigned by supervisor.

  • Superior interpersonal skills and ability to collaborate actively and work in a team environment.

Qualifications: KEY SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:
  • 2-4 years' of professional work experience preferred
  • College Graduate/Graduate School
  • Excellent verbal and written skills
  • Team player
  • Provides extraordinary service
  • Furthers the First Republic Bank culture and values
MENTAL/PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
  • The ability to learn and comprehend basic instructions; understand the meanings of words and respond effectively; and perform basic arithmetic accurately and quickly.
  • Vision must be sufficient to read data reports, manuals and computer screens.
  • Hearing must be sufficient to understand a conversation at a normal volume, including telephone calls and in person.
  • Speech must be coherent to clearly convey or exchange information, including the giving and receiving of assignments and/or directions.
  • Position involves sitting most of the time, but may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time.

description:
St. Jude Medical is now Abbott
We are seeking an experienced, high caliber Sr Data Analyst for Postmarket Surveillance. This position is responsible for various data analysis activities including: complaints trending, MDR/MDV trending, and providing data reporting inputs for Management Review and various reporting and month end activities.

Each employee can make a difference at St. Jude Medical and has the power, either individually or as a team, to influence the success of the company. We are team-oriented, fast-paced and progressive. We value people with great ideas who partner with others both internally and externally to take action and accomplish goals.

description:
Provide expertise in data analysis, including member, provider, encounters and claims data. Develops and designs reports, creates and maintains databases to support the business requirements of the team and our internal and external customers, and continually improves data acquisition and reporting methods. This position will have primary responsibility for the development and production of reports supporting Disease Management National Committee for Quality Assurance (NCQA) requirements. Perform analysis of business needs and data integration with CalOptima’s Business Intelligence application.

Position Responsibilities:
  • Support interim reporting for Department of Health Care (DHCS) or NCQA related initiatives (ex. Initial Health Assessment, Group Needs Assessment).
  • Generate and provide outcomes reporting for Health Education & Disease Management program evaluations.
  • Support reporting requirements for Health Services Advisory Group (HSAG)/DHCS/Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) Chronic Care Improvement Programs and Performance Improvement Projects assigned to Disease Management.
  • Develop and support ongoing monitoring of NCQA reporting requirements.
  • Develop and support ongoing monitoring/trending of department referrals.
  • Develop department productivity reports and staff performance dashboards based on defined metrics.
  • Provide technical support in the development and implementation of new initiatives/pilots.
  • Act as a liaison with IS, Quality Analytics or other technical teams in the area of report requirements documentation.
  • Develop and maintain databases.
  • Maintain a thorough knowledge of CalOptima’s data warehouse and the move to the business intelligence software. Assist in providing feedback to IS to resolve data integrity issues and to support reporting requirements.
  • Design reports from the data warehouses, and/or FACETS. Responsible for the assurance of data integrity.
  • Prepare ad-hoc analyses and work on special projects.
  • Other projects and duties as assigned.

Required Skills
  • Communicate effectively in writing and verbally, including trainings and public presentations.
  • Present information in a useable format and be able to clearly explain content.
  • Work with complex databases.

  • Develop and maintain effective working relationships with all levels of the Medical Data Management staff, other departments (i.e. IS, Health Services), and various external customers.
  • Effectively utilize computer and appropriate software and interact as needed with CalOptima’s IS Department.
Required Experience

Experience & Education:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Health Care Administration, Business Administration, Mathematics or a related field or equivalent work experience is required.
  • Master’s degree preferred.
  • Health care administration experience and experience that would have developed the knowledge and abilities listed above.
  • 5-7 years professional experience in a managed health care organization.
  • Prior experience with business intelligence data integration preferred.

Knowledge of:
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office products including Word, Excel, Outlook, Access and VBA (Visual Basic for Applications).
  • MS Access, to create ad-hoc reports and design databases; strong competence with the process of data retrieval from Data Warehouses and databases, creating user-friendly forms and reports.
  • Techniques in data design and data management, utilizing PC and Mainframe systems.
  • Excellent organizational skills and the ability to prioritize tasks and use time efficiently.
  • Senior-level data quality assessment and analysis skills.
  • Strong oral and written communication skills.
  • Managed-care concepts.
  • Medical coding, including ICD9, CPT, and HCPCS codes recommended.
  • SQL and VBA knowledge .

description:
Responsible for source system data analysis from EDS/FDM etc, variable gap analysis, data extraction design and coding, and data modeling. As a member of the Enterprise Risk team the Data Analyst will collaborate across business lines to collect, organize and analyze data from several source systems within the Bank. This is the highest level with the Data Analytics job family and is reserved for the Enterprise Risk Group for enterprise-wide duties and responsibilities.

Position Accountabilities

1. Identifies data analytics opportunities, designs, and executes test, data extraction, and analysis utilizing the department's various computer software packages within established deadlines. Analyze source data/file structures, Metadata, profile source data.

2. Develop data mapping and transformation rules and detailed designs based on system and business requirements. Creates, prepares, and documents detailed specifications of the programs utilized to pull data. Includes: creation and use of documents to facilitate the request and data integrity of the data that is provided to the internal customer.

3. Analyzes and recommends business, technology, and process improvement opportunities. Utilize automation tools to schedule, execute and monitor jobs. Performance tune the applications to meet operational production requirements

4. Knowledge of applications within the bank to interpret data requests and identify data analytics opportunities. Design and code functions of the application in accordance with the standards and architectural guidelines.

5. Maintain the quality control and auditing of Risk Datamart to ensure the accuracy and quality of data. Protect and insure the stability of the operational systems as well as maintain the integrity of the data they contain. Assist in determining the impact of operational systems and provide input into their resolution via data extraction and quantification.

6. Data modeling, profiling, mining and analysis. Developing reports and framework per requirements. Coordinate and prioritize all escalated activities, including testing, project management and enhancements and bug fixes.

7. Maintain cross-business responsibilities by providing end-user support to multiple organizations within the company when issues arise.

Qualifications

Required Education or Equivalent Experience

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, MIS or related field
  • Master’s/Advanced Degree in Computer Science, MIS or related field
  • Required license(s) or certification(s) ACL Certified Data Analyst (ACDA)
Required Experience

  • 6 to 8 years of directly related experience
Field of Experience

  • Strong experience working on any ETL tool (Informatica, Datastage, SAS DI Studio, etc)
  • Excellent organizational and documentation ability to create and maintain detailed documentation for data warehouse and procedures
  • Strong knowledge of relational database design and support, including the support of large UNIX/Oracle based enterprise software systems
  • Expert knowledge of SQL structured query language
  • Business systems analytical experience required
  • Strong problem solving; analytical; project management and communication skills
  • Banking industry experience is preferred
  • Ability to prioritize and resolve multiple complex and critical issues
  • Strong experience with Oracle on UNIX using command line and GUI SQL tools
  • Strong experience of working with UNIX shell/perl scripts
