title: Sr Data Analytics Analyst

description:
Looking for a chance to do meaningful work that touches millions? Come join the hardest working, nonprofit health plan in California and help us shape the future of health care. Blue Shield of California’s Mission is to ensure all Californians have access to high-quality care at an affordable price. Blue Shield is focused on improving health care delivery by working closely with providers and making it more accessible, affordable and customer-centric. Being a mission-driven organization means we do much more than serve our 4 million members: we were the first health plan in the nation to limit our annual net income to 2 percent of revenue and return the difference to our customers and the community, and since 2005 we have contributed more than $325 million to the Blue Shield of California Foundation to improve community health and end domestic violence. We also believe that a healthier California begins with our employees, so we provide them with resources to develop and maintain a healthy lifestyle through our award-winning wellness program, Wellvolution.

We're hiring smart thinkers and doers who want to work for a leader and innovator in the challenging, ever-changing healthcare space. Come and help us make health care better for everyone.

Cost of Health Care Analytics at Blue Shield of California supports analytic development and production reporting of cost of health care experience and emerging trends from financial, care utilization, and population health perspectives. Our aim is to provide insightful and actionable information and consultation to internal and external business and clinical stakeholders in an effort to provide a platform for the control of the cost of health care.

A major specific focus of this position will be the development and maintenance of routine reports and ad hoc analyses for presentation to external providers as well as internal audiences. This scope will include both internal development and report production as well as support of reporting vendor functions. Vendor support will include ETL of company data and management of analytic logic contained in pre-ETL and ETL stages as well as vendor data processing and presentation stages. Meeting complex and time-sensitive monthly production schedules are a major component of this role. Identification and implementation of process improvements and technical efficiencies will also be expected. Additionally, similar tasks in the employer reporting domain could assigned to this role. This role is best suited for someone who can “own” the big picture and voluminous details of their work while working collaboratively with peers and stakeholders, and receiving broad guidance from her/his director.

Primary responsibilities to include but not limited to:
Develop routine reports in accordance with business unit and medical management needs and run monthly production processes on an agreed upon schedule

Ascertain insights and identify areas of concern from monthly reports

Summarize key analytic concepts, methodologies, and results for audiences of varying level of analytic understanding

Communicate key findings and significance of findings to stakeholders

Reconcile data results from different sources and combine them into integrated reports spanning cost, quality, utilization, and risk profile metrics

Apply healthcare business knowledge and key concepts in health insurance to develop routine and ad hoc analyses

Prioritize work and work enhancement requests while providing key deliverables to stakeholders in a timely manner

Collaborate with junior and senior colleagues on analytic approaches

Mentor junior colleagues in analysis and business knowledge

Develop and maintain clinical databases to guide business decision making for BSC population health management, cost of health care management, quality of care, and network design and strategies.

Function as a facilitator and mentor for analysis workgroups.

Provide training and mentoring for team members on best practices for analysis and reporting; assists in the development of supplemental analytic training tools and materials; conduct formal training sessions for lower level analysts and analysts in other Departments.

Consult and coordinate with analysts in other departments to reconcile analytical approaches.

Participate on internal workgroups and committees to provide analytical insight and support for the implementation and enhancement of new programs, products, and services. This may include interactions with internal and external customers to define analytical needs and specifications.

Work with other departments and business units to gather business requirements to design, build, and/or enhance data systems and applications that will better serve specific reporting requirements.

Advise analysts in other departments and business units on standardization of business rules and methods for analysis and reporting.

Design, implement, and manage complex data structures and analysis systems.

Create system QA processes and documentation.

Use appropriate technical, clinical, and financial knowledge to assess the completeness and reliability of data and the validity and accuracy of analytical results.

Assess business risks associated with analytical processes and data systems and develops strategies to mitigate risks.

Critically review and revise existing analytical processes for currency, efficiency, and sufficiency. Identifies existing inefficiencies and problems and takes action to implement solutions.

Develop programs and processes that can be run by other lower levels analysts.

Produce accurate work under tight deadlines

Develop documentation and creates and executes work plans for analyses of high complexity.

Continuously refine and expands the technical, clinical, and financial content knowledge required to successfully complete these duties.

Qualifications

Requires a BA/BS in health science, quantitative social science, public health, health services research, business or math/statistics.

Requires knowledge of healthcare data (CPT4, IDC9, etc.).

Must have expertise with the technical, clinical, and financial concepts necessary to adequately perform the duties described above.

Experience working with large scale health databases.

Requires ability to use SAS or SAS EG, MS Office, esp. Excel,

UNIX, SQL/PL-SQL with minimal supervision and support.

Must be able to develop computer programs and scripts using Base SAS, SAS EG and ANSI SQL

Experience with data visualization software such as Tableau or Business Objects data visualization tools.

Experience using Phyton, R and Netezza desirable.

Knowledge or experience using clinical risk adjustment, burden of illness scoring, episode analysis, and provider profiling strongly preferred.

Certifications: SAS Certified Base Programmer Credential or equivalent strongly preferred.

Minimum Experience Level

Requires 5 to 10 years’ experience in Health Care (managed care, academic, or gov't payer), Typically has 5 or more years’ experience as a Health Data Analyst, Medical Economist or related role in a health care setting.

External hires must pass a background check/drug screen. Qualified applicants with arrest records and/or conviction records will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with Federal, State and local laws, including but not limited to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability status and any other classification protected by Federal, State and local laws.

description:
Full -Time position

Open for GC/Citizens only

The Data Architect will provide specialized expertise and focus to ensure that a comprehensive, coherent, and effective data warehouse and data lake architecture is in place for storing, maintaining, and managing all of the data associated with the data warehouse program in its transition from a central mainframe environment to a distributed architecture. The Data Architect will need to operate at both a high level in helping to establish the guidelines, practices, and models for understanding and managing the "big picture”, and at a low level to guide team members in implementation details such as: data modeling; data warehouse, data lakes, and database design and optimization. Recent relevant experience involving a complex, multiple application and multiple department environment with both traditional data warehouse and big data is strongly preferred.

Primary Responsibilities:
The Data Architect will be responsible for understanding the requirements and detailed data ecosystem of the components and applications associated with the PSJSP program, and using this knowledge to prepare and champion specific recommendations, guidelines, practices, and design models which will ultimately form the basis for the program data architecture. The Data Architect will also act as an in-house expert to mentor and assist technical staff in mastering techniques and best practices associated with: data modeling; data warehouse, data lakes, and database design and optimization and related activities.

The Data Architect will collaborate as part of a team composed of technical leaders representing the enterprise, application, data and network architecture, interface development, security, and business relationship management areas of the program.

Experience Requirement:
  • 10+ years of related experience in software development, of which at least:
  • Five years includes specific duties as a data architect, data warehouse architect, data modeler, or data analyst;
  • Five years "hands on” experience managing one or more of the following database systems: Microsoft SQL Server 2008 or higher, Oracle, or IBM DB2, involving implementation of database schemas, indexes, and query optimization;
  • Three years "hands on” experience implementing database stored procedures. Note: The above role specific experience may have been acquired concurrently.
  • Experience defining and implementing data security, quality enforcement, and retention policies in a complex, multiple application environment;
  • Experience creating, implementing and testing procedures for backing up and recovering databases;
Must have a solid understanding of principles and practices of:

  • Kimball methodology;
  • Data lakes, data warehouse, and big data;
  • software development;
  • project and technical documentation;
  • programming, including programming languages and utilities is desirable;
Skills Requirement:
  • Research, analyze and define technical problems and recommend alternative solutions.
  • Ability to understand, model, and portray the big data picture, spanning multiple applications.
  • Ability to define and implement practices for aligning data architecture with business requirements.
  • Knowledge of both established and emerging data technologies, including the ability to identify when each can be effectively applied and the advantages / disadvantages of each.
  • Ability to clearly document data structures, data definitions, and data provenance.
  • Understanding of data indexing strategies for a variety of data types.
  • Ability to work closely with department technical and management resources.
  • Must be able to produce high quality work, both independently and on a team, in a fast-moving environment.
  • Must be able to plan and prioritize personal tasking.
  • Must be able to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.

title: Data Analyst

description:
OVERVIEW OF THE POSITION

Under the supervision of the Substance Use Residential Helpline Program Manager, the Helpline Data Analyst is responsible for the collating and entering program and client related data into the Alameda County Electronic Health Record Database, Clinicians Gateway (CG), the Center Point Management Information System (MIS), AVAYA phone system and any other necessary databases identified by Center Point, Inc. and Alameda County Behavioral Health Care Services. The Helpline Data Analyst is required to verify the accuracy of the data being entered and personally collecting missing items from data sources. Additionally, Call Center Data Analyst is responsible for maintaining CG/MIS files, producing CG/MIS reports and queries, and entering data in a timely manner. Some administrative and clerical duties are also associated with this position, as needed.

PRIMARY DUTIES

1
Enter Helpline participant data and related information from each of the Center Point data collection instruments, into the applicable CG & MIS Database.

2
Enters correct and validated data, providing overall quality control of various data requirements.

3
Ensure that the data upload occurs in a timely manner and that data is entered no later than the 10 th of each month for the previous month.

4

Makes note of missing data and works with the Program Manager, Assessment Specialist’s, Care Manager’s and other staff to gather missing data.

5

Retrieves data from source documents. Collates data received and conducts data entry/upload to the CG and MIS databases.

6
Works with Program Manger to provide statistical information and data reports for evaluation contract reporting purposes.

7
Answer telephones and greet public who visit Helpline office.

8
Under the supervision and direction of the Program Manager, responds to requests for data information from the ACBHCS, Center Point Management, and others as required by the funder.

9
Ensures timely, sufficient, correct and validated data entry to produce monthly, quarterly and annual reports.

10
Operates computer, copy and facsimile machines with familiarity.

11
Interacts with staff, clients and public in a culturally sensitive manner.

12
Types or transcribes reports, business correspondence, and other materials.

13
Responsible for entering and ensuring secure storage of all confidential data.

14
Produces MIS & CG reports and queries as requested.

15
Performs office administrative, reception and other duties as needed or directed.

REQUIREMENTS

High School or GED Certificate is required, higher education preferred.

A minimum of one year experience in data entry and data management is required.

Must be able to operate within a Windows computer environment.

Clerical and administrative (office) experience is essential.

Must adhere to all confidentiality protocols.

May be required to travel to Marin and other Center Point, Inc. offices as needed.

description:
Job Description:
Bank of America's BSCM Data Quality and Governance team is looking for a Senior Data Analyst for Wholesale. Qualified
candidates must be able to manage a queue of work to meet objectives, and be self-directed, collaborative, analytical and
proactive in execution and problem resolution. The Senior Data Analyst is responsible for
Authoritative Wholesale data Subject Matter Expert (SME) who will be hands-on with the data, understanding the
overall flow and usage of information from the upstream sources through the capital calculation engine and reporting,
including understanding of the regulations, product mix, derivations, risk drivers, calculation logic, and downstream capital
processes.
Driving operational excellence ensuring critical process controls and data validation activities are performed as data are
consumed by the capital calculators during the monthly production cycle, ensuring that DQ scripts and measurement
processes remain timely and relevant, and ensuring ad hoc requests and data incidents are researched, documented,
and resolved.
Analyzing data issues within established SLA timelines and recommends Defect or Enhancement classification to the
Monthly Research Prioritization Governance meeting.
Understanding the overall flow and usage of historical data consumed by the Wholesale Capital modeling process,
including understanding the regulations, historical sources and data anomalies, product mix, derivations, risk drivers, and
calculation logic. In addition, understand how the outputs of the models are leveraged in the current month production
process to drive out PD, LGD and EAD parameters used in the calculation of RWA/capital and in reporting or downstream
functions. Ensure historical data controls and data quality measurement processes are established and consistently
executed.
Collaborate with upstream business and technology partners, prioritize needs, and influence actions to resolve identified
data defects and deliver enhancements in a timely fashion.
Act as key representative for the Wholesale worksteam on all project initiatives developing requirements, testing
strategies, identifying potential risks, impacts and ultimately defining the key success factors. Effectively present to and
influence business and technology leadership.
Provide guidance and support to the Wholesale DSE Liaison and Sourcing Analyst in the execution of their tasks.
Responsible for independently conducting quantitative analytics and complex modeling projects. Leads efforts in
development of new models, analytic processes or system approaches. Creates documentation for all activities and may
work with technology staff in design of any system to run models developed. Incumbents possess excellent quantitative/
analytic skills and are able to influence strategic direction, as well as develop tactical plans.

Shift: 1st shift (United States of America)

Hours Per Week: 40
title: Sr. Quantitative Fin Analyst

description:
Plans, coordinates, and implements trauma program performance improvement activities as required by AHS, County, State, and American College of Surgeons (ACS) standards and requirements for trauma center verification and designation; responsible for implementing the Trauma Program Performance Improvement Plan and monitoring compliance to Trauma Program standards, policies, procedures and practices.

DUTIES & ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS: NOTE : The following are the duties performed by employees in this classification. However, employees may perform other related duties at an equivalent level. Not all duties listed are necessarily performed by each individual in the classification.

1. Acts as a resource to the trauma registrar staff and nursing.

2. Collaborates with the TMD & TPM on loop closure and maintains required documentation.

3. Designs data collection systems and processes that support the Trauma Program Performance Improvement Plan.

4. Educates nursing staff in TNCC procedures, trauma nursing documentation and performance improvement content.

5. Evaluates and reports Trauma Program performance by developing and applying process and outcomes measures.

6. Interprets and applies County, State, and ACS standards of care to contribute to the optimal care of patients.

7. Maintains reporting database, incorporating the following activities: identifies, tracks, monitors and reports complications and performance trends; analyzes and interprets performance improvement related statistical reports and compiles and reports results; develops and conducts audits with the assistance of the trauma data analyst that supports trauma program performance improvement activities; accesses and interprets clinical data from a variety of databases to review pre-hospital, emergency department, hospital records, and rehabilitation records; works with the Trauma Data Analyst to provide regular reports or as requested by administration or other ancillary departments; monitors trended data for specific complications.

8. Monitors and measures the quality and timeliness of care provided by physicians, nurses, and other healthcare providers for patients of all ages throughout the continuum of care.

9. Oversees all aspects of participation in the ACS Trauma Quality Improvement Program (TQIP).

10. Participates in all phases of planning, preparation, and execution of an ACS trauma center re-verification review and trauma center designation.

11. Participates in Trauma Multidisciplinary Rounds to identify, report, and monitor compliance with guidelines and standards of care, complications of care and performance issues.

12. Performs other duties as required.

13. Prepares case summaries for review by the TMD, TPM, and other PI reviewers.

14. Supports preparation of the Trauma Performance Improvement and Patient Safety Committee agenda, case summaries, and presentation materials.

15. Tracks all performance improvement activities, conducts follow-up of open issues, and works with leadership to resolve issues, as required.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Required Education : Bachelor's degree in Nursing.

Preferred Education : Master's degree in Nursing, Public Health or Informatics.

Required Experience : Five years of trauma nursing experience, within a Critical Care environment, ICU or Emergency Department.

Preferred Experience : Experience within a trauma quality or performance improvement environment; experience utilizing databases, including developing and producing statistical reports; experience implementing or participating in the implementation of evidence-based practice projects; teaching experience.

Required Licenses/Certifications : Valid license to practice as a Registered Nurse in the State of California; Basic Life Support Certification (BLS) issued by the American Heart Association.

Preferred Licenses/Certifications : Emergency Nurses Association Trauma Nurse Core Course (TNCC).
title: Trauma Program Performance Improvement Coordinator (rev 111816)

description:
The QI Performance Improvement Sr. Data Analyst provides analytical, research, and technical database management support for the QI Performance Improvement teams (HEDIS, HCC & QIP/PIP/CCIP). The Sr. Data Analyst provides business-oriented analyses, program applications and database management for the Performance Improvement team. This position is expected to produce high level analytic reports monthly and on an ad hoc basis, participate is all data projects and be a liaison to Vendors as needed. The Sr. Data Analyst will assist the HEDIS, HCC & QIP/PIP/CCIP teams in improving patient care, care coordination, efficiency and quality while assuring compliance standards are met. The Analyst provides assistance with cost control, revenue maximization, development of data policies and other projects as assigned by the HEDIS Manager and VP of Performance Improvement.

The San Diego Sr. Analyst will assist all SD FQHCs with EHR development and will provide technical support to the San Diego Network team in addition to the duties listed above. This position may require occasional travel.

QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Health Care or Science related field, or Mathematics/Statistics.Candidates will be considered with a demonstrated portfolio of related work experience and have current certifications.



  • Must have at least 2 years of experience working with population-based data and reporting, preferably in a managed care setting involving Medicare and Medicaid programs; And at least one year of experience working with clinical data; Or, at least 2 years of related work in computer data collections and analysis programming or system analysis.



  • Must have experience and ability to manipulate and convert various data types; work with SQL data warehouse management; work with Oracle and Microsoft SQL server; and have advanced usage of Microsoft Access and Excel, batch automation, advanced reporting writing.



  • Must be proficient in collecting, managing, assuring data quality, and reporting of all data relevant to the QI Performance Improvement department



  • Must be able to work independently to complete approved projects in a timely while maintaining data integrity and accuracy



  • Programming skills in VB and/or VBA preferred



  • Experience with EHR and EMR systems preferred



Responsibilities:
  • Data maintenance, preparation and reporting for audit
  • Develop automation and synchronization of data systems to maximize efficiency and while maintaining data integrity
  • Manages monthly data exchange with MSO/IPAs and FQHCs, including providing onsite training related to ICE file layouts as needed.
  • Performs monthly and ad hoc data analysis on all data received and provides suggestions to the QI team to meet the goals of the department and business needs
  • Generates QIB reports and provides technical expertise to the Network Support team
  • Assist FQHCs in the development of EHR systems and assures Care1st interests are addressed, specifically as it relates to HEDIS related data
  • Vendor management: Assists in the development of SOWs, assures project completion and manages all data exchange
  • Provides technical expertise and assistance to the QI Performance Improvement as it relates to projects and initiatives
  • Collaborates with MIS to ensure data integrity, accuracy and timeliness of monthly data updates and Web Portal content is updated
  • Collaborates with the HEDIS Manager and Clinical Supervisor to update QI Performance Improvement content on the Web Portal
  • Other duties and projects as assigned by the VP of Performance Improvement, QI Medical Director, or HEDIS Manager
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability status and any other classification protected by Federal, State, and local laws.
title: QI Performance Improvement Sr. Data Analyst

description:
Are you someone who enjoys working with numbers? Do you want to learn the ins and outs of data infrastructure development? Are you a self-motivated thinker who wants to make an impact in the fast-growing field of healthcare policy research?

We are looking for a Data Systems Programmer (DSP) – Operations Specialist who highly values research, wants to work with multifaceted datasets, and craves new challenges in programming. As a DSP, you will have the opportunity to gain first-hand experience integrating and structuring the healthcare data that shapes policy on many key topics, such as the Affordable Care Act, Medicare, and Medicaid. You will also have the chance to work closely with seasoned programmers, developing the skills to work with software analytic tools and coding languages. In addition, you will work alongside smart, vibrant people with a passion for the exciting future of healthcare research.

The Data Systems Programmer – Operations Specialist will:
Support data access through application design, including fault analysis and detection, quality control, and the development of tracking systems.

Process and structure large amounts of data to provide efficient querying ability.

Design and create processing and querying programs that integrate data into the company’s in-demand data management systems.

Optimize programs for top-notch performance in complex data-manipulation procedures.

Collaborate with a dedicated DSP team and in-house researchers to maintain systems, produce documentation, and educate internal and external users about company resources.

Perform validation checks across multiple sources to verify data integrity as needed.

Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Benefits & Perks

Flexible work hours

Casual dress

Friday bagel breakfasts, monthly lunches catered from local restaurants, and free coffee, tea, and snacks

Holiday events that include food, games, and prizes

Great PTO accrual rates

Professional development assistance

Annual tuition assistance funds

Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and life insurance

401K retirement plans

Shuttle to/from the Millbrae BART & Caltrain station

Public transportation discounts

Required Skills

Required Experience

Qualifications Required

A Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Economics, Health Economics, Public Policy, or related field with quantitative emphasis.

Strong organizational, planning, and problem solving skills.

Strong interpersonal skills and a team player.

Excellent written and oral communication skills required.

Familiarity with one or more computer programming languages.

Qualifications Desired

Master’s in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Economics, Health Economics, Public Policy, or 2+ years of work experience in a field with quantitative emphasis.

Interest in big data.

Previous experience in a Data Analyst/Data Systems position a plus, but not required.

1+ years of experience with computer programming languages a plus, but not required.

description:
Are you someone who enjoys working with numbers? Do you want to learn the ins and outs of data infrastructure development? Are you a self-motivated thinker who wants to make an impact in the fast-growing field of healthcare policy research?

We are looking for a Data Systems Programmer (DSP) – Algorithms Specialist who highly values research, wants to work with multifaceted datasets, and craves new challenges in programming. As a DSP, you will have the opportunity to gain first-hand experience integrating and structuring the healthcare data that shapes policy on many key topics, such as the Affordable Care Act, Medicare, and Medicaid. You will also have the chance to work closely with seasoned programmers, developing the skills to work with software analytic tools and coding languages. In addition, you will work alongside smart, vibrant people with a passion for the exciting future of healthcare research.

The Data Systems Programmer – Algorithms Specialist will:
Develop and validate complex algorithms, including linkage across multitudes of databases and optimizing run-time efficiency.

Extract, transform, and load (ETL) big data.

Design and create processing and querying programs that integrate data into the company’s in-demand data management systems.

Optimize programs for top-notch performance in complex data-manipulation procedures.

Collaborate with a dedicated DSP team and in-house researchers to maintain systems, produce documentation, and educate internal and external users about company resources.

Perform validation checks across multiple sources to verify data integrity as needed.

Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Benefits & Perks

Flexible work hours

Casual dress

Friday bagel breakfasts, monthly lunches catered from local restaurants, and free coffee, tea, and snacks

Holiday events that include food, games, and prizes

Great PTO accrual rates

Professional development assistance

Annual tuition assistance funds

Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and life insurance

401K retirement plans

Shuttle to/from the Millbrae BART & Caltrain station

Public transportation discounts

Required Skills

Qualifications Required

A Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Economics, Health Economics, Public Policy, or related field with quantitative emphasis.

Strong organizational, planning, and problem solving skills.

Strong interpersonal skills and a team player.

Excellent written and oral communication skills required.

Familiarity with one or more computer programming languages.

Qualifications Desired

Master’s in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Economics, Health Economics, Public Policy, or 2+ years of work experience in a field with quantitative emphasis.

Interest in big data.

Previous experience in a Data Analyst/Data Systems position a plus, but not required.

1+ years of experience with computer programming languages a plus, but not required.

Required Experience
title: Data Systems Programmer-Algorithms Specialist

title: IT and Database Administrator

description:
Operates as the primary business and financial analyst for projects within a program. Participates in the preparation, analysis, reconciliation, and forecasting of project-related business, accounting and financial data.

Operates as the performance data analyst for a program. Participates in the preparation, analysis, reconciliation and forecasting of project related operations data such as compliance, utilization rates, completion rates, response times, milestone completion rates and other performance metrics.

Role Responsibility:
Coordinates preparation and analysis of internal and external reports through gathering, analyzing and summarizing data and information. This includes budget reports, forecasting reports, variance reports and other financial and management reports.

Prepares presentation materials for project and corporate management as required.

Evaluates and monitors the performance and efficiency of the program or project(s).

Monitors project/program revenue and expense transactions and reports, reviews for accuracy and completeness; investigates discrepancies.

Develops and maintains management of critical and key performance reports.

Works on overall project planning, schedules, and deliverables along with project team.

Works with project staff to prepare cost and revenue budgets.

Provides support to the project team by gathering and analyzing data in the establishment and/or maintenance of project business processes, procedures and policies.

Assists in the initiation, conducting, and coordinating of studies and analysis of resource allocation.

Responsible for coordination of transactional accounting activities with corporate office personnel.

Position operates within the project/program structure, and has dotted line reporting responsibility to corporate accounting.

Other duties as assigned by supervisor.

The Ideal Candidate:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE

BS/BA degree in Business Administration, Finance, or Accounting, with 5+ years of experience in a business or operations environment. An acceptable equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered. Should be knowledgeable and experienced with software packages such as Microsoft Word and Excel. Experience with Great Plains Accounting, and SAP Ariba systems is a plus. Individual should be a self-starter and used to working in a fast-paced environment.

LANGUAGE SKILLS

Communicates effectively in both oral and written English technical language, both in interpreting requirements and providing reports. Should possess good customer service abilities along with refined grammar skills. The position requires interaction with other departments and field employees and therefore the incumbent should possess excellent interpersonal skills.

REASONING ABILITY

Ability to define problems, collects data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. On occasion the ability to interpret a variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

While performing the duties of this job, the incumbent is regularly required to sit; use hand and fingers, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear. The incumbent is occasionally required to stand for long periods of time. The incumbent may be required to lift and/or move up to 10 lbs. And occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 lbs. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

While performing the duties of this job, the employee regularly works in an office environment. There is low to moderate noise in this work environment.

About the Company:
Why work for G4S Secure Integration?

Global experts in the assessment, design, construction, maintenance and management of communication networks and electronic security systems

Over 20 Years of proven experience as an established large-scale systems integrator providing unified communications and security solutions

Financially Sound Company, Highly Regarded by Customers & Industry Peers

Highly Competitive Compensation Plan & Comprehensive Benefits Package

G4S Secure Integration is a systems integrator that brings innovative, flexible and cost efficient thinking to the design, construction and maintenance of stand-alone or integrated communication networks and electronic security systems. For over two decades, we have offered commercial, industrial and governmental clients an efficient single point of contact for all their project issues. A trusted partner to customers and suppliers around the world, G4S Secure Integration takes great pride in delivering outstanding technology, superior customer service and a great return on investment.

G4S Secure Integration has deployed over 2 million fiber miles in more than 200 metropolitan and rural areas and completed over 1,500 large-scale, electronic security systems projects in the United States, Europe, Asia, Central America, and the Middle East.

Headquartered in Omaha, Nebraska, G4S Secure Integration is managed by executives from the telecommunications, construction and security industries. For more information, visit the company’s website at www.g4s.us or call (866) 221-5641 .

We offer an attractive, competitive compensation plan, an outstanding comprehensive benefits package, and significant opportunity for professional growth and advancement in the rapidly expanding security/telecommunications industry. We strongly encourage inquiries from qualified women and minority candidates. While interest from all applicants for employment with G4S Secure Integration is genuinely appreciated, we can respond only to those candidates with qualifications closest to the job requirements. For confidential consideration, please visit http://technologycareers.g4s.com/ and apply on-line. No phone calls please.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Minorities/Female/Disabled/Veteran

description:
The Data Analytic Consultant provides support in making strategic data-related decisions by analyzing, manipulating, tracking, internally managing and reporting data. These positions function both as a consultant and as a high-level data analyst. The position works with clients to develop the right set of questions/hypotheses, using the appropriate tools/skills to derive the best information to address customer needs.

Essential Functions :

• Provides consultation to clients, including organizational leadership and guides work towards actionable outcomes.
• Regularly measures the impact of business decisions on clients and customers.

title: Data Consultant - National Clinical Technology Team - Oakland, CA

description:
Posted Dec 30 – Accepting applications
About us:

At Qadium we believe that succeeding in a world of rapidly changing technology and constantly evolving security threats requires a team of skilled engineers who know how to work together to build great software. We think great ideas surface when everyone in the company feels they have a voice and can contribute to the definition and evolution of who we are as a company. The work you will do here is technical, challenging and interesting, and you will be a part of a team that values collaboration and open dialogue. We look for engineers who have a testing mindset, excel at fast-paced problem solving, and who want to understand how all the parts work together to make systems work.

The role:

Qadium’s technology platform collects data from the world’s connected devices, turns those data into knowledge and organizes it to help our customers understand and secure their networks. As a Data Analyst/Engineer at Qadium, you will be an integral part of the team that ensures that the quality of our work exceeds expectations of our customers and potential customers. You will use Qadium’s internal engineering tools to analyze these data and deliver technical assessments of organizational cyber security for customer and sales support.

You should be a passionate and skilled ‘data diver’ who uses multiple tools and information sources to find unknown vulnerabilities across the global internet.

What you’ll own:
  • Internal engineering tools to identify device exposures across the global Internet
  • Technical assessments of network security for target customers for our sales process
  • Development of new analysis tools and techniques to apply Qadium data to new areas
Our ideal candidate has :
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent experience
  • Experience with data analysis, statistics, and data visualization
  • Coding ability in a language of your choice (some we’d be excited about: Python, R, Java, Matlab, etc.) and a desire to learn more!
  • 2+ years of hands-on data science experience
  • A results-oriented nature and proven success in a fast-paced environment
Bonus points for:
  • Previous experience with/interest in customer-facing work
  • Interest in cybersecurity and Internet/network protocols
  • Experience applying machine learning and quantitative modeling to real-world data
  • Knowledge of exploratory and explanatory data visualization techniques
Oh yeah and we offer other stuff too
  • Competitive salaries
  • Full benefits (medical, dental, vision)
  • Generous equity compensation
  • 401K
  • A well-stocked office in SOMA- walking distance of Caltrain, Muni, BART, and buses
title: Cyber Risk Analyst @ Qadium

description:
Are you a strategic financial leader who can also roll up your sleeves and dig in? Do you thrive in an environment of growth and change? Are you a senior leader who is known for successfully mentoring and developing your people while simultaneously solving accounting challenges, providing timely financial results and finding root causes for discrepancies while helping the company exceed revenue projections? If so, you may be a great fit for PrimeCo’s Controller role, please read on!

PrimeCo is a different kind of company committed to nurturing long-term relationships with our customers by understanding their needs and offering solutions with the highest value and best quality for painting and reconstruction projects in the HOA/commercial market throughout Southern California.

Great candidates for PrimeCo’s Controller role get the “big picture” and believe that PrimeCo's culture of openness, collaboration, fabulous results and fun is the best way to grow our bottom line. We openly share our goals, results, and we expect everyone to contribute, not only to the work effort, but also with new ideas of how best to tackle obstacles and opportunities. Our fast-paced group has an infectiously positive attitude and drive to win. This is a great opportunity to grow your career, help grow a thriving company and have fun doing it.

MISSION

The Controller position is multifaceted and influential in informing and guiding management in company performance. This role ensures that financial information is GAAP-compliant, timely, and complete; standard operating procedures are developed, maintained, and respected; company assets are secure; information and reporting is timely, accurate and relevant; and the Accounting team is productive and professionally developed.

  • Prepare timely, complete, and accurate GAAP-compliant monthly financial statements that are consistently audit-ready.
  • Manage cash flow via billings, collections, and inter-departmental collaboration.
  • Develop and execute the initiatives and strategic plans for the Accounting department.
  • Provide the management team with the timely information and reporting they eed to analyze financial results and make informed decisions. Assist management in interpreting the data and reports.
  • Assist the President in developing divisional and company annual expense and capital investment budgets. Perform budget variance analysis and inform management of significant variances and the related causes.
  • Oversee the Accounting department activities. Ensure the department is well managed, productive, compliant with all regulations, producing the planned results, and working in collaboration with all departments to achieve departmental and company objectives.
  • Assist the President in designing and implementing the systems required to gather, process and report the financial and job cost information needed by the management team.

Our Ideal Candidate

  • Undergraduate degree in Accounting, Finance or related discipline.
  • At least 10 years in Accounting and a minimum of 3 years in Management as this individual will start with 2 direct reports and may increase.
  • Previous experience within construction industry preferred.
  • Experience managing and mentoring within a corporate accounting environment.
  • Must have strong written and verbal communication skills due to the open office environment and regular cross functional team management.
  • Experience working with project managers and superintendents and overseeing construction projects and processing.
  • Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
  • Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
  • Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
  • Experience in a Microsoft Dynamics product is a plus
  • Experience in ERP migration/implementation

A Players – We are looking for a rock star Controller with not only a solid record of success but someone who also embodies these key attributes:

  • Passionately finds ways over, around, or through barriers to success. Achieves results despite lack of resources. Goes beyond the call of duty. Shows bias for action. A results oriented “doer.”
  • Uses analysis to identify significant problems and opportunities. Analyzes problems and people in depth. Sorts the wheat from the chaff determining root causes.
  • Deals effectively not with just concrete, tangible problems but with abstract, conceptual matters.
  • Self-aware by recognizing own strengths and weaknesses, Not defensive. Does not rationalize mistakes or blame others.

What Can You Expect?

We are committed to make sure every person we add to the team raises the average of the group. Our leadership not only values each and every one of our team members, they are committed to your personal development and success. Our employees enjoy working here and enjoy working with each other.

As PrimeCo’s Controller, reporting to the president, you’ll continue our culture of trust and open communication as you strengthen our accounting department’s capabilities with results that speak for themselves. You also serve as a collaborative member of the Executive Leadership Team and be responsible for helping the company achieve its growth objectives through the strategic planning, people, processes and systems to manage and support the growth of the business. You’ll be coached and developed by a visionary leader and interact daily with a loyal and energetic staff.

Do your values match ours?

  • We do what we say
  • We love what we do
  • We own our mistakes
  • We make every day a success

We’d love to hear from you and what you can contribute to PrimeCo as well as what we can do to help you grow into your dream career! Please provide resume, salary and an intro letter. We’d like to get to know you.

Job Type: Full-time

Job Location:

  • Oceanside, CA

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • Accounting Management: 10 years
  • Management: 3 years

title: Marketing Analyst - Freelance

description:
We’re using big data and analytics to predict the future of the real estate market in the US. Our goal is to use this data to help people make better real estate decisions. Our platforms forecast real estate values at a local level, and every month, we forecast 36 months into the future, and our models predict more than 95% of the variation in price over time.We're seeking a passionate Data Analyst to help continue building the most powerful dataset in real estate.What you'll do: Apply expertise in quantitative and business analysis to reach actionable insights and drive decision makingCollaborate with engineering, product and data science teams to identify needs and solve problemsEnsure the quality of all data flowing into and out of our systemsDevelop key business reporting and marketing analyticsWhat you have: 3+ years experience in quantitative analysisAdvanced level SQL knowledgeExposure to large datasetsExperience with PythonExcellent communication skillsCollaborative and proactive personalityAbility to work through ambiguity and deal with shifting prioritiesBonus points for knowledge of: Real estate marketsPredictive modelingPandas, NumPy, scikit-learnHadoopWe build products that use data and predictive models to help others make better real estate decisions. There is over $33 trillion dollars in residential real estate in the US, but the data and tools available to builders, investors and appraisers to help them understand the market are lacking when compared to other fields.We empower our clients to make better real estate decisions by providing products that leverage the best real estate forecasts, data and visualization tools around - ours.

We track thousands of data elements every month, from national factors down to house-level data. Together, we have built the most exhaustive proprietary dataset going back 40+ years. The data is analyzed to pinpoint the driving factors behind market change. Our databases are constantly expanding - great data is required for accurate forecasts.

SQL, Python, Analytics
title: Data Analyst

description:
Position Title: Principal Investigator

Reports to: CMO / EVP Clinical Research

Location: La Jolla, CA

Organization Overview

Solely funded by philanthropists Gary and Mary West, West Health includes the nonprofit and nonpartisan Gary and Mary West Health Institute and Gary and Mary West Foundation in San Diego, and the Gary and Mary West Health Policy Center in Washington, D.C. These organizations are working together toward a shared mission dedicated to enabling seniors to successfully age in place with access to high-quality, affordable health and support services that preserve and protect their dignity, quality of life and independence. For more information, visit westhealth.org and follow @ westhealth .

POSITION SUMMARY The West Health Institute ( WHI ) is recruiting for a Principal Investigator (PI) who will provi de leadership in the implementation and dissemination of disruptive innovations designed to support our Successful Aging strategy. The PI will work with the WHI and W est H ealth P olicy C enter (WHPC) teams to further West Health’s mission to create new, more cost-effective ways of delivering high-quality care to make successful aging a reality for all seniors in America. Through a combination of medical research and policy initiatives, collaborations, education and advocacy, West Health is committed to supporting and creating healthcare delivery models that improve care and access while reducing costs for our fast-growing, diverse population of seniors. The P I is responsible for the development and execution of research activities for the Institute. The successful candidate will apply research expertise in the development of research protocols; obtaining IRB and meeting other regulatory requirements, leading a cross functional research team ( e.g. data analyst, study coordinators, health economist) to ensure research timeliness are protocols are executed on time and within budget. The PI will support and develop manuscripts, whitepapers, and engage with stakeholders to catalyze adoption of new models of care that advance our successful aging mission.

The ideal candidate will possess strong clinical , health policy and research skills . The candidate must have a track record of effectively forging partnerships between various stakeholders , including academic partners, medical centers, community - based senior organizations, government agencies, payers, and patient advocates to drive the process of unmet need identification, meaningful innovation, and implementation.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND FUNCTIONS
  • Research, analyze, and translate strategies to encourage provision and use of cost effective senior health and support services
  • Identification of strategies to promote the integration of evidence into policy and program decisions.
  • Appropriate adaptation of interventions according to senior population needs
  • Identification of approaches to scale-up effective interventions
  • Establish an impact evaluation for population based intervention
  • Demonstrate collegial, collaborative, and diplomatic interpersonal style with ability to implement inclusive approaches to foster consensus and engagement across diverse stakeholders and constituents
  • Communicate effectively both orally and in writing to a multi- ­ disciplinary stakeholder group
  • Drive publication of results in peer ­ reviewed journals, and more importantly, drive adoption of impactful solutions by a diverse set of healthcare industry stakeholder

QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE
  • MD or Ph.D in relevant field, preferred (e . g. clinical research, health services research, clinical epi demiology, implementation science, health policy, health economics, outcomes research)
  • 3 + years of experience managing professional staff, projects, and collaborative relationships
  • Experience and expertise in development and evaluation of research programs for senior health care is a plus
  • Must possess strong analytic and technical skills .
  • Strong written and verbal communication, time management, presentation and organizational skills
  • Exceptional interpersonal communication skills, ability to build research partnerships and to establish rapport and credibility at all levels
  • Ability to establish and maintain relationships with diverse organizations, agencies , and persons
  • Knowledge of research operations management, including bud geting, project management, broad knowledge of management principles and techniques
  • Highly self- ­ motivated individuals with hi gh energy, positive and professional approach, a “can- ­ do” attitude, and attention to detail
  • A bility to work both independently and within a team environment
  • Experience and expertise with evaluating healthcare costs, preferred

West Health Institute is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against persons on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, marital status, age, disability or veteran's status.
title: Principal Investigator

description:
Do you want to have a major impact on the way the world uses software? Are you passionate about excelling in a challenging position that is constantly evolving? Do you wake up every morning looking for a challenge? The Sales Acceleration Specialist will take JFrog’s amazing sales growth to the next level and beyond! The best candidate will be excited by the chance to analyze our sales data for opportunities and issues. They will determine how to implement, manage testing and roll-out effective processes and programs that will dramatically enhance our sales strategies and ability to execute for our customers. The Sales Acceleration Specialist will work closely with our sales team, marketing, and infrastructure team, focusing on improving our sales processes. The right person is organized, loves analyzing data, and executing programs. Responsibilities

  • Analyze sales data to identify patterns and unusual behavior

  • Measure the success of programs and adjust strategy/process

  • Develop, own, lead and represent project plans and business intent for all Sales focused programs
  • Collaborate with and influence stakeholder groups across the organization to successfully complete projects on time with quality results
  • Work well autonomously while effectively leading cross functional teams
  • Proactively identify issues and potential process improvements

Desired Skills and Experience

  • Advanced data analysis and modeling skills
  • Ability to develop new ideas for relevant analytics
  • Project management skills - ability to drive tasks, oversee execution, collaborate between different parties (internal/external), matrix management, manage without authority
  • Demonstrated attention to detail, committed to producing excellent quality results
  • Self-motivated, positive attitude
  • Able to work and deliver independently and with a team
  • Ability to work successfully in a fast-paced, rapidly changing work environment
  • Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively across departments
  • Metrics driven
  • Strong follow-up and organizational ability
  • BS or equivalent working experience in a technical field
  • Hard worker who loves to have fun while executing!

description:
Some people take things as they come. Others relentlessly push themselves to go farther. Combine health care and technology, which are two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet, with UnitedHealth Group's culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get: industry-leading health care services at a company that's improving the lives of millions. The rewards for performance are significant.

As the Health Care Economics Consultant you will support the data integration from multiple sources and conduct research and investigation of key business problems. Using exception analytical skills, you will develop and improve data management techniques and support quantitative data analytics for the enterprise. As a subject matter expert, you will interpret and analyze data from various sources and recommend best approaches for its consolidation. You will participate in projects identifying potential areas for improvement in data management and usage. Your analyses will be used to create viable, real-world solutions in a complex health care landscape. The work is as challenging as it is rewarding. You'll open doors to new opportunities. This is where bold people with big ideas are writing the next chapter in health care. Join us. There's never been a better time to do your life's best work.(sm)

Primary Responsibilities:
  • Provide claims, premium, capitation and membership data in support of utilization analyses
  • Create and update automated processes
  • Perform regular and repeatable data extraction, aggregation, and quality checking from multiple sources and tables in support of trend identification, root cause analysis
  • Analyze data or data sources utilized by internal customer groups
  • Asses and interpret business requirements and propose technical solutions
  • Identify solutions to non-standard requests and problems
  • Solve moderately complex problems and/or conduct moderately complex analyses
  • Work with minimal guidance; seek guidance on complex tasks
  • Translate concepts into practice
  • Provide explanations and information to others on data availability, content and interpretation
  • Research data quality questions; present findings; and suggest solutions as necessary
  • Create custom data extracts and aggregation processes in support of one time studies
  • Participate in projects by contributing to database creation, maintenance, and enhancement
  • Create reporting tools to investigate sources of variations
  • Produce and review reports

Required Qualifications:
  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience
  • 3+ years of work experience in a corporate setting
  • 1+ years of health care experience working with claims data and medical codes
  • 2+ years of experience in healthcare data analytics
  • Intermediate level proficiency with SAS
  • Advanced level of proficiency working with MS Excel
  • Experience working with large data sets (100M+ rows, and with multiple data sets concurrently)
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Must be a detail-oriented self-starter, critical thinker, with analytic skills and evidence of creative, proactive problem solving
  • Proficiency with MS Office Suite
  • Proficiency with SQL
  • Advanced SAS skills
  • Ability to effectively manage multiple priorities
Careers at UnitedHealthcare Employer & Individual. We all want to make a difference with the work we do. Sometimes we're presented with an opportunity to make a difference on a scale we couldn't imagine. Here, you get that opportunity every day. As a member of one of our elite teams, you'll provide the ideas and solutions that help nearly 25 million customers live healthier lives. You'll help write the next chapter in the history of health care. And you'll find a wealth of open doors and career paths that will take you as far as you want to go. Go further. This is your life's best work.(sm)

Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

description:
Praedicat is a funded FinTech startup in Los Angeles that is delivering innovative new “foresight modeling” to commercial clients built on cutting-edge big data analytics and technologies. Our cloud-based SaaS products, CoMeta™ and Oortfolio™, are pushing the limits of scalable risk modeling and big data. Our team is blazing new trails in forward-looking, science-based risk analytics using advanced machine learning algorithms and related technologies. We are looking for a strong candidate to join our growing team in Los Angeles.

For this role, we need a creative thinker with expertise in natural language processing (NLP). Our data is amazingly rich and provides a fantastic opportunity for data scientists to create and explore algorithms that will ultimately make the world a cleaner, healthier and safer place. You will be expected to develop an understanding of Praedicat’s clients and proprietary analytics, and think creatively about how Praedicat can solve their problems through software and analytics. · Making a difference: Our products deliver data from peer-reviewed science into the workflow of business so that our clients can use it to make better decisions – cleaner technologies, safer products, a healthier environment.

  • Multidisciplinary collaboration: We work in teams with smart people from multiple disciplines to develop creative solutions. · Hard problems and cutting-edge technologies: Our data science, modeling and software engineering challenges are hard and innovative solutions are necessary. ResponsibilitiesWork effectively with data scientists, modelers, engineers and business users to creatively find solutions to complex problemsPerform various tasks to assist in model building, validation and deploymentUnderstand and programmatically implement mathematical, statistical data, and computational solutionsConduct data analysis, data integration, data management and feature engineeringPerform various tasks of data ingestion, data transformation, and data visualizations RequirementsMasters, Ph. D., or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (computer science, physics, mathematics, bioinformatics, etc.)Ability to solve problems thoroughly, quickly and creatively with an eye for detailHands on experience in many aspects of data management activities involving large data sets (e.g.
data gathering and profiling, data analysis, test data creation, data validation)Strong background in machine learning using unsupervised and supervised methods, statistics, information retrieval, or graph analysisProven track record of leveraging large amounts of data to solve real-world problems, preferably using tools like Python, Hadoop, MapReduce, Pig, or HiveFluent in SQL, data manipulation, and data analysis in an OLAP environmentExperience and mastery of high level programming languages such as Python and JavaDemonstrable experience in developing high quality production-worthy softwareComfortable with data analysis and visualization Incentive Compensation and BenefitsPraedicat believes in a work-life balance that is supported by a competitive compensation and benefits package. All full-time regular employees are eligible for benefits such as: Participation in Praedicat’s Stock Incentive Plan offering equity-based incentives for employeesAnnual bonuses tied to individual and company performanceThe ability to contribute to a Praedicat-sponsored 401(k) planMedical insurance coverage, with both HMO and PPO options, as well as dental and vision coverageGenerous allotment of PTO (paid time off) and official holidays each yearPraedicat, Inc. is dedicated to improving corporate management of complex risks and in particular the risk that corporate activities may result in injury or financial losses to workers, customers or the public at large. Our solution relies on the mining of large, primarily text-based data sources.

Our multidisciplinary team leverages cutting-edge technologies to extract metadata from scientific literature. We analyze the data with a structured approach incorporating applied legal reasoning and economics. Praedicat is developing a comprehensive system of software products designed to bring 21st Century science-based risk analytics to liability insurance and corporate risk management. We believe that by translating text-based science into risk data, we will solve our global corporate clients critical business problems and make the world cleaner, safer, and healthier at the same time.

Praedicat was created by the RAND Corporation and Risk Management Solutions, Inc. after the two companies collaborated on research and development to improve the identification and prioritization of emerging risks using modeling and cutting-edge computer science. Praedicat is an independent corporation launched in March 2012.Praedicat is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment with Praedicat is determined on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status.data management, data analysis, data validation, testing data creation, machine learning, information retrieval, graph analysis, SQL, Python, Hadoop, MapReduce, Pig, Hive, Java

description:
NEW LEARNING RETREAT CENTER OPENING MAY 2017!

Named for the number of minutes in a day, 1440 Multiversity is a brand new nonprofit learning retreat center destination in the California redwoods showcasing cutting-edge weekend and 5-day programs in health and wellness, personal growth, and professional development. Our 75 acre state-of-the-art facility offers beautiful accommodations, walking trails, dining facilities and a wellness center. It is nestled between Santa Cruz and Silicon Valley in Scotts Valley, opens Memorial Day weekend and will feature a wide array of world-class faculty. 1440 Multiversity was founded by and for people interested in leading integrated lives -- built around mindful, conscious choices. If you want to be part of an organization whose mission is learning for better living, 1440 Multiversity could be just what you're looking for--professionally and personally. As a 1440 Multiversity employee, you'll have numerous opportunities for personal and professional development--in your job responsibilities, in the relationships you form, and in the programs you'll have the opportunity to attend. You'll spend your workday with people who strive to live into the values of authenticity, presence, and humility, while working courageously and tenaciously to birth this new kind of school--one that hosts world-renowned faculty and delivers a phenomenal experience for our guests.

More Coming Soon....

If you want to be part of an organization whose mission is learning for better living, 1440 Multiversity could be just what you're looking for--professionally and personally. As a 1440 Multiversity employee, you'll have numerous opportunities for personal and professional development--in your job responsibilities, in the relationships you form, and in the programs you'll have the opportunity to attend. You'll spend your workday with people who strive to live into the values of authenticity, presence, and humility, while working courageously and tenaciously to birth this new kind of school--one that hosts world-renowned faculty and delivers a phenomenal experience for our guests. In addition to a range of common employee benefits, you'll have discounted access to delicious and healthy meals, café treats, and holistic retail and wellness offerings. Most important, you'll be part of creating a powerful, welcoming guest experience that has the potential to transform lives.
