description:
Position Title: Community Advocacy Coordinator (Bilingual: Spanish/English)

Who We Are : CORA (Community Overcoming Relationship Abuse), is the only agency in San Mateo County providing crisis intervention and supportive services to survivors of domestic violence and their children. We provide legal assistance, education and outreach, community-based advocacy, individual and group counseling, a 24-hour hotline, emergency response through our collaboration with law enforcement, two emergency shelters and supportive housing to survivors of intimate partner violence/abuse.

CORA is currently seeking a Community Advocacy Coordinator to lead two new and exciting domestic violence prevention collaborations within San Mateo County:

  • In collaboration with San Mateo County District Attorney’s Office and Rape Trauma Services, the Youth Engagement & Advocacy (YEA!) Program will target youth victimized by, or at risk for sexual/domestic violence, dating violence, or commercial sexual exploitation.
  • In collaboration with the City of East Palo Alto, the East Palo Alto Domestic Violence Community Advocacy Pilot Project will address the needs of residents of East Palo Alto who are experiencing, or at risk for, domestic violence.

The Community Advocacy Coordinator is expected to operate with a high level of independence. S/He will have an opportunity to shape and provide ongoing direction and support in the development of innovative community-based programming as we continue to expand this new service delivery model. Each program will provide each specialized population with uniquely tailored advocacy, prevention, education, and intervention services.

Position Summary: The Community Advocacy Coordinator is responsible for developing a vision around and facilitating high quality programming for all of CORA’s new domestic violence prevention collaborative projects geared toward specialized populations. This position is responsible for program development, day-to-day operations, and direct supervision of a team of specialized community advocates responsible for providing community-based, culturally and linguistically responsive services to domestic violence survivors and their families. The Community Advocacy Coordinator will work in partnership with the Community Education Coordinator and respective advocates to provide education, training, and technical assistance to community stakeholders. This position will establish and maintain ongoing collaborative relationships; design, implement, monitor, and evaluate programs in alignment with contract requirements; and manage referral systems to ensure efficient access to CORA’s comprehensive, trauma-informed services, as needed. This position will be located at our administrative office in San Mateo and will be required to travel to multiple locations throughout San Mateo County.

The Community Advocacy Coordinator should promote CORA’s culture, building effective relationships both inside and outside the organization that inspire others to action and possess knowledge and experience in the provision of trauma-informed domestic violence services. The prospective candidate must share a passion for our mission, be an adaptable, self-reflective, empathetic team player with strong interpersonal skills, and have a desire to support the needs of survivors of intimate partner abuse. The Community Advocacy Coordinator will bring a sophisticated understanding of cultural competency and conflict resolution, and demonstrate self-initiative and a genuine interest in professional and personal growth. This individual should also demonstrate interest and proven skill in implementing best practices.

Primary Responsibilities:

Program Coordination/Supervision (60%):

  • Coordinate day-to-day operations of the YEA! Program, East Palo Alto Domestic Violence Community Advocacy Pilot Project, and any other potential community-based programs, and provide direct supervision and support to each program’s community advocate.
  • Provide leadership in maintaining and implementing the overall vision for community-based advocacy services consistent with the mission and values of CORA.
  • Working in close coordination with each collaborative partner, conduct outreach to each community’s stakeholders to schedule specialized trainings tailored to each population, including establishing schedules and creating eligibility requirements and referral practices.
  • Responsible for developing specialized training curriculum and programming for each targeted population and leading a team in the development of culturally relevant program design.
  • Recruit, train, supervise, and evaluate staff/volunteers to ensure the success, sustainability, resourcefulness, and ongoing development of each program.
  • Establish strategic partnerships and assign appropriate staff to develop partnerships with various stakeholders and collaborative partners to coordinate and leverage service delivery and service connections.
  • Work with community advocates to bolster and refresh staff and partner agencies’ competencies in working with each specialized population.
  • Ongoing communication and collaboration with collaborative partners and CORA’s department leads to manage the referral process and ensure quality service delivery.
  • Provide leadership and consultation and implement concrete decision-making strategies to support high risk cases.
  • Attend and/or facilitate partner agency meetings.

Administrative (20%):

  • Monitor upkeep of records and database functionality to support program documentation requirements.
  • Participate in the ongoing development of program policies and procedures and ensure programs are consistently meeting their goals and objectives in accordance with contract requirements.
  • Assist in the maintenance of filing systems, perform quarterly validity checks, and develop/implement new procedures relating to each program.
  • Review timesheets, requests for time off, and coordinate schedules to ensure sufficient coverage.
  • Coordinate with appropriate contractors to resolve any technical challenges affecting service delivery.
  • Develop evaluation plan to measure impact, ensure compliance, and perform programmatic assessments that include data collection, analysis, and direct input from community stakeholders.
  • Compile program statistics and prepare quarterly reports (including data, narrative, success story elements) in collaboration with the director and data analyst.
  • Consistently review and update training materials and department protocols that align with strategic planning and program development and evaluation in collaboration with the Director of Crisis and Advocacy Services.
  • Communicate changes in policy and procedure to staff and volunteers.
  • Perform maintenance and routine administrative tasks such as revising internal forms and documents, copying/stocking client forms, coordinating file archiving schedule.

Direct Service/Operational Duties (20%):

  • Refer victims to CORA’s intervention services, as appropriate, including mental health services, legal services, emergency shelter, supportive housing, children’s programming, and life skills training.
  • Provide coverage support for advocates, as needed.
  • Develop and distribute program materials, flyers, and brochures.
  • Coordinate and streamline intake/screening process and triage referrals.
  • Communicate effectively with community partners and respond to client concerns regarding service delivery.
  • Attend supervision, departmental, agency staff meetings, and community meetings as assigned.
  • Provide advocacy support and conduct community outreach as assigned by supervisor.
  • Provide leadership as appropriate to contribute to the operation and growth of the agency.

Required Skills:

  • BA degree in social work, psychology, counseling, or related field; or an equivalent combination of education and experience in the provision of social services.
  • Managerial and/or supervisory experience in the nonprofit, human services field required.
  • Experience working with survivors of domestic violence preferred, including completion of 40-hour domestic violence training. Candidates who have not completed the training will be required to do so.
  • Experience working with underserved, high-risk, and isolated populations providing direct client and community engagement services; two years minimum.
  • Bilingual English/Spanish fluency preferred.
  • Must be available to work a flexible schedule, which may which may include day/evening hours Monday through Friday, and some weekends and holidays.
  • Ability to provide culturally competent services and work with a diverse staff and clientele in an empathetic and non-judgmental manner.
  • Must demonstrate acceptable level of maturity, emotional stability, and sound judgment to provide effective services to diverse populations.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to function as a part of a team and work in collaboration with outside agencies.
  • Ability to comply with all confidentiality policies and procedures; maintain confidentiality of client data and personal information.
  • Ability to de-escalate and resolve conflict effectively while maintaining personal safety.
  • Ability to integrate feedback and utilize supervision.
  • Valid CA driver’s license, access to reliable transportation, and insurance required. Willingness to travel to multiple sites within San Mateo County.
  • Background check, including fingerprinting clearance from the Department of Justice; Demonstrate eligibility to work in the United States.
  • Familiarity with community-based services in San Mateo County preferred.

Reports to: Director of Crisis and Advocacy Services

Benefits/Compensation: This is a regular, full-time, exempt position. Salary range is $46-47K per year; non-negotiable. CORA offers excellent health benefits (medical, dental, vision, chiropractic), generous time-off policies (including 3 weeks of vacation in 1st year), LT disability, life insurance, and a matching retirement plan.

CORA History and Overview

CORA has provided services to survivors of intimate partner abuse for nearly 40 years. Our programs include Crisis Intervention Services, including a 24-hour hotline, collaboration with law enforcement, emergency shelter options, and supportive counseling. Family Support Services provides mental health therapy, supportive/transitional housing, and a children’s program. CORA has robust legal services for survivors of domestic violence and provides educational workshops about the dynamics of domestic violence and healthy relationship skills.

CORA is strengths-based, collaborative, accessible, and client-centered. CORA believes that everyone deserves to be treated with respect in their intimate relationships. We provide safety, support and healing to individuals who experience abuse in an intimate relationship and educate the community to break the cycle of domestic violence. Regardless of a survivor’s race, class, gender, sexual orientation, or culture, we save lives and provide an opportunity to begin again.

CORA inspires work of the highest caliber by fostering staff engagement through transparency and inclusion in agency decisions wherever possible. We strive to ensure our policies and communications reflect an appreciation of the impact of social inequities, historical and current, and actively promote healthy relationships amongst staff by demonstrating mutual respect in all our communications.

Websites : www.corasupport.org and www.teenrelationships.org

CORA is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We seek diversity with respect to race, color, age, sex, (including breastfeeding and medical conditions related to breastfeeding), religion (including religious dress or grooming practices), national origin, mental or physical disability, genetic characteristics and information, ancestry, marital status, family status, political belief, sexual orientation, gender (including gender identity and expression), medical condition, military, or veteran status or any other category or status protected by Federal, State or other applicable laws.

All applicants are welcome. Individuals who are bilingual, people of color, members of the LGBTQ community and/or survivors of domestic violence are strongly encouraged to apply. The position will remain open until filled.

No phone calls please.

Job Type: Full-time

Required language:

  • Spanish

description:
Lodestar: A Lighthouse Community Charter School
THE ORGANIZATION
Social justice movements come in all shapes and sizes. Here at Lighthouse Community Public Schools we are engaged in an educational movement that goes beyond our classrooms working to disrupt educational inequities by providing our students and families exceptional educational opportunities every day. Grounded in our core values of community, integrity, agency, love, and social justice rooted in EL Education Model, LCPS is a leader in fostering innovative schools achieving exceptional student outcomes where each child is at the center of their own learning. Our mission is to prepare diverse students for college, a career of their choice, and to be lifelong changemakers.

Founded in 2002, LCPS operates a high-achieving K-12 public charter school, and our K-8 sister site, Lodestar, that opened in Fall 2016; serving nearly 1,000 students in East Oakland. Lighthouse is a beacon for public education and our graduates fulfill the promise of a better, brighter Oakland. 95% of our graduates, almost all of whom are first-generation college students, are accepted into four-year colleges. We were named the Hart Vision Charter School of the Year in 2013, and the #1 high school for closing achievement for low-income Latino students in 2016. If the work we do here at LCPS appeals to your values regarding quality education for all then please join our movement! Learn more at www.lighthousecharter.org

About Lodestar—A New Way of Doing School
Lodestar is an innovative, new school that opened in East Oakland in Fall 2016. Lodestar teachers are excited by the possibility of transforming the traditional model of education to be student-centered and experiential. Our teaching pedagogy is built around:

  • Design principles of agency
  • Students belonging to an educational community that provides personalized learning
  • Project-based learning expeditions using Making/Arts/Design
  • “Just right” instruction in math and literacy.
This model allows our teachers to specialize in delivering either project-based interdisciplinary learning or small-group, multi-age math or literacy instruction. This year, we are adding grades 3 and 7 to our existing grade levels of K, 1, 2, and 6. We will continue to add grades until we are K-12. Take a look at our work and watch our lab in action here!

Responsibilities of the Kindergarten Instructional Aide (Immediate Opening)

  • Co-coordinate and collaboratively supervise a focused and supportive learning environment for a multi-aged group of students in the “home space” (literacy and math lab) in which students are engaged in self-directed work. The number of students in the “home” space at any given time may range between 30-60 depending on the current configuration of whole-group, small-group, and individualized instruction.
  • Support students to develop agency by helping students to develop independent study habits.
  • Support students to develop proficiency in literacy and numeracy through small group and individual tutoring.
  • Support literacy and numeracy teachers in maintaining an academic culture ideal for student learning by implementing preferred Lodestar academic and cultural strategies and systems including Reader’s and Writer’s Workshop, Restorative Justice, and Responsive Classroom.
  • Collaborate regularly with teachers to ensure that every Lodestar student is receiving just-right personalized reading and numeracy instruction based on data.
  • Attend and actively participate in professional development activities, team and staff meetings.
  • Contribute unique strengths to the development and design of the new school as a founding educator.
Other additional responsibilities as assigned by supervisor.

Core Competencies

We are looking for talented people who exhibit competencies in our 5 tenets and the Lodestar agency mindset:

HIGH EXPECTATIONS FOR ALL

  • VISIONARY, INNOVATIVE, & EQUITY-FOCUSED URBAN EDUCATOR: Believes and demonstrates that every student can learn and commits to holding high expectations and providing opportunities for all students.
  • MODELS GROWTH MINDSET: Holds a growth-mindset for self, colleagues, and students demonstrated by self-reflection and the belief that everyone is a lifelong learner.
DEEP LEARNING THROUGH RIGOROUS CURRICULUM

  • FACILITATOR OF DEEP LEARNING: Supports personalized and rigorous and meaningful learning experiences for all students in a student coaching role.
  • AUTHENTIC DATA ANALYST: Transparently uses and analyzes authentic data to advance practice and student goals. Supports students in the process of analyzing students’ own progress towards their learning goals.
SERVING THE WHOLE PERSON & ENGAGING FAMILIES

  • COMMUNITY BUILDER: Builds deep and caring relationships, uses restorative and responsive practices, and communicates effectively with students, families, colleagues, and community.
  • COMMUNITY MEMBER: Takes a humble and assets-based approach to working with and becoming a part of our community.
PROFESSIONAL LEARNING COMMUNITY

  • SKILLED COLLABORATOR: Collaborates with empathy by listening to divergent perspectives and demonstrating pedagogical expertise, mission-alignment, and high levels of professionalism at all times.
  • STRATEGIC TEAMMATE: Works in a strategic manner autonomously and collaboratively despite complexity.
AGENCY MINDSET

  • MODELS AGENCY: Exhibits persistence, creativity, flexibility, motivation to make change, and the ability to imagine new approaches and opportunities for impact.
  • COMMITTED FOUNDER: Brings passion to the founding of a new school as a dependable, organized, solutions-oriented, and optimistic founding team member committed to both starting up and staying to teach our kids.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
  • A.A. required, Bachelor’s Degree preferred
  • 2+ years working with urban youth in either a school, non-profit, or youth empowerment setting. Experience in a school setting is a plus
  • Bilingual in Spanish a plus
TIME COMMITMENT

200-day regular instructional schedule-until June 30th, 2017.

Common Building Hours: All educators are expected to maintain hours of 8:00 - 4:00 pm and 8:00-5:00 one day a week for Professional Development.

COMPENSATION

Commensurate with experience. Competitive benefits package.

TO APPLY

People of color are strongly encouraged to apply.

Interested candidates should submit:
  • Resume
  • Cover letter describing your interest in this exciting position and why you are an optimal fit, including how your teaching philosophy, approach to student learning, and educational expertise would contribute to the Lodestar founding team
  • 3 references with Name, Email, Phone Number and Title/nature of working relationship
Application submission screening and initial phone interviews will be completed on a rolling basis with a deadline of . In-person interviews and performance tasks will take place on-site.

Lighthouse Community Charter School is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity at all levels.

Opportunity for a Call Center Data Analyst in our French Camp office. Put your customer service knowledge and analytical skills to work in a meaningful way! Join our hands-on, high-touch dedicated customer service department and assist our 340,000+ members in accessing the healthcare they need. This is a great opportunity if you are mission driven, have a commitment to service, and thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced work environment. This is a great opportunity for someone with mid-level analytical skills and a strong foundation in customer service.

As a Call Center Data Analyst, you would be responsible for analyzing and reporting on call center data for the purposes of forecasting, capacity planning and scheduling.

Requirements include: Ability to analyze data and determine needed process changes, to gather, compile and report on data information; strong skills in data identification, integration, validation, manipulation, interpretation, database manipulation and reporting; the ability to write and run queries (SQL) and link tables; strong knowledge of call center reports, metrics, policies and procedures; the ability to forecast and schedule customer service representatives based off of call volumes utilizing a Workforce Management System; advanced skills in MS Excel including the ability to create formulas, charts, graphs, pivot tables and macros Knowledge of Workforce Management tools in a call center or similar production environment.

Education and experience: High School Diploma and/or equivalent; at least two years’ experience as an analyst in a call center; at least three years in customer service; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

description:
Position title: Sales Analyst and Promotions Coordinator

Job location: Berkeley, California

Working hours: 8AM-5PM, Monday through Friday

Reports to: Director of Sales/CEO

General tasks

The La Tourangelle Sales Analyst and Promotions Coordinator main mission is to analyze market and sales information to support the company sales and marketing strategy, grow sales, increase overall company profitability and maintain outstanding customer service. As such his/her responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Analyze sales of La Tourangelle products across all distribution channels and territories to identify trends, gaps, leads and generate actionable reports leading to increased sales and profitability.
  • Market trends analysis: acquire market data and perform analysis to identify trends, threats, opportunities and produce actionable reports to guide the company sales and marketing strategy.
  • Gap analysis: identify opportunities and voids by performing gap analysis (at existing retailers, geographical, product portfolio, pricing, distributor, etc.).
  • Promotions management: promotional coordinator is working with sales team to establish a promotional plan. He/she oversees the plan execution, monitoring and analysis.
  • Forecasting monthly sales: Recognize, follow and analyze trends. Consider history, behavior, seasonality and promotions to place an educated prediction. Partner with Sales and Marketing to provide global sales forecasting, to include all new products launches, promotions and discontinuations.
  • Charge back management: monitor customer payment deduction and charge back. Dispute charges when necessary.
  • Broker commissions management: The sales analyst is in charge of monthly broker commission calculation.
  • Support Regional Sales Managers with sales tools, movement reports, ad hoc projects, etc. to strengthen their sales pitch.
  • New product submission and distributors catalog management.
  • Maximize the profitability and relevancy of La Tourangelle catalog by performing pricing analysis at various level in the distribution (distributor, wholesale, srp).
  • Prepare presentation & analysis to support the sales team at various customers’ category reviews.
  • Act as a valuable team member and take an active role in establishing partnerships with other sales people and other La Tourangelle team members to help the organization and its team member thrive and reach their goals.

Goals and objectives

  • La Tourangelle is a small business that requires team work and flexibility in work assignment. By nature, the La Tourangelle Sales Analyst and Promotions Coordinator needs to be able to multitask and interact with various departments and different team members having various skills and positions.
  • In addition to the General tasks described above, the overall objective of the Sales Analyst and Promotions Coordinator is to do his/her best efforts to help grow a financially successful company and meet the strategic goals set by the CEO.
  • As a team member, his/her feedback and improvement suggestions are encouraged and appreciated. He/she is expected to maintain and promote team spirit and good communication between various departments and personnel.
  • Participation in inter departments meetings is encouraged and appreciated. Participation in team building events and any advice to help build a successful and sustainable company is value and appreciated.
  • This Job description may change at any time as the company needs and objectives evolve.

Education and Experience

  • Bachelor degree in Computer Science or Business or equivalent 5 to 7 years in a related field (i.e. sales analytics, retail sales analysis, etc.)
  • Minimum 1-3 years’ experience in a manufacturing CPG environment
  • Strong analytical and reporting skills (proficient in syndicated data; AC Nielsen, SPINS and/or IRI)
  • Experience with retail promotional reporting and analysis
  • Ability to co-ordinate and manage several critical projects and requests simultaneously
  • Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to convey complex information
  • Ability to utilize disparate data/resources to determine competitive positioning
  • Strong interpersonal and problem solving skills with the ability to work independently as well as within a team environment
  • Excellent group presentation skills
  • Self-directed with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment with multiple accountabilities and multiple internal customers
  • Extensive knowledge of MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint including ability to use graphs, formulae and pivot tables
  • Knowledge of SAP Business One software a plus
  • Must be dedicated to a high level of accuracy
  • Relentless sense of urgency
  • Self-proclaimed foodie; Interested in cooking, eating and living a healthy lifestyle
  • Cross cultural awareness and proven adaptability
  • Enjoys working with diverse backgrounds
  • Foreign languages a plus

Our Company and Work Environment

We, at La Tourangelle, are an authentic & traditional family producer of specialty oils handcrafting a wide range of delicious artisan nut oils both in France and California. All the La Tourangelle nut oils sold in North America are made in our artisan oil mill located in Woodland, CA mostly from California grown nuts. We also distribute an exclusive line of premium oils imported from all over the World. All our artisan oils are expeller-pressed, Non-GMO, all natural and delicious.

To apply, please submit:

  • Resume
  • Cover letter
  • Your knowledge and experience as a Data Analyst
  • Your interest in La Tourangelle

Job Type: Full-time

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

description:
Fender Digital Products is a new division of Fender Musical Instruments Corporation (“FMIC”) located in Hollywood, CA. Fender Digital Products is a new division making apps, websites, platforms and tools to compliment the guitars, amps and audio gear that Fender makes.

Fender of course is an American icon. Born in Southern California with a world-wide influence extending beyond the studio and the stage. A Fender is more than an instrument, it is a cultural symbol that resonates across fashion, entertainment and more.

Building on this brand authenticity, Fender is expanding its direct-to-consumer relationship through a suite of digital products and interactive experiences. We are looking for an CRM/Email Marketing Manager to build a more robust and sophisticated email marketing & marketing automation program to deliver results for Fender’s e-commerce, Digital Products and Marketing initiatives.

The ideal candidate will have built and managed high volume and complex email programs for IR500 brands. You will have rolled out new ESP and marketing automation platforms, successfully migrated millions or records and are collaborative in nature, having worked closely with design, UI/UX, DBAs and key business unit owners. You are a true player/coach, able to code HTML email templates, train junior team members, and stay current on best mobile and delivery practices.

Responsibilities:
  • Own Email/CRM/Marketing Automation strategy, technology, optimization and analytics.
  • Manage a team of one designer, one email coordinator and a data analyst, ensuring best email and design practices along with data hygiene are adhered to.
  • Ensure best email and design practices along with data hygiene are adhered to
  • Retention/LTV - Own the build out of segmentation, customer journeys and touchpoints, and lifecycle marketing efforts to improve customer lifetime value
  • Take operational responsibility for delivery of campaigns, ongoing A/B testing, tracking and analytics, funnel analysis, segmentation strategies and technology implementations.
Key Working Relationships:
Internal

  • Accountable to all internal business owners to create, schedule, execute and measure email marketing campaigns and programmatic campaigns.
  • Collaborate with internal and external design, copy & brand resources to drive asset & content creation & delivery.
  • Partner with Director of Retention to evolve and optimize Fender’s overall customer engagement, retention and automation strategies.
  • Clearly and succinctly communicate campaign results and analyses to leadership.
External

  • Leverage vendor relationships (ESP, analytics, AI) to stay current on industry developments, best practices and bleeding edge innovations.
  • Experience working with an array of analytics solutions (GA, Segment, Tableau, Looker, etc.) to track email performance and reporting.
Requirements:
  • 2-3 years of experience owning email & marketing automation strategy with real life examples of successful revenue growth and engagement growth at scale.
  • 5-7 years of experience working with enterprise and/or scalable cloud-based ESPs (Exact target, Responsys, Blueshift, Iterable, etc.).
  • Strong Understanding of Email Marketing Best Practices, International CAN-SPAM Laws, HTML and CSS.
  • Basic Knowledge of Photoshop and Graphic Design Best Practices.
  • Excellent Written and Verbal Communication Skills with Copywriting Experience a Plus.
  • Strong Quantitative Skills to Analyze Data and Make Informed Decisions.
  • Experience Creating Dashboards for Metrics Reporting.
  • Skilled with creating PowerPoint or Keynote presentations to articulate campaign strategy and performance.
  • SQL Experience a plus.
Education Requirements:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Journalism or related field.
About Fender Musical Instruments:
Fender Musical Instruments Corporation (FMIC) is one of the world’s leading musical instrument manufacturers, marketers and distributors, whose portfolio of brands includes Fender®, Squier®, Gretsch®, Jackson®, EVH®, Charvel® and Groove Tubes®, among others. For more information, visit www.fender.com ( http://www.fender.com/ ). FMIC offers a competitive benefits package which includes medical, dental, 401(k), paid time off, and an equipment purchase program to help you get the band back together. Fender Musical Instruments Corporation is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, age, color, religion, disability, veterans’ status, sexual orientation, or any other protected factor.

description:
Intermedia – Sr. Sales Operations Analyst

It’s one thing to work for a company that’s a household name. It’s an even better thing to work for a company that took on those household names—and won.

The only thing better than that, of course, is knowing that you’ve been absolutely instrumental to that victory.

That’s the opportunity Intermedia presents today. We’re taking on the world’s biggest tech companies in a battle for the $50B business communications and productivity industry. Our goal is both modest and earth-shattering: to eliminate the pain of deploying and managing business IT.

The Sr. Sales Operations Analyst position will be part financial analyst, business and data analyst and leader. As a member of the Sales Operations Team reporting to the Director, Global Sales Operations, this position provides a unique opportunity to proactively engage in multiple areas of focus within Sales Operations. Through collaboration and communication this position will contribute to meaningful data analysis.

The successful candidate will be curious and able to clarify ambiguous requests for information. Will have the ability to develop an in-depth understanding of company sales databases. Enjoy sorting through the details and consolidating data.

RESPONSIBILITES:
Forecasting & Planning:
Coordinates sales forecasting, and planning used within the sales organization. Proactively monitors and strives to maintain high levels of data quality, accuracy, and process consistency in the sales organization's forecasting and planning efforts.
Deep and thorough understanding of the overall sales forecasting/planning engine that drives territory management & quota setting process

Reporting, Analysis, & Insight:
Measures, analyzes and reports results to support informed, fact-based business decisions which drive improved performance and results across multiple sales channels.
Perform ad hoc analysis for major sales initiatives and programs. This often involves starting with a fairly undefined problem, identifying trends and issues, synthesizing and reporting the results.
Partner with the sales teams to understand the business and sales challenges.
Develop, socialize and report consistent assessment of historical performance.
Build and implement sales analytics and business intelligence which will enable the global sales organization to successfully execute on selling strategies, build greater customer intimacy, and achieve sales goals.
Define, refine and automate our systems / processes / templates that will allow us understand the layers of business, market environments, and competitor landscapes in which we operate and compete more efficiently and effectively.
Develop sales leadership dashboards, PPT presentations, etc., to communicate results in a succinct, easy-to-understand manner, to all levels of the organization.

Communication & Presentation:
Synthesize complex data into easily understood and compelling management reports and performance dashboards.
Act as a trusted advisor and leader when creating presentation material regarding the performance of the business.
Presenting analysis and reporting to executive level audience.

Ad-Hoc:
Engage on projects relating to the advancement of sales operations initiatives.

QUALIFICATIONS:
BA/BS in Business Administration or related degree required; 4+ years’ professional experience in a software company and with at least 4 years in sales operations or analyst role.
Strong problem solving and analytical skills.
Strong Project Management competencies.
Exceptional interpersonal, oral and written communication skills.
Ability to adapt quickly to a changing environment.
Strong Salesforce.com administrator skills. Experience with BI reporting tools a plus.
Experience creating reporting via Salesforce and other reporting tools (Insight Squared, C9, WAVE, GoodData, etc.)
Advanced MS Office software skills (Word, Powerpoint, Excel, Outlook).
Collegial, proactive attitude, ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment is essential.

description:
Job Code: #3414
Title: Sales Operations Data Analyst -- 97749
Job Type: Direct Hire
Job Location: Lake Forest California

Job Description:
Job Description
The Sales Operations Data Analyst role is an integral part of the corporate Sales Operations team supporting a nationwide sales force and other related roles. We track key performance metrics, optimize geographic territories and markets, and administer various systems designed to facilitate and incentivize sales performance. This position will be responsible for administering commissions for the national sales team. In addition, the position will ensure our data sources talk to each other properly and that we're collecting the information we need to provide thorough and accurate reporting to everyone from sales representatives to executive leadership. We produce a large number of recurring reports, and there is a great deal of opportunity for this role to streamline and automate these processes, reducing the need for manual data entry and improving accuracy and efficiency. This position will have the freedom to use your creativity to improve our processes, data management and reporting. There are several experienced analysts on our team and throughout the company that this role will have the opportunity to collaborate with on a daily basis in order to continuously improve your skill set. There is ample opportunity for growth as an analyst and into management within Sales Operations or other departments like Finance, IT, or Operations.
Owns the Sales Incentive Compensation System and payroll process, troubleshooting issues and identifying opportunities for improvement, ensuring compliance with SOX and internal processes.
Create models and analytics to support decision making for various projects, including compensation plan design.
Respond to escalated field leadership and sales rep questions regarding compensation and incentives.
Create workflows to verify that system interfaces are working properly, and that data ties out between systems.
Manage the design, automation, and production of sales reports and dashboards to track key performance metrics.
Create SQL queries to retrieve data from corporate data sources.
Design and automate QA processes to ensure data and reporting accuracy, consistency and completeness.
Identify process improvement needs and develop ideas for implementation across the department or sales force.
Analyze data and reports to proactively identify trends and make recommendations to leadership.
Track results of new programs and other growth initiatives.
Respond to field leadership's requests for information and ensure that reports meet their needs.
Perform other related duties as directed by supervisor.

Candidate Requirements
Four-year college degree in an analytical discipline (Finance, Accounting, Economics, etc.) or equivalent work experience.
Three to five years of related work experience in an analytical role focused on process improvement.
Advanced Excel proficiency required.
Intermediate Access proficiency required (advanced query design, beginning-to-intermediate form design).
Ability to work with multiple spreadsheets and databases to generate complex analytical reporting under minimal supervision.
Microsoft SQL Server and reporting tools.
Compensation experience.
Sales analysis experience.
Intermediate proficiency in VBA (other programming languages will be considered, but this role is primarily going to code in VBA).
Ability to create complex analytical models (financial, sales, operations).
Microsoft SharePoint 2013 experience.
Six Sigma or other process improvement certification.

title: Sales Operations Data Analyst -- 97749

description:
(Internal title: Sr. IT Consultant)

Position Description

The Enterprise Information Data Architect is responsible and accountable for application data architecture strategy, data architecture vision, and application data modeling across the Farmers enterprise. Primary responsibilities include developing application data architecture strategy, developing application data reference models, leading application data architecture software evaluations, and assessing impact of change to application data architectures, data models, and messaging models. This role also includes responsibility of architecture delivery and governance to ensure alignment to data architecture standards and vision. Solution architectures will include data models, standard interfaces for data access and value-added data services, metadata including an inventory of data, and follow best practices for data creation, usage, and messaging exchange.

Position Requirements

Deep understanding of Enterprise Architecture principles, standards, and enterprise strategy development.

Ability to evaluate and assess existing legacy data assets with an eye on modernization and simplification.

Ability to build and articulate a data architecture and delivery roadmap indicating current, transition, and future state architectures, focused around clear benefits to both IT and business users.

Proven experience in architecture governance, controls, and peer reviews in regards to data, security, and cloud.

Experienced in developing architecture reference models for data governance and control.

Ability to lead software evaluations including RFP development, capabilities assessment, formal scoring models, and delivery of executive presentations supporting a final directional recommendations.

Ability to authentically and effectively communicate with various stakeholders across business and IT.

Responsible for creating design patterns and best practices for data and the integration of data through the enterprise.

Responsible for creating reference architecture, and roadmap necessary to hold architecture delivery to the level of quality.

Ability to understand and mitigate architecture risk and compromise

Required Skills and Abilities

Expert knowledge and demonstrated abilities working in large, multi-million dollar Data architecture programs.

Proven ability to work with all levels within the IT and Business organization.

Experience in influencing executive business and IT leadership.

A self-motivated, directed, dynamic, positive, flexible, resourceful, and respectful individual.

Attention to detail and strong organization skills.

Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Well versed in the Data domains (Analytics, BI, Big Data, Operational Data Store, Metadata, Master Data, Unstructured Data).

Ability to design and develop Business Process Management workflows, spanning both orchestration and human task use cases.

Demonstrated expertise in message exchange patterns (synchronous request-reply, asynchronous fire-and-forget, broadcast-multi-cast, and publish-subscribe.)

Experienced in SOA, with a deep understanding of web services (XSDs, WSDLs) used within an Enterprise Service Bus.

Demonstrated expertise with transformation techniques, including but not limited to transformation, aggregation, decomposition, abstraction, and canonicalization.

Hands-on ability to build and manage enterprise canonical models, leveraging both industry and application specific service models.

Demonstrated expertise in defining and implementing distributed enterprise component-based architecture and frameworks to support abstraction.

Proven ability to work with various service transports and protocols (i.e. SOAP, HTTP, MQ, etc.).

Experience with Guidewire PolicyCenter or ClaimCenter is a plus.

Insurance industry experience is preferred.

Hands-on ability to build and manage enterprise data models, leveraging both industry and application specific service models.

Experience with unstructured or semi-structured data design and implementation.

Hands on experience with data profiling tools and processes.

description:
Looking for a company that inspires passion, courage and imagination, where you can be part of the team shaping the future of global commerce? Want to shape how millions of people buy, sell, connect, and share around the world? If you’re interested in joining a purpose driven community that is dedicated to creating an ambitious and inclusive workplace, join eBay – a company you can be proud to be a part of.

Data security analysts will help in monitoring how information is stored, modified and accessed on corporate databases and data warehouses.

Primarily looking for abnormal activity or behavioral patterns of access, modification or usage of data that violates predefined uses cases. Data security analyst would participate as member of delivery team that would be responsible for the following activities but not limited to:

• Develop data protection strategies, architectures and implementation plans for protecting data at rest.
• Implement and manage data protection solutions for heterogeneous data storage platforms

Key Responsibilities may include:

• Responsible for monitoring security alerts within Imperva, reaching out to respective teams to drive resolution
• Partner with SOC on alerts that investigation teams potentially malicious
• Provide recommendations on fine tuning policies to eliminate false positives
• Data analysis of audit policies to develop potential new use cases for security policy monitoring
• Support annual PCI audit through generation of pre-defined PCI reports
• Troubleshoot Imperva Appliances for any perceived issues, act as key point of contact for Imperva Support
• Monitor Imperva system alerts to insure proper archive of performance of infrastructure (backups, archive storage, etc…)
• Deploy patch’s updates as required and version upgrades as they are available
• Review and assess additional databases families for monitoring
• Perform data discovery scans and assist in streamlining data classification process
• Responsible for supporting the delivery of security solutions with a focus on data protection programs planning, policies and procedures development, data classification, data privacy, risk assessments, and implementation of programs and solutions
• Security generalist familiar with security and privacy frameworks, compliance requirements and security and privacy department planning and operations
• Ability to lead junior security analysts
• Conversant in basic project management principles and project quality methods
• Provides technical services for the support of integrated data loss prevention security systems and solutions
• Participates with the client in the strategic design process to translate security and business requirements into processes and systems
• Communicate with internal and external resources to ensure all polices meet compliance and security requirements for the customer.
• Perform technical configuration reviews and health assessments
• Provide assessment audit support during internal or external audits including Critical Practices, ISO, PCI and SSA 16
• Assist in developing metrics for the program depicting ROI and Risk Reduction
• Assist in Use case development for security monitoring policies
  • Job Description
    • Minimum of 5-8 year experience as a Data Security Analyst
    • Minimum of 2 year experience related to at least two of the following: risk assessments, security and privacy policy development, data protection or security strategy, general IT, data privacy and security controls development, compliance readiness (i.e. PCI, SOX, HIPPA, GLBA) or technical security architecture/design
    • Fundamental knowledge of Oracle, Teradata, Hadoop, SQL, stored procedures, scripts and reports
    • Demonstrates the ability to analyze and resolve issues independently
    • Knowledge of project management tasks, experience creating application documentation, and demonstrated ability to train other team members.
    • Knowledge of enterprise ETL tools, data warehouse support/reporting, and data export, import and integration experience is a plus.
    • Understanding of PCI requirements and support company’s annual PCI audit
    • Good data analyst skills, able to look through data to find patterns that could be used to further streamline
    • Manage maintenance, enhancements and upgrades for supported security systems using standard project methodology
    • Experience with Database monitoring tools like Imperva, Guardium etc is preferred
    • Bachelors Degree preferred
    • Preference for at least one current recognized security professional certification such as CISSP, CISM, CISA or ISO 27001 Lead Auditor
    • Additional Preferred Skill Requirements:
    • Experience in working in a highly dynamic large scale enterprise
    • Knowledge of security vendors and security product capabilities
    • Exposure to Data Protection solutions and technologies including - Data Loss Prevention (DLP), Data Masking/Tokenization, Data Classification, and Data Encryption
    Professional Skill Requirements:
    • Good organizational, multi-tasking, and time-management skills
    • Ability to successfully pass a client background screening if required
    • Proven ability to work independently and as a team member
    • Good communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills
    • Ability to work with multiple teams in a fast paced environment

description:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to share, and make the world more open and connected. Through our growing family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that helps billions of people around the world connect and share what matters most to them. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to make the world more open and accessible. Connecting the world takes every one of us—and we're just getting started. This position is responsible for the management of workplace planning, occupancy planning and analyses and strategic space projects for the Menlo Park Campus. The Workplace Planning Manager will report to the head of Space Planning and coordinate with other Planning/Facilities Managers to successfully deliver projects with minimum impact to employees or business operations. This includes management and coordination of all aspects of a space planning project: programming, design, estimating, resource allocations, logistics and schedule facilitation, budgeting and completion follow through. Partner and advisor to senior management and space contacts within business groups on all workplace planning activities.
Develops space options and business case proposals for complex space problems. Develop plans to accommodate staffing and other business requirements.
Partner with Workplace Data Analyst to develop and own business forecast, including headcount, to accurately track space needs that is supported by excellent data, trend analysis, possible outcomes.
Presents & negotiates with the business units to implement plans aligned with corporate guidelines, including scenarios to optimize use of space while meeting business requirements.
Responsible for integrity of the data in CAFM system related to occupancy, space utilization, allocation, space efficiency and vacancy. Identify goals and initiatives to continually improve occupancy accuracy and reporting.
Manages relocations including the development and execution of project planning activities, timing of group moves/relocations, migration and phasing plans, stack and block plans, architectural test-fits and relocations.
Develop occupancy analysis reporting to effectively communicate occupancy/vacancy ratios, headcount projections and workplace conditions.
Develop dashboards which includes headcount projections, capacity, vacancy, churn information, and space allocations in facilities.
Manage design direction and integrity for all HQ facilities, as well as selection of furniture standards.
This individual will engage in research, external benchmarking, and academic, vendor and industry affiliations to identify next generation standards that can be leveraged to enhance productivity and improve collaboration effectiveness.
Participates in the development & integration of space management tools & processes to improve efficiency. description:
The Enterprise Information Data Architect is responsible and accountable for application data architecture strategy, data architecture vision, and application data modeling across the Farmers enterprise. Primary responsibilities include developing application data architecture strategy, developing application data reference models, leading application data architecture software evaluations, and assessing impact of change to application data architectures, data models, and messaging models. This role also includes responsibility of architecture delivery and governance to ensure alignment to data architecture standards and vision. Solution architectures will include data models, standard interfaces for data access and value-added data services, metadata including an inventory of data, and follow best practices for data creation, usage, and messaging exchange.

  • Deep understanding of Enterprise Architecture principles, standards, and enterprise strategy development.
  • Ability to evaluate and assess existing legacy data assets with an eye on modernization and simplification.
  • Ability to build and articulate a data architecture and delivery roadmap indicating current, transition, and future state architectures, focused around clear benefits to both IT and business users.
  • Proven experience in architecture governance, controls, and peer reviews in regards to data, security, and cloud.
  • Experienced in developing architecture reference models for data governance and control.
  • Ability to lead software evaluations including RFP development, capabilities assessment, formal scoring models, and delivery of executive presentations supporting a final directional recommendation.
  • Ability to authentically and effectively communicate with various stakeholders across business and IT.
  • Responsible for creating design patterns and best practices for data and the integration of data through the enterprise.
  • Responsible for creating reference architecture, and roadmap necessary to hold architecture delivery to the level of quality.
  • Ability to understand and mitigate architecture risk and compromise
  • Expert knowledge and demonstrated abilities working in large, multi-million dollar Data architecture programs.
  • Proven ability to work with all levels within the IT and Business organization.
  • Experience in influencing executive business and IT leadership.
  • A self-motivated, directed, dynamic, positive, flexible, resourceful, and respectful individual.
  • Attention to detail and strong organization skills.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Well versed in the Data domains (Analytics, BI, Big Data, Operational Data Store, Metadata, Master Data, Unstructured Data).
  • Ability to design and develop Business Process Management workflows, spanning both orchestration and human task use cases.
  • Demonstrated expertise in message exchange patterns (synchronous request-reply, asynchronous fire-and-forget, broadcast-multi-cast, and publish-subscribe.)
  • Experienced in SOA, with a deep understanding of web services (XSDs, WSDLs) used within an Enterprise Service Bus.
  • Demonstrated expertise with transformation techniques, including but not limited to transformation, aggregation, decomposition, abstraction, and canonicalization.
  • Hands-on ability to build and manage enterprise canonical models, leveraging both industry and application specific service models.
  • Demonstrated expertise in defining and implementing distributed enterprise component-based architecture and frameworks to support abstraction.
  • Proven ability to work with various service transports and protocols (i.e. SOAP, HTTP, MQ, etc.).
  • Experience with Guidewire PolicyCenter or ClaimCenter is a plus.
  • Insurance industry experience is preferred.
  • Hands-on ability to build and manage enterprise data models, leveraging both industry and application specific service models.
  • Experience with unstructured or semi-structured data design and implementation.
  • Hands on experience with data profiling tools and processes.
  • Expert knowledge of normalized and dimensional modeling techniques.
  • 7-10+ years in similar role.
  • Guidewire experience (PolicyCenter, ClaimCenter, DataHub).
  • Insurance experience is preferred.
  • Prior working knowledge with Salesforce and Salesforce object model.
  • Certifications in Enterprise Architecture frameworks (i.e. TOGAF, Zachman, EABOK, EACOE, etc).
  • Insurance data model experience (i.e. IAA and Accord).
  • Canonical management tools (i.e. IgniteXML).
  • Experience with traditional data warehouse analyst, ETL developer, or BI / information delivery developer.
  • Experience with Oracle, DB2, SQL Server, MongoDb, Greenplum, MySQL, etc.
  • Data modeling, reverse-engineering, and profiling tools, e.g. ERwin, Embarcadero, Data Explorer, Data Flux.
  • 4 year degree. IT background or emphasis preferred.
  • 10+ years in technology, consulting background would be preferred.
  • Experience with any existing Cloud Service Provider (e.g. Amazon EC2, Google, or Microsoft Azure.
  • Possess at least seven years of experience in the position or a very similar related position.
  • Experience of both on premise and Cloud Integration frameworks (i.e. Oracle ESB, Message Broker, DataPower, Cast Iron, Boomi).
  • 5 years’ experience of solution design associated with data modeling, message modeling, and Integration.
  • Additional 3-5 years working in another role within an IT delivery team, such as a developer, business/data analyst, quality assurance analyst, ETL developer, DBA.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $175,000.00 /year

  • Enterprise Architect: 5 years

description:
Description

Intuit seeks a Staff Business Data Analyst that will be responsible to help define how we use data driven insights to transform customer experiences and ensure a consistent end-to-end customer experience across all services and channels. We are looking for an experienced analyst with excellent technical skills and analytical experience to lead decision support and insights for our Customer Care Analytics team.

Our goal is to champion a customer experience focused environment through data driven insights, drive best in class service delivery experience for our customers, and work with partners to deliver an easy experience that resolves customer issues and creates net promoters. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a team that analyzes experiments and continually iterates on customer and agent experiences. We strive to create an environment of innovation where team members are encouraged to experiment and test new ideas, learning from our successes and mistakes.

Responsibilities:
  • Responsible to understand the overall performance of the Customer Care assisted contact channels by analyzing current trends, understanding business drivers, and proactively delivering data driven recommendations
  • Manage team of analysts that are responsible to create forecasts, dashboards, and analysis of key performance indicators and strategic initiatives
  • Drive analytical approaches to diagnose the root cause of customer issues, including the development of voice of customer analytics… used to uncover trends and actionable insights to improve the product and customer experience
  • Create dashboards by pulling data from different sources; present analysis to the executive management team
  • Support strategic initiatives by creating learning plans, implement A/B tests, and partnering with cross-functional teams to build strategies for ongoing success
  • Partner with data engineering to ensure data is available and accurate. Manage priorities to help make new data sources available. Pursues data quality, troubleshoots data validation, and sees issues to resolution
  • Answer ad-hoc analytic questions and train users to self-serve standard reports leveraging Tableau

Qualifications
  • 7-10 years of experience in decision support analytics with proven ability to drive results and take on expanding responsibilities. Prior experience directly managing people is required
  • Deep subject matter expertise with SQL and Tableau
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills… able to develop and use structured approaches to identify root causes and recommend resolutions
  • Attention to detail with a high degree of accuracy on work output; ensures that reporting and analysis is on time and error free
  • Strong communication skills, both verbal and written… present results in meaningful terms and instills confidence in recommendations. Ability to manage interactions and influence effectively across a complex matrixed organization
  • Proven ability to build strong relationships with business partners to deliver results
  • Strong organization, time management and task prioritization skills
  • Proactive and inquisitive learner… seeks out and capitalizes on opportunities for change that enhance the business, rather than reacting to circumstances

title: RN - Quality Coordinator

description:
We are hospitals and affiliated medical groups, working closely together for the benefit of every person who comes to us for care. We build comprehensive networks of quality healthcare services that are designed to offer our patients highly coordinated, personalized care and help them live healthier lives. Through collaboration, we strive to provide all of our patients and medical group members with the quality, affordable healthcare they need and deserve.

The RN - Quality Coordinator is responsible for providing professional, administrative, and quality coordination support to the PMH CQPSO; facilitates an effective overall working relationship with management throughout the company and with external contacts. Supports the corporate quality and patient safety staff in assigned project based work, performs assignment planning and develops a tracking system to provide feedback on status. Tracks survey and event follow-up PI processes for the CQPSO and works with local quality and risk leadership to ensure on time completion of deliverables. Initiates and coordinate a variety of duties as they relate to the successful operations of the quality and patient safety program. Performs basic quality data collection, management and presentation functions under the direction of the Corporate CQPSO and Data Analyst.

Job Responsibilities/Duties
  • Manages calendars, schedules meetings, performs various typing, initiates correspondence, maintains files, makes travel arrangements, and other routine administrative work and minor business details.



  • Accurately populates performance data into dashboards, analytical reports, and presentations.



  • Track and trend survey and event activity across the company. Monitor action plans and measures of success for timely compliance.



  • Initiates and responds to informational requests, including policies, procedures, regulations, report preparation, and correct source for answers. Refers complex issues or those in need of policy interpretation to CQPSO or designee.



  • Monitors Quality and Patient Safety project management and strategic plan(s) deadlines to ensure compliance and provides follow-up with involved hospital leaders as needed.
Qualifications
  • Minimum Education : High School Diploma or equivalent. BS in related field.



  • Minimum Experience : Five (5) five years of progressive clerical, quality and/or performance improvement experience; or an equivalent amount of education and experience. Strong computer skills including working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite: Word, Excel and Powerpoint.



  • Req. Certification/Licensure



: Current CA RN License; CPHQ preferred. Employee Value Proposition Prospect Medical Holdings, Inc., is guided by a diverse and highly experienced leadership core. This group maintains the vision that has made Prospect a needed difference-maker in the lives of so many patients today, and many executives contribute to our continued efforts. description:
We are seeking a Business Intelligence Data Analyst to join our team to enhance the companys internal metadata competency. This individual will be responsible for the schema analysis, import and maintenance of Consumer Credit Solutions (CCS) metadata on the AbInitio hub .

This individual will be involved in multiple steps of analysis process (1) LOB business environment understanding (2) making sense of the import data (3) translating metadata into expanded AbInitio deployment (4) presenting metadata hub to business users. This may also include providing insights to update existing user guides, manuals.

Specific job functions include:
  • Work with business analysts, technical partners and business partners to develop analytical approaches that meet business requirements. This involves analyzing data, translating requests into AbInitio schema solutions and transforming results into actionable information.
  • Import metadata received from business analysts/resolve errors.
  • Completing ad-hoc research requests around metadata features.
  • Maintain user documentation, source library
Attend working meetings to discuss, resolve metadata implementation

The successful candidate will be on expert level AbInitio eco system knowledge, including expertise with AbInitio Graph development, Enterprise Meta data Environment (EME) maintenance and Data Quality Environment (DQE).

3. Assist teacher with preparation of instructional materials. 4. Tutor students individually or in small groups to reinforce classroom

learning activities. 5. Communicate with hearing impaired students using sign language; translate

verbal English to foreign language; communicate with parents. 6. Supervise students in the Resource Center. 7. Assist students with physical hygiene activities, such as feeding, dressings

and toileting. 8. Perform specialized health care procedures under direct supervision. 9. Attend Individual Educational Plan conferences and associated meetings. 10. Perform general clerical tasks for the classroom teacher associated with

student record keeping, preparation of class notices and grade reports, and correcting student work.

11. Maintain classroom discipline in absence of the teacher. 12. Assist therapists with special services. 13. Attend and participate with students’ field trips and community outings. 14. Push manual wheelchairs. Lift students out of wheelchairs and back in for

bathroom breaks and exercise sessions. 15. Instruct students concerning laboratory procedures and use of materials. 16. Assist students in workability visiting job sites.

description:
**************

In a nutshell:
**************

Creative Difference ( https://creativedifference.ideo.com/#/about ) is a new venture borne out of IDEO’s Design for Change studio. It is an enterprise tool used to assess an organization’s creative competencies in the areas of innovation, competitiveness, and adaptability. And, we are in search for a mid-level Software Engineer to manage relationships with our corporate clients and individual users of Creative Difference.

*************************************************
Why is this role important for IDEO’s work?
*************************************************

Our Design for Change studio’s Product Team, based out of our San Francisco office, is looking to scale up its engineering on the Creative Difference product team to streamline the product, iterate on features, and improve the customer experience. It is a small team with a big goal.

****************************

Once you are here, you will:
****************************

  • Build on existing codebase to implement new features, fix bugs, and extend the codebase
  • Work on full application stack: front-end marketing site, front-end user application, back-end API, administration, and data modeling and querying
  • Work with data analyst to help support their data needs
  • Work closely with product owner and team to uncover new customer needs, prioritize tasks, and implement and launch new features
  • Collaborate with other developers via code reviews and occasional pair programming
  • Collaborate with IDEO’s talented design team to help shape new features
*******************
Relevant Experience
*******************

Must Haves

  • 5+ years experience working on production quality software in a team environment
  • 3+ years experience working on production quality Ruby on Rails apps
  • Fluency and comfort working with Javascript and Angular
  • Fluency and comfort working with databases (data modeling, SQL, optimization)
  • Fluency and comfort with automated testing (we use Rspec + Capybara)
  • Fluency and comfort working with Git
  • A passion for readable, extensible, beautiful code.
Above and Beyond

  • BS / MS in computer science or related engineering field
  • Diving in, understanding, and building on existing codebases is easy
  • Taking user feedback, synthesizing user needs, and bringing them to a feature list, design, and implementation is second nature
  • Interest in Big Data technologies - Hadoop, Apache Spark, MADLib, etc
  • Going from coding to a brainstorm then diving back into code is the perfect day
  • Contributing to great visual design alongside world-class designers sounds blissful
  • You’re excited to be at IDEO, learn more about Design Thinking, and work amongst super creative people
*************************
What does IDEO offer you?
*************************

IDEO is a place unlike any other. It’s a place where you can solve diverse, complex challenges for our clients or the organization, alongside thoughtful, intelligent individuals who lead with curiosity, empathy, and optimism. Sure we work hard, but we also intentionally craft moments that allow our community to pause, create, and connect. We encourage our community to bring their whole selves to work, respect the need for work-life balance, and allow for autonomy in the design process and your career.

IDEO San Francisco’s Design for Change Studio focuses on helping organizations adapt to and drive change. At times we’re redesigning the employee and customer experience, other times we’re helping to build innovation engines within organizations, and sometimes even unifying large companies with a common purpose.

***************************

Check out some of our work:
***************************

  • Creative Difference ( https://creativedifference.ideo.com/ )- We designed a tool to assess an organization's creative competitiveness.
  • IDEO U ( http://www.ideou.com/ ): An online school where anyone can unlock their creative potential through design thinking and collaboration
  • OI Engine ( http://oiengine.com/ ): An innovation software product, helping organizations engage their people and networks in creative problem-solving online
  • Intercorp ( https://www.ideo.com/case-study/launching-an-innovation-lab-to-benefit-peruvians ): Launching an innovation lab to benefit Peruvians
  • Team Rubicon ( https://www.ideo.com/case-study/designing-a-global-plan-for-disaster-response ): Designing a Global plan for disaster response

Job Description:
You will be part of a small and talented Data Analytics team. Data Analytics team is responsible for providing Analytics Intelligence solutions for the entire organization. As a senior member of Data Analytics group, you will be responsible for working directly with Business Users and creating reports/dashboards and performing ad-hoc analysis on business problems that provide actionable insights. We are also working on creating our Big data pipeline to feed data in our Data Lake using Apache Spark and querying it using PrestoDB, so you will get a chance to work on the new Open Source Analytics technologies.

Key Responsibilities
Passionate about learning Business Key Metrics and doing an analysis to find trends and drivers.
Analyzes requirements, designs and develops business intelligence applications to meet business needs.
Participates in Business Metrics discussion sessions; works together with users to find the best possible solution to a given business problem.
Supports business users on answering complex business questions via MicroStrategy and ad-hoc SQL queries.
Architecting, Designing and Delivering Analytical solutions(analysis, reports or Dashboards) from end to end
Troubleshoots technical issues at all levels.
Well conversant with current BI products and tools and have means to solve any issues
Relationship building with key business stakeholder
Contribute to data aggregation strategy for reporting, dashboards, and self-service analytics

Requirements:
Ability to lead your own projects → Identifying User Requirements to writing ETL scripts to aggregate the data to creating dashboards/reports.
Two (2) or more years of experience as a business or data analyst
Experience with business intelligence solutions, such as MicroStrategy or Tableau
Advanced data visualization and SQL skills
Experience working directly with business users to build reports, dashboards and solving business questions with data.
Demonstration of strong performance and growth in prior roles and academics
Strong organizational skills, excellent written and oral communication skills
Ability to clearly communicate reasoning and rationale for feature prioritization and tradeoffs
Ability to create shell scripts, and programming experience with Python, Perl or Ruby is a plus
BS/BA, in Computer Science area, MS in Computer Science is a plus

description:
What you’ll be doing:
We are looking for a Data Scientist who has sound business understanding, data handling, programming and data visualization skills to formulate the questions that will help business identify and overcome operational challenges using KPI’s.

As a Data Scientist you will be expected to create business insights from the available data. You should be confident in your ability to structure the data in a useful manner, mine it, and make relevant assumptions, build correlation models, prove causality, and search the data for signs of anything that can deliver a positive business impact.

Work with the application teams to source data, transform the data for analysis and compute usable insights from data.

Ability to create statistical models and data system programming as required.

Understanding of structured SQL and / or other BI tools/packages.

Understand partner business objectives and provide actionable analytic insights on topics like:

  • consumer behavior and purchase patterns.
  • sales force alignments, targeting, call reporting, sampling, performance measurement, sales reporting and incentive compensation.
Establish key performance indicators and analyze metrics to identify root causes behind shifts in performance.

Conduct extensive analysis on partner performance trends and provide insight into growth opportunities; synthesizing diverse, complex information to develop a story with data and insights.

Monitor performance of business goals and communicate status through visual analytics.

Proactively identify new analytic techniques to develop differentiated analytic solutions to drive results.

Establish and maintain relationships with key client decision makers.

Write queries and perform other duties as assigned.

Analyze sales trends, performs market assessments and prepares ad hoc data analyses as needed.

Develop, implements, and maintains sales reporting and performance measurement systems for sales team.

Supports promotion arrangements and related activities.

Develop, implements, and maintains sales reporting and performance measurement systems for sales team.

Supports promotion arrangements and related activities.

What you need for this role:
Bachelor's Degree in a related field: statistics, decision sciences, economics, predictive analytics, engineering or other quantitative fields or five (5) years of experience in a related data analytics discipline.

5+ years experience managing databases, providing timely user support, and writing reports, or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Ability to perform complex statistical reporting, including skill in composing logical, detailed, and analytical reports

Experience using the following platforms: Hadoop, Hive, Azure Cloud, Power BI, SAP, Salesforce, and SQL

Experience using BusinessObjects for developing and maintaining business intelligence and complex analytic reports.

Strong interpersonal, organizational, and time management skills.

Proficiency with Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, and Microsoft Excel (Pivot Tables, VLookups)

Medical or regulated industry experience is a plus.

Coding experience preferred

Ability to create and deliver presentations to technical and non-technical audiences.

Ability to quickly learn new data models and functions.

An understanding of the difference between correlation and causation.

What’s in it for you:
Competitive pay and great benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401k and more

Opportunities for growth and training

Stability of a profitable 60+ year old company

Great work environment

About Bio-Rad:
Bio-Rad is a global leader providing a broad array of clinical diagnostics and life science research products. With a team of more than 7,800 employees and a global network of operations serving our customers, we help people live longer, healthier lives.

Bio-Rad was founded over six decades ago and has continued to provide the healthcare industry with innovative and useful products that help life science researchers accelerate the discovery process and medical diagnostic labs obtain faster, better results.
