description:
This position is located in Serra Mesa, CA (San Diego County)

Hours
8-hour day shift, variable hours: primarily 8:00 am - 4:30 pm, but hours may vary to meet business needs. No weekends.

Required Skills and Qualifications
  • Baccalaureate degree in appropriate health-related field
  • Current CA license appropriate to requirements of position - for this position unencumbered CA Registered Nurse licensure required
  • 3-5 years of clinical experience in healthcare and leadership experience
  • Previous operational acute care experience
  • Leadership experience that promotes collaborative teamwork
  • Ability to effectively work with Sharp management, staff, physicians; to communicate clearly, concisely and accurately with people verbally and in writing; to achieve results for the organization and the project with and through people; to practice good time management; to demonstrate good leadership and project management skills
  • Ability to successfully manage multiple project work teams using applied principles of project and team management
  • Knowledge and experience in utilization of change management theory and practice
  • Strong quantitative, analytical and process redesign skills, along with project management skills will be essential components of this role
  • Knowledge and understanding of principles of healthcare risk management
  • Current knowledge of Joint Commission, state and federal regulatory agency requirements, standards and regulations, particularly those related to Performance Improvement
  • Knowledge of general principles of quality improvement, infection control, safety, corporate compliance and HIPAA
  • Intermediate computer skills, including knowledge regarding a variety of computer software applications, including relational database, MS Office, PowerPoint, Cerner, Excel, statistics and clinical information systems
  • Ability to perform statistical analysis on a variety of data types from a variety of data sources
  • Ability to effectively interact, in oral and written forms, with medical and hospital staff, as well as patients, families, visitors, attorneys and the community at large
  • Maintains confidentiality of quality improvement department information (refer to quality confidentiality agreement)

Preferred Skills and Qualifications
  • Previous case review and Performance Improvement experience strongly desired
  • BSN degree strongly preferred
  • Masters degree
  • Certified Professional in Healthcare Quality (CPHQ)
  • Current BLS certification for HealthCare Providers
  • Trained in Lean Six Sigma

Description

Summary
This Senior Specialist - Performance Improvement position is within the high profile Quality & Patient Safety department supporting the entities of the Sharp Metropolitan Medical Campus. Responsibilities include but are not limited to: managing performance improvement projects using Define, Measure, Analyze, Improve, Control (DMAIC) and applicable lean six sigma tools, managing the peer review process for assigned medical specialties, conducting comprehensive case review for opportunities for improvement and partnering with appropriate clinical and administrative colleagues to drive change. The successful candidate will be able to apply ‘lean’ principles to project management, select appropriate metrics for projects and analyze data to ensure accurate measurement of causes and effects.

The Quality & Patient Safety Department is instrumental in improving clinical quality, reducing patient harm through a comprehensive patient safety program and fostering a culture of safety. The department is made up of staff members consisting of: Decision Support Analysts, Sr. Specialists, Admin/Data Analyst; with various skill sets from data mining, to conducting root cause analysis and being involved in process improvement. The clients served encompass all of Sharp Metropolitan Medical Campus which includes: Sharp Mary Birch Hospital for Women & Newborns, Sharp Memorial Hospital, Sharp Memorial Outpatient Pavilion, Sharp Mesa Vista, and Sharp McDonald Center.

Sharp Memorial Hospital — the first hospital in San Diego with all private patient rooms — is dedicated to providing the highest-quality, patient-centered care and consists of 368 beds . Designed to promote comfort and healing with the use of natural light and soothing colors, the hospital offers the latest medical technology and is home to San Diego’s largest, most modern Emergency and Trauma Center.
Sharp Memorial is known for outstanding programs in cardiac and vascular care, cancer treatment, orthopedic and neurological services, rehabilitation, robotic surgery and multi-organ transplantation, and has been recognized as a MAGNET®-designated hospital for nursing excellence and is also designated as a Patient-Centered Hospital by Planetree, an organization committed to personalizing, humanizing, and demystifying the hospital experience for patients and their families.

Essential Physical Requirements of the position may be discussed during the interview.

description:
Tanko Lighting is looking for a rock star. Our professional services team needs someone who can translate data and organize details to ensure streamlined implementation of municipal LED street light conversion projects. If you consider yourself an independent and hard worker, Excel/Access/Arc GIS proficient, well-rounded with solid people skills, a collaborator, and most importantly are passionate about doing ethically sound, high-value work within the energy efficiency world, we'd love to hear from you.

Tanko Lighting helps municipalities convert their aging street lighting infrastructure to energy efficient LED technology. We provide a turn-key solution that offers comprehensive project management services, including infrastructure audit, project design, procurement, construction management, and commissioning. We are a growing company looking for team members to help deliver superior consulting services to our clients nationwide.

What you can expect from us:

- Your hard work will always be appreciated and acknowledged

- A comfortable work environment where people ACTUALLY enjoy working together

- Competitive salaries and a structure that compensates for a job well done

- A solid team of people who have a sincere interest in seeing you, and the company as a whole, succeed

- A proper set of priorities: People. Planet. Profit.

Tanko Lighting is an equal opportunity employer and affords equal opportunity to all applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other status protected under local, state or federal laws. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. To learn more about what we do and why we do it, see our website: www.tankolighting.com

Job Summary: This salaried position supports the company's turn-key lighting projects in its professional services division. The position provides analysis, research, data coordination and project management support for business development and project implementation.

Summary of essential job functions:

Works closely with the project manager and data team to coordinate project implementation from beginning to end

Develops detailed analyses on life cycle costs, energy efficiency savings, cash flows, and cost benefits of comprehensive street light replacement projects

Assists with project planning and strategy

Trains and manages field staff on data collection efforts

Coordinates with data analyst to create client-facing reports

Supports material procurement and invoicing, requiring detailed project tracking

Coordinates with utilities to secure rebates and rate changes for new LED fixtures

Conducts on-site commissioning as needed

Provides administrative support for reporting requirements, proposal and presentation development, production schedule management, and preparation of deliverables

Other duties as requested

Minimum Requirements:

Bachelors degree in Environmental/Sustainability Management, Engineering, Information Systems, Science, Business Management or other relevant field

Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, demonstrated experience managing data in Excel

Superior organizational skills and attention to detail

Excellent interpersonal and communication skills

Proven analytical skills

Background in sustainability and/or energy efficiency preferred

Project management experience preferred

Experience with ArcGIS software a plus

Available immediately to start

Job Type: Full-time

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • Project Coordination: 1 year

Required license or certification:

  • Driver's License

description:
With a nationwide sales team and several manufacturing locations, B. Braun Medical has become a leading full-line supplier of healthcare products and services in the U.S. The company is committed to delivering innovative products and services with unmatched quality, superior technology, and cost-effectiveness, while maintaining environmental responsibility. Through its "Sharing Expertise®" initiative, B. Braun promotes best practices for continuous improvement of healthcare products and services. B. Braun employs over 4,500 people in the USA. B. Braun Medical Inc. began its operations in the USA in 1957. Initially, the company manufactured and sold disposable plastic syringes. During the 1980s and early 1990s, the company undertook several expansions and enlarged its product line of disposable medical devices. With the acquisition of McGaw, Inc. in 1997, including Central Admixture Pharmacy Services, Inc. (CAPS®), B. Braun dramatically broadened its product lines and services to U.S. customers.

U.S. Facilities and Operations:

Supporting product sales are a network of nationwide marketing and manufacturing locations. Bethlehem, Pennsylvania, is home to the U.S. Corporate Headquarters along with the marketing offices of the Hospital, Outpatient Markets (OPM), Renal Therapies, Vascular Interventional, International, and OEM Divisions. Central Admixture Pharmacy Services, Inc.(CAPS®) is also managed from this location. The nearby Allentown, Pennsylvania, facility manufactures Needle-free products, IV Safety Catheters, Anesthesia Systems, Introducers, Pharmacy Admixture products. Vascular products including Right Heart Catheters and Interventional Accessories are also manufactured in Allentown. The Irvine, California facility produces IV Solutions, Basic and Specialty Nutrition, Drug Delivery, and BTC products. Infusion Pump Systems are manufactured in Carrollton, Texas and IV administration and IV and Irrigation sets are produced in the Dominican Republic.

Responsibilities: Position Summary:

This Quality position supports a pharmaceutical manufacturing environment through the application of various statistical procedures, methods, and tools. The position will interact with production, engineering, quality and other technical personnel in support of pharmaceutical manufacturing problem solving. It is expected that the incumbent will participate in numerous technical teams as well as serve as an internal consultant relative to statistical approaches to problem solving. In addition, analyses of data and generation of reports to support technical decisions will be required. Use of Statistical programming, Statistical Modeling, and Statistical Tools (i.e. SAS programming, MiniTab, Base SAS/STAT, Excel, and ASCII) will be required.

Responsibilities: Essential Duties
  • Collects and analyzes pharmaceutical manufacturing data via appropriate statistical methods.
  • Performs statistical analyses to drive to decisions to address technical problems.
  • Supports various production, engineering, quality, and technical teams in the evaluation of data; looks for variation trends and helps to establish appropriate control, alert, and action limits.
  • Provides support to pharmaceutical product stability by evaluating product degradation trends and confidence limits.
  • Participates in multi-functional teams as a consultant in developing statistical approaches to solved technical problems.
  • Provides training to fellow associates in basic statistical principles. May be required to present data/information to technical peers and company management.
  • Recommends data management and evaluation approaches to aid in continuous
Expertise: Knowledge & Skills
  • 5 years working in medical devices, biotech/pharmaceutical Industry experience
  • Expertise in statistical principles, methods, and procedures and the ability to instruct others in these areas
  • Demonstrated ability to apply statistical tools and models to help solve manufacturing variability issues
  • Knowledge of statistical sampling practices
  • Previous experience in application of statistical models to predict product long term stability
  • Ability to create novel statistical techniques as needed and to demonstrate the mathematical validity of these techniques
  • Ability to read, analyze, and interpret the most complex documents
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to make effective and persuasive presentations on complex topics to management
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • High degree of initiative and self-motivation
  • Demonstrated ability to identify and adapt to shifting priorities and competing demands
  • Strong attention to detail and accuracy
  • Strong time management and prioritization skills for management of multiple projects
  • Ability to work effectively independently and within teams
  • Strong organization skills
  • Organizational savvy, ability to navigate/network within a large organization

Qualifications: Expertise: Qualifications - Experience/Training/Education/Etc

Required:
  • Bachelor’s degree with 7 years’ of experience in Manufacturing Operations data analyst role, or Master’s degree with 5 years’ of experience in Manufacturing Operations data analyst role, or Ph.D. degree with 2 years of experience in Manufacturing Operations data analyst role.
  • Willing to work flexible hours.
  • Ability to travel up to 5%.
Desired:
  • Experience in Health Care Industry Manufacturing strongly preferred.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to use hands to handle or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 pounds.

Braun offers an excellent benefits package, which includes healthcare, a 401(k) plan, and tuition reimbursement. To learn more about B. Braun and our safety healthcare products or view a listing of our employment opportunities, please visit us on the internet at www.bbraunusa.com Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities /Women/ Veterans/Disabled

Through its “Sharing Expertise®” initiative, B. Braun promotes best practices for continuous improvement of healthcare products and services.

description:
Under general supervision, the FWA and Privacy Compliance Analyst helps to ensure that HPSJ and its provider network are compliant with all program contractual, state and federal regulatory requirements. Performs compliance program activities, including but not limited to coordination of timely/accurate submission and tracking of required report deliverables; and review and disposition of fraud, waste and abuse (FWA) case referrals and FWA detection and prevention activities in connection with FWA. Work is varied and moderately complex, and requires a moderate degree of discretion and independent judgment.

Supervises None.

Essential Functions
  • Develops, maintains and updates master list of deliverables for required reports, materials and other items that are requested by regulators or that require regulatory approval.
  • Monitors due dates and sends reminders to stakeholders; provides guidance and/or clarification on required report data elements and formats as needed; escalates as required.
  • Compiles deliverables, obtains appropriate approvals and submits deliverables according to timelines.
  • Supports auditing and monitoring activity including but not limited to annual mock reviews, reviews conducted by regulators, and targeted audits to confirm compliance with contracts provisions and state or federal guidelines.
  • Refers suspected FWA and Privacy incidents to appropriate agency; develops, maintains and monitors referrals and their outcomes.
  • Reviews results of claims, clinical analysis and provider data, gathering additional data as necessary; analyzes and interprets to identify suspected FWA; translates findings into reports, charts and/or graphs for further action and/or research.
  • Coordinates tracking, reporting and analysis of cases (i) accepted for payment and (ii) not accepted for payment by the FWA Vendor for Compliance Committee and Compliance Officer.
  • Assists with development of financial reporting to track and report outcome of FWA vendor claims review for Compliance Committee and Compliance Officer.
  • Coordinates quarterly FWA meetings, webinars and other events; takes minutes as required; compiles, monitors and follows-up on action plans, with assistance from others, as needed.
  • Conducts in person ad hoc and scheduled training on FWA and privacy activities and reporting resources; assists in the review and update of annual all employee FWA and Privacy training; sends periodic FWA and Privacy communications to staff.
  • Creates, maintains and updates FWA language for inclusion in materials such as Member Newsletter, Member Handbook, Provider Manual and provider communications.
  • Coordinates the incident reporting and management process; monitors and documents progress and outcomes; escalates areas of non-compliance to management as required.
  • Coordinates reviews of reported privacy incidents, including completion of breach investigations to regulatory agencies.
  • Assists in policy and procedure and desktop development and updates, including coordinating design, review, approval, cataloging and dissemination; maintains the compliance software program by ensuring the contents are updated accurately and on a timely basis.
  • Serves as a backup point person in coordinating communications or requests for Compliance Officer and/or Compliance Director from State or Federal FWA entities, such as DHCS.

Required Skills
  • Strong knowledge of health care operations, including managed care, as they relate to compliance.
  • Strong knowledge of HIPAA privacy regulations and rules, and FWA programs.
  • Strong knowledge of: procedure coding and medical terminology, and their application in benefits; general medical policy benefits and exclusions; industry standard payment practices
  • Strong knowledge of applicable federal and state laws, regulations and standards, including those related to member privacy and/or claims submissions (i.e., False Claims Act, Medi-Cal, DMHC).
  • Basic knowledge of standard contract components and contract language.
  • Strong research skills with the ability to identify and review complex materials to develop and evaluate options and propose solutions.
  • Strong skills in data identification, integration, validation, manipulation, interpretation and reporting.
  • Strong problem-solving skills.
  • Strong knowledge of audit, control and monitoring processes, and the ability to effectively implement and maintain them.
  • Strong organizational skills, with the ability to effectively manage multiple priorities.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with individuals at all levels inside and outside of HPSJ.
  • Strong oral and written communication skills with the ability to communicate professionally, effectively and persuasively to diverse individuals and groups inside and outside of HPSJ; includes the ability to effectively explain complex information.
  • Strong presentation skills, including the ability to tailor presentations to a specific audience, and address and interact with large groups.
  • Strong customer service skills.
  • Basic mathematics skills.
  • Basic skills in reporting software, such as Tableau, with ability to present data in consumable formats such as charts and graphs.
  • Intermediate Word, Excel and Power Point skills.
  • Ability to speak and be understood in English.
  • Ability to handle confidential information with appropriate discretion

Required Experience
  • Bachelor’s Degree; and
  • At least three years of managed care compliance experience; and
  • At least two years of experience as a data analyst in a Medi-Cal managed care plan; and
  • At least three years of experience reading, analyzing and interpreting State and federal laws, rules and regulations; or
  • Equivalent combination of education and experience.

Licenses, Certifications

Required
  • Certified in Health Care Compliance

description:
ServiceNow is changing the way people work. With a service-orientation toward the activities, tasks and processes that make up day-to-day work life, we help the modern enterprise operate faster and be more scalable than ever before.
If you thought you knew about ServiceNow and what we do, take a look again!
Our products lines are diverse and robust. The Enterprise Cloud is dynamic, scalable to billions of transactions weekly, and global in scope and size.

As a part of the core Platform as a Service offering, the Intelligent Automation Development team is building the core machine learning/AI/predictive analytics technology that will power revenue generating business use-cases using customer data to predict desired outcomes automatically; hence delivering a manifold increase in productivity of business processes of ServiceNow customers. The team focuses on operationalizing machine learning and predictive analytics use cases for all ServiceNow business applications.

We employ only the brightest and most forward-thinking predictive analytics developers on the planet. We have offices in San Diego, San Francisco and Santa Clara and work as a distributed team. Come join the Intelligent Automation team and make your mark in the most challenging problem area - helping customer derive the insights from their own data on ServiceNow platform for enterprise applications, each customer at a time!

What you get to do in this role:


Design, implement, test, deliver and support ServiceNow's internal predictive analytics engine as a part of the overall Platform-as-a-Service offering. Specifically, you will learn and work on:
  • Understand the business needs of Platform BU's customers
  • Translate the needs into data requirements
  • Design, code and test features that enhances the DxC engine to solve new business use cases
  • Support, fix bugs, improve performance, work with operations to make the engine self reliant
  • Develop innovative patentable ideas that ensures the competitiveness of this product within the domain of similar work being done in the industry
  • Deliver key asks from internal constituents
  • Visualize key statistical concepts of underlying models and its performance

In order to be successful in this role, we need someone who has:
  • Passion for software development and problem-solving
  • Java and Statistical Library programming skills a must
  • Experience with scripting languages (ruby, javascript, bash)
  • Exceptional debugging, testing, and problem solving skills
  • Understanding of statistical libraries, algorithms and concepts
  • Self-starter, with quick learning curve
  • Strong written and verbal communication
  • Hands on programmer, not a data analyst
  • Has the ability to extend existing libraries to solve specific operational problems that manifests based on data distribution, and usage.

We provide competitive compensation, generous benefits and a professional atmosphere. This is a very collaborative and inclusive work environment where individuals strong on aptitude and attitude will have an opportunity to grow their professional careers through working with some of the most advanced technology and talented developers in the business.

description:
A fast-growing digital agency is looking for a Senior Data Analyst to play an integral role on their analytics team in San Francisco. This is an exciting time to join an industry leader that has an established presence at the forefront of digital innovation. This analytically-driven agency fosters top talent and expects the Senior Data Analyst to embody their world class client service and digital expertise. The ideal candidate is someone with prior team management experience and is comfortable in a client-facing role. Your strategic approach to utilizing various statistical models and analytical tools to analyze large data sets paired with your entrepreneurial spirit will enable you to thrive here!

Responsibilities
  • Gain an in-depth understanding of client goals and objectives for campaigns
  • Identify key indicators of success in terms of campaign performance
  • Stay abreast of industry trends, technologies, and tools to ensure that the agency is providing competitive service to clients
  • Conduct statistical modeling and utilize Big Data tools for forecasting
  • Facilitate the integration of data sets and campaign reporting techniques
  • Participate in the hiring and onboarding process for new analytics team hires
  • Foster a positive team environment that encourages professional growth

Qualifications
  • Minimum of 4 years of digital analytics experience within media, marketing, or related
  • Exposure to mobile marketing is a plus!
  • Strong ability to interpret data and provide POV recommendations based on campaign performance and results
  • Prior experience with SQL, SAS, R, Oracle, Linux, Hadoop, Hive, Cloudera
  • Mathematically and analytically inclined
  • Refined project management and team management skills
  • Stellar communication and presentation skills
  • Bachelor’s Degree

description:
Thumbtack is a local services marketplace that connects customers with the right professionals for anything they need done. Every day we rally around the impact Thumbtack has on people’s lives — helping people plan their perfect wedding, families improve their homes, and small businesses grow and thrive. Thumbtack today has 1,100+ types of services, millions of customer requests, and hundreds of thousands of paying professionals. Join our growing team in the quest to build THE destination for anything you need done.

If interested, please submit a cover letter, resume and 3-5 links to sample stories you have worked on that are representative of your editing and/or writing skills.

------------------------
About the Editorial Team
------------------------

The editorial team is 110% focused on building brand awareness with beautiful, inspirational, data-driven trends content. We field surveys, analyze our marketplace, and engage customers and pros to tell interesting stories about Thumbtack and our marketplace.

--------------
About the Role
--------------

Thumbtack is looking for an Associate Editor to join our editorial team to produce and edit regular articles, in-depth reports and other engaging and creative consumer-facing content. If you love creating content in a variety of formats across a wide range of lifestyle subjects, this is your dream job.

We’re looking for an experienced editor with at least 2-5 years of experience writing, assigning and editing articles across a variety of lifestyle topics including home improvement, interior design, wellness, weddings, and more. The right candidate is a strong writer and editor who can work with freelance writers to create compelling copy and can manage multiple editorial projects at a time. The ideal candidate is also a fountain of ideas for packaging stories, finding angles in our unique marketplace data for articles and someone who thinks strategically about storytelling. Experience and interest in telling stories with data and trends is a strong plus.

----------------
Responsibilities
----------------

  • Research and write or edit multiple articles each week
  • Develop, assign and edit articles at scale with freelance and contract writers
  • Develop and pitch story ideas that leverage Thumbtack’s unique customer and marketplace trend data
  • Work with data analyst team and economists to analyze data in our marketplace for compelling trends stories
  • Interview Thumbtack service providers and consumers for articles
  • Project manage multiple editorial projects at a time across channels
  • Work with the creative team on design and photo needs for articles
  • Collaborate with other team members on daily content as well as larger projects
  • Contribute to audience and traffic growth through social media, writing newsletter email copy and other marketing activities
------------------------
Must-Have Qualifications
------------------------

  • At least 2-5 years of experience in writing/reporting/editing/blogging, online publishing and/or magazines or related field (required)
  • Strong interest in and grasp of consumer trends and content in a variety of areas including home, wellness, and lifestyle media
  • Ability to turn around accurate and engaging copy while meeting deadlines
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced startup environment and handle multiple projects simultaneously
  • Energetic, proactive person who has the ability to both work independently and collaborate with others
  • Basic CMS/WordPress/HTML and some Photoshop skills strongly preferred
  • Bachelor’s degree or higher
---------------------------
Nice-to-Have Qualifications
---------------------------

  • Experience managing a team of freelancers, project management and data visualization a strong plus
-------------
More About Us

-------------

Thumbtack is the destination for getting things done—from house remodeling to event planning to music lessons and more. Each year, more than 200,000 professionals across the country service a growing 5 million Thumbtack projects in 1,100+ unique categories. Founded in 2009 and headquartered in San Francisco, Thumbtack has raised more than $275 million from Sequoia Capital, Tiger Global Management, Javelin Investment Partners, Baillie Gifford, and Google Capital.

  • Learn more about our culture, benefits, and perks ( http://thumbtack.com/jobs )
  • Follow Thumbtack on LinkedIn ( https://www.linkedin.com/company/thumbtack-inc. )
Thumbtack embraces diversity. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and do not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, citizenship, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

title: Administrative Assistant

description:
The Clinical Data Analyst supports the reporting needs of the Children’s Oncology Group ( COG ) in the study of new treatments and cures for childhood cancer. Under the supervision of the Associate Director of Research Operations, the Clinical Data Analyst will work with multidisciplinary staff to understand the needs of the organization and create report datasets from multiple relational databases for the purposes of NIH reporting requirements, clinical trial data monitoring, sample acquisition tracking, reimbursement credit, and other reports based on the needs of the project. S/he is responsible for coordinating with Statisticians, Disease Committees, operations staff, and biobank staff to set up and monitor systems for standard tracking and reporting of clinical trial and specimen acquisition data. Assignments require basic knowledge of SQL code, SAS and Advanced Query Tool ( AQT ) software, and the ability to understand clinical trial data and research specimen characteristics.

Duties & Responsibilities:
  • Work with multidisciplinary staff to understand the reporting needs of COG in order to assist in the aims of various projects including NCORP , QuadW, and Developmental Therapeutics
  • Create report datasets from relational databases
  • Understand and use databases for patient registry, clinical trial data, sample inventory, and institutional membership
  • Present and summarize study and inventory data in ways that are understandable and useful to COG operations staff, clinical investigators and senior statisticians.
  • Understand the goals of assigned projects and how data reporting contributes to these goals
  • Propose reports that will support project goals
  • Perform other duties as required
  • Travel may be required for up to 2 working weeks per year

Qualifications:
  • Applicants should possess a Bachelor’s degree in related field. Master’s preferred.
  • 5 years of related experience
  • Understanding of databases, data relationships, quality, and integrity
  • High level of PC literacy, including intermediate to advanced knowledge of Excel
  • High level of basic scripting ( SQL ) and familiarity with SAS , AQT and data reporting using relational databases
  • Understanding of clinical data desirable
  • Training or experience in biological or medical sciences is desirable
  • Must have collaborative and problem-solving skills
  • Must have good written and oral communications

Compensation:

This is an exempt position and the salary is commensurate with experience. PHI offers a generous benefits package including medical, dental, vision, short/long term disability insurance, life insurance, 403b (group retirement annuity) and partial subsidy of public transportation cost.

description:
Pacific Partners Management Services (PPMSI) is a managed services organization formed in 1997 with administrative offices located in Foster City, CA. We provide services to IPAs in the Santa Clara and Monterey Bay areas. Our managed care and ACO services support approximately 1,000 independent physicians and include executive management, full financial services, utilization management, quality improvement, credentialing, contracting, claims processing and provider and member network services.

PPMSI is part of HCA Physician Services Group (PSG), the physician and practice management solution for the Hospital Corporation of America (HCA). PSG operates more than 750 practices, Urgent Care Facilities, and partners with HCA’s 165 hospitals to structure employed provider programs, professional service agreements, and joint ventures that offer the communities we serve high quality, cost effective care. We manage a collection of highly motivated and innovative leaders who are committed to excellence in every aspect of their career.

We offer an excellent benefits package, competitive salary and growth opportunities. Join our team and share your skills and talents with the nation’s largest private provider of healthcare services.

Reporting to the CFO, the Senior Financial and Data Analyst performs detailed accounting functions, financial analysis, and provides various general accounting services for the financial operations of the organization. Ensure adequate internal controls exist for all accounting functions, with documented policies and procedures. Reconcile accounts, prepare budgets, maintain budget to actual reports and support CFO with related accounting duties.

The Senior Financial and Data Analyst is responsible for managing the data extraction, quality assurance, documentation, and reporting needs for the ACO program. This position works with internal teams as well as external partners to determine appropriate sources of data, extract data according to specifications, modify data elements based on audit findings and as needed for reporting a variety of program metrics including utilization, clinical quality, patient-reported outcomes, and patient experience.

The Senior Financial and Data Analyst supports the ACO Division in analyzing and benchmarking performance results to assist in quality improvement and feedback reporting. This position works with the ACO team to develop programs designed to implement interventions which will subsequently prevent unnecessary admissions, readmissions and overutilization; to meet the Triple Aim of better care, better health, and lower cost.

Additional Duties Include:
Responsible for monthly financial cycle performing account reconciliations, variance analysis, and financial statement variance analysis. Ensures accounting processes are completely in a timely manner while ensuring adequate internal controls are maintained.

Responsible for various healthplan processes including detailed analysis of capitation revenue, expense, fee for service claims expense, membership and IBNR. Responsible to monitor receipt, reconciliation, and analysis of above processes per each healthplan contract.

Responsible to manage the annual budget development and consolidation of departmental and company budgets for actual to budget analysis.

Prepares budget to actual variance reports and analyzes variances for each company and department.

Produce standard and ad-hoc reporting to analyze trends for the statement of operations and the balance sheet.

Participate in the preparation of audit schedules and prepare other required backup for annual and regulatory audits.

Identify and implement process improvements with emphasis on streamlining processes, budget load and cash management.

Filing and maintenance of financial and corporate documents in compliance with legal requirements.

Provide a high level of customer service within finance and to other business partners in conjunction with strong written and verbal communication skills.

Manage data extraction, documentation and quality review of all ACO program data.

Develop tools and methods of identifying high risk patients using payor information as well as in-house analysis.

Work with the PPMSI Infrastructure Applications team to define a methodology for integrating ACO data into the existing data warehouse.

Work with the PPMSI Infrastructure Applications team integrate ACO data into existing production applications.

Conduct quality assurance of produced datasets; undertake corrective action to address data issues identified upon data mapping or data quality audits.

Write and maintain project documentation and technical specifications.

Develop and manipulate databases on an ad hoc basis to support integration of data into the existing data warehouse.

Conduct and interpret analyses and generate reports.

Track and evaluate patterns of care and outcomes.

Identify and develop solutions to address potential data gaps.

Maintain data security processes and ensure HIPAA data security and privacy requirements are met.

Communicate project details in writing and verbally to collaborating organizations and other stakeholders.

Qualifications

Education and Experience:
Bachelor Degree (B.A.) from four-year college or university.

At least 5 years’ experience in accounting/finance role with increasing responsibilities and demonstrated ability to work with minimal direction in the healthcare industry.

Practical experience with and/or demonstrated understanding of health care information systems particularly as it relates to: medical services claims; clinical data from EHRs and registries; cost, utilization and quality performance measures; data sources, data types including claims, eligibility and clinical information systems.

Knowledge:
Must have knowledge of generally accepted accounting practices and principles.

Knowledge of auditing practices and principles

(prepares audit support for external auditors).

Knowledge of accounting best practices, internal controls and standardized processes and procedures.

Must have ability to operate financial software such as Adaptive Planning, Sage100, Microsoft Excel, MS Office Suite, Adobe, or other programs in an integrated computer environment.

Experience with relational databases, SQL, and/or other reporting tools.

Experience with statistical analysis.

Skills Required:
Possess excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills utilizing utmost discretion with sensitive and confidential information.

Ability to research accounting issues, read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations relevant to accurate financial reporting.

Must have ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment with minimal guidance or supervision, including the ability to make decisions about applications of policies and procedures to work, organize time and set priorities to meet established deadlines and to shift priorities and workload frequently to accommodate new and/or urgent tasks.

Ability to work independently, organize time and set priorities to meet established deadlines and to shift priorities and workload to frequently accommodate new and more urgent tasks.

Must have ability to demonstrate and maintain a professional demeanor during interaction with a wide variety of personalities in demanding situations.

Must have ability to demonstrate and maintain cooperative working relationships with staff, physicians and administration, and work effectively as a team.

Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions.

Demonstrated supervisory skills monitoring departmental staff and workloads, evaluating and mentoring staff through documented, measurable objectives.

Ability to coordinate activities across multiple functions and drive them to completion.

Proactive issues identification, risk management skills, and conflict resolution.

Understand how to communicate difficult/sensitive information tactfully.

Ability to motivate team to work together in the most efficient manner.
title: Senior Manager of Analytics

description:
The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.

The Global Google Marketing Solutions (GMS) Product and Channel Activation team contributes to the success of GMS (Google’s fastest growing advertising channel) and our advertisers by developing effective solutions for advertiser business needs, supporting sales with strategic business growth initiatives and advocacy for products that better address small business and mid-market customer needs.

We are looking for a data scientist to lead our small business growth and development efforts, from the inception of a small business database to analyses on the small business universe to uncovering opportunities for accelerated growth and customer success. As a Small Business Data Scientist, you will partner with different Google Engineering, Product, Marketing, and Sales teams to develop segment insights from big data, consolidating existing Google technologies as well as building new ones. You will also work with others on the team to deliver valuable insights that drive the medium to long term strategy of small business growth at Google.

You have a bias for action, and can break down complex problems into steps that drive cross-functional decision making at fast speeds. You are an extremely organized project manager, an excellent data analyst, and a strong people influencer and negotiator. Additionally, you will have meaningful exposure and visibility to senior executives and cross-functional leaders as you communicate data driven insights to help ensure success for Google’s highest level company goals.

When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! Our team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused team members are the "human face" of Google, helping entrepreneurs both individually and broadly build their online presence and grow their businesses. We are dedicated to growing the unique needs of advertising companies. Our teams of strategists, analysts, advisers and support specialists collaborate closely to spot and analyze customer needs and trends. Together, we create and implement business plans broadly for every type of businesses.

Responsibilities
  • Develop information architecture and database schema, pulling from multiple sources.
  • Lead the design and implementation of a data strategy for identifying and tracking Google’s success with small businesses, collaborating heavily with sales leads and technical partners across multiple Engineering teams.
  • Evaluate opportunities for growth, based on data driven analysis, and work with partner teams to implement solutions and iterate.
  • Build models/segmentations and extensions to new markets and products to drive innovation and product and business strategies for small business growth.

Qualifications Minimum qualifications:
  • BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Quantitative sciences, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 6 years of related work experience.
  • Experience with SQL, Dremel capabilities including optimizing scripts, doing joins, and using other functions.
  • Experience with logs data.

Preferred qualifications:
  • MS degree.
  • Demonstrated ability to design databases and data infrastructures from multiple data sources.
  • Proven ability to interface and influence Sales teams, Product Management and Engineering teams - partnering closely with other cross-functional stakeholders.
  • Strong analytical, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills. Comfortable with internet technologies and working in a fast-paced and fast-changing sales environment.
  • Passion for small businesses and Google’s ability to provide value to them.
  • Superb written and oral communication, facilitation and interpersonal skills.
title: Small Business Growth Data Architect, Global GMS Product and Sales Activation

description:
THE COMPANY:

Beautycon Media began as a festival business four years ago and has since grown into a successful e-commerce subscription box business, while at the same time forging its way into the media space. Our goal is to create meaningful connections challenging the status quo while creating a “community” destination for all. Profiled in major outlets such as The New York Times, Fast Company, Mashable, Digiday, MTV, and Bustle as a company to watch, we are expanding quickly and strategically and are looking for entrepreneurial-minded individuals who have a proven track record of success in the start up environment to develop and oversee strategic digital initiatives that span multiple channels.

OVERVIEW:

We are seeking a Sr. Analyst to join our analytics team within Beautycon. The perfect candidate for this role is obsessed with perfection, enjoys analytical problem solving, and excels at working with diverse teams to achieve success. If you’re someone who loves data, is passionate about data, and wants to work in a fun and dynamic work environment, this role is for you!

Job Functions:

The Analyst, Digital Analytics will assist in efforts to transform data and reporting into insights, recommendations, and results. The ideal candidate will go beyond reporting, peel away the layers of data, and suggest constructive marketing test and competitive opportunities to improve business performance on a regular basis.

Identify and document current datasets, source systems, points of contact, regularly maintain comprehensive data inventory going forward.

Collaborate with internal and external business partners to identify and acquire new datasets to meet evolving business needs

Prioritize and complete other tasks and projects as assigned in support of strategic objectives.

Job Requirements:

Skills/Abilities:

Demonstrated ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with business partners and colleagues.

Demonstrated ability to organize projects and bring them to a successful conclusion.

Expert analytic abilities using SQL, Excel, and other tools (e.g. Tableau, MicroStrategy, etc.).

Working knowledge of cloud-based data environments & tools (e.g. AWS, Big Query, Hadoop, etc.).

Ability to design and analyze data from disparate sources including but not limited to: Google Analytics, Survey Monkey, Tribe Dynamics, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Instagram, Snapchat, Netbase

Ability to write code in R, Java, or Python is a huge plus.

Experience:

Experience collecting, analyzing, monitoring, and reporting on qualitative and quantitative datasets

Bachelor’s Degree in Sociology, Business, Advertising, Math or Statistics

5+ years in an analyst role with increasing responsibility in a startup or agency background
title: Senior Data Analyst

description:
Sr. Manager, Digital Marketing is responsible for developing, implementing, managing and optimizing the consumer loyalty program, Brilliant Distinctions®. This person will be responsible for managing all websites and mobile applications, in addition to integration of brand team initiative, promotions and product additions, as needed. The position requires analytical thinking, database acumen, excellent project management skills in order to effectively work with internal and external stakeholders to meet timelines and execute within the budget.
Strict adherence to legal and regulatory guidelines will be critical for this role as well as the ability to focus on long-term success.

Main Areas of Responsibilities
  • Manages all facets of the Brilliant Distinctions Consumer Loyalty Program; reports to the Director of Consumer Loyalty.

  • Develops/maintains digital and mobile strategies across B2C and B2B Platforms: Brilliant Distinctions, Allergan Partner Privileges, Allergan One, eCommerce

  • Leads implementation of strategic roadmap focusing on accelerating and amplifying our ongoing consumer loyalty efforts leveraging technology

  • Ongoing monitoring of performance metrics and Dashboard Reviews

  • Coordinates integration of brand team initiatives, content and promotions into web and mobile applications; keeping all stakeholders apprised of changes/enhancements

  • Coordinates with Loyalty Data Analyst on business opportunities

  • Monitors/reports performance metrics

  • Coordinates digital campaigns with CRM, Brand and development teams

  • Collaborates with brand teams to develop and deploy content, promotions and campaigns

  • Manages our interactive/video production agencies

  • Manages the consumer marketing budget and evaluates program ROI. Conducts quarterly variance analysis and continuously monitors expenses to ensure they are in-line with quarterly and annual budgets. Identifies changes in market or program conditions which would lead to favorable/unfavorable variance to budget/forecast.

  • Manages department budget and expenses

  • Works with Consumer Loyalty Coordinator(s) to achieve all consumer loyalty KPIs, timelines and budget goals.

  • Approves promotional materials working with AGN systems

  • Develops effective working relationships with Sales, key VIPs, physicians and other staff groups to assist in guiding marketing programs. Works with field sales representatives on a regular basis. Attends major conventions and meetings as directed.

Job Qualifications

Education and Experience
  • Bachelor’s degree, MBA preferred

  • Five or more years in B2C and/or B2B marketing, managing websites, mobile applications and database marketing/CRM/email initiatives

  • Demonstrable experience leading and managing agency partners or agency-side experience

  • Solid knowledge of website analytics and loyalty program metrics and to create forecasts and key metrics in order to measure results.

  • Experience in optimizing landing pages and user funnels and online acquisition tactics

  • Experience managing budgets

  • Up-to-date with loyalty program/digital marketing best practices

  • Knowledge of cosmetic/beauty, CPG and/or prestige consumer brands desired.

  • Agency experience a plus



Essential Skills and Abilities
Exhibits:
  • Strong creative and conceptual thinking skills

  • Strong presentation skills

  • Strong analytical skills and data-driven thinking

  • Analytical and problem resolution skills

  • Strong communication skills, both verbal and written

  • Strong interpersonal skills



Ability to:
  • Lead and influence as evidenced by experience as a manager/project leader

  • Work within complex multi-faceted organization and a cross-functional environment

  • Manage and prioritize work load, multi-task and manage a diverse mix of issues, responsibilities and challenges

  • Train across sales teams and call center associates

  • Travel 25%



Demonstrates:
  • Demonstrated strategic thinking and analytical expertise while able to articulate concepts and ideas

  • Experience in marketing theory, principles, and practices within the health care industry

  • Ability to find solutions within legal and regulatory constraints
title: Sr. Manager, Digital Marketing

description:
Dixon Marine Services, Inc. (DMS) is an Oceanographic, Wetland Restoration Firm specializing in wetland restoration, environmental investigations, and the remediation of impacted sediments. We are a certified woman-owned small business that believes in enjoying and preserving the natural environment and its native inhabitants. By participating and consulting for environmental restoration and remediation projects occurring on the west coast, the work and dedication to that belief is a reflection of our company.

DMS is a dynamic firm that utilizes developed techniques as well as unique approaches to remediation work, and provides services to several state and federal agencies as well as the private sector. We support both the environmental remediation world through our sediment investigations and the power and utility sector with our oceanographic survey services. DMS is an integration of scientists, engineers and operating engineers whose focus is providing marine services related to sub bottom habitat creation, wetland restoration and the remediation of impacted sediments.

DMS has an immediate opening for a Hydrographic Surveyor/Data Analyst for work on restoration and remediation projects. The position will include managing and performing hydrographic data acquisition, data analysis and the production of deliverables. The position will provide support for environmental marine construction projects that may involve environmental dredging, water quality monitoring and sediment investigations in marine and freshwater environments.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Prepare daily reports
  • Maintain project job costing
  • Project document control
  • Project schedule updates
  • Track vendor and subcontractor progress
  • Update submittal and RFI logs
  • Ensure dredging work complies with plans and specifications
  • Review shop drawings and submittals for conformance with contract
  • Coordinate inspections with consultants
  • Enforce quality control and expediting subcontractors
  • Provide technical engineering information and interpretation of plans, detail sheets and specifications for subcontractors
  • Track and report daily quantities for labor and materials

Competencies:

  • Communications: ability to produce clear status reports, writes clearly, communicates tactfully and candidly, exhibits clear verbal skills and an excellent listener
  • Problem Solving: Identifying complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions. Able to resolve difficult or complicated challenges.
  • Management of Resources: Obtaining and seeing to the appropriate use of equipment and materials needed to perform certain work.
  • Attention to Detail: Diligently attends to detail and pursues quality in accomplishing tasks. Checks work to ensure accuracy and completeness.
  • Teamwork: Promotes cooperation and commitment within a team to achieve goals and deliverables.
  • Time Management: ability to manage competing priorities effectively, to be resourceful and to use time as a resource.
  • Environmental, Health and Safety Management: Understand and know how to comply with all regulations; implement a positive attitude toward health and safety in the design and execution of the project; ensure safe deliverables and incorporate sustainable development practices

Education/Experience:

  • BS/MS from four-year college or university in Geography (GIS), Environmental Engineering, Marine Sciences or a related field. Experience with field engineering in construction, restoration and/or dredging; combination of education and experience.
  • Working knowledge of hydrographic single beam / multibeam systems, modern MRU's, side scan sonar and magnetometer systems
  • Strong marine background
  • Strong understanding of USACE specifications for hydrographic surveys
  • Knowledge of fluid flow and pump curves
  • Mechanical/Hydraulic Dredging
  • Language Ability: strong written and verbal communication skills to effectively present information and respond to questions from managers, clients and customers. Bi-lingual is a plus.
  • Reasoning Ability: ability to solve practical problems and interpret a variety of instructions given in written, oral, diagram or schedule form.
  • Computer Skills: to perform this job successfully, an individual should have knowledge of and experience with Hypack, AutoCAD,MS Office, MS Project. Additional IT experience is also a plus.

Additional Skills:

  • Possess a valid driver’s license and insurable driving record
  • Pass or have acquired the 40 Hour HAZWOPER Training and annual refresher course
  • Any additional certifications/licensing that would pertain to the construction industry or related area.

Job Type: Full-time

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • Hydrographic Surveying: 3 years

Required license or certification:

  • Driver's License
title: Hydrographic Surveyor

description:
The CRM Data Analyst will rationalize data from multiple sources and have a penchant for ensuring that data is clean and reliable data, experience working w/in Salesforce.com and various relational database technologies & ETL tools, and experience in data modeling & analysis. This role will act as liaison to analytics, sales, data warehouse, & product & engineering teams to understand & define key challenges including data mastering & deduplication and lead resulting resolution efforts. You will examine the existing landscape of Zendesk customer data across the scope of demographics, geography, company hierarchy, trial event history and product usage and coordinate with both business and technical leaders to isolate current and expected data challenges and present short- and long-term solutions to reporting needs across the organization.

What you get to do every day:
  • Work with a variety of SaaS Applications that make up our sales & marketing ecosystem, including Salesforce.com.
  • Work with a dynamic global team comprised of technical developers, analysts, and administrators that are focused on providing the very best experience to our internal customers through best in class technology, data, and processes.
  • Be a key player in improving and maintaining our Salesforce.com Sales Cloud implementation and experience
  • Co-management of production, User Acceptance, and Sandbox environments
  • Implement and integrate third-party products / applications on the Salesforce platform as well as other SaaS applications
  • Ensure Quality Assurance testing happens on all developed solutions before deployment
  • Research and advise on best practices for data quality, ETL, and MDM
  • Compose data & analytics dictionaries and training content for multiple internal consumer groups
  • Build narratives on complex metrics that can be consumed by both technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • Stay current with the periodic Salesforce releases and leverage the updates applicable to the Operations team
  • Engage with business stakeholders to gather/analyze requirements and map them to solutions that leverage Salesforce functionality and are well-timed to meet organizational growth objectives
  • In addition to Salesforce.com, you will have opportunities to work within Zendesk, Zuora, and a host of other licensed tools for Sales & Marketing operations.
What you bring to the role:
  • 3+ years experience with CRM data quality management processes, tools and methodologies in Salesforce.com or other enterprise-level CRM platform
  • 3+ years CRM analyst experience in mid-sized to large-enterprise organizations
  • 3+ years experience with RDBMS technologies such as MySQL, SQL Server, Oracle, etc..
  • Extensive exposure to current best-of-breed SaaS-based ETL/middleware tools and processes e.g. Informatica Cloud 360, clearMDM, DBAmp, Boomi etc.
  • Extensive experience with CRM data visualization tools e.g. Salesforce Reports & Dashboards, Apsona, Tableau, Microstrategy, Wave Analytics, etc.
  • Proficiency with DataLoader; SOQLXplorer; and Excel for data manipulation and complex custom reports; Zuora for Salesforce, Territory Management, and DemandTools is a plus
  • Can organize your work clearly and thoughtfully, communicating your findings throughout the team as required
  • Excellent communication skills both written and verbal and a strong sense of diplomacy and timing in all your interactions
  • Detail oriented with strong prioritization skills
  • Strong analytical, problem solving, communication, and coordination skills.
  • Salesforce Administrator and Advanced Administrator certifications at minimum (Sales Cloud Consultant a plus)
Nice to have’s:
  • BA or equivalent work experience and 3+ years experience with CRM data quality management processes, tools and methodologies in Salesforce.com or other enterprise-level CRM platform
  • SQL/SOQL query development and management for data isolation and analysis
  • 3+ years project management experience
  • Experience in SaaS sales/business model architectures
Zendesk builds software for better customer relationships. It empowers organizations to improve customer engagement and better understand their customers. More than 80,000 paid customer accounts in 150 countries and territories use Zendesk products. Based in San Francisco, Zendesk has operations in the United States, Europe, Asia, Australia, and South America. Learn more at www.zendesk.com .
title: CRM Data Analyst

description:
Director of Academic and Learning Support

Professional Job Summary

The Director of Academic and Learning Support inspires excellence, responds to the needs of the time, and makes a positive difference by preparing young women to live with heart, faith, and courage in the Catholic tradition. The Director of Academic and Learning Support greatly values accepting uniqueness, awakening minds, and guiding students in the spirit of the Sisters of Saint Joseph of Carondelet. The Director of Academic and Learning Support is responsible for the supervision and implementation of academic and learning support programs; retrieving data from multiple measures of assessment, and analyzing and responding to the unique conditions that apply to academic and learning support.

The Director of Academic and Learning Support models humble leadership, embraces possibility, and inspires an Esprit De Corps amongst students, parent guardians, colleagues, and community stakeholders.

The position requires working closely with Carondelet High School’s students, parent guardians, faculty and staff, community stakeholders, and at times outside professionals, to help meet the various needs and multiple challenges that relate to academic and learning success.

The Director of Academic and Learning Support exercises good judgement and sound decision making, is an inventive and critical thinker, is innovative, is technologically savvy, and an industrious leader of academic and learning support programs. In addition, the Director of Academic and Learning Support advances student development and learning, fosters community engagement, promotes diversity, inclusion, respect, and empowers students, faculty, and staff to thrive.

Essential Leadership Responsibilities

  • Manages complex conversations, meetings, and crisis situations and deals with conflict proactively, responsively, and with balanced intent.
  • Aptitude toward analyzing, solving, and interpreting problems, facilitating consensus decision making at meetings, organizing resources and events, and establishing priorities.
  • Fosters a positive and supportive educational environment built on trust, safety of the whole child, and with mission and charism grounding all decision-making that precipitates parent guardian and student conferences, meetings, and academic and learning plans.
  • Incorporates best practices, new and significant information, creative strategies and modalities in aiding the student, teacher, and parent guardian toward successful outcomes of interventions.

Administrative Responsibilities

  • Coordinates academic and learning programs for 9th, 10th and 11th, and 12th grade students. Monitors the academic and learning progress of each student and empowers each student to be self-regulated in their learning, as central advocates for meeting their personal academic and learning needs. Confers regularly with students regarding academic performance that needs improvement and discusses options and strategies to resolve issues and strategizes ways to increase and maintain academic success and positive learning outcomes.
  • Works closely with the Learning Specialists in supporting Carondelet High School’s students, parent guardians, faculty and staff, and at times outside professionals, in meeting the various needs, successes, and challenges that relate to educational plans and learning styles/differences. In addition, supports the Learning Specialists in coordinating services for all students with documented learning disabilities.
  • Monitors and evaluates the quality, depth, and scope of student educational plans, accommodations, medical, and or psychological diagnosis that impacts academics and learning.
  • Proactively creates and implements a plan of academic support for students on academic probation and confers with the Vice-Principal for Student Affairs on matters related to academic probation.
  • Structures formal letters to student and parent guardian and documents all communication with such probation matters. Consults with the Athletic Director on a case by case basis regarding athletic probation and eligibility.
  • Meets with students on academic probation on a weekly basis and encourages students to be advocates for their academic and learning success during the designated time period.
  • Monitors the academic progress of each student and empowers each student to be self-regulated in their own learning and as central advocates for meeting their academic needs
  • The Academic Support Specialist interrelates with students to help them identify what is, and is not, working. Learning options are explored with each student and study skills are taught that enhance individual learning styles.
  • Creates and executes a plan of academic support for students encountering medical diagnosis and communicates all information and results to the team, parent guardian, and designated faculty and staff.
  • Retrieves and creates D and F reports on a weekly basis from student’s struggling with their academics and learning and supervises appropriate remediation of D/F grades toward graduation and college eligibility. Notifies students, parent guardians, and the Student Affairs Department members of all academic deficiencies.
  • Creates and maintains an innovative program of study skills and related tutorials
  • Assists Principal of summer session, primarily, in the role of Attendance Officer
  • Manages, reports, and guides the (Return to Learn) Concussion Protocol
  • Designs, leads, and implements the schedule for PSAT prep, ordering/organizing materials, packaging, and execution of the on campus PSAT for grades 10 and 11.
  • Monitors students assigned to study hall. Provides direction and support for those students who may benefit from additional support.
  • Confers with parent guardians of students on academic probation and/or in danger of academic disqualification at the conclusion of the third quarter. Provides necessary documentation and appropriate notification of possible dismissal for lack of academic progress.
  • Refers students with academic deficiencies to the Vice-Principal for Student Affairs and Principal for review in June, recommending academic probation, or dismissal as appropriate.
  • Arranges, participates, and often leads parent and student conferences, academic and learning meetings, transition meetings, and pulse meetings as requested by the student, parent guardian, and/or faculty and staff.
  • Advises students in need of remediation and advancement about summer remediation opportunities. Is responsible for follow through with students about completion of necessary remediation. Works in concert with College and Career Advisors, and Carondelet High School’s Data Analyst with this follow-up.
  • Works with the Data Analyst to collect and disseminate data that will lead to improved methodology and advising to ensure the success of all students.

Enduring Expectations

The Director of Learning and Academic Support is an active listener, attentive problem solver, and exhibits higher order thinking skills that reflect invention and development. Confidentiality, self-actualization, compassion, and courage are vital virtues toward effective academic and learning outcomes. Communication and interpersonal skills are grounded in humility and sound judgment.

Qualification Requirements

  • Bachelor’s Degree
  • Master’s Degree preferred
  • 5+ years’ experience working in education in a learning specialist role
  • Tech Savvy and able to build and run reports for training and information gathering
  • Ability to work both collaboratively and independently viewed as a caring and compassionate contributor/team player
  • Skilled in use of Microsoft Office programs

Please apply at: www.carondeleths.org

Job Type: Full-time

Required education:

  • Bachelor's
title: Director of Academic and Learning Specialist

description:
Job Tracking ID: 85347-217588
Location: Sacramento, CA
Job Type: Full-Time/Regular Date Updated: September 13, 2016

Job Description:
The Application Support Engineers role is to provide application support from a technical perspective. This includes supporting data loading and mining operations, responsibility for standard maintenance processes, log verification, error resolution, patch maintenance, supporting the implementation of new applications and building application interfaces. Light database administration is also a requirement.
We are looking for an individual who is passionate about their work, eager to tackle new challenges and learn the skills necessary to find solutions while on the job. We value innovation, intelligence, and ability as well as a demonstrated willingness to take ownership of projects and systems. The IT department is excited about the opportunity to help shape and support our growing company and we hope you are too!

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Builds interfaces / manages interface projects between business applications.
Modifies existing forms and reports; builds new forms and reports as required by users.
Monitors application processes to ensure availability
Work directly with personnel (functional and technical), external consulting partner and/or other outside vendors as required.
Work with different departments to develop a thorough understanding of the business processes and business requirements in order to facilitate the implementation of the ERP system and other related applications.
Perform application configuration and setup across multiple areas of the ERP system and other related applications.
Lead application functionality testing, patch testing, and provide recommendations for functionality enhancement. Work with software vendor to implement enhancements.
Develop and update important documentation including business process flows, requirements documents, functional and technical design documents, test cases, and user training materials.
Execute the activities and tasks identified with little to no supervision.
Communicate and manage relationships with internal and external customers. Must portray excellent facilitation skills.
Research and resolve technical issues (in person, by telephone, or via e-mail); provide prompt assistance with resolutions or a work-around when possible.
Help develop business process modeling.
Communicate progress to management.
Test pilot new applications to validate work instructions and database information.
Utilizes project management skills to successfully manage time to accomplish projects.
Mentors Level I Application Support Engineers.
Translates complex business needs and problems into system configuration, test and setup requirements.
Translate business requirements into working IT documentsincluding functional requirements, functional design, and technicaldesign, as applicable.
Solves complex, highly technical problems effectively while under pressure. Experience and Skills:
5+ years related experience in a technical application support function.
Requires BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or MIS.
Must be a self-motivated, dependable team player with the ability to work independently.
Demonstrated passion for customer satisfaction.
Demonstrated strong communication skills. Must be able to multi-task, be proactive and complete tasks in a timely manner.
Proven knowledge includes database and networking administration, and programming experience.
Demonstrated ability to interact successfully with all levels of employees, external resources and customers.
Effective planning and organizational abilities and superior detail-orientation. Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
Proficiency with SQL Server, MS Biztalk, and MS Visual Studio application.
Experience with Microsoft development technologies (VB, VB Script, COM+, etc.)
Working knowledge of MS office suite of products including MS Access and MS Project preferred
Ability to quickly learn new technologies and programming languages with little mentoring and/or training.
MS Access experience is plus. VBA and Application development using MS Access.
SharePoint experience is required. Both 3.0 and MOSS.
Must be a U.S. Citizen

Number of Openings: 1
Years of Experience: More than 5 Years
