title: Application Support Engineer II - Data Analyst

description:
ABOUT THE ROLE:

Trojan Battery Company is looking for a dynamic Senior Product Specialist. This position will provide you with the opportunity to partner with a dynamic and analytical group who set a high bar for innovation and success in a high-growth environment. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you'd like to help, this is your chance to make history.

This is a key position, within the Trojan Battery Marketing Department, assisting with successful execution of new product introductions, product life cycle management, product profitability monitoring and ensuring overall customer satisfaction. Position focuses on addressing daily product support requests, developing new or modified bills of material (BOM), margin analysis, sku analysis, process realignment, new business opportunities and maintaining awareness on competing products and trends. This position requires the ability to multi-task, gather and report numerical data, produce and report on statistical metrics, research and develop process improvements and excellent problem solving skills. Candidate must have strong communications and analytical skills, solid technical instincts and learning potential.

THE DAY TO DAY:

  • Research, initiate and follow through on product configuration changes, new product part number generation, engineering study review and BOM updates.
  • Identify and resolve internal and external customer issues and concerns in a timely fashion to ensure customer satisfaction.
  • Coordinate with multiple departments, including engineering, manufacturing, accounting and marketing teams in new product development and execution activities.
  • Identify and recommend product enhancements and updates to address new business opportunities.
  • Initiate SKU analysis and recommend product and process improvements and obsolescence opportunities.
  • Participate in review of product profitability and pricing analysis.
  • Collaborate with business units in support of business plans to achieve company revenue goals.
  • Support marketing team in developing sales and marketing tools.
  • Stay up-to-date with product knowledge, business flow, sales process and market dynamics.
  • Assist in creation of market requirements documentation.
  • Maintain complete documentation for all product related activities.
  • Investigate product compliance to relevant standards.
  • Follows quality system procedures.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:

  • The ideal candidate will possess a Bachelor’s degree in either Product Management, Marketing, or Business. Alternatively, candidates with a Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, along with solid marketing work experience, may be considered.
  • 5 – 10 years of relevant work experience preferred.
  • Strong technical background or B2B experience a plus.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential, with proven proficiency in English. Spanish language proficiency a plus.
  • Ability to work well within a cross-functional team environment with product management experience and strong organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills.
  • Able to interact and communicate with internal and external customers regarding product questions.
  • Ability to analyze data, pursue solutions and produce meaningful results
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office applications and spreadsheets
  • Familiarity with database software
  • Ability to work with sometimes limited direction to meet research/information needs of the business.
  • Highly motivated self-starter with the capability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic business environment.
  • Exceptional ability to multi-task with great attention for detail

WHO WE ARE:

Founded in 1925 by George Godber and Carl Speer, Trojan Battery Company is the world’s leading manufacturer of deep-cycle batteries. From deep-cycle flooded batteries to deep-cycle AGM and gel batteries, Trojan has shaped the world of deep-cycle battery technology with more than over 90 years of battery manufacturing experience.

Trojan Battery Company’s core values focus on our commitment to developing innovative environmentally friendly energy storage solutions that effectively meet customer needs, and serve the global community at large. Trojan values the integrity of our business relations, the quality of our deep-cycle technology, reliability of our products and services, as well as the professional growth of our team members.

PERKS and BENEFITS:

  • A variety of Medical, Dental, and Vision Plans
  • A variety of Insurance Plans and options
  • Section 125 Cafeteria Plan
  • 401(k)/401k Roth
  • Disability Income – specific locations and/or classification
  • Group Legal Services
  • Corporate 529 College Savings Plan
  • Tuition Reimbursement
  • Credit Union Membership
  • Blue Heart Campaign- An awareness raising initiative to fight human trafficking and its impact on society
  • A variety of Employee Discounts
  • Employee Wellness Programs
  • Volunteer and Company Sponsored Philanthropy Trips

Job Type: Full-time

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • development of new or modified bills of material (BOM), margin analysis, sku analysis, process realignment: 3 years
  • Product Management, Business Intelligence Analyst or related Data Analyst: 4 years
title: Senior Product Specialist

description:
Company
Based in San Francisco, Pacific Gas and Electric Company, a subsidiary of PG&E; Corporation (NYSE: PCG), is one of the largest combined natural gas and electric utilities in the United States. And wedeliver some of the nation's cleanest energy to our customers in Northern and Central California. For PG&E;, 'Together, Building a Better California' is not just a slogan. It's the very core of our mission and the scale by which we measure our success. We knowthat the nearly 16 million people who do business with our company count on our more than 24,000 employees for far more than the delivery of utility services. They, along with every citizen of the state we call home, also expect PG&E; to help improve theirquality of life, the economic vitality of their communities, and the prospect for a better future fueled by clean, safe, reliable and affordable energy.

Pacific Gas and Electric Company is an Affirmative Action and Equal Employment Opportunity employerthat actively pursues and hires a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, age, religion, physical or mental disability status, medical condition, protectedveteran status, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information or any other factor that is not related to the job. Department Overview
The men and women of Electric Operations ensure thedelivery of safe and reliable electric service to our customers. Electric Operations is responsible for every aspect of PG&E;'s electric distribution and transmission operations, including planning, engineering, maintenance and construction, asset management,business planning, restoration and emergency response. Position Summary
The Senior Field Safety Specialist supports the Corporate Contractor Safety Program in the T-Line organization.
The main focus will be ensuring hazards are identified andmitigated for high and medium risk projects prior to the start of a job, that safety observations are completed, for tracking and trending observation data and incident data for contractors and for ensuring incidents are investigated using the Corporate CausalEvaluation Standards.

This role partners with Safety Engineering and Health Services (SE&HS;) to ensure alignment with the over-arching corporate safety program and resolution to systematic issues. The incumbent is a Subject Matter Expert (SME)resource for electrical standards, procedures and for regulatory (e.g. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), National Fire Protection Agency (NFPA), Department of Transportation (DOT), etc.)
information as it relates to electrical workpractices. Qualifications

Minimum:
  • 5 years of work experience in complex utility or industrial environments.
  • High School Diploma or GED
Desired:
  • Experience working in a union environment.
  • Working knowledge ofindustry standards and regulations (e.g. OSHA [California and Federal], NFPA, DOT)
  • Proficient with conducting incident investigations and associated causal analyses
  • Proficient in hazard identification and associated mitigation actions.
  • Proficient in hazard exposure and risk reduction processes.
  • Working knowledge of PG&E; standards and procedures.
  • Knowledge of Human Performance Improvement concepts and principles.
  • Certified Safety Professionals (CSP) or Certified UtilitySafety Professional (CUSP) or other industry-recognized certifications desired. Responsibilities
  • Performs job hazard analyses and assists in development of Pre-Construction Risk Assessments.
Identifies and recommends and/or implements associatedhazard mitigation. Observes field work
performed by contractors. Utilizing experience, skill and available procedural manuals, advises supervisors, contractors and inspectors regarding the safest procedures and practices in conducting their work.
  • Provides Storm Response Electrical Safety Support
  • Ensures employee and public safety hazard exposure reduction.
  • Assists Human Performance Specialists with safety related incident investigation and causal analysis. Provides insights and opinionregarding the incident cause, what alternative procedure should have been used.
  • Interfaces with peers in PG&E; Academy training, exchanging information regarding observed safety trends and possible needs for new training or modified procedures.
  • Applies construction trade, regulatory, and Company standard knowledge to assist in the development of safety improvement procedures and processes. May prepare process map documentation.
  • Partners with Safety Engineering and Health Services (SE&HS;) toensure alignment with the over-arching Corporate Safety program and collaborate in resolution to systematic issues.
  • Assists department data analyst with safety data tracking and trending.
  • Develops and communicates plans to leverage identified strengths.
title: Sr. Electrical Field Safety Specialist - Flexible Location

description:
Looking for a chance to do meaningful work that touches millions? Come join the hardest working, nonprofit health plan in California and help us shape the future of health care. Blue Shield of California is focused on transforming health care by making it more accessible, affordable and customer-centric. Being a mission-driven organization means we do much more than serve our 3.5 million members: we were the first health plan in the nation to limit our annual net income to 2 percent of revenue and return the difference to our customers and the community, and since 2005 we have contributed more than $325 million to the Blue Shield of California Foundation to improve community health and end domestic violence. We also believe that a healthier California begins with our employees, so we provide them with resources to develop and maintain a healthy lifestyle through our award-winning wellness program, Wellvolution.

We're hiring smart thinkers and doers who want to work for a leader and innovator in the challenging, ever-changing healthcare space. Come and help us make health care better for everyone.

The Director Information Architecture is a senior member of the IT team reporting into VP of Enterprise Architecture (EA) and owns, represents and documents specific large enterprise level information and data directions. This is a strategic role and is also responsible for establishing the strategy, vision, and roadmap for information and data platforms.

Specific Responsibilities Include:
• Provides technical and data leadership to the application development group, IT, and the enterprise including being conversant with and cognizant of the future direction of systems, how that direction will impact the enterprise, and how future and current systems can be exploited for the benefit of the enterprise
• Works closely with other IT groups to coordinate current and future plans and activities including coordination and technical assistance to facilitate specific development projects that involve the computing environment, the coordination of software upgrades and the installation of new products.
• Recognizes and identifies potential areas where existing policies and procedures require change, or where new ones need to be developed, especially regarding future business expansion.
• Keeps current on assessments of technology for the business.
• Performs at or above the enterprise’s Information Technology performance standards.Data Analyst Responsibilities:
• Consults with the business to determine logical design for new business solutions.
• Coordinates with database administrators the physical construction of databases for projects and maintenance activities.
• Consults with other lead data architect for compliance to enterprise data design and maintenance.
• Collaborates with Enterprise Architecture for compliance to strategic enterprise direction
• Coordinates and leads data activities in support of projects in the development of enterprise systems.
• Develops, maintains, and approves data models for large applications.

Database Administration Responsibilities:
• Translates the logical design to a physical design and implemented database.
• Performs database tuning and performance at a server and database level.
• Provides required data integrity and recoverability for the business.
• Sets standards and controls the necessary infrastructure process associated with the database(s) of the enterprise.
• Assists in troubleshooting and technical system support for the application development group.
• Provides weekly and monthly reports on system problems and their solutions, as well as assisting in forecasts of future utilization and equipment requirements.

• Develops meta data standards for the enterprise

• Active partner with the business in development and execution of Data Governance and Standards.

• Extensive database modeling (Erwin), design, development and maintenance experience.

• Hands-on experience with data warehouse appliances, master data management including metadata and data governance.

• Building and managing a data warehouse and industry standard Business Intelligence tools (BO, Cognos, etc.)

Direction of Others/Direction Received:
• Assist in all of the activities of the database management group including database design, data dictionary management, system management, system programming, and troubleshooting.
• Coordinate with the personnel of the database management, application development and distributed systems groups.
• Provide technical leadership to IT and the enterprise, especially on issues relating to future Information Technology modernization and/or expansion and Data Architecture directions and transitions.

Qualifications






Candidate Profile and Requirements:
• 15+ years of system implementation experience in a large IT organization
• 10 years of varied database consulting and design experience, 5 years using the database(s) the enterprise uses
• 12+ years of direct experience as an Enterprise level Architect, preferably as an Information Architect
• Experience with multiple SDLC methodologies and demonstrated proficiency in understanding SDLC methodologies
• Knowledge of relational database technology, transaction processing and data warehouse design and advanced modeling and design tools
• At least 6 years of development experience with modern development tools and technologies, including Java (EJB, DAO, JTA, ORB, Beans, JMS, Servlets, and JSP) • Experience in large distributed systems across multiple platforms
• Strong understanding of ETL tools like Informatica • Knowledge of AIX/Unix and Windows Operating Systems
• Good working knowledge of Oracle 11G or later; J2EE and Java Development Platform
• Familiarity with Object Oriented Languages like C#, C++
• Good understanding of virtualization technologies and implementations
• Demonstrated leadership in achieving shared objectives in a matrixed organization, coordinating projects and services across business and organizational boundaries, and building effective cross-functional teams
• Effective communicator with a strong customer service orientation; ability to communicate effectively across multiple levels, and lead and influence senior professionals.• Proven experience in executing complex releases or programs involving multiple disciplines
• Experience building frameworks for service oriented architecture (SOA)
• Knowledge of modeling tools like Rational RequisitePro, Rational SoDA, ProVision, IteraPlan etc.Preferred Experience:
• Healthcare or large service provider experience
• MS in Computer Science or Engineering with at least 10 years of relevant IT experience
• Knowledge of Healthcare specific software like McKesson Claim Check, ITS, BCBS Association Software’s
• Exposure to Managed Care Information Systems such as Facets, Diamond, MetaVance
• Strong experiences in other Trizetto products such as Facets Workflow, CWS/CES, HIPAA Gateway, NetworX Pricer, ITS, hpXr, Care Advance, etc.Education/Credentials: BS in Computer Science or Engineering with at least 15 years of relevant IT experience. BS or BA in other disciplines is acceptable, supplemented with adequate relevant experience.MS in Computer Science or Engineering with at least 10 years of relevant IT experience.

Preferred Experience:

• Healthcare or large service provider experience

• MS in Computer Science or Engineering with at least 15 years of relevant IT experience

• Knowledge of Healthcare specific software like McKesson Claim Check, ITS, BCBS Association Software’s

• Exposure to Managed Care Information Systems such as Facets

• Strong experiences in other Trizetto products such as Facets Workflow, CWS/CES, HIPAA Gateway, NetworX Pricer, ITS, hpXr, Care Advance, etc.

• Excellent presentation, written and verbal communications skills.

• Solid project leadership/management skills.

• Healthcare, medical or provider experiences a significant plus.

External hires must pass a background check/drug screen. Qualified applicants with arrest records and/or conviction records will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with Federal, State and local laws, including but not limited to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability status and any other classification protected by Federal, State and local laws.

description:
ServiceNow is changing the way people work. With a service-orientation toward the activities, tasks and processes that make up day-to-day work life, we help the modern enterprise operate faster and be more scalable than ever before.

If you thought you knew about ServiceNow and what we do, take a look again!
Our products lines are diverse and robust. The Enterprise Cloud is dynamic, scalable to billions of transactions weekly, and global in scope and size. As a part of the core Platform as a Service offering, the Intelligent Automation Development team is building the core machine learning/AI/predictive analytics technology that will power revenue generating business use-cases using customer data to predict desired outcomes automatically; hence delivering a manifold increase in productivity of business processes of ServiceNow customers. The team focuses on operationalizing machine learning and predictive analytics use cases for all ServiceNow business applications.

We employ only the brightest and most forward-thinking predictive analytics developers on the planet. We have offices in San Diego, San Francisco and Santa Clara and work as a distributed team. Come join the Intelligent Automation team and make your mark in the most challenging problem area - helping customer derive the insights from their own data on ServiceNow platform for enterprise applications, each customer at a time!

What you get to do in this role:
Design, implement, test, deliver and support ServiceNow's internal predictive analytics engine as a part of the overall Platform-as-a-Service offering. Specifically, you

Understand the business needs of Platform BU's customers
Translate the needs into data requirements
Design, code and test features that enhances the DxC engine to solve new business use cases
Support, fix bugs, improve performance, work with operations to make the engine self reliant
Develop innovative patentable ideas that ensures the competitiveness of this product within the domain of similar work being done in the industry
Lead and deliver key asks from internal constituents by example
Visualize key statistical concepts of underlying models and its performance
In order to be successful in this role, we need someone who has:

Passion for software development and problem-solving
Ability to translate business needs into data requirements
Java and Statistical Library programming skills a must
Experience with scripting languages (ruby, javascript, bash)
Experienced in various forms of decision sciences software development
Exceptional debugging, testing, and problem solving skills
Exceptional understanding of statistical libraries, algorithms and concepts
Self-starter, with quick learning curve
Strong written and verbal communication
Hands on programmer, not a data analyst
Has the ability to extend existing libraries to solve specific operational problems that manifests based on data distribution, and usage.
Working experience within product development teams is a must
Must have demonstrated work experience thro multiple life cycles of a product within a single company.
Must have demonstrated capabilities to create patentable ideas.
We provide competitive compensation, generous benefits and a professional atmosphere. This is a very collaborative and inclusive work environment where individuals strong on aptitude and attitude will have an opportunity to grow their professional careers through working with some of the most advanced technology and talented developers in the business.

Position Located in Santa Clara, California
title: Sr. Staff Software Engineer, Machine Learning and Intelligent Automation

description:
Are you a problem-solver looking to work on a product that makes people’s lives better? The everyday employees who use Yammer tell us that they feel smarter, more appreciated by their coworkers, and more connected to the jobs where they spend 8+ hours a day, every day. That’s what motivates us to come to work, support each other, and keep making our product better.

Is this the right job for you?
- You get excited about tackling big, complicated, and often ambiguous problems and have autonomy in decision making
- You understand that human behavior is complex and changing behaviors is a lot harder than building features and technology
- You love products - trying new things, asking yourself ‘why did they build it that way?’, questioning ‘what would happen if?’
- You’re comfortable communicating and negotiating with cross-functional teams - you get your points across without being a jerk, and people like working with you even if they might disagree with you - You’ve got good UX instincts -- you won’t need to do your own design, but you’ll need to work effectively with your designer and researcher peers
- You enjoy thinking analytically -- you won’t be expected to write SQL queries, but you’ll need to work effectively with your data analyst peers

This is what you’ll be doing:
- Collaborate with other product managers, designers, researchers, data analysts, and engineering teams to determine product strategy and prioritize the features that will bring the most value to our customers
- Manage the product development process from conception through design, build, release, A/B testing, analysis, and iteration
- Analyze data to optimize performance and focus on the product areas with the highest potential to drive usage
- Constantly learning, asking questions, being humble, and supporting your team members
- Using the product we’re building every day, and constantly questioning how we can make it more useful for our customers
This is how we do it:
- A/B test everything (including our own instincts and assumptions), build iteratively, and ship quickly -- it keeps us humble.
- Rotate project areas, from web to mobile and across product goals -- it keeps us from being silo’d.
- Bring in all the right resources (data analysts, research, design, copy, engineering) from the beginning -- it keeps us respectful of a diversity of perspectives.

Required: - You have at least 2 years of Product Management experience, designing and shipping products that lots of people use and love.

Yammer and Microsoft: Yammer is now an integral part of Office 365, has grown significantly over the past years and is used by millions of users. Yammer helps power other Microsoft experiences including Delve, Office 365 video and SharePoint. Yammer helped accelerate the company-wide adoption of product usage as a key success metric. With all this, Yammer is well set up to be a major engine of growth for Microsoft and Office 365.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, marital status, pregnancy, protected veteran status, protected genetic information, political affiliation, or any other characteristics protected by local laws, regulations, or ordinances.
title: Product Manager - Yammer

description:
St. Jude Medical is now Abbott
We are seeking an experienced, high caliber Postmarket Surveillance Manager. Under the direction of department management, the Postmarket Surveillance (PS) Manager will oversee all activities pertaining to receiving and investigating reports of worldwide complaints/events on a variety of products. They will provide direction to individuals who receive and investigate reports of product complaints, evaluate returned products, and perform data analysis. The PS Manager will also assist the team by overseeing complaint investigations and all associated functions, ensuring the complaint database is updated. The PS Manager will follow established global regulations for complaint handling and prepare and assemble complaint information for regulatory inquiries, ensuring a timely response. This person will provide support during inspections by regulatory bodies, ensure appropriate and timely global medical device reporting, and observe for trends in product complaints. The PS Manager will also be responsible to provide budgetary input and is responsible to adhere to the established department budget, and they are responsible for performance and salary reviews for their team.

Each employee can make a difference at St. Jude Medical and has the power, either individually or as a team, to influence the success of the company. We are team-oriented, fast-paced and progressive. We value people with great ideas who partner with others both internally and externally to take action and accomplish goals.

Impact this role will have on St. Jude Medical:
  • Supports enterprise and department objectives on product complaints (e.g. thorough investigations, timely reported of adverse events, new product initiatives)

  • Manage daily activities of PS Analysts and Data Analysts

  • Provide on-site support of department staff and objectives, promoting positive staff relationships, and ensuring adherence to department procedures

  • Prepare and present employee performance and salary reviews

  • Have a detailed understanding of global regulations (e.g. FDA, European Vigilance, Canada, Australia) pertaining to medical device reports

  • Oversee device reporting to ensure complaints are evaluated for reportability and submitted when appropriate and on time

  • Review global medical device reports prior to submission

  • Ensure complaints and adverse events requiring the attention of management are communicated

  • Maintain knowledge of elevated ongoing investigations

  • Provide complaint investigation support to team members, as appropriate

  • Collaborate with Data Analyst when data is requested by management or regulatory agencies

  • Be vigilant of possible trends related to product complaints and relay information or concerns to upper management, including new product complaints

  • Provide support for database activities including identification of issues and database projects (e.g. conversions, upgrades, testing)

  • Maintain department procedures to reflect current regulatory requirements and department practices, and ensure they are followed

  • Participate in interviewing and hiring of new employees

  • Ensure PS intranet sites and forms are maintained

  • Facilitate equipment and supply purchases for site

  • Participate/establish meetings and department projects as requested

  • Ensure new employees are properly trained and oriented

  • Support all Divisional initiatives as identified by divisional management and in support of Quality Management Systems (QMS), Environmental Management Systems (EMS), and other regulatory requirements

  • Hires and retains a diverse, highly qualified staff and provides ongoing performance feedback. Maintains a safe and professional work environment

  • Complies with U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) regulations, other regulatory requirements, Company policies, operating procedures, processes, and task assignments
    • Maintains positive and cooperative communications and collaboration with all levels of employees, customers, contractors, and vendors


  • Performs other related duties and responsibilities, on occasion, as assigned

Your experience(s), education and knowledge will further expand St. Jude Medical’s marketplace success:
  • Registered nurse or medical professional with four-year degree, preferably in nursing or management and five years’ experience in a medical setting
    • Previous supervisory, cath lab or critical care experience a plus


  • Must possess strong writing and verbal communication skills, and excellent organizational skills for managing multiple ongoing tasks in a busy department

  • Must be confident in making sound decisions regarding adverse event reporting based on medical knowledge and experience, and demonstrate problem-solving ability

  • Must be able to interpret medical reports and records

  • Must be familiar with the use of computers and MS Office including programs for data management (e.g. Excel)

  • Ability to work in a highly matrixed and geographically diverse business environment

  • Strong leadership skills, including the ability to set goals and provide positive and constructive feedback respectfully to build positive relationships and improve business results

  • Ability to work effectively within a team in a fast-paced changing environment

  • Strong verbal and written communications with ability to effectively communicate at multiple levels in the organization

  • Multi-tasks, prioritizes and meets deadlines in timely manner

  • Strong organizational, planning, and follow-up skills and ability to hold others accountable

  • Ability to travel approximately 5-25%, including internationally

  • Ability to maintain regular and predictable attendance

Your preferred qualifications and education:
  • Experience working in a broader enterprise/cross division business unit model preferred

  • Knowledge of global medical device reporting regulations (e.g. FDA, European Vigilance) a plus
    • Should be detail and team-oriented and be able to function independently while working with cross-functional teams and providing work direction to department members
title: Postmarket Surveillance Manager

description: Coordinates and partners with warranty and other departments within Product Operations to provide data for improvement in various functional areas such as: QA - to provide detailed failure analysis to manufacturing facilities Technical Support - to provide supporting data for Technical Support Hotline warranty decisions Distribution – to track and report warranty claim data related to transportation issues FSAs - to provide detailed information for individual dealer warranty audits Conducts audits to review warranty costs and provides detailed data for product improvement and analysis of all warranty claim types as needed; expands root problem analysis; proposes solutions for important warranty issues Sets monitoring procedures for emerging product issues Provides time sensitive data for accounting and reporting purposes: Accounting – to provide monthly warranty claim reimbursement reports to respective divisions Public Affairs - to provide detailed data reporting for failures under TREAD Act Assists other departments within KMC for special projects as requested or required Through inter-department cross-training, serves as back up to other warranty staff on an as-needed basis Creates technology solutions and analyzes claim information in order to make/recommend changes or adjustment to KPP extended service contract program as needed: Prepares business plan and reviews claims expenses and earnings Analyzes pricing and profitability Provides forecasting and budget detail Coordinates with Legal Department and Warranty Department to insure compliance with all state laws for sales, registrations, claims, cancellations, form review, etc.

description:
Informatica MDM Development Lead / Administrator
We are seeking an Informatica Development Lead with experience in leading, solutioning, implementing, and supporting robust and complex MDM/ETL initiatives utilizing the following technologies: Informatica MDM (9.7.x or greater), Informatica Power Center, Informatica Data Quality, Oracle, JBOSS, Java, Unix. The candidate should posess strong analytical and problem solving skills with experience in requirements analysis, data profiling, solution design, user trainings, code and design reviews, deployment, technical documentaion and installation of Informatica MDM Hub, IDD, Hierarchy Manager and SIF.

The Informatica MDM Data Governance program consolidates the financial records manage in decentralized systems into a single system of truth for critical financial data thereby reducing reconciliation, errors and time to complete month end close. As part of this new program, the MDM oversight is nearly doubling in 2016 in support of the FP&A;, Controllership and PFiT.

Work you’ll do
  • Develop, modify, or update applications used by business units or infrastructure units. Lead, or play lead technical role in development teams' efforts to determine unit needs and business processes that are automated by the application. Assess high level design issues relating to platform, enterprise software, and interactions with other systems.

  • Provide design leadership in large or complex development projects involving application development, migrations, and additions to existing applications. Participate in project meetings with other technical staff and business owners and subject matter experts.

  • Assess and develop high level design requirements for project and communicate in writing or in meetings with development team. Assess detailed specifications against design requirements.

  • Review application in progress of development to ensure compliance with overall design parameters and corporate development standards. Guide programmers/developers on technical issues.

  • Develop or review development of test protocols for testing application before user acceptance. Review test results and direct further development.

  • May serve as technical lead, architect, and project lead or principle developer in course of large or complex project.

  • May provide, or guide provision of technical support to applications currently in production

  • May mentor or guide work of less experienced programming and development staff.

The team

Application Management Services

In today’s business world, the cost and complexity of information technology is higher than ever. Many organizations find themselves with a complex digital environment that is difficult to manage and costly to maintain. At Deloitte Consulting LLP, we work with clients to make sense of these challenges, driving application performance and achieving better business results. Providing a full range of industry leading services, including digital, systems integration and resource planning, we enable clients to fine tune Application Management Services to their IT and business objectives. Learn more about our Application Management Services practice.
  • Experienced in Informatica MDM Development including a strong understanding of MDM, ETL and BI Architectures. Expertise should include requirement analysis, application design, development, automation testing, integration and support of business applications in various stages of the software development life cycle.

  • MDM development may include MDM Admin duties (such as security or promoting code to production), production support and projects. The candidate may work in various roles such as MDM/ETL/BI Developer and Data Modeler demonstrating a strong understanding of many business processes and technical fields. Other skills beneficial to the role:
    Provided Informatica MDM Admin support the organization during submission cycles. This includes working with MDM users and approvers to resolve MDM issues in the IDD.


  • Designed/architected and implement end-to-end Informatica MDM solutions using the following development tools
    • Informatica MDM Hub

    • Informatica Data Director (IDD)

    • Informatica IDQ

    • Informatica PowerCenter

    • SAP Power Designer (process flow designing)


  • Designed and implement Business Process workflows using BPM technologies tied to MDM solutions
    • Informatica BPM (Active VOS)

    • Informatica SIF (SDK) API’s

    • Messaging triggers and queues

    • Strong data analyst experience


  • Performed development with following languages: SQL and PL/SQL, Java, UNIX, TOAD

  • Familiar with ETL mappings, User Exits, Match rules etc.

  • Experience with design and/or understand complex data models

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE
  • Minimum 6+ years Informatica experience

  • Experience leading, mentoring and managing offshore teams

  • Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience

Required Experience
  • MDM Admin Experience (security composites, IDD, promoting code)

  • At ease communicating with accounting users and leaders at all levels.

  • Informatica IDD experience, the MDM users perform maintenance and workflow for cost center and financial hierarchies in the IDD.

  • Workflow experience and custom user exits (Java programming)

  • Bulk Upload processing from excel template

  • Strong solutions design and development expertise, knowledge of computer systems and tool capabilities (and limitations), understanding of enterprise data warehousing concepts and patterns and sound business knowledge in order to meet the needs of client(s).

  • Experience working in complex Informatica and similar environments performing systems (i.e.: system level applications) analysis, design, development and unit testing of software applications from user requirements

Preferred Experience
  • 5+ years of Informatica suite experience including MDM (Hub and IDD), and Power Center Knowledge, Power Exchange, Data Quality and/or Data Virtualization are a plus.

  • Proven expertise in MDM Hierarchies, MDM Admin & ActiveVos

  • Provide expertise from a deep exposure to multiple platform integration points including: SAP ECC, BPC, BW, Oracle 11G, HANA

  • Provide domain experience in Finance preferred (Cost Center, Profit Center, Business Unit and VP Hierarchies)

  • Other relevant experience – MS Excel macro and VB scripting for mass upload template modifications

  • Understanding of the banking industry or SAP FI (Cost Center, Profit Center, General Ledger, Accounts Payable, Fixed Assets, Payment Flow)

  • Workflow experience and custom user exits (Java programming)

  • MDM Bulk Upload processing from excel template

How you’ll grow
At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs at Deloitte University, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

Benefits
At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Link

Deloitte’s culture
Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. Learn more about Life at Deloitte.

Corporate citizenship
Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities. Learn more about Deloitte’s impact on the world.

Recruiter tips
We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you’re applying to. Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals
title: Informatica MDM Development Lead / Administrator

description:
Senior Data Analyst
We werefounded to do one thing and one thing only - to seriously make online shopping simpler and more convenient. We deliver customers online orders right from a retailers website directly to each customers door. Data is the cornerstone of our business, and you will provide analytical support for all business intelligence activities.
As Senior Data Analyst you will facilitate the design effort on a variety of projects in a highly collaborative, fast-paced environment. Your role is to deliver detailed use cases, process flows, business rules, and assist in guiding the business decision process. You will work closely with team members throughout the organization in data analytics necessary to drive customer experience and operational economics. You will drive the system and requirements analysis and help in the discussions to refine the requirement and what is possible to be implemented in the agreed timeframe for the project.
Responsibilities
? Partner with Logistics, Operations, Sales, Finance, and Product stakeholders to prioritize analysis activities and reporting requirements in support of company goals
? Lead analysis activities that underpin strategic decisions, optimize delivery execution, and measure and motivate our crowd-sourced drivers
? Problem solve how specific metrics need to be generated and, when required, work with the product and engineering teams to implement solutions (e.g. data gathering, gap analysis, work on submitted feature request or business requirement documents, file bugs etc).
? Pull and model data in order to create quantitative models including forecast, operational, financial, and statistical models of business trends
? Publish and track key metrics via dashboards, scorecards, and share ad-hoc analysis with both internal and external stakeholders.
? Drive ongoing data cleansing/data improvement tasks.
? Support and operationalize the reporting of key performance indicators
Qualifications
? 5+ years of analytical work experience in high data volume environments (preferably in internet, software, media, or financial industries)
? Demonstrated track record in the development and delivery of reporting and analysis in a demanding business environment
? Strong analytical skills with the ability to extract and integrate data from various platforms or sources
? Exceptional verbal and written communication skills with a demonstrable track record of effectively partnering with technical, business, and operational colleagues.
? Knowledge of data mining and data validation
? Experience writing SQL and knowledge of database infrastructure a plus
? Knowledge of or experience with the Looker Business Intelligence platform is a plus.
? B.S. in Business Administration, Computer Science or related field, Masters degree a plus.
title: Sr. Data Analysis

description:
Description:
Providence is calling a full time, day shift Clinical Data Analyst for the Institute for Human Caring at Providence TrinityCare Hospice in Torrance, California

In this position you will:
Support the CMO ( Chief Medical Officer ) and Quality Improvement Director to measure the quality of whole person care at the Providence facilities.

Be responsible for report and dashboard design, data retrieval, report generation, data analysis, statistical analysis, dashboard updates and maintenance.

Be responsible for supporting a number of projects with varying complexity and reporting requirements.

Qualifications:
Required qualifications for this position include:
Information technology background

minimum 2 years industry related experience

Strong relational database knowledge

Strong computer skills ( i.e., word processing, spreadsheets, databases, statistical packages, PowerPoint ).

Proficient with project design, project management, data entry, data quality control.

Competent in research skills ( i.e., problem solving, questioning, listening, innovating ).

Competent in written and oral communication and organization skills.

Proficient with statistical analysis, interpretations and feedback to clinical managers.

Excellent written and verbal communications skills

Preferred qualification for this position include:
Experience in healthcare preferred ( hospital, lab, physician offices, etc )

Bachelor of Science degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Science is strongly preferred

Six sigma experience a plus

Ability to write advanced queries using SQL

Advanced Access database design and management

Demonstrated ability to graphically display and present analytic data

About the ministry you will serve:
The Providence Institute for Human Caring is leading a transformation of health services to emphasize whole person care.

Dr. Ira Byock, a national expert on palliative care, leads the Institute for Human Caring. Under his guidance, the Institute is working to encourage patients to talk with their doctors and families about what kind of care they want through the end of life. This is the first step toward whole person care.

Most Americans want to spend their final days at home, surrounded by loved ones. Yet about 70 percent of people spend their last days in hospitals or nursing homes. This can deprive patients and their families of the comfort they need at a difficult and emotional time. The Institute for Human Caring believes whole person care can help change this. The result will be better care and support for everyone who is sick, and their families.

We offer a full comprehensive range of benefits - see our website for details

http://www.providenceiscalling.jobs/rewards-benefits/

Our Mission

As people of Providence, we reveal God's love for all, especially the poor and vulnerable, through our compassionate service.

About Us

Providence Health & Services is the third largest not-for-profit health system in the United States. Providence employs more than 76,000 caregivers (employees) across a five-state area; AK, WA, MT, OR, and CA. Our facilities include 34 hospitals, 475 physician clinics, senior services, supportive housing and other health and educational services. Providence is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Providence does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, disability, veteran, military status, religion, age, creed, national origin, sexual identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, genetic information, or any other basis prohibited by local, state, or federal law.

Schedule: Full-time

Shift: Day

Job Category: Research Nursing

Location: California-Torrance

Req ID: 141387
title: Clinical Data Analyst - Institute for Human Caring ( Full Time - Day Shift )

description:
Are you a seasoned product manager looking to make a big impact, both directly and through a team of PMs, on a product that makes people’s lives better?
The everyday employees who use Yammer tell us that they feel smarter, more appreciated by their coworkers, and more connected to the jobs where they spend 8+ hours a day, every day. That’s what motivates us to come to work, support each other, and keep making our product better.

Is this the right job for you?
• You are passionate about growing a team, and empowering them to become future leaders.
• You believe that the best ideas should win, and you’re not afraid of advocating for or supporting a less popular idea on its merits. You are also not afraid to admit when you are wrong.
• You get excited about tackling big, complicated, and often ambiguous problems and have autonomy in decision making.
• You understand that human behavior is complex and changing behaviors is a lot harder than building features and technology.
• You love products - trying new things, asking yourself, why did they build it that way, questioning what would happen if you’re comfortable communicating and negotiating across the organization, you get your points across without being a jerk, and people like working with you even if they might disagree with you, you’ve got good UX instincts you won’t need to do your own design, but you’ll need to work effectively with your designer and researcher peers.
• You enjoy thinking analytically, you won’t be expected to write SQL queries, but you’ll need to work effectively with your data analyst peers.

This is what you’ll be doing:
• Manage a growing team of product managers (4-6 people)
• Suggest and lead changes in our organizational structure, execution, and systems.
• Collaborate with other leaders in product, design, research, analytics, and engineering to determine product strategy and prioritize what will bring the most value to our users and customers.
• Manage the product development process from conception through design, build, release, experimentation, analysis, and iteration.
• Analyze data to optimize performance and focus on the product areas with the highest potential to drive usage.
• Constantly learning, asking questions, being humble, and supporting your team members.
• Using the product, we’re building every day, and constantly questioning how we can make it more useful for our users and customers.
This is how we do it:
• Build iteratively, ship quickly, test our assumptions, and learn -- it keeps us humble.
• Rotate project areas and across product goals it keeps us from being silo’ed. This means your team will work on every aspect of the product.
• Bring in all the right resources (data analysts, research, design, copy, engineering) from the beginning, it keeps us respectful of a diversity of perspectives.

Required Qualifications:
• You have designed and shipped products that lots of people use and love. Depending on the size and type of teams/companies you have worked at in the past, that could translate to anywhere from 4-10+ years of experience.
• Previous experience as a people manager is a plus.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, marital status, pregnancy, protected veteran status, protected genetic information, political affiliation, or any other characteristics protected by local laws, regulations, or ordinances
title: Product Manager Lead

We are a successful growing company now over 30 years strong. We are currently hiring for a Positive, Energetic and Self-Motivated Team Member to join our Team!

description:
The Director, Fraud Risk Management is responsible for managing all aspects of Fraud Risk Management as it pertains to specific portfolios and channels of the business. This position is responsible for managing a team of people who will be responsible for short-term and long-term projects. The Director will set the vision for the group and working cross-functionally to execute profitable solutions.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Responsible for the leadership of the team – he/she must set vision, participate in short-term and long-term business planning, and effectively work as a liaison between Risk and the business.
  • Set strategy for application and existing customer fraud management.
  • Manage a team of individuals who can utilize database management, reporting and analysis software to store, organize and manipulate data.
  • Utilize advanced statistical software to develop tree-based and regression models to minimize credit/fraud losses and maximize response and approval rates.
  • Present findings and make recommendations to management team.
  • Work with third party data providers to negotiate costs and relationships.
  • Own and maintain the performance of certain KPI’s.
  • Must communicate effectively with other groups, ensure the team’s priorities are aligned with the company priorities, and ensure that he/she meets the prescribed goals.
  • Complete all other projects as assigned.

Experience and Education:
  • Minimum 4 year degree or equivalent experience (Computer Science, Math, or Business Degree preferred)
  • 7+ years data analyst/modeling experience.
  • Experience extracting and manipulating very large datasets (1 million+ records)
  • Experience with database query languages such as SAS and SQL.
  • Experience with statistical analysis and modeling software such as Excel, Word, Power Point, JMP, and/or Angoss Knowledge Studio.
  • Proven experience working in fast-paced environment with ever-changing demands.
  • Strong communication skills.
  • Experience in financial services fraud, risk management, or target marketing a plus.
Required Skills and Abilities:
  • Strong leader capable of high output.
  • Team player that is self-motivated and has excellent communication skills.
  • Collaborative work style that builds effective working relationships.
  • Ability to effectively work in a fast paced, rapidly changing environment.
  • Strong experience in business process improvement/process automation.
  • Excellent problem solving skills – must have the ability to be strategic in understanding and analyzing problems.
  • Works effectively in the face of stress and changing priorities.
title: Director, Fraud Risk Management

description:
Are you looking for an opportunity to use your technological vision, expertise and management talents for good? Do you love the idea of helping hundreds of thousands of homeless pets find their way out of shelters and into loving homes?

Our Mission

Adopt-a-Pet.com, North America’s largest non-profit adoptable-pet search engine, believes there’s a home for every shelter pet - they just need to be seen by the right person at the right time. By opening a virtual window into every shelter pet’s cage and letting potential adopters peek inside, we help over 17,000 animal shelters and rescue organizations connect their 250,000 homeless pets with our audience of 5 million online pet searchers each month.

The Team

We are a relatively small group of intelligent, mission driven, fun people who care deeply about helping companion animals. As a member of this extraordinary team, you will be instrumental in helping us maintain and develop our technical backbone to support innovation of our product now and into the future. Our team and those the CTO will manage are distributed primarily across a few key locations including Los Angeles, San Francisco, and Indiana. Our CTO should ideally be located either in Southern California or in Northern California/bay area. We work with a high degree of flexibility and autonomy from home offices most days and come together in our regional offices ideally at least one day a week. As an organization, we collaborate via Slack, video conferencing, Basecamp, email and phone.

CTO Role

Adopt-a-Pet.com is growing, and we’re looking for somebody who take us into a new era where our search results and content must be able to nimbly adapt to new devices and mediums, and work in conjunction with smart data analytics. We’re also hiring a Senior Data Analyst who reports to the CTO. We have just begun a re-architecture with the help of an offshore development partner to develop a microservices approach to our system in order to preserve our core database functionality and instances on AWS. We’re rewriting much of our existing Perl code using Node, Python and PHP and converting it all into RESTful APIs to talk to our database. We are revamping our Presentation Layer to be responsive and integrating a headless CMS and CRM solution. This is all in addition to other features we are maintaining using a variety of technologies and configurations. Although this work is largely underway, it has only just begun and you will take the reigns and shape the project using your expertise and vision.

Our ideal CTO candidate will have a track record of building and managing an engineering team (in house and off shore), working with technologies such as microservices, and managing a stack rearchitecture of the type we are undergoing. The CTO must balance crucial and ongoing business needs of a website with millions of visitors and myriad stakeholders and contractual relationships with the need to continuously improve user experience for our developers and customers now and into the future.

Responsibilities

The core responsibility of our CTO is to make sure our company's technology strategy serves its business strategy, and to hire and manage the operations of the engineering team and any supportive outsourcing. Points of responsibility include:

• Big picture knowledge of all our systems and capabilities

• As a key member of the executive team, collaborate to set the technical strategy for the organization

• Platform selection and technical design

• Owning the development methodology

• Setting realistic technical project budgets to be maintained by the project managers

• Providing options that meet changing business needs and present them to the larger executive team

• Finding the "80/20" - Helping the Product team know what might meet most of their objectives for much less cost and effort

• Growing other technical leaders within the company by challenging the other engineering team members to expand their skills

• Helping maintain a positive engineering culture

• Ability to lead a team through change while clearly articulating the vision at both the technical and business levels

• Be responsible for making sure the engineers write adequate specs, interface well with QA, and release quality product on time

• Manage the engineering team including personnel issues, conflict resolution, and decision-making regarding hiring/firing

• Ensure Adopt-a-Pet.com is following technology best practices and maintaining quality

• Being, along with our VP of Technical Strategy and Integration, the external face of the engineering team

Requirements: The ideal candidate has:
  • 10+ years of expertise building & leading engineering teams to deliver high quality customer experiences to millions of users.

  • You have a proven track record as an exceptional team builder. You understand how to identify, attract, and work with the absolute best. You can motivate a team to go further, do more and do better quality work than they think they can.

  • Experience architecting distributed systems, micro-services, and data tools to handle large scale, high throughput workloads.

  • You must have full stack experience across both web and mobile.

  • You must be exceptional at identifying and breaking down problems to find unique solutions.

  • Experience with a broad range of systems, API's, protocols, and standards.
    •
  • Experience working with industry standard testing and code quality frameworks.

Location:

The location is somewhat flexible and you can choose to work mostly from home. We have regional workspaces in San Francisco and Claremont, CA (Los Angeles county), and we’d love for you to be based in Southern or Northern California with the ability to drop into the appropriate workspace potentially once a week (this can be flexible). There is also the potential for travel.

Benefits: Adopt-a-Pet.com offers:

Competitive salary, great benefits (fully-paid family medical, dental, vision and a 401K plan with company matching, unlimited vacation days), mega-flexibility, work-life balance, and a growing team of highly-motivated, smart people to collaborate with.
title: Chief Technology Officer - CTO

description:
At Mission Hospital with locations in Mission Viejo and Laguna Beach, CA our core values of Dignity, Service, Excellence and Justice translate into an environment where the welfare of our patients always comes before the bottom line. As non-profit acute care facilities, we serve all of south Orange County. Mission Hospital Mission Viejo is a Level II Trauma Center and is the area's designated regional trauma center. We have Centers of Excellence in heart, maternity, trauma, breast care, spine, vascular, stroke and brain injury. Mission Hospital Laguna Beach provides local coastal communities with 24-hour emergency department services, medical/surgical services, behavioral health programs including inpatient and outpatient psychiatric and chemical dependency services and an outpatient eating disorder program. Mission Surgery Center performs approximately 4,500 annual surgeries and provides a safe and convenient outpatient setting. It is accredited by the Accreditation Association of Ambulatory Health Care. We are a member of the St. Joseph Health System, one of only 12 winners worldwide of the Gallup Organization's Great Workplace Award, which recognizes an 'extraordinary ability to create an engaged workplace culture'; we've received two Beacon Awards for clinical excellence and in 2012 we received Magnet Designation which recognizes hospitals for top patient care, quality nursing and innovations in nursing and healthcare. We offer a collegial work environment with competitive salaries and benefits. Mission Hospital provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Mission Hospital complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
The Trauma Performance Improvement (PI) Coordinator works with the Trauma Data Analyst to maintain the Trauma Registry according to ACS-COT and OCEMS requirements. This position is intended to help enhance operational function and efficiency, quality of care, and to support the overall trauma performance improvement program at Mission Hospital.


Responsibilities include:
  • Accurate retrieval, compilation, registration, submission and presentation of clinical study data
  • Provide analytical support to Mission Hospital trauma services operations and patient care delivery.
  • Assists in the dissemination of results/findings and maintain communication patterns with physicians, hospital staff and study sponsors.
Professional Experience Requirements
  • Three years clinical experience.
  • Strong analytical, organizational, interpersonal, leadership, and customer service skills.
  • Knowledge of hospital operations including clinical, financial, and support activities.
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office products such as Word, Excel, Publisher , and Access.
  • Excellent communication, including writing/composition skills
  • Demonstrated knowledge of systems analysis, critical thinking, problem solving, and ability to manage multiple priorities.
  • Proven track record of working effectively in a flexible work environment with a results-oriented approach.
Preferred Education
  • Bachelors or Master Degree, preferably in Nursing/Administration, Hospital or Health Services Administration, or Business Administration

License/Certification Requirements
  • Current California RN License
  • American Heart Association (AHA) BLS and ACLS for Healthcare Provider

This job code does not have a prepopulated job description. You must manually add the job description to this requisition in order to post.
Organization
title: RN Trauma Coordinator - (Performance Improvement Nurse)

description:
Are you a professional seller, experienced in selling to marketers? If so then we may have a great opportunity for you! Aberdeen Group is seeking a ROCK STAR to join our growing sales team.
Why this opportunity is exciting? The Aberdeen brand is a recognized, established and trusted brand offering content marketing and demand generation solutions. We recently added capabilities related to marketing data and analytics and are on the verge of launching new products in the market that are highly differentiated. With private equity backing and a global footprint, we are poised for growth with a culture of innovative thinking, results orientation, and holding each other accountable.

Plus, we’re a pretty fun bunch!

The Sales Executive’s role is to generate new client revenue and grow existing relationships using a combination of consultative selling and challenger sales techniques to build advisor relationships with clients. Sellers are supported by our marketing team with best in class demand generation, nurture programs, customer marketing and pipeline acceleration. Sales development reps help set appointments for you from marketing leads.

Compensation is limited only by your performance. We offer a competitive and rewarding commission plan with mid and end of year incentive bonuses (in addition to commission plan). We have great benefits including a 401k program with generous immediate company match.

Essential Functions & Responsibilities Function Specific:
  • Meet and exceed monthly, quarterly, and yearly sales revenue objectives.
  • Research, analyze, and qualify opportunities (assess client need) in assigned territory.
  • Prospect and contact business executives each day to schedule phone and on site appointments to analyze business processes, question for understanding, schedule customized product demonstrations, and manage stages of the sales process to conclusion.
  • Willingness to travel up to 50% of the time.
  • Demonstrate proficiency with a consultative sales methodology that focuses on developing a clear understanding of a client’s organizational and departmental business needs.
  • Manage CRM database of customer contacts and progress through pipeline development steps.
  • Forecast expected revenue from pipeline on a monthly basis with weekly progress updates.
  • Develop and maintain a detailed knowledge of Aberdeen Market Intelligence solutions and associated value propositions.
  • Be a strong team member and enjoy working in a team environment.



Critical Working Relationships
  • In our business, it is critical that a successful Sr. Sales Executive be a strong team member and enjoy working in a team environment.
  • The most critical working relationship for the Sr. Sales Executive is the client relationship. The typical sales exec. manages relationships with at least 20 major clients and often up to 75 key clients. Client relationships are at the manager/director level and often require the ability to navigate the C-suite.
  • The Sr. Sales Executive will work with the sales support team, Sales Engineer, Data Analyst and Client Project Manager.

Qualifications Education:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Marketing or Communications preferred and/or equivalent experience and formal training in consultative sales approach will help ensure success.
Experience/Knowledge/Skills:
  • 5+ years of demonstrable consultative sales success in a role requiring prospecting, cold-calling, analyzing, and closing new business.
  • Must be comfortable discussing business value, ROI, market factors and general business conditions; know the basics of how sales, marketing, and business development work together to achieve revenue goals.
  • Must be knowledgeable of business marketing and sales functions and how market intelligence is used to target new business opportunities, especially within the IT/Telecom space.
  • Direct experience selling data-driven marketing services and/or related marketing technologies (sales automation tools, marketing platforms) is preferred.
  • Must have proven past ability in consistently achieving and exceeding sales plan.
  • Prior experience selling business / marketing services, or IT products / services directly to decision makers in sales or marketing organizations.
  • Internet and computer savvy, familiar with the full suite of MS office products.
  • Experience managing sales activity through a CRM application is preferred.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills are required.
  • Ability to make a high volume of calls per day and communicate across technology verticals.
  • Self-motivated with minimum supervision, possess an excellent work ethic, and have a commitment to growth in a sales career.
title: Sr. Sales Executive

description:
Large healthcare client in the Sorrento Valley area is currently searching for a Data Analyst/Data Programmer to join their team! Working in a tight knit team with a relatively hands off manager, this Analyst/Programmer will be developing/maintaining software applications (utilizing SQL, T-SQL and EDI) to aid in brand new client implementations for their robust SaaS applications. Fantastic benefits, a work life balance that truly exists (instead of what most companies claim and then fail to back up), a manager that embraces/encourages exponential growth and perks on par with the standard that companies such as Google and Amazon have touted.

Ideal candidates would have 3-7 years of experience as either a Data Analyst, Data Engineer or DBA, solid grasp of SQL, understanding of EDI and a desire to work with enormous data sets.

Does this sound like it could be your next possible opportunity? If so, please apply and send your resume directly to jmcmillin@provenrecruiting.com and we'll reach out to see how this could be the next step in your career!
