description:
NCSOFT West Mobile, a software development company focused on making high-quality, cutting-edge, and conceptually innovative free-to-play mobile games, is seeking a talented Senior Product Manager to join our team of mobile developers working on an unannounced Original IP, in our San Mateo studio. We are highly collaborative and always searching for ways to engage players in a creative way.

As a Senior Product Manager, you will guide and drive the long term revenue strategy for high fidelity, deeply monetizing, midcore mobile games. You'll utilize a deep understanding of the competitor and market space, along with qualitative and quantitative data to optimize your game through new features, live events, sales, and economy balancing. You will own the live success of your product, partnering with the marketing, data science, and development teams to hold the high level strategy and drive execution.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Guide the strategy for the product, new features, and acquisition of new users
  • Continuously research the existing market space of mobile users, along with the competitive space in order to hold an intelligent, informed opinion on major risks and opportunities for the product
  • Leverage user research, market research, and analytics data to build a deep understanding for the game and the players, identifying ways to further grow strengths and bolster against weaknesses
  • Build models and forecasts in excel to prioritize predict the impact of new features
  • Design and own new features
  • Work with the design team to create feature specs
  • Drive and own new features, collaborating with designers, artists, and engineers to find optimal solutions and ensuring that the execution and implementation of the feature continues to align with the strategy for the feature and the high level strategy for the product
  • Evaluate current and proposed features for their impact on KPIs
  • Build models to forecast player engagement and behavior around game systems
  • Run the live operations of the game through events, price optimization, and game balance.
  • Set goals and expectations for new features, events, and sales
  • Work with the data analytics team to define and measure KPIs and metrics, create dashboards, and monitor game performance
  • Analyze user data, evaluating the success of existing operations and new opportunities for game features or further optimizations
  • Report regularly on the health and success of the product
  • Mentor other Product Managers in monetization design, the competitor space, and best practices in development, analysis and research
REQUIREMENTS:
  • 3+ years of product management experience in the development and live operations of f2p games.
  • Communication skills. You take complicated concepts and break them into comfortable pieces. You're practically a mind reader in conversations, finding misunderstandings or miscommunications and resolving them effortlessly.
  • Collaboration and leadership. You can find the right strategic vision for your colleagues and rally them behind it. You help the team build the best solution to the problem, and keep everyone focused on the high level picture.
  • Analytical skills. You can crank out A/B test analyses in your sleep and dig into noisy data to find a strong signal.
  • Microsoft Excel skills. You breathe formulas, charts, models, pivot tables, and forecasting.
PLUSES:
  • Direct work experience on strategy or RPG mobile f2p games with deep systems
  • Experience as an economy designer, data analyst, software engineer, financial analyst or consultant
  • SQL, tableau, and other data analysis and data visualization tools
  • Basic programming and scripting knowledge
  • Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Economics, Finance, Computer Science, Engineering
  • MBA
title: Senior Product Manager

description: Job Description
title: Data Analyst

description:
Hightail is transforming how marketing and creative teams collaborate to create innovative campaigns and content. Conceived and built in partnership with leading marketing and creative professionals, Hightail makes it easy (and dare we say fun?) for clients, internal teams, agencies and freelancers to share, contribute, feedback, improve and approve creative content, projects and campaigns.

Our Sr. Customer Insights Manager will be responsible for working in a cross-functional capacity to recognize and analyze key performance indicators as well as provide actionable analytical insight for Hightail’s core business. Working with our business intelligence and data warehousing team, the Sr. Customer Analyst will collaborate with stakeholders in the Product, Marketing, Finance and Sales teams to uncover and understand usage trends, correlate user behavior with desired outcomes, increase conversion rates and optimize customer lifetime value. In addition, a key responsibility will be to define and execute A/B tests, with the goal of ensuring timely and accurate results that will, in turn, feed into actionable insights and optimizations for product features, user interface and messaging.
Your analysis and recommendations will strongly influence organization-level strategy, processes and decisions. Your quantitative skills, strategic insights and ad-hoc analytical curiosity will make you an intricate part of the team, where decisions are informed by data, and innovation is supported by a test & learn culture.
Key Responsibilities
Define, execute and disseminate reports and dashboards using Snowflake, ThoughtSpot, Heap, Tableau, Excel and other tools.
Work with BI team to ensure all tracking, tagging, ETL and any other necessary data sources are properly configured.
Drive A/B testing activities based on product strategy and roadmap, including definition and communication of test plans, test execution, and interpretation of results using Optimizely or similar A/B testing tool.
Manage relationships and communication with different A/B test and other analytics vendors.
Perform ad-hoc analysis based on user-level data, as well as cohort/segment analysis, to identify trends and causal relationships.
Pull data (typically daily) about site and/or mobile app activities using Heap, Thoughtspot, and Snowflake and analyze user data using Excel, Python, and other tools to manipulate data.
Develop predictive models around key customer outcomes, particularly conversion and churn.
Measure and help develop recommendations to improve KPIs, such as CPA, paid conversion rate, Daily & Monthly Active Users, churn, etc.
Ensure accuracy of data capture and reporting across multiple tools
Prioritize multiple projects across the organization and respond quickly to stakeholders. Manage and keep track of all open issues and ensure issues are resolved in timely manner
Personal Qualifications
Strong intellectual aptitude and curiosity regarding business performance, consumer research and analytical tools to measure performance.
Passion for effective data visualization - creating reports, dashboards and analytics to generate business insights and ensure ready consumption of data by executives.
Excellent communication skills - interpersonal, written and presentation.
Team collaboration - ability to collaborate with business and technical stakeholders, make data driven recommendations, and ensure common understanding with timely problem-solving.
BA/BS Degree from top school/program in computer science, statistics, or advanced mathematics.
Sense of humor.
Required Experience
5+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, Business Analyst or other Data Analysis role.
2+ years of experience working on A/B and Multivariate Testing on site and mobile channels/applications.
Hands-on experience working with a variety of testing and analytics tools including:
Testing – Adobe Target, Optimizely, or equivalents.
Web Reporting – Adobe Analytics , Google Analytics, Heap, IBM Coremetrics or equivalents.
DB and Repositories - Snowflake or equivalent.
Data Aggregation and Visualization – Thoughtspot, Tableau or equivalents.
Excel – strong skills including the ability to manipulate and visualize large quantities of data; must have deep familiarity with pivot tables, charts and macros.
Ability to program in Python, R [other languages] to pull and manipulate data strongly desired.

description:
The people of St. Joseph Health have worked for 53 years to improve health and quality of life in California's North Bay region, starting in Sonoma County, where the Sisters of St. Joseph of Orange opened the doors of Santa Rosa Memorial Hospital in 1950. Today, we continue the mission begun by the Sisters and continued through the St. Joseph Health Ministry of extending the healing ministry of Jesus to those we serve through an integrated spectrum of primary, urgent, acute, outpatient, palliative care and regional referral services. Sonoma County entities aligned with St. Joseph Health include the 278-bed Santa Rosa Memorial Hospital, the region's only Level II trauma center, as well as the 80-bed Petaluma Valley Hospital. Our services also encompass three Urgent Care centers, Hospice of Petaluma, Memorial Hospice and North County Hospice, the Annadel Medical Group, as well as the St. Joseph Home Care Network. We act as a regional referral hub for outlying hospitals, while also providing outpatient behavioral health care, education to promote health and prevent chronic disease, rehabilitation, oral health care, community benefit programs, and more, all fostering health and quality of life throughout the area. St. Joseph Health provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, St. Joseph Health complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
The Infection Prevention Specialist will support the organization's Infection Control Program. As an Infection Prevention professional, the employee will provide consultation, and support to all facility operations with professional accountability in the following functions: surveillance, epidemiological studies, outbreak control, data management and reporting, education, monitoring, consultation, and performance improvement.

This position will focus on a sound ongoing knowledge of the Joint Commission's National Patient Safety Goals and regulatory mandates (SB 1058, 158, 739 and 1301) as they pertain to the organization's culture of safety. On a regular basis and as new information pertinent to the National Patient Safety Goals (NPSGs) and regulatory mandates becomes available the Infection Control Data Analyst will be responsible for providing the organization's Patient Safety, Infection Control and Institutional Quality Committees with organization-wide data that demonstrates compliance.

The Infection Prevention Specialist will aggregate, review, analyze and enter data that supports the organization's Patient Safety and Infection Control Programs. This includes interfacing with the Centers for Disease Control and California Department of Public Health (CDPH) by providing them with reports, including written summaries, data, information on special projects and compliance documentation. The Infection Control Data Analyst will perform extensive research that will substantiate clinical data reports by identifying supportive data. This position functions with minimal guidance. Exceptional skill in prioritizing and handling multiple tasks is essential. Must have the ability to effectively present data and communicate infectious disease and statistical concepts to all audiences.

Minimum Position Qualifications:
Education: Bachelor’s degree in Nursing or appropriately related health care field, e.g., Microbiology, Certified Lab Scientist, Public Health, etc.
Experience: Minimum two years’ experience in acute care hospital/ clinical setting
Training: Attends basic course in Infection Control within first year as deemed
necessary by IC Manager
License / Certification: Current California Licensure as a Registered Nurse as appropriate.

Preferred Position Qualifications:
- Master’s degree in Nursing, Public Health, or equivalent related healthcare field.
- Lean/Six Sigma experience/training preferred.
- Certification in Infection Control (CIC)
- Experience in infection control, public health, microbiology, and teaching

Essential Functions:
1. ICPs collaboratively administer the infection control program on assigned campuses throughout Sonoma County using an integrated approach to achieve improvement of infection control and health care outcomes in a cost-effective manner.
2. Management of critical data and information through:
• Surveillance for endemic nosocomial rates
• Outbreak detection and control
• Special projects and studies utilizing epidemiological principles and statistical techniques
• Identification and monitoring of antibiotic resistant organisms
• Documentation and reporting
• Benchmarking with internal, local and national data
3. Collaboration to achieve and maintain accreditation readiness and compliance with regulatory agencies in all infection control standards including, JCAHO, DHS, CMS, and OSHA. Includes reporting communicable diseases to the appropriate agencies.
4. Development of integrated, area-wide policies and procedures related to infection control, which are practical, scientifically valid and result in improved outcomes for patients, staff, and visitors.
5. Education, training, and leadership
• Planning and development of educational offerings for individuals and groups of various sizes, purposes, and educational levels. Continual monitoring and training on patient care practices.
6. Consultation and collaboration in infection control matters:
• Provided to administration and management, hospital and clinic staff, physicians, patients, visitors, Medical Access, Home Care, Hospice, Behavioral Health, and outside agencies.
• Acts as a liaison to the general public
• Serves as Infection Control resource on Medication and Nutrition Team, Pharmacy and Therapeutics Committee and its subcommittees (e.g., Antibiotic Use Team), Safety Committee, and the Product Evaluation Committee, for respective campuses.
• Participates as needed in county-wide meetings related to infection control.
7. Performance Improvement
• Works collaboratively with physicians and staff throughout the organization to identify opportunities for improvement in infection prevention, formulate action plans and evaluate effectiveness.
• Facilitates patient teams to achieve specified outcomes.
• Participates in achievement of core measure benchmarks.
• Implements IHI bundles and SJHS goals to achieve improvements in infection prevention.
8. Infection Control Committee
• Prepares reports for the Committee
• Prepares and submits reports to medical staff departments and committees as indicated.

Additional Responsibilities:
1. Represents the organization in the local community as required.
2. Represents Infection Control on committees and teams, as assigned, and serves as a resource on infection control practices, requirements, research, and recommendations.
3. Participates in local chapter of Associated Practitioners in Infection Control and Prevention (APIC).
4. Other duties as assigned.

Knowledge / Skills / Abilities:
1. Mechanisms of disease transmission
2. Basic medical microbiology
3. Patient care practices
4. Adult learning theory
5. Mechanisms of cost containment
6. Effective leadership techniques
7. Understanding of research principles
8. Computer literacy, i.e. accessing internet, word processing, spreadsheets, databases, graphics, flowcharting and e-mail
9. Concepts and techniques of performance improvement
10. Basic knowledge of statistics
11. Legislative and regulatory processes
12. Data input, data processing, data analysis, graphic presentation of same, database management
13. Federal, state, and local regulations pertaining to infection control
14. Independent decision making and ability to work with minimal supervision
15. Ability to multi-task and prioritize
16. Effective communication skills and diplomacy

Organization
title: Infection Prevention Specialist - RN - CIC - Performance Improvement - 8hr Full-time Day

description:
Make an impact in your community by bringing your professional skills and expertise to nonprofits and social change organizations. Taproot Foundation makes it easy for you to make a difference.

The Taproot Foundation is a nonprofit organization that connects nonprofits and other social change organizations with skilled volunteers through pro bono service. We power collaboration that connects communities and drives social change.

Taproot offers a range of opportunities to engage in meaningful pro bono work, depending on the time you have available. You can work on a large-scale team-based project over several months, tackle more bite-sized challenges that can be delivered in a day, or address needs that fall in between. Taproot has virtual opportunities and in-person engagements. We’ve got many options to suit your interest!

Now it’s your turn to join the movement and Make It Matter ©.

We are currently looking for Data Analysts to support Program Measurement projects. This opportunity is flexible enough to work around the schedule of a full-time job.

You’ll:
  • Expand your social and professional networks
  • Deepen your connection with your community
  • Build leadership skills, and demonstrate your talents
The Data Analyst is the lead on analyzing existing program data for the nonprofit and, on some larger projects, developing a program dashboard. On those projects, they map and analyze the quality of existing program data, define the data requirements for the dashboard, and build out the program dashboard. This person should be a data and Excel expert.

A successful Data Analyst has 3-5 years of data experience.

Learn more and apply today: http://www.taprootfoundation.org/do-probono/individuals/apply
title: Data Analysts Needed for Pro Bono Program Measurement Projects

description:
ABOUT TINYCO
TinyCo, a Jam City-owned company, is a San Francisco studio at the forefront of bringing the world’s most popular entertainment franchises to mobile games. Our titles, including Family Guy: The Quest for Stuff and Marvel Avengers Academy, have been downloaded more than 115 million times and in the process, have won several “Best Game” awards. And with huge Hollywood properties on the horizon, we’re just getting started!

As gamers ourselves, we attribute our success to our passionate team. Our mission is to make millions of people happy five minutes at a time. We believe when you staff a team with creative people, cut away bureaucracy, and add in heavy doses of fun & challenge, you get award-winning results!

ABOUT THE ROLE
We’re currently looking for an exceptional Senior Monetization Manager to drive in-game monetization across our existing games. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment and has strong analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills. With the success of our current games & new games on the horizon, we’ll need a motivated go-getter to join our team!

WHAT YOU GET TO DO EVERY DAY
Analyze player purchase behavior based on game data
Create, drive and optimize CRM sales to drive in-game monetization
Communicate promotions, sales and events to players via in-game and out-game channels
Optimize monetization through game data analysis of the in-game economy
Create and analyze new reporting tools to obtain qualitative information driving your decision
Run A/B testing on promotional sales art to maximize conversion
Collaborate & coordinate with the product team to achieve those goals in a fast moving environment
Improve on existing and new features to improve conversion and monetization
Be an authority in the purchasing psychology of payers and non-payers

WHAT WE EXPECT FROM YOU
Minimum of 3 years of experience in the gaming industry as a Monetization Manager or Product Manager, with a focus on CRM sales
Strong data analysis and problem-solving skills (previous experience as Data Analysts applicable)
Passion and deep understanding of free-to-play mobile games, of course!
BA/BS or higher in CS/EE/Engineering/Mathematics/Statistics/Economics, or related field

NICE TO HAVE
Knowledge of mobile technology -- its boundaries and unique potential as it applies to games
UA and/or Marketing experience
MBA

RELATED KEYWORDS
Economy, monetization, retention, revenue, data, data analyst, data analysis, product manager, analytics, road map, roadmap, features, design

WE ARE AWESOME. YOU WANT TO WORK HERE.
title: Senior Monetization Manager

description:
Position: Sr ETL Developer (Datastage)

Location: Culver City 90232

The job is to build a DataMart solution for one of the LOB. This role is for the ETL Developer who comes with hands on experience in different integration (ETL) tools like DataStage. Teradata experience in terms of understanding the MPP architecture, use of load utilities to process data is must. Build a DataMart using data from different sources and considering the end reporting needs. Good understanding on data modelling especially physical data models to design the ETL mappings. Will work with Business Users or Functional experts to identify the data sources for various reporting needs and construct data mapping rules from source to target DataMart.

  • The person will either come with Media & Entertainment experience or will have a strong desire to learn.
  • Expertise in Financial area is an added advantage.
  • Should have good working experience in Agile development methodology.

Responsibilities include:

  • Interacting with Users and SMEs to understand reporting requirements and identify the data sources to fulfill those reporting requirements
  • Develop source to target mappings
  • Design, develop and test ETL data work flows.
  • Building a reconciliation and exception processes to keep the data accurate for reporting and to keep checks and balances with source data
  • Ensure to deliver optimized ETL design to achieve acceptable performance and utilize the database and ETL resources effectively
  • Strong UNIX development skills to write wrapper scripts for scheduling ETL workflows
  • Data analyst skills to determine root cause problems for data integrity and data quality issues identified through QA or by business report owners
  • Working with Reporting teams to facilitate delivering the reporting solutions
  • Should be able to estimate the work and provide delivery timelines
  • Should be familiar with HADOOP or any other BI Cloud technologies like Snowflake etc

Qualifications:

  • Hand on experience with DataStage and Teradata is must
  • Data Warehouse database platforms –Teradata experience is must
  • Knowledge on Business Objects and Tableau reporting/dashboarding tools
  • Knowledge and experience of at least one data profiling tool (experience with Information Analyzer is an added advantage)
  • Experience on relational databases like Oracle
  • Entertainment industry business models and data knowledge a plus
  • Strong with data modeling concepts (star schemas, snowflake schemas, highly normalized data models), and familiarity with data modeling tools is an added advantage
  • Familiar with physical database administration concepts such as table partitioning, materialized views, indexing strategies, aggregate navigation and their role within the decision support environment
  • Familiar with source control tools such as SVN
  • Excellent SQL programming skills
  • Excellent problem solving skills
  • Excellent communication skills with both business and technical customers
title: Sr ETL Developer (Datastage)

title: GSST Data Analyst I

description:
Captiv8 is looking for an energetic, experienced, and amazing Product Owner! This person will handle the vision, platform, and execution of the largest social media marketplace on the planet. Captiv8 helps brands and creators connect to impact audiences around the world. As more and more millennials start shifting away from TV and consuming more content on Youtube, Snapchat, Instagram, Vine, and other platforms, the creators building that content need a platform that empowers them to manage their audiences, grow their audiences and make money. Captiv8 is that platform!

About Captiv8:
Our founding team is made up of great individuals that have over $1B in acquisitions, managed over $600M+ in revenue and taken two companies public. Our last venture was one of the largest monetization platforms on the planet for the mobile-first economy.

Captiv8 is a global platform connecting and delivering influencers, audiences and brands at scale: we work with top Fortune 500 brands like Adidas, Starbuck, Disney, Amazon, Microsoft and many others. Our platform features passionate influencers across Instagram, Snapchat, Vine, Youtube and other networks. The audience makeup is truly global with over 850 million total audience reach spanning the top social networks.

Captiv8 is backed by incredible institutions including Social+Capital, Subtraction Capital, Launch Fund and many others.

Director of Product Description:
We are looking for a seasoned product management professional with strong domain expertise in social media across Instagram, vine, snapchat, twitter, and facebook to lead end-to-end product management efforts for a suite of media planning and data products. The Director, Product Management will define the product strategy, develop the product roadmap, identify product requirements, establish priorities, and collaborate with business stakeholders across the organization and within the brands and the service teams supporting large brands and influencers.

The individual must have strong leadership and formal product management methodology experience blended with several years of practical experience, resulting in proven success launching new products. The candidate must also have extensive experience working with all levels of the organization (executive, to developer, to data analyst) The person must have a minimum of 5+ years of overall experience, including at least 3-5 years in product management. Must have a strong “presence” and the ability to drive change in the organization. The candidate, while possessing a strong background in formal methodologies MUST have a proven ability to be effective in a creative, unstructured culture.

This is a great opportunity to be a part of a proven team and come in at the ground level.

Responsibilities:
  • Lead the full product lifecycle for a suite of products or services covering concept, specification, design, launch, and enhancement phases.
  • Develop a comprehensive product roadmap for the media planning products/services and related data to deliver against business goals.
  • Conduct market research and engage with internal customers, clients, prospects and external partners to identify market needs and opportunities.
  • Collaborate with a broad set of business and technology stakeholders to understand current product capabilities and identify gaps.
  • Consolidate, rationalize, and prioritize market requirements into the product roadmap to define go-to-market strategy and timeline for product features and enhancements
  • Define success metrics and be accountable to them.
  • Design functional specifications and make feature, resource, and timeline trade-off decisions.
  • Collaborate closely with engineering leaders and their teams through all stages of the product development. Take on 'Product Owner' role on scrum teams.
  • Lead and coordinate product rollout efforts with marketing, sales and other client facing teams. Collaborate with marketing and customer training groups for collateral on overall offering including white papers, case studies, demos, training material, etc.
  • Act as the key product evangelist and expert for internal teams as well as external users.
  • Work with offshore engineering teams.
  • Huge plus if you can speak Russian, optional
Experience/Skills Required:
  • University degree in the field of computer science or business administration. Master’s or PhD. degree in one these fields desirable.
  • Minimum 3 - 5 years experience in product management and/or product marketing in a technology field.
  • Proven track record of setting product development targets and delivering results a must, including experience authoring MRDs and PRDs.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills including presentation experience to large and diverse audiences.
  • Experience in strategic technology planning, execution, and policy development.
  • Excellent knowledge of media and/or advertising technology environments, including data management, media management and delivery, and back-office systems.
  • Solid understanding of computer systems characteristics, features, and integration capabilities.
  • Excellent understanding of project management principles.
  • Agile (Scrum) highly desired.
  • Proven experience in planning, organization, and development.
  • Demonstrated ability to apply technology solutions to business problems.
  • Ability to set and manage priorities judiciously.
  • Exceptionally self-motivated and directed.
  • Superior analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities.
  • Ability to motivate and collaborative in a highly matrixed environment.
  • Strong analytical skills evidenced by a proven ability to quantitatively and qualitatively analyse product concepts, strategic opportunities and competitive threats.
  • Aptitude for working with internal and external stakeholders to define requirements and quantify market opportunities - then driving them to realization.
  • Experience and/or strong desire to work in a high pressure, high demand entrepreneurial environment.
  • Ability to gain credibility quickly.
  • Action orientated, gets things done and makes decisions.
  • Excellent relationship builder.
  • Global citizen who has strong understanding and experience in rolling out products and services across multiple markets taking into account time zone and cultural challenges and differences.
  • Flexibility and adaptability while being able to drive organizational change is essential.
  • Must take action in solving problems while exhibiting judgment and a realistic understanding of issues.
  • Must have ability to solve problems and deal with a variety of variables in situations where limited or no standardization exists.
  • Must have ability to quickly assess situations, define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions.
  • Must have a strong understanding of business direction and needs.
title: Director of Product

description:
Employment Status: Full-time, probationary "exempt" position.

Work Schedule: Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

First Review Deadline: This position will remain open until filled. Applications will be reviewed beginning Monday, September 28, 2016.
Position Summary: Incumbents in positions at this level perform the full range of work related to program and policy research, analysis, development, evaluation, and/or operational and fiscal analysis related to an administrative specialty. Work requires applying a theoretical knowledge base to develop recommendations and conclusions. Incumbents often serve as program administrators.

Current employees will be given preferred consideration.

Under the general direction of the Associate Dean for Innovation, Collaborations and Quarter to Semester Conversion, execute strategic research projects on behalf of the Dean's office at the Jack Brown College of Business and Public Administration. Projects focus on the College's programmatic audiences and aim to promote evidence-based dialogs, decisions and assessments about the College's strategic plan and strategic initiatives, stewardship of the Jack Brown endowment for the College, and the quarter-to-semester conversion. The incumbent will collect, organize, and analyze information from the university's and college's various internal data systems as well as from external sources and using audience surveys and polls, and will respond to ad hoc requests for data and analysis. The candidate with have a dotted line relationship with the Office of Institutional Research. The incumbent will perform duties in the following program areas:

Coordinator, Business Intelligence:
Conduct data analysis, provide forecasts and predictions, and construct and maintain research databases. Develop models to support planning, enrollment management, decision-making, quarter-to-semester conversion, and accreditation.
Take ownership of projects from planning, design, execution, monitoring, writing of results, and dissemination of information. The incumbent will prepare static reports with both tabular and graphical presentations as well as web-based active reports.
Develop College-level processes and procedures to define, refine, implement, collect, report and analyze metrics, indicators and goals for Campus/College Strategic plans and various strategic initiatives.
Compile data and prepare annual, quarterly, monthly, and specialized reports as delegated.
Create graphs, reports, and dashboards both routine and/or ad hoc for departmental or aggregate results using sound practices on statistical graphics and data visualization.
Support strategic research projects by collecting and analyzing secondary data concerning business and public administration market trends and competitor offerings.

Coordinator, Evidence for Academic and Co-curricular Innovations:
Design, implement audience surveys, polls and other data collection systems, perform analysis, and report on results in support of the office of the Associate Dean.

Administrative Support:
Administrative and constituency support for the office of the Associate Dean – Innovations, Collaborations and Quarter to Semester Conversion, and other duties as assigned.

Required Qualifications:
Equivalent to a bachelor's degree with the equivalent to three years of progressively responsible experience in institutional or programmatic research, data analysis, data management, information technology, operations research, quality assurance, and/or project management. Specialized coursework in social sciences, economics, mathematics, statistics, computer science, or related field is preferred.
Working knowledge of statistical analysis and research methodology, experience working with quantitative data, expert knowledge of SPSS (e.g., statistical analysis, writing syntax), Excel (e.g., pivot tables, formulas, macros), Word, and Powerpoint.
Ability to understand database concepts and data modeling, databases (Oracle, MYSQL, MSSQL), data mappings, data transformation, systems analysis, experience in designing, constructing, analyzing, and maintaining large databases.
Demonstrated superior interpersonal, written and oral communication skills.
Ability to meet deadlines, manage multiple projects concurrently, think critically and strategically, and must be highly organized and have meticulous attention to detail.
Ability to understand data specifications, elements, dictionaries, reporting structures, and reporting requirements for federal, state, CSU, and accrediting mandates.
Ability to think qualitatively and quantitatively, and be conscious of data security and risk management.
Ability to work effectively with internal and external constituencies in a diverse University environment.

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience in SQL, Peoplesoft, or a business intelligence tool (Tableau, iDashboard, Cognos, OBIEE) preferred.

A background check (including a criminal records check) must be completed satisfactorily before any candidate can be offered a position with the CSU. Failure to satisfactorily complete the background check may affect the application status of applicants or continued employment of current CSU
employees who apply for the position.

The person holding this position is considered a 'mandated reporter' under the California Child Abuse and Neglect Reporting Act and is required to comply with the requirements set forth in CSU Executive Order 1083 as a condition of employment.

California State University, San Bernardino is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. We consider qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, genetic information, medical condition, disability, marital status, or protected veteran status.

This position may be "Designated" under California State University's Conflict of Interest Code. This would require the filing of a Statement of Economic Interest on an annual basis and the completion of training within 6 months of assuming office and every 2 years thereafter. Visit the Human Resources Conflict of Interest webpage link for additional information: http://hrd.csusb.edu/conflictInterest.html

This position adheres to CSU policies against Sex Discrimination, Sexual Harassment, and Sexual Violence, including Domestic Violence, Dating Violence, and Stalking. This requires completion of Sexual Violence Prevention Training within 6 months of assuming employment and on a two-year basis thereafter. (Executive Order 1096)
title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst (AA/S EI)/ Jack Brown College (2016-00663)

description:
New Century Health is leading transformative change in specialty caremanagement. By combining medical management expertise with a deep understandingof healthcare informatics, physician management and healthcare technologysystems development, we generate insights that drive leading edge and effectiveinnovation. What does this mean to you? It means that when you join us, youwill be a key contributor to one the fastest growing healthcare services in theNational Oncology and Cardiology care management space today. With yourknowledge, skills and abilities, you will impact the delivery of care and directlycontribute to our ability to positively impact and meet the critical unmetneeds of patients suffering from all types of cancer.
We support our employees with an outstandingbenefit package that features programs like employee paid medical benefits,100% match on your 401k contribution up to 4% of your base salary, generoustuition reimbursement, as well as above average paid time off. If you areinterested in working with some of the most dedicated, passionate and smartestpeople on the planet, express your interest in speaking with us and we willrespond immediately.

SUMMARY
The Vice President ofAnalytics is responsible for the Analytics department at NCH as well as closeparticipation with IT development, Provider and Payor interaction, and overallprofitability of NCH. The Analytics team is integral to the successof our clinical initiatives as well as our overall business. Thusthe leadership role must be prepared to support all areas of the organizationto develop greater understanding, affect strategy, and recommend actionproactively on anything that impacts the organization. Knowledge of medical terminology is a plus.Knowledge of Oncology or Cardiology related analytic approaches areappreciated. Business or entrepreneurship experience is required.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES ANDRESPONSIBILITIES

Responsibilityof overall analytic strategy for NCH.

Participationin IT development related to data warehouse, BI Stack, and upstream systemsimplementations.

Developmentof analytic standards and responsible for ensuring adherence to same

Mentoringrelationship with subordinates.

description:
The Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL) leads the world in robotic and autonomous missions in earth orbit, solar system, and in the study of the universe. JPL is a Federally Funded Research and Development Corporation managed and operated by California Institute of Technology on behalf of NASA. Over 700 professionals lead and support the business of the Laboratory under the leadership of the Office of the Chief Financial Officer.

The Enterprise Business Information Services (EBIS) Division maintains stewardship over the ever-evolving Business IT portfolio of applications and systems required to support the Laboratory's robust and complex business processes. EBIS manages the full systems lifecycle across all major business processes, provides technical services and support, and strategically partners with the Laboratory's business community. Key organizational initiatives include a business intelligence program, data analytics, and adopting agile methodologies and tools.

If you love technology and data, and want to help the leading center for robotic space exploration, we are seeking team members for our Business Intelligence and Analytics program office. This lean team delivers enterprise BI solutions to business users across the lab, using primarily Oracle and OBIEE. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record as a data technologist, the communication skills and business awareness to bridge the technology gap with our users, and the daring to learn and pitch in at every stage of the BI process. Bring your talents and ideas to help us expand our team and deliver great BI solutions to a world class organization.

Job description:
  • Partner with business users, subject matter experts and your teammates in the BI and Analytics Program Office to implement high quality Business Intelligence solutions for JPL
  • Participate in end-to-end technical BI solutions including:
o Data analysis using SQL

o Data modeling

o ETL design and development using Informatica PowerCenter

o Report and dashboard design and development using OBIEE, Tableau and R

o Debugging, testing, and QA

o Implementation and user support

o Utilities, scripting, and automation
  • Tasks may include work from:
o BI projects

o Data science projects

o Adhoc requests

o Maintenance requests

o Infrastructure projects

o Bug fixes
  • Provide estimates to project management
  • Support daily operations and maintenance as needed
  • Abide by standards and procedures
  • Document code and processes

Qualifications: Required Skills/Experience:
  • Typically requires a Bachelor degree with at least 6 years of information technology experience or Master’s degree with 4 years of related experience in Finance, Business Administration, Computer Information systems, Computer Science or related discipline
  • 3+ years working as a Data Analyst or BI Developer
  • Analytical and problem solving skills
  • Proficiency with SQL
  • Experience with reporting tools such as Cognos, OBIEE, Tableau, etc.
  • BI concepts such as ETL, dimensional modeling and data presentation
  • SDLC concepts
  • Excel and math skills
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Eagerness and ability to learn
Skills that are a plus:
  • PL/SQL
  • Oracle EBS R12
  • Informatica
  • OBIEE
  • Javascript
  • CSS
  • Analytics applications such as Tableau and languages like R or Python
  • Keen understanding of statistics
title: Enterprise Applications Software Engineer III, Business Intelligence and Analytics

description:
In the context of the rapidly evolving healthcare environment with extreme focus on the cost and affordability of innovative new specialty medicines, Amgen is committed to developing a new capability to develop and execute global strategies to establish and sustain value-based partnerships with healthcare payers, governments and delivery systems. This includes the establishment of a new global value-based partnership hub that will explore and execute new and innovative mechanisms of patient access that create win-win-win situations for patients, payers and Amgen, while improving access to key stakeholders and their support of policies that shape the external environment.

This Director role will lead the Global Health Economics (GHE) US Value-Based Partnership team, with the following responsibilities:

Provide strategic GHE input in building Amgen’s new Global Value-Based Partnership capability.

Serve as point of contact and oversight for all Value-Based Partnership projects across GHE

Function as the GHE lead across all Therapeutic Area & Corporate level Partnerships, including the design, scientific governance approval, execution and publication of Health Economic Research components

Coordinate product level partnership project resourcing (FTE requirements) with GHE Product leads both regionally & globally

Provide flexible GHE headcount resource to support GHE product leads in executing high priority product level partnership projects

Identify GHE product level research projects suitable for execution through partnerships

Support Global Partnership Hub Partnership lead(s) in partnership ideation and partner segmentation, and business case development

Work with Global Value-Based Partnership Manager(s) to execute contracted partnerships

Ensure clear and consistent communication between the Global Partnership Hub and the GHE leadership team, GHE Value-Based Partnership Team and GHE product leads

Work with Global Head of Value-Based Partnerships and Hub Planning and Ops on strategic planning and partnership prioritization

Support end-to-end negotiation and execution of TA or Corporate-Level partnerships

Provide critical input to Hub Data analyst on partnership Business Case Development, Valuation, and Prioritization

Keep aware of legal and compliance guardrails

Basic Qualifications:

Doctorate degree and 4 years of health economics and outcomes research experience
OR
Master’s degree and 8 years of health economics and outcomes research experience
OR
Bachelor’s degree and 10 years of health economics and outcomes research experience

Preferred Qualifications:

Ability to align internal and external stakeholders around future value payer partnership initiatives

Experience managing multiple simultaneous projects with direct commercial or research implications

Strong interpersonal skills, negotiation skills, active listening, and relationship management skills

Partnership, contracting, and/or valuation modeling experience

Understanding or familiarity with the Value & Access organization, and how it interfaces with other parts of the business

Experience working with or for external payers and providers

Awareness and ability to navigate and conform to Commercialization and Corporate Governance processes

Amgen is committed to unlocking the potential for patients suffering from serious illnesses by discovering, developing, manufacturing and delivering innovative human therapeutics. This approach begins by using tools like advanced human genetics to unravel the complexities of disease and understand the fundamentals of human biology.

Amgen focuses on areas of high unmet medical need and leverages its expertise to strive for solutions that improve health outcomes and dramatically improve people’s lives. A biotechnology pioneer since 1980, Amgen has grown to be one of the world’s leading independent biotechnology companies, has reached millions of patients around the world and is developing a pipeline of medicines with breakaway potential.

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.
title: Global Health Economics Director – US Value-Based Partnerships

description:
COMPANY PROFILE

CHC Consulting is not your everyday, cookie cutter kind of OSP engineering firm. We're better. We provide high caliber outside plant engineering and staffing solutions to top companies in the telecommunications industry. Our singular focus: engineering solutions for the telecom industry. Our signature outcome: satisfied clients. We provide turnkey, cost effective engineering solutions that save client’s time, resources and money. We specialize in staffing the best and brightest telecommunications professionals for contract and full time positions with leading companies nationwide.

SUMMARY

Payroll Data Analyst Manager will support the Payroll Manager of a nationwide telecommunications design firm.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

  • Process Garnishment Orders
  • Input New Hire information into ADP and internal systems
  • Check for local taxes for New Hires
  • Extensive Job Costing in Access Database
  • Create Job Codes
  • Process timesheets for payroll upload for 700+ employees

  • Data analysis for proper pay structure
  • Process multiple pay rates for multiple positions
  • Calculate Piecework Overtime / Double time, as well as blended rates
  • Analyze inputs for double payments & job assignments
  • Import files into ADP & database
  • Receive and analyze invoices for outside vendors and log into database
  • Research inquiries from AP for discrepancies

REQUIRED SKILLS

  • Minimum three years of experience in the payroll/finance department of a company with at least 500 employees
  • Experience with ADP or ADP Workforce Now (preferred)

  • Position requires strong communication skills, both written and verbal

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

  • Must be able to sit for extended periods of time
  • Must be able to look at a computer screen for extended periods of time

All requirements are subject to possible modification to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities.

This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee occupying this position. Employees will be required to follow any other job-related instructions and to perform other job-related duties requested by their supervisor.

Requirements are representative of minimum levels of knowledge, skills, and/or abilities. To perform this job successfully, the incumbent will possess the abilities or aptitudes to perform each duty proficiently.

This document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise, other than an “at-will” employment relationship.

Job Type: Full-time

  • High school or equivalent

Required experience:

  • Payroll: 1 year
  • Data Analysis: 2 years

description:
Are you a problem-solver looking to work on a product that makes people’s lives better?
The everyday employees who use Yammer tell us that they feel smarter, more appreciated by their coworkers, and more connected to the jobs where they spend 8+ hours a day, every day. That’s what motivates us to come to work, support each other, and keep making our product better.

Is this the right job for you?
- You get excited about tackling big, complicated, and often ambiguous problems and have autonomy in decision making
- You understand that human behavior is complex and changing behaviors is a lot harder than building features and technology
- You love products - trying new things, asking yourself “why did they build it that way?”, questioning ‘what would happen if…?’
- You’re comfortable communicating and negotiating with cross-functional teams - you get your points across without being a jerk, and people like working with you even if they might disagree with you
- You’ve got good UX instincts -- you won’t need to do your own design, but you’ll need to work effectively with your designer and researcher peers
- You enjoy thinking analytically -- you won’t be expected to write SQL queries, but you’ll need to work effectively with your data analyst peers

This is what you’ll be doing:
- Collaborate with other product managers, designers, researchers, data analysts, and engineering teams to determine product strategy and prioritize the features that will bring the most value to our customers
- Manage the product development process from conception through design, build, release, A/B testing, analysis, and iteration
- Analyze data to optimize performance and focus on the product areas with the highest potential to drive usage
- Constantly learning, asking questions, being humble, and supporting your team members
- Using the product we’re building every day, and constantly questioning how we can make it more useful for our customers

This is how we do it:
- A/B test everything (including our own instincts and assumptions), build iteratively, and ship quickly -- it keeps us humble.
- Rotate project areas, from web to mobile and across product goals -- it keeps us from being silo’ed.
- Bring in all the right resources (data analysts, research, design, copy, engineering) from the beginning -- it keeps us respectful of a diversity of perspectives.

Required Qualifications:
You have designed and shipped products that lots of people use and love. Depending on the size and type of teams/companies you've worked at in the past, that could translate to anywhere from 2-5+ years' experience.

Yammer and Microsoft: Yammer is now an integral part of Office 365, has grown significantly over the past years and is used by millions of users. Yammer helps power other Microsoft experiences including Delve, Office 365 video and SharePoint. Yammer helped accelerate the company-wide adoption of product usage as a key success metric. With all this, Yammer is well setup to be a major engine of growth for Microsoft and Office 365.

What's next?
If you are a PM at Microsoft, some of the skills mentioned above, and parts of the interview process may be new to you. Rest assured that we value your current expertise, and hope you are eager to pick up new skills. In fact, we work regularly with other teams to share best practices and help shape the future of the PM discipline at Microsoft. We have also put together a note to get your started: https://www.yammer.com/microsoft.com/#/notes/2198794

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, marital status, pregnancy, protected veteran status, protected genetic information, political affiliation, or any other characteristics protected by local laws, regulations, or ordinances.

description:
Captiv8 is looking for an energetic, experienced, and amazing Product Owner! This person will handle the vision, platform, and execution of the largest social media marketplace on the planet. Captiv8 helps brands and creators connect to impact audiences around the world. As more and more millennials start shifting away from TV and consuming more content on Youtube, Snapchat, Instagram, Vine, and other platforms, the creators building that content need a platform that empowers them to manage their audiences, grow their audiences and make money. Captiv8 is that platform!

About Captiv8:
Our founding team is made up of great individuals that have over $1B in acquisitions, managed over $600M+ in revenue and taken two companies public. Our last venture was one of the largest monetization platforms on the planet for the mobile-first economy.

Captiv8 is a global platform connecting and delivering influencers, audiences and brands at scale: we work with top Fortune 500 brands like Adidas, Starbuck, Disney, Amazon, Microsoft and many others. Our platform features passionate influencers across Instagram, Snapchat, Vine, Youtube and other networks. The audience makeup is truly global with over 850 million total audience reach spanning the top social networks.

Captiv8 is backed by incredible institutions including Social+Capital, Subtraction Capital, Launch Fund and many others.

VP of Product Description:
We are looking for a seasoned product management professional with strong domain expertise in social media across Instagram, vine, snapchat, twitter, and facebook to lead end-to-end product management efforts for a suite of media planning and data products. The VP, Product Management will define the product strategy, develop the product roadmap, identify product requirements, establish priorities, and collaborate with business stakeholders across the organization and within the brands and the service teams supporting large brands and influencers.

The individual must have strong leadership and formal product management methodology experience blended with several years of practical experience, resulting in proven success launching new products. The candidate must also have extensive experience working with all levels of the organization (executive, to developer, to data analyst) The person must have a minimum of 10-15 years of overall experience, including at least 5-7 years in product management. Must have a strong “presence” and the ability to drive change in the organization. The candidate, while possessing a strong background in formal methodologies MUST have a proven ability to be effective in a creative, unstructured culture.

This is a great opportunity to be a part of a proven team and come in at the ground level.

Responsibilities:
  • Lead the full product lifecycle for a suite of products or services covering concept, specification, design, launch, and enhancement phases.
  • Develop a comprehensive product roadmap for the media planning products/services and related data to deliver against business goals.
  • Conduct market research and engage with internal customers, clients, prospects and external partners to identify market needs and opportunities.
  • Collaborate with a broad set of business and technology stakeholders to understand current product capabilities and identify gaps.
  • Consolidate, rationalize, and prioritize market requirements into the product roadmap to define go-to-market strategy and timeline for product features and enhancements
  • Define success metrics and be accountable to them.
  • Design functional specifications and make feature, resource, and timeline trade-off decisions.
  • Collaborate closely with engineering leaders and their teams through all stages of the product development. Take on 'Product Owner' role on scrum teams.
  • Lead and coordinate product rollout efforts with marketing, sales and other client facing teams. Collaborate with marketing and customer training groups for collateral on overall offering including white papers, case studies, demos, training material, etc.
  • Act as the key product evangelist and expert for internal teams as well as external users.
  • Work with offshore engineering teams.
  • Huge plus if you can speak Russian, optional
Experience/Skills Required:
  • University degree in the field of computer science or business administration. Master’s or PhD. degree in one these fields desirable.
  • Minimum 5 - 7 years experience in product management and/or product marketing in a technology field.
  • Proven track record of setting product development targets and delivering results a must, including experience authoring MRDs and PRDs.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills including presentation experience to large and diverse audiences.
  • Experience in strategic technology planning, execution, and policy development.
  • Excellent knowledge of media and/or advertising technology environments, including data management, media management and delivery, and back-office systems.
  • Solid understanding of computer systems characteristics, features, and integration capabilities.
  • Excellent understanding of project management principles.
  • Agile (Scrum) highly desired.
  • Proven experience in planning, organization, and development.
  • Demonstrated ability to apply technology solutions to business problems.
  • Ability to set and manage priorities judiciously.
  • Exceptionally self-motivated and directed.
  • Superior analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities.
  • Ability to motivate and collaborative in a highly matrixed environment.
  • Strong analytical skills evidenced by a proven ability to quantitatively and qualitatively analyse product concepts, strategic opportunities and competitive threats.
  • Aptitude for working with internal and external stakeholders to define requirements and quantify market opportunities - then driving them to realization.
  • Experience and/or strong desire to work in a high pressure, high demand entrepreneurial environment.
  • Ability to gain credibility quickly.
  • Action orientated, gets things done and makes decisions.
  • Excellent relationship builder.
  • Global citizen who has strong understanding and experience in rolling out products and services across multiple markets taking into account time zone and cultural challenges and differences.
  • Flexibility and adaptability while being able to drive organizational change is essential.
  • Must take action in solving problems while exhibiting judgment and a realistic understanding of issues.
  • Must have ability to solve problems and deal with a variety of variables in situations where limited or no standardization exists.
  • Must have ability to quickly assess situations, define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions.
  • Must have a strong understanding of business direction and needs.
title: Vice President of Product

description:

This position is responsible for the delivery of quality/performance improvement and peer review for the Sutter Delta medical staff departments and quality/performance improvement for the entire medical center, leadership and employees. The Director exercises a high degree of autonomy in performing the assigned responsibilities and functions cooperatively with senior leadership and other members of the quality and infection prevention teams to support the mission, strategic plan, goals and values of Sutter Delta Medical Center and the Sutter Health System while assuring quality patient outcomes. This position is responsible for the daily operation of physician peer review and medical staff quality support, data management, performance improvement, and the organizations’ Accreditation/Licensure processes. description:
Location: Oakland, California Reports to: National Fellows Program Director In advance of School Year 2017-2018, we are now accepting applications from candidates who wish to be considered for Site Manager positions in Oakland, CA. Math Coaches and Math Specialists encouraged to apply! OverviewAbout Blueprint Schools Network (Blueprint)Blueprints mission is to promote educational equity and improve life outcomes for students by partnering with school districts to plan, implement and monitor school improvement initiatives. Our strategic framework arose from an unprecedented analysis of more than 100 schools that identified five core, research-based strategies driving student achievement, common to high performing schools.

These strategies include: 1.Ensuring every student has an excellent teacher and a school leader committed to their success;2.Increasing instructional time;3.Setting clear, consistent standards for academic achievement and establishing a school-wide focus on preparing all students for college;4.Collecting assessment data frequently to monitor each students academic progress and tailoring instruction to meet the needs of all learners; and5.Providing daily, small group tutoring to students using highly qualified and well-trained instructors.Our work with schools across the country has shown that positive change is possible when these five core strategies for school improvement are implemented together as a comprehensive package. Our culture is defined by talented and mission-driven people working together to accomplish great things. We value students first, integrity, sustainable results, diversity, collaboration and humility. About the Blueprint Math Fellows ProgramThe Blueprint Math Fellows program enhances student learning by reinforcing math instruction students receive in the classroom.

Fellows are charged with building strong relationships that help to increase each students self-confidence in and commitment to his/her education. Fellows are an integral part of the school experience, helping build a culture of high expectations for the students they serve. Blueprint is currently implementing the Math Fellows Program within public school districts in Oakland (CA), Boston (MA), Salem (MA), Holyoke (MA), and East St Louis (IL).The OpportunityBlueprint is looking for Site Manager(s) in Oakland, CA to (1) support through coaching and development of Math Fellows and (2) provide solutions for daily management issues involving Fellow-Student relationships, Fellow-Fellow relationships, and Fellow-staff relationships. As a Site Manager, you will have the opportunity to apply your experience as an Educator to promote educational equity and improve life outcomes for all students.

Site Managers will be supported by the National Fellows Program Director and Blueprints national cohort of Site Managers. She/he will be able to regularly partner with Blueprints Regional Fellows Team based in Oakland, a dedicated Data Analyst, and the Blueprint Human Capital Team.Responsibilities of the Site Manager (including but not limited to): Relationship Building & Collaboration: -Build relationships with school leaders and staff, parents, colleagues, and students-Facilitate integration of Fellows into school staff-Collaborate with math teachers and other support staff in meeting the needs of students -Share student data to with school leaders and teachers-Work with Blueprint leadership and other Site Managers to continuously improve program implementationDeveloping & Managing Math Fellows: -Collaborate with Blueprint leadership to implement summer training for Fellows-Work with school leaders to ensure Fellows receive school-specific training-Build team among Fellows and foster positive team culture-Design and facilitate ongoing professional development for Fellows to support culture building, planning, instruction, data analysis, and issues of social justice as it relates to our students and communities, etc.- Weekly observations and coaching of Fellows-Oversee professionalism to ensure Fellows meet expectations-Fellow evaluationsInstructional Leadership: -Design Common Core lesson plans aligned to grade level instruction-Provide content support to Fellows-Lead team to set student achievement goals and facilitate data meetings that support Fellows in monitoring progress toward goalsCompensation The Site Manager will receive a market-driven salary based on the competitive external market segment and in recognition of the responsibilities.
title: Site Manager, Oakland – Math Coaches encouraged to apply!

description:
The QI HEDIS Network Support Nurse will provide clinical support to the Network Support team responsible for outreach, training, development and engagement of MSO, PPG/IPA and Providers. The HEDIS Network Support Nurse is responsible for performing medical record review and audit, data extraction, maintaining the HEDIS data and computer systems The Nurse will supervise and oversee Network Support Coordinators and assist the Clinical Supervisor and HEDIS Manager in the maintenance and update of Web Portal content.

This position will require travel to Provider sites and may have alternate work sites within an assigned geographic region.

QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Current CA RN license in good standing.Bachelor’s degree in Nursing or Related field preferred.LVNs will be considered depending on clinical experience.



  • Experience working in a Managed Care or Provider office setting; or HEDIS experience; or recent Acute Care (within 5 years) preferred.



  • Experience with Medicare HCC Risks and ICD-10 and CPT codes preferred



  • Experience with Utilization Management, Case Management, Care Coordination and Medical Office preferred



  • Must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills, and have demonstrated experience with presentations.



  • Must have experience with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Power Point) and be proficient in working with computers and databases.



  • Must be able to collect, synthesize and analyze data and make recommendations to improve outcomes and meet goals



  • Must have excellent organizational skills, be able to work with minimal supervision, demonstrated leadership experience and have a team-oriented approach.Prior supervisory experience preferred.



· Must be detail oriented, be able to meet production standards, initiate new processes to improve quality care and train Providers as needed.
  • Must be Professional, have a good work ethic, be a conscientious problem solver and be results-oriented.



  • Must be adaptable, willing to learn, and take personal pride in their work.



Responsibilities:
  • Provide clinical support for all Performance Improvement related projects and interventions, especially Network Support, Outreach, Data and Medicare HCC teams.



  • Provide clinical expertise to Medical groups and key high volume providers, which will include but not limited to , HEDIS education, gap listing engagement, workflow process improvements, improved documentation practices.



  • Medical record abstraction and audit



  • Develop and prepare presentations and agenda for the group and high volume provider visits and engagement strategy



  • Work collaboratively with Data Analyst to develop stronger and more real-time EMR integration efforts



  • Provide clinical expertise to and the HEDIS data collection processes



  • Provide support to the Medicare HCC risk adjustment review process and medical record audit



  • Assist in the development of new HEDIS interventions and corrective action plans for HEDIS measures that fall below goals



  • Provide expertise and support to the Quality Improvement Projects, Performance Improvement Projects that involve HEDIS metrics.



  • Attend annual HEDIS certification class



  • Assist in the annual preparation of the HEDIS Roadmap Tool and audit process.



  • Prepare audit result reports, graphs and presentations



  • Prepare and implement annual training for Clinical and Non-Clinical staff



  • Provide clinical and administrative support to the Clinical Supervisor, HEDIS Manager, VP of Performance Improvement as needed, to include drafting/editing letters, mailings, faxes, coordinate schedules, phone calls that relate to HEDIS projects



  • Other duties as assigned by the HEDIS Manager, VP of Performance Improvement and QI Medical Director



All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability status and any other classification protected by Federal, State, and local laws.
title: QI HEDIS Network Support Nurse

description:
Hi. We’re TiVo. At our core, we’re innovators who continuously seek to fuel the ultimate entertainment experience. We touch the lives of binge-watching, music-loving, entertainment fanatics every day by inventing and delivering beautiful user experiences, and enable the world’s leading media and entertainment providers to nurture more meaningful relationships with their audiences.
We work hard, celebrate success and challenge everyone in our organization to make an impact. If you are as passionate as we are about the intersection of technology and entertainment, join us today.

We are looking for a talented and passionate Senior Performance Test Engineer who is interested in joining our performance testing team and helping to take TiVo, Inc services to the next level. In this role, you’ll be measuring, analyzing, and helping optimize the performance and scalability of our entire service. Partnering with our Engineering and Operations teams, you’ll be responsible for scoping and developing the tests, tools, frameworks, and processes necessary to ensure that our products and infrastructure are efficient, highly performing, scalable, and rock-solid reliable.

What you will be doing:
Design and implement scalability, stability, and stress tests using industry standard tools and custom developed software
Contribute to the quality, performance, and scalability of solutions by developing tools and frameworks to automate performance testing at the component and overall system level
Apply analytical skills to evaluate and interpret situations/problems using multiple sources of information
Create and distribute routine and ad-hoc analysis in support of performance objectives
Design benchmarks, test methodology, and analysis tools, and partner with teams across the company to implement and maintain them
Evangelize and support performance work and robust design throughout the engineering teams
Introduce and influence process improvements and act as an agent for change to the organization
Help establish a test automation vision for the product
Develop a roadmap to expand coverage of testing and test automation

What you need to successful:
5+ years of software testing and QA methodologies, preferably with a career focus on performance benchmarking and automated test development
Utilizing performance testing experience with tools such as JMeter, Gatling, or kafkaCat
Working closely with developers, QA engineers, and product managers to understand product requirements and design appropriate performance test plans to verify features performance and scalability requirements.
Experience building test automation solutions including test design and implementation, and development of support tools, harnesses, and fixtures
5 to 7 years of strong Java, Python, or Perl programming skills
Experience in developing highly complex, technically challenging projects, with solid engineering, scripting, and data analysis skills; self-sufficient data analyst
Strong analytical thinking, logical reasoning, problem recognition, and problem resolution skills.
Ability to influence decision-making and development priorities in areas where you have technical expertise and insights, but no direct authority
5+ years of experience testing web protocols (HTTP, SOAP, REST,RPC)
3+ years of experience with Linux at the command-line level
Strong understanding of Agile software development lifecycle
Ability to carry out role independently and resolve issues with minimal supervision

Preferred Skills
Knowledge of code and memory profiling tools for Java
Linux systems administration knowledge/experience
Knowledge of Kafka, Cassandra, Dockers, and OpenStack,
BS/MS in Computer Science (or equivalent) preferred

company: Redfish Technology - High Tech Executive Recruiters
description:
#22530 SENIOR TECHNICAL PRODUCT MANAGER SENIOR TECHNICAL PRODUCT MANAGER - Big Data, Risk Analytics
SAN FRANCISCO, CA (415)

Company Description:
Our Client is the pioneer in comprehensive risk analytics that improve the world's resilience to epidemics. Built on a strong foundation of epidemiology and international field science, including a worldwide network of on-the-ground experts, the company delivers actionable, data-driven insights that help countries, governments and corporations manage and mitigate infectious diseases. With a strategic global presence and sustained partnerships, their agile approach is helping the world track and transfer the risk associated with epidemic threats. The company's international footprint includes operations in 20 countries and offices in San Francisco, Washington, China, Canada, and Sierra Leone

The Opportunity:
Our client is seeking a high-energy technical product manager to add to its market focused product team. In this role, you will focus on building out data products and support build out of the data platform that addresses the needs of their enterprise customers. You will interface with key customers to understand market requirements and work collaboratively with other product leaders, engineers, data analysts and data scientists to convert these market requirements into products that will support real time decision-making and event modeling.

Who you are:
You are exceptionally intelligent - both IQ and EQ an energetic, go-getter, as passionate about working with partners and customers to truly understand their needs as you are about converting those requirements into detailed software specifications and working with engineering teams. You seek a creative outlet and enjoy a meaningful challenge. You love data. You crave to innovate, transform. You have impressive educational credentials and have worked on developing new data products as well as maintaining existing product lines.

Specifically, you have:
  • Five or more years of experience releasing and managing market accepted enterprise SaaS solutions.
  • Proven track record of defining and managing new product initiatives.
  • Strong people influencing and negotiation skills.
  • Significant experience working in agile software development environments and providing detailed feature specifications to engineers.
  • BS in Engineering, Computer Science or related field; or equivalent experience; MBA is a plus.
Responsibilities:
  • Drive operational excellence and continuous improvement of the data ingestion pipeline with a can do attitude.
  • Gather detailed functional requirements from internal stakeholders, collaborate with the development team to identify feature details and document them as user stories.
  • Assess business rules; perform source to target data mapping, design, review, implement and optimize ETL processes.
  • Perform data analysis, provide development support for existing systems, and troubleshoot data and/or system issues within the Data Warehouse environment as well as upstream systems, as needed.
  • Work cross functionally to drive implementation of new features and problem resolution, be comfortable rolling up sleeves and working alongside development team and data analyst team.
Qualifications:
  • Background in data pipeline design and development using a mixture of Big Data platforms and traditional ETL solutions.
  • Hands on experience with database / data structure design, data profiling, data refinement, query building and data mining required, exposure to Natural Language Processing preferred.
  • Experience working with a wide variety of data types - structured, unstructured, social media, text documents, images etc.
  • Experience with no-SQL technologies and big data platforms such as AWS, Hadoop and Spark required.
  • Experience working in an Agile/Scrum model with remote teams.
  • Passion for big data technologies.
  • Strong business acumen and an understanding of how to solve business process problems with technical data solutions.
Compensation:
  • Strong competitive salary.
  • Early stage options + Matching 401(k).
  • Employer-paid health benefits, PTO and more.
  • The chance to join a company that's changing the world as we know it!
